Fixed in 822 and 821 EX0007 || Step 2: 2000 Payments with 1 invoice - all invoices are for check payments- all invoices are on separate payments1. Open the schedule2. Print the checksRemember to select the NUL printer | Expected: Performance environment Load Print items grid Bug 270886 - Performance: Loading check print, remittance print or bank file grids times out with system error so records can't be processed 822.Ex0011 and could be earlier versions too Print checks 26 mins - using version 82231 min - using version 822 RC build32 mins - using version Master 5/2/202137 mins - using verson 822.EX0005 22/3/2021 Perf envir seems to be running slow55 mins - using verson 822.EX0006 24/3/2021 Perf envir running slow43 mins - using verson 822.EX0007 6/9/2021Having worse issues at EX0008 - is it an issue with the document server 75 mins - using verson 822.EX0007 (rolled back to EX0007 to check if the issues were in EX0008 code or environmental) 10/9/2021 This needs checked (all the other jobs up til this point were running well) 50 mins - using verson 822.EX0007 (send to printer turned off) 12/9/2021 73 mins - using verson 822.EX0007 12/9/2021 133 mins - using version 82SP4 21/3/24 Loeb Performance environment - 500 invoices39 mins - using version 82SP4 13/06/2024 - printed 382 checks as had to interrupt printing as per John Lee's instructions || Step 3: 2000 Payments with 1 invoice - all invoices are for check payments- all invoices are on seperate payments 1. Title: Invoice - GL - Changing Employee
Steps: Step 1: Pre req system settingsUser Dept/Prof is set to OnUPDATE GLM_PARMS SET USE_DEPT ='Y',USE_PROF ='Y' || Step 2: Employee Settingupdate CMS_OPTION set FLAG_VALUE = 'Y' --'N'where OPTION_CODE = 'JE_ODPC_DEF             ' | Expected: ODPC = Office, department, profit center || Step 3: ODPC default to Employee = 'Y'Change Employee field after fill in all required fields | Expected: ODPC changes and default based on Employee's Office, Dept and PC.Bug 227367 - GL offset Office field does not update when Employee is edited - Fixed || Step 4: ODPC default to Employee = 'N'Change Employee field after fill in all required fields | Expected: No change on Office, Dept and PC fields.Bug 226048 GL form - Do not clear the Dept and PC field when changing Employee if JE_ODPC_DEF = N.

Title: Jobs: Payment Schedule - Close while job is still running
Steps: Step 1: Create Payments1. Create a schedule with invoices- some have bank accounts- some don't have bank accounts Note: Need quite a few so that you have time to close before the next job finishes and you'll be running further jobs after this test step2. Create payments3. Close using close button while the create job is still running | Expected: Error message: There is a current job running on this payment schedule. If you close the schedule this job will continue to run in the background. Do you wish to wait for the job to complete? - Select Wait will cancel the close || Step 2: Create Payments1. Use the same schedule2. Create payments3. Close using X while the create job is still running | Expected: Error message: There is a current job running on this payment schedule. If you close the schedule this job will continue to run in the background. Do you wish to wait for the job to complete? - Select Ignore will process the close and the job will continue to run || Step 3: Print Remittances1. Use the same schedule2. Print the remittances3. Title: Performance - Invoice: Duplicate Number Validation
Steps: Step 1: a. Setup a vendor (A)    - with itself as the Parent Vendor    - select the Use Subsidiaries option    - select the Enforce Unique Invoice Numbers Across Subsidiaries optionb. Setup another two vendors (B & C) and set their parent vendor as vendor A above. || Step 2: Capture invoices as follows:a. Run the import wizard and import 2000 different invoices, each with a GL line and Disbursement line, for each of the vendors aboveb. Post the invoices imported for each vendor.c. Post an invoice for each of the vendors above as follows:    - with Invoice number DUPA for vendor A    - with Invoice number DUPB for vendor B    - with Invoice number DUPC for vendor C | Expected: Performance Environmenta. The invoices are imported in just under 27 minutes for each of the vendors. - using version 822b. The invoices are posted in just under 12 minutes for each vendor. - using version 822 || Step 3: Create an invoice for each vendor individually in the Invoice Entry screen and enter the invoice number as follows:a. enter invoice number DUPAb. enter invoice number DUPBc. enter invoice number DUPC | Expected: Performance EnvironmentThe duplicate check is performed in less than 1 second for all scenarios - using version 8220 (build 1080810) LocalThe duplicate check is performed in less than 1 second for all scenarios - using version 8220 (build 1079836)Local with Fiddler set to simulate modem speedsThe duplicate check is performed in 3 to 4 seconds for all scenarios - using version 8220 (build 1079836)

Title: Invoice Entry - Temporary Vendor Names: Disable feature on Firm Level
Steps: Step 1: Pre req1 Existing Inoice with Temp VendorUntick "Allow Temporary Vendor Name" in Admin > AP > Firm Options.- this field is ticked by default. || Step 2: Invoice Entry Screen - Vendor field | Expected: Enter Temp Vendor is no longer supported.Vendor field drop down :- "Create Temporary Vendor" is not in dropdown- Temporary Vendor Names doesn't show up in MRU- Still validates existing Temp Vendor Invoices || Step 3: Existing Temp Vendor Invoices | Expected: - Shows "A temporary Vendor name" is being used"- Can only change to actual vendor from the Vendor field- Should not effect the ability to edit existing invoice and detail line.

Title: Payment - Remittance: Email to multiple Vendor email addressess
Steps: Step 1: Note:  example remittance formats are attached to the docudraft set up stepNote:  user will select which email format on the fly when sending the remittance, unlike the email remittance format which is set against the bank being used on the payment | Expected: 7/3/2018- We now support multiple email addresses for vendors. Setup in EM for the vendor. The field is just a text field and the emails addresses need to be seperated by a semo colon || Step 2: Data pre reqsVendor- Preferred remittance method = email- Has multiple email address (These are set up in entity manager. The field is just a text field and the emails addresses need to be seperated by a semi colon)Payments- Manual completed payment for vendor || Step 3: Create remittance and send to multiple email addresses1. Select print payments 2. Enter date3. Select  Print Remittance Advices4. Select a printer if one is not defaulted5. Click on  the Yes radio button6. Select a format7. Select Ok | Expected: Remittance Created and Email is sentEmail sent to both email addresses || Step 4: Email remittance advices to multiple email addresses1. Select to Email Remittance Addresses2. Select a format 3. Select Email Remittance Advices | Expected: Email is sentEmail sent to both email addresses

Title: Jobs: Payment Schedule - Print/Reprint Check Payments
Steps: Step 1: Note: 821 uses a config value but from 822, there is a new flag column in TBM_FMT_CH that is checkedNote: This was introduced for Ogletree due to their print jobs taking a long time. The bank lock was holding up other jobs as all their offices use the same bank. It should only be used when NOT using pre printed check stationery || Step 2: Pre req dataTwo Invoices for bank 1 - Bank is derived from the APType used on the invoice- Pay by Electronic Banking = off- Seperate check = on- PostedTwo Invoices for bank 2 - Bank is derived from the APType used on the invoice- Pay by Electronic Banking = off- Seperate check = on- PostedTwo Invoices for bank 3 - Bank is derived from the APType used on the invoice - Pay by Electronic Banking = off- Seperate check = on- Posted | Expected: --------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- All Banks with formats, printers and office-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------SELECT b.BANK_CODE,b.ACCT_TYPE,b.CURRENCY_CODE,b.OFFC,o.COMPANY_CODE,b.INACTIVE[Bank Inactive],b.SHORT_NAME,b.ASSIGN_WIRE_NUMBER,b.AUTO_WIRE_NUM,TREG_BANK,USE_TRST_EFT,b.CH_FORMAT_UNO,cf.FORMAT_CODE[Check Format],b.TEST_FORMAT_UNO,cf.PRINT_ALL_PAGES,cf.INACTIVE[Chq Format Inactive],cf.FILENAME[Check File],b.RA_FORMAT_UNO,ra.FORMAT_CODE[Remittance Format],ra.INACTIVE[Rem Format Inactive],ra.FILENAME[Remittance File],b.RF_FORMAT_UNO,rf.FORMAT_CODE[Receipt Format],b.RF_TEST_FORMAT,rf.INACTIVE[Rct Format Inactive],rf.FILENAME[Receipt File],b.ALLOW_CHECK_PRINTER_SELECTION, pr1.PRINTER_UNO,pr1.PRINTER_ID[Check Printer], pr1.NETWORK_PATH [Check printer path],pr2.PRINTER_UNO,pr2.PRINTER_ID[Remit Printer], pr2.NETWORK_PATH [Remit printer path]--,b.*FROM TBM_BANK bLEFT JOIN TBM_FMT_CH cf ON b.CH_FORMAT_UNO = cf.FORMAT_UNOLEFT JOIN TBM_FMT_RA ra ON b.RA_FORMAT_UNO = ra.FORMAT_UNOLEFT JOIN TBM_FMT_RF rf ON b.RF_FORMAT_UNO = rf.FORMAT_UNOLEFT JOIN CMS_PRINTER pr1 ON b.CH_PRINTER_UNO = pr1.PRINTER_UNO LEFT JOIN CMS_PRINTER pr2 ON b.RF_PRINTER_UNO = pr2.PRINTER_UNO JOIN HBL_OFFICE o ON b.OFFC = o.OFFC_CODE--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- AP Type's bank and company-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------SELECT typ.APTYPE_CODE,typ.APTYPE_DESC,typ.BANK_CODE,b.CURRENCY_CODE,o.OFFC_CODE,o.COMPANY_CODEFROM APL_APTYPE typJOIN TBM_BANK b ON Typ.BANK_CODE = b.BANK_CODEJOIN HBL_OFFICE o ON b.OFFC = o.OFFC_CODE || Step 3: Start job from payment scheduleSchedule has multiple items | Expected: Job runs* Local notification sent so notification form displays * User lock exists on schedule header- lock owner =  S- expiry = NULL* Job starts processing- Job status = R * Schedule header user lock removed* Schedule header job lock applied - lock owner =  B- expiry = NULL- reason = Locked for printing* Bank is locked at the start of a job- Lock Owner = B- expiry = NULL - reason = Printing Checks* All items are locked at the start of the job- lock type =  B- expiry = 20- reason = Printing* Each item is unlocked once its been processed (changed in 822 to unlock at end of job)* Bank is unlocked* Item locks are removed (as from 822)* Schedule header job lock removed * User lock applied to schedule header - lock owner =  S- expiry = NULL - reason = Opened by user* Service sends notifications to notification form and recent activity grid* All selected items processed* Job status = C when completed* There are no orphaned item locks when job is completed---------------------------------------------------------------------- Get the most recent job--------------------------------------------------------------------DECLARE @job asintSET @job = (SELECTTOP (1) JOB_QUEUE_UNO FROM APE_JOB_QUEUE ORDERBY JOB_QUEUE_UNO DESC)--SET @job = 3032---------------------------------------------------------------------- Job--------------------------------------------------------------------SELECT'JOB'[JOB],j.JOB_QUEUE_UNO,j.JOB_PARAMETER_UNO,j.JOB_TYPE,j.JOB_STATUS,UPDATE_MESSAGE,j.TOTAL_ITEMS,j.PROCESSED_ITEMS,FAILED_ITEMS,ERROR_COUNT,j.INITIATED_BY, IS_REVIEWED,IS_CANCELLED,DATEDIFF(mi,j.INITIATED_DATE,j.LAST_MODIFIED)[Process Mins],j.INITIATED_DATE,j.LAST_MODIFIEDFROM APE_JOB_QUEUE j WHERE j.JOB_QUEUE_UNO = @job --AND JOB_TYPE = 'PAYPRTCH'ORDER BY j.JOB_QUEUE_UNO DESC ---------------------------------------------------------------------- Parameters--------------------------------------------------------------------SELECT jp.* FROM APE_JOB_PARAMETER jpLEFTJOIN APE_JOB_QUEUE j ON j.JOB_PARAMETER_UNO = jp.JOB_PARAMETER_UNOWHERE j.JOB_QUEUE_UNO = @job---------------------------------------------------------------------- PAYMENT ALERTS--------------------------------------------------------------------SELECTDISTINCT'ALERTS'[ALERTS],a.SOURCE_TYPE,a.SOURCE_UNO,chq.REQUEST_NUM,a.MESSAGE_KEY,a.MESSAGE_CONTEXT,a.MESSAGE_INTERNAL,a.JOB_QUEUE_UNO, a.JOB_ALERT_UNO,a.ALERT_LEVEL,a.CREATE_DATEFROM APE_JOB_ALERT aLEFTJOIN APE_JOB_ALERT j ON j.JOB_QUEUE_UNO = a.JOB_QUEUE_UNOLEFTJOIN APT_CHECK chq ON a.SOURCE_UNO = chq.TRAN_UNO AND a.SOURCE_TYPE ='PAY'LEFTJOIN APT_INVOICE inv ON a.SOURCE_UNO = inv.TRAN_UNO AND a.SOURCE_TYPE ='INV'WHERE a.JOB_QUEUE_UNO = @jobORDERBY a.JOB_QUEUE_UNO DESC,a.SOURCE_UNO--, a.ALERT_UNO DESC || Step 4: Start job from payment gridSchedule has multiple items | Expected: Job runs* Local notification sent so notification form displays * Job starts processing- Job status = R * User lock applied to schedule header - lock owner =  S- expiry = NULL - reason = Opened by user* Schedule header user lock removed * Schedule header job lock applied - lock owner =  B- expiry = NULL- reason = Locked for printing* Bank is locked at the start of a job- Lock Owner = B- expiry = NULL - reason = Printing Checks* All items are locked at the start of the job- lock type =  B- expiry = 20- reason = Printing* Each item is unlocked once its been processed (changed in 822 to unlock at end of job)* Bank is unlocked* Item locks are removed (as from 822)* Schedule header job lock removed this got unlocked before the items did  * Service sends notifications to notification form and recent activity grid* All selected items processed* Job status = C when completed* There are no orphaned item locks when job is completed* Grid refreshed at end of job || Step 5: Cancel JobCreate a volume of payments so you can see the multiple processing steps display in  the recent activities grid | Expected: Job is canceled* Job status = X* Jobs stops processing* There are no orphaned locks when job is stopped* Grid refreshed at end of job

Title: Jobs: Payment Schedule - Generate Payments DUPLICATE
Steps: Step 1: Pre reqsMultiple schedules each with multiple items || Step 2: Note: As the job process is quick, there is no time to check that the lock occurred so need to check using sql profilter: search for: lockcio || Step 3: Start job from payment scheduleSchedule has multiple items | Expected: Job runs* Local notification sent so notification form displays * Job starts processing* All items are locked at the start of the job- locks applied with no expiry* Each item is unlocked once its been processed * Job status = R while processing* Service sends notifications to notification form and recent activity grid* All selected items processed- All payments are created first- Then Payments are released- Schedule Status is then updated* Job status = C when completed* Bank is unlocked* There are no orphaned locks when job is completed---------------------------------------------------------------------- Get the most recent job--------------------------------------------------------------------DECLARE @job asintSET @job = (SELECTTOP (1) JOB_QUEUE_UNO FROM APE_JOB_QUEUE ORDERBY JOB_QUEUE_UNO DESC)--SET @job = 3032---------------------------------------------------------------------- Job--------------------------------------------------------------------SELECT'JOB'[JOB],j.JOB_QUEUE_UNO,j.JOB_PARAMETER_UNO,j.JOB_TYPE,j.JOB_STATUS,UPDATE_MESSAGE,j.TOTAL_ITEMS,j.PROCESSED_ITEMS,FAILED_ITEMS,ERROR_COUNT,j.INITIATED_BY, BY j.JOB_QUEUE_UNO DESC ---------------------------------------------------------------------- Parameters--------------------------------------------------------------------SELECT jp.* FROM APE_JOB_PARAMETER jpLEFTJOIN APE_JOB_QUEUE j ON j.JOB_PARAMETER_UNO = jp.JOB_PARAMETER_UNOWHERE j.JOB_QUEUE_UNO = @job---------------------------------------------------------------------- PAYMENT ='PAY'LEFTJOIN APT_INVOICE inv ON a.SOURCE_UNO = inv.TRAN_UNO AND a.SOURCE_TYPE ='INV'WHERE a.JOB_QUEUE_UNO = @jobORDERBY a.JOB_QUEUE_UNO DESC,a.SOURCE_UNO--, a.ALERT_UNO DESC || Step 4: Start Job Title: Jobs: Payment Schedule - Print/Reprint Remittances
Steps: Step 1: Pre reqsMultiple schedules each with multiple items || Step 2: Note: As the job process is quick, there is no time to check that the lock occurred so need to check using sql profilter: search for: lockcio || Step 3: Start job from payment scheduleSchedule has multiple items | Expected: Job runs* Local notification sent so notification form displays * User lock exists on schedule header- lock type =  S- expiry = NULL* Job starts processing- Job status = R * Schedule header user lock removed* Schedule header job lock applied- lock type =  B- expiry = NULL - reason = Locked for printing* Job lock applied to bank- lock type =  B- expiry = NULL- reason = Printing Remittances* All items are locked at the start of the job- lock type =  B- expiry = NULL NULL from 822 as we're not unlocking til the end of the job- reason = Printing Remittances* Each item is unlocked once its been processed (changed in 822 to unlock at end of job)* Bank lock removed* Job status = C when completed* Item locks removed (as from 822)* Schedule header job lock removed * User lock applied on schedule header - lock type =  S- expiry = NULL- reason = Open by user* Service sends notifications to notification form and recent activity grid* All selected items processed* There are no orphaned item locks when job is completed---------------------------------------------------------------------- Get the most recent job--------------------------------------------------------------------DECLARE @job asintSET @job = (SELECTTOP (1) JOB_QUEUE_UNO FROM APE_JOB_QUEUE ORDERBY JOB_QUEUE_UNO DESC)--SET @job = 3032---------------------------------------------------------------------- Job--------------------------------------------------------------------SELECT'JOB'[JOB],j.JOB_QUEUE_UNO,j.JOB_PARAMETER_UNO,j.JOB_TYPE,j.JOB_STATUS,UPDATE_MESSAGE,j.TOTAL_ITEMS,j.PROCESSED_ITEMS,FAILED_ITEMS,ERROR_COUNT,j.INITIATED_BY, IS_REVIEWED,IS_CANCELLED,DATEDIFF(mi,j.INITIATED_DATE,j.LAST_MODIFIED)[Process Mins],j.INITIATED_DATE,j.LAST_MODIFIEDFROM APE_JOB_QUEUE j WHERE j.JOB_QUEUE_UNO = @job --AND JOB_TYPE = 'PAYPRTCH'ORDER BY j.JOB_QUEUE_UNO DESC ---------------------------------------------------------------------- Parameters--------------------------------------------------------------------SELECT jp.* FROM APE_JOB_PARAMETER jpLEFTJOIN APE_JOB_QUEUE j ON j.JOB_PARAMETER_UNO = jp.JOB_PARAMETER_UNOWHERE j.JOB_QUEUE_UNO = @job---------------------------------------------------------------------- PAYMENT ALERTS--------------------------------------------------------------------SELECTDISTINCT'ALERTS'[ALERTS],a.SOURCE_TYPE,a.SOURCE_UNO,chq.REQUEST_NUM,a.MESSAGE_KEY,a.MESSAGE_CONTEXT,a.MESSAGE_INTERNAL,a.JOB_QUEUE_UNO, a.JOB_ALERT_UNO,a.ALERT_LEVEL,a.CREATE_DATEFROM APE_JOB_ALERT aLEFTJOIN APE_JOB_ALERT j ON j.JOB_QUEUE_UNO = a.JOB_QUEUE_UNOLEFTJOIN APT_CHECK chq ON a.SOURCE_UNO = chq.TRAN_UNO AND a.SOURCE_TYPE ='PAY'LEFTJOIN APT_INVOICE inv ON a.SOURCE_UNO = inv.TRAN_UNO AND a.SOURCE_TYPE ='INV'WHERE a.JOB_QUEUE_UNO = @jobORDERBY a.JOB_QUEUE_UNO DESC,a.SOURCE_UNO--, a.ALERT_UNO DESC || Step 4: Start job from payment gridSchedule has multiple items | Expected: Job runs* Job starts processing* Schedule header user lock removed* Schedule header job lock applied- lock type =  B- expiry = NULL - reason = Locked for printing* Job lock applied to bank- lock type =  B- expiry = NULL- reason = Printing Remittances* All items are locked at the start of the job- lock type =  B- expiry = NULL 20 should be NULL from 822 as we're not unlocking til the end of the job- reason = Printing Remittances* Each item is unlocked once its been processed (changed in 822 to unlock at end of job)* Bank lock removed* Job status = C when completed* Item locks removed (as from 822)* Schedule header job lock removed got removed before the items were unlocked* Job status = R while processing* Service sends notifications to notification form and recent activity grid* All selected items processed* There are no orphaned item locks when job is completed || Step 5: Cancel JobCreate a volume of payments so you can see the multiple processing steps display in  the recent activities grid | Expected: Job is canceled* Job status = X* Jobs stops processing* There are no orphaned locks when job is stopped* Grid refreshed at end of job

Title: Upgrade 821 to 822 - New Invoice and Approval Workflow
Steps: Step 1: Setup Workflow. Make sure active and suspended workflow can carry on when upgraded to 822 workflow.Workflow started in 82 should be completed with 82 version even with 821 version imported. Workflow started in 821 should be using 821. || Step 2: Create WF task as Step 3 to 17 in 82.1 Verify them in 82.2.*Note: The environment being used for this upgrade on Dec 2019 having issue with Approval task missing in WF. Instead of testing if each tasks opens up, we purposely allow the environment to have the blank Approval task and test if this issue will be gone when upgrade to 822. || Step 3: New Invoice task - Active | Expected: Can get back to task || Step 4: New Invoice task - Suspend | Expected: Can resume task. || Step 5: Code Invoice task - Active | Expected: Can get back to task, can continue to code invoice. || Step 6: Code Invoice task - Suspend | Expected: Can resume task. || Step 7: Approval GL task - Active | Expected: Approval GL will still be blank. Restart a new worklow up to this point to verify if this issue is fixed || Step 8: Approval Disb task - Suspend | Expected: Can resume task. Approval Disb will still be blank. Restart a new worklow up to this point to verify if this issue is fixed || Step 9: Starting new workflow after the upgrade and 822 workflow imported1. New invoice2. GL and Disb Approval | Expected: Can kick off New Invoice WF and Approval WF. 'Resubmited' wording on task description is also there when WF is resubmitted.* Also new WF is in 821 version. We fixed 198243 for 821.

Title: Payment Items - Disbursement: Rates Hierachy Level 1 contraints have unit rates and markup
Steps: Step 1: Note: This uses a common SP created for classic. Note: Matter and client constraints can only have a max of 1 of each set up for each cost codeThe hierachy for this test is:Note: This does not match the documentation. Decission was made to change the documentation rather than the code1. The disbursement rate 2. The matter constraint rates 3. The client constraint rates 4. The Rate Set attached to the matter5. The cost code rates || Step 2: Pre req dataNote: You might already have a setup for this with various clients/matters but if not, you can use this set up and add on to it based on the following stepsClient: For client rateMatter 1: For matter rateDisb Cost Code (e.g. RH3)Classic | Client Disbursements | Disbursement Setup | Disbursement Types- Allow soft = Y- Allow Hard = Y- Allow edit of base values = Y- Apply markup = Y- Has Unit rates = Y Payment- Vendor type- Currency = USD- Incomplete or Complete || Step 3: Cost Code rates and markup1. Add Rates row 1 for costs code: level 1, markups - Rate level = 1- USD currency- Effective date = 1/1/2019- Markup amount = 10.00- Unit Rate 1 = 2.00 2. Add Rates row 2 for cost code: level 2, unit rates- Rate level = 2- USD currency- Effective date = 1/12/2019- Unit Rate 1 = 2.00 3. Add Disb to Payment and save- Client/matter- Disb code- Other mandatory fields- Quantity = 1 | Expected: Uses rates row 2 for unit rate then rates row 1 for markup 2 + 10 = 12FormBase = 12 (displays 10 until the quantity added)Bill = 12 (displays 10 until the quantity added)CDT_DISBRATE_METHOD = 4BASE_AMT = 12TOBILL_AMT = 12STD_AMT = 2 (standard amount doesn't use the markup)DECLARE @disb asint= 3460DECLARE @costcode asvarchar(50)= (SELECT COST_CODE FROM CDT_DISB WHERE DISB_UNO = @disb)DECLARE @matteruno asint= (SELECT MATTER_UNO FROM CDT_DISB WHERE DISB_UNO = @disb)DECLARE @clientuno asint= (SELECT CLIENT_UNO FROM HBM_MATTER WHERE MATTER_UNO = @matteruno)--/*SELECT''[Disb],BASE_QTY,BASE_AMT,BILL_QTY,TOBILL_AMT,STD_AMT,BILLED_AMT,AUTO_CALCULATE,CURRENCY_CODE,DRUNO,PERIOD,RATE_METHOD,DI_OFFC,DI_EMPL_UNO, TRAN_DATE,POST_DATE,BILL_TRAN_UNO,LAST_MODIFIED,* FROM CDT_DISB  WHERE DISB_UNO = @disbSELECT ''[Client/Matter],m.CLNT_MATT_CODE, tm.RATE_LEVEL[Matter Rate Level],tm.RATE_LEVEL_DATE[Matter RL Date],tm.DI_RATE_SET_UNO[Matter Rate Set],tc.RATE_LEVEL[Client Rate Level],tc.RATE_LEVEL_DATE[Client RL Date],tc.DI_RATE_SET_UNO[Client Rate Set]FROM HBM_MATTER mJOIN HBM_CLIENT c ON m.CLIENT_UNO = c.CLIENT_UNOJOIN TBM_MATTER tm ON m.MATTER_UNO = tm.MATTER_UNOJOIN TBM_CLIENT tc ON m.CLIENT_UNO = tc.CLIENT_UNOWHERE m.MATTER_UNO = @matteruno--SELECT * FROM tbm_matter where MATTER_UNO = @matteruno--*/--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- COST CODE RATES-- Rate sets values are also stored in the TBM_RATE_DISB for a cost code but they-- are linked to a matter via TBM_MATTER-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------SELECT''[TBM_RATE_DISB],dr.COST_CODE,cc.COST_DESC,dr.OFFC,GROUP_TYPE,dr.MATTER_UNO,CASEWHEN dr.MATTER_UNO <> 0 THEN m.MATTER_CODE +': '+ m.MATTER_NAME +' ('+CAST(m.MATTER_UNO ASnvarchar)+')'ELSE''END[Matter],dr.CLIENT_UNO,CASE WHEN dr.CLIENT_UNO <> 0 THEN c.CLIENT_CODE + ': ' + c.CLIENT_NAME + ' (' + CAST(c.CLIENT_UNO AS nvarchar) + ')' ELSE '' END[Client], CASE WHEN dr.RATE_SET_UNO <> 0 THEN rs.RATE_SET_CODE + ': ' + rs.RATE_SET_DESC + ' (' + CAST(rs.RATE_SET_UNO AS nvarchar) + ')' ELSE '' END[Rate Set],  EFF_DATE,dr.RATE_LEVEL,rl.DESCRIPTION [Rate Level],dr.CURRENCY_CODE,MK_PCNT,MK_AMT,THRESHOLD_1,UNIT_COST,THRESHOLD_2,UNIT_COST_2,THRESHOLD_3,UNIT_COST_3,THRESHOLD_4,UNIT_COST_4,UNIT_COST_5,INEMP_REQD,ALLOW_BASE_EDIT,ALLOW_HARD,ALLOW_SOFT,dr.ROW_UNO--,dr.* FROM TBM_RATE_DISB drJOIN CDL_COST cc ON dr.COST_CODE = cc.COST_CODELEFTJOIN HBM_MATTER m ON dr.MATTER_UNO = m.MATTER_UNOLEFTJOIN HBM_CLIENT c ON dr.CLIENT_UNO = c.CLIENT_UNOLEFTJOIN TBL_RATE_SET rs ON dr.RATE_SET_UNO = rs.RATE_SET_UNOLEFTJOIN TBL_LEVEL_DISB rl ON dr.RATE_LEVEL = rl.RATE_LEVEL--/*WHERE cc.COST_CODE = @costcodeAND(dr.GROUP_TYPE IN (3,4)OR (dr.GROUP_TYPE = 1 AND dr.MATTER_UNO = @matteruno)OR (dr.GROUP_TYPE = 2 AND dr.CLIENT_UNO = @clientuno))--*/ORDERBY dr.COST_CODE, dr.EFF_DATE descSELECT''[Rate Set linked to the matter],m.CLNT_MATT_CODE,tm.DI_RATE_SET_UNO,rs.RATE_SET_CODE,dr.COST_CODE,EFF_DATE,dr.CURRENCY_CODE,MK_PCNT,MK_AMT,THRESHOLD_1,UNIT_COST,THRESHOLD_2,UNIT_COST_2,THRESHOLD_3,UNIT_COST_3,THRESHOLD_4,UNIT_COST_4,UNIT_COST_5,dr.ROW_UNOFROM TBM_MATTER tmJOIN HBM_MATTER m ON tm.MATTER_UNO = m.MATTER_UNOJOIN TBL_RATE_SET rs ON tm.DI_RATE_SET_UNO = rs.RATE_SET_UNOJOIN TBM_RATE_DISB dr ON rs.RATE_SET_UNO = dr.RATE_SET_UNOWHERE tm.MATTER_UNO = @matterunoSELECT''[Client and Matter Contraints],cmd.REC_TYPE,cmd.MATTER_UNO,m.CLNT_MATT_CODE,cmd.CLIENT_UNO,c.CLIENT_CODE,cmd.COST_CODE,cmd.RATE_LEVEL,cmd.RATE_LEVEL_DATE,ROW_UNO--cmd.* FROM TBM_CLMAT_DISB cmdLEFTJOIN HBM_MATTER m ON cmd.MATTER_UNO = m.MATTER_UNOLEFTJOIN HBM_CLIENT c ON cmd.CLIENT_UNO = c.CLIENT_UNOWHERE cmd.COST_CODE = @costcodeAND(cmd.MATTER_UNO = @matteruno OR cmd.CLIENT_UNO = @clientuno) || Step 4: Rate set and rate set markup1. Add Rates row 3 for rate setClassic | Hub Setup | Time and Billing Setup | Rate Sets- Currency = USD- Rate Type = Disb- Disb Code- Effective Date = 1/11/2019- All offices = Y- Markup amount = 30.00- Unit Rate 1 = 3.00Link to matter: Classic | Matter Management | Time and Billing | Disbs2. Add Disb to Payment and save- Client/matter- Disb code- Other mandatory fields- Quantity = 1 | Expected: Uses rates row 3 for unit rate and markup 3 + 30 = 33FormBase = 33 (displays 30 until the quantity added)Bill = 33 (displays 30 until the quantity added)CDT_DISBRATE_METHOD = 3BASE_AMT = 33TOBILL_AMT = 33STD_AMT = 3 (standard amount doesn't use the markup) || Step 5: Client constraint rate and markup 1. Add Client constraint rates row 4: level 1, unit rates Classic | Client management | Disbursement constraints- Disbursement = cost code- Currency = USD- Effective date = 1/10/2019- Current = level 1- Markup amount = 40.00 - Unit Rate 1 = 4.002. Add Disb to Payment and save- Client/matter- Disb code- Other mandatory fields- Quantity = 1 | Expected: Uses rates row 4 for unit rate and markup 4 + 40 = 44FormBase = 44 (displays 40 until the quantity added)Bill = 44 (displays 40 until the quantity added)CDT_DISBRATE_METHOD = 2BASE_AMT = 44TOBILL_AMT = 44STD_AMT = 4 (standard amount doesn't use the markup) || Step 6: Matter constraint rate and markup 1. Add Matter constraint rates row 5: level 1, mark up and unit ratesClassic | Matter management | Disbursement constraints- Disbursement = cost code- Currency = USD- Effective date = 1/9/2019- Current = level 1- Markup amount = 50.00 - Unit Rate 1 = 5.002. Add Disb to Payment and save- Client/matter- Disb code- Other mandatory fields- Quantity = 1 | Expected: Uses rates row 5 for unit rate and markup 5 + 50 = 55FormBase = 55 (displays 50 until the quantity added)Bill = 55 (displays 50 until the quantity added)CDT_DISBRATE_METHOD = 1BASE_AMT = 55TOBILL_AMT = 55STD_AMT = 5 (standard amount doesn't use the markup)

Title: Schedule - Vendor: Warn if invoice disbursement not paid or full bill not paid
Steps: Step 1: Pre reqs Admin | Accounts Payable | Accounts payable options | Firm options- Withhold disbursement cash receipt until vendor is paid (HOLD_DISB) = Off- Withhold disbursement cash receipt until check is reconciled (HOLD_DISB_CHECK_RECONCILE) = Off- Hold Invoice for Full Bill Payment (INV_PAYFULL_RELEAS)= OffNote: Pub database comes with defaults:- Withhold disbursement cash receipt until vendor is paid = On- Withhold disbursement cash receipt until check is reconciled = Off- Hold invoice for full bill payment = OffSELECT INV_PAYFULL_RELEAS,HOLD_DISB_CHECK_RECONCILE,HOLD_DISB FROM APM_PARMSUPDATE APM_PARMS SET INV_PAYFULL_RELEAS ='N',HOLD_DISB_CHECK_RECONCILE ='N',HOLD_DISB ='Y'--DefaultUPDATE APM_PARMS SET INV_PAYFULL_RELEAS ='N',HOLD_DISB_CHECK_RECONCILE ='N',HOLD_DISB ='N'--Don't need full bill paidUPDATE APM_PARMS SET INV_PAYFULL_RELEAS ='Y',HOLD_DISB_CHECK_RECONCILE ='N',HOLD_DISB ='N'--Need full bill paid || Step 2: Disb not billed - disb payment required (full bill payment not required)1. Full bill payment required = Off - APM_PARMS.INV_PAYFULL_RELEAS = N Note: reopen app to pick up the change2. Create an invoice3. Set Client Bill Payment Required = On- APT_INVOICE.BILL_PMT_REQD = Y4. Add a disb item5. Post the invoice6. Attempt to add to schedule- From grid - From add multiple within schedule- From add single within schedule | Expected: From gridCreate schedule but don't add invoiceError: Client disbursements for this invoice have not been paid. INVPMT_UNPAIDDISBFrom add multiple within scheduleDon't add invoiceFrom add single within scheduleWarning: Client disbursements have not been paid. Do you want to continue?INVPMT_UNPAIDDISB || Step 3: Disb has been billed but not paid - disb payment required but (full bill payment not required)1. Full bill payment required = Off - APM_PARMS.INV_PAYFULL_RELEAS = N 2. Create an invoice3. Set Client Bill Payment Required = On- APT_INVOICE.BILL_PMT_REQD = Y4. Add a disb item5. Post the invoice6. Create a bill- add the disb7. Post the bill8. Attempt to add to schedule- From grid - From add multiple within schedule- From add single within schedule | Expected: From gridCreate schedule but don't add invoiceError: Client disbursements for this invoice have not been paid. INVPMT_UNPAIDDISBFrom add multiple within scheduleDon't add invoiceFrom add single within scheduleWarning: Client disbursements have not been paid. Do you want to continue?INVPMT_UNPAIDDISB || Step 4: Disb has been billed but not fully paid and paid amt is not posted - disb payment required (full bill payment not required)Note: Payments are made via classic Account Receivable against the bill1. Full bill payment required = Off - APM_PARMS.INV_PAYFULL_RELEAS = N 2. Create an invoice3. Set Client Bill Payment Required = On- APT_INVOICE.BILL_PMT_REQD = Y4. Add a disb item5. Post the invoice6. Create a bill- add the disb7. Post the bill8. Pay some of the bill (via Accounts Receivable) but not enough to cover the full disb amount. - disb has not been fully paid based on BLH_PAID_DISBNote: Do NOT Post the bill payment9. Attempt to add to schedule- From grid - From add multiple within schedule- From add single within schedule | Expected: From gridCreate schedule but don't add invoiceError: Client disbursements for this invoice have not been paid. INVPMT_UNPAIDDISBFrom add multiple within scheduleDon't add invoiceFrom add single within scheduleWarning: Client disbursements have not been paid. Do you want to continue?INVPMT_UNPAIDDISBNote: the message is displayed because altho some bill payment has been made to the disb, the bill payment has not been posted (logic added in 83) || Step 5: Disb has been billed and fully paid and paid amt is not posted - disb payment required (full bill payment not required)1. Full bill payment required = Off - APM_PARMS.INV_PAYFULL_RELEAS = N 2. Create an invoice3. Set Client Bill Payment Required = On- APT_INVOICE.BILL_PMT_REQD = Y4. Add a disb item5. Post the invoice6. Create a bill- add the disb7. Post the bill8. Pay the full disb amount on the bill (via Accounts Receivable) BLH_PAID_DISBNote: Do NOT Post the bill payment9. Attempt to add to schedule- From grid - From add multiple within schedule- From add single within schedule | Expected: From gridCreate schedule but don't add invoiceError: Client disbursements for this invoice have not been paid. INVPMT_UNPAIDDISBFrom add multiple within scheduleDon't add invoiceFrom add single within scheduleWarning: Client disbursements have not been paid. Do you want to continue?INVPMT_UNPAIDDISBNote: the message is displayed because altho bill payment has been made to the disb for the full disb amt, the bill payment has not been posted (logic added in 83) || Step 6: Disb has been billed and fully paid and paid amt is posted - disb payment required (full bill payment not required)1. Full bill payment required = Off - APM_PARMS.INV_PAYFULL_RELEAS = N 2. Create an invoice3. Set Client Bill Payment Required = On- APT_INVOICE.BILL_PMT_REQD = Y4. Add a disb item5. Post the invoice6. Create a bill- add the disb7. Post the bill8. Pay the full disb amount on the bill (via Accounts Receivable) BLH_PAID_DISB9. Post the bill payment. 10. Attempt to add to schedule- From grid - From add multiple within schedule- From add single within schedule | Expected: From gridCreate schedule and add invoiceFrom add multiple within scheduleAdd invoiceFrom add single within scheduleAdd invoice || Step 7: Disb has not been billed - disb payment required (full bill payment is required)1. Full bill payment required = ON- APM_PARMS.INV_PAYFULL_RELEAS = Y Note: reopen app to pick up the change2. Create an invoice3. Set Client Bill Payment Required = On- APT_INVOICE.BILL_PMT_REQD = Y4. Add a disb item5. Post the invoice6. Attempt to add to schedule- From grid - From add multiple within schedule- From add single within schedule | Expected: From gridCreate schedule but don't add invoiceError: Client disbursements for this invoice have not been paid. INVPMT_UNPAIDDISBFrom add multiple within scheduleDon't add invoiceFrom add single within scheduleWarning: Client disbursements have not been paid. Do you want to continue?INVPMT_UNPAIDDISB || Step 8: Disb has been billed and the bill has not been fully paid - disb payment required (full bill payment required)1. Full bill payment required = ON- APM_PARMS.INV_PAYFULL_RELEAS = Y 2. Create an invoice3. Set Client Bill Payment Required = On- APT_INVOICE.BILL_PMT_REQD = Y4. Add a disb item5. Post the invoice6. Create a bill- add the disb- add a time entry7. Post the bill8. Pay part of the bill (via Accounts Recievable - ensure some of the allocation is against the disb)10. Post the bill payment11. Attempt to add to schedule- From grid - From add multiple within schedule- From add single within schedule | Expected: From gridCreate schedule but don't add invoiceError: Client disbursements for this invoice have not been paid. INVPMT_UNPAIDDISBFrom add multiple within scheduleDon't add invoiceFrom add single within scheduleWarning: Client disbursements have not been paid. Do you want to continue?INVPMT_UNPAIDDISB || Step 9: Disb has been billed to a split bill and the bill has not been fully paid - disb payment required (full bill payment required)1. Full bill payment required = ON- APM_PARMS.INV_PAYFULL_RELEAS = Y 2. Create an invoice3. Set Client Bill Payment Required = On- APT_INVOICE.BILL_PMT_REQD = Y4. Add a disb item5. Post the invoice6. Create a split bill- add the disb7. Post the bill8. Pay one split of the bill (via Accounts Receivable) 9. Post the bill payment10. Attempt to add to schedule- From grid - From add multiple within schedule- From add single within schedule | Expected: From gridCreate schedule but don't add invoiceError: Client disbursements for this invoice have not been paid. INVPMT_UNPAIDDISBFrom add multiple within scheduleDon't add invoiceFrom add single within scheduleWarning: Client disbursements have not been paid. Do you want to continue?INVPMT_UNPAIDDISB

Title: Payment Items - Disbursement: Rates Hierachy Level 2 and level 3 contraints do not have rates
Steps: Step 1: Note: This uses a common SP created for classic. Note: Matter and client constraints can only have a max of 1 of each set up for each cost codeThe hierachy for this test is:Note: This does not match the documentation. Decission was made to change the documentation rather than the codeNote: if there are no markups set on the rate that is found, use the markup from the cost code level 1 rate1. The disbursement rate 2. The Rate Set attached to the matter3. The cost code rates that match the level for the Matter contraint that doesn't have its own rates4. The cost code rates that match the level for the client contraint that doesn't have its own rates5. The cost code rates || Step 2: Pre req dataClient: Matter: Disb Cost Code (e.g. RH2)Classic | Client Disbursements | Disbursment Setup | Disbursement Types- Allow soft = Y- Allow Hard = Y- Allow edit of base values = Y- Apply markup = Y- Has Unit rates = Y Payment- Vendor type- Currency = USD- Incomplete or Complete || Step 3: Cost Code rates and markup1. Add Rates row 1 for costs code: level 1, markups- Rate level = 1- USD currency- Effective date = 1/1/2019- Markup amount = 10.002. Add Rates row 2 for cost code: level 1, unit rates- Rate level = 1- USD currency- Effective date = 1/12/2019- Unit Rate 1 = 2.00 3. Add Rates row 3 for cost code: level 2, unit rates- Rate level = 2- USD currency- Effective date = 1/12/2019- Unit Rate 1 = 2.50 3. Add Rates row 4 for cost code: level 3, unit rates- Rate level = 3- USD currency- Effective date = 1/12/2019- Unit Rate 1 = 2.60 4. Add Disb to Payment and save- Client/matter- Disb code- Other mandatory fields- Quantity = 1 | Expected: Uses rates row 2 for unit rate then rates row 1 for markup 2 + 10 = 12FormBase = 12 (displays 10 until the quantity added)Bill = 12 (displays 10 until the quantity added)CDT_DISBRATE_METHOD = 4BASE_AMT = 12TOBILL_AMT = 12STD_AMT = 2 (standard amout doesn't use the markup)DECLARE @disb asint= 3460DECLARE @costcode asvarchar(50)= (SELECT COST_CODE FROM CDT_DISB WHERE DISB_UNO = @disb)DECLARE @matteruno asint= (SELECT MATTER_UNO FROM CDT_DISB WHERE DISB_UNO = @disb)DECLARE @clientuno asint= (SELECT CLIENT_UNO FROM HBM_MATTER WHERE MATTER_UNO = @matteruno)--/*SELECT''[Disb],BASE_QTY,BASE_AMT,BILL_QTY,TOBILL_AMT,STD_AMT,BILLED_AMT,AUTO_CALCULATE,CURRENCY_CODE,DRUNO,PERIOD,RATE_METHOD,DI_OFFC,DI_EMPL_UNO, TRAN_DATE,POST_DATE,BILL_TRAN_UNO,LAST_MODIFIED,* FROM CDT_DISB  WHERE DISB_UNO = @disbSELECT ''[Client/Matter],m.CLNT_MATT_CODE, tm.RATE_LEVEL[Matter Rate Level],tm.RATE_LEVEL_DATE[Matter RL Date],tm.DI_RATE_SET_UNO[Matter Rate Set],tc.RATE_LEVEL[Client Rate Level],tc.RATE_LEVEL_DATE[Client RL Date],tc.DI_RATE_SET_UNO[Client Rate Set]FROM HBM_MATTER mJOIN HBM_CLIENT c ON m.CLIENT_UNO = c.CLIENT_UNOJOIN TBM_MATTER tm ON m.MATTER_UNO = tm.MATTER_UNOJOIN TBM_CLIENT tc ON m.CLIENT_UNO = tc.CLIENT_UNOWHERE m.MATTER_UNO = @matteruno--SELECT * FROM tbm_matter where MATTER_UNO = @matteruno--*/--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- COST CODE RATES-- Rate sets values are also stored in the TBM_RATE_DISB for a cost code but they-- are linked to a matter via TBM_MATTER-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------SELECT''[TBM_RATE_DISB],dr.COST_CODE,cc.COST_DESC,dr.OFFC,GROUP_TYPE,dr.MATTER_UNO,CASEWHEN dr.MATTER_UNO <> 0 THEN m.MATTER_CODE +': '+ m.MATTER_NAME +' ('+CAST(m.MATTER_UNO ASnvarchar)+')'ELSE''END[Matter],dr.CLIENT_UNO,CASE WHEN dr.CLIENT_UNO <> 0 THEN c.CLIENT_CODE + ': ' + c.CLIENT_NAME + ' (' + CAST(c.CLIENT_UNO AS nvarchar) + ')' ELSE '' END[Client], CASE WHEN dr.RATE_SET_UNO <> 0 THEN rs.RATE_SET_CODE + ': ' + rs.RATE_SET_DESC + ' (' + CAST(rs.RATE_SET_UNO AS nvarchar) + ')' ELSE '' END[Rate Set],  EFF_DATE,dr.RATE_LEVEL,rl.DESCRIPTION [Rate Level],dr.CURRENCY_CODE,MK_PCNT,MK_AMT,THRESHOLD_1,UNIT_COST,THRESHOLD_2,UNIT_COST_2,THRESHOLD_3,UNIT_COST_3,THRESHOLD_4,UNIT_COST_4,UNIT_COST_5,INEMP_REQD,ALLOW_BASE_EDIT,ALLOW_HARD,ALLOW_SOFT,dr.ROW_UNO--,dr.* FROM TBM_RATE_DISB drJOIN CDL_COST cc ON dr.COST_CODE = cc.COST_CODELEFTJOIN HBM_MATTER m ON dr.MATTER_UNO = m.MATTER_UNOLEFTJOIN HBM_CLIENT c ON dr.CLIENT_UNO = c.CLIENT_UNOLEFTJOIN TBL_RATE_SET rs ON dr.RATE_SET_UNO = rs.RATE_SET_UNOLEFTJOIN TBL_LEVEL_DISB rl ON dr.RATE_LEVEL = rl.RATE_LEVEL--/*WHERE cc.COST_CODE = @costcodeAND(dr.GROUP_TYPE IN (3,4)OR (dr.GROUP_TYPE = 1 AND dr.MATTER_UNO = @matteruno)OR (dr.GROUP_TYPE = 2 AND dr.CLIENT_UNO = @clientuno))--*/ORDERBY dr.COST_CODE, dr.EFF_DATE descSELECT''[Rate Set linked to the matter],m.CLNT_MATT_CODE,tm.DI_RATE_SET_UNO,rs.RATE_SET_CODE,dr.COST_CODE,EFF_DATE,dr.CURRENCY_CODE,MK_PCNT,MK_AMT,THRESHOLD_1,UNIT_COST,THRESHOLD_2,UNIT_COST_2,THRESHOLD_3,UNIT_COST_3,THRESHOLD_4,UNIT_COST_4,UNIT_COST_5,dr.ROW_UNOFROM TBM_MATTER tmJOIN HBM_MATTER m ON tm.MATTER_UNO = m.MATTER_UNOJOIN TBL_RATE_SET rs ON tm.DI_RATE_SET_UNO = rs.RATE_SET_UNOJOIN TBM_RATE_DISB dr ON rs.RATE_SET_UNO = dr.RATE_SET_UNOWHERE tm.MATTER_UNO = @matterunoSELECT''[Client and Matter Contraints],cmd.REC_TYPE,cmd.MATTER_UNO,m.CLNT_MATT_CODE,cmd.CLIENT_UNO,c.CLIENT_CODE,cmd.COST_CODE,cmd.RATE_LEVEL,cmd.RATE_LEVEL_DATE,ROW_UNO--cmd.* FROM TBM_CLMAT_DISB cmdLEFTJOIN HBM_MATTER m ON cmd.MATTER_UNO = m.MATTER_UNOLEFTJOIN HBM_CLIENT c ON cmd.CLIENT_UNO = c.CLIENT_UNOWHERE cmd.COST_CODE = @costcodeAND(cmd.MATTER_UNO = @matteruno OR cmd.CLIENT_UNO = @clientuno) || Step 4: Client constraint 1. Add Client constraint Classic | Client management | Disbursement constraints- Disbursement = cost code- Currency = USD- Effective date = 1/10/2019- Current = level 22. Add Disb to Payment and save- Client/matter- Disb code- Other mandatory fields- Quantity = 1 | Expected: Uses rates row 3 for unit rate and 1 for markup 2.50 FormBase = 2.50 (displays 0 until the quantity added)Bill = 2.50 (displays 0 until the quantity added)CDT_DISBRATE_METHOD = 4BASE_AMT = 2.50TOBILL_AMT = 2.50STD_AMT = 2.50 || Step 5: Matter constraint rate and markup 1. Add Matter Classic | Matter management | Disbursement constraints- Disbursement = cost code- Currency = USD- Effective date = 1/9/2019- Current = level 32. Add Disb to Payment and save- Client/matter- Disb code- Other mandatory fields- Quantity = 1 | Expected: Uses rates row 4 for unit rate and 1 for markup 2.60 FormBase = 2.60 (displays 0 until the quantity added)Bill = 2.60 (displays 0 until the quantity added)CDT_DISBRATE_METHOD = 4BASE_AMT = 2.60TOBILL_AMT = 2.60STD_AMT = 2.60 || Step 6: Rate set and rate set markup1. Add Rates row 5 for rate setClassic | Hub Setup | Time and Billing Setup | Rate Sets- Currency = USD- Rate Type = Disb- Disb Code- Effective Date = 1/11/2019- All offices = Y- Markup amount = 30.00- Unit Rate 1 = 3.00Link to matter: Classic | Matter Management Time and Billing | Disbs2. Add Disb to Payment and save- Client/matter- Disb code- Other mandatory fields- Quantity = 1 | Expected: Uses rates row 5 for unit rate and markup 3 + 30 = 33FormBase = 33 (displays 30 until the quantity added)Bill = 33 (displays 30 until the quantity added)CDT_DISBRATE_METHOD = 3BASE_AMT = 33TOBILL_AMT = 33STD_AMT = 3 (standard amount doesn't use the markup)

Title: Schedule - Vendor: Header look and feel
Steps: Step 1: The design for new vendor payment header is outlined on https://aderant.sharepoint.com/RD/AP/Moscow%20Design%20Wiki/Payment%20Schedule%20Entry%20Screen.aspx || Step 2: The header fields appear in the following order: || Step 3: Schedule Number | Expected: Read only field. Display as 'New' for a new schedule. Display APS_SCHEDULE_Z.SCHEDULE_NUM when it is an existing schedule entry. || Step 4: Schedule Type | Expected: Display right next to schedule number. Display either Vendor or Employee Payment depend on which has been selected. || Step 5: Bank | Expected: List control. Only show active and not trust bank Acct_Type <> 'T. Disabled when there are invoices attached to schedule. (Bug 161447) || Step 6: Payment Date | Expected: Date provider, also date to be printed on check. Must be in parms dates || Step 7: Date To Print | Expected: Date provider, only on >= today's date. do not have to be in posting range || Step 8: Language | Expected: list control, showing available language. Spanish, English, French for our case || Step 9: Take overdue Discount | Expected: pick list. Default is set based in parameter APM_PARMS.TAKE_DISCOUNT (need to restart AP to see the changes) || Step 10: Details total and currency | Expected: Read only. Update when invoices are added or removed from schedule. Currency is obtained from bank selected above. || Step 11: Payment Status - Upper right flag | Expected: Should display as orange flag with 'E' for Edit. Change to green 'P' flag for request generated.

Title: Schedule - Vendor: Invoice Form Look and Feel - NEEDS WORK
Steps: Step 1: Test case copied from another - needs redone || Step 2: Display | Expected: Break this down into separate steps for each fieldModify Mode- All fields populated where data exists (populated from the selected invoice)- Fields editable (if schedule is still editable): Remit Vendor, Discount Amount, 1099 Amount, Payment Amount, Withheld Amount and Separate Check fieldView mode- Form is read only- All fields populated where data exists (populated from the selected invoice) || Step 3: Vendor | Expected: Data Provider- Lookup- Mandatory- Populated from selection of invoice- Does not return record with UNO 0- Searches on name,id- Active and Inactive items - Has MRUs- Lookup Displays the code and descriptionSELECT VENDOR_NAME, VENDOR_ID,OWNING_OFFC,CURRENCY_CODE,*FROM APM_VENDORData Returned- Multi Select returns invoices for each filter item || Step 4: Invoice | Expected: Data Provider- Lookup- Mandatory- Returns all available outstanding and part paid invoices where:    EAP_INITATED = 'Y' AND 'N' (why just Y and N? it could be NULL)   List is filtered by vendor if entered (is it filtered by remit vendor?)   Does not return an invoice that has a part payment on an unposted payment || Step 5: Remit Vendor IDAdded in 821SP1 | Expected: Data Provider- Lookup- Mandatory- Populated from selection of vendor or invoice - Does not return record with UNO 0- Searches on name,id- Active and Inactive items - Has MRUs- Lookup Displays the code and descriptionSELECT VENDOR_NAME, VENDOR_ID,OWNING_OFFC,CURRENCY_CODE,*FROM APM_VENDORData Returned- Multi Select returns invoices for each filter item || Step 6: Middle SectionInvoice Amount, Invoice DateDiscount Amount, Discount DateInv 1099 Amount, Due DateBalance, Hold DateNarrative | Expected: Display- Read only || Step 7: EditableDiscount Amount, 1099 AmountPayment Amount, Withheld AmountSeparate Check (checkbox) | Expected: These fields will be automatically populated when an invoice is selected. Can be modify.- Payment amount and 1099 amount cannot be < 0 (can get into this state when the discount amount on the invoice > the invoice amount) || Step 8: State Withhold Taxfrom 82SP2 | Expected: - Only visible when CMS_OPTION code: "ST_WHTAX" is on - Only enabled when selected invoice has state withhold tax setup || Step 9: Cancel button || Step 10: Add button || Step 11: Add & Close button

Title: Schedule - grid: Look and Feel NEEDS REDONE
Steps: Step 1: Redo this - copied from another test case || Step 2: Hover to the 'Payment' icon beside the invoice status. | Expected: A small window appear when you hover over the info icon. It should show this invoice has Outstanding status and the hover over also shows the payment schedule Number the invoice attached to. || Step 3: Check the Payment Schedule column in the Invoices grid. | Expected: Should display the payment schedule number which the invoice attached to.  *If this column is not available, right click and add from context menu. || Step 7: General Checks | Expected: * Zoom ctrl + mouse scroll * Tabbing* Scroll bars* Column sorting Bug 210417: BUG: Expert AP Invoices List Screen - Alerts Tab doesn't sort- Fixed* Row selection* Grouping* Numbers, amounts and dates right aligned* Text left aligned* Money displays currency symbol || Step 8: Select | Expected: * select all * reverse * select * select none * Shift + click - selects all between the two selected * Ctrl + A - selects all || Step 9: Customising the columns | Expected: * Available columns (settings maintained)* Column order (settings maintained)* Column width (settings maintained)* Freeze columns (settings maintained) || Step 10: Right click menu | Expected: When the corresponding ribbon bar item is enabled:User Story 159879 - Grids need right click functionality matching some of the ribbon bar itemsOpen ReleaseUnreleasePostCancelPrint PaymentsCreate Bank FileReprint ChecksRecrreate Bank FileReprint Remittance AdvicesEvaluate RulesAlways:* Select All* Select None* Reverse Select-----------------------*Export----------------------* Columns* Grouping* Freeze Columns || Step 11: Paper clip | Expected: Opens the documents for viewing || Step 12: Performance | Expected: * Loads 2000 payments in approx 15 seconds* Select All and select none for 2000 is almost immediateBug 171525 - Payment Grid: Performance issues

Title: Invoice - Disb Detail - Expansion Codes - Default Narrative
Steps: Step 1: Available from 82SP1.EX0011 and 82SP2.EX0001 onwards*Expansion Code narrative default when Client.Matter, PhaseTask (optional), and Disb Code are filled in. || Step 2: Turn off Firm Options > Generate Disbursement Text flagBug 236724 : User Expansion Code can be selected when setup Firm Disb Type || Step 3: Setup - Expansion CodesAdmin > Hub Setup > Firm Setup > Expansion Code Expansion Code DISB1Expansion Type = DExpansion Text = Expansion Code 1 from Client.Matter Matter Plan Expansion Code DISB2Expansion Type = DExpansion Text = Expansion Code 2 from Task Code Expansion Code DISB3Expansion Type = DExpansion Text = Expansion Code 3 from Disb Code || Step 4: Setup Matter Plan Create two phase task.Classic > Task Based Billing Management > Task SetsAdd New Phase1.Task1 and Phase2.Task2.Set Task1 Disb Expansion Code = DISB1 Link Phase TasksClassic > Task Based Billing Management > Plan CodeLink Phase1.Task1. to AnyPhase.L110.Link Phase2.Task2 to AnyPhase.AnyTask Attach Matter Plan to a matter.Classic > Matter Management > Time and Billing > Billing tab || Step 5: Setup Task CodeAdmin > Hub Setup > Time and Billing Setup > Tasks  Create new or use existing task code. This test case uses existing L110 task code.Disb Expansion Code = DISB2 || Step 6: Setup Disb CodeAdmin > Disbursements > Disb Options > Disb Type Disb Expansion Code = DISB3 || Step 7: Default narrative from Matter Plan with Expansion CodeCreate disbursement with:- Client.Matter with matter plan- Phase1.Task1- Disb with DISB3 expansion code | Expected: Matter plan expansion code narrative is defaulted - DISB1 Expansion Text = Expansion Code 1 from Client.Matter Matter Plan || Step 8: Default narrative from Task with Expansion CodeCreate disbursement with:- Client.Matter without matter plan- Phase1.Task1- Disb with DISB3 expansion code | Expected: Task expansion code narrative is defaulted - DISB2Expansion Text = Expansion Code 2 from Task Code || Step 9: Default narrative from Disb Code with Expansion CodeCreate disbursement with:- Client.Matter without matter plan- Phase2.Task2 (without expansion code setup)- Disb with DISB3 expansion code | Expected: Task expansion code narrative is defaulted - DISB3Expansion Text = Expansion Code 3 from Disb Code || Step 10: Not defaulting narrative from Expansion Code when Firm Options > Generate Disbursement Text = Y.Create disbursement with:- Client.Matter with matter plan- Phase1.Task1- Disb with DISB3 expansion code | Expected: Generated narrative is populated on a new form.Narrative change window will pop up window when Client.Matter, PhaseTask and Disb Code is entered.Click OK - Narrative change to DISB1 Expansion TextExpansion Text = Expansion Code 1 from Client.Matter Matter PlanClick Cancel - Narrative remain unchange.

Title: Invoice - Disb Detail - Expansion Codes - Changing Client.Matter field
Steps: Step 1: Available from 82SP1.EX0011 and 82SP2.EX0001 onwards*Expansion Code narrative default when Client.Matter, PhaseTask (optional), and Disb Code are filled in. || Step 2: See shared step on where to setup the expansion code in different areas || Step 3: Pre reqMatter A with Matter Plan A- Matter plan > Task code 1 > Expansion Code = DISBA1- Matter plan > Task Code 2 > Expansion Code = DISBA2Matter B with Matter Plan A (Same matter plan as Matter A)- Matter plan > Task code 1 > Expansion Code = DISBA1- Matter plan > Task code 2 > Expansion Code = DISBA2Matter C with Matter Plan C- Matter plan > Task code 1 > Expansion Code = DISBC1- Matter plan > Task code 2 > Expansion Code = No setupMatter D without matter plan setup || Step 4: Matter with Matter Plan with Expansion Code --> Matter same Matter Plan with Expansion Code1. Create a new disbursment with Matter A with task 1.2. Save3. Expansion Code default from DISBA14. Change MatterA to Matter B | Expected: Pop up narrative change from Matter Plan confirmation dialog. Click Yes. Narrative change to default from DISBB1 || Step 5: Matter with Matter Plan with Expansion Code --> Matter with the same Matter Plan 1. Create a new disbursment with Matter A with task 1.2. Save3. Expansion Code default from DISBA14. Change Matter A to Matter B | Expected: no pop up dialog. Narrative remain unchange. || Step 6: Matter with Matter Plan with Expansion Code --> Matter with different Matter Plan with Expansion Code1. Create a new disbursment with Matter A with task 1.2. Save3. Expansion Code default from DISBA14. Change Matter A to Matter C | Expected: Pop up narrative change from Matter Plan confirmation dialog. Click Yes. Narrative change to default from DISBC1 || Step 7: Matter with Matter Plan with Expansion Code --> Matter with Matter Plan without Expansion Code1. Create a new disbursment with Matter A with task 2.2. Save3. Expansion Code default from DISBA24. Change Matter A to Matter C | Expected: no pop up dialog. Narrative remain unchange. || Step 8: Matter with Matter Plan with Expansion Code --> Matter without Matter Plan 1. Create a new disbursment with Matter A with task 1.2. Save3. Expansion Code default from DISBA14. Change Matter A to Matter D | Expected: no pop up dialog. Narrative remain unchange. || Step 9: Matter without Matter Plan with Expansion Code --> Matter with Matter Plan with Expansion Code 1. Create a new disbursment with Matter A2. Save3. No text default4. Change Matter D to Matter A | Expected: no pop up dialog. Narrative change to default from DISBA1

Title: Schedule - Vendor: Taking overdue discount - Add Multiple
Steps: Step 1: Create Invoice with discount1. Create invoice- Enter mandatory data- Invoice date = today- Amount = 100- Select Payment Term '2%10' - add a line item to balance2. Post the Invoice | Expected: Invoice created with discount- Due date is 30 days > Invoice date- Discount date is 10 days > invoice date- Discount amount = 2.00 || Step 2: Take Overdue Discount = ON  Payment Date < Discount date 1. Create schedule and save- enter bank to match invoice- payment date = today- Date to print = today- Take Overdue Discount = Y2. Select to add multiple invoices3. Clear the 'Due Date To' filter4. Enter the vendor id5. Search & Add | Expected: Invoice item added with discount appliedGrid and Invoice item form displayInvoice Amount = 100.00Payment Amount = 98.00Discount Amount = 2.001099 Amount = 98.00APT_INVOICE_AMT (new  record)TRAN_TYPE = CHDISCNT_AMT = 2.00TC_AP_AMT = 100.00AP_AMT = 100.00TC_PAID_AMT = 98.00PAID_AMT = 98.00TEN99_AMT = 98.00----------------------------------------------------------------------------------- Declarations ---------------------------------------------------------------------------------DECLARE @schedulenum asint= 26DECLARE @schbank asvarchar(50)= (SELECT BANK_CODE FROM APS_SCHEDULE_Z WHERE SCHEDULE_NUM = @schedulenum)DECLARE @company asvarchar(20)= (SELECT COMPANY_CODE FROM TBM_BANK b JOIN HBL_OFFICE o ON b.OFFC = o.OFFC_CODE WHERE b.BANK_CODE = @schbank)----------------------------------------------------------------------------------- Header---------------------------------------------------------------------------------SELECT ''[APS_SCHEDULE_Z],SCHEDULE_NUM, z.STATUS,CASE WHEN z.SCHEDULE_TYPE = 'V' THEN 'Vendor' WHEN z.SCHEDULE_TYPE = 'E' THEN 'Employee' ELSE''END[Schedule Type],z.BANK_CODE,@company[Company],z.CHECK_DATE[Payment Date],z.DATE_TO_PRINT,cl.DISPLAY_TEXT [Language],----------------------------------------------------------------------------------- Other fields---------------------------------------------------------------------------------z.CREATE_DATE,p.EMPLOYEE_NAME +' ('+ p.EMPLOYEE_CODE +')'[Created By],TAKE_DISCOUNT,z.EAP_INITIATED, z.CHECK_LANGUAGE,z.STATUS_DATE,p2.EMPLOYEE_NAME +' ('+ p2.EMPLOYEE_CODE +')'[Status Employee],z.STATUS_EMPL_UNO,z.CREATE_EMPL_UNO,z.CUTOFF_DATE,z.INACTIVE,z.PRIMARY_REGION,z.LAST_MODIFIED----------------------------------------------------------------------------------- From---------------------------------------------------------------------------------FROM APS_SCHEDULE_Z zLEFTJOIN HBM_PERSNL p ON z.CREATE_EMPL_UNO = p.EMPL_UNO -- created employee LEFTJOIN HBM_PERSNL p2 ON z.STATUS_EMPL_UNO = p2.EMPL_UNO -- status employee LEFTJOIN CXL_CODE_LOOKUP look1 ON z.STATUS= look1.DB_VALUE and look1.LOOKUP_GROUP ='PaymentScheduleStatus'JOIN CXL_CODE_LOOKUP cl on cl.DB_VALUE = z.CHECK_LANGUAGE and cl.LOOKUP_GROUP ='CheckLanguage'WHERE SCHEDULE_NUM = @schedulenum----------------------------------------------------------------------------------- Schedule items---------------------------------------------------------------------------------SELECT ''[APT_INVOICE_AMT],ia.ROW_UNO,ia.INV_TRAN_UNO,SOURCE_REF,ia.TRAN_TYPE,v.VENDOR_NAME +' ('+ v.VENDOR_ID +')'[Vendor],v2.VENDOR_NAME +' ('+ v2.VENDOR_ID +')'[Remit Vendor],inv.INVOICE_NUM,inv.SEPARATE_CHECK,CASE WHEN inv.BANK_ACCOUNT_UNO = 0 THEN'Check'WHEN inv.BANK_ACCOUNT_UNO <> 0 THEN'Electronic Banking'END [Payment Method],inv.BANK_ACCOUNT_UNO,chq.WIRE_NUM,chq.CHECK_NUM,inv.INVOICE_DATE,inv.CURRENCY_CODE[Inv Cur],inv.TC_INV_AMT,inv.INV_AMT,ia.SIGN,ia.TC_CODE,ia.TC_PAID_AMT,ia.PAID_AMT,TC_AP_AMT,ia.AP_AMT,ia.TEN99_AMT,ia.DISCNT_AMT,inv.REF_NUM,ia.DISCNT_AMT, HOLD_DATE, ST_WHELD,inv.APTYPE_CODE,typ.BANK_CODE,inv.VENDOR_UNO,inv.REMIT_VENDOR_UNO,inv.EXPERT_INVOICE_STATUS, INVOICE_STATUS,inv.TRAN_UNO[TRAN_UNO Invoice],ia.LAST_MODIFIEDFROM APT_INVOICE_AMT iaJOIN APT_INVOICE inv on ia.INV_TRAN_UNO = inv.TRAN_UNOJOIN APL_APTYPE typ ON inv.APTYPE_CODE = typ.APTYPE_CODE LEFT JOIN APT_CHECK chq ON ia.SOURCE_TRAN_UNO = chq.TRAN_UNO LEFTJOIN APM_VENDOR v ON inv.VENDOR_UNO = v.VENDOR_UNO -- vendor LEFTJOIN APM_VENDOR v2 ON inv.REMIT_VENDOR_UNO = v2.VENDOR_UNO -- remit vendor WHERE ia.SCHEDULE_NUM = @schedulenumAND TRAN_TYPE <>'CHX' || Step 3: Take Overdue Discount = ON Payment Date = Discount date 1. Remove the invoice item2. Change payment date to = discount date3. Select to add multiple invoices4. Clear the 'Due Date To' filter5. Enter the vendor id6. Search & Add | Expected: Invoice item added with discount appliedGrid and Invoice item form displayInvoice Amount = 100.00Payment Amount = 98.00Discount Amount = 2.001099 Amount = 98.00APT_INVOICE_AMT (new  record)TRAN_TYPE = CHDISCNT_AMT = 2.00TC_AP_AMT = 100.00AP_AMT = 100.00TC_PAID_AMT = 98.00PAID_AMT = 98.00TEN99_AMT = 98.00 || Step 4: Take Overdue Discount = ONPayment Date > Discount 1. Remove the invoice item2. Change payment date to > discount date3. Select to add multiple invoices4. Clear the 'Due Date To' filter5. Enter the vendor id6. Search & Add | Expected: Invoice item added with discount appliedGrid and Invoice item form displayInvoice Amount = 100.00Payment Amount = 98.00Discount Amount = 2.001099 Amount = 98.00APT_INVOICE_AMT (new  record)TRAN_TYPE = CHDISCNT_AMT = 2.00TC_AP_AMT = 100.00AP_AMT = 100.00TC_PAID_AMT = 98.00PAID_AMT = 98.00TEN99_AMT = 98.00 || Step 5: Take Overdue Discount = OFFPayment Date < Discount date 1. Remove the invoice item2. Change payment date to = today3. Set Take Overdue Discount = N4. Select to add multiple invoices5. Clear the 'Due Date To' filter6. Enter the vendor id7. Search & Add | Expected: Invoice item added with discount appliedGrid and Invoice item form displayInvoice Amount = 100.00Payment Amount = 98.00Discount Amount = 2.001099 Amount = 98.00APT_INVOICE_AMT (new  record)TRAN_TYPE = CHDISCNT_AMT = 2.00TC_AP_AMT = 100.00AP_AMT = 100.00TC_PAID_AMT = 98.00PAID_AMT = 98.00TEN99_AMT = 98.00 || Step 6: Take Overdue Discount = OFFPayment Date = Discount date 1. Remove the invoice item2. Change payment date to = discount date3. Select to add multiple invoices4. Clear the 'Due Date To' filter5. Enter the vendor id6. Search & Add | Expected: Invoice item added with discount appliedGrid and Invoice item form displayInvoice Amount = 100.00Payment Amount = 98.00Discount Amount = 2.001099 Amount = 98.00APT_INVOICE_AMT (new  record)TRAN_TYPE = CHDISCNT_AMT = 2.00TC_AP_AMT = 100.00AP_AMT = 100.00TC_PAID_AMT = 98.00PAID_AMT = 98.00TEN99_AMT = 98.00 || Step 7: Take Overdue Discount = OFFPayment Date > Discount 1. Remove the invoice item2. Change payment date to > discount date3. Select to add multiple invoices4. Clear the 'Due Date To' filter5. Enter the vendor id6. Search & Add | Expected: Invoice item added with discount NOT appliedAPT_INVOICE_AMT (new  record)TRAN_TYPE = CHDISCNT_AMT = 0 TC_AP_AMT = 100.00AP_AMT = 100.00TC_PAID_AMT = 100.00PAID_AMT = 100.00TEN99_AMT = 100.00

= C$185.78Discount amount = C$46.44Inv 1099 Amount = C$185.78Balance = C$185.78Invoice item form display bottom sectionDiscount amount = C$46.44Payment Amount = C$139.341099 Amount = ----------------------------------------------------------------------------------- Declarations ---------------------------------------------------------------------------------DECLARE @vendorid asVARCHAR (50)='tst2'DECLARE @invoice asVARCHAR (50)='mar29'DECLARE @vendoruno asint= (SELECT VENDOR_UNO FROM APM_VENDOR WHERE VENDOR_ID = @vendorid)DECLARE @tran AS INT = (SELECT TRAN_UNO FROM APT_INVOICE WHERE VENDOR_UNO = @vendoruno AND INVOICE_NUM =  @invoice)DECLARE @invoicecur as VARCHAR (10) = (SELECT CURRENCY_CODE FROM APT_INVOICE WHERE VENDOR_UNO = @vendoruno AND INVOICE_NUM =  @invoice)----------------------------------------------------------------------------------- Invoice session---------------------------------------------------------------------------------SELECT ''[APS_INVOICE_Z],* FROM APS_INVOICE_Z z JOIN APT_INVOICE inv ON inv.SESSION= z.SESSIONWHERE TRAN_UNO = @tran----------------------------------------------------------------------------------- Invoice -- When not posted, amounts are in invoice currency -- When posted amounts are in system currency based on the DRUNO for the invoice date? ---------------------------------------------------------------------------------SELECT''[APT_INVOICE],TRAN_UNO,SESSION,SCHEDULE_NUM,SOURCE_REF,INVOICE_NUM,i.NAME_UNO,i.ADDRESS_UNO,SOURCE,INVOICE_DATE,DRUNO,PERIOD,TC_CODE,TC_INV_AMT,CURRENCY_CODE,DUE_DATE,ORIGINAL_AMT,INV_AMT,BALANCE,SALES_USE_TAX,DISC_AMT,TAX_AMT,TEN99_AMT,EXPERT_INVOICE_STATUS,INVOICE_STATUS,EXP_RPT_STATUS,JURISDIC_CODE,TEN99_CODE,DISCTERM_CODE,APTYPE_CODE,USE_OVERRIDE,USE_NAME_OVERRIDE,USE_ADDRS_OVERRIDE,i.BILL_PMT_REQD,EAP_INITIATED,EI_ID,-- expertIMAGE_ID,-- classic----------------------------------------------------------------------------------- Bank Acount i.TEXT_ID <> 0 THEN'('+CAST(i.TEXT_ID ASVARCHAR)+') '+ chqm.textELSE''END[Narrative],i.GL_AUDIT_NUM,i.APPROVED_DATE,i.CREATE_DATE,i.LAST_MODIFIED--,* FROM APT_INVOICE iLEFTJOIN HBA_NAME_BANK_ACCOUNT ba ON i.BANK_ACCOUNT_UNO = ba.BANK_ACCOUNT_UNOLEFTJOIN APV_AccountsPayableText chqm on i.TEXT_ID = chqm.TEXT_ID --Table is APT_TEXTWHERE TRAN_UNO = @tran----------------------------------------------------------------------------------- Invoice Amounts ---------------------------------------------------------------------------------SELECT''[APT_INVOICE_AMT],ia.ROW_UNO,INV_TRAN_UNO,SOURCE_TRAN_UNO,TRAN_TYPE,ia.SCHEDULE_NUM,CASE WHEN TRAN_TYPE = 'CH'  THEN (SELECT CAST(REQUEST_NUM AS VARCHAR) + ': ' + EXPERT_PAYMENT_STATUS FROM APT_CHECK WHERE TRAN_UNO = SOURCE_TRAN_UNO) ELSE '' END[Payment],SIGN,ia.TC_CODE,ia.TC_AP_AMT,ia.AP_AMT,ia.TC_PAID_AMT,ia.PAID_AMT,ia.TEN99_AMT,ia.ST_TEN99_AMT,ia.ST_WHTAX_AMT,DISCNT_AMT,ia.WHELD_AMT, ia.DRUNO,ia.PERIOD,ia.LAST_MODIFIED,*FROM APT_INVOICE_AMT ia--LEFT JOIN TBL_CURR_RATE r ON r.CURRENCY_CODE = ia.TC_CODE AND r.DRUNO = ia.DRUNOWHERE INV_TRAN_UNO = @tranORDERBY ia.ROW_UNO || Step 4: Reduce payment amount1. Title: Invoice - Disb Detail - Expansion Codes - Changing Phase.Task field
Steps: Step 1: Available from 82SP1.EX0011 and 82SP2.EX0001 onwards*Expansion Code narrative default when Client.Matter, PhaseTask (optional), and Disb Code are filled in. || Step 2: See shared step on where to setup the expansion code in different areas || Step 3: Pre reqTask Code A with Expansion Code DISBA, linked to two different PhaseTask Code B with Expansion Code DISBBTask Code C without expansion codeMatter A with Matter Plan A- Matter plan > Task code A > Expansion Code = DISBMPA- Matter plan > Task Code B > Expansion Code = No setupMake sure each of these tasks are linked to a phase. and each Expansion Code have unique expansion text. || Step 4: Task A --> Task B with different expansion code setup1. Create a new disbursment with Task A2. Save3. Expansion Code default from DISBA4. Change Task A to Task B | Expected: Pop up narrative change from phasetask confirmation dialog. Click Yes. Narrative change to default from DISBB || Step 5: Task A --> Task A but linked to different Phase1. Create a new disbursment with Task A2. Save3. Expansion Code default from DISBA4. Change Task A to Task A with different Phase. | Expected: no pop up dialog. Narrative remain unchange. || Step 6: Task A --> Task C with no setup1. Create a new disbursment with Task A2. Save3. Expansion Code default from DISBA4. Change Task A to Task C | Expected: no pop up dialog. Narrative remain unchange. || Step 7: Task C with no setup --> Task A with setup1. Create a new disbursment with Task C2. Save3. No expansion text default4. Change Task C to Task A | Expected: no pop up dialog. Narrative change to default from DISBA || Step 8: with Matter Plan, Task A --> Task B with no setup1. Create a new disbursment with Matter A with task A.2. Save3. Expansion Code default from DISBMPA4. Change Task A to Task B | Expected: no pop up dialog. Narrative remain unchange. || Step 9: with Matter Plan, Task B with no setup --> Task A  1. Create a new disbursment with Matter A with task B2. Save3. No expansion text default4. Change Task B to Task A | Expected: no pop up dialog. Narrative change to default from DISBA

Title: Invoice - Disb Detail - Expansion Codes - Changing Disb Code field
Steps: Step 1: Available from 82SP1.EX0011 and 82SP2.EX0001 onwards*Expansion Code narrative default when Client.Matter, PhaseTask (optional), and Disb Code are filled in. || Step 2: See shared step on where to setup the expansion code in different areas || Step 3: Pre reqDisb Code A with Expansion Code DISBADisb Code B with Expansion Code DISBBDisb  Code C without expansion code || Step 4: Disb Code A --> Disb Code B1. Create a new disbursment with Disb Code A2. Save3. Expansion Code default from DISBA4. Change Disb Code A to Disb Code B | Expected: Pop up narrative change from disbursement code confirmation dialog. Click Yes. Narrative change to default from DISBB || Step 5: Disb Code A --> Disb Code C1. Create a new disbursment with Disb Code A2. Save3. Expansion Code default from DISBA4. Change Disb Code A to Disb Code C | Expected: no pop up dialog. Narrative remain unchange. || Step 6: Disb Code C --> Disb Code A1. Create a new disbursment with Disb Code C2. Save3. No text defaulted4. Change Disb Code A to Disb Code C | Expected: no pop up dialog. Narrative default from DISBA

Title: Payment Items - Disbursement: Expansion Codes - Default Narrative
Steps: Step 1: Available from 82SP1.EX0011 and 82SP2.EX0001 onwards*Expansion Code narrative default when Client.Matter, PhaseTask (optional), and Disb Code are filled in. || Step 2: Turn off Firm Options > Generate Disbursement Text flagBug 236724 : User Expansion Code can be selected when setup Firm Disb Type || Step 3: Setup - Expansion CodesAdmin > Hub Setup > Firm Setup > Expansion Code Expansion Code DISB1Expansion Type = DExpansion Text = Expansion Code 1 from Client.Matter Matter Plan Expansion Code DISB2Expansion Type = DExpansion Text = Expansion Code 2 from Task Code Expansion Code DISB3Expansion Type = DExpansion Text = Expansion Code 3 from Disb Code || Step 4: Setup Matter Plan Create two phase task.Classic > Task Based Billing Management > Task SetsAdd New Phase1.Task1 and Phase2.Task2.Set Task1 Disb Expansion Code = DISB1 Link Phase TasksClassic > Task Based Billing Management > Plan CodeLink Phase1.Task1. to AnyPhase.L110.Link Phase2.Task2 to AnyPhase.AnyTask Attach Matter Plan to a matter.Classic > Matter Management > Time and Billing > Billing tab || Step 5: Setup Task CodeAdmin > Hub Setup > Time and Billing Setup > Tasks  Create new or use existing task code. This test case uses existing L110 task code.Disb Expansion Code = DISB2 || Step 6: Setup Disb CodeAdmin > Disbursements > Disb Options > Disb Type Disb Expansion Code = DISB3 || Step 7: Default narrative from Matter Plan with Expansion CodeCreate disbursement with:- Client.Matter with matter plan- Phase1.Task1- Disb with DISB3 expansion code | Expected: Matter plan expansion code narrative is defaulted - DISB1 Expansion Text = Expansion Code 1 from Client.Matter Matter Plan || Step 8: Default narrative from Task with Expansion CodeCreate disbursement with:- Client.Matter without matter plan- Phase1.Task1- Disb with DISB3 expansion code | Expected: Task expansion code narrative is defaulted - DISB2Expansion Text = Expansion Code 2 from Task Code || Step 9: Default narrative from Disb Code with Expansion CodeCreate disbursement with:- Client.Matter without matter plan- Phase2.Task2 (without expansion code setup)- Disb with DISB3 expansion code | Expected: Task expansion code narrative is defaulted - DISB3Expansion Text = Expansion Code 3 from Disb Code || Step 10: Defaulting narrative from Expansion Code when Firm Options > Generate Disbursement Text = Y.Create disbursement with:- Client.Matter with matter plan- Phase1.Task1- Disb with DISB3 expansion code | Expected: Generated narrative is populated on a new form.Narrative change window will pop up window when Client.Matter, PhaseTask and Disb Code is entered.Click OK - Narrative change to DISB1 Expansion TextExpansion Text = Expansion Code 1 from Client.Matter Matter PlanClick Cancel - Narrative remain unchange.

Title: Payment Items - Disbursement: Expansion Codes - Changing Client.Matter field
Steps: Step 1: Available from 82SP1.EX0011 and 82SP2.EX0001 onwards*Expansion Code narrative default when Client.Matter, PhaseTask (optional), and Disb Code are filled in. || Step 2: See shared step below on where to setup the expansion code in different areas : || Step 3: Pre reqMatter A with Matter Plan A- Matter plan > Task code 1 > Expansion Code = DISBA1- Matter plan > Task Code 2 > Expansion Code = DISBA2Matter B with Matter Plan A (Same matter plan as Matter A)- Matter plan > Task code 1 > Expansion Code = DISBA1- Matter plan > Task code 2 > Expansion Code = DISBA2Matter C with Matter Plan C- Matter plan > Task code 1 > Expansion Code = DISBC1- Matter plan > Task code 2 > Expansion Code = No setupMatter D without matter plan setup || Step 4: Matter with Matter Plan with Expansion Code --> Matter same Matter Plan with Expansion Code1. Create a new disbursment with Matter A with task 1.2. Save3. Expansion Code default from DISBA14. Change MatterA to Matter B | Expected: Pop up narrative change from Matter Plan confirmation dialog. Save3. Expansion Code default from DISBA14. Change Matter A to Matter B | Expected: no pop up dialog. Narrative remain unchange. || Step 6: Matter with Matter Plan with Expansion Code --> Matter with different Matter Plan with Expansion Code1. Create a new disbursment with Matter A with task 1.2. Save3. Expansion Code default from DISBA14. Change Matter A to Matter C | Expected: Pop up narrative change from Matter Plan confirmation dialog. Click Yes. Narrative change to default from DISBC1 || Step 7: Matter with Matter Plan with Expansion Code --> Matter with Matter Plan without Expansion Code1. Create a new disbursment with Matter A with task 2.2. Save3. Expansion Code default from DISBA24. Change Matter A to Matter C | Expected: no pop up dialog. Narrative remain unchange. || Step 8: Matter with Matter Plan with Expansion Code --> Matter without Matter Plan 1. Create a new disbursment with Matter A with task 1.2. Save3. Expansion Code default from DISBA14. Change Matter A to Matter D | Expected: no pop up dialog. Narrative remain unchange. || Step 9: Matter without Matter Plan with Expansion Code --> Matter with Matter Plan with Expansion Code 1. Create a new disbursment with Matter A2. Save3. No text default4. Change Matter D to Matter A | Expected: no pop up dialog. Narrative change to default from DISBA1

Title: Jobs: Payment Schedule - Post Payments
Steps: Step 1: Pre reqsMultiple schedules each with multiple items || Step 2: Note: As the job process is quick, there is no time to check that the lock occurred so need to check using sql profilter: search for: lockcio || Step 3: Start job from payment scheduleSchedule has multiple items | Expected: Job runs* Local notification sent so notification form displays * User lock exists on schedule header- lock type =  S- expiry = NULL* Job starts processing- Job status = R * Schedule header user lock removed* Schedule header job lock applied - Lock Owner = B - Lock timeout = NULL - Reason = Check schedule postREPEAT THIS FOR EACH INVOICE* Lock invoices item with a job lock - Lock Owner = B- Lock timeout = 20 - Reason = check post* Posting lock applied * Posting lock removed* Invoice item job lock removedEND OF ITEM PROCESS* Schedule header job lock removed * Schedule header user lock applied - Lock Owner = S- Lock timeout = NULL- Reason = Opened by user* Service sends notifications to notification form and recent activity grid* All selected items processed* Job status = C when completed* There are no orphaned locks when job is completed---------------------------------------------------------------------- Get the most recent job--------------------------------------------------------------------DECLARE @job asintSET @job = (SELECTTOP (1) JOB_QUEUE_UNO FROM APE_JOB_QUEUE ORDERBY JOB_QUEUE_UNO DESC)--SET @job = 3032---------------------------------------------------------------------- Job--------------------------------------------------------------------SELECT'JOB'[JOB],j.JOB_QUEUE_UNO,j.JOB_PARAMETER_UNO,j.JOB_TYPE,j.JOB_STATUS,UPDATE_MESSAGE,j.TOTAL_ITEMS,j.PROCESSED_ITEMS,FAILED_ITEMS,ERROR_COUNT,j.INITIATED_BY, IS_REVIEWED,IS_CANCELLED,DATEDIFF(mi,j.INITIATED_DATE,j.LAST_MODIFIED)[Process Mins],j.INITIATED_DATE,j.LAST_MODIFIEDFROM APE_JOB_QUEUE j WHERE j.JOB_QUEUE_UNO = @job --AND JOB_TYPE = 'PAYPRTCH'ORDER BY j.JOB_QUEUE_UNO DESC ---------------------------------------------------------------------- Parameters--------------------------------------------------------------------SELECT jp.* FROM APE_JOB_PARAMETER jpLEFTJOIN APE_JOB_QUEUE j ON j.JOB_PARAMETER_UNO = jp.JOB_PARAMETER_UNOWHERE j.JOB_QUEUE_UNO = @job---------------------------------------------------------------------- PAYMENT ALERTS--------------------------------------------------------------------SELECTDISTINCT'ALERTS'[ALERTS],a.SOURCE_TYPE,a.SOURCE_UNO,chq.REQUEST_NUM,a.MESSAGE_KEY,a.MESSAGE_CONTEXT,a.MESSAGE_INTERNAL,a.JOB_QUEUE_UNO, a.JOB_ALERT_UNO,a.ALERT_LEVEL,a.CREATE_DATEFROM APE_JOB_ALERT aLEFTJOIN APE_JOB_ALERT j ON j.JOB_QUEUE_UNO = a.JOB_QUEUE_UNOLEFTJOIN APT_CHECK chq ON a.SOURCE_UNO = chq.TRAN_UNO AND a.SOURCE_TYPE ='PAY'LEFTJOIN APT_INVOICE inv ON a.SOURCE_UNO = inv.TRAN_UNO AND a.SOURCE_TYPE ='INV'WHERE a.JOB_QUEUE_UNO = @jobORDERBY a.JOB_QUEUE_UNO DESC,a.SOURCE_UNO--, a.ALERT_UNO DESC || Step 4: Start job from payment schedule gridSchedule has multiple items | Expected: Job runs* Local notification sent so notification form displays * Job starts processing- Job status = R * Schedule header job lock applied - Lock Owner = B - Lock timeout = NULL - Reason = Check schedule postREPEAT THIS FOR EACH INVOICE* Lock invoices item with a job lock - Lock Owner = B- Lock timeout = 20 - Reason = invoice select* Posting lock applied * Posting lock removed* Invoice item job lock removedEND OF ITEM PROCESS* Schedule header job lock removed * Service sends notifications to notification form and recent activity grid* All selected items processed* Job status = C when completed* There are no orphaned locks when job is completed* Grid refreshed at end of job || Step 5: Cancel JobCreate a volume of payments so you can see the multiple processing steps display in  the recent activities grid | Expected: Job is canceled* Job status = X* Jobs stops processing* There are no orphaned locks when job is stopped* Grid refreshed at end of job
