Title: Payment Schedule: Lock - Add single invoice
Steps: Step 1: Pre reqsPosted Invoice || Step 2: Note: As the job process is quick, there is no time to check that the lock occurred so need to check using sql profilter: search for: lockcio || Step 3: A from payment schedule1. Create schedule2. Add manadatory data3. Add invoice via Add Single- Schedule not saved before invoice added | Expected: Job runs* User lock exists on schedule header- lock type =  S- expiry = NULL* Invoice User lock applied- Lock Owner = S- Lock timeout = 20- Reason = Opened by user* Invoice added to schedule* Invoice user lock removed

Title: Jobs: Payment Schedule - Add multiple invoices
Steps: Step 1: Pre reqsMultiple posted Invoices for the same bank || Step 2: Note: As the job process is quick, there is no time to check that the lock occurred so need to check using sql profilter: search for: lockcio || Step 3: Start job from payment schedule1. Create schedule2. Add manadatory data3. Add invoices via Add multiple | Expected: Job runs* Local notification sent so notification form displays * User lock exists on schedule header- lock type =  S- expiry = NULL* Job starts processing- Job status = R * Schedule header user lock removed * Schedule header job lock applied - Lock Owner = B - Lock timeout = NULL - Reason = check schedule save message seems wrong* Lock all invoices items with a job lock - Lock Owner = B- Lock timeout = NULL- Reason = invoice select* All invoices locks removed when job completed * Schedule header job lock removed * Schedule header user lock applied - Lock Owner = S- Lock timeout = NULL- Reason = Opened by user* Service sends notifications to notification form and recent activity grid* All selected items processed* Job status = C when completed* There are no orphaned locks when job is completed---------------------------------------------------------------------- Get the most recent job--------------------------------------------------------------------DECLARE @job asintSET @job = (SELECTTOP (1) JOB_QUEUE_UNO FROM APE_JOB_QUEUE ORDERBY JOB_QUEUE_UNO DESC)--SET @job = 3032---------------------------------------------------------------------- Title: Jobs: Payment Schedule - Locking and form refresh when a Payment Schedule job exceeds the timeout limit
Steps: Step 1: Note: By default the timeout for jobs is set to 10 mins. The job will continue running in the background but the UI is no longer aware of it. || Step 2: Pre reqs Timeout valueNote: By default the timeout for jobs is set to 10 mins. Set the timeout to a lesser value so you can test on a smaller database:Expert Share | bindings.configChange the sendTimeout values Posted InvoicesSufficient number of posted invoices for the bank to cause the jobs to exceed the timeout || Step 3: Run each job1. Create a schedule2. Run each job (ensuring they take longer than the timeout)- Add multiple invoices- Generate payments- Print/Reprint payments- Create/Recreate bank file- Print/Reprint remittances- Email remittances- Post payments | Expected: Job times out  - Ribbon bar is disabled when job started - Message displayed in yellow bar Bug 251420 - Payment Schedule timeout message is not being display'The current job has not yet completed, and is still running in the background. If you wish to perform further actions on this schedule, please close the schedule and reopen it when the current job has completed'- The screen is not refreshed and buttons remain disabled- Job lock on schedule remains (User lock is not applied)Bug 240180 - Various issues related to Create Payments job processing - leading to timeouts Job completes- Message remains- The screen is not refreshed and buttons remain disabled- Schedule job lock and invoice locks are removed Bug 251824 - Payment Schedule timeout message - tidy up for ribbon bar enabling

Title: Jobs: Print/Reprint Check Payments - Unlock bank early (821 only)
Steps: Step 1: Note: This was introduced for Ogletree due to their print jobs taking a long time. The bank lock was holding up other jobs as all their offices use the same bank. It should only be used when NOT using pre printed check stationery || Step 2: Pre dataCheck formatsEnsure you have 3 Check formats set up to use docudraftAdmin | Account Payable | Accounts Payable Options | Check FormatsBank 1- Uses format 1 (set via entity manager in the bank's account payable tab)- Has check numbers register (set via entity manager in the banks's register checks tab)Bank 2- Uses format 2- Has check numbers register Bank 3- Uses format 3- Has check numbers register Two Invoices for bank 1- Bank is derived from the APType used on the invoice- Pay by Electronic Banking = off- PostedTwo Invoices for bank 2- Bank is derived from the APType used on the invoice- Pay by Electronic Banking = off- PostedTwo Invoices for bank 3- Bank is derived from the APType used on the invoice - Pay by Electronic Banking = off- Posted | Expected: --------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- All Banks with formats, printers and office-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------SELECT b.BANK_CODE,b.ACCT_TYPE,b.CURRENCY_CODE,b.OFFC,o.COMPANY_CODE,b.INACTIVE[Bank Inactive],b.SHORT_NAME,b.ASSIGN_WIRE_NUMBER,b.AUTO_WIRE_NUM,TREG_BANK,USE_TRST_EFT,b.CH_FORMAT_UNO,cf.FORMAT_CODE[Check Format],b.TEST_FORMAT_UNO,cf.PRINT_ALL_PAGES,cf.INACTIVE[Chq Format Inactive],cf.FILENAME[Check File],b.RA_FORMAT_UNO,ra.FORMAT_CODE[Remittance Format],ra.INACTIVE[Rem Format Inactive],ra.FILENAME[Remittance File],b.RF_FORMAT_UNO,rf.FORMAT_CODE[Receipt Format],b.RF_TEST_FORMAT,rf.INACTIVE[Rct Format Inactive],rf.FILENAME[Receipt File],b.ALLOW_CHECK_PRINTER_SELECTION, pr1.PRINTER_UNO,pr1.PRINTER_ID[Check Printer], pr1.NETWORK_PATH [Check printer path],pr2.PRINTER_UNO,pr2.PRINTER_ID[Remit Printer], pr2.NETWORK_PATH [Remit printer path]--,b.*FROM TBM_BANK bLEFT JOIN TBM_FMT_CH cf ON b.CH_FORMAT_UNO = cf.FORMAT_UNOLEFT JOIN TBM_FMT_RA ra ON b.RA_FORMAT_UNO = ra.FORMAT_UNOLEFT JOIN TBM_FMT_RF rf ON b.RF_FORMAT_UNO = rf.FORMAT_UNOLEFT JOIN CMS_PRINTER pr1 ON b.CH_PRINTER_UNO = pr1.PRINTER_UNO LEFT JOIN CMS_PRINTER pr2 ON b.RF_PRINTER_UNO = pr2.PRINTER_UNO JOIN HBL_OFFICE o ON b.OFFC = o.OFFC_CODE--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- AP Type's bank and company-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------SELECT typ.APTYPE_CODE,typ.APTYPE_DESC,typ.BANK_CODE,b.CURRENCY_CODE,o.OFFC_CODE,o.COMPANY_CODEFROM APL_APTYPE typJOIN TBM_BANK b ON Typ.BANK_CODE = b.BANK_CODEJOIN HBL_OFFICE o ON b.OFFC = o.OFFC_CODE || Step 3: Pre req settingsPre print stationery formats- Set up check formats 1 and 2 via configuration manager. Note: Format 3 will not be set so will assume the default of 'Y'Technical.Applications.ExpertAccountsPayable.OptionsPrePrintedStationeryFormatsExample:<CheckFormats><CheckFormat name='FM1' preprinted='N'/><CheckFormat name='FM2' preprinted='Y'/> </CheckFormats> | Expected: --Unlock bank early in print check processSELECT Path,Scope,Name,Content FROM Configuration.ConfigName n INNER JOIN Configuration.ConfigValue v ON n.Id = v.NameIdWHERE Path LIKE 'Technical.Applications.ExpertAccountsPayable.Options'AND NAME = 'PrePrintedStationeryOption'--Unlock bank early in print check process for these formatsSELECT Path,Scope,Name,Content FROM Configuration.ConfigName n INNER JOIN Configuration.ConfigValue v ON n.Id = v.NameIdWHERE Path LIKE 'Technical.Applications.ExpertAccountsPayable.Options%'AND NAME = 'PrePrintedStationeryFormats' || Step 4: Unlock bank early is not used - check format set to unlock early1. Set option to use this functionality to off via configuration managerTechnical.Applications.ExpertAccountsPayable.OptionsPrePrintedStationeryOption = False2. Add invoices 1 and 2 to a schedule- Bank 13. Create payment 4. Print checks from the schedule | Expected: Bank is not unlocked earlyNote: Using sql profilter. Will need to search on the following and check the LN number they appear on to ensure they're in the correct order- search for locks (lockcio) - search for check numbers assigned (APT_CheckUpdate) where @P57 = NULL- search for update to DDS_Draft table (DocudraftReportFileInsert)- search for job set to completed (UPDATE dbo.APE_JOB_QUEUE)  where @P1 = 'C' for completed* Bank is locked at the start of a job- lock applied with no expiry - Lock Owner = B* All items are then locked - locks applied with no expiry- Lock Owner = B* All selected items processed and DDS_Draft table is updated* Checks are printed and job is set to completed* Each item is unlocked once it's been processed * Bank is unlocked * There are no orphaned locks when job is completed (if the schedule is still open then there will be a user lock on that) || Step 5: Unlock bank early is used - check format set to unlock early1. Set option to use this functionality to on via configuration managerTechnical.Applications.ExpertAccountsPayable.OptionsPrePrintedStationeryOption = True2. Add invoices 1 and 2 to a schedule- Bank 13. Create payment 4. Print and reprint checks from the schedule | Expected: Bank is unlocked earlyNote: Using sql profilter. Will need to search on the following and check the LN number they appear on to ensure they're in the correct order- search for locks (lockcio) - search for check numbers assigned (APT_CheckUpdate) where @P57 = NULL- search for update to DDS_Draft table (DocudraftReportFileInsert)- search for job set to completed (UPDATE dbo.APE_JOB_QUEUE) where @P1 = 'C' for completed* Bank is locked at the start of a job- lock applied with no expiry - Lock Owner = B* All items are then locked - locks applied with no expiry- Lock Owner = B* Check numbers assigned (not for reprint unless you select to craete new check numbers)* Bank is unlocked * All selected items processed and DDS_Draft table is updated* Checks are printed and job is set to completed* Each item is unlocked once it's been processed * There are no orphaned locks when job is completed (if the schedule is still open then there will be a user lock on that) || Step 6: Unlock bank early is used- check format set to not unlock early1. Set option to use this functionality to off via configuration managerTechnical.Applications.ExpertAccountsPayable.OptionsPrePrintedStationeryOption = True2. Add invoices 3 and 4 to a schedule- Bank 23. Create payment 4. Print checks from the schedule | Expected: Bank is not unlocked earlyNote: Using sql profilter. Will need to search on the following and check the LN number they appear on to ensure they're in the correct order- search for locks (lockcio) - search for update to DDS_Draft table (DocudraftReportFileInsert)- search for job set to completed (UPDATE dbo.APE_JOB_QUEUE) where @P1 = 'C' for completed* Bank is locked at the start of a job- lock applied with no expiry - Lock Owner = B* All items are then locked - locks applied with no expiry- Lock Owner = B* All selected items processed and DDS_Draft table is updated* Checks are printed and job is set to completed* Items are unlocked* Bank is unlocked * There are no orphaned locks when job is completed (if the schedule is still open then there will be a user lock on that) || Step 7: Unlock bank early is used - check format not set1. Set option to use this functionality to off via configuration managerTechnical.Applications.ExpertAccountsPayable.OptionsPrePrintedStationeryOption = True2. Add invoices 5 and 6 to a schedule- Bank 33. Create payment 4. Print checks from the schedule | Expected: Bank is not unlocked earlyNote: Using sql profilter. Will need to search on the following and check the LN number they appear on to ensure they're in the correct order- search for locks (lockcio) - search for update to DDS_Draft table (DocudraftReportFileInsert)- search for job set to completed (UPDATE dbo.APE_JOB_QUEUE) where @P1 = 'C' for completed* Bank is locked at the start of a job- lock applied with no expiry (note: this is an exception, as jobs normally have an expiry, but we don't  know how long the check run will take)- Lock Owner = B* All items are then locked - locks applied with no expiry- Lock Owner = B* All selected items processed and DDS_Draft table is updated* Checks are printed and job is set to completed* Each item is unlocked once it's been processed * Bank is unlocked * There are no orphaned locks when job is completed (if the schedule is still open then there will be a user lock on that)

Title: Jobs: Print/Reprint Check Payments - Unlock bank early (822 onwards)
Steps: Step 1: Note: 821 uses a config value but from 822, there is a new flag column in TBM_FMT_CH that is checkedNote: This was introduced for Ogletree due to their print jobs taking a long time. The bank lock was holding up other jobs as all their offices use the same bank. It should only be used when NOT using pre printed check stationery || Step 2: Pre req dataCheck format 1Pre-Numbered Stationery = NAdmin | Account Payable | Accounts Payable Options | Check FormatsCheck format 2Pre-Numbered Stationery = YCheck format 3Pre-Numbered Stationery = ''Bank 1- Uses format 1 (set via entity manager in the bank's account payable tab)- Has check numbers register (set via entity manager in the banks's register checks tab)Bank 2- Uses format 2- Has check numbers register Bank 3- Uses format 3- Has check numbers register | Expected: --------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- All Banks with formats, printers and office-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------SELECT b.BANK_CODE,b.ACCT_TYPE,b.CURRENCY_CODE,b.OFFC,o.COMPANY_CODE,b.INACTIVE[Bank Inactive],b.SHORT_NAME,b.ASSIGN_WIRE_NUMBER,b.AUTO_WIRE_NUM,TREG_BANK,USE_TRST_EFT,b.CH_FORMAT_UNO,cf.FORMAT_CODE[Check Format],b.TEST_FORMAT_UNO,cf.PRINT_ALL_PAGES,cf.INACTIVE[Chq Format Inactive],cf.FILENAME[Check File],b.RA_FORMAT_UNO,ra.FORMAT_CODE[Remittance Format],ra.INACTIVE[Rem Format Inactive],ra.FILENAME[Remittance File],b.RF_FORMAT_UNO,rf.FORMAT_CODE[Receipt Format],b.RF_TEST_FORMAT,rf.INACTIVE[Rct Format Inactive],rf.FILENAME[Receipt File],b.ALLOW_CHECK_PRINTER_SELECTION, pr1.PRINTER_UNO,pr1.PRINTER_ID[Check Printer], pr1.NETWORK_PATH [Check printer path],pr2.PRINTER_UNO,pr2.PRINTER_ID[Remit Printer], pr2.NETWORK_PATH [Remit printer path]--,b.*FROM TBM_BANK bLEFT JOIN TBM_FMT_CH cf ON b.CH_FORMAT_UNO = cf.FORMAT_UNOLEFT JOIN TBM_FMT_RA ra ON b.RA_FORMAT_UNO = ra.FORMAT_UNOLEFT JOIN TBM_FMT_RF rf ON b.RF_FORMAT_UNO = rf.FORMAT_UNOLEFT JOIN CMS_PRINTER pr1 ON b.CH_PRINTER_UNO = pr1.PRINTER_UNO LEFT JOIN CMS_PRINTER pr2 ON b.RF_PRINTER_UNO = pr2.PRINTER_UNO JOIN HBL_OFFICE o ON b.OFFC = o.OFFC_CODE--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- AP Type's bank and company-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------SELECT typ.APTYPE_CODE,typ.APTYPE_DESC,typ.BANK_CODE,b.CURRENCY_CODE,o.OFFC_CODE,o.COMPANY_CODEFROM APL_APTYPE typJOIN TBM_BANK b ON Typ.BANK_CODE = b.BANK_CODEJOIN HBL_OFFICE o ON b.OFFC = o.OFFC_CODE || Step 3: Use pre-number stationery = N 1. Create and release 2 payments- Bank 12. Select both payment from the grid3. Print and reprint checks | Expected: Bank is unlocked earlyNote: Using sql profilter. Will need to search on the following and check the LN number they appear on to ensure they're in the correct order- search for locks (lockcio) - search for check numbers assigned (AccountsPayableModel.PaymentUpdate) where @P57 = NULL  - search for update to DDS_Draft table (DocudraftReportFileInsert)- search for job set to completed (UPDATE dbo.APE_JOB_QUEUE) where @P1 = 'C' for completed* Bank job lock applied* All items are then locked - locks applied with no expiry- Lock Owner = B* Check numbers assigned (not for reprint unless you select to create new check numbers)* Bank is unlocked * All selected items processed and DDS_Draft table is updated* Checks are printed and job is set to completed* All items are unlocked* There are no orphaned locks when job is completed (if the schedule is still open then there will be a user lock on that)Bug 246221 - Payment schedule: Print check job unlocks and locks all open schedules at the end of the job || Step 4: Use pre-number stationery = Y 1. Title: Payment Items - Disbursement: STD amount with rates and markup at cost code level only
Steps: Step 1: Pre req dataNote: The calculation of STD amount is different dependant on the source type- For CDN (billing and disb app) calculation is based of the rates- For AP and CH (Invoice, Payment and Expenses) calculation is based off the base amountNote: You can use your own amounts but probably easier to follow the calculations by using the example amounts in the test caseDisb Code 1Classic | Client Disbursements | Disbursment Setup | Disbursement Types- Allow soft = Y- Allow Hard = Y- Allow edit of base values = Y- Apply markup = Y- Has Unit rates = Y Rates row for Disb Code 1- Has one rates row with mulltiple unit rates and set a markup amount- USD currencyUnit Rate 1 = 1.00 Markup amount = .10 Disb Code 2Classic | Client Disbursements | Disbursment Setup | Disbursement Types- Allow soft = Y- Allow Hard = Y- Allow edit of base values = Y- Apply markup = Y- Has Unit rates = N Rates row for Disb Code 2- Has a markup %Markup % = 10 for CAD Payment 1- Vendor type- Currency = USD- Incomplete or Complete Payment 2- Vendor type- Currency = CAD- Incomplete or Complete || Step 2: Select to add Disb code 1 to Payment 1- Client/matter- Disb code- Other mandatory fields | Expected: Base amount and Bill amount populated Auto calc = ONBase Amount = .10 (markup amount)Bill Amount = .10 (copied from base amount) || Step 3: Set the quantity - Quantity = 1- Save & Close | Expected: Base amount and Bill amount updatedFormAuto calc = ONBase Amount = 1.10 (Unit rates x 1 + markup amount)Bill Amount = 1.10 (copied from base amount)CDT_DISBSTD_AMT = 1.00 (base amount 1.10 - markup .10) || Step 4: Edit the quantity - Quantity = 2- Save & Close | Expected: Base amount and Bill amount updatedFormAuto calc = ONBase Amount = 2.10 (Unit rates x 2+ markup amount)Bill Amount = 2.10 (copied from base amount)CDT_DISBSTD_AMT = 2.00 (base amount 2.10 - markup .10) || Step 5: Edit the quantity and Bill amount- Quantity = 3- Bill Amount = 100- Save & Close | Expected: Base amount and Bill amount updatedFormAuto calc = OFFBase Amount = 3.10 (Unit rates x 3+ markup amount)Bill Amount = 100.00 (as entered)CDT_DISBSTD_AMT = 3.00 (base amount 3.10 - markup .10) || Step 6: Edit the quantity - Quantity = 4- Save & Close | Expected: Base amount and Bill amount updatedFormAuto calc = OFFBase Amount = 3.10 (no auto calc) 3.20 as markup was applied againBill Amount = 3.10 (copied from base amount) 3.20 as base amount is incorrectBug 173942 - Disb: Base and Bill Amount recalculated incorrectly on Office, Employee, quantity change CDT_DISBSTD_AMT = 3.00 (base amount 3.10 - markup .10) 3.10 as base amount is incorrect || Step 7: Select to add a Disb code 2 to Payment 2- Client/matter- Disb code- Other mandatory fields | Expected: Base amount and Bill amount populated Auto calc = OFFBase Amount = blank Bill Amount = blank || Step 8: Edit the base amount- Base Amount = 100- Save & Close | Expected: Base amount and Bill amount updatedFormAuto calc = OFFBase Amount = 110.00 (Amount entered + markup amount)Bill Amount = 110.00 (copied from base amount)CDT_DISBSTD_AMT = 100.00 (base amount 100 - markup 10) || Step 9: Edit the quantity - Quantity = 1- Save & Close | Expected: Base amount and Bill amount updatedFormAuto calc = OFFBase Amount = 110.00 (unchanged) 121.00 as markup was applied againBill Amount = 110.00 (unchanged ) 121.00 as base amount is incorrectBug 173942 - Disb: Base and Bill Amount recalculated incorrectly on Office, Employee, quantity change CDT_DISBSTD_AMT = 100.00 (unchanged ) 110.00 as base amount is incorrect

Title: Invoices: Security Roles -  Invoice Import Wizard
Steps: Step 1: SaveUserLevelMappingProfile available from 822.EX3 and 83. || Step 2: Pre reqcreate a few firm and user mapping profiles in Invoice Import. || Step 3: When having both SaveFirmLevelMappingProfile and SaveUserLevelMappingProfile | Expected: In Import Invoice Wizard- Choose: shows firm and user mapping profile- Edit: shows firm and user mapping profile- Copy: shows firm and user mapping profile, have the option to save new copy as firm or user- Create: can select to save new mapping profile as firm or user profile on next screen (where you enter profile name). || Step 4: When having SaveFirmLevelMappingProfile but NOT SaveUserLevelMappingProfile | Expected: In Import Invoice Wizard- Choose: shows firm and user mapping profile- Edit: shows firm only- Copy: shows firm and user mapping profile, new profile created from copy will be firm only even if it is copied from user profile- Create: can create new, default to firm || Step 5: When NOT having SaveFirmLevelMappingProfile but having SaveUserLevelMappingProfile | Expected: In Import Invoice Wizard- Choose: shows firm and user mapping profile- Edit: shows user only- Copy: shows firm and user mapping profile, new profile created from copy will be user only even if it is copied from firm profile- Create: can create new, default to user || Step 6: When not having both SaveFirmLevelMappingProfile and SaveUserLevelMappingProfile | Expected: In Import Invoice Wizard- Choose: shows firm and user mapping profile- Edit: disabled- Copy: disabled- Create: disabled

Title: Vendor Row Level security - Invoices
Steps:
Step 1: Pre reqUPDATE HBM_PERSNL SET PRIVILEGE_LEVEL = 0 WHERE LOGIN='way.wong' || Step 2: Pre req Secured Vendor A - secured to your user- available to other user (eg, TTQA4 on my local). Use this user for verification on unsecured view. Vendor B with remit vendor secured vendor A Vendor C with secured vendor A as related payee Vendor D with as child vendor, with Vendor A as parent vendor, ENFORCE UNIQUE INVOICE NUMBER ACROSS SUBSIDIARIES = Y. 1 invoice A with secured vendor A1 invoice B with secured remit vendor B1 invoice C with secured alternate payee C1 invoice D with vendor D || Step 3: Invoice List Screen | Expected: Vendor DP - Search secured vendor with code and vendor name, doesn't return vendor- Select secured vendor from MRU doesn't populate the field. Remit Vendor DP- Search secured vendor with code and vendor name, doesn't return vendor- Select secured vendor from MRU doesn't populate the field. Invoice Number DP- Search invoice A with secured vendor, doesn't return anything.- Search invoice B with secured remit vendor, doesn't return anything. Grid- Search with invoice date, Invoice A and B doesn't return. || Step 4: Invoice Entry Screen | Expected: Secured Vendor DP - Search secured vendor with code and vendor name, doesn't return vendor- Select secured vendor from MRU doesn't populate the field. Remit Vendor DP- Search with code and vendor name, doesn't return vendor- select vendor from MRU doesn't populate the field.- Empty Red validation box if selected Vendor has a secured Remit Vendor. with "The Remit Vendor attached to this Vendor is secured" message.- Required field Alternative Payee/Address- Can see Vendor A in alternative payee selection screen. || Step 5: Parent/Child Invoice number validation- Allow subsidiaries on secured vendor- link an unsecured child vendor to it - create invoice with secured vendor- create another invoice using unsecured child vendor with same invoice number | Expected: no invoice number duplicate validation when invoice is created by secured user. non secured user get the duplicate invoice number validation error as expected.The behavior in Environment 8241 was tested and found to be consistent with Environment 8230.When ENFORCE UNIQUE INVOICE NUMBER ACROSS SUBSIDIARIES = Y:Secured User:Unable to create two invoices with the same invoice number across the secured vendor and its unsecured child vendor. The system triggers a duplicate invoice number validation error.
Unsecured User:Cannot access the secured vendor to create an invoice. They can only create invoices using the unsecured child vendor.
When ENFORCE UNIQUE INVOICE NUMBER ACROSS SUBSIDIARIES = N:Secured User:Able to create invoices with the same invoice number across both the secured vendor and its unsecured child vendor without triggering a duplicate validation error.
Unsecured User:Still cannot access the secured vendor to create invoices in Accounts Payable (AP). Access remains limited to the unsecured child vendor. || Step 6: Invoice Import | Expected: import secured vendor- invalid vendor message showing vendor is invalid or do not have security before import import secured remit vendor- spec doesn't seems to cover what happen when trying to import secured remit vendor.Currently it throws this message in job alert after import, invoice record is not created. Bug 246579 - Vendor Security - null remitVendor error when create invoice from Inv Import and Image Recognition for vendor with secured vendorBug 246727 - message change

Open task | Expected: Vendor field is empty when open form. Cannot select secured vendor || Step 7: Create Vendor task-  Kick off workflow with temporary vendor- open create vendor task | Expected: Vendor field is empty when open form. Clicking Ok will tab out of Vendor field. Vendor field remain empty || Step 14: Initiate Approval Workflow (From grid and entry screen)- For both secured vendor and remit vendor:- Create new invoice, select secured vendor / remit vendor- Make sure to Approved flag is not checked.- Click Initiate Workflows. | Expected: Shows 'Security Applies' pop up. Clicking Ok closes the pop up, no new workflow initiated.- The error message on grid is not translated yet. || Step 15: New Invoice task- select secured vendor- select secured remit vendor- select these vendors again in MRU | Expected: Shows 'Security Applies' pop up. Clicking Ok will tab out of Vendor field. Vendor field remain empty || Step 16: Create Vendor task | Expected: Temp vendor has null security ID, getting security applies, which is a bug. || Step 17: Code Invoice task- Create an invoice with NON secured vendor, proceed until Code Invoice task- Select secured vendor- select vendor with secured remit vendor | Expected: Vendor and / or Remit Vendor field display an error (the red box) around the field. Hover over message :  "It is not permissable to process an invoice for a secured Vendor / Remit Vendor via the workflow process" || Step 18: Account Review task | Expected: Vendor and / or Remit Vendor field display an error (the red box) around the field. Hover over message :  "It is not permissable to process an invoice for a secured Vendor / Remit Vendor via the workflow process" || Step 19: GL/Disb/Inv Approval task | Expected: Invalid scenario, should not be able to get into approval with secured vendor / remit vendor || Step 20: Test as P0 user. UPDATE HBM_PERSNL SET PRIVILEGE_LEVEL = 0 WHERE LOGIN='way.wong' || Step 21: New Invoice dropdown form | Expected: Cannot select secured vendor.Select Remit secured shows Security Applies pop up window. || Step 22: Initiate Approval Workflow (From grid and entry screen)- For both secured vendor and remit vendor:- Create new invoice, select secured vendor / remit vendor- Make sure to Approved flag is not checked.- Click Initiate Workflows. | Expected: Invalid scenario. Should not be able to access invoice with secured vendor / remit vendor. || Step 23: New Invoice task- select secured vendor- select secured remit vendor- select these vendors again in MRU | Expected: Secured Vendor: clears field and tab offSecured remit vendor: Security Applies pop up. || Step 24: Code Invoice / Acc Review / Acc Correction task- Create an invoice with NON secured vendor, proceed until Code Invoice task- Select secured vendor- select vendor with secured remit vendor | Expected: Cannot select secured vendorSecured remit vendor will have a red box error.Can proceed by selecting alternative vendor / remit vendor.

Use this user for verification on unsecured view.Vendor B with remit vendor secured vendor A || Step 3: create anticipated disb in Billing- 1 for secured vendor- 1 for secured remit vendor- 1 for unsecured vendor || Step 4: Antic disb grid in AP- create invoice- enter disb with client.matter created for antic disb | Expected: return only antic disbs for vendor selected in header, hence not possible to add antic disb for secured vendor || Step 5: Antic disb grid in Disbursement app | Expected: the antic disb grid in Disbursement app doesn't return antic disb with a vendor || Step 6: Antic disb entry form in Billing | Expected: Cannot select secured vendor and vendor with secured remit vendor in the form.

Title: Vendor Row Level security - Image Recognition
Steps: Step 1: Pre reqUPDATE HBM_PERSNL SET PRIVILEGE_LEVEL = 0 WHERE LOGIN='way.wong' || Step 2: Pre req Secured Vendor A - secured to your user- available to other user (eg, TTQA4 on my local). Use this user for verification on unsecured view.Vendor B with remit vendor secured vendor AVendor C with secured vendor A as related payee || Step 3: In Schedule Manager, run to populate vendor seed- Image Processing - Initial Vendor Seed Schedule 1 || Step 4: Setup Image SourcesAdmin > IR > AP > Image SourcesImage type = AP.Source File Path = where your IR files at. || Step 5: open invoice manually- IR > Open > Browse to folder | Expected: Vendor DP - Search secured vendor with code and vendor name, doesn't return vendor- Select secured vendor from MRU doesn't populate the field.CAN SELECT VENDOR WITH SECURED REMIT VENDOR. SUBMIT THIS INVOICE WILL GET ERROR IN JOB ALERT. || Step 6: open invoices automatically- IR > Open > select file folder where image sources are.- as non secured user, rerun the invoice, allow it to pick up secured vendor manually if cannot be done automatically.- submit.-delete all created invoice as they have served as 'seed'. rerun as needed to make sure it picks up secured vendor automatically- as secured user, rerun the invoices | Expected: rerun as secured user doesnt pick up secured vendor.

Title: Invoice Import - Disbursement: Rates Hierachy Level 1 contraints have unit rates and markup
Steps: Step 1: Note: This uses a common SP created for classic. Note: Matter and client constraints can only have a max of 1 of each set up for each cost codeThe hierachy for this test is:Note: This does not match the documentation. Decission was made to change the documentation rather than the code1. The disbursement rate 2. The matter constraint rates 3. The client constraint rates 4. The Rate Set attached to the matter5. The cost code rates || Step 2: Pre req dataClient 1Matter 1 for client Client 2:Has client constraintsMatter 1 for client 2Has Matter contraintsMatter 2 for client 2Disb Cost CodeClassic | Client Disbursements | Disbursement Setup | Disbursement Types- Allow soft = Y- Allow Hard = Y- Allow edit of base values = Y- Apply markup = Y- Has Unit rates = Y Payment- Vendor type- Currency = USD- Incomplete or Complete || Step 3: Cost Code rates and markup1. Add Rates row 1 for costs code: level 1, markups- Rate level = 1- USD currency- Effective date = 1/1/2019- Markup amount = 10.002. Add Rates row 2 for cost code: level 1, unit rates- Rate level = 1- USD currency- Effective date = 1/12/2019- Unit Rate 1 = 2.00 3. Import Invoice with DisbAuto calc  = Y- Client/matter = C1.M1- Disb code- Other mandatory fields- Quantity = 1 | Expected: Uses rates row 2 for unit rate then rates row 1 for markup 2 + 10 = 12FormBase = 12 (displays 10 until the quantity added)Bill = 12 (displays 10 until the quantity added)CDT_DISBRATE_METHOD = 4BASE_AMT = 12TOBILL_AMT = 12STD_AMT = 2 (standard amount doesn't use the markup)DECLARE @disb asint= 3460DECLARE @costcode asvarchar(50)= (SELECT COST_CODE FROM CDT_DISB WHERE DISB_UNO = @disb)DECLARE @matteruno asint= (SELECT MATTER_UNO FROM CDT_DISB WHERE DISB_UNO = @disb)DECLARE @clientuno asint= (SELECT CLIENT_UNO FROM HBM_MATTER WHERE MATTER_UNO = @matteruno)--/*SELECT''[Disb],BASE_QTY,BASE_AMT,BILL_QTY,TOBILL_AMT,STD_AMT,BILLED_AMT,AUTO_CALCULATE,CURRENCY_CODE,DRUNO,PERIOD,RATE_METHOD,DI_OFFC,DI_EMPL_UNO, TRAN_DATE,POST_DATE,BILL_TRAN_UNO,LAST_MODIFIED,* FROM CDT_DISB  WHERE DISB_UNO = @disbSELECT ''[Client/Matter],m.CLNT_MATT_CODE, tm.RATE_LEVEL[Matter Rate Level],tm.RATE_LEVEL_DATE[Matter RL Date],tm.DI_RATE_SET_UNO[Matter Rate Set],tc.RATE_LEVEL[Client Rate Level],tc.RATE_LEVEL_DATE[Client RL Date],tc.DI_RATE_SET_UNO[Client Rate Set]FROM HBM_MATTER mJOIN HBM_CLIENT c ON m.CLIENT_UNO = c.CLIENT_UNOJOIN TBM_MATTER tm ON m.MATTER_UNO = tm.MATTER_UNOJOIN TBM_CLIENT tc ON m.CLIENT_UNO = tc.CLIENT_UNOWHERE m.MATTER_UNO = @matteruno--SELECT * FROM tbm_matter where MATTER_UNO = @matteruno--*/--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- COST CODE RATES-- Rate sets values are also stored in the TBM_RATE_DISB for a cost code but they-- are linked to a matter via TBM_MATTER-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------SELECT''[TBM_RATE_DISB],dr.COST_CODE,cc.COST_DESC,dr.OFFC,GROUP_TYPE,dr.MATTER_UNO,CASEWHEN dr.MATTER_UNO <> 0 THEN m.MATTER_CODE +': '+ m.MATTER_NAME +' ('+CAST(m.MATTER_UNO ASnvarchar)+')'ELSE''END[Matter],dr.CLIENT_UNO,CASE WHEN dr.CLIENT_UNO <> 0 THEN c.CLIENT_CODE + ': ' + c.CLIENT_NAME + ' (' + CAST(c.CLIENT_UNO AS nvarchar) + ')' ELSE '' END[Client], CASE WHEN dr.RATE_SET_UNO <> 0 THEN rs.RATE_SET_CODE + ': ' + rs.RATE_SET_DESC + ' (' + CAST(rs.RATE_SET_UNO AS nvarchar) + ')' ELSE '' END[Rate Set],  EFF_DATE,dr.RATE_LEVEL,rl.DESCRIPTION [Rate Level],dr.CURRENCY_CODE,MK_PCNT,MK_AMT,THRESHOLD_1,UNIT_COST,THRESHOLD_2,UNIT_COST_2,THRESHOLD_3,UNIT_COST_3,THRESHOLD_4,UNIT_COST_4,UNIT_COST_5,INEMP_REQD,ALLOW_BASE_EDIT,ALLOW_HARD,ALLOW_SOFT,dr.ROW_UNO--,dr.* FROM TBM_RATE_DISB drJOIN CDL_COST cc ON dr.COST_CODE = cc.COST_CODELEFTJOIN HBM_MATTER m ON dr.MATTER_UNO = m.MATTER_UNOLEFTJOIN HBM_CLIENT c ON dr.CLIENT_UNO = c.CLIENT_UNOLEFTJOIN TBL_RATE_SET rs ON dr.RATE_SET_UNO = rs.RATE_SET_UNOLEFTJOIN TBL_LEVEL_DISB rl ON dr.RATE_LEVEL = rl.RATE_LEVEL--/*WHERE cc.COST_CODE = @costcodeAND(dr.GROUP_TYPE IN (3,4)OR (dr.GROUP_TYPE = 1 AND dr.MATTER_UNO = @matteruno)OR (dr.GROUP_TYPE = 2 AND dr.CLIENT_UNO = @clientuno))--*/ORDERBY dr.COST_CODE, dr.EFF_DATE descSELECT''[Rate Set linked to the matter],m.CLNT_MATT_CODE,tm.DI_RATE_SET_UNO,rs.RATE_SET_CODE,dr.COST_CODE,EFF_DATE,dr.CURRENCY_CODE,MK_PCNT,MK_AMT,THRESHOLD_1,UNIT_COST,THRESHOLD_2,UNIT_COST_2,THRESHOLD_3,UNIT_COST_3,THRESHOLD_4,UNIT_COST_4,UNIT_COST_5,dr.ROW_UNOFROM TBM_MATTER tmJOIN HBM_MATTER m ON tm.MATTER_UNO = m.MATTER_UNOJOIN TBL_RATE_SET rs ON tm.DI_RATE_SET_UNO = rs.RATE_SET_UNOJOIN TBM_RATE_DISB dr ON rs.RATE_SET_UNO = dr.RATE_SET_UNOWHERE tm.MATTER_UNO = @matterunoSELECT''[Client and Matter Contraints],cmd.REC_TYPE,cmd.MATTER_UNO,m.CLNT_MATT_CODE,cmd.CLIENT_UNO,c.CLIENT_CODE,cmd.COST_CODE,cmd.RATE_LEVEL,cmd.RATE_LEVEL_DATE,ROW_UNO--cmd.* FROM TBM_CLMAT_DISB cmdLEFTJOIN HBM_MATTER m ON cmd.MATTER_UNO = m.MATTER_UNOLEFTJOIN HBM_CLIENT c ON cmd.CLIENT_UNO = c.CLIENT_UNOWHERE cmd.COST_CODE = @costcodeAND(cmd.MATTER_UNO = @matteruno OR cmd.CLIENT_UNO = @clientuno) || Step 4: Rate set and rate set markup1. Add Rates row 3 for rate setClassic | Hub Setup | Time and Billing Setup | Rate Sets- Currency = USD- Rate Type = Disb- Disb Code- Effective Date = 1/11/2019- All offices = Y- Markup amount = 30.00- Unit Rate 1 = 3.00Link to matter: Classic | Matter Management | Time and Billing | Disbs2. Import DisbAuto calc  = Y- Client/matter = C1.M1- Disb code- Other mandatory fields- Quantity = 1 | Expected: Uses rates row 3 for unit rate and markup 3 + 30 = 33FormBase = 33 (displays 30 until the quantity added)Bill = 33 (displays 30 until the quantity added)CDT_DISBRATE_METHOD = 3BASE_AMT = 33TOBILL_AMT = 33STD_AMT = 3 (standard amount doesn't use the markup) || Step 5: Client constraint rate and markup 1. Add Client constraint rates row 4: level 1, unit rates Classic | Client management | Disbursement constraints- Disbursement = cost code- Currency = USD- Effective date = 1/10/2019- Current = level 1- Markup amount = 40.00 - Unit Rate 1 = 4.002. Import DisbAuto calc  = Y- Client/matter = C2.M2- Disb code- Other mandatory fields- Quantity = 1 | Expected: Uses rates row 4 for unit rate and markup 4 + 40 = 44FormBase = 44 (displays 40 until the quantity added)Bill = 44 (displays 40 until the quantity added)CDT_DISBRATE_METHOD = 2BASE_AMT = 44TOBILL_AMT = 44STD_AMT = 4 (standard amount doesn't use the markup) || Step 6: Matter constraint rate and markup 1. Add Matter constraint rates row 5: level 1, mark up and unit ratesClassic | Matter management | Disbursement constraints- Disbursement = cost code- Currency = USD- Effective date = 1/9/2019- Current = level 1- Markup amount = 50.00 - Unit Rate 1 = 5.002. Import DisbAuto calc  = Y- Client/matter = C2.M1- Disb code- Other mandatory fields- Quantity = 1 | Expected: Uses rates row 5 for unit rate and markup 5 + 50 = 55FormBase = 55 (displays 50 until the quantity added)Bill = 55 (displays 50 until the quantity added)CDT_DISBRATE_METHOD = 1BASE_AMT = 55TOBILL_AMT = 55STD_AMT = 5 (standard amount doesn't use the markup)

Steps: Step 1: Pre reqsMapping profileHave a mapping profile that has Disbursement Base Quantity and Bill Quantity mapped | Expected: SELECT Path,Scope,Name,Content FROM Configuration.ConfigName n INNER JOIN Configuration.ConfigValue v ON n.Id = v.NameId--WHERE Path LIKE 'Preference.SavedSearches.%'WHERE Path LIKE'Business.AccountsPayable.MappingProfiles' || Step 2: Disbursements to importImport Spread SheetDisbursement Base Quantity = 2Disbursement Bill Quantity = 5 || Step 3: ImportRun the importer  using the existing mapping | Expected: Disbursement imported ignoring the Bill Quantity valueselect DISB_UNO,COST_CODE,BL_EMPL_UNO,DI_EMPL_UNO,OK_TO_EDIT_BASE,TAXABLE,BILL_PRINT,CURRENCY_CODE,RATE_METHOD,BASE_QTY,BASE_AMT,BILL_QTY,TOBILL_AMT,STD_AMT,AUTO_CALCULATE,BILLED_AMT,SESSION,*from cdt_disb dorderby d.DISB_UNO descDisb BASE_QTY = 2BILL_QTY = 2 || Step 4: Import Wizard mapping changes1. Select to import2. Select the file3. Select to edit and existing mapping4. Title: Upgrade - Pre-numbered Stationery (To 822.EX004)
Steps: Step 1: After UPD and deploymentCheck that pre-numbered stationery field has been added and value is NULL | Expected: Pre-number field addedTBM_FMT_CHPRE_NUMBERED_STATIONERY = NULLselect PRE_NUMBERED_STATIONERY,* from TBM_FMT_CH || Step 2: Set values to be not NULL on some recordse.g.Record 1update TBM_FMT_CH SET PRE_NUMBERED_STATIONERY ='P'where FORMAT_CODE ='BOTCHK'Record 2update TBM_FMT_CH SET PRE_NUMBERED_STATIONERY ='N'where FORMAT_CODE ='CHK02'Record 3update TBM_FMT_CH SET PRE_NUMBERED_STATIONERY ='Y'where FORMAT_CODE ='CHK03'Record 4update TBM_FMT_CH SET PRE_NUMBERED_STATIONERY =''where FORMAT_CODE ='CHK04'Record 5update TBM_FMT_CH SET PRE_NUMBERED_STATIONERY =NULL where FORMAT_CODE ='CHK05' || Step 3: Run post upgrade scriptTBM_FMT_CH_Default.sql | Expected: Records updatedRecord 2TBM_FMT_CH.PRE_NUMBERED_STATIONERY = NAll other recordsTBM_FMT_CH.PRE_NUMBERED_STATIONERY = Y

Title: Jobs: Payment Schedule - Print/Reprint Check Payments  - Unlock bank early (822 onwards)
Steps: Step 1: Note: 821 uses a config value but from 822, there is a new flag column in TBM_FMT_CH that is checkedNote: This was introduced for Ogletree due to their print jobs taking a long time. The bank lock was holding up other jobs as all their offices use the same bank. It should only be used when NOT using pre printed check stationery || Step 2: Pre req dataCheck format 1Pre-Numbered Stationery = NAdmin | Account Payable | Accounts Payable Options | Check FormatsCheck format 2Pre-Numbered Stationery = YCheck format 3Pre-Numbered Stationery = ''Bank 1- Uses format 1 (set via entity manager in the bank's account payable tab)- Has check numbers register (set via entity manager in the banks's register checks tab)Bank 2- Uses format 2- Has check numbers register Bank 3- Uses format 3- Has check numbers register Two Invoices for bank 1 on schedule 1- Bank is derived from the APType used on the invoice- Pay by Electronic Banking = off- Seperate check = on- PostedTwo Invoices for bank 2 on schedule 2- Bank is derived from the APType used on the invoice- Pay by Electronic Banking = off- Seperate check = on- PostedTwo Invoices for bank 3 on schedule 3- Bank is derived from the APType used on the invoice - Pay by Electronic Banking = off- Seperate check = on- Posted | Expected: --------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- All Banks with formats, printers and office-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------SELECT b.BANK_CODE,b.ACCT_TYPE,b.CURRENCY_CODE,b.OFFC,o.COMPANY_CODE,b.INACTIVE[Bank Inactive],b.SHORT_NAME,b.ASSIGN_WIRE_NUMBER,b.AUTO_WIRE_NUM,TREG_BANK,USE_TRST_EFT,PRE_NUMBERED_STATIONERY,b.CH_FORMAT_UNO,cf.FORMAT_CODE[Check Format],b.TEST_FORMAT_UNO,cf.PRINT_ALL_PAGES,cf.INACTIVE[Chq Format Inactive],cf.FILENAME[Check File],b.RA_FORMAT_UNO,ra.FORMAT_CODE[Remittance Format],ra.INACTIVE[Rem Format Inactive],ra.FILENAME[Remittance File],b.RF_FORMAT_UNO,rf.FORMAT_CODE[Receipt Format],b.RF_TEST_FORMAT,rf.INACTIVE[Rct Format Inactive],rf.FILENAME[Receipt File],b.ALLOW_CHECK_PRINTER_SELECTION, pr1.PRINTER_UNO,pr1.PRINTER_ID[Check Printer], pr1.NETWORK_PATH [Check printer path],pr2.PRINTER_UNO,pr2.PRINTER_ID[Remit Printer], pr2.NETWORK_PATH [Remit printer path]--,b.*FROM TBM_BANK bLEFTJOIN TBM_FMT_CH cf ON b.CH_FORMAT_UNO = cf.FORMAT_UNOLEFTJOIN TBM_FMT_RA ra ON b.RA_FORMAT_UNO = ra.FORMAT_UNOLEFTJOIN TBM_FMT_RF rf ON b.RF_FORMAT_UNO = rf.FORMAT_UNOLEFT JOIN CMS_PRINTER pr1 ON b.CH_PRINTER_UNO = pr1.PRINTER_UNO LEFT JOIN CMS_PRINTER pr2 ON b.RF_PRINTER_UNO = pr2.PRINTER_UNO JOIN HBL_OFFICE o ON b.OFFC = o.OFFC_CODE--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- AP Type's bank and company-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------SELECT typ.APTYPE_CODE,typ.APTYPE_DESC,typ.BANK_CODE,b.CURRENCY_CODE,o.OFFC_CODE,o.COMPANY_CODEFROM APL_APTYPE typJOIN TBM_BANK b ON Typ.BANK_CODE = b.BANK_CODEJOIN HBL_OFFICE o ON b.OFFC = o.OFFC_CODE || Step 3: Use pre-number stationery = N 1. Add invoices 1 and 2 to a schedule- Bank 13. Create payment 4. Print and reprint checks from the schedule | Expected: Bank is unlocked earlyNote: Using sql profilter. Will need to search on the following and check the LN number they appear on to ensure they're in the correct order- search for locks (lockcio) - search for check numbers assigned (AccountsPayableModel.PaymentUpdate) where @P3 > 0 (the check number) and @P57 = NULL  - search for update to DDS_Draft table (DocudraftReportFileInsert)- search for item updated (AccountsPayableModel.PaymentUpdate) where @P58 has a date- search for job set to completed (UPDATE dbo.APE_JOB_QUEUE) or (UPDATE dbo.[APE_JOB_QUEUE]) where @P1 = 'C' for completed* Schedule header user lock removed if job was run from the open schedule* Schedule header job lock applied * Bank job lock applied* All items are then locked - locks applied with no expiry- Lock Owner = B* Check numbers assigned (not for reprint unless you select to create new check numbers)* Bank is unlocked * All selected items processed and DDS_Draft table is updated* Checks are printed and job is set to completed - Pre ex0011* Checks are printed and items updated - From ex0011* Job is set to completed - From ex0011* All items are unlocked* Items are updated - Pre ex0011* Schedule header job lock removed * Schedule header user lock applied if job was run from the open schedule* There are no orphaned locks when job is completed (if the schedule is still open then there will be a user lock on that)Bug 246221 - Payment schedule: Print check job unlocks and locks all open schedules at the end of the job || Step 4: Use pre-number stationery = Y 1. Add invoices 3 and 4 to a schedule- Bank 23. Create payment 4. Print checks from the schedule | Expected: Bank is not unlocked earlyNote: Using sql profilter. Will need to search on the following and check the LN number they appear on to ensure they're in the correct order- search for locks (lockcio) - search for check numbers assigned (AccountsPayableModel.PaymentUpdate) where @P3 > 0 (the check number) and @P57 = NULL  - search for update to DDS_Draft table (DocudraftReportFileInsert)- search for item updated (AccountsPayableModel.PaymentUpdate) where @P58 has a date- search for job set to completed (UPDATE dbo.APE_JOB_QUEUE) or (UPDATE dbo.[APE_JOB_QUEUE]) where @P1 = 'C' for completed* Schedule header user lock removed if job was run from the open schedule* Schedule header job lock applied * Bank job lock applied* All items are then locked - locks applied with no expiry- Lock Owner = B* Check numbers assigned (not for reprint unless you select to create new check numbers)* All selected items processed and DDS_Draft table is updated* Checks are printed and job is set to completed - Pre ex0011* Checks are printed and items updated - From ex0011* Job is set to completed - From ex0011* All items are unlocked* Bank is unlocked * Items are updated - Pre ex0011* Schedule header job lock removed * Schedule header user lock applied if job was run from the open schedule* There are no orphaned locks when job is completed (if the schedule is still open then there will be a user lock on that)Bug 246221 - Payment schedule: Print check job unlocks and locks all open schedules at the end of the job || Step 5: Use pre-number stationery = ''1. Add invoices 5 and 6 to a schedule- Bank 33. Create payment 4. Print checks from the schedule | Expected: Bank is not unlocked earlyNote: Using sql profilter. Will need to search on the following and check the LN number they appear on to ensure they're in the correct order- search for locks (lockcio) - search for check numbers assigned (AccountsPayableModel.PaymentUpdate) where @P3 > 0 (the check number) and @P57 = NULL  - search for update to DDS_Draft table (DocudraftReportFileInsert)- search for item updated (AccountsPayableModel.PaymentUpdate) where @P58 has a date- search for job set to completed (UPDATE dbo.APE_JOB_QUEUE) or (UPDATE dbo.[APE_JOB_QUEUE]) where @P1 = 'C' for completed* Schedule header user lock removed if job was run from the open schedule* Schedule header job lock applied * Bank job lock applied* All items are then locked - locks applied with no expiry- Lock Owner = B* Check numbers assigned (not for reprint unless you select to create new check numbers)* All selected items processed and DDS_Draft table is updated* Checks are printed and job is set to completed - Pre ex0011* Checks are printed and items updated - From ex0011* Job is set to completed - From ex0011* All items are unlocked* Bank is unlocked * Items are updated - Pre ex0011* Schedule header job lock removed * Schedule header user lock applied if job was run from the open schedule* There are no orphaned locks when job is completed (if the schedule is still open then there will be a user lock on that)Bug 246221 - Payment schedule: Print check job unlocks and locks all open schedules at the end of the job

Title: Payment - Tax: Tax included - Look and Feel
Steps: Step 1: Pre req setupSet a valid GL account for tax codes e.g: 40120UPDATE TBL_TAX_BOOK SET ACCT_UNO = 127 WHERE BOOK = 1Set taxes in use tax on:UPDATE CMS_OPTION SET FLAG_VALUE ='Y'WHERE OPTION_CODE ='TAXES_IN_USE'UPDATE APM_PARMS SET DEFAULT_TAX_IN ='Y'--Q,X,Y,NUPDATE APM_PARMS SET RECOV_CONT_REQD ='N' || Step 2: Tax Included <> NA1. Vendor payment - Tax Included = Yes or No | Expected: - Can't have invoice line item with any of the other line item types- If invoice line item, then post is avail but calculate tax is not avail. On posting, the Tax included is set to NA || Step 3: Tax Included <> NA1. Vendor payment - Tax Included = NA | Expected: - Can have invoice line item with any of the other line item types- Post is avail but calculate tax is not avail.

Title: Payment - Remittance: Email using 365 versus not 365
Steps: Step 1: Note:  example remittance formats are attached to the docudraft set up stepNote:  user will select which email format on the fly when sending the remittance, unlike the email remittance format which is set against the bank being used on the payment || Step 2: Pre reqsUser 1Has a 365 email addressUser 2Has a standard email addressVendor- Has a valid email address || Step 3: 3651.  Set the Exchange URLAdmin | System | Email e.g.https://outlook.office365.com/EWS/Exchange.asmx2. Set the Remittance Advice SenderAdmin | System | Email | Accounts Payable- Office 365 = on- Email address (of a user that has a 365 email)- Password (of the email user)3. Create an electronic payment for the vendor4. Print remittance for payment5. Email remittance advices | Expected: Email is sent || Step 4: Non 3651.  Set the Exchange URLAdmin | System | Email e.g.https://mail.aderant.com/EWS/Exchange.asmx2. Set the Remittance Advice SenderAdmin | System | Email | Accounts Payable- Office 365 = off- Email address - Username (of the email user)- Password (of the email user)3. Create an electronic payment for the vendor4. Print remittance for payment5. Email remittance advices | Expected: Email is sent

Title: Jobs: Print/Reprint Check Payments - Timeout and logging
Steps: Step 1: Pre reqsSet the logging on1. AP App back stage2. Enable logging = Start Log Level = Troubleshooting3. In services, restart ADERANT DocuDraft Queue Manager ServiceNote: Should not have to do this but seems to need itno sometimesNote: May also have to do an issreset || Step 2: Printing times outSet config to a value that will timeoutTechnical.Applications.ExpertAccountsPayable.Options.PrintingTimeout = 1Print Checks with timeout1. Create a payment for type check2. Add line items to balance3. Print View logs Note: once the browser has loaded, remove the nav.... part from the end so should look something like this:http://wsakl001426.ap.aderant.com/Expert_Local/ApplicationServices/WebInquiries/Home/ExternalInquiry/#/ExpertSystem.Inquiries.Instrumentation.LogsSet the logging filter- Application = Accounts Payable- Level = debug- message = DocumentPrinter | Expected: Print jobs shows an error but documents createdError displaysAspose.Pdf Print PDF file failed with error: Printer \\svfp301.ap.aderant.com\PT_AKL_Development_01 is not responding. Aborting printing.Logging records createdNote: The loging records may take some time to come thru to the monitoring DBDocumentPrinter.PrintPdfFile Aspose - Started.DocumentPrinter - Timeout is set to 1 seconds.DocumentPrinter.PrintPdfFile Aspose - Completed.SELECT ID,DATE,LOGGER,MESSAGE, EXCEPTION,EXCEPTIONTYPE ,APPLICATION,DOMAIN,MACHINE,LOCATION,PROXYIDENTITY,LOGLEVEL,THREAD,LEVEL,ACTIVITYDATA,SERVICECALLDATA,SESSIONID,ACTIVITYID,SERVICECALLID ,SESSIONDATAFROM [Instrumentation].[FWM_LOG]--WHERE SESSIONDATA = 'Expert Accounts Payable'WHEREMESSAGELIKE ('%DocumentPrinter%')--AND LOGGER LIKE('Aderant.AccountsPayable%')--AND LEVEL IN ('ERROR','FATAL')-- DEBUG,WARN,FATAL,ERROR,INFO--AND LEVEL IN ('ERROR','FATAL','DEBUG')-- DEBUG,WARN,FATAL,ERROR,INFO--AND LEVEL IN ('DEBUG')-- DEBUG,WARN,FATAL,ERROR,INFO--AND LEVEL IN ('ERROR','FATAL','INFO')-- DEBUG,WARN,FATAL,ERROR,INF--AND LEVEL IN ('ERROR','FATAL','INFO','DEBUG','WARN')-- DEBUG,WARN,FATAL,ERROR,INFOORDERBY ID desc || Step 3: Printing doesn't timeoutSet config to a value that will not timeoutTechnical.Applications.ExpertAccountsPayable.Options.PrintingTimeout = 45Print Checks with timeout1. Create a payment for type check2. Add line items to balance3. Print View logs | Expected: Print jobs succeeds Logging records createdNote: The loging records may take some time to come thru to the monitoring DBDocumentPrinter.PrintPdfFile Aspose - Started.DocumentPrinter - Timeout is set to 45 seconds.DocumentPrinter.PrintPdfFile Aspose - Completed.

Title: Payment Items - Invoice: Cancel in a later fiscal year impact on Summary tables
Steps: Step 1: Note: Sometimes payments are canceled some time later and therefore may be canceled in a different fiscal year. If the Vendor has not had any action done that would cause a summary table row to be created for the current year, then when the cancel is performed, it is expected to create that new row. An example is: Clients will send out checks that may not get presented within the expiry time for a check so they cancel the payment and this couilod be some months after the payment was created | Expected: Bug 248218 - Vendor summary tables issues || Step 2: Pre reqsNZD Rates Rate: 1.175604360300000Reciprocal: 0.850626310831998 || Step 3: Create a new vendor- APType linked to bank BAUK (so NZD) || Step 4: Create and post an invoice for the vendor- amount = 100.00- keep the APType defaulted- change currency to USD | Expected: New records created forAPH_VENDOR_YEARAPH_VENDOR_SUMMAPT_ APH_VENDOR_YEARFISCAL_YEAR = Current fiscal yearINVOICE_AMT = 100.00AP_CHECK_AMT = 0TOTAL_CHECK_AMT = 0APT_NET_AMT = 100.00GAIN_LOSS_AMT = 0INVOICE_COUNT = 1CHECK_COUNT = 0APT_VENDOR_SUMMINVOICE_AMT = 100.00AP_CHECK_AMT = 0TOTAL_CHECK_AMT = 0AP_BALANCE = 100.00GAIN_LOSS_AMT = 0LAST_PAID_AMT = 0INVOICE_COUNT = 1 CHECK_COUNT = 0 || Step 5: Quick pay the invoice | Expected: Payment created- amount = NZD117.56 || Step 6: Post the payment | Expected: Records updated APH_VENDOR_YEARAPH_VENDOR_SUMMAPT_ APH_VENDOR_YEARFISCAL_YEAR = Current fiscal yearINVOICE_AMT = 100.00AP_CHECK_AMT = 100.00 99.9996291014Looks like its using MONEY cos when I calculate using FLOAT is comes back to 100.00TOTAL_CHECK_AMT = ? 0 Should this be 100.00?APT_NET_AMT = 0GAIN_LOSS_AMT = 0 0.0003708986INVOICE_COUNT = 1CHECK_COUNT = 1 0 should this be 1?APT_VENDOR_SUMMINVOICE_AMT = 100.00AP_CHECK_AMT = 100.00 99.9996291014TOTAL_CHECK_AMT = ? 0 Should this be 100.00?AP_BALANCE = 0GAIN_LOSS_AMT = 0 0.0003708986LAST_PAID_AMT = 100.00 99.9996291014INVOICE_COUNT = 1 CHECK_COUNT = 1 0 should this be 1? || Step 7: Cancel payment in a later fiscal year1. Change the summary year row to be an earlier fiscal year e.g.UPDATE APH_VENDOR_YEAR SET FISCAL_YEAR = 2013 WHERE ROW_UNO = 712. Cancel Payment | Expected: New record created for current fiscal yearAPH_VENDOR_YEARRecords updated APH_VENDOR_YEARAPH_VENDOR_SUMMAPH_VENDOR_YEARFISCAL_YEAR = Previous fiscal year (which was the current fiscal year record from above)INVOICE_AMT = 100.00AP_CHECK_AMT = 0TOTAL_CHECK_AMT = 0APT_NET_AMT =  0 Not sure about thisGAIN_LOSS_AMT = 0 -0.0003708986INVOICE_COUNT = 1CHECK_COUNT = 1 0 should this be 1?APH_VENDOR_YEARFISCAL_YEAR = Current fiscal yearINVOICE_AMT = 0AP_CHECK_AMT = -100.00 -99.9996291014TOTAL_CHECK_AMT = 0APT_NET_AMT =  100.00  what should this be?GAIN_LOSS_AMT = 0 -0.0003708986INVOICE_COUNT = 0CHECK_COUNT = 0APT_VENDOR_SUMMINVOICE_AMT = 100.00AP_CHECK_AMT = 0TOTAL_CHECK_AMT = 0AP_BALANCE = 100.00 GAIN_LOSS_AMT = 0 LAST_PAID_AMT = 100.00 99.9996291014 INVOICE_COUNT = 1 CHECK_COUNT = 0 || Step 8: Cancel payment (alternative to previous step)Cancel Payment | Expected: New record created for current fiscal yearAPH_VENDOR_YEARRecord updated APH_VENDOR_SUMMAPT_ APH_VENDOR_YEARFISCAL_YEAR = Current fiscal yearINVOICE_AMT = 100.00AP_CHECK_AMT = 0TOTAL_CHECK_AMT = 0APT_NET_AMT =  100.00GAIN_LOSS_AMT = 0 INVOICE_COUNT = 1CHECK_COUNT = 0APT_VENDOR_SUMMINVOICE_AMT = 100.00AP_CHECK_AMT = 0TOTAL_CHECK_AMT = 0AP_BALANCE = 100.00GAIN_LOSS_AMT = 0 LAST_PAID_AMT = 100.00 99.9996291014INVOICE_COUNT = 1 CHECK_COUNT = 0

Title: Payment Items - Invoice: Cancel multiple in a later fiscal Summary tables
Steps: Step 1: Note: Sometimes payments are canceled some time later and therefore may be canceled in a different fiscal year. If the Vendor has not had any action done that would cause a summary table row to be created for the current year, then when the cancel is performed, it is expected to create that new row. An example is: Clients will send out checks that may not get presented within the expiry time for a check so they cancel the payment and this couilod be some months after the payment was created || Step 2: Create 2 invoices for the same vendor- take note of the values in APH_VENDOR_YEAR | Expected: SELECT ''[APH_VENDOR_YEAR],ROW_UNO,vy.VENDOR_UNO,vy.FISCAL_YEAR,INVOICE_AMT,AP_CHECK_AMT,TOTAL_CHECK_AMT,AP_NET_AMT,DISCOUNT_AMT,WITHHELD_AMT,REFUND_AMT,GAIN_LOSS_AMT,ST_WITHHELD_AMT,CRNOTE_AMT,INVOICE_COUNT,CHECK_COUNT,REFUND_COUNT,CRNOTE_COUNT,LAST_INV_DATE,LAST_CHECK_DATE,vy.LAST_MODIFIEDFROM APH_VENDOR_YEAR vyJOIN APM_VENDOR v ON vy.VENDOR_UNO = v.VENDOR_UNOWHERE v.VENDOR_ID = || Step 3: Create an invoices for a different vendor- take note of the values in APH_VENDOR_YEAR || Step 4: Create and post vendor payment1. Create the payment- amount = total of the 3 invoices2. add the invoices3. Post the payment || Step 5: Cancel payment in a later fiscal year1. Change the summary year row to be an earlier fiscal year e.g.UPDATE APH_VENDOR_YEAR SET FISCAL_YEAR = 2013 WHERE ROW_UNO = 712. Cancel Payment | Expected: Values in APH_VENDOR_YEAR have been inserted/updated for the current year

Title: Rules: Disb rules in multiple applications
Steps: Step 1: Select to create a new rule for AP Disbs1. Design studio | Expert Accounts Payable | Rules | 2. Right click on the end point Detail Validation | Disbursement Validation3. Add rule | Create new4. Enter header details- Name- Code5. Enter activity details- Enter message (text must be in double quotes)"AP: Amount can't be greater than 100"- Add field Disbursement.BaseAmount- Set operator to >- Set value to 1006. Save | Expected: Rule is savedSELECT CODE,r.NAME,r.INACTIVE,ENTITY_ASSOCIATED,RULE_KEY,rv.EFFECTIVE_FROM,rv.EFFECTIVE_UNTIL,rc.NAME, rc.DATA_TYPE,r.* FROM FWM_RULE rLEFT JOIN FWM_RULE_VERSION rv ON r.RULE_UNO = rv.RULE_UNO LEFT JOIN FWM_RULE_CONTRACT rc ON r.RULE_UNO = rc.RULE_UNO ORDER BY r.RULE_UNO desc || Step 2: Select to create a new rule for Disbs1. Design studio | Expert Disbursements | Rules | 2. Right click on the end point Disbursement processing | On Disbursement Save |3. Add rule | Create new4. Enter header details- Name- Code5. Enter activity details- Enter message (text must be in double quotes)"Disb: Amount can't be greater than 100"- Add field Disbursement.BaseAmount- Set operator to >- Set value to 1006. Save | Expected: Rule is saved || Step 3: Select to create a new rule for Billing1. Design studio | Expert Billing | Rules | 2. Right click on the end point Prebill Processing Disbursement Validation 3. Add rule | Create new4. Enter header details- Name- Code5. Enter activity details- Enter message (text must be in double quotes)"Billing: Amount can't be greater than 100"- Add field Disbursement.BaseAmount- Set operator to >- Set value to 1006. Save | Expected: Rule is saved || Step 4: Create disbursement1. New payment- enter mandatory data2. Add a disb- Amount = 100.01- Enter other mandatory data4. Save & Close | Expected: AP and Disb Error messages displayed and errors saved- Error message from AP- Error message from DisbursementsAPT_MESSAGE 2 created- Both messagesCDT_MESSAGE 1 created- Just the disb message || Step 5: View Disb in disb app | Expected: Disb Error message displayed - Error message from Disbursements

Title: Payment Items - Disbursement: Cancel with retained billed amount when classic used for the second bill
Steps: Step 2: Note: When using the retained billed amount functionality, disbs that are returned to WIP from a prebill, may have a retained amount set due to the billed amount being edited on the bill. This is so that when they are next pulled to another bill, the retained amount will be applied as the Bill amount rather than getting it from the To Bill amountNote: As the users are not supposed to use classic billing iof they're a Retained Amount site, this should never be an issue as expert billing sets the value to NULL || Step 3: Setup pre reqs MatterFor the disbs and billTurn on retain billed amountNote: This is required so that the billed amount will be set from the retained amount if the retained amount is not NULL. Otherwise it will get set from the To Bill amountAdmin | Billing | Fees/Disbursements | User Retained Billed Amount/HoursUPDATE BLM_PARMS SET USE_RETAINED_BILLED = 'Y' || Step 4: Create a vendor payment and post itHeaderPayment method <> CheckAmount = 10Disb 1Auto Calc = offAmount = -10Disb 2Auto Calc = offAmount = 20 | Expected: Payment createdDisb 1CDT_DISB.SOURCE_TRAN_TYP = CHCDT_DISB.WIP_STATUS = WCDT_DISB.BILL_TRAN_UNO = 0CDT_DISB.BASE_AMT = -10.00CDT_DISB.TOBILL_AMT = -10.00CDT_DISB.BILLED_AMT = 0CDT_DISB.RETAINED_BILLED_AMT = NULLDisb 2CDT_DISB.SOURCE_TRAN_TYP = CHCDT_DISB.WIP_STATUS = WCDT_DISB.BILL_TRAN_UNO = 0CDT_DISB.BASE_AMT = 20.00CDT_DISB.TOBILL_AMT = 20.00CDT_DISB.BILLED_AMT = 0CDT_DISB.RETAINED_BILLED_AMT = NULLSELECT d.DISB_UNO,d.WIP_STATUS,d.ED_INITIATED,m.CLNT_MATT_CODE,d.COST_CODE,d.TOBILL_AMT,d.BILLED_AMT,d.RETAINED_BILLED_AMT,d.BILL_TRAN_UNO,d.SOURCE_TRAN_TYP,d.SOURCE_TRAN_UNO,d.BILL_QTY,d.CURRENCY_CODE,EXPERT_DISB_STATUS,d.MATTER_UNO,d.LAST_MODIFIED--,d.* FROM CDT_DISB dJOIN HBM_MATTER m on d.MATTER_UNO = m.MATTER_UNOJOIN TBM_MATTER tm on d.MATTER_UNO = tm.MATTER_UNOORDER BY d.DISB_UNO desc || Step 5: Create a prebill in expert billing that pulls in the disbs | Expected: Prebill createdDisbs are on the prebillDisb 1 (updated)CDT_DISB.SOURCE_TRAN_TYP = CHCDT_DISB.WIP_STATUS = PCDT_DISB.BILL_TRAN_UNO = The bill's tran unoCDT_DISB.BASE_AMT = -10.00CDT_DISB.TOBILL_AMT =  -10.00CDT_DISB.BILLED_AMT = -10.00CDT_DISB.RETAINED_BILLED_AMT = NULLDisb 2 (updated)CDT_DISB.SOURCE_TRAN_TYP = CHCDT_DISB.WIP_STATUS = PCDT_DISB.BILL_TRAN_UNO = The bill's tran unoCDT_DISB.BASE_AMT = 20.00CDT_DISB.TOBILL_AMT = 20.00CDT_DISB.BILLED_AMT = 20.00CDT_DISB.RETAINED_BILLED_AMT = NULL || Step 6: Edit the disbs- Disb 1 billed amount = -11.00- Disb 2 billed amount = 21.00 | Expected: Disbs updatedDisb 1 (updated)CDT_DISB.SOURCE_TRAN_TYP = CHCDT_DISB.WIP_STATUS = PCDT_DISB.BILL_TRAN_UNO = The bill's tran unoCDT_DISB.BASE_AMT = -10.00CDT_DISB.TOBILL_AMT =  -10.00CDT_DISB.BILLED_AMT = -11.00CDT_DISB.RETAINED_BILLED_AMT = NULLDisb 2 (updated)CDT_DISB.SOURCE_TRAN_TYP = CHCDT_DISB.WIP_STATUS = PCDT_DISB.BILL_TRAN_UNO = The bill's tran unoCDT_DISB.BASE_AMT = 20.00CDT_DISB.TOBILL_AMT = 20.00CDT_DISB.BILLED_AMT = 21.00CDT_DISB.RETAINED_BILLED_AMT = NULL || Step 7: Return the prebill to WIPSelect to retain the billed disb amounts | Expected: Disbs are returned to WIPDisbs now have a retained billed amountDisb 1 (updated)CDT_DISB.SOURCE_TRAN_TYP = CHCDT_DISB.WIP_STATUS = WCDT_DISB.BILL_TRAN_UNO = The bill's tran uno Is this correct? Shouldn't it be 0?CDT_DISB.BASE_AMT = -10.00CDT_DISB.TOBILL_AMT =  -10.00CDT_DISB.BILLED_AMT = 0CDT_DISB.RETAINED_BILLED_AMT = -11.00Disb 2 (updated)CDT_DISB.SOURCE_TRAN_TYP = CHCDT_DISB.WIP_STATUS = WCDT_DISB.BILL_TRAN_UNO = The bill's tran uno Is this correct? Shouldn't it be 0?CDT_DISB.BASE_AMT = 20.00CDT_DISB.TOBILL_AMT = 20.00CDT_DISB.BILLED_AMT = 0CDT_DISB.RETAINED_BILLED_AMT = 21.00 || Step 8: Create another prebill that pulls in the disbsNeeds to be created in classicNote: the reason for doing this, is that if the disb is not on a bill, AP will cancel the disb when the invoice or payment is canceled. If the disb is on a bill then AP can not cancel the disb, instead it will create a contra entry for the refund | Expected: Prebill createdDisbs are on the prebillNote: because classic doesn't use retained amount it also doesn't update them. So on expert they would be reset to NULL at this pointDisb 1 (updated)CDT_DISB.SOURCE_TRAN_TYP = CHCDT_DISB.WIP_STATUS = PCDT_DISB.BILL_TRAN_UNO = The bill's tran unoCDT_DISB.BASE_AMT = -10.00CDT_DISB.TOBILL_AMT =  -10.00CDT_DISB.BILLED_AMT = -10.00CDT_DISB.RETAINED_BILLED_AMT = -11.00Disb 2 (updated)CDT_DISB.SOURCE_TRAN_TYP = CHCDT_DISB.WIP_STATUS = PCDT_DISB.BILL_TRAN_UNO = The bill's tran unoCDT_DISB.BASE_AMT = 20.00CDT_DISB.TOBILL_AMT = 20.00CDT_DISB.BILLED_AMT = 20.00CDT_DISB.RETAINED_BILLED_AMT = 21.00 || Step 9: Cancel the payment | Expected: Payment is cancelled- The original disb is not deleted because its on a bill.- Contra entries are created for the disbs Note: because there was a value in the retained amount due to classic not clearing it, the contra entry value will created from that thereby causing an over payment of the refund. Tonya is aware of this but its a billing issue.Disb 1 (updated)CDT_DISB.SOURCE_TRAN_TYP = CHCDT_DISB.WIP_STATUS = PCDT_DISB.BILL_TRAN_UNO = The bill's tran unoCDT_DISB.BASE_AMT = -10.00CDT_DISB.TOBILL_AMT =  -10.00CDT_DISB.BILLED_AMT = -10.00CDT_DISB.RETAINED_BILLED_AMT = -11.00Disb 2 (updated)CDT_DISB.SOURCE_TRAN_TYP = CHCDT_DISB.WIP_STATUS = PCDT_DISB.BILL_TRAN_UNO = The bill's tran unoCDT_DISB.BASE_AMT = 20.00CDT_DISB.TOBILL_AMT = 20.00CDT_DISB.BILLED_AMT = 20.00CDT_DISB.RETAINED_BILLED_AMT = 21.00Disb 1 (contra entry created)CDT_DISB.SOURCE_TRAN_TYP = CHXCDT_DISB.WIP_STATUS = WCDT_DISB.BILL_TRAN_UNO = 0CDT_DISB.BASE_AMT = 10.00CDT_DISB.TOBILL_AMT =  10.00CDT_DISB.BILLED_AMT = 0CDT_DISB.RETAINED_BILLED_AMT = 11.00Disb 2 (contra entry created)CDT_DISB.SOURCE_TRAN_TYP = CHXCDT_DISB.WIP_STATUS = WCDT_DISB.BILL_TRAN_UNO = 0CDT_DISB.BASE_AMT = -20.00CDT_DISB.TOBILL_AMT = -20.00CDT_DISB.BILLED_AMT = 0CDT_DISB.RETAINED_BILLED_AMT = -21.00

Title: Payment - Vendor: Address default from various payment creation method (From 822.EX0006)
Steps: Step 1: Pre req Vendor A setup as below:- Has a different vendor as Remit Vendor B- Has a Client Name C related payee with 1 default address- Remit Vendor B has 3 addresses.>> One is Vendor Remit Address>> One is Name Default Address>> One is neither Remit NOR Default address#Vendor Remit Address setup in Entity Manager > Vendor > Details > Remittance Address.#Vendor Name Address setup in Name Maintenance screen. | Expected: select V.VENDOR_ID,v.VENDOR_UNO,v.NAME_UNO,rv.VENDOR_ID as RemitVendorID,rv.vendor_uno as RemitVendorUno,case when Rv.ADDRESS_UNO = a.ADDRESS_UNO then 'Y' else 'N' END as RemitAddress,case when a.ADDRESS_UNO = n.ADDRESS_UNO then 'Y' else 'N' END as VendorDefaultAddress,a.ADDRESS_UNO,a.ADDRESS1,a.ADDRESS2, a.ADDRESS3,a.ADDRESS4from apm_vendor vleft join APM_VENDOR rv on V.REMIT_VEND_UNO = RV.VENDOR_UNOleft join HBM_ADDRESS a on a.NAME_UNO = rv.NAME_UNOleft join HBM_NAME n on n.NAME_UNO = a.NAME_UNOwhere v.VENDOR_ID = 'address3' and a.INACTIVE = 'N' select INVOICE_NUM,VENDOR_UNO,REMIT_VENDOR_UNO,NAME_UNO,ADDRESS_UNO,USE_OVERRIDE,USE_NAME_OVERRIDE,USE_ADDRS_OVERRIDE from apt_invoice order by LAST_MODIFIED desc || Step 2: Create Invoice with Vendor A with setup as below:Invoice 1 with no overrideName_Uno = 0Address_uno  = 0Override flags = 'N' Invoice 2 with name overrideName_Uno = selected name C unoAddress_uno  = selected name C address unoOverride flags = 'Y' Invoice 3 with address only overrideName_Uno = vendor B unoAddress_uno  = selected address unoOverride flags = 'Y' Invoice 4 with address removed.Name_Uno = vendor B unoAddress_uno  = 0Override flags = 'Y' || Step 3: Add invoice to payment manually - Vendor A Create a vendor payment for Vendor A, leave the address as defaultAdd invoices into payment, one invoice at a time.Observe the address on payment header. | Expected: Invoice 1 - added.Invoice 2 - prompted with "Invoice has an overriding name" dialog. Click Yes - default name C and address from invoice, even if name C is not related to vendor A. Click No - payment address retain.Invoice 3 - prompted with "Invoice has an overriding name" dialog. Click Yes - default name and address to vendor B as invoice. Invoice 4 - prompted with "Invoice has an overriding name" dialog. Click Yes - default name to vendor B and address as 0 as per invoice. || Step 4: Add invoice to payment manually - Vendor BCreate a vendor payment for Vendor B (the Remit vendor of the invoices), leave the address as defaultAdd invoices into payment, one invoice at a time.Observe the address on payment header. | Expected: Invoice 1 - added. Invoice 2 - prompted with "Invoice has an overriding name" dialog. Click Yes - default name C and address from invoice. Click No - payment address retain.Invoice 3 - prompted with "Invoice has an overriding name" dialog. Click Yes - default address from invoice.Invoice 4 - prompted with "Invoice has an overriding name" dialog. Click Yes - default address as 0 as per invoice.  Notice that Payment Entry still showing Remit Address after reopen payment but APT_CHECK is showing ADDRESS_UNO = 0. || Step 5: Add invoice to payment using Quick PayFrom Invoices list screen, select all four invoices. Verify that you cannot quick pay them all at once.Quick Pay the invoices individually. | Expected: Quick Pay from:Invoice 1 - Payment created for Vendor B. Address uno = Vendor B Remit addressInvoice 2 - Payment created for Vendor B. Name and address for Name C from invoice.Invoice 3 - Payment created for Vendor B. Address uno from invoice.Invoice 4 - Payment created for Vendor B. Address uno default from vendor remit address. APM_VENDOR.ADDRESS_UNO. || Step 6: Generate payments from Payment Schedule Select all four invoices on Invoices grid. Create Payment Schedule.DO NOT check 'Separate Check' for each of these invoices. Generate Payments. | Expected: Verify payments: three payments created. (order could be different)Payment 1 created with Invoice 2.Payment 2 created with Invoice 1 and 4.Payment 3 created with Invoice 3. || Step 7: Generate payments from Payment Schedule with Separate CheckSelect all four invoices on Invoices grid. Create Payment Schedule.Make sure to check 'Separate Check' for each of these invoices. Generate Payments. | Expected: Verify payments: four payments created. (order could be different)Payment 1 created with Vendor B wth Vendor B Remit address, with Invoice 1.Payment 2 created with Vendor B with name and address for Name C, with Invoice 2.Payment 3 created with Vendor B with address uno from invoice, with Invoice 3.Payment 4 created with Vendor B. Address uno default from vendor remit address, with Invoice 4.

Title: AP Customisation: Alternate New Invoice Workflow
Steps: Step 1: Pre reqsCustomized Workflow- see attachedWF Clean up (i.e. you may have imported the WF and then restored your DB)Remove any WF instances fro IIS manager that are not in the DB || Step 2: Import attached Custom WorkflowDeployment manager | Packages | Import | Expected: Two Workflow definitionsOut of the box workflowName = Aderant.Workflow.AP.NewInvoiceCustom workflowName = Aderant.Workflow.AP.NewInvoice2Default workflowAderant.Workflow.AP.NewInvoiceSELECT * FROM WFM_WORKFLOW_DEFINITION WHERE CATEGORY ='Accounts Payable'AND METADATAPRIMED ='Y'SELECT n.Path,v.scope,n.Name,v.Content,v.UserOrGroupDisplayName,v.Id FROM Configuration.ConfigName n INNER JOIN Configuration.ConfigValue v ON n.Id = v.NameIdWHERE Path LIKE 'Technical.Applications.ExpertAccountsPayable.Workflow.NewInvoice%'AND NAME = 'DefaultWorkflow' || Step 3: Create a New Invoice WorkflowAP app | Invoice Tab | Initiate Workflow | New Invoice | Expected: Out of the box workflow startedName = Aderant.Workflow.AP.NewInvoiceSELECT ''[WF and Lock],inv.TRAN_UNO[Invoice Trans],wf.PUBLICDATAVALUE2[Invoice],STARTEDON,wf.STATE[WF State],wf.PUBLICDATAVALUE1,l.LOCK_OWNER, l.LOGIN_ID,l.GUID,l.LOCK_REASON,wf.PUBLICDATAVALUE3,PUBLICDATAVALUE4,wf.STARTEDBYUSERNAME,wf.WORKFLOWNAME,wf.WORKFLOWINSTANCEID,PARTICIPANTS, TASKTYPE FROM WFM_WORKFLOW_SUMMARY wfLEFT JOIN CMS_LOCK l ON wf.WORKFLOWINSTANCEID = l.GUID AND TABLE_NAME = 'APT_INVOICE' LEFTJOIN APT_INVOICE inv ON inv.TRAN_UNO = l.TABLE_ROW_UNOLEFTJOIN WFM_TASK wft ON wf.WORKFLOWINSTANCEID = wft.WORKFLOWINSTANCEIDWHERE WORKFLOWCATEGORY ='Accounts Payable'ORDERBY wf.STARTEDON desc, Invoice,PUBLICDATALABEL1 || Step 4: Change the default workflow to the custom oneAdmin | Accounts Payable | Workflow | New Invoice Workflow | Expected: Custom WF changedBug || Step 5: Create a New Invoice Workflow1. Repen AP app to pick up the new configuration values2. Create a workflowAP app | Invoice Tab | Initiate Workflow | New Invoice | Expected: Custom workflow startedName = Aderant.Workflow.AP.NewInvoice2SELECT ''[WF and Lock],inv.TRAN_UNO[Invoice Trans],wf.PUBLICDATAVALUE2[Invoice],STARTEDON,wf.STATE[WF State],wf.PUBLICDATAVALUE1,l.LOCK_OWNER, l.LOGIN_ID,l.GUID,l.LOCK_REASON,wf.PUBLICDATAVALUE3,PUBLICDATAVALUE4,wf.STARTEDBYUSERNAME,wf.WORKFLOWNAME,wf.WORKFLOWINSTANCEID,PARTICIPANTS, TASKTYPE FROM WFM_WORKFLOW_SUMMARY wfLEFT JOIN CMS_LOCK l ON wf.WORKFLOWINSTANCEID = l.GUID AND TABLE_NAME = 'APT_INVOICE' LEFTJOIN APT_INVOICE inv ON inv.TRAN_UNO = l.TABLE_ROW_UNOLEFTJOIN WFM_TASK wft ON wf.WORKFLOWINSTANCEID = wft.WORKFLOWINSTANCEIDWHERE WORKFLOWCATEGORY ='Accounts Payable'ORDERBY wf.STARTEDON desc, Invoice,PUBLICDATALABEL1

Save the form. | Expected: Form is customized || Step 3: Create new invoice with disb1. Open the AP app.2. Create a new invoice.3. Fill in all required fields and save it.4. Add a new disbursement.5.
