Title: Payment - Check print Client Side: Original and Copies
Steps: Step 1: Pre req All Pages = onAdmin | Accounts Payable | Check Printing | Check Formats- Select Code=GDPRC1, Select DocuDraft- Change File name to the attached template and ensure the file is saved in the template folder || Step 2: Pre reqOpen Expert Administration, go to <System |  Printer Settings | Client Side Printing> and ensure Accounts Payable tick box is selected. || Step 3: Pre req - Remittance template 2 pages- Page one has check and first part of remittance advice text- Page two has more remittance advice text || Step 4: Print Original Only, select one of the client printersFile copy = No | Expected: * One copy only set to check printer || Step 5: Print Original and file copy, select one of the client printersFile copy = YesPrinter selected that is not the same as the check printer | Expected: * First copy sent to check printer* Second copy sent to copy printer

Title: Payment - Check print Client Side: Water mark
Steps: Step 1: Pre req  Set Expert Image OnAdmin | System | Expert Imaging | Accounts Payable || Step 2: Pre req All Pages = onAdmin | Accounts Payable | Check Printing | Check Formats- Select Code=GDPRC1, Select DocuDraft- Change File name to the attached template and ensure the file is saved in the template folder || Step 3: Pre req - Remittance template 2 pages- Page one has check and first part of remittance advice text- Page two has more remittance advice text || Step 4: Print Check and copySecond copy = Yes | Expected: IMPORTANT !!! : check the real output hasn't got the watermark as we've had issues with this in the past * No printed pages have a water mark* Docudraft file has a water mark on all pages* Copy of file in images folder has a water mark on all pages || Step 5: Re-Print check and copySecond copy = Yes | Expected: IMPORTANT !!! : check the real output hasn't got the watermark as we've had issues with this in the past * No printed pages have a water mark* Docudraft file has a water mark on all pages* Copy of file in images folder has a water mark on all pages

Title: Payment - Check Print Client Side: Report Writer General
Description: This should not be impacted by Client Side printing changes since the addition feature to print client side is for non-report writer documents. Closing as obsolete.
Steps: Step 1: Create a new vendor payment with Check method || Step 2: Fill in required fields and add details lines || Step 3: Click Print Payments | Expected: Payment is releasedPayment is shown on the Print Checks SPOD and is checked. || Step 4: Click Print | Expected: Report Writer Print Checks window should come up.# Of Checks to Print = 1 and is disabledStarting Check Number = Next available for the bank and is enabledEnding Check Number = starting number+1 and is disabled.Bank = bank on check and disabledCurrency = bank currency and disabled || Step 5: Click Ok | Expected: Payment is printed to the printer attached to the bankRun Report Window comes up || Step 6: Check Printer and click OK.Note:Leave FileLeave EmailLeave Print Constraints page | Expected: Sends another copy of the check to the printerMore than one can be checked and will send it to multiple places.Would create a Report Viewer file (can be viewed using Report Viewer in ?)Would send an email of the payment Needs to be combined with one of the other options. Sends a Report Constraint page and a payment copy || Step 7: Check APT_CHECK | Expected: Check_Num and Print_Session updated

Title: Jobs: Print/Reprint Check Payments - Client Side
Steps: Step 1: Set  Client Side printing for Accounts Payable to True Expert Admin | System |Printer Settings | Client Side Printing || Step 2: Note: As the job process is quick, there is no time to check that the lock occurred so need to check using sql profilter: search for: sp_cmsmakelockcio || Step 3: General | Expected: * Job created from grid no matter how many items selected || Step 4: Start job | Expected: Job runs* Local notification sent so notification form displays * Job starts processing* Bank is locked at the start of a job- lock applied with no expiry - Lock Owner = B* All items are locked at the start of the job- locks applied with no expiry* Job status = R while processing* Service sends notifications to notification form and recent activity grid* All selected items processed* Each item is unlocked once its been processed (changed in 822 to unlock at end of job?)* Job status = C when completed* Checks are printed* Items are unlocked* Bank is unlocked (in the future there will be a setting introduced to allow the bank to be unlocked after the database updates are committed but before the actually printing process)* There are no orphaned locks when job is completed* Grid refreshed at end of jobBug 175357 - Print/Reprint job lock: Should not be an expiry on a print check lock for payment when its a job lock ---------------------------------------------------------------------- Get the most recent job-------------------------------------------------------------------- DECLARE @job asintSET @job = (SELECTTOP (1) JOB_QUEUE_UNO FROM APE_JOB_QUEUE ORDERBY JOB_QUEUE_UNO DESC)--SET @job = 3032---------------------------------------------------------------------- Job-------------------------------------------------------------------- SELECT'JOB'[JOB],j.JOB_QUEUE_UNO,j.JOB_PARAMETER_UNO,j.JOB_TYPE,j.JOB_STATUS,UPDATE_MESSAGE,j.TOTAL_ITEMS,j.PROCESSED_ITEMS,FAILED_ITEMS,ERROR_COUNT,j.INITIATED_BY, IS_REVIEWED,IS_CANCELLED,DATEDIFF(mi,j.INITIATED_DATE,j.LAST_MODIFIED)[Process Mins],j.INITIATED_DATE,j.LAST_MODIFIEDFROM APE_JOB_QUEUE j WHERE j.JOB_QUEUE_UNO = @job --AND JOB_TYPE = 'PAYPRTCH'ORDER BY j.JOB_QUEUE_UNO DESC  ---------------------------------------------------------------------- Parameters--------------------------------------------------------------------SELECT jp.* FROM APE_JOB_PARAMETER jpLEFTJOIN APE_JOB_QUEUE j ON j.JOB_PARAMETER_UNO = jp.JOB_PARAMETER_UNOWHERE j.JOB_QUEUE_UNO = @job---------------------------------------------------------------------- PAYMENT ALERTS-------------------------------------------------------------------- SELECTDISTINCT'ALERTS'[ALERTS],a.SOURCE_TYPE,a.SOURCE_UNO,chq.REQUEST_NUM,a.MESSAGE_KEY,a.MESSAGE_CONTEXT,a.MESSAGE_INTERNAL,a.JOB_QUEUE_UNO, a.JOB_ALERT_UNO,a.ALERT_LEVEL,a.CREATE_DATEFROM APE_JOB_ALERT aLEFTJOIN APE_JOB_ALERT j ON j.JOB_QUEUE_UNO = a.JOB_QUEUE_UNOLEFTJOIN APT_CHECK chq ON a.SOURCE_UNO = chq.TRAN_UNO AND a.SOURCE_TYPE ='PAY'LEFTJOIN APT_INVOICE inv ON a.SOURCE_UNO = inv.TRAN_UNO AND a.SOURCE_TYPE ='INV'WHERE a.JOB_QUEUE_UNO = @jobORDERBY a.JOB_QUEUE_UNO DESC,a.SOURCE_UNO--, a.ALERT_UNO DESC || Step 5: StepsCreate a volume of payments so you can see the multiple processing steps display in  the recent activities grid | Expected: The two processing steps are:Pre processingPrinting or Reprinting || Step 6: Cancel JobCreate a volume of payments so you can see the multiple processing steps display in  the recent activities grid | Expected: Job is canceled* Job status = X* Jobs stops processing* There are no orphaned locks when job is stopped* Grid refreshed at end of job

Title: Jobs: Print/Reprint Check Payments - Unlock bank early Client Side
Steps: Step 1: Note: 821 uses a config value but from 822, there is a new flag column in TBM_FMT_CH that is checkedNote: This was introduced for Ogletree due to their print jobs taking a long time. The bank lock was holding up other jobs as all their offices use the same bank. It should only be used when NOT using pre printed check stationery || Step 2: Set  Client Side printing for Accounts Payable to True Expert Admin | System |Printer Settings | Client Side Printing || Step 3: Pre req data Check format 1Pre-Numbered Stationery = NAdmin | Account Payable | Accounts Payable Options | Check Formats Check format 2Pre-Numbered Stationery = Y Check format 3Pre-Numbered Stationery = '' Bank 1- Uses format 1 (set via entity manager in the bank's account payable tab)- Has check numbers register (set via entity manager in the banks's register checks tab) Bank 2- Uses format 2- Has check numbers register  Bank 3- Uses format 3- Has check numbers register | Expected: --------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- All Banks with formats, printers and office-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------SELECT b.BANK_CODE,b.ACCT_TYPE,b.CURRENCY_CODE,b.OFFC,o.COMPANY_CODE,b.INACTIVE[Bank Inactive],b.SHORT_NAME,b.ASSIGN_WIRE_NUMBER,b.AUTO_WIRE_NUM,TREG_BANK,USE_TRST_EFT,b.CH_FORMAT_UNO,cf.FORMAT_CODE[Check Format],b.TEST_FORMAT_UNO,cf.PRINT_ALL_PAGES,cf.INACTIVE[Chq Format Inactive],cf.FILENAME[Check File],b.RA_FORMAT_UNO,ra.FORMAT_CODE[Remittance Format],ra.INACTIVE[Rem Format Inactive],ra.FILENAME[Remittance File],b.RF_FORMAT_UNO,rf.FORMAT_CODE[Receipt Format],b.RF_TEST_FORMAT,rf.INACTIVE[Rct Format Inactive],rf.FILENAME[Receipt File],b.ALLOW_CHECK_PRINTER_SELECTION, pr1.PRINTER_UNO,pr1.PRINTER_ID[Check Printer], pr1.NETWORK_PATH [Check printer path],pr2.PRINTER_UNO,pr2.PRINTER_ID[Remit Printer], pr2.NETWORK_PATH [Remit printer path]--,b.*FROM TBM_BANK bLEFT JOIN TBM_FMT_CH cf ON b.CH_FORMAT_UNO = cf.FORMAT_UNOLEFT JOIN TBM_FMT_RA ra ON b.RA_FORMAT_UNO = ra.FORMAT_UNOLEFT JOIN TBM_FMT_RF rf ON b.RF_FORMAT_UNO = rf.FORMAT_UNOLEFT JOIN CMS_PRINTER pr1 ON b.CH_PRINTER_UNO = pr1.PRINTER_UNO LEFT JOIN CMS_PRINTER pr2 ON b.RF_PRINTER_UNO = pr2.PRINTER_UNO JOIN HBL_OFFICE o ON b.OFFC = o.OFFC_CODE --------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- AP Type's bank and company-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------SELECT typ.APTYPE_CODE,typ.APTYPE_DESC,typ.BANK_CODE,b.CURRENCY_CODE,o.OFFC_CODE,o.COMPANY_CODEFROM APL_APTYPE typJOIN TBM_BANK b ON Typ.BANK_CODE = b.BANK_CODEJOIN HBL_OFFICE o ON b.OFFC = o.OFFC_CODE || Step 4: Use pre-number stationery = N  1. Create and release 2 payments- Bank 12. Select both payment from the grid3. Print and reprint checks | Expected: Bank is unlocked early Note: Using sql profilter. Title: Jobs: Payment Schedule - Print/Reprint Check Payments  - Unlock bank early Client Side

pr2.PRINTER_UNO JOIN HBL_OFFICE o ON b.OFFC = o.OFFC_CODE --------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- AP Type's bank and company-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------SELECT typ.APTYPE_CODE,typ.APTYPE_DESC,typ.BANK_CODE,b.CURRENCY_CODE,o.OFFC_CODE,o.COMPANY_CODEFROM APL_APTYPE typJOIN TBM_BANK b ON Typ.BANK_CODE = b.BANK_CODEJOIN HBL_OFFICE o ON b.OFFC = o.OFFC_CODE || Step 4: Start job from payment scheduleSchedule has multiple items | Expected: Job runs* Local notification sent so notification form displays * User lock exists on schedule header- lock owner =  S- expiry = NULL* Job starts processing- Job status = R * Schedule header user lock removed* Schedule header job lock applied - lock owner =  B- expiry = NULL- reason = Locked for printing* Bank is locked at the start of a job- Lock Owner = B- expiry = NULL - reason = Printing Checks* All items are locked at the start of the job- lock type =  B- expiry = 20- reason = Printing* Each item is unlocked once its been processed (changed in 822 to unlock at end of job)* Bank is unlocked* Item locks are removed (as from 822)* Schedule header job lock removed * User lock applied to schedule header - lock owner =  S- expiry = NULL - reason = Opened by user* Service sends notifications to notification form and recent activity grid* All selected items processed* Job status = C when completed* There are no orphaned item locks when job is completed ---------------------------------------------------------------------- Get the most recent job-------------------------------------------------------------------- DECLARE @job asintSET @job = (SELECTTOP (1) JOB_QUEUE_UNO FROM APE_JOB_QUEUE ORDERBY JOB_QUEUE_UNO DESC)--SET @job = 3032---------------------------------------------------------------------- Job-------------------------------------------------------------------- SELECT'JOB'[JOB],j.JOB_QUEUE_UNO,j.JOB_PARAMETER_UNO,j.JOB_TYPE,j.JOB_STATUS,UPDATE_MESSAGE,j.TOTAL_ITEMS,j.PROCESSED_ITEMS,FAILED_ITEMS,ERROR_COUNT,j.INITIATED_BY, IS_REVIEWED,IS_CANCELLED,DATEDIFF(mi,j.INITIATED_DATE,j.LAST_MODIFIED)[Process Mins],j.INITIATED_DATE,j.LAST_MODIFIEDFROM APE_JOB_QUEUE j WHERE j.JOB_QUEUE_UNO = @job --AND JOB_TYPE = 'PAYPRTCH'ORDER BY j.JOB_QUEUE_UNO DESC  ---------------------------------------------------------------------- Parameters--------------------------------------------------------------------SELECT jp.* FROM APE_JOB_PARAMETER jpLEFTJOIN APE_JOB_QUEUE j ON j.JOB_PARAMETER_UNO = jp.JOB_PARAMETER_UNOWHERE j.JOB_QUEUE_UNO = @job---------------------------------------------------------------------- PAYMENT ALERTS-------------------------------------------------------------------- SELECTDISTINCT'ALERTS'[ALERTS],a.SOURCE_TYPE,a.SOURCE_UNO,chq.REQUEST_NUM,a.MESSAGE_KEY,a.MESSAGE_CONTEXT,a.MESSAGE_INTERNAL,a.JOB_QUEUE_UNO, a.JOB_ALERT_UNO,a.ALERT_LEVEL,a.CREATE_DATEFROM APE_JOB_ALERT aLEFTJOIN APE_JOB_ALERT j ON j.JOB_QUEUE_UNO = a.JOB_QUEUE_UNOLEFTJOIN APT_CHECK chq ON a.SOURCE_UNO = chq.TRAN_UNO AND a.SOURCE_TYPE ='PAY'LEFTJOIN APT_INVOICE inv ON a.SOURCE_UNO = inv.TRAN_UNO AND a.SOURCE_TYPE ='INV'WHERE a.JOB_QUEUE_UNO = @jobORDERBY a.JOB_QUEUE_UNO DESC,a.SOURCE_UNO--, a.ALERT_UNO DESC || Step 5: Start job from payment gridSchedule has multiple items | Expected: Job runs* Local notification sent so notification form displays * Job starts processing- Job status = R * User lock applied to schedule header - lock owner =  S- expiry = NULL - reason = Opened by user* Schedule header user lock removed * Schedule header job lock applied - lock owner =  B- expiry = NULL- reason = Locked for printing* Bank is locked at the start of a job- Lock Owner = B- expiry = NULL - reason = Printing Checks* All items are locked at the start of the job- lock type =  B- expiry = 20- reason = Printing* Each item is unlocked once its been processed (changed in 822 to unlock at end of job)* Bank is unlocked* Item locks are removed (as from 822)* Schedule header job lock removed this got unlocked before the items did  * Service sends notifications to notification form and recent activity grid* All selected items processed* Job status = C when completed* There are no orphaned item locks when job is completed* Grid refreshed at end of job || Step 6: Cancel JobCreate a volume of payments so you can see the multiple processing steps display in  the recent activities grid | Expected: Job is canceled* Job status = X* Jobs stops processing* There are no orphaned locks when job is stopped* Grid refreshed at end of job

Title: Performance - Print Checks in Payment Schedule Client Side
Steps: Step 1: Note: Due to the restricted number of chrs that were able to be passed to a URL, this job failed from the schedule. Fixed in 822 and 821 EX0007 || Step 2: Set  Client Side printing for Accounts Payable to True Expert Admin | System |Printer Settings | Client Side Printing || Step 3: 2000 Payments with 1 invoice - all invoices are for check payments- all invoices are on seperate payments1. Open the schedule2. Print the checksRemember to select the NUL printer | Expected: Performance environment Expecting somewhere in the region of 30/32 mins ? mins - using verson 822.EX00081/12/2021 823.EX10 - Group performance testing on Jones Day's DB (Aug'25) (500 payments) - 13 mins 47 secs Note: Printing job failed due to printer error. Reported in the doc provided by John Lee

Title: Performance - Print Checks Client Side
Steps: Step 1: Set  Client Side printing for Accounts Payable to True Expert Admin | System |Printer Settings | Client Side Printing || Step 2: Make sure actual printing is turned off or select a fake printer from the network | Expected: EXEC SECURITY.SetContextByName ''SELECT n.Path,n.Name,v.Content,v.Scope,v.UserOrGroupDisplayName,v.Id FROM Configuration.ConfigName n INNER JOIN Configuration.ConfigValue v ON n.Id = v.NameIdWHERE Path LIKE 'Technical.Applications.ExpertAccountsPayable.Options%'AND NAME = 'PrintingEnabled' || Step 3: Print checks 2000 with 1 invoice (with 1 gl and 1 disb)1. From grid, Select none2. Select Print3. Add items4. Print Checks | Expected: Performance Environment Expecting somewhere in the region of 30 minsNote: The times are much more than expected and we have an existing bug, however the CS printing runs need looked at Bug 205850 - Payment Print Checks: Performance issuesClient side introduced at 822 EX0008  mins - using version 822.EX0008 1/12/2021 Print failure - 'The Request is not supported'123 mins - using version 822.EX0008 3/12/2021 124 mins - using version 822.EX0008 3/12/2021

Title: AP - Misc bug items with no specific test cases or just part of a larger test case
Steps: Step 1: Bug 255220 - Save button is enabled during Payment fetch Repro Steps 1Save payment, close payment. Reopen payment from grid. Easier to see when using Fiddler slow mode Repro steps 21. Payment ready for posting2. Change the tax included to Y or NThe save becomes enabled3. SaveThe save becomes disabled then becomes enabled and stays enabled until you click another field or outside the app | Expected: Save button is disabled || Step 2: Bug 254844 - Saving Detail line is editable when double clicking 1. Use fiddler to run modem speed2. Create  and save an invoice. 2. Add detail line, waiting for detail line to begin saving. Once it starts saving (shown by the spinner), then double click and change one of the values (E.G. Amount) then tab out of the cell. out of sync with the database value. | Expected: Value displayed on the form matches the saved DB value || Step 3: Bug 254810 - Saving Payment Trust Transaction does not run Trust Transaction rules - set up a rule under the AP > Detail Validations > Trust Payment Validation rule point- I set up the rule to just return a warning on save of the detail line- create a payment - selecting a trust bank as the paying bank- add a trust detail line to the payment | Expected: Rule is run on save || Step 4: Bug 251387 - Saving detail line does not occur if detail line save is in progress Run fiddler and set to modem speed 1. After editing a detail line (A) in line, wait until save occurs (default is 3 seconds). 2. After the save begins, quickly edit another detail line(B) After the save has complete, the invoice will be fetched and the screen will show that everything has been saved and there are no changes. 3. Close the invoice and reopen it again. | Expected: Line B is saved with the new value || Step 5: Bug 251110 - Save buttons enabled on a non dirty disb details form 1. Enter an invoice or payment2. Create a disbursement detail line and save it. 3. Reopen the disbursement detail line | Expected: Save buttons are not enabled || Step 6: Bug 277074 - The Bypass tax payment and tax amount did not dirty the formOpen a payment, created in Check request app, in Expert AP where Payee type is Miscellaneous (M) with status Incomplete (I) Note: Also refer to related bugs:274774 - Auto-calculated tax value in the AP Payment workflow is incorrect. This stops the completion of the Accounting Review step with error message 277128 - Update dialog message for Bypass Tax Validation | Expected: 1. Form is dirty.2. Enabled buttons are Save, Save & Close, Close & Add, Close, Delete.3.Warning message appears on the smart form, 'Bypass Tax Validation is selected in Miscellaneous Check Request. Verify payment and tax amounts.

Title: Recurring Invoice: Alerts removed when data fixed
Steps: Step 1: Recurring Invoice1. Create a recurring invoice with its first date and last date being today2. Add a line item to balance3. Set Generation method to Manual and save4. Generate the next invoice5. Change a field and save the recurring invoice againAn error will be created in APT_MESSAGE6. Change the last invoice date to something that would be after the Next Invoice Date (i.e. a month or two later) and save. | Expected: Record saved and error message removed- Message row removed from APT_MESSAGE- Alert no longer displays

Title: Invoice Edit - Alerts removed when data fixed

Create an invoice with a temporary vendor and save itAn error will be created in APT_MESSAGE2. Change the temporary vendor to a real vendor and save | Expected: Record saved and error message removed- Message row removed from APT_MESSAGE- Alert no longer displays

Title: Payment - Alerts removed when data fixed

Fix the error by changing the amount5. Save | Expected: Record saved and error message removed- Message row removed from APT_MESSAGE- Alert no longer displays

Title: Invoice Items - Disbursement: Save validation
Steps: Step 1: Pre-Reqs A Client/Matter/Vendor which we can modify.Otherwise you will need to do the following in Expert Entity Managerfilling in required fields:- Create a new Client to attach a matter to- Create a new Matter which we will modify in following steps so you will need to know the matter uno    UPDATE TBM_MATTER     SET ALLOW_DISB = 'Y' -- Allow Disbursements    WHERE MATTER_UNO = YOUR_MATTER_UNO_HERE- Create a new Vendor. || Step 2: Matter allows Soft Disbursements only 1. Create a new Vendor Payment and fill in required fields2. Add a disbursement detail line to the Payment.3. Fill in required fields.4. Before saving set Matter to only allows only soft disbursements:    UPDATE TBM_MATTER     SET ALLOW_DISB = 'S' -- Only allow soft Disbursements    WHERE MATTER_UNO = YOUR_MATTER_UNO_HERE5. Click Save & Close and a validation error should appear on the detail line. Bug: 206354 - Can't set the allow disb to Hard or Soft for a matter SELECT m.CLNT_MATT_CODE,m.MATTER_UNO,m.STATUS_CODE,tm.ALLOW_DISB,tm.* FROM TBM_MATTER tmJOIN HBM_MATTER m on tm.MATTER_UNO = m.MATTER_UNOWHERE m.CLNT_MATT_CODE ='' | Expected: Error:  DISBDETAIL_CM_NOTAUTH_HARDThe CLient/Matter combination is not authorized to have hard disbursements || Step 3: Matter does not allow Disbursements 1. You may use the same Payments above, or create a new one. 2. Set the Matter to allow disbursements    UPDATE TBM_MATTER     SET ALLOW_DISB = 'Y' -- Allow Disbursements    WHERE MATTER_UNO = YOUR_MATTER_UNO_HERE2. Add a New Disbursement3, Fill in the required fields4. Set the Matter so it does not allow Disbursements    UPDATE TBM_MATTER     SET ALLOW_DISB = 'N' -- Do not allow Disbursements    WHERE MATTER_UNO = YOUR_MATTER_UNO_HERE5. Save and Close the Disbursement | Expected: Error:  DISBDETAIL_CM_NOAUTHDISBThe Client/Matter combination is not authorized to have disbursements || Step 4: Matter is inactiveIn Expert Entity Manager1. Matters | Matter | Details | Matter DetailsEnsure that the Active flag can be edited and is set to Active. If it cannot check that no closing date is set. You may need to ensure that all disbursements that reference this matter are deleted before saving.In Expert Accounts Payable2, Create a new Payment or use the existing Payment and add a new Disbursement detail line.3. Fill in required fields.In Expert Entity Manager4. Set the Matter Active flag to Inactive (unchecked) and Save.In Expert Accounts Payable5. Click Save & Close on the Disbursement | Expected: Error: DISBDETAIL_CM_INACTIVEThis Client/Matter combination is inactive. || Step 5: Client Entity Type is invalidIn SQL Server Management Studio1. Ensure the Client Entity Type of the Client you are using on Disbursements is set to 'C' or 'F'.    UPDATE CXV_CLIENT    SET SET_ENTITY_TYPE = 'C' -- Client    WHERE CLIENT_UNO = YOUR_CLIENT_UNO_HERE In Expert Accounts Payable2, Create a new Payment or use the existing Payment and add a new Disbursement detail line.3. Fill in required fields.In SQL Server Management Studio4. Ensure the Client Entity Type of the Client you are using on Disbursements is set to 'C' or 'F'.    UPDATE CXV_CLIENT    SET SET_ENTITY_TYPE = 'B' -- Billing Payor    WHERE CLIENT_UNO = YOUR_CLIENT_UNO_HEREIn Expert Accounts Payable5. Click Save & Close on the Disbursement | Expected: Error: DISBDETAIL_CM_INACTIVEThis Client/Matter combination is inactive. || Step 6: Authorizing Employee is invalidAuthorising employee can be set at client or matter level. As this is at matter level, if you set a different employee at both client and matter level, either is a valid authorizer. If one is not set then any employee can authorise otherwise is limited to those setDECLARE @clientmattercode as varchar (50) = 'TST1.1'DECLARE @matter as int = (SELECT MATTER_UNO FROM HBM_MATTER WHERE CLNT_MATT_CODE = @clientmattercode)DECLARE @client as int = (SELECT CLIENT_UNO FROM HBM_MATTER WHERE CLNT_MATT_CODE = @clientmattercode)SELECT TCA1.CLIENT_UNO,TCA1.MATTER_UNO,TCA1.ROW_UNO,TCA1.EMPL_UNO , emp.EMPLOYEE_NAMEFROM TBM_CLMAT_AUEMP TCA1 JOIN HBM_PERSNL emp on TCA1.EMPL_UNO = emp.EMPL_UNOWHERE TCA1.MATTER_UNO = @matter OR TCA1.CLIENT_UNO = @clientThis needs some workIn Expert Accounts Payable1, Create a new Payment or use the existing Payment and add a new Disbursement detail line.2. Set Authorizing Employee to Employee 1 and fill in required fields.In Expert Entity Manager3. Clients | Client | Other Employees | Authorizing EmployeesAdd Employee 2 to the Authorizing Employees list.In Expert Accounts Payable4. Click Save and Close. | Expected: Error: DISBDETAIL_AU_NOAUTH The Authorized By employee for this client or matter. || Step 7: Disbursement Date is outside the Matter Open/Close Date and Allow Disb Before Matter Open is false (unchecked).In Expert Accounts Payable1, Create a new Payment or use the existing Payment and add a new Disbursement detail line.  2. Set the Date field to a value before the Open date you will set in step 3.In SQL Server Management Studio3. Set the Open and Close dates with the following SQL.    UPDATE HBM_MATTER    SET OPEN_DATE = 'YYYY/MM/DD', CLOSE_DATE = 'YYYY/MM/DD'    WHERE MATTER_UNO = -- YOUR MATTER UNO HERE  NOTE: Setting a close date in Entity Manager will automatically set the Matter to inactive and is not appropriate for this test.In Expert Administration4, Disbursements | Disbursement Options | Firm OptionsEnsure "Allow Disb Before Matter Open" flag is unchecked.In Expert Accounts Payable5. Click Save and Close.Repeat this step with a disbursement date after the Close date you set in step 3. | Expected: Error: DISBDETAIL_TRAN_NOTWITHINThe TRANSACTION DATE is not within the Client/Matter's OPEN and CLOSE dates || Step 8: Disbursement Date is greater than the Matters Close Date and Allow Disb Before Matter Open is True (checked)In Expert Accounts Payable1, Create a new Payment or use the existing Payment and add a new Disbursement detail line.  2. Set the Date field to a value before the Open date you will set in step 3.In SQL Server Management Studio3. Set the Open and Close dates with the following SQL.    UPDATE HBM_MATTER    SET OPEN_DATE = 'YYYY/MM/DD', CLOSE_DATE = 'YYYY/MM/DD'    WHERE MATTER_UNO = -- YOUR MATTER UNO HERE  NOTE: Setting a close date in Entity Manager will automatically set the Matter to inactive and is not appropriate for this test. In Expert Administration4, Disbursements | Disbursement Options | Firm OptionsEnsure "Allow Disb Before Matter Open" flag is checked.In Expert Accounts Payable5. Click Save and Close. | Expected: Error: DISBDETAIL_TRAN_NOTLESSThe TRANSACTION DATE is not less than the Client/Matter's CLOSE date || Step 9: Transaction Date is outside the Employee Hire/Terminate DateIn Expert Accounts Payable1, Create a new Payment or use the existing Payment and add a new Disbursement detail line.  2. Set the Date field to a value before the hire date of the employee you will set in step 3.Set the Employee field to the employee you will modify in step 3.In SQL Server Management Studio3. Set the Hire and Terminate dates with the following SQL.    UPDATE HBM_PERSNL    SET HIRE_DATE = 'YYYY/MM/DD', TERMINATE_DATE = 'YYYY/MM/DD'    WHERE EMPLOYEE_CODE = -- YOUR EMPLOYEE UNO HERE  NOTE: Setting a terminate date in Entity Manager will automatically set the Employee to inactive and is not appropriate for this test.In Expert Accounts Payable4, Click Save and AddRepeat this step with a disbursement date after the Terminate date you set in step 3. | Expected: Error: DISBDETAIL_DATE_NOVALIDFOREMP The TRANSACTION DATE is not within this employee's HIRE and TERMINATION datesError: DISBDETAIL_DATE_NOVALIDFOREMP The TRANSACTION DATE is not within this employee's HIRE and TERMINATION datesBug 234244 - Employees without previous hire dates are always considered in a Disbursements Transaction Date || Step 10: Authorizing Employee is inactive 1. Matter has authorised employee set up2. Ensure you have used the employee previous to authorise a disb so that the employee is on the MRU list3. Create a payment4. Select to add a disb- enter the mandatory data- select the authorize by employee5. Inactivate the employee record6. Save & Close the Disbursement window. | Expected: Error: Inactive employee with code .... || Step 11: Task plan and phase/task not selectedNote: Add a plan to the matter via entity manager under the Time and Billing | Billing | Expected: Error:  WESSTUFF_PHUNO_REQUIRED || Step 12: Phase/task is not valid for matter plan codeNote: Add a plan to the matter via entity manager under the Time and Billing | Billing | Expected: Error: WESSTUFF_NOVALIDATE || Step 13: Disbursement Code not available1. Select allowed Disbursement codes in Entity Manager under Vendor tab2. Make new payment using the vendor that has limited disbursement codes3. Make a new disbursment detail line 4. In Enitity Manager, remove the disbursement code that you used in the invoice5. Resave the invoice in AP | Expected: Error: DISBURSEMENTAVAILABLE || Step 14: Max amount1. Add payment with the max base amount (99999999999999) then Save & Add the disb2. Repeat for a second disbSave fails in the background3. Cancel  the disb formFail to save error icon is displayed4. Reopen the the disb to the error | Expected: Error: Max amount reached Notes: Seems that the max allowed has been increased but not sure this is correct tho. Not failing in AP but not sure the ramifications in GL || Step 15: Vendor Limited Disb types1. Add limited accounts for a vendor (in entity manager)2. Add GL item3. Check that accounts are limited to those set in entity manager and choose one. Save & Close4. Remove the account it in Entity Manager and save there.5. Edit the GL item and save- amount | Expected: Error: Account is not valid for this vendor || Step 16: Vendor Limited Disb Types - change of vendor1. Add limited accounts for a vendor (in entity manager)2. Add GL item3. Check that accounts are limited to those set in entity manager and choose one. Save & Close4. Remove the account it in Entity Manager and save there.5. Edit the GL item and save- amount | Expected: Error: Account is not valid for this vendor

Title: Performance - Add Multiple Invoices into Employee Payment Schedule
Steps: Step 1: Preq: Setup an employee with bank account (In entity manager) || Step 2: Pre req data Insert 3000 rows into HBA_NAME_BANK_ACCOUNT | Expected: Sql Used to populate bulk data declare @counter int = 0WHILE @counter <3000BEGIN INSERT INTO HBA_NAME_BANK_ACCOUNT (BANK_ACCOUNT_UNO,NAME_UNO,BANK_CODE, PAYMENT_TYPE_CODE,IS_DEFAULT,SEGMENT_1,SEGMENT_2,SEGMENT_3,SEGMENT_4,SEGMENT_5,LAST_MODIFIED)VALUES ((SELECT LASTKEY + 1 FROM CMS_UNIQUE_KEYS WHERE TBNAME = 'HBA_NAME_BANK_ACCOUNT') ,Insert name_uno here, 'BUSD','EB','N','888','888','77','00','', getdate())UPDATE CMS_UNIQUE_KEYS SET LASTKEY = LASTKEY + 1 WHERE TBNAME = 'HBA_NAME_BANK_ACCOUNT'set @counter = @counter + 1 END--------------------------------------------------Will need to update the NAME_UNO, BANK_CODE, PAYMENT_TYPE_CODE on above sql script || Step 3: Launch Expense-Create and approve an employee invoice || Step 4: Launch AP1. Payment schedule--Create a new employee payment schedule--Fill in the header2. Click add multiple invoices--Put in employee ID || Step 5: Search | Expected: Search should working and return all the results

Title: Invoice Import- Duplicate invoices
Steps: Step 1: Preq: Test case: 1. Create a new mapping with invoice header-with Vendor code, Invoice Number, Invoice Date, Invoice Amount || Step 2: Import duplicate invoices with real vendors Click Invoice Import from list screen->Select the attached files->Choose an existing mapping which created in Preq->Next || Step 3: Import | Expected: - Only one invoice row has been imported-The first row will be imported- There is alert for job shows duplicate invoice || Step 4: Import multiple invoices including one with the same invoice number already been imported Click Invoice Import from list screen->Select the attached files->Choose an existing mapping which created in Preq->Next || Step 5: Import | Expected: -Only the new invoice is imported- There is alert for job shows duplicate invoice || Step 6: Import duplicate invoices with temp vendors Click Invoice Import from list screen->Select the attached files || Step 7: Create mapping for temp vendor-> Click create a new mapping profile, Next->Profile Name: Temp vendor. Profile Type: User Profile, Next->Select Temp Vendor Name, Invoice Date, Invoice Amount, Currency Code, Payment term, AP type, Jurisdiction, 1099 Type-> Next || Step 8: Click Invoice Import from list screen->Select the attached files->Choose an existing mapping which created in Preq->Next || Step 9: Import | Expected: -Both of the temp vendor invoices are imported- There are validation errors on the list grid on the search screen-There are validation errors on the header on detail screen-There is job alert shows invoice imported with errors || Step 10: Change the temp vendor name to real vendor and offset to GL | Expected: Release and Post is enabled

Title: Smoke test AP: GL - ODP and employee
Steps: Step 1: Needs UI tests but also check what is covered by integrations tests. It may be that need to simplify this || Step 2: Note: this seems like a more of a granular test but any small change may adversely affect the outcome and impact on AP, AR and GL appsNote: these test are all using account, not planNote: Need to run this against both payment and invoiceNote: This was written for AR. AP and GL may not have the same UI fixes so you may see some differences that need to be fixed | Expected: https://aderant.sharepoint.com/RD/GL/GL%20Wiki/Journal%20Detail%20-%20Office%2c%20Department%2c%20Profit%20Center%2c%20Employee%20Default.aspx?OR=Teams-HL&CT=1629757463791 || Step 3: Pre req employee on the parm table- Employee's Office/Dept/Prof centre don't match the defaults on in the parms table OFFC = TLHDEPT = ADMPROF = FIRM Employee2 e.g. NZ11- Not the default employee on the parm table- Employee's Office/Dept/Prof centre don't match employee 1OFFC = PNSDEPT = CUSTPROF = SIP SELECT changing the settings Defaulting from employee  UPDATE CMS_OPTION set FLAG_VALUE ='Y'WHERE OPTION_CODE ='JE_ODPC_DEF' Using Multi office, Dept, Prof UPDATE GLM_PARMS SET MULTI_OFFC ='Y'UPDATE required = YHas only one Department matching employee 1Has only one Prof Centre matching employee 1 Account 4 e.g. ACCT2Dept required = YProf centre required = YEmpl required = NHas only one Department Has only one Prof Centre  Account 5 e.g. ACCT6Dept required = YProf centre required = YEmpl required = YOffices - both have different dept/prof linkHas office 1 that has 1 Department and 1 Title: Payment Items - Invoice: bill payment required with balanced currency
Steps: Step 1: [Covered by integration tests] || Step 2: System pre reqs New Rates Balanced Currency = YRate: 102.562534489200Reciprocal: 0.00975014906739900Note: Can be an existing currency or a new currency Classic | Omnicurrency Configuration | Currency Maintenance: for the balanced currency flagClassic | Omnicurrency Configuration | Exchange Rate Maintenance: for the rate || Step 3: AP Pre reqs  Admin | Accounts Payable | Accounts payable options | Firm options - Withhold disbursement cash receipt until vendor is paid (HOLD_DISB) = Off- Withhold disbursement cash receipt until check is reconciled (HOLD_DISB_CHECK_RECONCILE) = Off- Hold Invoice for Full Bill Payment = Off SELECT INV_PAYFULL_RELEAS,HOLD_DISB_CHECK_RECONCILE,HOLD_DISB FROM APM_PARMSUPDATE APM_PARMS SET INV_PAYFULL_RELEAS ='N',HOLD_DISB_CHECK_RECONCILE ='N',HOLD_DISB ='Y'--DefaultUPDATE APM_PARMS SET INV_PAYFULL_RELEAS ='N',HOLD_DISB_CHECK_RECONCILE ='N',HOLD_DISB ='N'--Don't need full bill paidUPDATE APM_PARMS SET INV_PAYFULL_RELEAS ='Y',HOLD_DISB_CHECK_RECONCILE ='N',HOLD_DISB ='N'--Need full bill paid || Step 4: Create Invoice - AP app 1. New invoice- USD Vendor- $1002. Set Client Bill Payment Required = On- APT_INVOICE.BILL_PMT_REQD = Y3. Add a disb item4. Post the invoice | Expected: Invoice is posted || Step 5: Bill the disb - Billing app 1. Create a prebill for the matter that was used in the invoice's disbursement2. Prep the bill (can do a manual prep)3. Post the bill | Expected: Bill is posted with disb || Step 6: Change the New exchange rate - Classic app 1. Classic | Omnicurrency Configuration | Exchange Rate Maintenance2. Change the rate effective todayRate = 130Note: The change needs to be sufficient that it will create Z rows with a decent loss/gain | Expected: New exchange rate updated || Step 7: Pay the bill - AR app 1. Cash receipt2. Add payment- fully pay the bill3. Post the cash receipt | Expected: Bill paid ZR rows on BLH_PAID_DISB for the currency DRUNO will be < -1  SELECT BAL_DRUNO, * FROM TBL_CURRENCY WHERE CURRENCY_CODE = '' || Step 8: Add invoice to payment 1. Create a vendor payment for same vendor used on the invoice2. Add the invoice | Expected: Invoice added to payment Note: should NOT get this warning as the balanced rows should not be included when calcuting if the bill is fully paidWarning: Client disbursements have not been paid. Do you want to continue?INVPMT_UNPAIDDISB

Title: Quick Pay: bill payment required with balanced currency
Steps: Step 1: [Covered by integration tests] || Step 2: System pre reqs New Rate Balanced Currency = YRate: 102.562534489200Reciprocal: 0.00975014906739900Note: Can be an existing currency or a new currency Classic | Omnicurrency Configuration | Currency Maintenance: for the balanced currency flagClassic | Omnicurrency Configuration | Exchange Rate Maintenance: for the rate || Step 3: AP Pre reqs  Admin | Accounts Payable | Accounts payable options | Firm options - Withhold disbursement cash receipt until vendor is paid (HOLD_DISB) = Off- Withhold disbursement cash receipt until check is reconciled (HOLD_DISB_CHECK_RECONCILE) = Off- Hold Invoice for Full Bill Payment = Off SELECT INV_PAYFULL_RELEAS,HOLD_DISB_CHECK_RECONCILE,HOLD_DISB FROM APM_PARMSUPDATE APM_PARMS SET INV_PAYFULL_RELEAS ='N',HOLD_DISB_CHECK_RECONCILE ='N',HOLD_DISB ='Y'--DefaultUPDATE APM_PARMS SET INV_PAYFULL_RELEAS ='N',HOLD_DISB_CHECK_RECONCILE ='N',HOLD_DISB ='N'--Don't need full bill paidUPDATE APM_PARMS SET INV_PAYFULL_RELEAS ='Y',HOLD_DISB_CHECK_RECONCILE ='N',HOLD_DISB ='N'--Need full bill paid || Step 4: Create Invoice - AP app 1. New invoice- USD Vendor2. Set Client Bill Payment Required = On- APT_INVOICE.BILL_PMT_REQD = Y3. Add a disb item4. Post the invoice | Expected: Invoice is posted || Step 5: Bill the disb - Billing app 1. Create a prebill for the matter that was used in the invoice's disbursement2. Prep the bill (can do a manual prep)3. Post the bill | Expected: Bill is posted with disb || Step 6: Change the exchange rate for your new rate - Classic app 1. Classic | Omnicurrency Configuration | Exchange Rate Maintenance2. Change the rate effective todayRate = 130Note: The change needs to be sufficient that it will create Z rows with a decent loss/gain | Expected: Exchange rate updated || Step 7: Pay the bill - AR app 1. Cash receipt2. Add payment- fully pay the bill3. Post the cash receipt | Expected: Bill paid ZR rows on BLH_PAID_DISB for the New currency DRUNO will be < -1  SELECT BAL_DRUNO, * FROM TBL_CURRENCY WHERE CURRENCY_CODE = '' || Step 8: Quick Pay the Invoice 1. Select Quick Pay | Expected: Invoice added to payment Payment created with invoice line item Note: should NOT get this warning as the balanced rows should not be included when calculating if the bill is fully paidWarning: Client disbursements have not been paid. Do you want to continue?INVPMT_UNPAIDDISB

Add a matter credit item- enter a value in the custom field- enter all other mandatory fields4. Post the payment5. Cancel to newPayment is canceled to new - all custom fields are copied to the new payment and items | Expected: Payment is canceled to new - all custom fields are copied to the new payment and items || Step 6: Process an employee wire payment 1. Create payment- enter a value in the custom field- enter all other mandatory fields2. Add an advance item- enter all mandatory fields3. Add an employee report item- enter all mandatory fields4. Post the payment5. Cancel to newPayment is canceled to new - all custom fields are copied to the new payment and items | Expected: Payment is canceled to new - all custom fields are copied to the new payment and itemsBug 235031 - AP Customization - Employee Invoice Payment Details Form - Custom field does not save the contents when posted and does not carry over to new when using the Cancel to New function || Step 7: Process an invoice1. Create invoice- enter a value in the custom field- enter all other mandatory fields2. Add a GL item- enter a value in the custom field- enter all other mandatory fields3. Update the fiscal year to 2012 on the summary table for the two employeesUPDATE APH_PERSNL_YEAR set FISCAL_YEAR = 2012 WHERE ROW_UNO IN () | Expected: Posted invoice with 2 employee FPCC items - Summary table APH_PERSNL_YEAR has a row for each employee for fiscal year 2012 || Step 5: Add invoice to payment and Post1. Quick pay the invoice2. Post the payment | Expected: Payment is posted - Summary table APH_PERSNL_YEAR has a row for each employee for fiscal year 2012 - Summary table APH_PERSNL_YEAR has a row for each employee for fiscal year 2014 || Step 6: Cancel payment1. Update the fiscal year to 2013 on the summary table for the two employees where fiscal year = 20142. Cancel the payment | Expected: Payment is canceled- Summary table APH_PERSNL_YEAR has a row for each employee for fiscal year 2012 - Summary table APH_PERSNL_YEAR has a row for each employee for fiscal year 2013 - Summary table APH_PERSNL_YEAR has a row for each employee for fiscal year 2014

Smoke Test AP: Imaging - check and remittance with client side printing on
Steps: Step 1: Note 1: Its important to run this test if any changes have been made to the printing process as the code for client side printing was added later and the flow of the code is different to CSP off || Step 2: Note 2: If you have an existing Expert Image Database and have rolled back your Expert database, you will need to clean out the image files in EI database otherwise you will have conflicts when you create new records in Expert that use the same reference and request numbers previously used and stored in the EI database. | Expected: Cannot be run in build pipeline currently || Step 3: General Pre ReqsClient side printing onAdmin | System | Printer settings | Client Side Printing || Step 4: Attached to Payment from the print check job1. New check Payment- enter mandatory fields 2. Add line item3. Print the check4. Run the Check loader job from Expert Imaging (The assumption is that if you are running this test case, you know how to run the expert image loader)5. View Image from the details form- from the view image ribbon button6. View image from the grid- from the paper clip | Expected: File can be viewedCheck Image Reference- Loader has copied the file From the source to EIDOCS\Checks\<month>- Loader has copied the reference to this file into the EI databaseSELECT*FROM EXPERTIMAGING.dbo.IMG_HEADERS WHERE TYPE_ID= 50 -- Payment check image || Step 5: Attached to Payment from the remittance job1. New EB Payment- enter mandatory fields 2. Add line item3. Print the remittance4. Run the Check loader job from Expert Imaging (The assumption is that if you are running this test case, you know how to run the expert image loader)5. View Image from the details form- from the view image ribbon button6. View image from the grid- from the paper clip | Expected: File can be viewedBug 268296 - BUG:  Remittance Advice PDF Files do not make it to Expert Image AP Payment Source path Fixed in 822 Ex0011Check Image Reference- Loader has copied the file From the source to EIDOCS\Checks\<month>- Loader has copied the reference to this file into the EI databaseSELECT*FROM EXPERTIMAGING.dbo.IMG_HEADERS WHERE TYPE_ID= 50 -- Payment check image

Title: Payment - Imaging: File copy - Imaging On/Off, Client side printing On/Off
Steps: Step 1: Note 1: Client side printing has different code for On versus Off and we've had issues with this in the copy to imaging source folder process - hense this test case || Step 2: Set Expert Image OnAdmin | Accounts Payable | Accounts Payable Setup | Document Management || Step 3: General Pre ReqsDocudraft:- folders- Views- templates- settingsPrinter Settings:UPDATE CMS_PRINTER SET NETWORK_PATH ='\\svfp301\PT_AKL_Development_01', DEVICE_NAME ='\\svfp301\PT_AKL_Development_01', PRINTER_DESC ='AK Dev 01'WHERE PRINTER_ID ='DEV01'UPDATE CMS_PRINTER SET NETWORK_PATH ='\\svfp301\PT_AKL_Reception_01',DEVICE_NAME ='\\svfp301\PT_AKL_Reception_01', PRINTER_DESC ='AK Recp 01'WHERE PRINTER_ID ='DEV02'Check formats e.g.UPDATE TBM_FMT_CH SETFILENAME='C:\CMS\81\Bin\CHKFMT01.RPT'WHERE FORMAT_CODE NOTIN ('CHK02','CHK03','CHK04','CHK05')UPDATE TBM_FMT_CH SETFILENAME='C:\CMS\81\Bin\CHKFMT02.RPT'WHERE FORMAT_CODE ='CHK02'UPDATE TBM_FMT_CH SETFILENAME='C:\CMS\81\Bin\CHKFMT02.RPT'WHERE FORMAT_CODE ='CHK03'UPDATE TBM_FMT_CH SETFILENAME='C:\CMS\81\Bin\CHKFMT02.RPT'WHERE FORMAT_CODE ='CHK04'UPDATE TBM_FMT_CH SETFILENAME='C:\CMS\81\Bin\CHKFMT02.RPT'WHERE FORMAT_CODE ='CHK05'UPDATE TBM_FMT_CH SETFILENAME='EXPERT_CHECK_FORMAT.docx', FORMAT_TYPE ='D'WHERE FORMAT_CODE ='BOTCHK'--BOTCHK was  C:\CMS\81\Bin\CHKFMT01.RPTOptions and parameters:UPDATE GLM_PARMS SET OVH_EMPL_UNO ='61'UPDATE CMS_OPTION SET FLAG_VALUE ='Y'WHERE OPTION_CODE ='JE_ODPC_DEF'UPDATE CMS_OPTION SET FLAG_VALUE ='Y'WHERE OPTION_CODE ='SALES_USE_TX'UPDATE APM_PARMS SET RECOV_CONT_REQD ='N'UPDATE CMS_OPTION SET FLAG_VALUE ='Y'WHERE OPTION_CODE ='1099_IN_USE'UPDATE TBM_BANK SET ASSIGN_WIRE_NUMBER ='Y',AUTO_WIRE_NUM ='Y'WHERE BANK_CODE ='BUSD'UPDATE TBL_TAX_BOOK SET ACCT_UNO = 127 WHERE BOOK = 1UPDATE CRM_PARMS SET TFR_CLNT_FIRM ='W'UPDATE APM_PARMS SETCUT_DATE ='2000-01-01 00:00:00.000',MIN_DATE ='2000-01-01 00:00:00.000',MAX_DATE ='2020-12-30 00:00:00.000'UPDATE CDM_PARMS SETMIN_DATE ='2000-04-01 00:00:00.000',MAX_DATE ='2022-05-30 00:00:00.000',CUT_DATE ='2012-05-01 00:00:00.000'UPDATE CRM_PARMS SETMIN_DATE ='2012-04-01 00:00:00.000',MAX_DATE ='2022-05-30 00:00:00.000',CUT_DATE ='2012-05-01 00:00:00.000' || Step 4: Print check - expert image ON, client side printing OFF1. Title: Check printing, Creating Electronic banking payment & Print remittances - Double partial posting
Steps: Step 1: Note: As the job process is quick, there is no time to check that the lock occurred so need to check using sql profilter: search for: sp_cmsmakelockcio & SP_CMSBREAKLOCKCIO || Step 2: Create 2 AP Vendor Invoices - Check & Electronic banking payment each || Step 3: Create Payment schedule for both the invoices (created above) || Step 4: Run Posting Manager in Classic to clear any back log of journals || Step 5: General | Expected: * Job created from grid no matter how many items selected || Step 6: Start job - Create Payment > run SQL server profiler > Print Payment (Check) or Create Bank file & Print Remittance > Post Payment | Expected: Job runs* Local notification sent so notification form displays * Job starts processing* Locking for a Check/ EB Payment (per sql profiler) - refer to attached screenshot* Updates APT_CHECK - refer to attached screenshot* There are no orphaned locks when job is completed* Grid refreshed at end of job

Title: Performance - Create EB Files from schedule
Steps: Step 1: Pre req data Vendor 1- Bank Account for bank that will be used on payments || Step 2: 2000 payments same vendor | Expected: Performance environment Load Bank File items grid Failed to load grid of items to process - using version 822 EX0011 9/5/2023 Bug 270886 - Performance: Loading check print, remittance print or bank file grids times out with system error so records can't be processed 822.Ex0011 Create Bank Files1 min - using version 82SP4 22/3/24823.EX10 - Group performance testing on Jones Day's DB (Aug'25) (Create EB file for 500 payments) - 20 secs || Step 3: 500 payments 3 vendors - Create EB file | Expected: CRT Performance Environment - Jones Day DB823.EX10 - Group performance testing (Aug'25) - 20 secs8250 - Group performance testing (Nov'25) -    1 min 20 secs || Step 4: 2000 payments same vendor Set fiddler on and similate modem speed | Expected: Local environment Load Bank File items grid Failed to load grid of items to process - using version 822 EX0011 9/5/2023 32 secs - using version PR 824/Master 28/6/2023Bug 270886 - Performance: Loading check print, remittance print or bank file grids times out with system error so records can't be processed 822.Ex0011 Create Bank Files

Title: Performance - Print Remittances from payment schedule
Steps: Step 1: Pre req data VendorDefault print preference = email || Step 2: 2000 EB with 1 invoice (invoices have 1 gl and 1 disb) - No email Note: Use the NUL printer | Expected: Performance Environment Load Print items grid Failed to load grid of items to process - using version 822 EX0011 9/5/2023 Bug 270886 - Performance: Loading check print, remittance print or bank file grids times out with system error so records can't be processed 822.Ex0011 Print remittances - no email. 72 mins - using 82SP4 (VMAZ824ITE) 22/3/24. || Step 3: 2000 EB with 1 invoice (invoices have 1 gl and 1 disb) - No email Set fiddler on and similate modem speedNote: Use the NUL printer | Expected: Local Environment Load Print items grid Failed to load grid of items to process - using version 822 EX0011 9/5/202333 secs - using version PR 824/Master 28/6/2023Bug 270886 - Performance: Loading check print, remittance print or bank file grids times out with system error so records can't be processed 822.Ex0011 Print remittances  - no email

Title: AP: Launching Expert Accounts Payable via Launcher > Expert Assistant
Steps: Step 1: Pre-requisite: Expert Assistant should be available in EA Pro to launch Expert Accounts Payable (customization required). || Step 2: Scenario:- After launching/getting ExpertAssistant via ExpertLauncher. When a user tried to launch AccountsPayable via Assistant, then exceptions would occur due to missing essential DLLs. || Step 3: Delete your C:\AderantExpert\<Environment>\Applications folder. || Step 4: Launch Expert Assistant 8.2.2 EX0011 via launcher (EA Pro) | Expected: Version 18.7.0 of the Aspose.Pdf.dll is downloaded locally when launching Expert Accounts Payable via launcher. || Step 5: Click on Action button > Click on Open Accounts Payable | Expected: Expert Accounts Payable Launches

Title: Payment Item - GL: ODP and employee
Steps: Step 1: Note: these test are all using account, not planNote: Need to run this against both payment and invoiceNote: This was written for AR. AP and GL may not have the same UI fixes so you may see some differences that need to be fixed | Expected: https://aderant.sharepoint.com/RD/GL/GL%20Wiki/Journal%20Detail%20-%20Office%2c%20Department%2c%20Profit%20Center%2c%20Employee%20Default.aspx?OR=Teams-HL&CT=1629757463791 || Step 2: Pre req data Payment- Vendor payment- Incomplete or Ready for ReleaseGLM_PARMS exampleDEF_OFFC = BUFOVH_DEPT = LITOVH_PROF = MAINOVH_EMPL_UNO = 61 (Baukova, Svetlana) Employee1 e.g. NZ10- Not the default employee on the parm table- Employee's Office/Dept/Prof centre don't match the defaults on in the parms table OFFC = TLHDEPT = ADMPROF = FIRM Employee2 e.g. NZ11- Not the default employee on the parm table- Employee's Office/Dept/Prof centre don't match employee 1OFFC = PSNDEPT = CUSTPROF = AUDEmployee3 e.g. 61 - Employee on the parms table- Has different OPP than parms to ensure values are picked up from parms and not this employeeOFFC = TORDEPT = AUDPROF = SIP SELECT MULTI_OFFC,USE_INTERBOOK,DEF_OFFC,USE_DEPT,OVH_DEPT,USE_PROF,OVH_PROF,OVH_EMPL_UNO,e.EMPLOYEE_NAME,*FROM GLM_PARMS parmLEFTJOIN HBM_PERSNL e ON parm.OVH_EMPL_UNO = e.EMPL_UNO || Step 3: Sql for changing the settings Defaulting from employee  UPDATE CMS_OPTION set FLAG_VALUE ='Y'WHERE OPTION_CODE ='JE_ODPC_DEF' Using Multi office, Dept, Prof UPDATE GLM_PARMS SET MULTI_OFFC ='Y'UPDATE GLM_PARMS SET USE_DEPT ='Y'UPDATE GLM_PARMS SET USE_PROF ='Y' | Expected: SELECT * FROM CMS_OPTION WHERE OPTION_CODE ='JE_ODPC_DEF'  SELECT MULTI_OFFC,USE_INTERBOOK,DEF_OFFC,USE_DEPT,OVH_DEPT,USE_PROF,OVH_PROF,OVH_EMPL_UNO,e.EMPLOYEE_NAME,*FROM GLM_PARMS parmLEFT JOIN HBM_PERSNL e ON parm.OVH_EMPL_UNO = e.EMPL_UNO || Step 4: Pre req account settings Note: Set up all accounts first otherwise if you just change settings on one account, you'll need to keep reopening the app to pick up the new settings Account 1 e.g. 40150Dept required = YProf centre required = YEmpl required = Y Account 2 e.g. 40120Dept required = NProf centre required = NEmpl required = N Account 3 e.g. ACCT1Dept required = YProf centre required = YEmpl required = YHas only one Department matching employee 1Has only one Prof Centre matching employee 1 Account 4 e.g. ACCT2Dept required = YProf centre required = YEmpl required = NHas only one Department Has only one Prof Centre Account 5 e.g. ACCT6Dept required = YProf centre required = YEmpl required = YOffices - both have different dept/prof linkHas office 1 that has 1 Department and 1 prof center matching employee 2Has office 2 that has 2 departments and 2 office | Expected: SELECT BOOK,SUBLEDGER,INACTIVE,ACCT_CODE,DEPT_REQD,PROF_REQD,EMPL_REQD--,* FROM GLM_CHART c WHERE BOOK = 1ORDER BY c.ACCT_CODE || Step 5: Default from employee: Use Offc/Dept/ProfitC Account Requires field entry - Title: Invoice - Edit and Save header when line items have existing error
Steps: Step 1: Note: This won't happen easily when the the data is entered via the UI but you can get errors more likely with the import or API. So for this test case we'll just poke the error in via sql || Step 2: Pre req set upInvoice - unposted- GL line item with error  e.g.IF NOT EXISTS (SELECT * FROM CMS_UNIQUE_KEYS WHERE TBNAME = 'APT_MESSAGE')BEGININSERT INTO [dbo].[CMS_UNIQUE_KEYS] ([TBNAME]) VALUES ('APT_MESSAGE')ENDINSERT INTO APT_MESSAGE (ROW_UNO,COMMAND_ID,SOURCE_TYPE,SOURCE_UNO,INVOICE_UNO,PARENT_TYPE,ADVANCE_UNO,MODULE_ID,MESSAGE,IS_FATAL,RULE_KEY,REASON,EMPL_UNO,OVERRIDE,OVERRIDE_EMPL_UNO,CREATED_DATE,SEVERITY,LAST_MODIFIED)VALUES((SELECT LASTKEY + 1 FROM CMS_UNIQUE_KEYS WHERE TBNAME = 'APT_MESSAGE'),'1E2AF15B-E5D9-4BA1-A408-F65304901383','AccountingJournalTransaction',529,1862,'Invoice',0,110070,'Test: AP_GL_ACCOUNT_SECURED$!$141$!$41140$!$1','Y',NULL,NULL,0,NULL,0,NULL,NULL,getdate()) UPDATE CMS_UNIQUE_KEYS SET LASTKEY = LASTKEY + 1 WHERE TBNAME = 'APT_MESSAGE' || Step 3: Save header edits only 822.Ex00111. Edit the invoice header e.g. amount2. Save | Expected: Invoice saves- Header is saved- GL line item is not saved as there are no changes- Erroe remains on the GL line item

Title: Payment Items - Employee Advance: Post and Cancel when multiple rows for different employees and no record for current fiscal year in the summary table
Steps: Step 1: Note: This test case is to ensure there are no primary key violations on the summary tables || Step 2: Pre req setupNote: Assuming that the fiscal year is 2014 as per the dacpac but if you're testing on a DB with different fiscal year, then change the value in the test steps to match your setup || Step 3: Pre req dataEmployee 1No row in APH_PERSNL_YEAREmployee 2No row in APH_PERSNL_YEAR | Expected: DELETE FROM APH_PERSNL_YEAR WHERE ROW_UNO IN ()SELECT y.EMPL_UNO,emp.EMPLOYEE_CODE,y.FISCAL_YEAR,y.FIRM_PAID_CC_AMT,y.LAST_MODIFIED,y.* FROM APH_PERSNL_YEAR y JOIN HBM_PERSNL emp ON y.EMPL_UNO = emp.EMPL_UNOorder by y.EMPL_UNO, ROW_UNO || Step 4: Create an advance for each of the employees and set summary table fiscal year to a past year1. Advance 1- for employee 1- approved (posted)1. Advance 2- for employee 2- approved (posted)2. Update the fiscal year to 2012 on the summary table for the two employeesNote: looks like expenses app is not creating the summary rows so only need to update if any already exist for current fiscsal yearUPDATE APH_PERSNL_YEAR set FISCAL_YEAR = 2012 WHERE ROW_UNO IN () | Expected: Approved Advances- Summary table APH_PERSNL_YEAR has a row for each employee for fiscal year 2012 || Step 5: Add advance to payment and Post1. Create employee payment2. Add the 2 advances3. Post the payment | Expected: Payment is posted - Summary table APH_PERSNL_YEAR has a row for each employee for fiscal year 2012 - Summary table APH_PERSNL_YEAR has a row for each employee for fiscal year 2014 || Step 6: Cancel payment1. Update the fiscal year to 2013 on the summary table for the two employees where fiscal year = 20142. Cancel the payment | Expected: Payment is canceled- Summary table APH_PERSNL_YEAR has a row for each employee for fiscal year 2012 - Summary table APH_PERSNL_YEAR has a row for each employee for fiscal year 2013 - Summary table APH_PERSNL_YEAR has a row for each employee for fiscal year 2014

Title: Payment Items - Invoice: Add while previous row is still saving
Steps: Step 1: Note: Some users have issues where there is a window for error caused by the slowness of their environments. This test case is to check a fix made to prevent the looping issues caused by this Note: The issue can arise when attempting to add either the same invoice row again or a row for a different invoice || Step 2: Pre req setup Fiddler (to slow down the UI)Set modem speed on Rules | Performance | Simulate modem speed Set a delay in a SP (to slow down the back end processes)Use SP_CMSMAKELOCKCIO )ASsetnocounton waitfordelay'00:00:20' || Step 3: Pre req data Invoice- Posted- No payments made against the invoice | Expected: ----------------------------------------------------------------------------------- Declarations ---------------------------------------------------------------------------------DECLARE @vendorid as VARCHAR (50) = 'tst1'DECLARE @invoice as VARCHAR (50) = '1'DECLARE @original as varchar (1) = 'Y' --If not Y, then we are looking at the contra entry for a canceled payment DECLARE @vendoruno as int = (SELECT VENDOR_UNO FROM APM_VENDOR WHERE VENDOR_ID = @vendorid) DECLARE @invoicetrans as int = (SELECT CASE WHEN @original = 'Y' THEN (SELECT TRAN_UNO FROM APT_INVOICE WHERE VENDOR_UNO = @vendoruno AND INVOICE_NUM =  @invoice AND INVOICE_STATUS <> 'X' ) ELSE (SELECT TRAN_UNO FROM APT_INVOICE WHERE VENDOR_UNO = @vendoruno AND INVOICE_NUM =  @invoice AND INVOICE_STATUS = 'X' )END--ELSE (SELECT TRAN_UNO FROM APT_CHECK WHERE REQUEST_NUM = @payment AND CHECK_STATUS <> 'X' )END)--DECLARE @tran AS INT = (SELECT TRAN_UNO FROM APT_INVOICE WHERE VENDOR_UNO = @vendoruno AND INVOICE_NUM =  @invoice)DECLARE @tran AS INT = (SELECT TRAN_UNO FROM APT_INVOICE WHERE TRAN_UNO = @invoicetrans  ) -- this doesn't make sense --DECLARE @invoicecur as VARCHAR (10) = (SELECT CURRENCY_CODE FROM APT_INVOICE WHERE VENDOR_UNO = @vendoruno AND INVOICE_NUM =  @invoice)DECLARE @invoicecur as VARCHAR (10) = (SELECT CURRENCY_CODE FROM APT_INVOICE WHERE TRAN_UNO = @invoicetrans) ----------------------------------------------------------------------------------- Invoice session---------------------------------------------------------------------------------SELECT ''[APS_INVOICE_Z],* FROM APS_INVOICE_Z z JOIN APT_INVOICE inv ON inv.SESSION = z.SESSIONWHERE TRAN_UNO = @tran ----------------------------------------------------------------------------------- Invoice  -- When not posted, amounts are in invoice currency -- When posted amounts are in system currency based on the DRUNO for the invoice date? ---------------------------------------------------------------------------------SELECT ''[APT_INVOICE],TRAN_UNO,SESSION,SCHEDULE_NUM,SOURCE_REF,INVOICE_NUM,VEND.VENDOR_NAME+' ('+VEND.VENDOR_ID + ')' AS 'VENDOR',i.TEMP_VENDOR_NAME,RVEND.VENDOR_NAME+' ('+RVEND.VENDOR_ID + ')' AS 'Remit Vendor',EAP_INITIATED,WF_INSTANCE_UNO,EXPERT_INVOICE_STATUS,INVOICE_STATUS,EXP_RPT_STATUS,i.LAST_MODIFIED--,* FROM APT_INVOICE iLEFT JOIN APM_VENDOR VEND ON I.VENDOR_UNO = VEND.VENDOR_UNOLEFT JOIN APM_VENDOR RVEND ON I.REMIT_VENDOR_UNO = RVEND.VENDOR_UNOWHERE TRAN_UNO = @tran ----------------------------------------------------------------------------------- Invoice Amounts ---------------------------------------------------------------------------------SELECT ''[APT_INVOICE_AMT],ia.ROW_UNO,INV_TRAN_UNO,SOURCE_TRAN_UNO,TRAN_TYPE,ia.SCHEDULE_NUM,CASE WHEN TRAN_TYPE = 'CH'  THEN (SELECT CAST(REQUEST_NUM AS VARCHAR) + ': ' + EXPERT_PAYMENT_STATUS FROM APT_CHECK WHERE TRAN_UNO = SOURCE_TRAN_UNO) ELSE '' END[Payment],SIGN,ia.TC_CODE,ia.TC_AP_AMT,ia.AP_AMT,ia.TC_PAID_AMT,ia.PAID_AMT,ia.DRUNO,ia.PERIOD,ia.LAST_MODIFIED,*FROM APT_INVOICE_AMT iaWHERE INV_TRAN_UNO = @tranORDER BY ia.ROW_UNO || Step 4: Add Invoice row1. Open payment2. Add Invoice details 3. Save & Add | Expected: Invoice row is saving || Step 5: Add duplicate row while first row is still savingNote: You need to be quick otherwise the previous row will have saved1. Enter the same invoice | Expected: Two invoice rows saving - You can see 1 row in the grid attempting to save- The schedule number of the invoice gets set to '-1' by the first row- The second item will have an error in the form Validation Error message on form is 'Invoice has already been added to Payment.'Note: prior to the fix the save went into a loop continuing to update the schedule number to -1 and no failure message was displayed || Step 6: Remove the saved row1. Remove row 1 | Expected: Invoice amount row is removed - The only saved row which was row one is removed- The schedule number for the invoice is set back to 0 || Step 7: Add Invoice row for invoice 11. Open payment2. Add Invoice details 3. Save & Add | Expected: Invoice row is saving || Step 8: Add Invoice row for invoice 21. Open payment2. Add Invoice details 3. Save & Add | Expected: - Both invoice rows are saving and will eventually both save- The schedule number of both invoices gets set to -1

Title: Payment - Remittance: Preferred remittance method for vendor (client side printing on)
Steps: Step 1: Pre reqs Client side printing onAdmin | System | Primter Settings | Clientside Printing || Step 2: Data pre reqs Note: all payments will need to have the same bank and be released Vendor 1- set to use 'Email'- has manual payments Vendor 2- set to 'Mail'- has manual payments Vendor 3- set to 'No' preference- Has manual payments Vendor 4- no preference set i-e NULL- Has manual payments SELECT VENDOR_ID,ven.APTYPE_CODE,ven.PREFERRED_PAYT_METHOD[Pay Method],ven.PREFERRED_REMIT_DELIV_METHOD[Deliver Method],ven.REMITTANCE_EMAIL[Email],typ.BANK_CODE,b.ACCT_TYPE,b.OFFC[Bank Offc],b.CURRENCY_CODE[Bank Cur],b.SHORT_NAME,b.ALLOW_CHECK_PRINTER_SELECTION[Select Printer],cf.FORMAT_CODE[Check Format],cf.FILENAME[Check File],rf.FORMAT_CODE[Remittance Format],rf.FILENAME[Remittance File],VENDOR_NAME--,ven.NAME_UNO,n2.NAME[Vendor Name]FROM APM_VENDOR venJOIN APL_APTYPE typ ON ven.APTYPE_CODE = typ.APTYPE_CODEJOIN TBM_BANK b ON Typ.BANK_CODE = b.BANK_CODEJOIN HBM_NAME n ON b.NAME_UNO = n.NAME_UNOJOIN HBM_NAME n2 ON ven.NAME_UNO = n2.NAME_UNOLEFTJOIN TBM_FMT_CH cf ON b.CH_FORMAT_UNO = cf.FORMAT_UNOLEFTJOIN TBM_FMT_RA rf ON b.RA_FORMAT_UNO = rf.FORMAT_UNOWHERE VENDOR_ID LIKE ('')ORDERBY VENDOR_ID --UPDATE APM_VENDOR SET PREFERRED_REMIT_DELIV_METHOD = '' WHERE VENDOR_ID =  --M,E,N--UPDATE APM_VENDOR SET REMITTANCE_EMAIL = '' WHERE VENDOR_ID = '' || Step 3: Print all1. Select payments2. Select to remit payments3. Set options- Print all- email = no | Expected: Remittances created and printed Remittances created for payments for all vendorsRemittances sent to printer for payments for all Vendors No remittances emailed || Step 4: Print Only1. Select payments2. Select to remit payments3. Set options- Print for mail only- email = no | Expected: Remittances created and printed Remittances created for payments for all vendorsRemittances sent to printer for payments for Vendors 2 No remittances emailedBug 269917: Firms using AP Client side printing 822.EX0008 - Expert AP printing ALL remittance advices despite "Print remittance advices for mail delivery only" option selected. || Step 5: Print All and email1. Select payments2. Select to remit payments3. Set options- Print all- email = yes- email format | Expected: Remittances created and printed Remittances created for payments for all vendorsRemittances sent to printer for payments for all Vendors Emails sent for Vendor 1 || Step 6: Print to mail only and Email1. Select payments2. Select to remit payments3. Set options- Print for mail only- email = yes- email format | Expected: Remittances created and printed Remittances created for payments for all vendorsRemittances sent to printer for payments for Vendors 2 Emails sent for Vendor 1Bug 269917: Firms using AP Client side printing 822.EX0008 - Expert AP printing ALL remittance advices despite "Print remittance advices for mail delivery only" option selected.

Title: AP Customization - add a custom field with adhoc list added to invoice Grid
Steps: Step 1: Scenario:- add field _PAYMENT_METHOD to APT_INVOICE- add Payment_Method data provider to invoice form- there is no validation || Step 2: Open DBEditor, select version 82 || Step 3: Click Tables > APT_INVOICE, Right Click > Revise || Step 4: Add a new column Name: _PAYMENT_METHOD: Type: String  Size: 100  Nulls: True || Step 5: Open Expert Share > Domain Wizard Select Extend an existing entity > APT_INVOICE > _PAYMENT_METHOD > select Invoice (Sql View:AccountsPayableModel.Invoice) Complete the wizard || Step 6: Open Deployment Manager> Go to the pacakges tab and then click Apply Customizations in the ribbon panel Click yes to create the package and yes again after to deploy the customizations. || Step 7: Open Expert Admin app > System > Adhoc List Editor > add (+) to Adhoc Lists, enter Adhoc List Name & Description. Add (+) to List items, enter Primary text, Secondary text and Code Text and save || Step 8: When applied and deployed (via deployment manager) open Design Studio Accounts Payable > Forms > Invoice Entry > Invoice Entry Add new Search Box, bind to Invoice.PAYMENT_METHOD select Payment_Method (Adhoc list)  Data Provider. Save and exit. || Step 9: Go back to Expert Admin app > AP > Grid > Invoice Grid > Add (+) to Available fields > Invoice Grid,Invoice,Payment_Method > Display format - Standard > Data Provider - Payment_Method (Adhoc List) > Add custom field to Column defaults and Filter defaults > Save and Close || Step 10: Open AP, create new Invoice, select a Payment_Method in the custom Payment_Method search box and save | Expected: Payment_Method field is on the form- Data provider returns Payment_Methods- Selected Payment_Method is saved to the new DB fields

Title: Invoices - [Expert] Creating an invoice
Steps: Step 1: Pre-requisite: Set up an environment for AP in Expert || Step 2: In Expert, go to Accounts Payable then click on Invoice tab on the left-hand side bar. || Step 3: Enter header: Vendor:1102Invoice No: INV1102Invoice date: Today's dateInv Amt: 1000Click 'Save' on the ribbon bar | Expected: Your latest invoice entry is created in APS_INVOICE_Z table with Status 'E'A new row will be create in ACT_TRAN, APT_INVOICE. || Step 4: In Details area, select G/L tab. add G/L Detail, fill in as follow:Account: 61050 Office Supplies - GeneralOffice: AUKDepartment: ADMProfit Center: FIRMAmt: 1000Click 'Save and Close'  Make sure Remaining Balance is 0.00. Press Post if no longer want to edit it in future, else click Release. | Expected: A new row will be created in ACT_TRAN_JE.Invoice session status in APS_INVOICE_Z will be set to P or R for posted or released invoice. New entry is created in APT_INVOICE_AMOUNT if posted. Release invoice, APT_INVOICE.Expert.INVOICE_STATUS = R Posted invoice, APT_INVOICE.Expert.INVOICE_STATUS = O

Title: Payment Item - GL: Save Validation
Steps: Step 1: Note: Multi book and allowed GL accounts is tested under invoice || Step 2: Account type = H1. Add a GL item using account and save2. Change the account using sql to one where ACCT_TYPE = H3. Edit the GL item and save- amountSELECT  ACCT_TYPE,* FROM GLM_CHART | Expected: Error: Account can not be a headerXPNS_CANT_SPECIFY_HEADER_ACCT || Step 3: Account is subledger1. Add a GL item using account and save2. Change the account using sql to one where subledger = Y3. Edit the GL item and save- amountSELECT  SUBLEDGER,* FROM GLM_CHART | Expected: Error: Account can not be a sub ledgerXPNS_CANT_SPECIFY_HEADER_ACCT || Step 4: Plan1. Select to add a GL item2. Select a plan that has no details3. Save & Close | Expected: Error: Empty GL PlanSELECT A.PLAN_DESC, A.INACTIVE FROM GLM_PLAN A INNER JOIN GLM_PLAN_DET B on B.PLAN_CODE = A.PLAN_CODE INNER JOIN GLM_CHART C on C.ACCT_UNO = B.ACCT_UNO WHERE  C.BOOK=1 || Step 5: Office is inactive1. CMS_OPTION.JE_ODPC_DEF = Y2. Add a GL item3. Use an account where employee is set to mandatory4. Select an employee where employee's office is not valid (e.g. CIOEB has TOK which is inactive)SELECT * FROM CMS_OPTION WHERE OPTION_CODE ='JE_ODPC_DEF' | Expected: Error: Office is Inactive or Invalid || Step 6: Department is inactive 1. CMS_OPTION.JE_ODPC_DEF = Y2. Add a GL item3. Use an account where department is required4 . Enter mandatory data and save5. Set the dept to inactive6. Edit the line item e.g. amount7. Save | Expected: Error: Department is Inactive or Invalid || Step 7: Profit center is inactive 1. CMS_OPTION.JE_ODPC_DEF = Y2. Add a GL item3. Use an account where profit center is required4 . Enter mandatory data and save5. Set the prof center to inactive6. Edit the line item e.g. amount7. Save | Expected: Error: Profit center is Inactive or Invalid || Step 8: Vendor Limited Accounts1. Add limited accounts for a vendor (in entity manager)2. Add GL item3. Check that accounts are limited to those set in entity manager and choose one. Save & Close4. Remove the account it in Entity Manager and save there.5. Edit the GL item and save- amount | Expected: Error: Account is not valid for this vendor

Select to add GL item 2. Enter account | Expected: On entry of accountEmployee =  disabled and defaulted from parmsOffice = mandatory and blankDepartment  = mandatory and blankProf = mandatory and blank || Step 6: Account 4Dept required = YProf centre required = YEmpl required = Y1. Select to add GL item 2. Enter account | Expected: On entry of accountEmployee =  is mandatory and blankOffice = mandatory and blankDepartment  = mandatory and blankProf = mandatory and blankOn entry of employeeOffice = mandatory and blankDept = mandatory and blankProf = mandatory and blankOn change of employee when ODP have been entered Office = remains as entered changed to match employeeDept = remains as entered changed to match employeeProf = remains as entered changed to match employee || Step 7: Account 7Dept required = YProf centre required = NEmpl required = Y1. Select to add GL item 2. Enter account | Expected: On entry of accountEmployee =  is mandatory and blankOffice = mandatory and blankDepartment  = mandatory and blankProf = disabled and defaulted from parms On entry of employeeOffice = mandatory and blankDept = mandatory and blankOn change of employee when ODP have been entered Office = remains as enteredDept = remains as entered || Step 8: Account 8Dept required = NProf centre required = YEmpl required = Y1. Select to add GL item 2. Enter account | Expected: On entry of accountEmployee =  is mandatory and blankOffice = mandatory and blankDepartment  = disabled and defaulted from parms Prof = mandatory and blankOn entry of employeeOffice = mandatory and blankProf = mandatory and blankOn change of employee when ODP have been entered Office = remains as enteredProf = remains as entered || Step 9: Account 9Dept required = YProf centre required = YEmpl required = NHas only one DepartmentHas only one Prof Centre1. Select to add GL item 2. Title: Payment - Updating bank to one with a different currency on a saved check
Steps: Step 1: Note:  A saved payment exists with an initial bank and currency, and it has no detail lines. Therefore, the bank can be modified.Access to the APT_CHECK and ACT_TRAN tables. || Step 2: Open an existing Payment | Expected: Has no detail lines. Payment is saved with initial bank (BANK A) and currency (CURRENCY A) || Step 3: Verify the records in the APT_CHECK & ACT_TRAN table | Expected: Both APT_CHECK and ACT_TRAN tables should reflect Currency A. SQL: select TC_CODE,CURRENCY_CODE,* from APT_CHECK; select TRANS_CURRENCY,* from ACT_TRAN || Step 4: Update the bank to one with a different currency and verify the impact on records i-e Change the bank of the saved payment to Bank B (Currency B). || Step 5: Check the APT_CHECK and ACT_TRAN tables for the updated payment. | Expected: Both APT_CHECK and ACT_TRAN tables should reflect Currency B. || Step 6: Enter the details lines in the payment || Step 7: Post the payment and verify that the journals created have the correct currency. | Expected: The journal entries should reflect the updated currency (Currency B).

Title: AP -> Payments -> Simple Client Payment Create, Release
Steps: Step 1: Pre-req:Create a Client at EM || Step 2: Start Expert Accounts Payable | Expected: The application should be launched successfully || Step 3: Click on Payments tab | Expected: Payments search page should be opened || Step 4: Click on New Payment->Client Payment | Expected: Payment (New) form should be opened || Step 5: Fill in required header details (Bank should be non Trust )and save | Expected: The header details should be saved successfully || Step 6: Create General Ledger and fill in required fields | Expected: GL record should be added successfully || Step 7: Create Tax records and fill in required fields | Expected: Tax record should be added successfully || Step 8: Make sure the Remaining Balance is 0 after adding the records.Save and close | Expected: The record should be saved and closed successfully || Step 9: Go to payment list screen and search and list the newly created payment | Expected: The payment should be listed successfully || Step 10: Validate the details at the Grid | Expected: Payment Ref, Account, Client/Matter, Bank, Payee Name, Status, Check amount, Payment Method || Step 11: Open the Payment | Expected: Payment should be opened successfully || Step 12: Click on Release | Expected: Release button  should get disabled,Unrelease button should get enabled,Post should remain Disabled,Print Payment should be enabled. No error should be encountered

Title: AP -> Payments -> Simple Vendor Electronic Payment Create, Release, Post, Cancel
Steps: Step 1: Pre-requisite: Configure a Vendor which has default Electronic Payment set .                             At Admin System settings for printer Client Side printing for AP should be set                                  PDF Printer should be configured || Step 2: Start Expert Accounts Payable | Expected: The application should be launched successfully || Step 3: Click on Payments tab | Expected: Payments search page should be opened || Step 4: Click on New Payment->Vendor Payment | Expected: Payment (New) form should be opened || Step 5: Fill in required at header details.Select the Vendor specified in pre-req and save | Expected: The payment method should be Electronic || Step 6: Create General Ledger and fill in required fields | Expected: GL record should be added successfully || Step 7: Create Disbursement and fill in required fields | Expected: Disbursement record should be added successfully || Step 8: Make sure the Remaining Balance is 0 after adding the records.Save and close | Expected: The record should be saved and closed successfully || Step 9: Go to payment list screen and search and list the newly created payment | Expected: The payment should be listed successfully || Step 10: Validate the details at the Grid | Expected: Payment Ref, Account, Client/Matter, Bank, Payee Name, Status, Check amount, Payment Method || Step 11: Open the Payment | Expected: Payment should be opened successfully || Step 12: Click on Release | Expected: Release button  should get disabled,Unrelease button should get enabled,Post should remain Disabled,Print Payment should be enabled. No error should be encountered || Step 13: Click on Print Payment | Expected: Validate Print Remittance Advice popup is opened || Step 14: Fill the required details and click OK | Expected: Save the pdf file . || Step 15: Click on Post Payment | Expected: Post Payment should be successful || Step 16: Click on Cancel and perform Cancel to New Invoice | Expected: Cancel to new Invoice should be successful
