Title: Approval Workflow - Admin - General Ledger Approvers
Steps: Step 1: Approvel Level | Expected: Radio buttons.Level 1 to Level 4.Only one can be selected at a time.Switching level do not refresh Book.Default to Level 1.Note: Switch between the levels should not crash Admin app. || Step 2: Book | Expected: Drop down. From GLV_BOOK. Book 2 - Ledger is NOT listed.Required. Default to Firm BookNote: Switch between the books should not crash Admin app. || Step 3: GL Accounts and Approver grid | Expected: Allow inline edit.Note: Add large number of rows i-e around 300 rows. Allow Add/ Remove/ Modify row. While loading large number of rows should not crash Admin app. (refer to Bug 266167) || Step 4: Account | Expected: RequiredAccounts selection tree dropdown.Accounts available depends on the Book selected.Active Account only. Doesn't filter out matched account as you enter.Can only type in full Account Code and tab out. || Step 5: Office | Expected: OptionalDrop down list.Active Office only. || Step 6: Department | Expected: OptionalDrop down list.Active Department only. || Step 7: Approver | Expected: OptionalEmployee search control.Active Employee or Workgroup only.Cannot search via Employee Code.Admin app should not crash if there is any inactive employees assigned as approver earlier.Bug: 273259 (internally raised bug)Expert Admin crashes when a GL approver is Inactive (BatchableQuery<T> bug)Bug: 276061 Expert Admin > GL Approvers page errors when there are inactive employees as approvers (Client raised bug) || Step 8: Validation || Step 9: Entry inserted to APA_GL_APPROVER | Expected: One row regardless if it is Firm Master Book and using Multi book. || Step 10: Duplicate Row on same book same level | Expected: Duplicate row error || Step 11: Duplicate row on same book different level | Expected: Valid || Step 12: Duplicate row on different book same level | Expected: Valid || Step 13: Duplicate row on different book different level | Expected: Valid || Step 14: It should not be possible to have multiple rows with the same Level, Book, Account, Office and Department - including NULL values for office / department

Title: General: Security roles
Steps: Step 1: Pre reqsUser must have ExpertAccountsPayableApplication role assigned for the other application roles to be able to be tested, except for ExpertAccountsPayableAdministration || Step 2: AllowRuleErrorOverride | Expected: Allowed when user has the role assigned, otherwise not allowed When there is an error based on a rule- User can override || Step 3: EvaluateRules | Expected: Allowed when user has the role assigned, otherwise not allowedButton/Right Click Menu allowed in grid - Evaluate RulesFunctionality allowed in payment- Evaluation Rules || Step 4: ExpertAccountsPayableAdministration | Expected: Allowed when user has the role assigned, otherwise not allowedAccounts payable tree in admin app- Not visible unless user has the role || Step 5: ExpertAccountsPayableApplication | Expected: Allowed when user has the role assigned, otherwise not allowedAccounts Payable Application- Can't be run unless user has the role || Step 6: SaveFirmLevelMappingProfile | Expected: Visible when user has the role assigned, otherwise not visibleImport Invoice Wizard- Profile type || Step 7: SaveFirmLevelSearch | Expected: Visible when user has the role assigned, otherwise not visibleAll major grids- Save search as | Save as firm search

Title: RecurringInvoices: Security roles
Steps: Step 1: Pre reqsUser must have ExpertAccountsPayableApplication role assigned || Step 2: CreateRecurringInvoice | Expected: Allowed when user has the role assigned, otherwise not allowedButtons allowed in grid - New Recurring Invoice- Open- DeleteRecurring invoice functionality allowed- Create, edit, delete, save || Step 3: GenerateRecurringInvoice | Expected: Allowed when user has the role assigned, otherwise not allowed* When assigned, the button is enabled, otherwise disabled* When assigned, the right click menu is enabled, otherwise disabled* When assigned, recurring invoice can be generated

Title: Upgrade - Expense reports and advances
Steps: Step 1: Old version - set up dataSet up 2 of each in an approved state :- expense reports with billable and non billable items - advances || Step 2: Upgrade new version || Step 3: New Version - Use Expense report in Payment schedule | Expected: - Expense report can be added to a payment schedule- Payment can be created from schedule || Step 4: New Version - Use Expense report in Payment | Expected: - Expense report can be added to a payment- Payment can be posted || Step 5: New Version - Use Advance in Payment schedule | Expected: - Advance can be added to a payment schedule- Payment can be created from schedule || Step 6: New Version - Use Advance in Payment | Expected: - Advance can be added to a payment - Payment can be posted

Title: Quick Pay - Allow Spot Rate for Quick Pay
Steps: Step 1: Expert Admin> Accounts Payable> Firm Options> Allow Spot Rate for Quick Pay | Expected: APM_PARMS. CHK_SPOT_RATES || Step 2: Allow Spot Rate=Y1. Create a complete invoice with APTYPE with non-system currency bank.2. Release and post it3. Quick Pay the invoice | Expected: The spot rate button next to the currency field on the created payment is visible and clickable. || Step 3: Allow Spot Rate = N1. Create a complete invoice with APTYPE with non-system currency bank.2. Release and post it3. Quick Pay the invoice | Expected: The spot rate button next to the currency field on the created payment is not visible

Title: New Invoice Workflow - Code Invoice Task - Vendor with GL Default
Steps: Step 1: Pre reqVendor with GL lines defaultVendor with a GL line and a CC line defaultVendor with GL lines default available for interbookVendor with GL plan Vendor with GL plan default available for interbook | Expected: NOTE - Defaulted GL line will not be editable if there are validation error on the invoice header.It should look at entering empl || Step 2: Vendor with GL lines default1. Kick off New Invoice Workflow using vendor with two GL lines default.2. Proceed until Code Invoice task | Expected: GL lines defaulted || Step 3: Vendor with a GL line and a CC line default1. Kick offf New Invoice Workflow using vendor with a GL line and a CC line default2. Proceed until Code Invoice task | Expected: Only GL lines is defaulted, the firm paid credit card flag is shown || Step 4: Vendor with GL lines default available for interbook1. Kick offf New Invoice Workflow using vendor with GL lines available for different book using ermployee on other book.2. Proceed until Code Invoice task | Expected: Depends on which book is used, only the gl line for the book is defaulted.*Bug191243 fixed - WF - Invoice Book should default from Employee, not the Vendor APType || Step 5: Vendor with GL plan 1. Kick offf New Invoice Workflow using vendor with GL plan 2. Proceed until Code Invoice task | Expected: All GL lines in the plan is defaulted || Step 6: Vendor with GL plan default available for interbook1. Kick offf New Invoice Workflow using vendor with GL plan available for different book using employee on other book.2. Proceed until Code Invoice task | Expected: Depends on which book is used by the employee, the gl line setup for the gl plan of the book is defaulted.* Bug 197507 fixed - Vendor defaulted GL lines using GL plan do not have the right amount allocated || Step 7: Workflow initiated with Temporary Vendor then change to Vendor with GL lines default setup1. Kick offf New Invoice Workflow using temporary vendor2. On the Create Vendor task, change vendor to Vendor with GL lines default setup3. Proceed until Code Invoice task | Expected: Depends on which book is used, only the gl line for the book is defaulted.*Bug 197501 fixed - Vendor defaulted GL line not created if workflow is initiated with a temp vendor first. || Step 8: Workflow initiated with Temporary Vendor then change to Vendor with GL plan default available for interbook1. Kick offf New Invoice Workflow using temporary vendor2. On the Create Vendor task, change vendor to Vendor with GL lines default available for interbook.3. Proceed until Code Invoice task | Expected: Depends on which book is used, only the gl line for the gl plan of the book is defaulted.*Currently not getting GL line default. which book should it default from? kick off user or user who put in the vendor?*Bug 197501 fixed - Vendor defaulted GL line not created if workflow is initiated with a temp vendor first.

Title: Approval Workflow - GL Approval - All Level - Approval Limit and Grouping - Single Currency
Steps: Step 1: *After the GL Approver has been identified, we check if user is in the approvers limit to approver the GL. || Step 2: Pre reqSetup GL ApproverAdmin | AP | Workflow | Approvers and Approval Limits | General Ledger ApproversApproval Level - 1Book - 1Account - 61000 or any detail accountOffice - TLHDepartment - ADMApprover - TTQA1Setup GL Approval LimitAdmin | AP | Workflow | Approvers and Approval Limits | General Ledger Approval LimitsApprover : TTQA1Currency : USDLower Limit : 9.99Upper Limit : 100.99 || Step 3: GL amount within limit - USD1001. Create invoice with GL line USD100.2. Kick off approval workflow | Expected: TTQA1 receive the task. || Step 4: GL amount equal to Lower limit - USD9.991. Create invoice with GL line USD9.992. Kick off approval workflow | Expected: TTQA1 receive the task. || Step 5: GL amount equal to Upper limit - USD100.991. Create invoice with GL line USD100.992. Kick off approval workflow | Expected: TTQA1 receive the task. || Step 6: GL amount out of limit1. Create invoice with GL line USD9.98.2. Kick off approval workflow3. Repeat with GL line USD101. | Expected: TTQA1 do not receive any approval task. Workflow proceed to Total Invoice Approvals. || Step 7: Total GL amount within limit - USD1001. Create invoice with TWO GL line , USD50 each2. Kick off approval workflow | Expected: TTQA1 receive the Approval task. Both the GL lines are grouped as one task and assign to TTQA1, || Step 8: Total GL amount out of limit - USD1501. Create invoice with THREE GL line , USD50 each2. Kick off approval workflow | Expected: TTQA1 do not receive any approval task. Workflow proceed to Total Invoice Approvals.GL Amount are totalled up and add up to USD150, which do not faill into approval limit.

Create invoice with GL line CAD100.2. Kick off approval workflow | Expected: TTQA1 receive the task. || Step 4: GL amount equal to Lower limit - CAD9.991. Create invoice with GL line CAD9.992. Kick off approval workflow | Expected: TTQA1 receive the task. || Step 5: GL amount equal to Upper limit - CAD100.991. Create invoice with GL line CAD100.992. Kick off approval workflow | Expected: TTQA1 receive the task. || Step 6: GL amount out of limit1. Create invoice with GL line CAD9.98.2. Kick off approval workflow3. Repeat with GL line CAD101. | Expected: TTQA1 do not receive any approval task. Workflow proceed to next step || Step 7: Total GL amount within limit - CAD1001. Create invoice with TWO GL line , CAD50 each2. Kick off approval workflow | Expected: TTQA1 receive the Approval task. Both the GL lines are grouped as one task and assign to TTQA1, || Step 8: Total GL amount out of limit - CAD1501. Create invoice with THREE GL line , CAD50 each2. Kick off approval workflow | Expected: TTQA1 do not receive any approval task. Workflow proceed to next stepGL Amount are totalled up and add up to CAD150, which do not fall into approval limit.Note that it is not looking at USD approval limit

Title: Approval Workflow - GL Approval - Firm Paid Credit Card
Steps: Step 1: Setup Admin > AP > Workflow > Invoice Approval Process General Ledger Approvals- check Approval Level 1 and 2.Disbursement Approvals- check Approcal Levwl 1 and 2.Admin > AP > Workflow > Approvers and Approval Limits > GL Approvers.Approval Level 1 - Account 61000, TLH, ADM, TTQA1- Account 61000, TTQA2 (leave Off and Dept blank)Vendor FPCC, setup in Entity > Vendor > GL & FPCC Default- Firm Book, Account 61000, AUCK, ADM, FIRM || Step 2: Create an invoice with a FPCC line.Send invoice for Approval. | Expected: *Invoice needs to be in unapproved state to send for Approval. || Step 3: Check TTQA1 and TTQA2 Task Inbox | Expected: TTQA2 recevies the GL approval task.*FPCC is being setup as AUCK office. Hence it does not go to TTQA1 approval for TLH office. No disbursement approval task received or created.The approval form should be identical to GL Approval form

Title: Approval Workflow - GL Approval - Taxes
Steps: Step 1: Setup Admin > AP > Workflow > Invoice Approval Process General Ledger Approvals- check Approval Level 1 and 2.Disbursement Approvals- check Approval Level 1 and 2.Admin > AP > Workflow > Approvers and Approval Limits > GL Approvers.Approval Level 1 - Account 61000, TLH, ADM, TTQA1- Account 61000,  COR, TTQA2 (leave Office blank)Setup Tax  and Jurisdiction Codes for using the account.Classic > Hub Setup > Time and Billing > Tax Code and Tax Jurisdiction Maintenance.Tax Code Recoverable Offsets - Account 61000, COR, MAIN.Set Tax Code to Jurisdiction. || Step 2: Manual entered Tax line1. Create an invoice with a manually entered Tax line using tax code which you setup.2. Send invoice for approval. | Expected: TTQA2 recevies the GL approval task.*Recoverable offset is being setup as COR dept. Hence it does not go to TTQA1 approval for ADM dept. No disbursement approval task received or created.The approval form should be identical to GL Approval form || Step 3: Calculated Tax line1. Create an invoice with Tax line created from Calculate Tax based on Jurisdiction.2. Send invoice for approval. | Expected: TTQA2 recevies the GL approval task.*Recoverable offset is being setup as COR dept. Hence it does not go to TTQA1 approval for ADM dept. No disbursement approval task received or created.*If you have approval setup for the details which taxes calculated from, it should create another approval task for that detail line.The approval form should be identical to GL Approval form

Decline on GL and resubmit.1. Create invoice with GL line.2. Submit for approval.3. Approve on Lvl 1, Decline on Lvl 2, Decline by Completing task with an Approval Comment. 4. Resubmit invoice for approval | Expected: Receive GL Approval task Lvl 2. Should not need to reapprove Lvl 1Resubmitted invoice has a (Resubmitted ) on the title.GL line remain unapproved and Approval Comment remain on form. || Step 9: Multi Level Approvals on. Decline on Disb and resubmit.1. Create invoice with Disb line.2. Submit for approval.3. Approve on Lvl 1, Decline on Lvl 2, Decline by Completing task with an Approval Comment. 4. Resubmit invoice for approval | Expected: Receive Disb Approval task Lvl 2. Should not need to reapprove Lvl 1Resubmitted invoice has a (Resubmitted ) on the title.Disb line remain unapproved and Approval Comment remain on form. || Step 10: Multi Level Approvals on. Approve on Lvl 1, Decline on Lvl 2, Decline by Completing task with an Approval Comment.4. Approve GL line5. Resubmit invoice for approval | Expected: Received Disb Approval task Lvl 2. Should not need to reapprove Lvl 1Resubmitted invoice has a (Resubmitted ) on the title.Disb line remain unapproved and Approval Comment remain on form. not receiving GL approval task. || Step 11: Multi Level Approvals on. Approve both disb and gl, Decline the invoice. resubmit.1. Create invoice with a Disb and a GL line.2. Submit for approval.3. Approve GL & Disb line4. Decline invoice on lvl 2.5. Resubmit invoice for approval | Expected: Received Total Invoice Approval task Lvl 2. Should not need to reapprove Lvl 1Resubmitted invoice has a (Resubmitted ) on the title.Invoice remain unapproved and Approval Comment remain on form.

Title: New Invoice Workflow - Admin - Approval Workflow Required flag and related setup
Steps: Step 1: Order of the fields have been changed from 822.EX3 and 83 | Expected: US 241214 Update the order of the fields in the Admin Form for New Invoice Workflow || Step 2: Setup Admin > Workflow > New Invoice Workflow > Approval Workflow Required. | Expected: When flag is checked, Approval Review Action and Task Name field will appear. || Step 3: Approval Workflow Required = Y1. Create new invoice workflow and get pass Accounting Review Task. | Expected: Approval Task starts right off. || Step 4: Approval Workflow Required = N1. Create new invoice workflow and get pass Accounting Review Task. | Expected: No Approval Task, invoice remain as not approved.Invoice might get release/post depends on your setup.If invoice failed to release/post, you will get Accounting Correction task. || Step 5: Approval Workflow Required = Y, Approval Review Action = End Workflow1. Create new invoice workflow and get pass Accounting Review Task.2. Decline the invoice on the approval task. | Expected: Workflow Ends.Invoice remain as not approved || Step 6: Approval Workflow Required = Y, Approval Review Action = Send to Coding User1. Create new invoice workflow and get pass Accounting Review Task.2. Decline the invoice on the approval task. | Expected: Coding user receive Approval Review task || Step 7: Approval Workflow Required = Y, Approval Review Action = Send to other user1. Create new invoice workflow and get pass Accounting Review Task.2. Decline the invoice on the approval task. | Expected: Task Performer as setup receives the approval review task.

Start a New Invoice Workflow and get pass Code Invoice Task.2. Title: Smoke Test AP: Recurring Invoices to invoice and payment using Quick Pay
Steps: Step 1: Has some coverage by int tests but needs a UI test || Step 2: Create a Recurring Invoice1. New Recurring Invoice- Vendor- Template name- Invoice Amount = $100.00- Generate every week- First invoice date- Last invoice date (must be >= first invoice date)2. Save | Expected: New Recurring Invoice saved* Generation Method = Do Not Generate* Remaining balance = $100.00* Ribbon Buttons enabled- Close & Add- Close- Delete* Item tabs enabled- GL- Disbursement || Step 3: Add a GL item to the recurring invoice- Account- Amount = $50.00- Other mandatory data | Expected: Int- SaveAndUpdateExpertRecurringInvoiceSucceedsGL item added to recurring invoice and saved* Generation Method= Do Not Generate* Remaining balance = $50.00* Ribbon Buttons enabled- Close & Add- Close- Delete || Step 4: Add a Disbursement item to the recurring invoice- Client/ Matter- Disb Code- Employee- Office- Base Amount = $50.00 | Expected: Disbursement item added to recurring invoice and saved* Generation Method= Do Not Generate* Remaining balance = $0.00* Ribbon Buttons enabled- Close & Add- Close- Delete || Step 5: Change Generation Method and save- Manual- Save | Expected: Generation method for recurring invoice changed* Generation Method= Manual* Remaining balance = $0.00* Ribbon Buttons enabled- Close & Add- Close- Generate Next Invoice || Step 6: Generate Next Invoice1. Click Generate next invoice-Yes to opening the generated invoice | Expected: Int- GenerateInvoiceWithGLDetailSucceedsInt- GenerateInvoiceWithDisbursementDetailSucceedsInt- GenerateInvoiceWithGLAndDisbursementDetailSucceedsInvoice generated successfully* Status = Released* Fields disabled* Remaining Balance = $0.00- All the fields are consistent with the recurring invoice- There is a general ledger and disbursement item attached to the invoice* Ribbon Buttons enabled- Close & Add- Close- Unrelease- Post || Step 7: Post the Invoice1. Click post | Expected: Int- PostInvoiceAfterGenerationSucceedsInvoice is posted* Status = Outstanding* Remaining balance = $0.00* Ribbon Buttons enabled- Close & Add- Close- Cancel- Quick Pay- Edit Invoice || Step 8: Quick Pay the invoiceClick Quick Pay in the ribbon panel | Expected: Int- SaveCheckHeaderInt- SaveCheckHeaderWithoutCheckMemoSucceedsNew payment is created and saved with invoice detail line.Invoice is closed and payment created and opened automatically.* Status = Ready for Posting* Check number  = 0* Remaining balance = 0* Ribbon Buttons enabled- Close & Add- Close- Delete- Evaluate Rules* Item tabs enabled- GL- Disbursements- Taxes- Invoice payments || Step 9: Change Payment Method to WireChange the Payment Method field to Wire and save- You may need to select an available Wire Number depending on setup. | Expected: Payment Method is WirePost button is enabled || Step 10: Release Payment | Expected: Payment is released* Status = Released* Ribbon Buttons enabled- Close & Add- Close- Post- Print Payments-Email Remittance Advices || Step 11: Post Payment | Expected: Int- PostingManualPaymentWorksInt- PostingManualCheckWithInvoiceTransactionPassesPayment is posted*Invoice is Settled* Status = Outstanding* Ribbon Buttons enabled- Close & Add- Close- Cancel- Print Payments-Email Remittance Advices

Title: Payment Items - Disbursement: Withhold Disbursement Cash Receipt Until Vendor is Paid
Steps: Step 1: Setup pre reqsWithhold flags are in adminAccount payable | Accounts payable Options | Firm OptionsNote: Withhold Disb...Paid can be on when Withhold Withhold Disb...Reconciled is off BUT if WithholdDisb...Reconciled is on then Withhold Disb...Paid must also be onNote:- If either of the withhold flags are on then Hold Invoice for Full Bill Payment must be off SELECT INV_PAYFULL_RELEAS,HOLD_DISB_CHECK_RECONCILE,HOLD_DISB FROM APM_PARMS || Step 2: Flag off - Invoice not on payment, Disb not billed1. Turn flags offUPDATE APM_PARMS SET INV_PAYFULL_RELEAS ='N',HOLD_DISB_CHECK_RECONCILE ='N',HOLD_DISB ='N'2. Create vendor invoice3. Add disb and post the invoice | Expected: CDT_DISB.HELD_BY_AP = NSELECT INV_PAYFULL_RELEAS,HOLD_DISB_CHECK_RECONCILE,HOLD_DISB FROM APM_PARMS--UPDATE APM_PARMS SET INV_PAYFULL_RELEAS ='N',HOLD_DISB_CHECK_RECONCILE ='N',HOLD_DISB ='N'SELECT''[CDT_DISB],d.DISB_UNO,d.WIP_STATUS,EXPERT_DISB_STATUS,SESSION,d.HELD_BY_AP--,d.*FROM CDT_DISB d WHERE DISB_UNO = SELECT ''[BLH_BILLED_DISB],bd.BILLED_DISB_UNO,BILL_TRAN_UNO,COST_CODE,HELD_BY_AP_AMT,BASE_AMT,STD_AMT,HARDSOFT,LAST_MODIFIED--,bd.* FROM BLH_BILLED_DISB bdWHERE DRUNO = 100026 AND COST_CODE = 'AIR'ORDER BY bd.BILLED_DISB_UNO desc || Step 3: Flag off - Invoice payed, disb billed1. Create vendor invoice2. Add disb and post the invoice3. Add invoice to payment and post the payment4. Bill disb | Expected: CDT_DISB.HELD_BY_AP = NBLH_BILLED_DISB.HELD_BY_AP_AMT = 0 || Step 4: Flag on - Invoice not on payment, Disb not billed1. Turn flag onUPDATE APM_PARMS SET INV_PAYFULL_RELEAS ='N',HOLD_DISB_CHECK_RECONCILE ='N',HOLD_DISB ='Y'2. Create vendor invoice3. Title: Workflow - Approval Workfow - Invoice Approval Status with Workflow cancellation
Steps: Step 1: Cancel Workflow when GL is not approved | Expected: Invoice and GL are unapproved. || Step 2: Cancel workflow when invoice is not approved, GL and disb approved | Expected: Invoice unapproved. || Step 3: Cancel workflow when invoice is not approved, GL approved, and disb not approved | Expected: Invoice unapproved, GL approved, and Disb not approved. || Step 4: Cancel workflow when invoice is not approved, GL not approved, disb is approved | Expected: Invoice unapproved, GL not approved, and Disb not approved. || Step 5: Terminate workflow | Expected: Invoice unapproved. Invoice remain locked to the workflow.

Title: New Invoice Workflow - Admin - Release Invoice Options
Steps: Step 1: Pre-req AP New Invoice workflow.Auto Post flag = N.Setup yourself as Account Review task performerSend failure email = Y.Email Recipient = User.*Turn off Approval Workflow to make testing easier. || Step 2: Auto Release flag = N, complete invoice1. Initiate New Invoice Workflow. 2. Complete the Code Invoice task with no error and invoice is complete (Invoice amount = Detail amount). | Expected: Workflow ended with invoice in Complete status || Step 3: Auto Release flag = N, invoice with error1. Initiate New Invoice Workflow. 2. Complete the Code Invoice task with invoice has error (eg, tax not calculated, set Tax Included = Y/N instead of NA) | Expected: Workflow proceed to Account Review stage. Receive task if you setup yourself as Account Review task performer. Complete the Account Review task and workflow ends with invoice in Complete status. || Step 4: Auto Release flag = Y, Failure Action = Send Accounting Correction task1. Initiate New Invoice Workflow.2. Complete the Code Invoice task with known validation error (changing min and max date in background) | Expected: Task performer receives Accounting Correction task.Receive Release Invoice Failed email. || Step 5: Auto Release flag = Y, Failure Action = End Workflow1. Initiate New Invoice Workflow.2. Complete the Code Invoice task with known validation error (changing min and max date in background) | Expected: Workflow ends, no further task required.Receive Release Invoice Failed email.

Title: New Invoice Workflow - Admin - Post Invoice Options
Steps: Step 1: Pre-req AP New Invoice workflow.Auto Release flag = N.Setup yourself as Account Review task performerSend failure email = Y.Email Recipient = User.*Turn off Approval Workflow to make testing easier. || Step 2: Auto Post flag = N, complete invoice1. Initiate New Invoice Workflow. 2. Complete the Code Invoice task with no error and invoice is complete (Invoice amount = Detail amount). | Expected: Workflow ended with invoice in Complete status || Step 3: Auto Post flag = N, invoice with error1. Initiate New Invoice Workflow. 2. Complete the Code Invoice task with invoice has error (eg, tax not calculated, set Tax Included = Y/N instead of NA) | Expected: Workflow proceed to Account Review stage. Receive task if you setup yourself as Account Review task performer. Complete the Account Review task and workflow ends with invoice in Complete status. || Step 4: Auto Post flag = Y, Failure Action = Send Accounting Correction task1. Initiate New Invoice Workflow.2. Complete the Code Invoice task with known validation error (changing min and max date in background) | Expected: Task performer receives Accounting Correction task.Receive Release Invoice Failed email.* Bug 197439 - WF - Account Correction task fails to find a performer when invoice is not set to auto release. || Step 5: Auto Post flag = Y, Failure Action = End Workflow1. Initiate New Invoice Workflow.2. Complete the Code Invoice task with known validation error (changing min and max date in background) | Expected: Workflow ends, no further task required.Receive Release Invoice Failed email.

Title: New Invoice Workflow - Admin - Email Recipients
Steps: Step 1: Email Recipients setupAdmin > AP > Workflow > New Invoice Workflow > Email RecipientsAuto Release Invoice = Y.Send failure email = Y. | Expected: This is whom the release/posting failure email will send to. || Step 2: Set Recipients to a User1. Kick off New Invoice Workflow 2. Code the invoice so that it fails the release validation (invoice date fall out of range). | Expected: Invoice failed the release process. The user receive the email. || Step 3: Set Recipients to a Workgroup1. Kick off New Invoice Workflow 2. Code the invoice so that it fails the release validation (invoice date fall out of range). | Expected: Invoice failed the release process. The users in the workgroup (if they have email address in DB) receive the email. || Step 4: Set Recipients to a user without email address setup in database1. Kick off New Invoice Workflow 2. Code the invoice so that it fails the release validation (invoice date fall out of range). | Expected: Invoice failed the release process. User do not receive email nor any error indicating the email is not being sent. Raised a bug to fix this.bug 197479 - WF - Need an error indication when email recipient do not have email address setup in database.

Title: New Invoice Workflow - Accounting Correction Task - Getting the Accounting Correction Task validation
Steps: Step 1: Invoice will require Account Review when- Failing the Invoice Release Validation- Failing the Invoice Post Validation | Expected: One of the things checked in Release validation is invoice date to be in apm_parms range.For Post validation, it checks if the invoice is approved before posting it. || Step 2: Failing the Invoice Release Validation1. Kick off New Invoice Workflow2. Code the invoice so that it is in Complete state.3. Before Complete task, change the parms date so that the invoice date is out of range at the background.4. Complete task. | Expected: Accounting Correction Task received.*Tested as part of 197345 || Step 3: Failing the Invoice Post Validation1. Kick off New Invoice Workflow2. Code the invoice so that it is in Complete state.3. Before Complete task, set invoice as not approved so that it fails the post validation4. Complete task. | Expected: Accounting Correction Task received.*blocked by 197439

Title: New Invoice Workflow - Accounting Correction Task - Form Validation
Steps: Step 1: Turn off Is Accounting Review Always Required flag -Admin > Workflow > New Invoice WorkflowTurn off Approval workflow too. || Step 2: Pre reqGetting Accounting Correction Task.1. Kick off New Invoice Workflow.2. Code the invoice to Complete but ensure the Approved flag is unchecked.3. Complete task4. Receive Accounting Correction Task || Step 3: Tax not Calculated.Set Tax Include = Yes/No.Complete Task | Expected: Another Accounting Correction Task return. Raised as 189462 Workflow - error message enhancement on invoice failing the workflow release validation || Step 4: Invoice Amount not match.Change the amount so that invoice amount not matching details amount. Complete task. | Expected: Another Accounting Correction Task return. With the warning of Invoice Status must be in Ready for Posting status for Release. || Step 5: Tax Calculated and Invoice Amount matched. | Expected: Task complete and Invoice posted. || Step 6: Invoice not Approved | Expected: Another Accounting Correction Task return.

Also have issue with config with GUID type, causing task performer cannot be found even if the task performer is valid. | Expected: Bug 208375 Approvals WF does not work correctly when launched from app due to the values saved on the config

Title: Approval Workflow - Disbursement Approval - All Level - Approval Limit and Grouping - Multi Currency
Steps: Step 1: *After the Disb Approver has been identified, we check if user is in the approvers limit to approve the Disb It should only look at the invoice currency for approval limit. || Step 2: Pre reqSetup Disb ApproverAdmin | AP | Workflow | Invoice Approval Process | Disbursement ApprovalsMultiple approvals required - No (Unticked)Approval Level - 1Task Performer - Client Billing Employee Setup a matter that TTQA1 user as the Client Billing Employee. Setup Disb Approval LimitAdmin | AP | Workflow | Approvers and Approval Limits | Disbursement Approval LimitsCurrency : CADLower Limit : 9.99Upper Limit : 100.99 Currency : USDLower Limit : 100.99Upper Limit : 200.99 | Expected: *Use Expert Assistant proxy functionality or Workflow Admin to check task assignees || Step 3: Disb amount within limit - CAD1001. Create invoice with Disb line CAD100.2. Kick off approval workflow | Expected: TTQA1 receive the task. || Step 4: Disb  amount equal to Lower limit - CAD9.991. Create invoice with Disb line CAD9.992. Kick off approval workflow | Expected: TTQA1 receive the task. || Step 5: Disb amount equal to Upper limit - CAD100.991. Create invoice with Disb line CAD100.992. Kick off approval workflow | Expected: TTQA1 receive the task. || Step 6: Disb  amount out of limit1. Create invoice with Disb line CAD9.98.2. Kick off approval workflow3. Repeat with Disb line CAD101. | Expected: TTQA1 do not receive any approval task. Workflow proceed to next step || Step 7: Total Disb amount within limit - CAD1001. Create invoice with TWO Disb line , CAD50 each2. Kick off approval workflow | Expected: TTQA1 receive the Approval task. Both the Disb lines are grouped as one task and assign to TTQA1, || Step 8: Total Disb  amount out of limit - CAD1501. Create invoice with THREE Disb line , CAD50 each2. Kick off approval workflow | Expected: TTQA1 do not receive any approval task. Workflow proceed to next stepDisbursement amounts are totalled up and add up to CAD150, which do not fall into approval limit.Note that it is not looking at USD approval limit

Title: Payment Items - Invoice: Text Items for invoice, invoice GL, payment, cancel payment and invoice/payment GL
Steps: Step 1: Note: ensure the etxt items are created in the correct tables and copied from the correct text records || Step 2: Create an invoice1. Create new invoice- add narrative text2. Add a GL item- has narrative text with > 250 chrs3. Post the invoice | Expected: Invoice created- Invoice narrative text item created in APT_TEXTe.g. inv nar for c1- Invoice's GL narrative text item created in ACT_TEXT (system generated text with invoice narrative appendede.g. VENDOR: Jan Vendor 1; INVOICE#: JAN1-C1; DATE: 30/08/2018  -  inv nar for c1Invoice Narrative--SELECT ''[APT_INVOICE],TEXT_ID,* FROM APT_INVOICE ORDER BY TRAN_UNO desc  DECLARE @invoice as int=SELECT TRAN_UNO,SOURCE_UNO, inv.TEXT_ID,INVOICE_NUM,txt.TXT1, inv.* FROM  APT_INVOICE invLEFT JOIN APT_TEXT txt ON inv.TEXT_ID = txt.TEXT_IDWHERE inv.TRAN_UNO = @invoiceInvoice's GL Narrative--SELECT ''[APT_INVOICE],TEXT_ID,* FROM APT_INVOICE ORDER BY TRAN_UNO desc  DECLARE @invoice as int=SELECT je.GL_ROW_UNO,je.GL_TEXT_ID,txt.TXT1,je.* FROM ACT_TRAN_JE jeLEFT JOIN ACT_TEXT txt ON je.GL_TEXT_ID = txt.TEXT_IDWHERE je.TRAN_UNO = @invoice || Step 3: Add invoice to a payment1. Can create the payment and add invoice or quick pay the invoice- Add narrative to payment2. Save the payment | Expected: Payment created- Payment narrative text item created in APT_TEXTPayment NarrativeDECLARE @payment as int = --SELECT ''[APT_Check],TEXT_ID,* FROM APT_Check ORDER BY TRAN_UNO desc SELECT chk.REQUEST_NUM, chk.TRAN_UNO, chk.TEXT_ID, txt.TXT1,chk.* FROM APT_CHECK chkLEFT JOIN APT_TEXT txt ON chk.TEXT_ID = txt.TEXT_IDWHERE TRAN_UNO = @payment || Step 4: Post the payment | Expected: Invoice/Payment GL text item created- Invoice/Payment GL text item created in APT_TEXT with text value copied from Invoice's GL item in ACT_TEXTInvoice/Payment GL narrativeDECLARE @invoice as int = DECLARE @payment as int = --SELECT ''[APT_INVOICE],TEXT_ID,* FROM APT_INVOICE ORDER BY TRAN_UNO desc  --SELECT ''[APT_Check],TEXT_ID,* FROM APT_Check ORDER BY TRAN_UNO desc SELECT je.GL_ROW_UNO,je.GL_TEXT_ID,txt.TXT1,je.*  FROM APT_INVPMT_JE jeLEFT JOIN APT_TEXT txt ON je.GL_TEXT_ID = txt.TEXT_IDWHERE je.INV_TRAN_UNO = @invoice AND je.SOURCE_TRAN_UNO = @payment || Step 5: Cancel the payment- add text to the cancel narrative | Expected: Payment canceled- Payment narrative text item created for the reversal payment in APT_TEXT with text value copied from original- Payment Cancel narrative text item created for the reversal payment in ACT_TEXT - Invoice/Payment GL cancel text item created in APT_TEXT for reversed Invoice/Payment GL e.g. Cancellation of: VENDOR: Jan Vendor 1; INVOICE#: JAN1-C1; DATE: 30/08/2018  -  inv nar for c1Payment narrative for reversalDECLARE @reversalpayment asint=SELECT''[Canceled Payment cancel narrative ACT_TEXT],TRAN_UNO,TRANS_TYPE,atxt.TEXT_ID,SOURCE_UNO,at.ORIG_TRAN_UNO,TXT1,TXT_N,*FROM ACT_TEXT atxtJOIN ACT_TRAN at ON  atxt.SOURCE_UNO = at.TRAN_UNOWHERE atxt.SOURCE_UNO = @reversalpaymentPayment cancel  narrative for reversalDECLARE @reversalpayment asint=SELECT''[Canceled Payment cancel narrative ACT_TEXT],TRAN_UNO,TRANS_TYPE,atxt.TEXT_ID,SOURCE_UNO,at.ORIG_TRAN_UNO,TXT1,TXT_N,*FROM ACT_TEXT atxtJOIN ACT_TRAN at ON  atxt.SOURCE_UNO = at.TRAN_UNOWHERE atxt.SOURCE_UNO = @reversalpaymentInvoice/Payment GL cancel narrative for reversalDECLARE @invoice as int = DECLARE @reversalpayment as int = SELECT ''[Invoice/Paymemt GL cancel narrative APT_TEXT],je.GL_ROW_UNO,je.GL_TEXT_ID,txt.TXT1,txt.TXT_N,je.*  FROM APT_INVPMT_JE jeLEFTJOIN APT_TEXT txt ON je.GL_TEXT_ID = txt.TEXT_IDWHERE je.INV_TRAN_UNO = @invoice AND je.SOURCE_TRAN_UNO = @reversalpaymentORDER BY je.GL_ROW_UNO desc

Title: Payment Items - Invoice: GL text fix up script
Steps: Step 1: Note 1: ensure the text items are created in the correct tables and copied from the correct text recordsNote 2:Posting manager looks for the text record on APT_TEXT and does something with it. select * from glt_jrnl where gl_Row_uno=select * from glt_text where text_id = We were putting the record in ACT_TEXT in error and setting that ID on the APT_INVPMT_JE.GL_TEXT_ID and then the copde was looking at APT_TEXT using that FK and getting a record that was not related at all hense the need to a fix up script Note 3: Dev notesthe invoice has ACT_TRAN_JE entries, and they have a text id pointing to ACT_TEXT.  When a payment is posted containing that invoice, we create APT_INVPMT_JE entries for each gl transaction on the invoice, and these new entries also have a text id on them, the bug was this id was the exact same as on the ACT_TRAN_JE entry, but it should point to APT_TEXT. i.e. we should create a new entry and use its id on the newly created APT_INVPMT_JE row || Step 2: Pre preqsUnique keysMake sure CMS_UNIQUE_KEYS.LASTKEY for APT_TEXT > than for ACT_TEXT and that there is data in APT_TEXT with text_ids that match the ids that ACT_TEXT items will be created with nextExisting text itemsYou may have to play around with your data a bit to get into the state the clients are in | Expected: Example of stuff I had to doSELECT ''[APT_TEXT],* FROM APT_TEXT ORDER BY text_id  desc --LAST_MODIFIED descSELECT ''[ACT_TEXT],* FROM ACT_TEXT ORDER BY text_id  desc --LAST_MODIFIED descSELECT * FROM CMS_UNIQUE_KEYS WHERE TBNAME ='APT_TEXT'--was less than ACT_TEXTSELECT * FROM CMS_UNIQUE_KEYS WHERE TBNAME ='ACT_TEXT'UPDATE CMS_UNIQUE_KEYS SET LASTKEY = 230 WHERE TBNAME ='APT_TEXT'UPDATE CMS_UNIQUE_KEYS SET LASTKEY = 214 WHERE TBNAME ='ACT_TEXT'--*/--/*INSERT INTO APT_TEXT (TEXT_ID,COLUMN_ID,SOURCE_UNO,TXT1,TXT2,TXT3,TXT4,TXT5,TXT6,LAST_MODIFIED,TXT_N)SELECT 2220,0,1378,'pay nar test 1',NULL,NULL,NULL,NULL,NULL,'2018-08-30 08:13:39.000',NULLUNIONALLSELECT 2230,0,1378,'pay nar test 2',NULL,NULL,NULL,NULL,NULL,'2018-08-30 08:13:39.000',NULLUNIONALLSELECT 2240,0,1378,'pay nar test 3',NULL,NULL,NULL,NULL,NULL,'2018-08-30 08:13:39.000',NULLUNIONALLSELECT 2250,0,1378,'pay nar test 4',NULL,NULL,NULL,NULL,NULL,'2018-08-30 08:13:39.000',NULLUNIONALLSELECT 2260,0,1378,'pay nar test 5',NULL,NULL,NULL,NULL,NULL,'2018-08-30 08:13:39.000',NULLUNIONALLSELECT 2270,0,1378,'pay nar test 6',NULL,NULL,NULL,NULL,NULL,'2018-08-30 08:13:39.000',NULLUNIONALLSELECT 2280,0,1378,'pay nar test 7',NULL,NULL,NULL,NULL,NULL,'2018-08-30 08:13:39.000',NULLUNIONALLSELECT 2290,0,1378,'pay nar test 8',NULL,NULL,NULL,NULL,NULL,'2018-08-30 08:13:39.000',NULLUNIONALLSELECT 2300,0,1378,'pay nar test 9',NULL,NULL,NULL,NULL,NULL,'2018-08-30 08:13:39.000',NULL || Step 3: Run posting manager - so we have a clean start pointApp shell | General Ledger | Posting manager1. Select Go 2. Take a copy of the data in the GL as a starting position | Expected: Posting manager runs || Step 4: Set up data for several payments to be used as bad data1. Apply old SP APP_POST_Check_UpdateInvoicePayments2. Add invoices with GL items using expert.- GL items have narratives3. Add Invoices to payments4. Post payments5. Cancel some of the payments6. Insert text into the TXT_N field of the text items | Expected: Invoice/Payment GL text item createdThe text valuea are copied from the Invoice's GL item. They are incorrectly applied to ACT_TEXT instead of APT_TEXTInvoice's GL Narrative--SELECT ''[APT_INVOICE],TEXT_ID,* FROM APT_INVOICE ORDER BY TRAN_UNO desc  DECLARE @invoice asint=SELECT je.GL_ROW_UNO,je.GL_TEXT_ID,txt.TXT1,je.* FROM ACT_TRAN_JE jeLEFTJOIN ACT_TEXT txt ON je.GL_TEXT_ID = txt.TEXT_IDWHERE je.TRAN_UNO = @invoiceInvoice/Payment GL narrative--SELECT ''[APT_INVOICE],TEXT_ID,* FROM APT_INVOICE ORDER BY TRAN_UNO desc  --SELECT ''[APT_Check],TEXT_ID,* FROM APT_Check ORDER BY TRAN_UNO desc SELECT je.GL_ROW_UNO,je.GL_TEXT_ID,txt.TXT1,je.*  FROM APT_INVPMT_JE jeLEFT JOIN ACT_TEXT txt ON je.GL_TEXT_ID = txt.TEXT_IDWHERE je.INV_TRAN_UNO = @invoice AND je.SOURCE_TRAN_UNO = @paymentSELECT je.GL_ROW_UNO,je.GL_TEXT_ID,txt.TXT1,je.*  FROM APT_INVPMT_JE jeLEFT JOIN APT_TEXT txt ON je.GL_TEXT_ID = txt.TEXT_IDWHERE je.INV_TRAN_UNO = @invoice AND je.SOURCE_TRAN_UNO = @payment || Step 5: Set up data for several payments to be used as good data1. Apply new SP APP_POST_Check_UpdateInvoicePayments2. Add invoices with GL items using expert.- GL items have narratives3. Add Invoices to payments via expert4. Post payments5. Cancel some of the payments | Expected: Invoice/Payment GL text item createdThe text values are copied from the Invoice's GL item. They are correctly applied to APT_TEXT || Step 6: Set up data for invoice created via classic that should not be impacted by the fix up script1. Add invoice with GL item using classic.- GL item has narrative2. Add Invoice to payment via expert3. Post payment | Expected: Invoice/Payment GL text item createdThe text value is copied from the Invoice's GL item. It is correctly applied to APT_TEXT || Step 7: Run the fix up script | Expected: Script runs* All records from ACT_TEXT for the GLs belonging to invoices applied to expert checks are copied to APT_TEXT and the PK ids on APT_INVPMT_JE are updated* All records from APT_TEXT for the GLs belonging to invoices applied to classic checks remain unchanged, the PK ids on APT_INVPMT_JE are NOT updated and duplicates are NOT created---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- Text Items for invoice, invoice GL, payment, cancel payment desc*/DECLARE @invoice asint= 2519DECLARE @payment asint= 2520DECLARE @reversalpayment asint= (SELECT TRAN_UNO FROM ACT_TRAN WHERE TRANS_TYPE ='CHX'AND ORIG_TRAN_UNO = @payment)-- Invoice narrativeSELECT ''[Invoice Narrative APT_TEXT],TRAN_UNO,SOURCE_UNO, inv.TEXT_ID,INVOICE_NUM,txt.TXT1,txt.TXT_N, inv.* FROM  APT_INVOICE invLEFTJOIN APT_TEXT txt ON inv.TEXT_ID = txt.TEXT_IDWHERE inv.TRAN_UNO = @invoice-- Invoice's GL narrativeSELECT ''[Invoice's GL narrative ACT_TEXT],je.GL_ROW_UNO,je.GL_TEXT_ID,txt.TXT1,txt.TXT_N,je.* FROM ACT_TRAN_JE jeLEFTJOIN ACT_TEXT txt ON je.GL_TEXT_ID Title: Payment - Suppress Payment trigger that sets document type
Steps: Step 1: Pre reqsEmployee - has bank account in HBM_NAME_BANK (old classic bank account) and that is their default- HBA_BANK_PAYTYP linked to is the default e.g.UPDATE HBA_BANK_PAYTYP SET IS_DEFAULT = 'Y' where ROW_UNO = - does not have bank account in HBA_NAME_BANK_ACCOUNT (new expert bank accounts) SELECT EMPL_UNO,NAME_UNO,EMPLOYEE_NAME,EMPLOYEE_CODE,* FROM HBM_PERSNL e ORDER BY e.EMPL_UNO descVendor- has bank account in HBM_NAME_BANK (old classic bank account)- does not have bank account in HBA_NAME_BANK_ACCOUNT (new expert bank accounts) SELECT VENDOR_UNO,NAME_UNO,VENDOR_ID,VENDOR_NAME,* FROM APM_VENDOR v ORDER BY v.VENDOR_UNO desc  --ROW_UNO is from HBA_BANK_PAYTYPIF NOT EXISTS (SELECT * FROM CMS_UNIQUE_KEYS WHERE TBNAME = 'HBM_NAME_BANK')BEGININSERT INTO [dbo].[CMS_UNIQUE_KEYS] ([TBNAME]) VALUES ('HBM_NAME_BANK')ENDINSERT INTO HBM_NAME_BANK(BANK_UNO,ROW_UNO,NAME_UNO,BANK_NAME,BANK_SORT,BANK_ACCT,IS_DEFAULT)VALUES((SELECT LASTKEY FROM CMS_UNIQUE_KEYS WHERE TBNAME = 'HBM_NAME_BANK'),22,857,'ETST1',1,1234,'Y')UPDATE CMS_UNIQUE_KEYS SET LASTKEY = LASTKEY + 1 WHERE TBNAME = 'HBM_NAME_BANK'INSERT INTO HBM_NAME_BANK(BANK_UNO,ROW_UNO,NAME_UNO,BANK_NAME,BANK_SORT,BANK_ACCT,IS_DEFAULT)VALUES((SELECT LASTKEY FROM CMS_UNIQUE_KEYS WHERE TBNAME = 'HBM_NAME_BANK'),27,858,'VTST102',2,2234,'Y')UPDATE CMS_UNIQUE_KEYS SET LASTKEY = LASTKEY + 1 WHERE TBNAME = 'HBM_NAME_BANK' BACs is onSELECT * FROM CMS_OPTION WHERE OPTION_CODE='BACS' UPDATE CMS_OPTION SET FLAG_VALUE = 'Y' WHERE OPTION_CODE='BACS' || Step 2: Employee expense processed via classic scheduler1. Create an employee expense in expert 2. Create a check schedule in classic3. Add the expense to the check schedule4. Type = NA1Remit Vendor bank account 3Bank = BUSDPayment Type = NA2Remit Vendor bank account 4Bank = BCADPayment Type = NA1Remit Vendor bank account 5Bank = Payment Type = EBRemit Vendor  bank account 6Bank = Payment Type = MISCRemit Vendor bank account 7Bank = Payment Type = MISCRemit Vendor bank account 8Bank = BUSDPayment Type = NA2 | Expected: SELECT distinct v.VENDOR_ID,ba.BANK_CODE,ba.IS_DEFAULT[BA Default],bs.BANKING_SYSTEM_CODE,bs.INACTIVE[BS Inactive],bs.IS_DEFAULT[BS Default],ba.PAYMENT_TYPE_CODE,pt.INACTIVE[PT Inactive],ptlink.IS_DEFAULT[PT Default],ba.SEGMENT_1,ba.SEGMENT_2,ba.SEGMENT_3,ba.SEGMENT_4,ba.SEGMENT_5,ba.SEGMENT_6,ba.SEGMENT_7,ba.SEGMENT_8,ba.SEGMENT_9,ba.SEGMENT_10,v.VENDOR_NAME,ba.NAME_UNO,ba.BANK_ACCOUNT_UNO,ba.LAST_MODIFIED FROM HBA_NAME_BANK_ACCOUNT baJOIN APM_VENDOR v on ba.NAME_UNO = v.NAME_UNOJOIN HBL_BANK_PAYTYP pt ON ba.PAYMENT_TYPE_CODE = pt.PAYTYP_CODEJOIN HBL_BANKING_SYSTEM bs ON pt.BANKING_SYSTEM_UNO = bs.BANKING_SYSTEM_UNOJOIN HBA_BANK_PAYTYP ptlink ON ba.PAYMENT_TYPE_CODE = ptlink.PAYTYP_CODE AND pt.BANKING_SYSTEM_UNO = bs.BANKING_SYSTEM_UNO WHERE v.VENDOR_ID =''AND ba.BANK_CODE =''--AND bs.INACTIVE = 'N'--AND pt.INACTIVE = 'N'ORDER BY v.VENDOR_NAME,ba.BANK_CODE, bs.BANKING_SYSTEM_CODE,ba.PAYMENT_TYPE_CODE--UPDATE HBL_BANKING_SYSTEM SET INACTIVE = 'N' WHERE BANKING_SYSTEM_CODE = 'NACHA'--UPDATE HBL_BANK_PAYTYP SET INACTIVE = 'Y' WHERE PAYTYP_CODE = 'NA1'--UPDATE HBA_NAME_BANK_ACCOUNT SET IS_DEFAULT = 'Y' WHERE BANK_ACCOUNT_UNO = 333--UPDATE HBL_BANKING_SYSTEM SET IS_DEFAULT = 'Y' WHERE BANKING_SYSTEM_CODE = ''--UPDATE HBA_BANK_PAYTYP SET IS_DEFAULT = 'Y' WHERE BANK_CODE = '' AND PAYTYP_CODE = 'NA1' || Step 3: Form load defaultSelect to create new vendor invoiceUPDATE HBL_BANKING_SYSTEM SET IS_DEFAULT ='N'WHERE BANKING_SYSTEM_CODE ='DEF'UPDATE HBL_BANKING_SYSTEM SET IS_DEFAULT ='Y'WHERE BANKING_SYSTEM_CODE ='' | Expected: Bank section displayed based on default banking systemNote: This all the default fields on the banking system is used for, just initial layout on form load- Payment Type is always the first row- Account is always the second row with each segment of the account displayed based on the sort order- Other fields are displayed based on the sort orderSELECT bs.BANKING_SYSTEM_CODE,bf.SEGMENT_NAME,bf.ACCOUNT_NUMBER_SEGMENT,bf.SORT_ORDER,bf.* FROM HBA_BANK_ACCOUNT_FORMAT bfJOIN HBL_BANKING_SYSTEM bs ON bf.BANKING_SYSTEM_UNO = bs.BANKING_SYSTEM_UNO WHERE bs.IS_DEFAULT ='Y'ORDERBY bf.ACCOUNT_NUMBER_SEGMENT DESC, bf.SORT_ORDER || Step 4: Default payment type, no bank account for the default payment type1. No default payment type2. Set Account 3 as default2. Select to create new vendor payment3. Change both payment types to be non default2. Change all accounts to be non default3. Select to create new vendor payment4. Add vendor | Expected: Bank section displayed based on selected account- First account returned is selected (probably account 1)- Accounts that can be selected are (accounts 1,2,3,6,7,8) || Step 7: No default payment type, Account with no bank is the default1. No default payment type2. Set Account 7 as default2. Select to create new vendor payment3. Add vendor | Expected: Bank section displayed based on selected account- First account returned for where account has a bank is selected (probably account 1) - Accounts that can be selected are (accounts 1,2,3,6,7,8) || Step 8: Payment type for account with no bank is default, default bank account linked to default payment type 1. Set Payment type MISC to default2. Set Account 7 as default2. Select to create new vendor payment3. Add vendor | Expected: Bank section displayed based on selected account- Default account for default payment type is selected (account 1).- Always look for bank account details with both bank and payment type before it would consider any without a bank on them- Accounts that can be selected are (accounts 1,2,3,6,7,8) || Step 9: No default payment type, Default account that has a bank, Default account that does not have a bank1. No default payment type2. Set Accounts 7 and 8 as default2. Select to create new vendor payment3. Set Accounts 2 and 3 as default | Expected: Bank section displayed based on selected account- First Default account for the bank is selected (probably account 2)- Accounts that can be selected are (accounts 1,2,3,6,7,8)

Title: AP WF Upgrade - Initiate Workflow > New Invoice
Steps: Step 1: Setup Workflow Ensure workflows are correctly versioned post-upgrade. | Expected: Active and suspended workflows continue after upgrade to 821. Workflow started in 82 completes with 82 version; workflow started in 821 uses 821. || Step 2: Pre-requisite: Import Accounts Payable Workflow package | Expected: Workflow package is available for use. || Step 3: Launch Initiate WF from Expert Accounts Payable in Invoice Grid > New Invoice > Enter mandatory header data Create 2 invoice workflows: one Active, one Suspended. | Expected: New Invoice form loaded || Step 4: Tick confirmation boxes and click OK Confirm goods/services received and return invoice for coding. | Expected: Invoice submitted for coding || Step 5: Suspend one process via Expert Assistant Convert Active process to Suspended. | Expected: Coding task removed from AP dashboard > Task inbox || Step 6: Upgrade to new version Ensure workflows persist through upgrade. | Expected: System upgraded to version 821 || Step 7: Access Active Workflow task from Task Inbox Continue with active workflow. | Expected: Task available for processing || Step 8: Add 1 GL offset and 1 Disbursement offset Ensure correct financial entries. | Expected: GL & Disbursement items added to form || Step 9: Complete task Workflow progresses to review stage. | Expected: Accounting Review task is created || Step 10: Open and complete Accounting Review task Final step for active workflow. | Expected: Invoice status changes to 'Ready for Posting (C)' || Step 11: Resume Suspended Workflow via Expert Assistant Reactivate suspended workflow. | Expected: Coding task reappears in AP dashboard > Task inbox || Step 12: Open invoice entry form from Task Inbox Continue suspended workflow. | Expected: Invoice form is accessible || Step 13: Add 1 GL offset and 1 Disbursement offset Ensure correct financial entries. | Expected: GL & Disbursement items added to form || Step 14: Complete task Final step for suspended workflow. | Expected: Accounting Review task is created || Step 15: Open and complete Accounting Review task Final step for suspended workflow. | Expected: Invoice status changes to 'Ready for Posting (C)'

Title: AP Customization: Cancel to New - covers multiple line item types
Steps: Step 1: Test steps need to be completed || Step 2: Pre reqs Note: See test case 189920 for example of adding custom fieldsNote: This TC expects customizations to be applied on Employee Advance and Employee Invoice transactions so that Cancel to New can be verified on Employee Payments (this is not outlined in 189920 as these look to be derived from views) Add a custom field to each of the following:- can just be a text field APT_CHECK (Payment)APT_INVOICE (Invoice)APT_INVOICE_AMT (Invoice)ACT_TRAN_JE (GL)CDT_DISB (Disb)ACT_TRAN_CR_CL (Client Credit)ACT_TRAN_CR_MA (Matter Credit)ACT_TRAN_TRUST(Trust)APT_INVOICE_AMT (Expense report) || Step 3: Process a vendor wire payment1. Create payment- enter a value in the custom field- enter all other mandatory fields2. Add a GL item- enter a value in the custom field- enter all other mandatory fields3. Add a Disb item- enter a value in the custom field- enter all other mandatory fields4. Add an invoice- enter a value in the custom field- enter all other mandatory fields6. Post the payment7. Cancel to new | Expected: Payment is canceled to new - all custom fields are copied to the new payment and items || Step 4: Process a vendor wire payment for a trust1. Create payment- user a trust bank- enter a value in the custom field- enter all other mandatory fields2. Add a Trust item- enter a value in the custom field- enter all other mandatory fields3. Post the payment4. Cancel to newPayment is canceled to new - all custom fields are copied to the new payment and items | Expected: Payment is canceled to new - all custom fields are copied to the new payment and itemsBug 205335 - Apply Customization on TrustModel: TrustTransaction/TrustTransactionView does not pass to Query.ViewModel || Step 5: Process a client wire payment 1. Create payment- enter a value in the custom field- enter all other mandatory fields2. Add a client credit item- enter a value in the custom field- enter all other mandatory fields3. Add a matter credit item- enter a value in the custom field- enter all other mandatory fields4. Post the payment5. Cancel to newPayment is canceled to new - all custom fields are copied to the new payment and items | Expected: Payment is canceled to new - all custom fields are copied to the new payment and items || Step 6: Process an employee wire payment 1. Create payment- enter a value in the custom field- enter all other mandatory fields2. Add an advance item- enter all mandatory fields3. Add an employee report item- enter all mandatory fields4. Post the payment5. Cancel to newPayment is canceled to new - all custom fields are copied to the new payment and items | Expected: Payment is canceled to new - all custom fields are copied to the new payment and itemsBug 235031 - AP Customization - Employee Invoice Payment Details Form - Custom field does not save the contents when posted and does not carry over to new when using the Cancel to New function || Step 7: Process an invoice1. Create invoice- enter a value in the custom field- enter all other mandatory fields2. Add a GL item- enter a value in the custom field- enter all other mandatory fields3. Add a Disb item- enter a value in the custom field- enter all other mandatory fields6. Post the invoice7. Cancel to new | Expected: Invoice is canceled to new - all custom fields are copied to the new invoice and items

Title: Create Payments - Existing Wire Number
Steps: Step 1: *Note : Should not be able to create payments with duplicate wire numbers. | Expected: *Bug 205366 Payment schedule: able to create a payment with an existing wire number || Step 2: Pre reqVendor with Bank Accounts || Step 3: Bank Set to Auto Generate Wire Numbers || Step 4: Create Payment in Expert | Expected: CMS_UNIQUE_KEY updatedselect * from CMS_UNIQUE_KEYS where TBNAME like ('_TBM_BANK_WIRE%')  order by LAST_MODIFIED desc || Step 5: Create wire payments in expert classic as classic isn't auto generating, or set bank to not auto generate and add a payment in expert. | Expected: The cms_unique_keys is not updated as the wire number was not auto generated || Step 6: Ensure Bank is now set to auto generate wire numbers || Step 7: Create an invoice in expert || Step 8: Add the invoice to a payment schedule || Step 9: Create payment from the payment schedule | Expected: It should be the look for next number of the last wire number in CMS_UNIQUE_KEY but because the next one already exists, it will move on to the next valid number. It then assigns the next valid wire number to the payment and update CMS_UNIQUE_KEY.

Title: Client/Matter row level security FUTURE BUT DOES IMPACT DPs
Steps: Step 1: This is a copy from the infrastructure tests so needs reviewed when we introduce row level security || Step 2: Note 1: Each step in this test cases builds on the previous stepNote 2: The type of grant applied makes no difference to the outcome for the user as we're only checking that the user is not denied. The entity manager form needs some review as this is confusing to the user. See test case 194186Training:https://aderant.csod.com/default.aspx?ReturnUrl=https%3a%2f%2faderant.csod.com%2fphnx%2fdriver.aspx%3froutename%3dSocial%2fUniversalProfile%2fTranscript%26TargetUser%3d124%26isCompletionRedirect%3dtrue%26loStatus%3d16%26regnum%3d1%26loId%3dd3666061-3239-4a6e-8f55-88bd50b45627iknow:https://aderant.sharepoint.com/sites/Iknow/Expert/Lists/Posts/Post.aspx?List=30beb497-583f-4aa1-b731-298d7b40c50d&ID=2891&Web=15687d89-7e79-49be-8fed-8c53925290a3 || Step 3: Pre req dataClient - has 2 matters- has never had client or matter securityUser 1- has privilege level 1UPDATE HBM_PERSNL SET PRIVILEGE_LEVEL = 1 WHERELOGIN=''User 2 - does not have privilege level 1User 3 - does not have privilege level 1- can proxy user 2Group 1- EveryoneNote: For security setup you can use either classic or entity manager Note: For testing the consumption of the security, there are multiple apps that you can use but not all use proxy, so EA may be the easiest to use | Expected: Note: This SQL only works on user, not group so needs enhancedDECLARE @client asvarchar(2000)='JANSEC1'DECLARE @clientuno asINT=  (SELECT CLIENT_UNO FROM HBM_CLIENT WHERE CLIENT_CODE = @client)SELECT sp.SECURITY_ID [Plan], sp.DESCRIPTION,'CLIENT: (' + CLIENT_CODE + ') ' + CLIENT_NAME  [Secured Item],c.SECURITY_ID[Item's linked plan],sr.ROW_UNO [Secure row],e.EMPL_UNO,e.EMPLOYEE_NAME, sr.RIGHTS_MASK,DENY_VIEW,REVOKED,sp.TYPEFROM CMS_SECURE_PLAN spLEFTJOIN CMS_SECURE_ROW sr ON sr.SECURITY_ID = sp.SECURITY_IDLEFTJOIN HBM_PERSNL e ON sr.PERSON_OR_GROUP = e.EMPL_UNOLEFT JOIN HBM_CLIENT c  ON sp.SECURED_ROW_UNO = @clientunoWHERE sp.TABLE_ID = 102 AND c.CLIENT_UNO = @clientunoUNIONSELECT sp.SECURITY_ID [Plan], sp.DESCRIPTION,'MATTER: ('+ m.CLNT_MATT_CODE +') '+ MATTER_NAME [Secured Item],m.SECURITY_ID[Item's linked plan],sr.ROW_UNO [Secure row],e.EMPL_UNO,e.EMPLOYEE_NAME, sr.RIGHTS_MASK,DENY_VIEW,REVOKED,sp.TYPEFROM CMS_SECURE_PLAN spLEFTJOIN CMS_SECURE_ROW sr ON sr.SECURITY_ID = sp.SECURITY_IDLEFTJOIN HBM_PERSNL e ON sr.PERSON_OR_GROUP = e.EMPL_UNOLEFTJOIN HBM_MATTER m ON sp.SECURED_ROW_UNO = m.MATTER_UNOWHERE sp.TABLE_ID = 104 AND m.CLIENT_UNO = @clientuno || Step 4: Plan exists on client as on but has no secured recordsAdd just a plan to the client  (on) | Expected: - User 1 can see the client and both matters  - User 2 can see the client and both matters- User 3 can see the client and both matters- User 3 can proxy user 2 and see the client and both matters || Step 5: Plan exists on matter as on 1 but has no secured recordsAdd just a plan to matter 1 (on) | Expected: - User 1 can see the client and both matters - User 2 can see the client and both matters- User 3 can see the client and both matters- User 3 can proxy user 2 and see the client and both matters || Step 6: Plan exists but is not on and has no secured records1. Set client plan to off2. Set matter 1 plan to off | Expected: - User 1 can see the client and both matters- User 2 can see the client and both matters- User 3 can see the client and both matters- User 3 can proxy user 2 and see the client and both matters || Step 7: Plan exists and is not on but has secured user record1. Set client plan to on2. Apply a grant to user 2 on the client3. Set client plan to off | Expected: - User 1 can see the client and both matters- User 2 can see the client and both matters- User 3 can see the client and both matters- User 3 can proxy user 2 and see the client and both matters || Step 8: Grant to user 2 on the client1. Set client plan to on (it already has a grant to user 2) | Expected: - User 1 can see the client and both matters- User 2 can see the client and both matters- User 3 can’t see any- User 3 can proxy user 2  and can't see any because security is not based on proxy || Step 9: Grant to user 2 on matter 11. Set client plan to off2. Set matter plan on matter 1 to on3. Apply a grant to user 2 on matter 1 | Expected: - User 1 can see the client and both matters- User 2 can see the client and both matters- User 3 can't see matter 1- User 3 can proxy user 2 and can't see matter because security is not based on proxy || Step 10: Grant to Group on Client, Deny to user 2 on matter 11. Set client plan to on2. Apply a grant to group 1 on the the client3. Change the security for user 2 on matter 1 to deny | Expected: - User 1 can see the client and both matters- User 2 can't see matter 1- User 3 can see the client and both matters- User 3 can proxy user 2 and can see all because security is not based on proxy || Step 11: Grant to Group on Client, Deny to user 2 on matter 1, Disable row level security for user 21. Add user 2 to a security group that has DisableRowLevelSecurity (you'll find this under Matter) | Expected: - User 1 can see the client and both matters- User 2 can see the client and both matters- User 3 can see the client and both matters- User 3 can proxy user 2 and can see all because security is not based on proxy || Step 12: Grant to Group on Client, Deny to user 2 on client, Deny to user 2 on matter 1, Disable row level security for user 21. Apply a deny to user 2 on the the client | Expected: - User 1 can see the client and both matters- User 2 can't see the client- User 3 can't see matter 1- User 3 can proxy user 2 and can't see matter 1 because security is not based on proxy

Payment Schedule job runs | Expected: Int- CreatePayments_ShouldCreateAPaymentForSingleExpenseReportInt- CreatePayments_ShouldCreateAPaymentForMultipleExpenseReports_InOneGroupInt- CreatePayments_ShouldCreateAPaymentForSingleEmployeeAdvanceInt- CreatePayments_ShouldCreateAPaymentForMultipleEmployeeAdvances_InOneGroupPayments createdNote: Jurisdiction is blank and required and it still allows you to release and post- this is expected behaviourPayment 1ExpensePayment 2Advance || Step 6: May need to delete payments to clean up

Title: Rules: Errors
Steps: Step 1: Pre Req RulesRule 1 (that will always run on save)1. Design studio | Expert Accounts Payable | Rules | 2. Add rule to invoice save3. Enter name and code4. Add activity 1- Activity = Assign- To = test (a new variable of type Int32)- Value = 05. Add activity 2- Activity = Log- Log level = LogLevel.Info- Message = 5/testRule 2 (that will only run when there is a tax item)1. Design studio | Expert Accounts Payable | Rules | 2. Add rule to invoice save3. Enter name and code4. Add activity 1- Activity = Assign- To = test (a new variable of type Int32)- Value = 05. Add activity 2- Activity = Log- Log level = LogLevel.Info- Message = 5/test6. Add a condition- Field = TaxEntries.Count- Operator = 1- Value = 1 || Step 2: Save Invoice1. Activate rule 1 and deactivate rule 22. Add an invoice header and save | Expected: Rule failure and Invoice is not savedACT_TRAN and APT_INVOICE do not exist || Step 3: Save invoice and line item1. Activate rule 1 and deactivate rule 22. Add an invoice header and don't save3. Add a line item which will cause a save | Expected: Rule failure and Invoice is not savedACT_TRAN, APT_INVOICE and line item do not exist || Step 4: Save invoice on add of line item1. Deactivate rule 1 and deactivate rule 22. Add an invoice header and save3. Activate rule 14. Edit the header5. Add a line item which will cause a save | Expected: Rule failure and Invoice is not saved- ACT_TRAN and APT_INVOICE- Header edits not saved- line item does not exist || Step 5: Import Invoice via the import wizard1. Activate rule 1 and deactivate rule 22. Use the import wizard to import an invoice with a line item | Expected: Rule failure and Invoice is not savedACT_TRAN, APT_INVOICE and line item do not exist || Step 6: Import Invoice via the import wizard using a rule on calculate taxNote: (this is because the save and calculate tax are processed differently for the import than they are via the UI. The first pass for the invoice will not have failure. The second pass for the calculate tax will have a failure but we need to roll the whole save back)1. Inactivate rule 1 and activate rule 22. Use the import wizard to import an invoice with a line item3. Set the calculate tax to be Y or N by defaultUPDATE APM_PARMS SET DEFAULT_TAX_IN = 'Y'4. Set vendor details in EM- vendor must have a GL default (set up in EM)- set Jur = CAD5. Use the import wizard to import an invoice | Expected: Rule failure- ACT_TRAN, APT_INVOICE and line item exist- Tax item is created- Tax included has veen updated to removed- Status = Incomplete

Title: Invoice - GL details - Rounding of GL Plan Split
Description:
GL Plans should be operating as follows :
 
- the value that is entered on the invoice / payment GL Detail screen is split based on the percentages indicated in the plan
- the split values are rounded to the number of decimal places specified for the currency in question - so
- if the invoice is being entered in USD then the splits should be rounded to 2 decimal places, if the invoice is entered in JPY the splits should be to 0 decimal places.
- the splits are then added up to ensure that they balance to the original value that was entered
- if not, then the difference ( washup ) is applied to the split with the greatest value ( i.e. not to the last line )
- important - the washup step is ONLY done if the percentages in the plan add to exactly 100%. If the plan does NOT add to 100% then NO washup is performed. If they set up their plan with 33% and 66% this does not add to 100% so no washup is done. 
- the values that are saved to the database ( ACT_TRAN_JE ) are the rounded values after any washup has been performed
- when the invoice is POSTED, these values will be converted to system currency ( if different to the entry currency ) and at this time they will have lots of decimal places, based on the applicable DRUNO / exchange rate.
 
This should then replicate the functionality as per Classic
Steps: Step 1: See Summary tab on how the split and rounding works || Step 2: Pre reqGL Plan Setup1. 20,50,30% distribution2. 20,50,30,0.01% distribution3. 33,66% distribution4. 33.33, 66.66% distribution CurrencyUSD - 2 decimal pointsYEN - no decimal pointsTUD - 3 decimal points || Step 3: GL Plan split1. Create invoice2. On the GL form : GL Plan = 20,50,30% distributionAmount = $2003. Save & Close | Expected: Three GL lines created : $100, $60 and $440 || Step 4: GL Plan split with washup1. Create invoice2. On the GL form : GL Plan = 20,50,30% distributionAmount = $200.013. Save & Close | Expected: Three GL lines created : $100.01, $60.00 and $40.00Washup is applied the largest amount || Step 5: GL Plan split with washup on credit1. Create invoice2. On the GL form : GL Plan = 20,50,30% distributionAmount = -$200.013. Save & Close | Expected: Three GL lines created : -$100.01, -$60.00 and -$40.00Washup is applied the largest credit amount || Step 6: GL Plan split with washup when plan is not fully added up.1. Create invoice2. On the GL form : GL Plan = 33,66% distributionAmount = $2003. Save & Close | Expected: Two GL lines created : $66, $132Invoice Remaining Balance = $2 || Step 7: GL Plan split with washup when plan is not fully added up, 2 decimal points1. Create invoice2. On the GL form : GL Plan = 33.33, 66.66% distributionAmount = $2003. Save & Close | Expected: Two GL lines created : $66.66, $133.32Invoice Remaining Balance = $0.02 || Step 8: GL Plan split with washup when plan add up more than 100%1. Create invoice2. On the GL form : GL Plan =  20,50,30,0.01% distributionAmount = $2003. Save & Close | Expected: Four GL lines created : $100.00, $60.00, $40.00 and $0.02 || Step 9: GL Plan split with 0 decimal points Currency - YEN, with 33,661. Create invoice2. On the GL form : GL Plan = 33,66% distributionAmount = 200YEN3. Save & Close | Expected: Two GL lines created : 66YEN ,132YENInvoice Remaining Balance = 2YEN || Step 10: 0GL Plan split with 0 decimal points Currency - YEN, with 33.33,66.661. Create invoice2. On the GL form : GL Plan = 33.33, 66.66% distributionAmount = 200YEN3. Save & Close | Expected: Two GL lines created : 67YEN, 133YENInvoice Remaining Balance = 0YEN || Step 11: GL Plan split with 3 decimal points Currency - TUD, with 33.33,66.661. Create invoice2. On the GL form : GL Plan = 33.33, 66.66% distributionAmount = TUD200.0003. Save & Close | Expected: Two GL lines created : TuD66.660, TuD133.320Invoice Remaining Balance = TuD0.020

Title: Payment - Current and Next Period
Steps: Step 1: Note 1:There have been issues with the comparison of dates as some code was comparing with date/time but should be comparing as midnightNote 2:We only post to current or next period.Note 3:Transaction date must fall within the min/max dates for the subsystemNote 4:For a transaction to be posted in current period it needs the following to be true otherwise it will be posted to next period1. transaction date <= Month end date2. post date <= cutoff date | Expected: You can test out the SP for results e.g.UPDATE APM_PARMS SET CUT_DATE =Convert(DateTime,DATEDIFF(DAY, 0,GETDATE()))+1DECLARE @trandate DATETIME = '2014-08-16 00:00:00.000'  DECLARE @period CHAR(6) exec SP_CMSPOST_GETJEPERIOD @trandate, 'AP',  @period outputSELECT @period || Step 2: Transaction Date > Month End Date and Cutoff Date > today1. Example setupTBM_PARMS.CUR_PER = 201408TBM_PARMS.ME_DATE = 31/8/2014APM_PARM.CUT_DATE = Today + 12. Create and Post paymentPayment Date = 1/9/2014 | Expected: Payment saved in Next PeriodPeriod = 201409SELECT tbparms.CUR_PER,tbparms.ME_DATE,apparms.CUT_DATE,GETDATE()[Today/Time],Convert(DateTime, DATEDIFF(DAY, 0, GETDATE())) [Today] FROM TBM_PARMS tbparmsJOIN APM_PARMS apparms ON apparms.ROW_UNO = 1 SELECT REQUEST_NUM,EAP_INITIATED, CHECK_DATE, PERIOD FROM APT_CHECK WHERE REQUEST_NUM IN () || Step 3: Transaction Date = Month End Date and Cutoff Date > today1. Example setupTBM_PARMS.CUR_PER = 201408TBM_PARMS.ME_DATE = 31/8/2014APM_PARM.CUT_DATE = Today + 12. Create and Post paymentPayment Date = 31/8/2014 | Expected: Payment saved in Current PeriodPeriod = 201408 || Step 4: Transaction Date < Month End Date and Cutoff Date = Today - 11. Example setupTBM_PARMS.CUR_PER = 201408TBM_PARMS.ME_DATE = 31/8/2014APM_PARM.CUT_DATE = Today -12. Create and Post paymentPayment Date = 30/8/2014 | Expected: Payment saved in Next PeriodPeriod = 201409 || Step 5: Transaction Date < Month End Date and Cutoff Date = Today1. Example setupTBM_PARMS.CUR_PER = 201408TBM_PARMS.ME_DATE = 31/8/2014APM_PARM.CUT_DATE = Today2. Create and Post paymentPayment Date = 30/8/2014 | Expected: Payment saved in Current PeriodPeriod = 201408 || Step 6: Transaction Date < Month End Date and Cutoff Date > Today1. Example setupTBM_PARMS.CUR_PER = 201408TBM_PARMS.ME_DATE = 31/8/2014APM_PARM.CUT_DATE = Today + 12. Create and Post paymentPayment Date = 30/8/2014 | Expected: Payment saved in Current PeriodPeriod = 201408

Title: Smoke Test AP: Imaging - Invoice and Payment with client side printing off
Steps: Step 1: Note 1: If you have an existing Expert Image Database and have rolled back your Expert database, you will need to clean out the image files in EI database otherwise you will have conflicts when you create new records in Expert that use the same reference and request numbers previously used and stored in the EI database. | Expected: Cannot be run in build pipeline currently || Step 2: Note 2:There are 3 ways in AP where you can add files:- Manually add to Invoice- Manually add to Payment- Added to payment by the check print process  For the manually added files the AP application called the Expert Image SPs to load the references to these files into the Expert Image database For the ChecksWe don't run the SP to load these into the EI database as this would make the print checks job take too long. So the user must use the EI loader app and run the load job.Note: Sierra environment can not print Checks/ Remittance advices when Client side printing turned off. || Step 3: General Pre Reqs Client side printing off Admin | System | Printer settings | Client Side PrintingNote: Client Side Printing off does not work in Expert Sierra_APA env. i-e only Client side printing works in Sierra_APA env. || Step 4: Manually Attached to Invoice1. New Invoice- enter mandatory fields and save2. Attach Image- From the attach image ribbon button3. View Image from the details form- from the view image ribbon button4. View image from the grid- from the paper clip | Expected: File can be viewed Invoice Image Reference - Reference to the file is stored in : SELECT EI_ID,*FROM APT_INVOICE WHERE INVOICE_NUM =SELECT*FROM EXPERTIMAGING.dbo.IMG_HEADERS WHERETYPE_ID= 10 --Invoice imageEXEC EXPERTIMAGING.dbo.api_GetPaths 10,<EI_ID>--Invoice imageSELECT * FROM DDS_DRAFT || Step 5: Manually Attached to Payment1. New Payment (not a check type)- enter mandatory fields and save2. Attach Image- From the attach image ribbon button3. View Image from the details form- from the view image ribbon button4. View image from the grid- from the paper clip | Expected: File can be viewed Payment Image Reference- Reference to the file is stored in : SELECT EI_ID,* FROM APT_CHECK WHERE REQUEST_NUM = SELECT*FROM EXPERTIMAGING.dbo.IMG_HEADERS WHERETYPE_ID= 150 -- Payment image Fails in 821 EX0004 on the ITE - Mark to investigateFails on master ITE || Step 6: Attached to Payment from the print check job1. New check Payment- enter mandatory fields 2. Add line item3. Print the check4. Run the Check loader job from Expert Imaging (The assumption is that if you are running this test case, you know how to run the expert image loader)5. View Image from the details form- from the view image ribbon button6. View image from the grid- from the paper clip | Expected: File can be viewedNote: Sierra environment can not print checks when Client side printing turned off. Check Image Reference- Loader has copied the file From the source to EIDOCS\Checks\<month>- Loader has copied the reference to this file into the EI databaseBug 213340 - Payment: Can't open check attachments SELECT*FROM EXPERTIMAGING.dbo.IMG_HEADERS WHERE TYPE_ID= 50 -- Payment check image || Step 7: Attached to Payment from the print check job and manually1. New check Payment- enter mandatory fields 2. Add line item3. Print the check4. Run the Check loader job from Expert Imaging (The assumption is that if you are running this test case, you know how to run the expert image loader)5. Attach Image- From the attach image ribbon button6. View Images from the details form- from the view image ribbon button- loads the select image form and has both images avail and both can be viewed7. View image from the grid- from the paper clip- loads the select image form and has both images avail and both can be viewed | Expected: Files can be viewedNote: Sierra environment can not print checks when Client side printing turned off. Payment Image Reference- Reference to the file is stored in : SELECT EI_ID,* FROM APT_CHECK WHERE REQUEST_NUM = SELECT*FROM EXPERTIMAGING.dbo.IMG_HEADERS WHERE TYPE_ID= 150 -- Payment imageSELECT*FROM DDS_DRAFT Check Image Reference- Loader has copied the file From the source to EIDOCS\Checks\<month>- Loader has copied the reference to this file into the EI databaseSELECT*FROM EXPERTIMAGING.dbo.IMG_HEADERS WHERE TYPE_ID= 50 -- Payment check image || Step 8: Delete Attachment1. Open payment that has manual and check image2. Select to delete image3. View Image | Expected: Only the check file is avail to view
