Title: Invoice - Disb detail - Anticipated Disbursements Grid
Steps: Step 1: Pre req.In Admin App > Accounts Payable > Accounts Payable Options > Firm Options > 'Display Anticipated Disbursements Grid on Disbursement Cards' must be checked. | Expected: This enables the Anticipated Disbursements Grid to be displayed on the Disbursement card entry screen in Invoice entry. || Step 2: Create a disbursement in Expert Account Payable by selecting the Invoices tab and clicking the 'New Invoice' icon.- Fill out the details and save the invoice- Click on the Disbursements entry tab and click the Add New button. | Expected: The Grid is displayed and is empty. || Step 3: Select a Client/Matter for which you did not post any anticipated disbursement entries. | Expected: The Grid displays a message = 'No Search Results'. || Step 4: Select a Client/Matter according to the anticipated disbursement entries posted earlier. Note - the Hard/Soft flag is set to Hard for Invoice entry and cannot be changed here. | Expected: The Grid displays the entries according to the Client/Matter and Hard/Soft flag combination. Note - the rows that are displayed will only be posted anticipated disbursements which are not completely matched and which have no vendor attached to them or a vendor attached to them that is the same vendor select for this invoice entry. || Step 5: Change the Client/Matter. | Expected: The Grid updates once the field is selected and displays any relevant rows according to the Client/Matter and Hard/Soft flag combination. || Step 6: Click on one of the rows in the grid when:- the currency field matches the currency of the grid row selected- the currency field does not match the currency of the grid row selected. | Expected: The Copy to Disbursement button will only become enabled when the currency field matches the currency of the grid row selected.Note - the Currency field is copied across from the Invoice entry screen into the disbursement entry card and cannot be changed here. || Step 7: Once enabled click the Copy to Disbursement button. | Expected: The selected item is copied to the entry card as follows:- Disb. Code is updated to the item copied- Base amount is updated to the item copied- Bill amount is updated to the item copied. || Step 8: Save the disbursement as follows:- using the Save and Close button- using the Save and Add button and then the Crtl + F9 function. | Expected: - Using the Save and Close button, the disbursement is saved and the entry screen closed.- Using the Save and Add button and then the Crtl + F9 function, the disbursement is saved and the screen is cleared and then re-populated with the previous entries and the Grid is updated. || Step 9: Open/Edit:- an unposted invoice- a posted invoice. | Expected: - For an unposted invoice you can edit the disbursement and the Grid is displayed.- For a posted invoice you can View the disbursement and the Grid is not displayed.

Title: Payment Items - Disbursement: Anticipated Disbursement Grid
Steps: Step 1: Pre req.In Admin App > Accounts Payable > Accounts Payable Options > Firm Options > 'Display Anticipated Disbursements Grid on Disbursement Cards' must be checked. Anticipated Disb required:1 Hard Disbursement with Vendor1 Soft Disbursement with Vendor1 Hard Disbursement without Vendor1 Soft Disbursement without Vendor | Expected: This enables the Anticipated Disbursements Grid to be displayed on the Disbursement card entry screen in Payment entry. || Step 2: Create a disbursement in Expert Account Payable by selecting the Payments tab and clicking the 'New Payment' icon and using both the 'Vendor Payment' and 'Miscellaneous Payment' options.- Fill out the details and save the payment- Click on the Disbursements entry tab and click the Add New button. | Expected: The Grid is displayed and is empty. || Step 3: Select a Client/Matter for which you did not post any anticipated disbursement entries. | Expected: The Grid displays a message = 'No results found'. || Step 4: Select a Client/Matter according to the anticipated disbursement entries posted earlier. Note - the Hard/Soft flag is set to Hard for Payment entry and cannot be changed here. | Expected: The Grid displays the entries according to the Client/Matter and Hard/Soft flag combination. Note - the rows that are displayed will only be posted anticipated disbursements which are not completely matched and which have no vendor attached to them or a vendor attached to them that is the same vendor select for this payment entry. In Vendor Payment - displays anticipated disbursements for selected vendor.In Misc Payment - displays all unmatched anticipated disbursement without vendor || Step 5: Change the Client/Matter. | Expected: The Grid updates once the field is selected and displays any relevant rows according to the Client/Matter and Hard/Soft flag combination. || Step 6: Click on one of the rows in the grid when:- the currency field matches the currency of the grid row selected- the currency field does not match the currency of the grid row selected. | Expected: The Copy to Disbursement button will only become enabled when the currency field matches the currency of the grid row selected.Note - the Currency field is copied across from the payment entry screen into the disbursement entry card and cannot be changed here. || Step 7: Once enabled click the Copy to Disbursement button. | Expected: The selected item is copied to the entry card as follows:- Disb. Code is updated to the item copied- Base amount is updated to the item copied- Bill amount is updated to the item copied. || Step 8: Save the disbursement as follows:- using the Save and Close button- using the Save and Add button and then the Crtl + F9 function. | Expected: - Using the Save and Close button, the disbursement is saved and the entry screen closed.- Using the Save and Add button and then the Crtl + F9 function, the disbursement is saved and the screen is cleared and then re-populated with the previous entries and the Grid is updated. || Step 9: Open/Edit:- an unposted payment- a posted payment. | Expected: - For an unposted payment you can edit the disbursement and the Grid is displayed.- For a posted payment you can View the disbursement and the Grid is not displayed.

Title: Payment - Imaging: MAIN
Steps: Step 1: Note 1: If you have an existing Expert Image Database and have rolled back your Expert database, you will need to clean out the image files in EI database otherwise you will have conflicts when you create new records in Expert that use the same reference and request numbers previously used and stored in the EI database. || Step 2: Note 2:There are 3 ways in AP where you can add files:- Manually add to Invoice- Manually add to Payment- Added to payment by the print processes (check or remittance)For the manually added files the AP application calls the Expert Image SPs to load the references to these files into the Expert Image databaseFor the Checks/RemittancesWe don't run the SP to load these into the EI database as this would make the print checks job take too long. So the user must use the EI loader app and run the load job. || Step 3: Set Expert Image OnAdmin | System | Expert Imaging | Accounts Payable || Step 4: General Pre ReqsDocudraft:- folders- Views- templates- settingsPrinter Settings:UPDATE CMS_PRINTER SET NETWORK_PATH ='\\svfp301\PT_AKL_Development_01', DEVICE_NAME ='\\svfp301\PT_AKL_Development_01', PRINTER_DESC ='AK Dev 01'WHERE PRINTER_ID ='DEV01'UPDATE CMS_PRINTER SET NETWORK_PATH ='\\svfp301\PT_AKL_Reception_01',DEVICE_NAME ='\\svfp301\PT_AKL_Reception_01', PRINTER_DESC ='AK Recp 01'WHERE PRINTER_ID ='DEV02'Check formats e.g.UPDATE TBM_FMT_CH SETFILENAME='C:\CMS\81\Bin\CHKFMT01.RPT'WHERE FORMAT_CODE NOTIN ('CHK02','CHK03','CHK04','CHK05')UPDATE TBM_FMT_CH SETFILENAME='C:\CMS\81\Bin\CHKFMT02.RPT'WHERE FORMAT_CODE ='CHK02'UPDATE TBM_FMT_CH SETFILENAME='C:\CMS\81\Bin\CHKFMT02.RPT'WHERE FORMAT_CODE ='CHK03'UPDATE TBM_FMT_CH SETFILENAME='C:\CMS\81\Bin\CHKFMT02.RPT'WHERE FORMAT_CODE ='CHK04'UPDATE TBM_FMT_CH SETFILENAME='C:\CMS\81\Bin\CHKFMT02.RPT'WHERE FORMAT_CODE ='CHK05'UPDATE TBM_FMT_CH SETFILENAME='EXPERT_CHECK_FORMAT.docx', FORMAT_TYPE ='D'WHERE FORMAT_CODE ='BOTCHK'--BOTCHK was  C:\CMS\81\Bin\CHKFMT01.RPTOptions and parameters:UPDATE GLM_PARMS SET OVH_EMPL_UNO ='61'UPDATE CMS_OPTION SET FLAG_VALUE ='Y'WHERE OPTION_CODE ='JE_ODPC_DEF'UPDATE CMS_OPTION SET FLAG_VALUE ='Y'WHERE OPTION_CODE ='SALES_USE_TX'UPDATE APM_PARMS SET RECOV_CONT_REQD ='N'UPDATE CMS_OPTION SET FLAG_VALUE ='Y'WHERE OPTION_CODE ='1099_IN_USE'UPDATE TBM_BANK SET ASSIGN_WIRE_NUMBER ='Y',AUTO_WIRE_NUM ='Y'WHERE BANK_CODE ='BUSD'UPDATE TBL_TAX_BOOK SET ACCT_UNO = 127 WHERE BOOK = 1UPDATE CRM_PARMS SET TFR_CLNT_FIRM ='W'UPDATE APM_PARMS SETCUT_DATE ='2000-01-01 00:00:00.000',MIN_DATE ='2000-01-01 00:00:00.000',MAX_DATE ='2020-12-30 00:00:00.000'UPDATE CDM_PARMS SETMIN_DATE ='2000-04-01 00:00:00.000',MAX_DATE ='2022-05-30 00:00:00.000',CUT_DATE ='2012-05-01 00:00:00.000'UPDATE CRM_PARMS SETMIN_DATE ='2012-04-01 00:00:00.000',MAX_DATE ='2022-05-30 00:00:00.000',CUT_DATE ='2012-05-01 00:00:00.000' || Step 5: Manually Attached to Invoice1. View image from the grid- from the paper clip5. Delete image | Expected: File can be viewed- View button enabledInvoice Image Reference- Reference to the file is stored in : SELECT EI_ID,*FROM APT_INVOICE WHERE INVOICE_NUM =SELECT*FROM EXPERTIMAGING.dbo.IMG_HEADERS WHERETYPE_ID= 10 --Invoice imageEXEC EXPERTIMAGING.dbo.api_GetPaths 10,<EI_ID>--Invoice imageFile can be deleted- Delete button enabled || Step 6: Manually Attached to Payment1. Run the Check loader job from Expert Imaging - Open Expert Image- Go to Checks- In the middle column, click the Loader tab.- Check that the Source path is the Payments source path from admin and that the Destination path is where you want the files stored.- Click run5. View Image from the details form- from the view image ribbon button6. View image from the grid- from the paper clip | Expected: Copy of the PDF file in ExpertImage folder- Print check process is completed- PDF is created for the printed check- Copy of the PDF is copied to the ExpertImage folderSELECT * FROM CMS_UNIQUE_KEYS WHERE TBNAME ='APT_CHECK.PRINT_SESSION'SELECT * FROM DDM_PATHSSELECT * FROM DDS_DRAFTSELECT * FROM APT_CHECK_FORM WHERE BANK_CODE = '' AND CHECK_NUM = EXEC SECURITY.SetContextByName ''SELECT n.Path,n.Name,v.Content,v.Scope,v.UserOrGroupDisplayName,v.Id FROM Configuration.ConfigName n INNERJOIN Configuration.ConfigValue v ON n.Id = v.NameIdWHERE Path LIKE 'Technical.Applications.ExpertAccountsPayable.Options.ExpertImage%' File can be viewed- View button enabledCheck Image Reference- Loader has copied the file from Source file (from EISource if setup followed: C:\Expert Imaging\EISource\Checks) get loaded into Destination (Same path but with EIDOCS instead e.g. C:\Expert Imaging\EIDOCS\Checks\<month>)- Loader has copied the reference to this file into the EI database- Images can be viewed in AP through the paperclip(list screen) or View Image(entry screen).SELECT * FROM EXPERTIMAGING.dbo.IMG_HEADERS WHERE TYPE_ID= 50 -- Payment check imageFile can NOT be deletes- Delete button disabled || Step 8: Attached to Payment from the print remittance job1. View image from the grid- from the paper clip | Expected: Copy of the PDF file in ExpertImage folder- Print remittance process is completed- PDF is created for the remmitance- Copy of the PDF is copied to the ExpertImage folderSELECT * FROM CMS_UNIQUE_KEYS WHERE TBNAME ='APT_CHECK.PRINT_SESSION'SELECT * FROM DDM_PATHSSELECT * FROM DDS_DRAFTEXEC SECURITY.SetContextByName ''SELECT n.Path,n.Name,v.Content,v.Scope,v.UserOrGroupDisplayName,v.Id FROM Configuration.ConfigName n INNERJOIN Configuration.ConfigValue v ON n.Id = v.NameIdWHERE Path LIKE 'Technical.Applications.ExpertAccountsPayable.Options.ExpertImage%' File can be viewed- View button enabledCheck Image Reference- Loader has copied the file from Source file (from EISource if setup followed: C:\Expert Imaging\EISource\Checks) get loaded into Destination (Same path but with EIDOCS instead e.g. C:\Expert Imaging\EIDOCS\Checks\<month>)- Loader has copied the reference to this file into the EI database- Images can be viewed in AP through the paperclip(list screen) or View Image(entry screen).SELECT * FROM EXPERTIMAGING.dbo.IMG_HEADERS WHERE TYPE_ID= 50 -- Payment check imageFile can NOT be deletes- Delete button disabled || Step 9: Attached to Payment from the print check job and manually1. New check Payment- enter mandatory fields 2. Add line item3. Print the check4. Run the Check loader job from Expert Imaging 5. Attach Image- From the attach image ribbon button6. View Images from the details form- from the view image ribbon button- loads the select image form and has both images avail and both can be viewed7. View image from the grid- from the paper clip- loads the select image form and has both images avail and both can be viewed8. Delete image | Expected: Copy of the PDF file in ExpertImage folder for the printed check- Print check process is completed- PDF is created for the printed check- Copy of the PDF is copied to the ExpertImage folderFiles can be viewed- View button enabled- A selection box is displayed for the user to select which of the files to displayPayment Image Reference- Reference to the file is stored in : SELECT EI_ID,* FROM APT_CHECK WHERE REQUEST_NUM = SELECT*FROM EXPERTIMAGING.dbo.IMG_HEADERS WHERE TYPE_ID= 150 -- Payment imageCheck Image Reference- Loader has copied the file From the source to EIDOCS\Checks\<month>- Loader has copied the reference to this file into the EI databaseSELECT*FROM EXPERTIMAGING.dbo.IMG_HEADERS WHERE TYPE_ID= 50 -- Payment check imageManually added File can be deleted- Delete button enabled- Check file is not deletedBug 229684 - Payment: Delete Image button is not always enabled when it should be || Step 10: Manually Attached to Payment - multiple versions1. New Payment (not a check type)- enter mandatory fields and save2. Attach Image- From the attach image ribbon button3. Repeat the attach image multiple times (use a different image so you know we're picking up the correct one)- prompted to confirm4. View Image from the details form- from the view image ribbon button5. View image from the grid- from the paper clip6. Delete images | Expected: File can be viewed- View button enabled- Latest saved file is displayedPayment Image Reference- Reference to the file is stored in : SELECT EI_ID,* FROM APT_CHECK WHERE REQUEST_NUM = SELECT*FROM EXPERTIMAGING.dbo.IMG_HEADERS WHERETYPE_ID= 150 -- Payment imageFile can be deleted- Delete button enabled- Latest files deleted first- When one file is deleted, the previous one is now the one that will be viewed- When all files have been deleted the EI_ID field should be clearedBug 232364 - Payment: App crash viewing images when payment has a check image and a backup image that has been deleted

State Withhold Tax Applies  = ON UPDATE CMS_OPTION SET FLAG_VALUE ='Y'WHERE OPTION_CODE ='ST_WHTAX'2. Enter mandatory data || Step 4: State Withhold Tax Applies | Expected: - Defaults to Unchecked- Should be optional || Step 5: State CodeState Code lookup should match HBL_STATE | Expected: - Mandatory if 'State Withhold Tax Applies' is checked otherwise not allowed- Look up: State Codes- Only returns active State Codes  SELECT * FROM HBL_STATE  ORDER BY STATE_CODE || Step 6: State Withholding Tax Percentage | Expected: - Mandatory if 'State Withhold Tax Applies' is checked otherwise not allowed- Numeric only- Max decimal places = 4- Max value = 100- Cannot be negative || Step 7: State Tax Withheld Box Number | Expected: - Mandatory if 'State Withhold Tax Applies' is checked otherwise not allowed- Integer only- Min Value = 0- Max Value = 2,147,483,647 || Step 8: State Income Box Number | Expected: - Mandatory if 'State Withhold Tax Applies' is checked otherwise not allowed- Integer only- Min Value = 0- Max Value = 2,147,483,647 || Step 9: Save | Expected: Record savedData saved || Step 10: Edit the recordEdit  and save | Expected: Changes saved || Step 11: Create a 1099 code with no state withholding tax1. Enter mandatory data2. State Withhold Tax Applies  = OFF3. Save | Expected: Record saved- ST_CODE is Null- ST_WHTAX_PCNT is Null- ST_BOX_NUM is Null- ST_WH_BOX_NUM is Null || Step 12: Referential Integrity Check 1. Add the 1099 code to a vendor and saveYou can do this via Expert Entity ManagerVendor | Any Vendor | 1099 Code2. In Admin App attempt to delete the 1099 you just added to a vendor and save | Expected: Save PreventedYou shouldn't be able to delete a 1099 code that is in use.

Title: Vendor Payment Schedule - Payment default values with State Withholding Tax - Add Single
Steps: Step 1: Setup Withhold TaxUPDATE CMS_OPTION SET FLAG_VALUE ='Y'WHERE OPTION_CODE ='WHTAX_IN_USE'UPDATE APM_PARMS SET WHOLD_PCNT = 10Setup State Withhold Taxupdate CMS_OPTION set FLAG_VALUE = 'Y' WHERE  OPTION_CODE = 'ST_WHTAX'AP > 1099 Types.State Withholding Tax Percentage: 20% || Step 2: Create invoice with below criteria, Invoice Amt = 100 CAD,Pmt Term = 2%10 (Might have to create a new pmt term)Jurisdic = GSTWith'd Tax = CheckedState With'd Tax = CheckedTax Include = NoAdd a GL Detail wih 100Click 'Add Tax' | Expected: Tax Include change to 'Added' || Step 3: Post them. || Step 4: Add Single ScreenAdd invoice into USD schedule using Add Single Invoice screen. | Expected: Discount Amount = $1.831099 Amount =$89.74Payment Amount = $62.82Withheld Amount = $8.97State Withheld Amount = $17.95----------------------------------------------------------------------------------- Declarations ---------------------------------------------------------------------------------DECLARE @vendorid asVARCHAR (50)='tst2'DECLARE @invoice asVARCHAR (50)='mar29'DECLARE @vendoruno asint= (SELECT VENDOR_UNO FROM APM_VENDOR WHERE VENDOR_ID = @vendorid)DECLARE @tran AS INT = (SELECT TRAN_UNO FROM APT_INVOICE WHERE VENDOR_UNO = @vendoruno AND INVOICE_NUM =  @invoice)DECLARE @invoicecur as VARCHAR (10) = (SELECT CURRENCY_CODE FROM APT_INVOICE WHERE VENDOR_UNO = @vendoruno AND INVOICE_NUM =  @invoice)----------------------------------------------------------------------------------- Invoice session---------------------------------------------------------------------------------SELECT ''[APS_INVOICE_Z],* FROM APS_INVOICE_Z z JOIN APT_INVOICE inv ON inv.SESSION= z.SESSIONWHERE TRAN_UNO = @tran----------------------------------------------------------------------------------- Invoice -- When not posted, amounts are in invoice currency -- When posted amounts are in system currency based on the DRUNO for the invoice date? ---------------------------------------------------------------------------------SELECT''[APT_INVOICE],TRAN_UNO,SESSION,SCHEDULE_NUM,SOURCE_REF,INVOICE_NUM,i.NAME_UNO,i.ADDRESS_UNO,SOURCE,INVOICE_DATE,DRUNO,PERIOD,TC_CODE,TC_INV_AMT,CURRENCY_CODE,DUE_DATE,ORIGINAL_AMT,INV_AMT,BALANCE,SALES_USE_TAX,DISC_AMT,TAX_AMT,TEN99_AMT,EXPERT_INVOICE_STATUS,INVOICE_STATUS,EXP_RPT_STATUS,JURISDIC_CODE,TEN99_CODE,DISCTERM_CODE,APTYPE_CODE,USE_OVERRIDE,USE_NAME_OVERRIDE,USE_ADDRS_OVERRIDE,i.BILL_PMT_REQD,EAP_INITIATED,EI_ID,-- expertIMAGE_ID,-- classic----------------------------------------------------------------------------------- Bank Acount ---------------------------------------------------------------------------------i.BANK_ACCOUNT_UNO,ba.PAYMENT_TYPE_CODE,ba.SEGMENT_1,ba.SEGMENT_2,ba.SEGMENT_3,ba.SEGMENT_4,ba.SEGMENT_5,ba.SEGMENT_6,ba.SEGMENT_7,ba.SEGMENT_8,ba.SEGMENT_9,ba.SEGMENT_10,CASEWHEN i.TEXT_ID <> 0 THEN'('+CAST(i.TEXT_ID ASVARCHAR)+') '+ chqm.textELSE''END[Narrative],i.GL_AUDIT_NUM,i.APPROVED_DATE,i.CREATE_DATE,i.LAST_MODIFIED--,* FROM APT_INVOICE iLEFTJOIN HBA_NAME_BANK_ACCOUNT ba ON i.BANK_ACCOUNT_UNO = ba.BANK_ACCOUNT_UNOLEFTJOIN APV_AccountsPayableText chqm on i.TEXT_ID = chqm.TEXT_ID --Table is APT_TEXTWHERE TRAN_UNO = @tran----------------------------------------------------------------------------------- Invoice Amounts ---------------------------------------------------------------------------------SELECT''[APT_INVOICE_AMT],ia.ROW_UNO,INV_TRAN_UNO,SOURCE_TRAN_UNO,TRAN_TYPE,ia.SCHEDULE_NUM,CASE WHEN TRAN_TYPE = 'CH'  THEN (SELECT CAST(REQUEST_NUM AS VARCHAR) + ': ' + EXPERT_PAYMENT_STATUS FROM APT_CHECK WHERE TRAN_UNO = SOURCE_TRAN_UNO) ELSE '' END[Payment],SIGN,ia.TC_CODE,ia.TC_AP_AMT,ia.AP_AMT,ia.TC_PAID_AMT,ia.PAID_AMT,ia.TEN99_AMT,ia.ST_TEN99_AMT,ia.ST_WHTAX_AMT,DISCNT_AMT,ia.WHELD_AMT, ia.DRUNO,ia.PERIOD,ia.LAST_MODIFIED,*FROM APT_INVOICE_AMT ia--LEFT JOIN TBL_CURR_RATE r ON r.CURRENCY_CODE = ia.TC_CODE AND r.DRUNO = ia.DRUNOWHERE INV_TRAN_UNO = @tranORDERBY ia.ROW_UNO

Post it. || Step 3: Add invoice into payment and post the payment. | Expected: Verify APT_INVOICE_AMT.ST_WHTAX and ST_TEN99_AMT on the CH row(s) || Step 4: Cancel the posted payment. | Expected: Verify APT_INVOICE_AMT.ST_WHTAX and ST_TEN99_AMT on the CHX row(s), it should have the same values as CH row(s).

Title: Payment - Cancel to New: State Withholding Tax
Steps: Step 1: Pre reqs Set State Withheld tax in use--SELECT * FROM CMS_OPTION WHERE OPTION_CODE ='ST_WHTAX'UPDATE CMS_OPTION SET FLAG_VALUE ='Y'WHERE OPTION_CODE ='ST_WHTAX' Set the state withheld %Admin > AP > AP Options > 1099 Codes. || Step 2: Create and Post a Vendor Payment1. Create and Post an Invoice with 1099 Type setup as above2. Create payment- All mandatory fields2. Add the invoice3. Save4. Post | Expected: Payment is saved and posted APT_INVOICE_AMTAPT_INVOICE_AMT.ST_WHTAX_AMT and ST_TEN99_AMT on the CH row(s) || Step 3: Cancel to New | Expected: Payment canceled and new payment created - APT_INVOICE_AMT.ST_WHTAX and ST_TEN99_AMT on the new CH row.- ST_WHTAX value brings forward from cancelled payment.- ST_TEN99_AMT is set NULL.

Title: Invoice: Remit Vendor with Name and Address Overrides
Description: This test case is to ensure that the remit vendor's details are displayed onscreen with the ability for the user to change these details as required and then post the invoice. The selected details are saved to the DB. These saved details are then transferred across to the payment entry when the Quickpay option or the Payment Schedule option is used to pay these invoices.
Steps: Step 1: Pre req.Maintenance to be done on two existing vendors or add two new vendors, which need to be setup as follows in Entity Manager > Vendor Maintenance:1 - Vendor A to be setup with the remit vendor set as itself (Vendor A), 2 - Vendor B to be setup with the remit vendor set as Vendor A above.For both these vendors setup:a - Two or more remittance addresses and the override name for each address, with one being set as the default,b - Two or more bank accounts, with one being set as the default bank,c - Two or more related payees with their own remit address, its override name and bank account. With one of each item being set as the default value for that item. || Step 2: Create an invoice for each vendor in Expert Account Payable by selecting the Invoices tab and clicking the 'New Invoice' icon. In the Invoice entry screen that opens:1 - Select Vendor A in the vendor data provider, select a bank account from the bank control dropdown list and fill out the other required details and save and close the invoice.2 - Select Vendor B in the vendor data provider, select a bank account from the bank control dropdown list and fill out the other required details and save and close the invoice. | Expected: 1 - Vendor A will be displayed in the remit vendor data provider together with its default override name and address below that.2 - Vendor A will be displayed in the remit vendor data provider together with its default override name and address below that. Note that the override name and address of the remit vendor is greyed out. This is due to the "Pay By Electronic Banking" option being ticked. This means that the bank details will be used when this invoice is paid either via the quickpay or via the payment schedule option. || Step 3: Open and post the invoices created in step 2 above:1 - With Vendor A selected and Vendor A displayed as the remit vendor in that data provider.2 - With Vendor B selected and Vendor A displayed as the remit vendor in that data provider. | Expected: Select VENDOR_UNO, REMIT_VEND_UNO, BANK_ACCOUNT_UNO, USE_OVERRIDE, USE_NAME_OVERRIDE, NAME_UNO, USE_ADDRS_OVERRIDE, ADDRESS_UNO from APT_INVOICE order by LAST_MODIFIED desc- VENDOR_UNO  = result 1 is uno of Vendor A and result 2 is uno of Vendor B- REMIT_VEND_UNO = uno of Vendor A is the result for both 1 & 2- BANK_ACCOUNT_UNO  = the uno of the bank account selected for result 1 or result 2- USE_OVERRIDE  = N- USE_NAME_OVERRIDE  = N- NAME_UNO  = 0- USE_ADDRS_OVERRIDE  = N- ADDRESS_UNO  = 0 || Step 4: Create and save 2 invoices as per step 2 above.1 - With Vendor A selected and Vendor A displayed as the remit vendor in that data provider.2 - With Vendor B selected and Vendor A displayed as the remit vendor in that data provider. Open each invoice saved above and untick the "Pay By Electronic Banking" tickbox, which de-activates the bank account control below it. Save and post the invoice. | Expected: When first opening each invoice the details are displayed as they have been saved above.When unticking the "Pay By Electronic Banking" option the bank account control becomes inactive and the override name and address is not greyed out anymore.This means that the override name and address details will be used when this invoice is paid via check.  Select VENDOR_UNO, REMIT_VEND_UNO, BANK_ACCOUNT_UNO, USE_OVERRIDE, USE_NAME_OVERRIDE, NAME_UNO, USE_ADDRS_OVERRIDE, ADDRESS_UNO from APT_INVOICE order by LAST_MODIFIED desc- VENDOR_UNO  = result 1 is uno of Vendor A and result 2 is uno of Vendor B- REMIT_VEND_UNO = uno of Vendor A is the result for both 1 & 2- BANK_ACCOUNT_UNO  = 0- USE_OVERRIDE  = N- USE_NAME_OVERRIDE  = N- NAME_UNO  = 0- USE_ADDRS_OVERRIDE  = N- ADDRESS_UNO  = 0 || Step 5: Create and save 2 invoices as per step 2 above.1 - With Vendor A selected and Vendor A displayed as the remit vendor in that data provider.2 - With Vendor B selected and Vendor A displayed as the remit vendor in that data provider. Open each invoice saved above and untick the "Pay By Electronic Banking" tick box, which de-activates the bank account control below it.Click the ellipsis (box with three dots […]), which is at the bottom of the address displayed.This opens up the Related Payee / Override Address selection box. Leave the Payee as displayed and change the address to the next address on the dropdown list.  Save and post the invoice. | Expected: When first opening each invoice the details are displayed as they have been saved above.When clicking the ellipsis and selecting the next address those details are now displayed onscreen.This override name and address details will be used when this invoice is paid via check.  Select VENDOR_UNO, REMIT_VEND_UNO, BANK_ACCOUNT_UNO, USE_OVERRIDE, USE_NAME_OVERRIDE, NAME_UNO, USE_ADDRS_OVERRIDE, ADDRESS_UNO from APT_INVOICE order by LAST_MODIFIED desc- VENDOR_UNO  = result 1 is uno of Vendor A and result 2 is uno of Vendor B- REMIT_VEND_UNO = uno of Vendor A is the result for both 1 & 2- BANK_ACCOUNT_UNO  = 0- USE_OVERRIDE  = Y- USE_NAME_OVERRIDE  = Y- NAME_UNO  = name uno of Vendor A- USE_ADDRS_OVERRIDE  = Y- ADDRESS_UNO  = address uno of Vendor A || Step 6: Create and save 2 invoices as per step 2 above.1 - With Vendor A selected and Vendor A displayed as the remit vendor in that data provider.2 - With Vendor B selected and Vendor A displayed as the remit vendor in that data provider. Open each invoice saved above and untick the "Pay By Electronic Banking" tick box, which de-activates the bank account control below it.Click the ellipsis (box with three dots […]), which is at the bottom of the address displayed.This opens up the Related Payee / Override Address selection box. The Payee currently displays the remit vendor. Change the payee to another related payee. Then the address dropdown list displays the address of the related payee selected.  Save and post the invoice. | Expected: When first opening each invoice the details are displayed as they have been saved above.When clicking the ellipsis and selecting another related payee the address dropdown list changes to the address details of the related payee which is selected and now displayed onscreen.This related payee name and address details will be used when this invoice is paid via check.  Select VENDOR_UNO, REMIT_VEND_UNO, BANK_ACCOUNT_UNO, USE_OVERRIDE, USE_NAME_OVERRIDE, NAME_UNO, USE_ADDRS_OVERRIDE, ADDRESS_UNO from APT_INVOICE order by LAST_MODIFIED desc- VENDOR_UNO  = result 1 is uno of Vendor A and result 2 is uno of Vendor B- REMIT_VEND_UNO = uno of Vendor A is the result for both 1 & 2- BANK_ACCOUNT_UNO  = 0- USE_OVERRIDE  = Y- USE_NAME_OVERRIDE  = Y- NAME_UNO  = name uno of the selected related payee of Vendor A- USE_ADDRS_OVERRIDE  = Y- ADDRESS_UNO  = address uno of the selected related payee of Vendor A

Title: Invoice List - Grid - Outstanding Balance after Part Payment of Vendor Invoice in Foreign Currency
Steps: Step 1: Pre req.2 Vendor records, each setup with a different currency other than the system currency. For each vendor add a bank account for Currency 1 & Currency 2.Vendor 1 with Currency 1 and Vendor 2 with Currency 2.Enter currency exchange rates as follows:- Currency 1, on Day 1 - rate to system currency = 0.7  - Currency 1, on Day 2 - rate to system currency = 0.5- Currency 2, on Day 1 - rate to system currency = 1.5  - Currency 2, on Day 2 - rate to system currency = 2.0 || Step 2: Post an invoice in their own currency for each vendor above in Expert Accounts Payable => Invoices => New Invoice. In the Invoice entry screen that opens:1 - Select vendor 1 in the vendor data provider, enter an invoice amount of 1000, select the invoice date as Day 1 above, enter the all other required fields and complete and post the invoice. 2 - Select vendor 2 in the vendor data provider, enter an invoice amount of 1000, select the invoice date as Day 1 above, enter the all other required fields and complete and post the invoice. Close the invoice to return to the invoice grid and search for the invoices posted. | Expected: 1 - The outstanding amount column will display the amount of 1000 in Currency 1 for that vendor.2 - The outstanding amount column will display the amount of 1000 in Currency 2 for that vendor. || Step 3: Post a vendor payment for the invoice captured above in Expert Accounts Payable => Payments tab => New Payment => Vendor Payment. In the Payment entry screen that opens:1 - Select vendor 1 in the vendor data provider, enter a payment amount of 200, select a bank for Currency 1 above, select the payment date as Day 2 above, enter the all other required fields and search for and select the invoice captured in 1 above. Complete and post the payment. 2 - Select vendor 2 in the vendor data provider, enter a payment amount of 200, select a bank for Currency 1 above (payment currency must be different to invoice currency), select the payment date as Day 2 above, enter the all other required fields and search for and select the invoice captured in 2 above. Complete and post the payment. Close the payment, return to the invoice grid and search for the invoices posted. | Expected: 1 - The outstanding amount column will display the amount of 800 in Currency 1 for that vendor.2 - The outstanding amount column will display the amount of 571.44 in Currency 2 for that vendor.Calculation of outstanding amount:1000 - 428.56 = 571.44 in Currency 2Payment of 200 in Currency 1 = 428.56 in Currency 2."Currency 1" / "Day 1 rate for Currency 1" * "Day 1 rate for Currency 2" = 200 / 0.7 * 1.5

Title: Payment - Misc: Create with vendor name record
Description: This is to test the scenario where the user is not allowed to create vendor payments using the miscellaneous payment function. If the user selects a vendor to be paid via the miscellaneous payment function then they receive a message with the option to be redirected to the vendor payment entry screen.
Steps: Step 1: Pre req.In Entity Manager, setup Name and Vendor records as follows: 1 - Name record linked to an active vendor.2 - Name record linked to an inactive vendor.3 - Name record linked to 2 (or more) vendors, all vendors being active.4 - Name record linked to 2 (or more) vendors, all vendors being inactive.5 - Name record linked to 2 (or more) vendors, 1 vendor being active & all the other vendors being inactive.6 - Name record linked to 2 (or more) vendors, 2 vendors being active & all the other vendors being inactive.Note:If the Name record is inactive, then when entering a miscellaneous payment and selecting such a name record the user is notified that it is inactive and given the option to cancel or continue and also has the ability to make the name record active whilst continuing with the payment. This does not impact the validation of miscellaneous payment to vendors as it is done after the inactive Name notifications to the user. | Expected: As Per Test Case 177985, for testing of Miscellaneous payment to inactive name records. || Step 2: Testing of the scenarios where vendor, client and employee payments are allowed to be done via the miscellaneous payment function. | Expected: As per Test Case 177963 || Step 3: Miscellaneous payments to vendors will not be allowed once the Firm Option is changed as follows:In Admin App > Accounts Payable > Accounts Payable Options > Firm Options > Allow Miscellaneous Payments to Vendors must be unchecked. Then click Save. | Expected: On Table APM_PARMS > ALLOW_MISC_VENDOR_PAYT must be N || Step 4: Create a payment in Expert Account Payable by selecting the Payments tab and clicking the 'New Payment' button and choosing Miscellaneous Payment from the dropdown list. In the Name search and selection screen that opens up, Search for and then select a name record setup as per the pre req. list above. Then click the Use Existing Name button and then click Finish on the screen thereafter.Scenario tested:  1 - Name record linked to an active vendor.2 - Name record linked to an inactive vendor.3 - Name record linked to 2 (or more) vendors, all vendors being active.4 - Name record linked to 2 (or more) vendors, all vendors being inactive.5 - Name record linked to 2 (or more) vendors, 1 vendor being active & all the other vendors being inactive.6 - Name record linked to 2 (or more) vendors, 2 vendors being active & all the other vendors being inactive. | Expected: The user receives a popup message advising them that this name record is linked to a vendor and if they proceed, they will be changed to the vendor payment type. The user can choose to cancel the operation.Note: Inactive vendor records are not counted when determining the message to display as vendor payments are not allowed against inactive vendors. Message 1 - is where the name record is linked to a single vendor and if they proceed, they will be changed to the vendor payment entry screen, wherein the vendor will be automatically selected in its data provider.Message 2 - is where the name record is linked to multiple vendors and if they proceed, they will be changed to the vendor payment entry screen and they will need to choose the appropriate vendor in its data provider. Scenario Results:1 - Message 1 received2 - Misc. payment created as the name has no active vendor attached to it and is treated as any other name.3 - Message 2 received4 - Misc. payment created as the name has no active vendor attached to it and is treated as any other name. 5 - Message 1 received6 - Message 2 received || Step 5: Create a payment in Expert Account Payable by selecting the Payments tab and clicking the 'New Payment' button and choosing Miscellaneous Payment from the dropdown list.      In the Name search and selection screen that opens up, Search for and then select a name that is not attached to a vendor. Then click the Use Existing Name button and then click Finish on the screen thereafter.In the miscellaneous payment entry screen that opens click the search icon in the vendor data provider and search for and then select a name record setup as per the pre req. list above.Scenario tested:  1 - Name record linked to an active vendor.2 - Name record linked to an inactive vendor.3 - Name record linked to 2 (or more) vendors, all vendors being active.4 - Name record linked to 2 (or more) vendors, all vendors being inactive.5 - Name record linked to 2 (or more) vendors, 1 vendor being active & all the other vendors being inactive.6 - Name record linked to 2 (or more) vendors, 2 vendors being active & all the other vendors being inactive. | Expected: The user receives a popup message advising them that this name record is linked to a vendor and if they proceed, they will be changed to the vendor payment type. The user can choose to cancel the operation.Note: Inactive vendor records are not counted when determining the message to display as vendor payments are not allowed against inactive vendors.Message 1 - is where the name record is linked to a single vendor and if they proceed, they will be changed to the vendor payment entry screen, wherein the vendor will be automatically selected in its data provider.Message 2 - is where the name record is linked to multiple vendors and if they proceed, they will be changed to the vendor payment entry screen and they will need to choose the appropriate vendor in its data provider.Scenario Results:1 - Message 1 received2 - Misc. payment created as the name has no active vendor attached to it and is treated as any other name.3 - Message 2 received4 - Misc. payment created as the name has no active vendor attached to it and is treated as any other name. 5 - Message 1 received6 - Message 2 received

Title: Workflow - Perform AP Tasks Security
Description: This test case specifically deals with the scenario where a user needs to be able to perform some workflow tasks for the new invoice workflow, yet they do not need any access to any other functions in the AP application.The "PerformAPApplicationTasks" security permission is added to allow this flexibility. This security permission is expected to be used solely with the "ExpertAccountsPayableApplication" security permission. In order for a firm to manage these users, it may be beneficial for them to set up an AP Workflow security policy that only has these permissions applied as any other permissions selected will add to the user's available functions accordingly.
Steps: Step 1: Pre req.1 - Setup the AP new Invoice workflow. 2 - Setup a security policy that only has the following two permissions applied to it and allocate it to a user without any other security policies allocated:- ExpertAccountsPayableApplication- PerformAPApplicationTasks3 - Start a New Invoice workflow and allocate the Code Invoice task to the user above.Note - if any other security permission is allocated to the user then the AP application will display these items as per the selections made. || Step 2: Start the AP application as the selected user. | Expected: The AP Application opens up to the Task Inbox. || Step 3: Click the back button on the Task Inbox | Expected: The application navigates to the tabs section, which displays an inactive Invoices tab and an active Recent Activities tab. No other AP feature or function is displayed. || Step 4: Select and open the "Code Invoice" workflow task allocated to this user via Expert Assistant or the AP application task inbox. | Expected: The task opens in the AP Application Invoice Entry screen and allows the user to make the necessary selections and Save and Complete the task if the entry screen is populated correctly.No other AP functions or features are available to the user.

Title: Payments - grid: Export to Excel
Steps: Step 1: Data Pre reqs:- Need to be able to see some data returned for every amount column so make sure there is data to support this- Negative Amounts- Difference currencies that have different number of decimal places || Step 2: Export to Excel1. Search for then data2. Export to Excel | Expected: Grid values are exported to excel- Currency symbol is an extra column to the left for each amount column- Amount columns no longer have currency symbol- For negative amounts, the brackets are stripped out and replaced with a minus sign- Amounts are still formated based on the currency for number of decimals- Maths functions work

Title: Invoice Entry - Duplicate Invoice Number Checking across Parent and Other Subsidiaries
Steps: Step 1: Note: This does not cover tempory vendors || Step 2: Pre. req.1. Maintenance to be done on three existing vendors or add three new vendors, which need to be setup as follows in Entity Manager > Vendor Maintenance:- Vendor A setup with parent vendor as itself, select the Use Subsidiaries and Enforce Unique Invoice Numbers Across Subsidiaries tickboxes.- Vendor B setup with parent vendor as Vendor A.- Vendor C setup with parent vendor as Vendor A.2. Post an invoice (in AP > Invoices > New Invoice) for the vendors above, each with a unique number as follows:- Vendor A invoice number DUPINVA- Vendor B invoice number DUPINVB- Vendor C invoice number DUPINVC || Step 3: Create an Invoice for Vendor A in Expert Accounts Payable > Invoices > New Invoice and in the entry screen that opens up enter the invoice number as follows:a - enter invoice number DUPINVAb - enter invoice number DUPINVBc - enter invoice number DUPINVC | Expected: In the Invoice entry screen the invoice number field outline turns red to indicate that the number entered is a duplicate and when you hover your mouse over the field the problem message is displayed as follows:a - Duplicate Invoice Number.b - Duplicate invoice number found on vendor (Vendor B) with the same parent vendor.c - Duplicate invoice number found on vendor (Vendor C) with the same parent vendor. || Step 4: Create an Invoice for Vendor B in Expert Accounts Payable > Invoices > New Invoice and in the entry screen that opens up enter the invoice number as follows:a - enter invoice number DUPINVAb - enter invoice number DUPINVBc - enter invoice number DUPINVC | Expected: In the Invoice entry screen the invoice number field outline turns red to indicate that the number entered is a duplicate and when you hover your mouse over the field the problem message is displayed as follows:a - Duplicate invoice number found on parent vendor (Vendor A).b - Duplicate Invoice Number.c - Duplicate invoice number found on vendor (Vendor C) with the same parent vendor.

Title: Performance - Release Payment with Trust
Steps: Step 1: Client stats | Expected: These are their numbers for the total records in ACT_TRAN_TRUST:Allens 919,711Dentons 626,774Norton Rose 1,060,342Orrick 209,377Quarles 44,823 || Step 2: Pre req data Trust Bank Client/Matter- For the trust accounts Trust account- Has trust credit amount 50,101,000 Bulk Trust accountsLoad via scriptNote: The number of trust accounts for this test is about 5 times more than any client has- All for the same trust bank and same matter- 500,000 accounts- 10 CH rows each (so 5,000,000 rows) | Expected: Sql Used to populate bulk data ------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------ Declarations------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------ Set these variables DECLARE @trustnametxt as varchar(20) = 'Bulk' DECLARE @matter as int = (SELECT MATTER_UNO FROM HBM_MATTER WHERE CLNT_MATT_CODE = 'TBULK1.1')DECLARE @bank as varchar (10) = 'TBULK1'--Set Number of records required DECLARE @numrecords as int = 400000 -- how many trust accounts do you want to addDECLARE @numrecordspayments as int = 10 -- how many trust payment amounts do you want to add -- *** Don't change these variables ***DECLARE @recordcount as intDECLARE @recordcountpayments as int DECLARE @lastkey as int = (SELECT LASTKEY FROM CMS_UNIQUE_KEYS WHERE TBNAME = 'TRM_TRUST')DECLARE @lastkeytp as int = (SELECT LASTKEY FROM CMS_UNIQUE_KEYS WHERE TBNAME = 'ACT_TRAN_TRUST')DECLARE @trustname as varchar (50)DECLARE @tranuno as int = 999999------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------ Add trust accounts----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------SET @recordcount = 0WHILE @recordcount <> @numrecordsBEGINSET @lastkey = @lastkey + 1SET @trustname = @trustnametxt + CAST(@lastkey as nvarchar)INSERT INTO TRM_TRUST (TRUST_UNO,TRUST_NUM,MATTER_UNO,BANK_CODE,TRUST_NAME,BALANCE,ON_MAT_REAL_INV,INV_DOCS_HELD,PAY_INTEREST,INT_PLAN_CODE,INT_RATE,HOLD_AMT,INT_EARNED,BANK_CHARGES,MIN_BALANCE,INACTIVE,ACCT_TYPE,TEN99_CODE,TEXT_ID,OPEN_DATE,OPEN_EMPL_UNO,ACCT_NUMBER,DEPOSIT_TERMS,CLOSE_DATE,CLOSE_EMPL_UNO,LAST_STMT_DATE,STMT_WAIVED,AVAILABLE_AMT,BENEFICIARY_UNO,TRUST_TYPE,INV_DESCRIPTION,INVESTED_DATE, LAST_MODIFIED) VALUES (@lastkey,@lastkey,@matter,@bank,@trustname,0,'','','N','',0,0,0,0,0,'N','G','',0,Convert(DateTime, DATEDIFF(DAY, 0, GETDATE())),100111,'','',NULL,0,NULL,'N',0,0,'COST','',NULL, getdate() )------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------ Add trust accounts payments----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------SET @recordcountpayments = 0WHILE @recordcountpayments <> @numrecordspaymentsBEGINSET @lastkeytp = @lastkeytp + 1INSERT INTO ACT_TRAN_TRUST (ROW_UNO,TRAN_UNO,TRUST_UNO,TRAN_TYPE,TRAN_DATE,PERIOD,GL_AUDIT_NUM,SIGN,AMOUNT_TYPE,AMOUNT,REMARKS,HELD,DRUNO,TRX_TYPE_CODE,WITHHOLD_TAX,TC_AMOUNT,TC_CODE ,LAST_MODIFIED) VALUES (@lastkeytp,@tranuno,@lastkey,'CH',Convert(DateTime, DATEDIFF(DAY, 0, GETDATE())),0,0,-1,'P',10.0000000000,'Bulk Test Data','N',0,'DEF',0.0000000000,10.0000000000,'USD' ,getdate())------------------------------------------------------ Update trust payment counts ----------------------------------------------------SET @recordcountpayments = @recordcountpayments + 1END------------------------------------------------------ Update trust counts ----------------------------------------------------SET @recordcount = @recordcount + 1END------------------------------------------------------ Update last keys----------------------------------------------------UPDATE CMS_UNIQUE_KEYS SET LASTKEY = @lastkey WHERE TBNAME = 'TRM_TRUST' UPDATE CMS_UNIQUE_KEYS SET LASTKEY = @lastkeytp WHERE TBNAME = 'ACT_TRAN_TRUST' ------------------------------------------------------ Misc----------------------------------------------------/*SELECT * FROM TRM_TRUST WHERE BANK_CODE = 'TBULK1' AND TRUST_NAME LIKE'Bulk%'order by TRUST_UNO descSELECT * FROM ACT_TRAN_TRUST WHERE TRAN_UNO = 999999order by ROW_UNO desc*/------------------------------------------------------ Clean up----------------------------------------------------/*DELETE FROM TRM_TRUST WHERE BANK_CODE = 'TBULK1' AND TRUST_NAME LIKE'Bulk%'DELETE FROM ACT_TRAN_TRUST WHERE TRAN_UNO = 999999*/ || Step 3: Create payment with trust1. Create a client payment- Use the pre req client and bank- small amount e.g. $12. Add a trust item- use the pre req client- use the trust that you added the credit toNote: The Trust DP will behave poorly but in real life the trusts would not all be attached to the same matter so this is not an issue | Expected: Payment savedReady for posting || Step 4: Release | Expected: Was taking 10 secs on the VM during pre test - using 822 versionWas taking 30 secs with the real update (this needs to be looked at, might just be the VM) - using 822 version || Step 5: 100,000 Trusts with 10 payments each | Expected: Performance Environment Release4 secs - using 822 version Release where amount would reduce below bank min4 secs - using 822 versionrange from 15 - 25 secs - using 822 version RC build

Title: Recurrring Invoice: Generate Invoice - Auto-release Recurring Invoices
Steps: Step 1: Setup:Admin |  AP Options | Firm Options | Auto-release Recurring Invoices. || Step 2: Generate invoice with Auto-release Recurring Invoice = N, generated manually 1. Turn Auto-release Recurring Invoice = N2. Create a balanced recurring invoice.3. Generate invoice manually | Expected: Generated invoice is in Ready to Post state. || Step 3: Generate invoice with Auto-release Recurring Invoice = N, generated automatically1. Turn Auto-release Recurring Invoice = N2. Create a balanced recurring invoice.3. Generate invoice automatically via scheduler manager. (remember to close the RI before running the schedule.) | Expected: Generated invoice is in Ready to Post state. || Step 4: Generate invoice with Auto-release Recurring Invoice = N with tax calculation1. Turn Auto-release Recurring Invoice = N2. Create a balanced recurring invoice with Tax Included = Y and Jurisdiction with Tax setup. 3. Generate invoice manually | Expected: Generated invoice is in Ready to Post state.Tax is also calculated. || Step 5: Generate invoice with Auto-release Recurring Invoice = Y1. Title: Invoice - Cancel - Cancel to New - Regenerate Internal Reference
Steps:
Step 1: Setup:Firm OptionsAdmin > Firm Options > Assign Internal Reference select*from CMS_UNIQUE_KEYS where TBNAME in ('APT_INVOICE.INTERNAL_REF.TOR','APT_INVOICE.INTERNAL_REF.TLH','APT_INVOICE.INTERNAL_REF') || Step 2: Assign Internal Reference = On Invoice Save, 
1. Create an invoice.
2. Save it. It should have the Internal Reference populated.3. Post it.4. Cancel the invoice to new invoice. | Expected: A new Internal Reference generated on the new invoice. Generated Internal Reference format is based on Internal Reference Source. (See TC 223293) || Step 3: Assign Internal Reference = On Invoice Post,
1. Create an invoice.
2. Post it. It should have the Internal Reference populated.3. Cancel the invoice to new invoice. | Expected: Internal Reference not generated on the new invoice.It will generate a new one again when you post this new invoice.Generated Internal Reference format is based on Internal Reference Source. (See TC 223982)

Reconcile. || Step 4: Listed below are field getting updated on Posting Invoice with GL item || Step 5: Invoice Disbursement entry cancelledCDT_DISB- WIP_Status = 'X'- Expert_disb_status = 'X'- Last_modifed || Step 6: Matching Disbursement entry (with negative ToBill_Amt) cancelledCDT_DISB- WIP_Status = 'X'- Expert_disb_status = 'X'- Last_modifed || Step 7: Original Matched Anticipated Disbursement entry reverts back to 'New'CDT_DISB_ANTIC.Source_Tran_Type = BL- Status = 'N'- Disb_balance = 100- Reversed = 'NULL' | Expected: 181242 Invoice Cancel - Inconsistent entries on cancelling invoice with Anticipated Disbursement. FIXED || Step 8: Matched Anticipated Disbursement set to ReversedCDT_DISB_ANTIC.Source_Tran_type = AP- Period = current period.- Reversed = 'Y' | Expected: 181242 Invoice Cancel - Inconsistent entries on cancelling invoice with Anticipated Disbursement. FIXED || Step 9: Insert New row for Cancelled Anticipated Disbursement.CDT_DISB_ANTIC.Source_Tran_type = APX- Status = blank field                   - Disb_Amt = 100- Match_Amt = -100- Reversed = 'R' || Step 10: Two Disbursement Modification entries created. CDT_DISB_MODThey should be identical except for :#Entry 1- Type = 'X', Base_Amt_Var = -100, ToBill_amt = -100, Std_Amt = -100#Entry 2- Type = 'M' (?), Base_Amt_Var = 0, ToBill_amt = 100, Std_Amt = 0 | Expected: 181242 Invoice Cancel - Inconsistent entries on cancelling invoice with Anticipated Disbursement. FIXED || Step 11: Update Disbursement Summary tableCDH_SUMMARY_GL- Base_Mod = previous amount + (-100)- last_modified || Step 12: Update Matter Summary tableTBH_MATTER_SUMM - Hard_Tot = previous amount + (-100)- Last_modified || Step 13: Update Vendor Summary and Vendor Year table.APH_VENDOR_YEAR and APH_VENDOR_SUMM

Title: Invoice - Cancel - Cancel disbursement with split
Steps: Step 1: Pre req1 Client.Matter with disbursement auto split setup.1 Client.Matter with disbursement delayed split setup. || Step 2: Cancel invoice with disbursement with Auto Split1. Create an invoice with disbursement for Client.Matter with auto split.2. Post it.3. Cancel invoice. | Expected: Each splitted disbursement cancelled as individual disbursement. || Step 3: Cancel invoice with Multicurrency disbursement with Auto Split1. Create an multicurrency invoice with disbursement for Client.Matter with auto split.2. Post it.3. Cancel invoice. | Expected: Each splitted disbursement cancelled as individual disbursement. || Step 4: Cancel invoice with disbursement with Delay Split1. Create an invoice with disbursement for Client.Matter with delay split.2. Post it. Process delayed split in Billing.3. Cancel invoice.*Billing do not allow delayed auto split for split total % <>100. | Expected: Each splitted disbursement are not cancelled. Instead a conta entry with negative amounts in CDT_DISB_MOD to balance the disb amount is created for each of them. These contra entries have SOURCE_TRAN_TYPE = 'APX'. || Step 5: Cancel invoice with Multicurrency disbursement with Delay Split1. Create a multicurrency invoice with disbursement for Client.Matter with delay split.2. Post it. Process delayed split in Billing.3. Cancel invoice.*Billing do not allow delayed auto split for split total % <>100. | Expected: Each splitted disbursement are not cancelled. Instead a conta entry with negative amounts in CDT_DISB_MOD to balance the disb amount is created for each of them. These contra entries have SOURCE_TRAN_TYPE = 'APX'.

Title: Invoice - Cancel - Cancel to New disbursement split
Steps: Step 1: Pre req1 Client.Matter with disbursement auto split setup.1 Client.Matter with disbursement delayed split setup. || Step 2: Cancel To New Disbursement - Client.Matter has auto splits setup 1. Create an invoice2. Add disbursement with Client.Matter to invoice2. Post it. 3. Cancel to New | Expected: FAIL As per: - Bug 188433. Getting an error message when you select Cancel. - Bug 181637 Cancel to New Invoice/Payment with disbursement split, disbursement will be split further when posting the New Invoice/Payment.) || Step 3: Cancel to New disbursement - Client.Matter with auto splits setup & delayed split disabled.1. Create an invoice2. Add disbursement with Client.Matter to invoice2. Post it.3. Cancel to New | Expected: FAILInvoice with any disbursement matter that has delayed split disabled or null, should not be able to be canceled to new. As the split has already occurred on post, so cancel to new is not allowed. || Step 4: Cancel to New disbursement - Client.Matter with auto splits setup and delayed split enabled, but none of matter's disbursements are on a PreBill.1. Check that no disbursements are on PreBill for Client.Matter.2. Create an invoice3. Add disbursement with Client.Matter to invoice4. Post it.5. Cancel to New | Expected: SUCCESSAll disbursement matters on invoice should have delayed split enabled and the matters have no disbursements on a prebill. No splitting has occurred so cancel to new is allowed. || Step 5: Cancel to New disbursement - Client.Matter with auto splits setup and delayed split enabled, but matter has disbursements on a PreBill.1. Create PreBill for Client.Matter2. Create an invoice3. Add disbursement with Client.Matter to invoice4. Post it.5. Cancel to New | Expected: FAILAll disbursement matters on invoice should have delayed split enabled. However at least one matter has a disbursement on a PreBill, meaning there is a potential for splits to have occurred in billing. So cancel to new is not allowed. || Step 6: Cancel to New disbursement - Multiple disbursements- First disbursement's matter has auto splits setup and delayed split enabled.- Second disbursement's matter has auto splits setup and delayed split disabled.2. Create an invoice3. Add disbursements listed above to invoice4. Post it.5. Cancel to New | Expected: FAILMix of disbursement matters having delayed split enabled or disabled, to verify that the code is catching if there are any disbursement matters which have delayed split as false. So cancel to new is not allowed because a split has already occurred on at least one. || Step 7: Auto disb splits are set up for a matter but not enabledSet Up- Enable Auto Disb Split = off- Enable Delayed Split = off- Some Disb splits are setup1. Create invoice2. Add disb for the matter3. Post the invoice4. Cancel to New the invoice | Expected: SuccessThe invoice can cancel to new as the splits are not enabled therefore will not occurCancel to New failed || Step 8: Delayed Auto disb splits are set up for a matter but not enabledSet Up- Enable Auto Disb Split = off- Enable Delayed Split = on- Some Disb splits are setup1. Create invoice2. Add disb for the matter3. Post the invoice4. Create a prebill with the disbs5. Cancel to New the invoice | Expected: FAILThe invoice can't be canceled to new even tho the splits are not enabled because they could become enabled after the invoice is posted and before the prebill is posted

Title: Payment - Vendor: Remmittance Vendor
Description:
The default address display in the payment screen for vendor payment should be as follow
 
Quote Dave's: 

For a Vendor Payment ( as opposed to Employee, Client or Misc ) we should first look for an Address_Uno on APM_Vendor and use that. 
If one is not present on APM_Vendor ( i.e. the uno is 0 ) then we look for the Address_Uno on the HBM_Name record for the Vendor ( i.e. where vendor.Name_Uno = name.Name_Uno ). 
If that address_Uno is also 0, then we look for the first address that we can find that is attached to the name record ( ie. from HBM_Address where address.Name_Uno = name.Name_Uno )
 
Since the search hiearchy is APM_vendor > hbm_name > hbm_address, we will test this from the lowest hierachy for minimal setup required.
Steps: Step 1: Data pre reqsVendor 1- Vendor sending in the invoiceVendor 2- Vendor to whom the payment will be made- This vendor is set as Vendor 1's remmittance vendor || Step 2: Create an invoice1. Create invoice for vendor 1 2. Add details3. Save and post | Expected: Posted invoice for vendor 1 || Step 3: Pay vendor 21. Create a vendor payment for vendor 22. Select to add an invoice - vendor will default to vendor 23. Change the vendor to vendor 14. Select the invoice5. Save and close | Expected: Invoice added to payment- Grid correctly displays vendor and remmittance vendor || Step 4: View Invoice details1. Reopen the invoice details | Expected: Invoice details- Form displays vendor 1 and all the invoice details correctly

Title: Expert Disb: Post Button: Check availability on Disbursement Tab
Description: Here is the criteria for the Post button being available:​available for multi-selectthe Post button should only be enabled if :the user has the PostDisbursement security permissionall selected items have ED_Initiated = 'Y' ( cannot post items that were created in classic )all selected items have an Expert_Disb_Status of either 'E' or 'R ( edit or released )all selected items have a Source_Tran_Type of 'CDN' - i.e. the transaction has come from the Disbursements application ( you cannot post a disbursement which originated in AP )there are no 'un-overridden' validation messages against any of the items ( nothing in CDT_Message table ) ( Note - if a message has been overridden, then that is OK )
Steps: Step 1: Log into Disbursements with a user that does not have 'PostDisbursements' security setting. Go to the Disbursements Tab and select a disbursement that was created in Expert but not in a posted status (WIP). | Expected: Post button will be disabled. || Step 2: Log into Disbursements with a user that does have 'PostDisbursements' security setting. Go to the Disbursements Tab and select a disbursement that was created in Expert but not in a posted status (WIP). | Expected: Post button will be enabled. || Step 3: Using the Search select, in the Created in Expert field select 'No'. | Expected: Post button will be disabled. || Step 4: Using the Search select, in the Created in Expert field select 'Yes'. | Expected: Post button will be enabled if all the other criteria is met. || Step 5: Using the Search select, in the Status field select all except E and R (Edit and Released). | Expected: Post button will be disabled. || Step 6: Using the Search select, in the Status field select E and R (Edit and Released). | Expected: Post button will be enabled if all the other criteria is met. || Step 7: Using the Search select, in the Created in Expert field select 'Yes'. Highlight a disbursement that is not 'CDN' in the Source type field. | Expected: Post button will be disabled for any source types that aren't CDN. || Step 8: Using the Search select, in the Created in Expert field select 'Yes'. Highlight a disbursement that is 'CDN' in the Source type field. | Expected: Post button will be enabled if all the other criteria is met.

Title: Invoice - Post - Auto Split Multicurrency Disbursement
Steps: Step 1: Pre-reqSetup Matter to have Auto Split disbursement setup.Matter 1 - Source Matter- Auto splits enabledMatter 2 - Child matter- 30% splitMatter 3- Child matter- 50% split.*See attached SQL for split disbursement related tables || Step 2: Create an invoice with a disbursement line with CAD100, using the Matter 1.Post it || Step 3: CDT_DISBOriginal record in CDT_DISB gets updated.Another two records created. | Expected: Record 1 (Original record) :- Source Matter- Base_Amt = 18.31~, 20% of entered amount. (the 20% which unassigned to any matter).- ToBill_amt = 18.31~- Std_amt = 18.31- Transferred = 'N'Record 2 (Split record 1) :- Child Matter- Base_Amt = 27.47~, 30% of entered amount. - ToBill_amt = 27.47~- Std_amt = 27.47- Transferred = 'S'Record 3 (Split record 2) :- Child Matter- Base_Amt = 45.79~, 30% of entered amount. - ToBill_amt = 45.79~- Std_amt = 45.79- Transferred = 'S' || Step 4: CDT_DISB_NEWA new record created after post. | Expected: Base_Amt, Tobill_amt and std_amt are the amount before split. USD 91.5744388053Type = 'N', Regular disbursement || Step 5: CDT_DISB_ORIGA new record for before split. (Split are done after post) | Expected: Base_Amt, Tobill_amt and std_amt are the amount before split. USD 91.5744388053Type = 'N', Regular disbursement || Step 6: CDT_DISB_MODThree records created. | Expected: Record 1 - neg73.26~ on the amount fields. Indicate  80% ($91.57) of original amount has been splitted out and deducted from the source matter.- Type = 'O', Split outRecord 2 - 27.47~ on the amount fields. Indicate 30% ($91.57) has been splitted out from source matter and added to the child matter. - Type = 'I', Split In.Record 3- 45.79~ on the amount fields. Indicate 50% ($91.57) has been splitted out from source matter and added to the child matter.- Type = 'I'. Split In. || Step 7: CDH_SUMMARY_GLThree records updated/created for each matter,cost_code and period combination | Expected: Record 1- Source Matter- Base_New = previous amount + 91.57- Base_Mod = previous amount + (-73.259551) 80% has been splitted to child matters- Tobill_New = previous amount + 91.57- Tobill_Mod= previous amount + (-73.259551) Record 2- Child Matter- Base_Mod = previous amount + 27.47, 30% splitted from source matter- Tobill_mod = previous amount + 27.47, 30% splitted from source matterRecord 3- Child Matter- Base_Mod = previous amount + 45.79, 50% splitted from source matter- Tobill_mod = previous amount + 45.79, 50% splitted from source matter || Step 8: TBH_MATTER_SUMMThree records updated/created for each matters | Expected: Record 1- Source Matter- Hard_Tot = previous amount + 18.31, 20% which not assigned to anyone- Hard_Count = previous count + 1- Hard_Wip_Bal = previous amount + 18.31Record 2- Child Matter- Hard_Tot = previous amount + 27.47, 30% splitted from source matter- Hard_Count = previous count + 1- Hard_Wip_Bal = previous amount + 27.47Record 3- Child Matter- Hard_Tot = previous amount + 45.79, 50% splitted from source matter- Hard_Count = previous count + 1- Hard_Wip_Bal = previous amount + 45.79 || Step 9: APH_VENDOR_YEAR updated || Step 10: APH_VENDOR_SUMM updated || Step 11: ACT_TRANupdated || Step 12: APS_INVOICE_ZStatus updated to P

Title: Payment Items - Disbursement: Post and cancel with auto splits where disb is billed
Steps: Step 1: Pre reqsMatter 1 - Source Matter- Auto splits enabledMatter 2 - Child matter- 30% splitMatter 3- Child matter- 50% splitMatter 4 | Expected: Use PAY - Disb auto splits.sql----------------------------------------------------------------------------------- Declarations---------------------------------------------------------------------------------DECLARE @payment as int = 368DECLARE @clientmatters as VARCHAR (2000) = 'tst5.2,tst5.3,tst5.4,tst5.5' --'tst113.1,tst113.2,tst113.3,tst113.4'DECLARE @paymenttrans as int = (SELECT TRAN_UNO FROM APT_CHECK WHERE REQUEST_NUM = @payment AND REVERSAL <> 'Y' )DECLARE @paycur as VARCHAR (10) = (SELECT CURRENCY_CODE FROM APT_CHECK WHERE TRAN_UNO = @paymenttrans )DECLARE @contrapaymenttrans as int = (SELECT TRAN_UNO FROM APT_CHECK WHERE REQUEST_NUM = @payment AND REVERSAL = 'Y' )DECLARE @contrapaycur as VARCHAR (10) = (SELECT CURRENCY_CODE FROM APT_CHECK WHERE TRAN_UNO = @contrapaymenttrans )----------------------------------------------------------------------------------- Payments---------------------------------------------------------------------------------SELECT @paymenttrans[TRAN_UNO],@contrapaymenttrans[TRAN_UNO contra]----------------------------------------------------------------------------------- CDT_DISB----------------------------------------------------------------------------------- Original paymentSELECT '' [CDT_DISB],m.CLNT_MATT_CODE,d.DISB_UNO,d.ACTIVITY_COUNT,SPLIT_NUM,TRANSFERRED,d.SOURCE_TRAN_TYP,SOURCE_TRAN_UNO,d.WIP_STATUS,d.EXPERT_DISB_STATUS, d.TRAN_DATE,d.HOLD_DATE,d.HARDSOFT,d.COST_CODE, d.DISB_REF,d.AUTO_CALCULATE,d.DRUNO,@paycur[Pay Cur],d.CURRENCY_CODE[Cur Entered] ,r.RATE,d.BILL_QTY,d.BASE_QTY,BASE_AMT,TOBILL_AMT,STD_AMT,BILLED_AMT,RETAINED_BILLED_AMT,d.OK_TO_EDIT_BASE,d.MATTER_UNO,d.BILL_TRAN_UNO,d.LAST_MODIFIED,d.* FROM CDT_DISB d JOIN HBM_MATTER m ON d.MATTER_UNO = m.MATTER_UNOJOIN TBL_CURR_RATE r ON r.CURRENCY_CODE = @paycur AND r.DRUNO = d.DRUNOINNER JOIN SplitByDelimiter (@clientmatters,',') s ON s.items = m.CLNT_MATT_CODEWHERE SOURCE_TRAN_UNO = @paymenttransORDER BY m.CLNT_MATT_CODE,d.DISB_UNO -- Contra paymentSELECT '' [CDT_DISB contra],m.CLNT_MATT_CODE,d.DISB_UNO,d.ACTIVITY_COUNT,SPLIT_NUM,d.SOURCE_TRAN_TYP,SOURCE_TRAN_UNO,d.WIP_STATUS,d.EXPERT_DISB_STATUS,d.TRAN_DATE,d.HOLD_DATE,d.HARDSOFT,d.COST_CODE, d.DISB_REF,d.AUTO_CALCULATE,d.DRUNO,@contrapaycur[Pay Cur],d.CURRENCY_CODE[Cur Entered] ,r.RATE,d.BILL_QTY,d.BASE_QTY,BASE_AMT,TOBILL_AMT,STD_AMT,BILLED_AMT,RETAINED_BILLED_AMT,d.OK_TO_EDIT_BASE,d.MATTER_UNO,d.BILL_TRAN_UNO,d.LAST_MODIFIED,d.* FROM CDT_DISB d JOIN HBM_MATTER m ON d.MATTER_UNO = m.MATTER_UNOJOIN TBL_CURR_RATE r ON r.CURRENCY_CODE = @contrapaycur AND r.DRUNO = d.DRUNOINNER JOIN SplitByDelimiter (@clientmatters,',') s ON s.items = m.CLNT_MATT_CODEWHERE SOURCE_TRAN_UNO = @contrapaymenttransORDER BY m.CLNT_MATT_CODE,d.DISB_UNO ----------------------------------------------------------------------------------- CDT_DISB_NEW----------------------------------------------------------------------------------- OriginalSELECT '' [CDT_DISB_NEW], m.CLNT_MATT_CODE, d.* FROM CDT_DISB_NEW d JOIN HBM_MATTER m ON d.MATTER_UNO = m.MATTER_UNOWHERE d.DISB_UNO IN(SELECT DISB_UNOFROM CDT_DISB d JOIN HBM_MATTER m ON d.MATTER_UNO = m.MATTER_UNOINNER JOIN SplitByDelimiter (@clientmatters,',') s ON s.items = m.CLNT_MATT_CODEWHERE SOURCE_TRAN_UNO = @paymenttrans)ORDER BY m.CLNT_MATT_CODE,d.DISB_UNO -- ContraSELECT '' [CDT_DISB_NEW contra], m.CLNT_MATT_CODE, d.* FROM CDT_DISB_NEW d JOIN HBM_MATTER m ON d.MATTER_UNO = m.MATTER_UNOWHERE d.DISB_UNO IN(SELECT DISB_UNOFROM CDT_DISB d JOIN HBM_MATTER m ON d.MATTER_UNO = m.MATTER_UNOINNER JOIN SplitByDelimiter (@clientmatters,',') s ON s.items = m.CLNT_MATT_CODEWHERE SOURCE_TRAN_UNO = @contrapaymenttrans)ORDER BY m.CLNT_MATT_CODE,d.DISB_UNO ----------------------------------------------------------------------------------- CDT_DISB_MOD----------------------------------------------------------------------------------- OriginalSELECT '' [CDT_DISB_MOD],m.CLNT_MATT_CODE,d.DISB_UNO, d.* FROM CDT_DISB_MOD d JOIN HBM_MATTER m ON d.MATTER_UNO = m.MATTER_UNOWHERE d.DISB_UNO IN(SELECT DISB_UNOFROM CDT_DISB d JOIN HBM_MATTER m ON d.MATTER_UNO = m.MATTER_UNOINNER JOIN SplitByDelimiter (@clientmatters,',') s ON s.items = m.CLNT_MATT_CODEWHERE SOURCE_TRAN_UNO = @paymenttrans)ORDER BY m.CLNT_MATT_CODE,d.DISB_UNO -- ContraSELECT '' [CDT_DISB_MOD contra], m.CLNT_MATT_CODE,d.DISB_UNO, d.* FROM CDT_DISB_MOD d JOIN HBM_MATTER m ON d.MATTER_UNO = m.MATTER_UNOWHERE d.DISB_UNO IN(SELECT DISB_UNOFROM CDT_DISB d JOIN HBM_MATTER m ON d.MATTER_UNO = m.MATTER_UNOINNER JOIN SplitByDelimiter (@clientmatters,',') s ON s.items = m.CLNT_MATT_CODEWHERE SOURCE_TRAN_UNO = @contrapaymenttrans)ORDER BY m.CLNT_MATT_CODE,d.DISB_UNO ----------------------------------------------------------------------------------- CDT_DISB_ORIG----------------------------------------------------------------------------------- OriginalSELECT '' [CDT_DISB_ORIG], m.CLNT_MATT_CODE, d.SPLIT_UNO,d.* FROM CDT_DISB_ORIG d JOIN HBM_MATTER m ON d.MATTER_UNO = m.MATTER_UNOWHERE d.DISB_UNO IN(SELECT DISB_UNOFROM CDT_DISB d JOIN HBM_MATTER m ON d.MATTER_UNO = m.MATTER_UNOINNER JOIN SplitByDelimiter (@clientmatters,',') s ON s.items = m.CLNT_MATT_CODEWHERE SOURCE_TRAN_UNO = @paymenttrans)ORDER BY m.CLNT_MATT_CODE,d.DISB_UNO -- ContraSELECT '' [CDT_DISB_ORIG contra], m.CLNT_MATT_CODE, d.SPLIT_UNO,d.* FROM CDT_DISB_ORIG d JOIN HBM_MATTER m ON d.MATTER_UNO = m.MATTER_UNOWHERE d.DISB_UNO IN(SELECT DISB_UNOFROM CDT_DISB d JOIN HBM_MATTER m ON d.MATTER_UNO = m.MATTER_UNOINNER JOIN SplitByDelimiter (@clientmatters,',') s ON s.items = m.CLNT_MATT_CODEWHERE SOURCE_TRAN_UNO = @contrapaymenttrans)ORDER BY m.CLNT_MATT_CODE,d.DISB_UNO ----------------------------------------------------------------------------------- Summary Title: Payment Schedule - Create Bank File - Deferred Emailing of Remittances
Area: ExpertSuite\Financials\Accounts Payable\Payment Schedule\Schedule Create Bank File
Steps: Step 1: https://aderant.sharepoint.com/RD/AP/Moscow%20Design%20Wiki/Deferred%20Emailing%20of%20Remittance%20Advices.aspx | Expected: Button behaviour in 181612 Test Case: 166407 Need to check that the email formats are supported || Step 2: While printing electronic payments in a payment schedule with at least one electronic payment, select the No radio button where it asks if you want to email the remittance advice | Expected: The remittance advice is not emailed and the validations do not occurElectronic Payments are printed || Step 3: Select the payment schedule on the list screen | Expected: Email Remittances button enabledCannot mulit-select payment schedules to email remittances even if they contain electronic payments.djo - you can multi-select schedules to email remittances. The item selection dialog will includes all items from the selected schedules that are for payment by electronic banking || Step 4: Click the Email Remittances button | Expected: Email Remittance window comes upPayment information displayed is correctAll electronic payments are shownCancel button works || Step 5: Choose Email format | Expected: Can change the email format || Step 6: Choose payments- Have some that are not meant to work mixed in (from the blue options below) | Expected: Can select different paymentsSelected Total changes depending on those selectedEmail Remittances button disabled if no payments checked || Step 7: Click Email Remittances | Expected: Validation checks for email Job is kicked offTest case: 167647 || Step 8: Preferred remittance method is email and default email address provided | Expected: Latest Remittance Advice  EmailedEmail format is correctFormat provided is used || Step 9: Preferred method not email and default email address provided | Expected: Not emailedBug 181903: Deferred Email Remittances- Payments and payment schedule- When Remittance Advice Method is 'Mail', emails are still being sent. djo - not correct. If the user has specifically selected to email a remittance then this can be done regardless of the vendors preferred method. The above bug was closed with no development. Test to make sure that the email is still sent if preferred method is not email. ( as long as they do have an address available ) || Step 10: Preferred method email and no default email address provided | Expected: Not emailed || Step 11: Email remittances before generating the remittance advices1. Have a payment schedule with the payments created but not printed2. Attempt to Email Remittances | Expected: Job errors out: Remittance advice file is not found. It might not have been generated yet.

Title: Invoice - Post - Auto Split Multicurrency Disbursement
Steps: Step 1: Pre-reqSetup Matter to have Auto Split disbursement setup.Matter 1 - Source Matter- Auto splits enabledMatter 2 - Child matter- 30% splitMatter 3- Child matter- 50% split.*See attached SQL for split disbursement related tables || Step 2: Create an CAD100 invoice with a disbursement line, using the Matter 1.Post it. | Expected: Result below are based on CAD rate = 1.092007784100000, reciprocal = 0.915744388053213 || Step 3: CDT_DISBOriginal record in CDT_DISB gets updated.Another two records created. | Expected: Record 1 (Original record) :- Source Matter- 20% of entered amount. (the 20% which unassigned to any matter).- Base_Amt, Std_Amt = 18.3148877611- Transferred = 'N'Record 2 (Split record 1) :- Child Matter- 30% of entered amount. - Base_Amt, Std_Amt = 27.4723316416- Transferred = 'S'Record 3 (Split record 2) :- Child Matter- 50% of entered amount.- Base_Amt, Std_Amt = 45.7872194027- Transferred = 'S' || Step 4: CDT_DISB_NEWA new record created after post. | Expected: Base_Amt, Tobill_amt and std_amt are the amount before split. 91.5744388053Type = 'N', Regular disbursement || Step 5: CDT_DISB_ORIGA new record for before split. (Split are done after post) | Expected: Base_Amt, Tobill_amt and std_amt are the amount before split. 91.5744388053Type = 'N', Regular disbursement || Step 6: CDT_DISB_MODThree records created. | Expected: Record 1 - neg73.2595510442 on the amount fields. Indicate  80% ($80) of original amount has been splitted out and deducted from the source matter.- Type = 'O', Split outRecord 2 - 27.4723316416 on the amount fields. Indicate 30% ($30) has been splitted out from source matter and added to the child matter. - Type = 'I', Split In.Record 3- 45.7872194027 on the amount fields. Indicate 50% ($50) has been splitted out from source matter and added to the child matter.- Type = 'I'. Split In. || Step 7: CDH_SUMMARY_GLThree records updated/created for each matter,cost_code and period combination | Expected: Record 1- Source Matter- Base_New = previous amount + 91.5744388053- Base_Mod = previous amount + (-73.2595510442) , 80% has been splitted to child matters- Tobill_New = previous amount + 91.5744388053- Tobill_Mod= previous amount + (-73.2595510442) Record 2- Child Matter- Base_Mod = previous amount + 27.4723316416 , 30% splitted from source matter- Tobill_mod = previous amount + 27.4723316416 , 30% splitted from source matterRecord 3- Child Matter- Base_Mod = previous amount + 45.7872194027, 50% splitted from source matter- Tobill_mod = previous amount + 45.7872194027, 50% splitted from source matter || Step 8: TBH_MATTER_SUMMThree records updated/created for each matters | Expected: Record 1- Source Matter- Hard_Tot = previous amount + 18.3148877611, 20% which not assigned to anyone- Hard_Count = previous count + 1- Hard_Wip_Bal = previous amount + 18.3148877611Record 2- Child Matter- Hard_Tot = previous amount + 27.4723316416 , 30% splitted from source matter- Hard_Count = previous count + 1- Hard_Wip_Bal = previous amount + 27.4723316416 Record 3- Child Matter- Hard_Tot = previous amount + 45.7872194027, 50% splitted from source matter- Hard_Count = previous count + 1- Hard_Wip_Bal = previous amount + 45.7872194027 || Step 9: APH_VENDOR_YEAR updated || Step 10: APH_VENDOR_SUMM updated || Step 11: ACT_TRANupdated || Step 12: APS_INVOICE_ZStatus updated to P

Title: Invoices - Spot rates: main test
Steps: Step 1: Create a vendor invoice- invoice date old enough to pick up a DRUNO that is not the lateste.g. 22/7/2012 will pick up DRUNO 100018- has gl item- has disb item- has tax item || Step 2: Enter a spot rate and saveRate = 0.679071030829825 (the reciprocal will be: 1 / 0.679071030829825 = 1.47260000000000) | Expected: Spot rate saved on the invoiceSPOT_RATE = 0.679071030829825 || Step 3: Post | Expected: A new set of currency rates is created with a new DRUNO- The new spot rate set will be a copy of the set that would have been used if that the payment had not been using spot rates e.g. 22/7/2012 uses DRUNO 100018- The CAD currency will be populated as per the spot rate enteredTBL_CURR_RATE.SPOT_RATE = YTBL_CURR_RATE.RATE = 0.679071030829825 (as entered)TBL_CURR_RATE.RECIPROCAL= 1.47260000000000 (1 / TBL_CURR_RATE.RECIPROCAL)TBL_CURR_DATE.FROM DATE = TodayTBL_CURR_DATE.TODATE = YesterdayNote: The dates seems odd but this is so the is never valid and therefore the rate will never be picked up by anothyer other that this invoice we have just used it forThe Invoice and all invoice items have the new DRUNOACT_TRAN_JE.DRUNO WHERE TAX_CODE =''CDT_DISB.DRUNOACT_TRAN_JE.DRUNO WHERE TAX_CODE = the tax codeAPT_INVOICE_AMT.DRUNO------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------ Latest spot rates set----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------SELECT DRUNO,CURRENCY_CODE,RATE,RECIPROCAL,SPOT_RATE,LAST_MODIFIEDFROM TBL_CURR_RATEWHERE DRUNO = (SELECT TOP(1) DRUNO FROM TBL_CURR_RATE WHERE SPOT_RATE ='Y' ORDER BY DRUNO DESC)ORDER BY CURRENCY_CODE------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------ Latest spot rates differences compared to specific DRUNO ----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------DECLARE @druno as int= (SELECT TOP(1) DRUNO FROM TBL_CURR_RATE WHERE SPOT_RATE <>'Y'ORDER BY DRUNO desc)--DECLARE @druno as int = 100018 --10SELECT cr1.DRUNO[Non spot DRUNO], cr2.DRUNO [Spot DRUNO],cr1.CURRENCY_CODE[Non Spot Cur], cr2.CURRENCY_CODE[Spot Cur], cr1.RATE[Non Spot rate], cr2.RATE[Spot Rate],cr1.RECIPROCAL[Non Spot Reciprocal], cr2.RECIPROCAL[Spot Reciprocal]FROM TBL_CURR_RATE cr1JOIN TBL_CURR_RATE cr2 ON cr1.CURRENCY_CODE = cr2.CURRENCY_CODEWHERE cr1.DRUNO = @drunoAND cr2.DRUNO = (SELECT TOP(1) DRUNO FROM TBL_CURR_RATE ORDER BY DRUNO DESC)AND cr1.CURRENCY_CODE IN(SELECT CURRENCY_CODE FROM(--Non spot rate setSELECT CURRENCY_CODE,RATE,RECIPROCALFROM TBL_CURR_RATEWHERE DRUNO = @druno--ORDER BY CURRENCY_CODEEXCEPT--Latest spot rate setSELECT CURRENCY_CODE,RATE,RECIPROCALFROM TBL_CURR_RATEWHERE DRUNO = (SELECT TOP(1) DRUNO FROM TBL_CURR_RATE WHERE SPOT_RATE ='Y'ORDER BY DRUNO DESC)--ORDER BY CURRENCY_CODE)as A)ORDER BY cr1.CURRENCY_CODE
