Title: Payment - Tax: Recoverable tax control field
Steps: Step 1: Pre req setup for recoverable taxNote: The recoverable tax amount field is just control total. When required, it needs to be entered and match the total tax items calculated (within the tolerance set in admin)For the validation on this to work correctly, taxes in use must also be onSet a valid GL account for tax codes e.g: 40120UPDATE TBL_TAX_BOOK SET ACCT_UNO = 127 WHERE BOOK = 1Set taxes in use tax on:UPDATE CMS_OPTION SET FLAG_VALUE ='Y'WHERE OPTION_CODE ='TAXES_IN_USE'UPDATE APM_PARMS SET DEFAULT_TAX_IN ='X'--Q,X,Y,N || Step 2: Pre req tax jurisdiction for recoverable tax calculationTax JurisdictionTax code 1- Seq 1- Recoverable- Recoverable account (as per pre reqs)- Disb  and percentage 15% || Step 3: Recoverable tax control field is not used1. Set recoverable tax control required to offAdmin | Accounts Payable | Accounts Payable Options | Firm Options UPDATE APM_PARMS SET RECOV_CONT_REQD ='N'2. New vendor payment3. Set tax include to Yes or No4. Add a GL item with the jurisdiction5. Calculate tax6. Release | Expected: Recoverable tax control is not used- Recoverable tax control field is hidden- release validation does not validate the recoverable tax value equals the total tax || Step 4: Recoverable tax tolerance = 0 and tax matches1. Set recoverable tax control required to onAdmin | Accounts Payable | Accounts Payable Options | Firm Options UPDATE APM_PARMS SET RECOV_CONT_REQD ='Y'2. Set tolerance to zeroAdmin | Accounts Payable | Accounts Payable Options | Firm Options UPDATE APM_PARMS SET RECOV_CONT_TOLERANCE = 03. New vendor payment4. Set tax include to Yes or No5. Add a GL item with the jurisdiction6. Calculate tax7. Set recoverable tax amount = total tax items8. Release | Expected: Release validation passes || Step 5: Recoverable tax tolerance = 0 and tax does not match1. Set recoverable tax control required to onAdmin | Accounts Payable | Accounts Payable Options | Firm Options UPDATE APM_PARMS SET RECOV_CONT_REQD ='Y'2. Set tolerance to zeroAdmin | Accounts Payable | Accounts Payable | Options | Firm Options UPDATE APM_PARMS SET RECOV_CONT_TOLERANCE = 03. New vendor payment4. Set tax include to Yes or No5. Add a GL item 6. Calculate tax7. Set recoverable tax amount <> total tax items8. Release | Expected: Release validation failsTax lines do not match recoverable tax || Step 6: Recoverable tax tolerance <> 0, tax is within the tolerance1. Set recoverable tax control required to onAdmin | Accounts Payable | Accounts Payable Options | Firm Options UPDATE APM_PARMS SET RECOV_CONT_REQD ='Y'2. Set tolerance .05Admin | Accounts Payable | Accounts Payable Options | Firm Options UPDATE APM_PARMS SET RECOV_CONT_TOLERANCE = .053. New vendor payment for 1004. Set tax include to Yes 5. Add a GL item for 100 with the jurisdiction6. Calculate tax (13.04)7. Set recoverable tax amount <> total tax items but is within .05 of the value (test both more 13.09 and less 12.99)8. Release | Expected: Release validation passes || Step 7: Recoverable tax tolerance <> 0, tax is not within the tolerance1. Set recoverable tax control required to onAdmin | Accounts Payable | Accounts Payable Options | Firm Options UPDATE APM_PARMS SET RECOV_CONT_REQD ='Y'2. Set tolerance = .05Admin | Accounts Payable | Accounts Payable Options | Firm Options UPDATE APM_PARMS SET RECOV_CONT_TOLERANCE =.053. New vendor payment for 1004. Set tax include to Yes 5. Add a GL item for 100 6. Calculate tax (13.04)7.Set recoverable tax amount <> total tax items and is not within .05 of the value (test both more 13.10 and less 12.98)8. Release | Expected: Release validation failsTax lines do not match recoverable tax

Title: Payment - Cancel to New: Tax
Steps: Step 1: Note: Testing of the cancel part of the payment is covered by the cancel test cases. Here, we need to reconcile the New part of the process as New payment would normally be done via the UI so we need to ensure that the creation of the New payment via code has the same outcome || Step 2: Pre preqsCAD RatesRate: 1.092007784100000Reciprocal: 0.915744388053213 || Step 3: Create payment with Tax item1. Create vendor payment- Bank = CAD currency- Currency = CAD- Amount = C$100- other mandatory fields2. Add a Tax item- Amount = C$100- enter all other fields | Expected: Payment created with Tax item || Step 4: Query the tables and copy results to spread sheetSELECT TOP(1) * FROM ACT_TRAN_JE ORDER BY TRAN_UNO DESCSELECT TOP(1) * FROM ACT_TRAN ORDER BY TRAN_UNO DESCSELECT TOP(1) * FROM ACT_TEXT ORDER BY TEXT_ID DESC || Step 5: Post payment || Step 6: Cancel to New | Expected: Payment is canceled and New payment created- New Payment has Tax item || Step 7: Reconcile tablesQuery tables and reconcile results from the original payment SELECTTOP(1)*FROM ACT_TRAN_JE ORDERBY TRAN_UNO DESCSELECTTOP(1)*FROM ACT_TRAN ORDERBY TRAN_UNO DESCSELECTTOP(1)*FROM ACT_TEXT ORDERBY TEXT_ID DESC | Expected: Tables and fields matchACT_TRAN_JE- Last modified is set, not copied from original- All fields that should match, do- All fields that won't match e.g. unos, are populated with the appropriate valuesACT_TRAN- Last modified is set, not copied from original- All fields that should match, do- All fields that won't match e.g. unos, are populated with the appropriate valuesACT_TEXT - Last modified is set, not copied from original- All fields that should match, do- All fields that won't match e.g. unos, are populated with the appropriate valuesWe're getting the old text copied over but it also may have the old default and therefore an old date. Should we prefix it with a new default text? Question to Dave

Title: Create Payments - Release validation
Description:
Save:
-          Date to print
-          Check Date between APM_PARMS
-          Check has detail line
-          Detail line total matches check amount
Release:
-          Validate check tax, validate tax has been calculated and recoverable tax etc
-          Validate check number
-          Validate wire number
-          Validate check amount
-          Validate check jurisdiction
-          Validate minimum trust balance
-          Validate check 1099 
-          Validate check has no error messages
-          Validate all accounts are accessible
-          Validate all books are accessible
Steps: Step 1: Pre req 3 valid invoices to attached to payment schedule *Note, Save and Release Check validations are being run when releasing check. See Summary for list of validation covered. || Step 2: When Create Payment, run release validation.If validation passed, release payment.If validation failed, set payment as I or C. || Step 3: Create Payment - No validation error1. Create new vendor payment schedule.2. Add an invoice with no known validation error to schedule.3. Create Request. | Expected: Payment created as Released with no validation error. || Step 4: Create Payment - With Save Check validations error (Invalid Date To Print validation)1. Create new vendor payment schedule2. Add an invoice with no known validation error to schedule.3. Hijack APS_SCHEDULE_Z.CHECK_DATE to out of parms date range.4. Create Request. | Expected: - Payment created as Ready for Posting. - Payment Schedule has red error bar- Job alert shows error. Job failed even tho payment was createdBug 251569 - Create Payment from Schedule job: The payment is created as expected when there is a save validation error but the Job fails || Step 5: Create Payment - With Release Check validations error (Jurisdiction Code )1. Create new vendor payment schedule2. Add an invoice with no known validation error to schedule3. Edit the  Tax Juristic Code being used (Tax Jurisdiction Maintenance in classic) to:  - tax in/out value = Out. select JURISDIC_CODE,* from APT_INVOICE order by TRAN_UNO desc 4. Create Request. | Expected: - Payment created as Ready for Posting. - Job had a warning. || Step 6: Create Payment - With Schedule header pre-validation error (Invalid Check Date validation)1. Create new vendor payment schedule.2. Set the schedule's Payment Date to today.3. Add an invoice with no known validation error to schedule.4. Hijack APM_PARMS.MAX_DATE to be before the schedule's Payment Date. (UPDATE APM_PARMS SET MAX_DATE = getdate() - 1).5. Create Request. | Expected: An error dialog pops up and stops you from proceeding. No job runs, and no payments should be created. || Step 7: Create Payment - With Schedule header validation error (Invalid Date To Print)1. Create new vendor payment schedule2. Add an invoice with no known validation error to schedule.3. Hijack APS_SCHEDULE_Z.DATE_TO_PRINT to some date before the current date.4. Create Request. | Expected: Job runs, but with an error. No payments are created

Title: AP -> Invoices -> Simple Invoice Create, Release, Post, Cancel
Steps: Step 1: Start Expert Accounts Payable | Expected: Application should be launched || Step 2: Go to Invoices tab | Expected: Invoices search page should open || Step 3: Click New Invoice | Expected: Invoice (New) form should open || Step 4: Only fill out required header fields and Save | Expected: Save should be successful || Step 5: Create General Ledger and fill in required fields | Expected: GL record should be added successfully || Step 6: Create Disbursement and fill in required fields | Expected: Disbursement record should be added successfully || Step 7: Make sure the Remaining Balance is 0 after adding the records.Save and close | Expected: The record should be saved and closed successfully || Step 8: Search the newly created Invoice || Step 9: Validate the details at the Grid | Expected: Vendor,  Invoice Amount, Currency, Status, AP Type, Vendor Type, Bank || Step 10: Open the Invoice | Expected: Invoice should be opened successfully || Step 11: Click on Release | Expected: Release button  should get disabled,Unrelease button should get enabled. No error should be encountered || Step 12: Click on Post | Expected: Post button  should get disabled,Cancel,Quick Pay button should get enabled. No error should be encountered. || Step 13: Click on Cancel | Expected: Cancel Invoice popup appears || Step 14: Fill required fields and click Cancel Invoice | Expected: The invoice should get Cancelled successfully.

No error should be encountered

Title: Invoice - GL details - Multibook Interbook
Description: This test case accomodate use cases detailed in Bug 182574
Steps: Step 1: Pre reqsShared steps are included for Multibook/Interbook setup above however due to how complex it is, there is another shared steps below for the specific setup for this test case.Note: Availability for use in the AP app- An account that is only book 1 will be avail for use for book 1 and other books- An account in book 1 that is mapped to another book will then only be avail for book 1 and the other book/s it's mapped to- An account that is not on book 1 but is mapped to another book, will only be avail for the book it's mapped toAccounts and Book/Office/Department/Profit Center links need to be done as follow:1. Firm / Master bookOffice : TLH, PAR, NYAccounts with ODP links: 61520, 60070,  60050, Account with no ODP links: 67000 2. Book 1000Office : PARAccounts with ODP links: 61520, 60070, 670003. Book 1001 Office : NYAccounts with ODP links: 61520, 60050 Interbook Setup needs to be done between:1. PAR to TLH2. NY and TLH Interbook Account Mapping needs to be done:1. Title: Payment Items - client credit: multi currency wash up and avail balance
Steps: Step 1: Note: Due to existing issues with the avail balance calc and the washup calc, you will need to use a new client for  this test so you don't have any existing credits. If you have existing credits, they may all look like they has washed up correctly but the calculations recalc all credits and allocation everytime and precision plus rounding issues cause things to not calc 100% correctly. This is the same as classic. The issue has been raised with product management. || Step 2: Pre preqsCAD RatesRate: 1.092007784100000Reciprocal: 0.915744388053213New Client Client credit = CAD 100 | Expected: Client Credit ACT_TRAN_CR_CL.AMOUNT = 91.5744388053  System currency because it's postedACT_TRAN_CR_CL.TC_AMOUNT = 100.00ACT_TRAN_CR_CL.TC_CODE = CADACT_TRAN_CR_CL.SIGN = 1ACT_TRAN_CR_CL.TRAN_TYPE = CRDECLARE @clientmatter asVARCHAR (2000)=''DECLARE @displaycur asVARCHAR (10)=''DECLARE @client asVARCHAR (2000)= (SELECT CLIENT_CODE FROM HBM_MATTER WHERE CLNT_MATT_CODE = @clientmatter)DECLARE @clientuno asINT= (SELECT CLIENT_UNO FROM HBM_MATTER WHERE CLNT_MATT_CODE = @clientmatter)--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- Client credits--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- Client creditsSELECT''[ACT_TRAN_CR_CL],cr.TRAN_UNO,chq.REQUEST_NUM,b.PREBILL_NUM,cr.PERIOD,mc.CREDIT_TYPE_DESC,cr.TRAN_TYPE,cr.SIGN,cr.AMOUNT,cr.TC_AMOUNT,cr.TC_CODE,c.CLIENT_CODE,cr.CLIENT_UNO,cr.DRUNO,cr.DATA_TYPE,cr.ROW_UNO,cr.LAST_MODIFIED--,cr.*FROM ACT_TRAN_CR_CL crJOIN HBM_CLIENT c ON cr.CLIENT_UNO = c.CLIENT_UNOJOIN TBM_MULT_CREDIT mc ON cr.DATA_TYPE = mc.CREDIT_TYPELEFTJOIN BLT_BILL b ON cr.TRAN_UNO = b.TRAN_UNOLEFTJOIN APT_CHECK chq ON cr.TRAN_UNO = chq.TRAN_UNOINNERJOIN SplitByDelimiter (@client,',') s ON s.items = c.CLIENT_CODEORDER BY cr.TRAN_UNO -- Are there any unposted items? These will prevent using any more of the creditselect ''[Number Unposted],count(*)[Client Credits] from ACT_TRAN_CR_CL crJOIN HBM_CLIENT c ON cr.CLIENT_UNO = c.CLIENT_UNOINNERJOIN SplitByDelimiter (@client,',') s ON s.items = c.CLIENT_CODEwhere DATA_TYPE = 'C' and PERIOD = 0 EXEC [APP_CALCULATE_CLIENT_BALANCES] @clientuno, @displaycur || Step 3: Add credit to CAD paymentBank Cur = CADPayment Amount = C$50Client credit = C$50 | Expected: Details form Balance = C$100.00Available = C$100.00Applied CreditACT_TRAN_CR_CL.AMOUNT = 50.00 Transaction currency because it's not postedACT_TRAN_CR_CL.TC_AMOUNT = 50.00ACT_TRAN_CR_CL.TC_CODE = CADACT_TRAN_CR_CL.SIGN = -1ACT_TRAN_CR_CL.TRAN_TYPE = CH || Step 4: Post payment | Expected: Applied CreditACT_TRAN_CR_CL.AMOUNT = 45.7872194027 System currency because it's postedACT_TRAN_CR_CL.TC_AMOUNT = 50.00ACT_TRAN_CR_CL.TC_CODE = CADACT_TRAN_CR_CL.SIGN = -1ACT_TRAN_CR_.TRAN_TYPE = CHSP: APP_CALCULATE_CLIENT_BALANCES (USD)Balance = 45.78 Available = 45.78 || Step 5: Add remaining avail credit to a USD paymentBank Cur = USDPayment Amount = $45.78Client credit = $45.78 | Expected: Details formBalance = $45.78 Available = $45.78 Applied CreditACT_TRAN_CR_CL.AMOUNT = 45.78 Transaction currency because it's not posted ACT_TRAN_CR_CL.TC_AMOUNT = 45.78 ACT_TRAN_CR_CL.TC_CODE = USDACT_TRAN_CR_CL.SIGN = -1ACT_TRAN_CR_CL.TRAN_TYPE = CH || Step 6: Post payment | Expected: Applied CreditACT_TRAN_CR_CL.AMOUNT = 45.78 System currency because it's posted ACT_TRAN_CR_CL.TC_AMOUNT = 45.78 ACT_TRAN_CR_CL.TC_CODE = USDACT_TRAN_CR_CL.SIGN = -1ACT_TRAN_CR_.TRAN_TYPE = CHWashup (DRUNO = -1)ACT_TRAN_CR_CL.AMOUNT = 0.0072194026 System currency 91.5744388053 (original credit) - 45.7872194027 (first payment client credit) - 45.78 (second payment client credit) = 0.0072194026ACT_TRAN_CR_CL.TC_AMOUNT = 0ACT_TRAN_CR_CL.TC_CODE = ACT_TRAN_CR_CL.SIGN = -1ACT_TRAN_CR_.TRAN_TYPE = CHSP: APP_CALCULATE_CLIENT_BALANCES (USD)Balance = 0 Available = 0

45.7872194027 = 45.7872194026 this should round to 45.78 not 45.77 | Expected: Details formBalance = $45.78 Available = $45.78 Applied CreditACT_TRAN_CR_MA.AMOUNT = 45.78 Transaction currency because it's not postedACT_TRAN_CR_MA.TC_AMOUNT = 45.78ACT_TRAN_CR_MA.TC_CODE = USDACT_TRAN_CR_MA.SIGN = -1ACT_TRAN_CR_MA.TRAN_TYPE = CH || Step 6: Post payment | Expected: Applied CreditACT_TRAN_CR_MA.AMOUNT = 45.78 System currency because it's postedACT_TRAN_CR_MA.TC_AMOUNT = 45.78ACT_TRAN_CR_MA.TC_CODE = USDACT_TRAN_CR_MA.SIGN = -1ACT_TRAN_CR_.TRAN_TYPE = CHWashup (DRUNO = -1)ACT_TRAN_CR_MA.AMOUNT = 0.0072194026 System currency 91.5744388053 (original credit) - 45.7872194027 (first payment client credit) - 45.78 (second payment client credit) = 0.0072194026ACT_TRAN_CR_MA.TC_AMOUNT = 0ACT_TRAN_CR_MA.TC_CODE = ACT_TRAN_CR_MA.SIGN = -1ACT_TRAN_CR_.TRAN_TYPE = CHSP: APP_CALCULATE_CLIENT_BALANCES (USD)Balance = 0 Available = 0

Create Bank disabled. || Step 2: Single select - EB Payment1. Select schedule which paid by EB.2. Select schedule which is not paid by EB | Expected: 1. Create Bank File enabled.2. Create Bank File disabled. || Step 3: Single select - EB File Created (EB_Sent > 1)1. Select schedule which has its bank file created2. Select schedule which do not has its bank file created | Expected: 1. Create Bank File disabled. Recreate Bank File enabled.2. Create Bank File enabled. Recreate Bank File disabled || Step 4: Single select - Release request1. select schedule which has request released.2. select schedule which request not released (due to validation error, see TC 184776 Step 4 or 5) | Expected: 1. Create Bank File enabled.2. Create Bank File disabled. || Step 5: Single select - Auto Reconciled Payment (When APM_PARMS.AUTO_RECONCILE_WIRE)1. select schedule which has payment auto reconciled and bank file not yet created.2. select schedule which has payment auto reconciled and bank file created. | Expected: 1. Create Bank File enabled.2. Create Bank File disabled. Recreate Bank File enabled. || Step 6: Multi select - Bank1. All selected schedule for the same bank2. Some of selected schedule for different bank | Expected: 1. Create Bank File enabled.2. Create Bank File disabled. || Step 7: Multi select - Request Generated1. All of selected schedule have request generated2. Some of the selected schedule do not have request generated | Expected: 1. Create Bank File enabled.2. Create Bank File enabled but you can only create for the one with request generated. || Step 8: Multi select - EB Payment1. All of selected schedule is to be paid by EB.2. Some of selected schedule is to be paid by EB.3. None of selected schedule is to be paid by EB. | Expected: 1. Create Bank File enabled.2. Create Bank File enabled. Can only print for those to be paid by EB. 3. Create Bank File disabled || Step 9: Multi select - EB File Created1. All of selected schedule has been printed2. Some of selected schedule has been printed,3. None of the selected schedule has been printed.4. Some of selected schedule has been printed but from different bank. | Expected: 1. Create Bank File disabled.2. Create Bank File enabled.  Can only print for those that has not been printed. Recreate Bank File enabled to print those printed check.3. Create Bank File enabled.4. Create Bank File disabled. || Step 10: Multi select - Release request1. All of selected schedule which has request released.2. Some of selected schedule which request not released (due to validation error)3. None of the selected schedule which request released. (all selected schedule has validation error) | Expected: 1. Create Bank File disabled.2. Create Bank File enabled. Can only print for those that requesrt has been released.3. Create Bank File disabled. || Step 11: Multi select - Auto Reconciled Payment (When APM_PARMS.AUTO_RECONCILE_WIRE)1. All of selected schedule which has bank file created, 2. Some of selected schedule which bank file not created. 3. None of the selected schedule which bank file not created. | Expected: 1. Create Bank File disabled.2. Create Bank File enabled. Can only print for those that yet to have bank file created.3. Create Bank File disabled.

Post the Payment | Expected: On CreateACT_TRAN.TRANS_NUMBER = <Payment Number>After check printACT_TRAN.TRANS_NUMBER = <Check Number>On PostACT_TRAN.TRANS_NUMBER = <Bank>-<Check Number> || Step 3: Manual Payment1. Create a check payment2. Add a GL line3. Post the Payment | Expected: On CreateACT_TRAN.TRANS_NUMBER = <Payment Number>On PostACT_TRAN.TRANS_NUMBER = <Bank>-<Check Number> || Step 4: Electronic Banking Payment1. Create a check payment2. Add a GL line3. Post the Payment | Expected: On CreateACT_TRAN.TRANS_NUMBER = <Payment Number>On PostACT_TRAN.TRANS_NUMBER = <Bank>-<(Payment Number)> || Step 5: Wire Payment1. Create a check payment2. Add a GL line3. Post the Payment | Expected: On CreateACT_TRAN.TRANS_NUMBER = <Payment Number>On PostACT_TRAN.TRANS_NUMBER = <Bank>-<(Payment Number)>

Only unposted payment are getting posted. || Step 7: Some payments are posted and some cancelled- Create payment schedule- Add invoices for check payment to schedule- Create Request- Post some of the payments in Payments tab then Cancel it.- Post the schedule in Payment Schedule tab. | Expected: Post button enabled in list screen, Getting 'No payments are available for posting dialog.' Post process is not kicked off. *Bug 189123 - 'Period associated with this payment is invalid' error when trying to post a posted EB payment schedule. It is trying to post the cancelled payment. || Step 8: Release wire payment + Unrelease wire payment- Create payment schedule- Add invoices for check payment to schedule- Create Request- Unrelease one check payment in Payments. | Expected: Posting all payments, release and unreleased payments. || Step 9: All EB payment Released and do not have bank file created.- Create payment schedule.- Add invoices for EB payment to schedule.- Create request. Payment should be release state if no validation error when creating request. | Expected: Post button enabled. Schedule posted successfully. || Step 10: EB Payment with bank file created + EB payment with bank file NOT created.- Create payment schedule.- Add invoices for EB payment in. - Create request- Create bank file for some the check in Payments.- Post the payment in Payment Schedule | Expected: Post button enabled. All payments in schedule posted successfully. || Step 11: EB Payment with bank file created + Posted EB payment- Create payment schedule.- Add invoices for EB payment in. - Create request- Create bank file for some the check in Payments and post SOME of them.- Post the schedule in Payment Schedule | Expected: Post button enabled. only unposted payments should be posted. || Step 12: All EB payment have bank file created and unposted.- Create payment schedule.- Add invoices for EB payment in.- Create request- Create Bank file. - Unrelease all payments from Payments list screen. | Expected: Post button disabled on Payment Entry screen. (but enabled on payment list screen.)  *Talked to Dave, we are okay with current behaviour as it would be a pain to retest. || Step 13: All EB payment have bank file created and posted. - Create payment schedule.- Add invoices for EB payment in.- Create request- Create Bank file. - Post schedule | Expected: Post button disabled. No available payment to post.

Title: Payment Schedule - Post - Run Release and Post payment validation
Steps: Step 1: NotesWhen posting payment on Ready for Posting state, it run Release and Post validation on both C# and SP. If Payment already release, it only runs Release and Post validation on the SP.(Note: Payment Schedule entry can't post unreleased payments, use the Payment Schedule Grid to post) || Step 2: Pre-req1st payment schedule with payment created and released.2nd payment schedule with payment created and ready for posting. || Step 3: Run Release SP validation on Released payment when posting schedule- Hijack the payment on 1st payment schedule so that it catches one of the Release validation on SP. (Bank account details of Payee Name <> Bank for Payment) | Expected: Schedule not posted. Getting validation error. || Step 4: Run Release C# validation on Released payment when posting schedule- Hijack the payment on 1st payment schedule so that it catches one of the Release validation on C#. (Invalid Check / Wire Number) | Expected: Schedule posted. C# validation not checked on Released payment. || Step 5: Run Release SP validation on Ready for Posting payment when posting schedule - Hijack the payment on 2nd payment  schedule so that it catches one of the Release validation on SP. (Bank account details of Payee Name <> Bank for Payment) | Expected: Schedule not posted. Getting validation error. || Step 6: Run Release C# validation on Ready for Posting payment when posting schedule- Hijack the payment on 2nd payment schedule so that it catches one of the Release validation on C#. (Invalid Check / Wire Number) | Expected: Schedule not posted. Getting validation error. || Step 7: Run Post validation on Released payment when posting schedule.- Hijack the payment on 1st payment so that it catched one of the Post validation. (Invalid period) | Expected: Schedule not posted. Getting validation error. || Step 8: Run Post validation on Ready for Posting payment when posting schedule.- Hijack the payment on 2nd payment so that it catched one of the Post validation. (Invalid period) | Expected: Schedule not posted. Getting validation error.

Title: Payment - Cancel to New: Spot Rates
Steps: Step 1: Note: Testing of the cancel part of the payment is covered by the cancel test cases. Here, we need to reconcile the New part of the process as New payment would normally be done via the UI so we need to ensure that the creation of the New payment via code has the same outcome || Step 2: Create and Post payment1. Create client (or vendor) payment- Bank = is not USD currency- Spot rate- All other mandatory fields2. Add detail item to match3. Save4. Post | Expected: Payment is saved and posted with spot rate || Step 3: Cancel to New | Expected: Payment canceled and new payment created- Spot rate copied from original paymentAPT_CHECK new entry createdSPOT_RATE = copied from original

Title: Invoice Entry - 1099 Code
Steps: Step 1: When 1099 not in use.UPDATE CMS_OPTION SET FLAG_VALUE ='N' WHERE OPTION_CODE ='1099_IN_USE'1. Create invoice. | Expected: APT_INVOICE.TEN99_CODE is saving as empty string.TEN99_Amount should be Zero. || Step 2: When 1099 in use.UPDATE CMS_OPTION SET FLAG_VALUE ='Y' WHERE OPTION_CODE ='1099_IN_USE'Create invoice. | Expected: APT_INVOICE.TEN99_CODE is saving as selected value on screen. || Step 3: Override 1099 Code from Vendors default | Expected: Set 'Separate Check' checkbox to be checked and disabled the field. || Step 4: Override 1099 Code from Vendors default, then set 1099 code back to Vendors default | Expected: 'Separate Check' checkbox should become enabled again but value remain as checked. || Step 5: Vendor do not have default, select one manuallly. | Expected: Set 'Separate Check' checkbox to be checked and disabled the field. || Step 6: Vendor is changed | Expected: 1099 Code reset based on new Vendor default.If separate check box was disabled, this should be enabled again.

Title: Recurring Invoice: 1099 not in use

Invoice Import with the created vendor and leave 1099 Code mapping blank. 2. Invoice Import with the created vendor and leave the cell that has 1099 Code mapped empty. | Expected: Invoice imported with no warnings and APT_INVOICE.TEN99_CODE = empty stringInvoice imported with no warnings and APT_INVOICE.TEN99_CODE = empty string

Title: Payment Items - Disbursement: Post and Cancel summary tables multi currency
Steps: Step 1: Pre reqs CAD Rates - currentRate: 1.092007784100000Reciprocal: 0.915744388053213 CAD Rates - old druno 100018Rate: 1.880904400000000Reciprocal: 0.531659131639014 Cost code 1- Allows hard- Has existing summary records for the current period Cost code 2- Allows hard- Has existing summary records for the current period Cost Code 3- Allows hard- Has no summary records for the current period Matter 1- Has existing summary records for the current period Matter 2- Has existing summary records for the current period Matter 3- Has no summary records for the current period Query the summary tables to get the start values -- Checks how many references a matter hasSELECT m.CLNT_MATT_CODE,s.MATTER_UNO,s.HARD_TOT,s.HARD_COUNT,s.SOFT_TOT,s.SOFT_COUNT,s.LAST_MODIFIED FROM TBH_MATTER_SUMM sJOIN HBM_MATTER m ON s.MATTER_UNO = m.MATTER_UNOWHERE m.CLNT_MATT_CODE in () -- e.g ('SGPC.M1', 'SGPC.C1') OR ('SGPC.M1')-- Summary of disbursement types per matterSELECT s.MATTER_UNO,COST_CODE,HARDSOFT,PERIOD,BASE_OPEN,BASE_NEW,BASE_MOD,BASE_BIL,TOBILL_OPEN,TOBILL_NEW,TOBILL_MOD,TOBILL_BIL,s.LAST_MODIFIEDFROM CDH_SUMMARY_GL sJOIN HBM_MATTER m ON s.MATTER_UNO = m.MATTER_UNOWHERE m.CLNT_MATT_CODE in () -- e.g ('SGPC.M1', 'SGPC.C1')AND COST_CODE in () -- e.g ('AIR', 'MILE')ORDER BY s.COST_CODE, s.HARDSOFT, s.PERIOD || Step 2: Create a payment- date does not fall into current druno e.g. 22/7/2013 (DRUNO 100018)- bank has CAD currency- Amount = C$600 || Step 3: Add a disb to the payment - enter all fields- matter = matter 1- Cost code = 1 - amount = C$100.00- date = e.g. 22/7/2013 (DRUNO 100018) | Expected: Disb 1 details item saved || Step 4: Add another disb to the payment - save and close- enter all fields- matter = matter 1- Cost code = 1 - amount = C$100- date = e.g. 22/7/2013 (DRUNO 100018) | Expected: Disb 2 details item saved || Step 5: Add another disb to the payment - save and close- enter all fields- matter = 1- cost code = 2- amount = C$100.00- date = e.g. 22/7/2013 (DRUNO 100018) | Expected: Disb 3 details item saved || Step 6: Add another disb to the payment - save and close- enter all fields- matter = matter 1- cost code = 3 - amount = C$100- date = today | Expected: Disb 4 details item saved || Step 7: Add another disb to the payment - save and close- enter all fields- matter = matter 2- cost code = 1 - amount = C$100.00- date = e.g. 22/7/2013 (DRUNO 100018) | Expected: Disb 5 details item saved || Step 8: Add another disb to the payment - save and close- enter all fields- matter = matter 3- cost code = 1 - amount = C$100- date = today | Expected: Disb 6 details item saved || Step 9: Post the payment | Expected: Payment is posted TBH_MATTER_SUMM for matter 1 updated HARD_TOT = increased by 4 X 53.1659131639 (212.6636526556) HARD_COUNT = increased by 4SOFT_TOT = unchangedSOFT_COUNT = unchangedLAST_MODIFIED = updated TBH_MATTER_SUMM for matter 2 updated HARD_TOT = increased by 53.1659131639 HARD_COUNT = increased by 1SOFT_TOT = unchangedSOFT_COUNT = unchangedLAST_MODIFIED = updated TBH_MATTER_SUMM for matter 3 row added HARD_TOT = 53.1659131639 HARD_COUNT = 1SOFT_TOT = 0SOFT_COUNT = 0LAST_MODIFIED = updated CDH_SUMMARY.GL for matter 1, Cost code 1 is updated BASE_NEW = increased by 2 X 53.1659131639 (106.3318263278) TO_BILL_NEW = increased by 2 X 53.1659131639 (106.3318263278) BASE_MOD = unchangedTO_BILL_MOD = unchangedLAST_MODIFIED = updated CDH_SUMMARY.GL for matter 1, Cost code 2 is updated BASE_NEW = increased by 53.1659131639 TO_BILL_NEW = increased by 53.1659131639 BASE_MOD = unchangedTO_BILL_MOD = unchangedLAST_MODIFIED = updated CDH_SUMMARY.GL for matter 1, Cost code 3 record is added BASE_NEW = 53.1659131639 TO_BILL_NEW = 53.1659131639 BASE_MOD = 0TO_BILL_MOD = 0LAST_MODIFIED = updated CDH_SUMMARY.GL for matter 2, Cost code 1 is updated BASE_NEW = increased by 53.1659131639 TO_BILL_NEW = increased by 53.1659131639 BASE_MOD = unchangedTO_BILL_MOD = unchangedLAST_MODIFIED = updated CDH_SUMMARY.GL for matter 3, Cost code 1 row is added BASE_NEW = 53.1659131639 TO_BILL_NEW = 53.1659131639 BASE_MOD = 0TO_BILL_MOD = 0LAST_MODIFIED = updated || Step 10: Cancel the payment | Expected: Payment canceled TBH_MATTER_SUMM - values match starting values- rows that were added are not removed  CDH_SUMMARY.GL for matter 1, Cost code 1 is updated BASE_NEW = unchangedTO_BILL_NEW= unchangedBASE_MOD = decreased by 2 X 53.1659131639 (106.3318263278) TO_BILL_MOD = decreased by 2 X 53.1659131639 (106.3318263278) LAST_MODIFIED = updated CDH_SUMMARY.GL for matter 1, Cost code 2 is updated BASE_NEW = unchangedTO_BILL_NEW= unchangedBASE_MOD = decreased by 53.1659131639 TO_BILL_MOD = decreased by 53.1659131639 LAST_MODIFIED = updated CDH_SUMMARY.GL for matter 1, Cost code 3 updated BASE_NEW = unchangedTO_BILL_NEW= unchangedBASE_MOD= -53.1659131639 TO_BILL_MOD= -53.1659131639 LAST_MODIFIED = updated CDH_SUMMARY.GL for matter 2, Cost code 1 is updated BASE_NEW = unchangedTO_BILL_NEW= unchangedBASE_MOD= decreased by 53.1659131639 TO_BILL_MOD= decreased by 53.1659131639 LAST_MODIFIED = updated CDH_SUMMARY.GL for matter 3, Cost code 1 updated  BASE_NEW = unchangedTO_BILL_NEW= unchangedBASE_MOD= -53.1659131639 TO_BILL_MOD= -53.1659131639 LAST_MODIFIED = updated

Title: Payment - Cancel to New: Disbursement with auto splits
Steps: Step 1: Note:  Bug 181637Cancel to New is copying over all the splits to the new payment so the parent amount (if the parent has a remaining split) gets re-split Note: Bug 188433 Has been raised as a tempory measure to stop the user being able to do a Cancel to New when that payment or invoice has disbs for a matter where that matter has auto or delayed auto splits set up. This a tempory measure to avoid re-splits until bug 181637 can be dealt with. Note: Bug 264542/ 262042 822 EX0011Has been raised to allow the cancel to new as long as the split has not occurred || Step 2: Cancel to New disbursement - Client.Matter with auto splits setup & delayed split disabled.Note: test from form and grid as there is different code 822 EX00111. Create a payment2. Add disbursement with Client.Matter to invoice2. Post it.3. Cancel to New | Expected: FAILError Message: Cannot cancel to newe as one or more disbursements were split when the payment was postedPayment with any disbursement matter that has delayed split disabled or null, should not be able to be canceled to new. As the split has already occurred on post, so cancel to new is not allowed. || Step 3: Cancel to New disbursement - Client.Matter with auto splits setup and delayed split enabled, but none of payment matter's disbursements are on a PreBill. Note: test from form and grid as there is different code 822 EX0011 1. Create an payment2. Add disbursement with Client.Matter to invoice3. Post it.4. Cancel to New | Expected: SUCCESSAll disbursement matters on payment should have delayed split enabled and the matters have no disbursements on a prebill. No splitting has occurred so cancel to new is allowed. || Step 4: Cancel to New disbursement - Client.Matter with auto splits setup and delayed split enabled, but at least one of the payment matter's disbursements is on a PreBill.Note: test from form and grid as there is different code  822 EX0011 1. Create a payment2. Add disbursement with Client.Matter to invoice3. Post it.4. Create PreBill for Client.Matter with the disbs from the payment5. Cancel to New | Expected: FAILError Message: Cannot cancel to newe as one or more disbursements were split when the payment was postedAll disbursement matters on payment should have delayed split enabled in this case. However at least one matter has a disbursement on a PreBill, meaning there is a potential for splits to have occurred in billing. So cancel to new is not allowed. || Step 5: Cancel to New disbursement - Multiple disbursements- First disbursement's matter has auto splits setup and delayed split enabled.- Second disbursement's matter has auto splits setup and delayed split disabled.Note: test from form and grid as there is different code  822 EX00111. Create an payment2. Add disbursements listed above to payment3. Post it.4. Cancel to New | Expected: FAILError Message: Cannot cancel to newe as one or more disbursements were split when the payment was postedMix of disbursement matters having delayed split enabled or disabled, to verify that the code is catching if there are any disbursement matters which have delayed split as false. So cancel to new is not allowed because a split has already occurred on at least one. || Step 6: Auto disb splits are set up for a matter but not enabledSet Up- Enable Auto Disb Split = off- Enable Delayed Split = off- Some Disb splits are setup1. Create payment2. Add disb for the matter3. Post the payment4. Cancel to New the invoice | Expected: SuccessThe invoice can cancel to new as the splits are not enabled therefore will not occurCancel to New failed || Step 7: Delayed Auto disb splits are set up for a matter but not enabledSet Up- Enable Auto Disb Split = off- Enable Delayed Split = on- Some Disb splits are setup1. Create payment2. Add disb for the matter3. Post the payment4. Create a prebill with the disbs5. Cancel to New the invoice | Expected: FAILThe invoice can't be canceled to new even tho the splits are not enabled because they could become enabled after the invoice is posted and before the prebill is posted

Title: Recurring Invoice: Status hover/Generation Method
Steps: Step 1: Create a complete recurring invoice || Step 2: Go to the upper right where the status flag is || Step 3: Do Not Generate (H) | Expected: Red H FlagLast Generated On: APM_RECINV.LAST_INV_DATENext Invoice Date: APM_RECINV.NEXT_INV_DATELast Modified: APM_RECINV.LAST_MODIFIED || Step 4: Manual (M) | Expected: Yellow M FlagLast Generated On: APM_RECINV.LAST_INV_DATENext Invoice Date: APM_RECINV.NEXT_INV_DATELast Modified: APM_RECINV.LAST_MODIFIED || Step 5: Automatic (A) | Expected: Green A FlagLast Generated On: APM_RECINV.LAST_INV_DATENext Invoice Date: APM_RECINV.NEXT_INV_DATELast Modified: APM_RECINV.LAST_MODIFIED || Step 6: 1. Click the '?' in right corner above the ribbon panel2. Turn off Tooltips3. Hover over the status flag | Expected: Status still shows.

Title: Quick Pay - Warn if invoice disbursement not paid or full bill not paid
Steps: Step 1: *Each and all of the disbursements in the invoice have to be partially paid to have the invoice qualified as 'Partially Paid' || Step 2: Mostly tested in 179742 as it uses the same code | Expected: Bug 187126: Payment: Quick pay from invoice - Confirmation message is not displaying when paying a disbursement that required bill payment first- fixed || Step 3: Invoice Bill Payment Required. Full Paid not RequiredAPT_INVOICE.BILL_PMT_REQD = 'Y'.APM_PARMS.INV_PAYFULL_RELEAS = 'N'If there are any client disbursements that have not been paid for selected invoice. | Expected: Invoice is not added to the payment.Job completes with error: Disbursement not paid.The number of errors depend on the number of invoices that have not been paid.Payment still created, but invoice is not added. || Step 4: Invoice Bill Payment Required. Full Paid not Required. Invoice partially paid.APT_INVOICE.BILL_PMT_REQD = 'Y'.APM_PARMS.INV_PAYFULL_RELEAS = 'N'Client disbursements in the invoice have been PARTIALLY paid. | Expected: Invoice added to paymentJob completes with no errors || Step 5: Invoice Bill Payment Required. Full Paid RequiredAPT_INVOICE.BILL_PMT_REQD = 'Y'.APM_PARMS.INV_PAYFULL_RELEAS = 'Y'One of disbursements in the invoice has been paid. Invoice is only partially paid. | Expected: Invoice is not added to the payment.Job completes with error: Disbursement not paid.The number of errors depend on the number of invoices that have not been paid.Payment still created, but invoice is not added. || Step 6: Invoice Bill Payment Required. Full Paid Required. Invoice is fully paid.APT_INVOICE.BILL_PMT_REQD = 'Y'.APM_PARMS.INV_PAYFULL_RELEAS = 'Y'Client disbursements in the invoice have been FULLY paid. | Expected: Invoice added to paymentJob completes with no errors

Title: Invoice List - Create Payment Schedule from Invoice List Screen - Validation
Steps: Step 2: Compare manual creation with Create Payment Schedule || Step 3: Different to bank currency1. Create an invoice that has a currency that is different to the bank currency that is attached to the AP Type (e.g. CAD currency for INE AP Type. Has Bank of Europe attached and is EUR.)2. Create another invoice that has the same currency as the bank currency 3. Release and post both invoices3. Select both and click Create Payment Schedule | Expected: 1. Both of the invoices should be in invoice currency in the grid. Payment Amount in the header should be in the bank currency || Step 4: Edit Invoice on PS1. Can add new invoices to the payment schedule | Expected: Changes made inline should reflect on card and vice versa || Step 5: Take Overdue Discount Amount=Y1.  Turn on Take Overdue Discount2. Create an invoice, release and post it3. Title: Quick Pay- Locks

Title: Payment Items - Disbursement: allow edit of base setting
Steps: Step 1: Note: Disbs created in AP or Expenses should not be able to have their base amounts changed by billingNote: If the value for OK_TO_EDIT_BASE is changed, as with any Admin changes, any open payments should be closed to reflect this changes otherwise you will not see expected behavior for the following steps.This occurs because we cache values when we have an open payment, otherwise we would need to fetch from databases constantly. || Step 2: From 82SP2.EX0003 and 83 US 241218 - Set Disbursement Card Base and Bill Amount to required and blank field when initialise the form. || Step 3: Allow edit of base = Y1. Create a payment2. Add a disb where the cost code is set to allow edit to baseSELECT ALLOW_BASE_EDIT,*FROM CDL_COST | Expected: Base Amount field enabled.Disbursement savedCDT_DISB.OK_TO_EDIT_BASE = NNote: is always set to N when entered via the AP application || Step 4: Allow edit of base = N1. Create a payment2. Add a disb where the cost code is set to not allow edit to baseSELECT ALLOW_BASE_EDIT,*FROM CDL_COST | Expected: Base Amount field disabled.Disbursement savedCDT_DISB.OK_TO_EDIT_BASE = N || Step 5: This test case is not valid as you can't have not allowed to edit unless you have ratesChange Disb Code with ALLOW_BASE_EDIT = Y to N1. Create a payment2. Add a disb where the cost code is set to allow edit to baseSELECT ALLOW_BASE_EDIT,*FROM CDL_COST3. Enter a base amont.4. Change disb code to NOT allow edit to base. | Expected: Base Amount field reset and disabled. Bug 199120 Disbursement Card - Base Amount should be disabled when Disb Code has 'N' for ALLOW_BASE_EDIT || Step 6: Change Disb Code with ALLOW_BASE_EDIT = Y to N and with unit rates1. Create a payment2. Add a disb where the cost code is set to allow edit to baseSELECT ALLOW_BASE_EDIT,*FROM CDL_COST3. Enter a base amont and quantity.4. Change disb code to NOT allow edit to base. | Expected: Base Amount field recalculated based on Quantity and disabled.

Title: Invoice List - Create Payment Schedule from Invoice List Screen - Create Payment Schedule
Steps: Step 1: Create an invoice, release and post it | Expected: Outstanding Invoice || Step 2: Select the invoice in the list screen | Expected: Create Payment Schedule button is enabled || Step 3: Click Create Payment Schedule | Expected: Dialogue- Create payment schedule from invoices confirmation. || Step 4: Click Cancel | Expected: Dialogue closes, user left on invoices view, no payment schedule created for the invoice || Step 5: Click Create Payment Schedule again || Step 6: Click Proceed | Expected: User taken from Invoice view to Payment Schedule View where the payment schedule created is open. || Step 7: Check the header and grid | Expected: SELECT * FROM APS_SCHEDULE_Z ORDER BY LAST_MODIFIED DESC || Step 8: Go back to invoice screen | Expected: Invoice that was put onto payment schedule has the payment hover and cannot be put on another payment schedule (button disabled)

Title: Payment - Remittance: Email for Employee payments
Steps: Step 1: This test case applies to Manual Check (M), Electronic(E) and Wire (W) payments || Step 2: ^ Can ignore the last step of the shared step 4 || Step 3: ^ Follow up to at least 6 for shared step 77. Entity Manager >Employee of choice8. Click the little card button next to Full Name9. Go to Bank Account Details10. Add Bank details || Step 4: No email setup1. Have no email addresses set up for the employee2. Create an electronic employee payment and print remittances with email | Expected: Job complete with error: Email address for employee [employee_name] is not found - RA still printed || Step 5: HBM_PRSNL.EMAIL | Expected: select EMAIL,*from HBM_PERSNL whereloginlike'%%' || Step 6: Setup 1. Entity Manager > Employee of choice2. Fill in Email field with aderant email || Step 7: Email1. Create an electronic employee payment 2. Print Payments > put in a Payment Date3. Click Print Remittance Advices 4. Select a printer if required (can turn this on through Entity Manager> Bank)5. Select Yes for emailing the remittance advices and choose a remittance advice email format | Expected: An email is sent to the email address set up || Step 8: HBM_NAME.INTERNET_ADDR | Expected: select INTERNET_ADDR,* from hbm_name where LAST_NAME = '' Check your name uno from HBM_PRSNL || Step 9: Setup1. Entity Manager > Employee of choice2. Click the small card button next to Full Name field3. Under Details fill in the Email field. || Step 10: Email - Internet_Addr- Note: Remove email address from HBM_PRSNL.EMAIL first 1. Create an electronic employee payment2. Print Payments > put in a Payment Date3. Click Print Remittance Advices 4. Select a printer if required (can turn this on through Entity Manager> Bank)5. Select Yes for emailing the remittance advices and choose a remittance advice email format | Expected: Receive an email || Step 11: Checking email defaults | Expected: HBM_PRSNL.EMAIL should be used before HBM_NAME.INTERNET_ADDR || Step 12: Can use two different email addresses in the two options (find another willing person?)With only your email1. Fill in HBM_PRSNL.EMAIL with your email2. Fill in HBM_NAME.INTERNET_ADDR with TTQA1@aderant.com3. Print and email RA4. Switch the two email address around (TTQA1 in EMAIL, yours in INTERNET_ADDR) | Expected: 3. You should receive an email4. You should NOT receive an email. || Step 13: Invalid Email address1. Enter an invalid email address into the Employees Email, valid email address in Internet Address2. Create an electronic payment, print and email the remittance advices3. Invalid email in Internet Address, valid email in Email.4. Invalid email in both Email and Internet Address | Expected: 2. Job error: "One or more recipients are invalid." - Remittance advice still printed3. Email sent4. Job error: "One or more recipients are invalid." - Remittance advice still printed || Step 14: Repeat test case using Reprint Remittance Advices1. Have RA not printed | Expected: 1. Job errors out - No remittance advice generated

Title: Payment Items - Disbursement: Post and cancel with auto splits with multi currency where disb is not billed
Steps: Step 1: Pre reqsCAD Rates Rate: 1.092007784100000Reciprocal: 0.915744388053213Matter 1 - Source Matter- Auto splits enabledUnder the time and billing | disbMatter 2 - Child matter- 30% splitMatter 3- Child matter- 50% split.Matter 4- Status does not allow disb- Child matter- 10% split. | Expected: ----------------------------------------------------------------------------------- Declarations---------------------------------------------------------------------------------DECLARE @payment asint= 368DECLARE @clientmatters asVARCHAR (2000)='tst5.2,tst5.3,tst5.4,tst5.5'DECLARE @paymenttrans asint= (SELECT TRAN_UNO FROM APT_CHECK WHERE REQUEST_NUM = @payment AND REVERSAL <>'Y')DECLARE @paycur asVARCHAR (10)= (SELECT CURRENCY_CODE FROM APT_CHECK WHERE TRAN_UNO = @paymenttrans )DECLARE @contrapaymenttrans asint= (SELECT TRAN_UNO FROM APT_CHECK WHERE REQUEST_NUM = @payment AND REVERSAL ='Y')DECLARE @contrapaycur asVARCHAR (10)= (SELECT CURRENCY_CODE FROM APT_CHECK WHERE TRAN_UNO = @contrapaymenttrans )----------------------------------------------------------------------------------- Payments---------------------------------------------------------------------------------SELECT @paymenttrans[TRAN_UNO],@contrapaymenttrans[TRAN_UNO contra]----------------------------------------------------------------------------------- CDT_DISB----------------------------------------------------------------------------------- Original paymentSELECT'' [CDT_DISB],m.CLNT_MATT_CODE,d.DISB_UNO,d.ACTIVITY_COUNT,SPLIT_NUM,TRANSFERRED,d.SOURCE_TRAN_TYP,SOURCE_TRAN_UNO,d.WIP_STATUS,d.EXPERT_DISB_STATUS, d.TRAN_DATE,d.HOLD_DATE,d.HARDSOFT,d.COST_CODE, d.DISB_REF,d.AUTO_CALCULATE,d.DRUNO,@paycur[Pay Cur],d.CURRENCY_CODE[Cur Entered] ,r.RATE,d.BILL_QTY,d.BASE_QTY,BASE_AMT,TOBILL_AMT,STD_AMT,BILLED_AMT,RETAINED_BILLED_AMT,d.OK_TO_EDIT_BASE,d.MATTER_UNO,d.BILL_TRAN_UNO,d.LAST_MODIFIED,d.* FROM CDT_DISB d JOIN HBM_MATTER m ON d.MATTER_UNO = m.MATTER_UNOJOIN TBL_CURR_RATE r ON r.CURRENCY_CODE = @paycur AND r.DRUNO = d.DRUNOINNERJOIN SplitByDelimiter (@clientmatters,',') s ON s.items = m.CLNT_MATT_CODEWHERE SOURCE_TRAN_UNO = @paymenttransORDER BY m.CLNT_MATT_CODE,d.DISB_UNO -- Contra paymentSELECT'' [CDT_DISB contra],m.CLNT_MATT_CODE,d.DISB_UNO,d.ACTIVITY_COUNT,SPLIT_NUM,d.SOURCE_TRAN_TYP,SOURCE_TRAN_UNO,d.WIP_STATUS,d.EXPERT_DISB_STATUS,d.TRAN_DATE,d.HOLD_DATE,d.HARDSOFT,d.COST_CODE, d.DISB_REF,d.AUTO_CALCULATE,d.DRUNO,@contrapaycur[Pay Cur],d.CURRENCY_CODE[Cur Entered] ,r.RATE,d.BILL_QTY,d.BASE_QTY,BASE_AMT,TOBILL_AMT,STD_AMT,BILLED_AMT,RETAINED_BILLED_AMT,d.OK_TO_EDIT_BASE,d.MATTER_UNO,d.BILL_TRAN_UNO,d.LAST_MODIFIED,d.* FROM CDT_DISB d JOIN HBM_MATTER m ON d.MATTER_UNO = m.MATTER_UNOJOIN TBL_CURR_RATE r ON r.CURRENCY_CODE = @contrapaycur AND r.DRUNO = d.DRUNOINNERJOIN SplitByDelimiter (@clientmatters,',') s ON s.items = m.CLNT_MATT_CODEWHERE SOURCE_TRAN_UNO = @contrapaymenttransORDER BY m.CLNT_MATT_CODE,d.DISB_UNO ----------------------------------------------------------------------------------- CDT_DISB_NEW----------------------------------------------------------------------------------- OriginalSELECT '' [CDT_DISB_NEW], m.CLNT_MATT_CODE, d.* FROM CDT_DISB_NEW d JOIN HBM_MATTER m ON d.MATTER_UNO = m.MATTER_UNOWHERE d.DISB_UNO IN(SELECT DISB_UNOFROM CDT_DISB d JOIN HBM_MATTER m ON d.MATTER_UNO = m.MATTER_UNOINNERJOIN SplitByDelimiter (@clientmatters,',') s ON s.items = m.CLNT_MATT_CODEWHERE SOURCE_TRAN_UNO = @paymenttrans)ORDER BY m.CLNT_MATT_CODE,d.DISB_UNO -- ContraSELECT '' [CDT_DISB_NEW contra], m.CLNT_MATT_CODE, d.* FROM CDT_DISB_NEW d JOIN HBM_MATTER m ON d.MATTER_UNO = m.MATTER_UNOWHERE d.DISB_UNO IN(SELECT DISB_UNOFROM CDT_DISB d JOIN HBM_MATTER m ON d.MATTER_UNO = m.MATTER_UNOINNERJOIN SplitByDelimiter (@clientmatters,',') s ON s.items = m.CLNT_MATT_CODEWHERE SOURCE_TRAN_UNO = @contrapaymenttrans)ORDER BY m.CLNT_MATT_CODE,d.DISB_UNO ----------------------------------------------------------------------------------- CDT_DISB_MOD----------------------------------------------------------------------------------- OriginalSELECT '' [CDT_DISB_MOD],m.CLNT_MATT_CODE,d.DISB_UNO, d.* FROM CDT_DISB_MOD d JOIN HBM_MATTER m ON d.MATTER_UNO = m.MATTER_UNOWHERE d.DISB_UNO IN(SELECT DISB_UNOFROM CDT_DISB d JOIN HBM_MATTER m ON d.MATTER_UNO = m.MATTER_UNOINNERJOIN SplitByDelimiter (@clientmatters,',') s ON s.items = m.CLNT_MATT_CODEWHERE SOURCE_TRAN_UNO = @paymenttrans)ORDER BY m.CLNT_MATT_CODE,d.DISB_UNO -- ContraSELECT '' [CDT_DISB_MOD contra], m.CLNT_MATT_CODE,d.DISB_UNO, d.* FROM CDT_DISB_MOD d JOIN HBM_MATTER m ON d.MATTER_UNO = m.MATTER_UNOWHERE d.DISB_UNO IN(SELECT DISB_UNOFROM CDT_DISB d JOIN HBM_MATTER m ON d.MATTER_UNO = m.MATTER_UNOINNERJOIN SplitByDelimiter (@clientmatters,',') s ON s.items = m.CLNT_MATT_CODEWHERE SOURCE_TRAN_UNO = @contrapaymenttrans)ORDER BY m.CLNT_MATT_CODE,d.DISB_UNO ----------------------------------------------------------------------------------- CDT_DISB_ORIG----------------------------------------------------------------------------------- OriginalSELECT '' [CDT_DISB_ORIG], m.CLNT_MATT_CODE, d.SPLIT_UNO,d.* FROM CDT_DISB_ORIG d JOIN HBM_MATTER m ON d.MATTER_UNO = m.MATTER_UNOWHERE d.DISB_UNO IN(SELECT DISB_UNOFROM CDT_DISB d JOIN HBM_MATTER m ON d.MATTER_UNO = m.MATTER_UNOINNERJOIN SplitByDelimiter (@clientmatters,',') s ON s.items = m.CLNT_MATT_CODEWHERE SOURCE_TRAN_UNO = @paymenttrans)ORDER BY m.CLNT_MATT_CODE,d.DISB_UNO -- ContraSELECT '' [CDT_DISB_ORIG contra], m.CLNT_MATT_CODE, d.SPLIT_UNO,d.* FROM CDT_DISB_ORIG d JOIN HBM_MATTER m ON d.MATTER_UNO = m.MATTER_UNOWHERE d.DISB_UNO IN(SELECT DISB_UNOFROM CDT_DISB d JOIN HBM_MATTER m ON d.MATTER_UNO = m.MATTER_UNOINNERJOIN SplitByDelimiter (@clientmatters,',') s ON s.items = m.CLNT_MATT_CODEWHERE SOURCE_TRAN_UNO = @contrapaymenttrans)ORDER BY m.CLNT_MATT_CODE,d.DISB_UNO ----------------------------------------------------------------------------------- Summary tables---------------------------------------------------------------------------------SELECT ''[TBH_MATTER_SUMM],m.CLNT_MATT_CODE,ms.MATTER_UNO,ms.HARD_TOT,ms.HARD_COUNT,ms.SOFT_TOT,ms.SOFT_COUNT,ms.LAST_MODIFIED FROM TBH_MATTER_SUMM msJOIN HBM_MATTER m ON ms.MATTER_UNO = m.MATTER_UNOINNERJOIN SplitByDelimiter (@clientmatters,',') s ON s.items = m.CLNT_MATT_CODEORDERBY m.CLNT_MATT_CODESELECT''[CDH_SUMMARY_GL],m.CLNT_MATT_CODE,cs.MATTER_UNO,COST_CODE,HARDSOFT,PERIOD,BASE_OPEN,TOBILL_OPEN,BASE_NEW,TOBILL_NEW,BASE_MOD,TOBILL_MOD,BASE_BIL,TOBILL_BIL,cs.LAST_MODIFIEDFROM CDH_SUMMARY_GL csJOIN HBM_MATTER m ON cs.MATTER_UNO = m.MATTER_UNOINNERJOIN SplitByDelimiter (@clientmatters,',') s ON s.items = m.CLNT_MATT_CODE--AND COST_CODE in ('AIR','COUR','JAN4')ORDERBY cs.MATTER_UNO,cs.COST_CODE, cs.HARDSOFT, cs.PERIOD || Step 2: Query summary tables to get the start values for  the 3 mattersCDH_SUMMARY_GLTBH_MATTER_SUMM | Expected: SELECT HARD_TOT ,HARD_COUNT ,SOFT_TOT ,SOFT_COUNT ,LAST_MODIFIED ,* FROM TBH_MATTER_SUMM WHERE MATTER_UNO in ()SELECT BASE_NEW ,TOBILL_NEW,BASE_MOD ,TOBILL_MOD ,LAST_MODIFIED ,* FROM CDH_SUMMARY_GL WHERE MATTER_UNO in () || Step Title: Payment - Wire: Wire Number Manual Assign
Steps: Step 1: This is similar to Test Case 167267: Payment - EB: Wire Number Manual assign || Step 2: Useful TablesTBM_BANK = Bank TableAPT_CHECK = Payment / Check Table Useful ColumnsTBM_BANK. ASSIGN_WIRE_NUMBER = If  wire numbers are mandatoryTBM_BANK. AUTO_WIRE_NUM = Should wire numbers automatically be generated APT_CHECK.WIRE_NUM = The associated wire number with a paymentNOTE: If banking details are updated, Expert Accounts Payable will need to be reset. || Step 3: Wire number is mandatoryUPDATE TBM_BANK SET ASSIGN_WIRE_NUMBER ='Y',AUTO_WIRE_NUM ='N' WHERE BANK_CODE =''1. Select to create vendor payment with Wire (W) payment method2. Select Vendor | Expected: Wire number is displayed as mandatory || Step 4: Wire number is optionalUPDATE TBM_BANK SET ASSIGN_WIRE_NUMBER ='N',AUTO_WIRE_NUM ='N' WHERE BANK_CODE =''1. Select to create vendor payment with Wire (W) payment method2. Select Vendor3. Enter amount4. SaveNote: Repeat this to ensure its not attempting to match the empty string as a value | Expected: Payment is saved- wire number is not generated- payment saves with blank wire number || Step 5: Leading and trailing spaces 1. Select to create vendor payment with Wire (W) payment method2. Select Vendor3. Enter amount4. Enter wire number = ' 123 '5. Save | Expected: Not allowed to enter white space- wire numberis saved as '123' (leading and trailing spaces removed) || Step 6: Spaces within the text 1. Select to create vendor payment with Wire (W) payment method2. Select Vendor3. Enter amount4. Enter wire number = '12 3'5. Save | Expected: UI does not allow this || Step 7: Special characters1. Select to create vendor payment with Wire (W) payment method2. Select Vendor3. Enter amount4. Enter wire number = !@#$%^&*()_+-=[]{}\|;',./:"<>?~`Paste the line above into the wire number field. | Expected: UI should prevent the entering of non-alphanumeric values. || Step 8: Alpha/numeric1. Select to create vendor payment with Wire (W) payment method2. Select Vendor3. Enter amount4. Enter wire number = 'a1b2'5. Save | Expected: Payment is saved - wire number is saved as 'a1b2' || Step 9: Duplicate1. Select to create vendor payment with Wire (W) payment method2. Select Vendor3. Enter amount4. Enter wire number = 'a1b2' | Expected: UI displays the field in error  - wire number 'a1b2' is already in use for BANK_CODE || Step 10: Duplicate by changing bank1. Have one bank that has some wire numbers already2. Select to create vendor payment with Wire (W) payment method3. Select Vendor4. Select bank = bank 15. Enter amount6. Enter wire number = unique for bank 1 but has been used for bank 27. Save8. Change bank  = bank 29. Save | Expected: Display error - Wire number already in useWire number gets removed when changing the bank Bug 176276 - Payment: Should not be able to save a duplicate wire numberBug 206474 - Payment: Save validation when there has been a service error for duplicate wire number, is prompting to save but closes without saving

Title: Payment - Wire: Wire Number auto assign
Steps: Step 1: Similar to Test Case 160936: Payment - EB: Wire Number Auto assign || Step 2: Pre ReqsThe following SQL script can be run to set auto assigning wire numbers and if wire numbers are mandatory. UPDATE TBM_BANK SET ASSIGN_WIRE_NUMBER ='N', AUTO_WIRE_NUM ='Y' WHERE BANK_CODE IN ('BANK', 'CODES') -- e.g ('BAUK', 'BOO')  Useful TablesTBM_BANK = Bank TableAPT_CHECK = Payment / Check TableCMS_UNIQUE_KEYS = Log of generated numbers Useful ColumnsTBM_BANK. ASSIGN_WIRE_NUMBER = If  wire numbers are mandatoryTBM_BANK. AUTO_WIRE_NUM = Should wire numbers automatically be generated APT_CHECK.WIRE_NUM = The associated wire number with a paymentCMS_UNIQUE_KEYS.TBNAME = The row associated with unos for wire numbersNOTE: If banking details are updated, Expert Accounts Payable will need to be reset. || Step 3: Vendor - Has bank accounts on multiple banks- No payment exists for the banks with auto generated wire numbers Note: Need to either have no wire payments or payments set so that the next number will be the same for 2 of the banks so we can see a duplicate wire number can be created where it is unique to the bank || Step 4: Create a payment for vendor for bank 11. Select to create payment2. Select Vendor3. Select bank 14. Enter the amount5. Save | Expected: Payment saved - wire number = 1 (latest wire number + 1 for that bank)- unique keys record createdYou can view unique key information for bank wire numbers with the following script.SELECT * FROM CMS_UNIQUE_KEYS WHERE TBNAME LIKE ('_TBM_BANK_WIRE_%') || Step 5: Create a payment for vendor for bank 21. Select to create payment2. Select Vendor3. Select bank 24. Enter the amount5. Save | Expected: Payment saved - wire number = 1 (latest wire number + 1 for that bank)- wire number is the same as for bank 1- unique keys record created || Step 6: Create another payment for vendor for bank 11. Select to create payment2. Select Vendor3. Select bank 14. Enter the amount5. Enter wire number = 26. Save | Expected: Payment saved - wire number = 2- is unique keys record updated? || Step 7: Create another payment for vendor for bank 11. Select to create payment2. Select Vendor3. Select bank 14. Enter the amount5. Save | Expected: Payment saved - wire number = 3 (latest wire number + 1 for that bank)- unique keys record updated || Step 8: Create payment for vendor for bank 1 setting the wire number manuallyNote: you can either set the bank to manual wire assign or create the payment via classic1. Select to create payment2. Select Vendor3. Select bank 14. Enter the amount5. Enter the next wire number being 46. Save | Expected: Payment saved - wire number = 4 - unique keys record NOT updated || Step 9: Create another payment for vendor for bank 1 1. If you have set the bank to manual in the previous step, then set it back to auto2. Select to create payment3. Select Vendor4. Select bank5. Enter the amount6. Save | Expected: Payment saved - wire number = 5 (next number > than either the lastkey or the greatest numeric wire number on a payment, whichever is greater )Note: at some point it was changed from this: (next number > than either the lastkey or the greatest numeric wire number on a payment, whichever is greater )- unique keys record updated

Title: Payment - Wire: Look and Feel
Steps: Step 1: Note: This test case is for the new payment type Wire (W) and it's differences to the other payments.Wire is like manual check but for electronic banking and it follows the same functionality as Appshells Wire.Note: Payment method | Expected: https://aderant.sharepoint.com/RD/AP/Moscow%20Design%20Wiki/New%20Payment%20Document%20Type%20-%20Manual%20Wire.aspx || Step 2: Payment method | Expected: Has four options: Check, Manual, Electronic, Wire || Step 3: Advanced search Payment Method field | Expected: - Has four options: Check (C), Manual (M), Electronic (E), Wire (W) - Wire searches for wire payments and not electronic. Only returns Wire- Electronic searches do not return Wire payments. Only returns Electronic || Step 4: Create a new vendor payment with preferred payment method Wire (W) | Expected: - Payment defaults to wire on input of vendor- Bank account details not pulled into payment - Wire Number is enabled/disabled and auto assigned using the same control as Electronic (E)- Date to Print is disabled- Cannot create a bank file (button disabled)APT_CHECK.DOCUMENT_TYPE = WAPT_CHECK.BANK_ACCOUNT_UNO = 0 || Step 5: Create new wire Client payment | Expected: - Bank account details not pulled into payment and are not required- Wire Number is enabled/disabled and auto assigned using the same control as Electronic (E)- Date to Print is disabled- Cannot create a bank file (button disabled)APT_CHECK.DOCUMENT_TYPE = WAPT_CHECK.BANK_ACCOUNT_UNO = 0 || Step 6: Create new wire Miscellaneous payment | Expected: Bank account details not pulled into payment and are not requiredWire Number is enabled/disabled and auto assigned using the same control as Electronic (E)Date to Print is disabledCannot create a bank file (button disabled)APT_CHECK.DOCUMENT_TYPE = WAPT_CHECK.BANK_ACCOUNT_UNO = 0 || Step 7: Create new wire Employee payment | Expected: Bank account details not pulled into payment and are not requiredWire Number is enabled/disabled and auto assigned using the same control as Electronic (E)Date to Print is disabledCannot create a bank file (button disabled)APT_CHECK.DOCUMENT_TYPE = WAPT_CHECK.BANK_ACCOUNT_UNO = 0 || Step 8: Release the payments | Expected: No issues || Step 9: Print the remittance advices | Expected: Follows the same printing as manual or electronic banking. || Step 10: Email the remittance advices | Expected: Follows same as emailing manual or electronic (Remittance Advice emailed and saved to the sender's email sent folder (refer to Bug: 266678)) || Step 11: Post the payments | Expected: No issues || Step 12: Cancel the payments to new | Expected: Payments created as Wire payments and APT_CHECK.DOCUMENT_TYPE = W || Step 13: Post them again (have to reprint them) | Expected: No issues || Step 14: Cancel them | Expected: Cancels correctly. Cancel payment lines have APT_CHECK.DOCUMENT_TYPE = W

Title: Payment - Wire: Printing
Payment - Check print: Additional Formatting
Steps: Step 1: Remittance templateAdd format tests:Left pad number with zeros to length of 5:a{}{FORMAT(CHECK_NUM, “LZD0W5”)}aRight pad number with zeros to length of 5:a{}{FORMAT(CHECK_NUM, “ZD0W5”)}aLeft pad number with spaces to length of 5:a{}{FORMAT(CHECK_NUM, “LD0W5”)}aRight pad number with spaces to length of 5:a{}{FORMAT(CHECK_NUM, “D0W5”)}aLeft pad text string with spaces to length of 10:a{}{PAD(ACCOUNT_NUM, -10)}aRight pad text string with spaces to length of 10:a{}{PAD(ACCOUNT_NUM, 10)}aLeft pad text string with any character to length of 10:a{}{PAD(ACCOUNT_NUM, -10, “0”)}aRight pad text string with any character to length of 10:a{}{PAD(ACCOUNT_NUM, 10, “0”)}aLeft pad amount with zero to length of 10 and strip out decimal separator:a{}{FORMAT(CHECK_AMOUNT, “LZSD2W10”)}a || Step 2: Print Check | Expected: Values output with correct formatting

Title: New Invoice Workflow - Code Invoice Task - Form Validation
Steps: Step 1: On screen / client validation should still be the same with entering the invoice manually in Invoice Entry form.See linked TC 163444 || Step 2: Other than it should still be able to :Saving Invoice and continue working on it later on. || Step 3: Save InvoiceEdit Invoice, Save Invoice, Close it.Reopen it | Expected: Changes saved, user can continue edit the invoice. || Step 4: Save and Close Invoice Edit Invoice, Save and Close invoice.Reopen it | Expected: Changes saved, user and continue edit the invoice. || Step 5: Close Invoice.Edit Invoice. Close invoice. | Expected: Prompted with Pending Changes dialog.Choosing Discard do not save the change made and close the task.

Title: Smoke Test AP: Payment Schedule - Vendor
Steps: Step 1: Has some coverage by int tests but needs a UI test that matches || Step 2: Pre reqsBUSD(or any) bank with Payment Type setup.Vendor with Bank AccountTwo vendor invoices with criteria as below. Vendor Invoice 1- Currency : USD- AP Type : INU- Pay by EB = off- Posted Vendor Invoice 2- With Bank Account for the remit vendor- Currency : USD- AP Type : INU- Pay by EB = on- Posted | Expected: Int- SaveCheckSchedule_ShouldSaveWithMinimalData || Step 3: Vendor Payment Schedule, add Single invoice1. Payment Schedule Tab > New Schedule > Vendor Payment Schedule2. Fill in the header with Bank : BUSD3. Add invoices using Add Invoices ribbon > Add Single Invoice.4. On the Add Single Invoices form locate one of the invoices we got using Vendor and Invoice field.5. After selecting an invoice, change the Payment Amount (need to be less than Invoice amount). Add and Close. | Expected: Int- SaveCheckSchedule_ShouldSaveWithVendorInvoiceVendor invoice is added. Payment Amount is the value you changed to, Invoice Amount remain unchanged. || Step 4: Vendor Payment Schedule with Electronic Banking1. Remove the invoices from the schedule2. Add invoices using Add Invoices ribbon > Add Multiple Invoices.3. On the Add Multiple Invoices form, select Payment Type for Invoice Two.4. Search and Add | Expected: Int- SaveCheckSchedule_ShouldPickUpInvoicesOnCriteriaAndSaveInvoice Two added. || Step 5: Vendor Payment Schedule, add Multiple invoice1. Remove the invoices from the schedule2. Add invoices using Add Invoices ribbon > Add Multiple Invoices.3. On the Add Multiple Invoices form, Click Search and Add. | Expected: There is this test case but it doesn't specifically add both check and EB and then it cleans up afterwards but we need the data for subsequent testsUIAPTestData.APVendorPaymentScheduleAddMultipleInvoiceCanFilterOnMultipleAPTypeThe two vendor invoices are added to schedule. (or more if you have existing invoices which satisfied the search criteria)Invoice One has Payment Method = Check.Invoice Two with Bank Account has Payment Method = Electronic Banking || Step 6: Create payments1. Select Create payments2. Ok to warning that you're about to create payments3. Payment Schedule job runs | Expected: Int- CreatePayments_ShouldCreateAPaymentForSingleVendorInvoiceInt- CreatePayments_ShouldCreateAPaymentForMultipleVendorInvoices_InOneGroupPayments created Payment 1Payment type = check Payment 2Payment type = electronicInt- GeneratingRequests_ForElectronicInvoices_AssignsWireNumbers_FromBankSequence || Step 7: Post PaymentsMake sure to print check for the check payment first. | Expected: Payments posted and schedule grid updated

Title: Payment - Post and Cancel: Manual payment
Steps: Step 1: Create payment with detail itemType = VendorBank = BUSDPayment date = todayMethod = ManualCheck Number = next avail check numberAmount = 100Sales / Use Tax = 1001099 Amount = 100Enter any other mandatory fieldsDetails Item amount = $100 | Expected: Payment createdAPT_CHECKENTRY_STATUS = NEXPERT_PAYMENT_STATUS = CSOURCE = MREVERSAL = NPAYEE_TYPE = VDOCUMENT_TYPE = MCHECK_NUM = as enteredPERIOD = 0DRUNO = 0TC_CODE = USDTC_CHK_AMT = 100CURRENCY_CODE = USDORIGINAL_AMT = NULLCHK_AMT = 100.00 (payment currency)TEN99_AMT = 100.00 (payment currency)SALES_USE_TAX = 100.00 (payment currency)TAX_AMT = Note: TEXT_ID is NULL in expert and 0 in classic - Title: Payment - Cancel to New: APA trust fields
Steps: Step 1: Note: Testing of the cancel part of the payment is covered by the cancel test cases. Here, we need to reconcile the New part of the process as New payment would normally be done via the UI so we need to ensure that the creation of the New payment via code has the same outcome || Step 2: Pre preqsAPA Trust is onUPDATE CMS_OPTION SET FLAG_VALUE ='Y' WHERE OPTION_CODE ='APA_TRUST'Bank- Account type = TrustClient (or Vendor) || Step 3: Create and Post payment1. Create client (or vendor) payment- Bank = bank 1- Type = Electronic or Wire- Bank account (if Electronic )- Trust Bank Id- Trust Acct- Trust Acct Name- Trust Pay Name2. Save3. Post | Expected: Payment is saved and posted with the trust data || Step 4: Cancel to New | Expected: Payment canceled and new payment created- New payment created with the trust fields copiedAPT_CHECK new entry createdTRST_BANK_ID = copied from originalTRST_ACCT  = copied from originalTRST_ANAME = copied from originalTRST_NPAY = copied from original

Title: New Invoice Workflow - New Invoice form - Data Providers
Steps: Step 1: Vendor | Expected: - Required- Search control. Standard Vendor data provider.- Able to enter Temporary Vendor Name. Temporary Vendor Name is distinguishable with a '(Temporary)'. Note that you cannot edit Temp Vendor, you will have to type in a new one to overwrite the existing one.- Supports MRU. *From 82SP2, Temp Vendor entry is not allowed if Firm Options > "Allow Temporary Vendor Name" is not ticked. || Step 2: Override Name/Address button | Expected: - Only display when a Vendor has been selected.- Opens up the same Change Name and Address window in Invoice Entry. || Step 3: Vendor Name/Address | Expected: - Display text only.- Display the selected or Overriden Vendor Name and Address - Do not display anything when temporary vendor is used. || Step 4: Invoice Number | Expected: - Required- Text field, Max 30 char.- Validates duplicate Invoice Number on selected Vendor.Added in 82SP2- If the option "Enforce Unique Invoice Numbers Across Subsidiaries" is selected in Entity Manager for a parent vendor, then validates duplicate Invoice Number for that parent and its subsidiaries as follows :  : Validates on the selected parent vendor,  : Validates on subsidiaries of the selected parent vendor,  : Validates on the selected subsidiary vendor,  : Validates on the parent vendor of the selected subsidiary vendor,  : Validates on the subsidiary vendors linked to the parent of the selected subsidiary vendor. || Step 5: Invoice Date | Expected: - Required- Date control- Default to current date. - Validates date is within min and max APM_PARMS date. || Step 6: Currency | Expected: - Required- Default to the vendor currency when vendor is selected. || Step 7: Invoice Amount | Expected: - Required- Must be less than or equal 999,999,999,999,999.00, else error, (15 digits). Bug 188007 - Display the currency symbol of selected currency. || Step 8: Attach/View buttonsAdded in 82SP2Remove button | Expected: For attaching image/invoice to the workflow.- When no image attached, Attach button enabled, View button disabled, Remove button disabled.- When image attached, Replace button enabled, View button enabled, Remove button enabled. || Step 9: Checkbox'I can confirm that goods or service have been received' || Step 10: Checkbox'Return the invoice to me for coding' || Step 11: Checkbox'Rush Payment' || Step 12: Payment Required By | Expected: - Enabled when 'Rush Payment' is ticked.- Required.- Date Provider || Step 13: Forward Invoice To | Expected: - Required- Default to current user when 'Return invoice to me for coding' is ticked. Possibly, logged in Bug 188007 .- Employee name data provider. || Step 14: Additional Instructions | Expected: - Text field- Unable to test for maximum characters allowed. The text are stored in Microsoft tables so they can be pretty big, megabytes in size and encoded too.
