Title: New Invoice Workflow - Create Vendor Task - Data Providers
Steps: Step 1: Form used in Create Vendor Task is almost identical to New Invoice Task. See 187973 | Expected: By this stage, the Service Verified By and Invoice to be Coded By field should be already populated. Also cannot change Forward Invoice To field.The rest of the fields should still be editable. || Step 2: Vendor | Expected: - Required- Search control. Standard Vendor data provider.- Able to enter Temporary Vendor Name. Temporary Vendor Name is distinguishable with a '(Temporary)'. Note that you cannot edit Temp Vendor, you will have to type in a new one to overwrite the existing one.- Supports MRU. *From 82SP2, Temp Vendor entry is not allowed if Firm Options > "Allow Temporary Vendor Name" is not ticked. || Step 3: Override Name/Address button | Expected: - Only display when a Vendor has been selected.- Opens up the same Change Name and Address window in Invoice Entry. || Step 4: Vendor Name/Address | Expected: - Display text only.- Display the selected or Overriden Vendor Name and Address - Do not display anything when temporary vendor is used. || Step 5: Invoice Number | Expected: - Required- Text field, Max 30 char.- Validates duplicate Invoice Number on selected Vendor.Added in 82SP2- If the option "Enforce Unique Invoice Numbers Across Subsidiaries" is selected in Entity Manager for a parent vendor, then validates duplicate Invoice Number for that parent and its subsidiaries as follows :  : Validates on the selected parent vendor,  : Validates on subsidiaries of the selected parent vendor,  : Validates on the selected subsidiary vendor,  : Validates on the parent vendor of the selected subsidiary vendor,  : Validates on the subsidiary vendors linked to the parent of the selected subsidiary vendor. || Step 6: Invoice Date | Expected: - Required- Date control- Default to current date. - Validates date is within min and max APM_PARMS date. || Step 7: Currency | Expected: - Required- Default to the vendor currency when vendor is selected. || Step 8: Invoice Amount | Expected: - Required- Must be less than or equal 999,999,999,999,999.00, else error, (15 digits). Bug 188007 - Display the currency symbol of selected currency. || Step 9: Attach/View buttonsAdded in 82SP2Remove button | Expected: For attaching image/invoice to the workflow.- When no image attached, Attach button enabled, View button disabled, Remove button disabled.- When image attached, Replace button enabled, View button enabled, Remove button enabled. || Step 10: Service Verified By field | Expected: Displays user who checked the 'Service/Goods has been received' checkbox || Step 11: Invoice to be Coded By field | Expected: Displays user who checked the 'Return the invoice to me for coding' checkbox || Step 12: Checkbox 'Rush Payment' || Step 13: Payment Required By | Expected: - Enabled when 'Rush Payment' is ticked.- Required.- Date Provider || Step 14: Forward Invoice To | Expected: Disabled if 'Invoice to be Coded by" is ticked || Step 15: Additional Instructions | Expected: - Text field- Unable to test for maximum characters allowed. The text are stored in Microsoft tables so they can be pretty big, megabytes in size and encoded too.

Title: Quick Pay- Take Discount
Steps: Step 1: Take Overdue Discount flag found in:Admin> Accounts Payable> Accounts Payable Options> Firm Options | Expected: select TAKE_DISCOUNT,*from APM_PARMS || Step 2: Take Overdue Discount = N1. Turn off Take Overdue Discount 2. Create two invoices with Discount Amount = $15 and a Discount Date that is:    a. After todays date    b. Before todays date3. Release and post both of them4. Go to the invoice list scren, select both of them and click Quick Pay | Expected: TAKE_DISCOUNT=NBoth invoices are added to the paymenta. Has $15 in the discount amountb. Has $0 in their discount amount || Step 3: Take Overdue Discount = Y1. Turn on Take Overdue Discount2. Create two invoices with Discount Amount = $15 and a Discount Date that is:    a. After todays date    b. Before todays date3. Release and post both of them4. Go to the invoice list scren, select both of them and click Quick Pay | Expected: TAKE_DISCOUNT=YBoth of the invoices are added to the paymentBoth of them have $15 in their Discount Amount field

Title: Payment Items - Invoice: Discount Amount and Discount Date
Steps: Step 1: Take Overdue Discount flag found in:Admin> Accounts Payable> Accounts Payable Options> Firm Options | Expected: select TAKE_DISCOUNT,*from APM_PARMS || Step 2: Take Overdue Discount = Y1. Turn on Take Overdue DiscountUPDATE APM_PARMS SET TAKE_DISCOUNT = 'Y'2. Create two invoices with Discount Amount = $15 and a Discount Date that is:    a. After todays date    b. Before todays date3. Release and post both of them4. Create a vendor payment5. Add both invoices to the payment | Expected: TAKE_DISCOUNT=YBoth of the invoices are added to the paymentBoth of them have $15 in their Discount Amount field || Step 3: Take Overdue Discount = N1. Turn off Take Overdue Discount UPDATE APM_PARMS SET TAKE_DISCOUNT = 'N'2. Create two invoices with Discount Amount = $15 and a Discount Date that is:    a. After todays date    b. Before todays date3. Release and post both of them4. Create a vendor payment5. Add both invoices to the payment | Expected: TAKE_DISCOUNT=NBoth invoices are added to the paymenta. Has $15 in the discount amountb. Has $0 in their discount amount

Title: Vendor Payment Schedule - Add Single Invoice Validation
Steps: Step 1: Invoice still open1. Create a new invoice, release and post it. Leave it open in the invoice view2. Create a new payment schedule with the same bank as on the Invoice's AP Type3. Click Add Invoices> Add Single Invoice4. Find and select the invoice created | Expected: Red box around Invoice field: "Open and locked in another view" || Step 2: Hold date after todays date1. Create an invoice and make the hold date after todays date 2. Release and post the invoice3. Create a payment schedule with the same bank as on the invoice AP Type4. Click Add Invoices> Add Single Invoice5. Find and select the invoice created    a. Select No    b. Select Yes | Expected: Choice dialogue comes up saying"Invalid invoice hold date"a. Red box around the Invoice field: "Today's date [todays_date] is less than the hold date on the invoice [hold_date]. "b. No validation error and lets you add it to the payment schedule.djo - raised low priority bug as the message box appears twice. Pressing either Yes or No displays the box for a second time. Bug number 234084 || Step 3: Disbursements not paid1. Create a new invoice with Client Bill Payment Required ticked2. Add a disbursement line3. Release and post the invoice4. Create a new payment schedule with the same bank as on the invoice AP Type5. Click Add Invoices> Add Single Invoice6. Find and select the invoice created    a. Select No    b. Select Yes | Expected: Choice dialogue comes up asking "Allow unpaid client disbursements"a. Red box around the Invoice field: "Client disbursements for this invoice have not been paid."b. No validation error and lets you add it to the payment schedule.djo - same bug as above occurs with this validation. Have added to the same bug. || Step 4: Different Company attached to bank1. Create a new invoice, release and post it2. Create a payment schedule with a bank different to the one attached to the invoices AP Type3. Click Add Invoices> Add Single Invoice4. Find and select the invoice created | Expected: Red box around the Invoice field: "The invoice belongs to a different company from which the check is being written" || Step 5: Same Company, Different Bank1, Check that BOT and BUSD have the same office attached (in Entity Manager)2. Create an invoice using AP Type INU3. Release and post the invoice4. Create a new payment schedule for BOT5. Click Add Invoices> Add Single Invoice6. Find and select the invoice created SELECT typ.APTYPE_CODE,typ.APTYPE_DESC,typ.BANK_CODE,b.CURRENCY_CODE,o.OFFC_CODE,o.COMPANY_CODEFROM APL_APTYPE typJOIN TBM_BANK b ON Typ.BANK_CODE = b.BANK_CODEJOIN HBL_OFFICE o ON b.OFFC = o.OFFC_CODE | Expected: No validation error. Allows you to add it to the payment schedule

Title: Schedule - Vendor: Criteria Validation - Add Multiple
Steps: Step 1: Pre req dataScheduleBank = BCAD (Office = TOR, Company = TOR)Date to Print = Today Has no itemsNote: All invoices need to be postedInvoice 1 Hold Date > todayDue Date <= todayINVOICE_STATUS= OSCHEDULE_NUM = 0Company of invoice matches company of schedulee.g.AP Type = INC (Bank = BCAD, Office = TOR, Company = TOR)Invoice 2Hold Date = todayDue Date <= todayINVOICE_STATUS= OSCHEDULE_NUM = 0Company of invoice matches company of schedulee.g.AP Type = INC (Bank = BCAD, Office = TOR, Company = TOR)Invoice 3Hold Date < todayDue Date <= todayINVOICE_STATUS= OSCHEDULE_NUM = 0Bank is not the same but Company of invoice matches company of schedulee.g.AP Type = INVC (Bank = BOO, Office = TOR, Company = TOR)Invoice 4 Hold Date = blankDue Date <= todayINVOICE_STATUS= OSCHEDULE_NUM = 0Company of invoice does not match company of schedulee.g. AP Type = INV(Bank = BOT, Office = TLH, Company = TLH)Invoice 5 Hold Date = blankDue Date > todayINVOICE_STATUS= OSCHEDULE_NUM = 0Company of invoice matches company of schedulee.g.AP Type = INC (Bank = BCAD, Office = TOR, Company = TOR)Invoice 6Hold Date = blankDue Date <= todayINVOICE_STATUS= OSCHEDULE_NUM > 0 (On a different schedule but not on a payment)Company of invoice matches company of schedulee.g.AP Type = INC (Bank = BCAD, Office = TOR, Company = TOR)Invoice 7Hold Date = blankDue Date <= todayINVOICE_STATUS= OSCHEDULE_NUM = 0 (Has a part payment on payment where it was added manually to the payment and payment is not posted)Company of invoice matches company of schedulee.g.AP Type = INC (Bank = BCAD, Office = TOR, Company = TOR)Invoice 8Hold Date = blankDue Date <= todayINVOICE_STATUS= OSCHEDULE_NUM = 0 (Has a part payment on payment where it was added manually to the payment and payment is posted)Company of invoice matches company of schedulee.g.AP Type = INC (Bank = BCAD, Office = TOR, Company = TOR)Invoice 9Hold Date = blankDue Date <= todayINVOICE_STATUS= OSCHEDULE_NUM = 0 (Has a part payment on payment where it was added to the payment via a different schedule and payment not posted)Company of invoice matches company of schedulee.g.AP Type = INC (Bank = BCAD, Office = TOR, Company = TOR)Invoice 10Hold Date = blankDue Date <= todayINVOICE_STATUS= OSCHEDULE_NUM = 0 (Has a part payment on payment where it was added to the payment via a different schedule and payment posted)Company of invoice matches company of schedulee.g.AP Type = INC (Bank = BCAD, Office = TOR, Company = TOR)Invoice 11Hold Date = blankDue Date <= todayINVOICE_STATUS= OSCHEDULE_NUM > 0 (On a schedule and on a payment and payment not posted)Company of invoice matches company of schedulee.g.AP Type = INC (Bank = BCAD, Office = TOR, Company = TOR)Invoice 12Hold Date = blankDue Date <= todayINVOICE_STATUS= OSCHEDULE_NUM > 0 (On a schedule and on a payment and payment posted)Company of invoice matches company of schedulee.g.AP Type = INC (Bank = BCAD, Office = TOR, Company = TOR) | Expected: Note:  The criteria for available items is:VENDOR_UNO > 0HOLD_DATE<= today or is NULLDUE_DATE <= today ?INVOICE_STATUS= OSCHEDULE_NUM = 0COMPANY_CODE of Invoice is same company as schedule (this is derived from the office of the schedule's bank AND the office of the bank of the invoice's APType)SELECT typ.APTYPE_CODE,typ.APTYPE_DESC,typ.BANK_CODE,b.CURRENCY_CODE,o.OFFC_CODE,o.COMPANY_CODEFROM APL_APTYPE typJOIN TBM_BANK b ON Typ.BANK_CODE = b.BANK_CODEJOIN HBL_OFFICE o ON b.OFFC = o.OFFC_CODE----------------------------------------------------------------------------------- Declarations ---------------------------------------------------------------------------------DECLARE @schedulenum as int = DECLARE @schbank asvarchar(50)= (SELECT BANK_CODE FROM APS_SCHEDULE_Z WHERE SCHEDULE_NUM = @schedulenum)DECLARE @company asvarchar(20)= (SELECT COMPANY_CODE FROM TBM_BANK b JOIN HBL_OFFICE o ON b.OFFC = o.OFFC_CODE WHERE b.BANK_CODE = @schbank)----------------------------------------------------------------------------------- Header---------------------------------------------------------------------------------SELECT ''[APS_SCHEDULE_Z],SCHEDULE_NUM, z.STATUS,CASE WHEN z.SCHEDULE_TYPE = 'V' THEN 'Vendor' WHEN z.SCHEDULE_TYPE = 'E' THEN 'Employee' ELSE''END[Schedule Type],z.BANK_CODE,@company[Company],z.CHECK_DATE[Payment Date],z.DATE_TO_PRINT,cl.DISPLAY_TEXT [Language],----------------------------------------------------------------------------------- Other fields---------------------------------------------------------------------------------z.CREATE_DATE,p.EMPLOYEE_NAME +' ('+ p.EMPLOYEE_CODE +')'[Created By],TAKE_DISCOUNT,z.EAP_INITIATED, z.CHECK_LANGUAGE,z.STATUS_DATE,p2.EMPLOYEE_NAME +' ('+ p2.EMPLOYEE_CODE +')'[Status Employee],z.STATUS_EMPL_UNO,z.CREATE_EMPL_UNO,z.CUTOFF_DATE,z.INACTIVE,z.PRIMARY_REGION,z.LAST_MODIFIED----------------------------------------------------------------------------------- From---------------------------------------------------------------------------------FROM APS_SCHEDULE_Z zLEFTJOIN HBM_PERSNL p ON z.CREATE_EMPL_UNO = p.EMPL_UNO -- created employee LEFTJOIN HBM_PERSNL p2 ON z.STATUS_EMPL_UNO = p2.EMPL_UNO -- status employee LEFTJOIN CXL_CODE_LOOKUP look1 ON z.STATUS= look1.DB_VALUE and look1.LOOKUP_GROUP ='PaymentScheduleStatus'JOIN CXL_CODE_LOOKUP cl on cl.DB_VALUE = z.CHECK_LANGUAGE and cl.LOOKUP_GROUP ='CheckLanguage'WHERE SCHEDULE_NUM = @schedulenum----------------------------------------------------------------------------------- Schedule items---------------------------------------------------------------------------------SELECT ''[APT_INVOICE_AMT],ia.ROW_UNO,ia.INV_TRAN_UNO,SOURCE_REF,ia.TRAN_TYPE,v.VENDOR_NAME +' ('+ v.VENDOR_ID +')'[Vendor],v2.VENDOR_NAME +' ('+ v2.VENDOR_ID +')'[Remit Vendor],inv.INVOICE_NUM,inv.SEPARATE_CHECK,CASE WHEN inv.BANK_ACCOUNT_UNO = 0 THEN'Check'WHEN inv.BANK_ACCOUNT_UNO <> 0 THEN'Electronic Banking'END [Payment Method],inv.BANK_ACCOUNT_UNO,chq.WIRE_NUM,chq.CHECK_NUM,inv.INVOICE_DATE,inv.CURRENCY_CODE[Inv Cur],inv.TC_INV_AMT,inv.INV_AMT,ia.SIGN,ia.TC_CODE,ia.TC_PAID_AMT,ia.PAID_AMT,ia.AP_AMT,inv.REF_NUM,DISC_DATE, DISC_AMT, HOLD_DATE, ST_WHELD,inv.APTYPE_CODE,typ.BANK_CODE,inv.VENDOR_UNO,inv.REMIT_VENDOR_UNO,inv.EXPERT_INVOICE_STATUS, INVOICE_STATUS,inv.TRAN_UNO[TRAN_UNO Invoice],ia.LAST_MODIFIEDFROM APT_INVOICE_AMT iaJOIN APT_INVOICE inv on ia.INV_TRAN_UNO = inv.TRAN_UNOJOIN APL_APTYPE typ ON inv.APTYPE_CODE = typ.APTYPE_CODE LEFT JOIN APT_CHECK chq ON ia.SOURCE_TRAN_UNO = chq.TRAN_UNO LEFTJOIN APM_VENDOR v ON inv.VENDOR_UNO = v.VENDOR_UNO -- vendor LEFTJOIN APM_VENDOR v2 ON inv.REMIT_VENDOR_UNO = v2.VENDOR_UNO -- remit vendor WHERE ia.SCHEDULE_NUM = @schedulenumAND TRAN_TYPE <>'CHX'----------------------------------------------------------------------------------- Avail Vendor items---------------------------------------------------------------------------------SELECT''[Avail Vendor Items],inv.INVOICE_NUM,v.VENDOR_ID,inv.DUE_DATE,inv.HOLD_DATE,typ.BANK_CODE,inv.CURRENCY_CODE,ba.PAYMENT_TYPE_CODE,inv.APTYPE_CODE,o.COMPANY_CODE,inv.DISCTERM_CODE,inv.DISC_DATE,inv.SEPARATE_CHECK,inv.JURISDIC_CODE,inv.BILL_PMT_REQD,v.VENDOR_ID,rv.VENDOR_ID[Rem Ven Id],v.VENDTYP_CODE,v.OWNING_OFFC,inv.DRUNO,INV_AMT,inv.DISC_AMT,inv.BALANCE,inv.HOLD_DATE,inv.TEN99_AMT,inv.HOLD_TAX,inv.ST_WHELD, inv.SCHEDULE_NUM,inv.INVOICE_STATUS,inv.EAP_INITIATED,inv.VENDOR_UNO,v.REMIT_VEND_UNO,inv.TRAN_UNOFROM APT_INVOICE inv INNER JOIN TBL_CURRENCY cur ON inv.CURRENCY_CODE = cur.CURRENCY_CODE INNER JOIN APL_APTYPE typ ON inv.APTYPE_CODE = typ.APTYPE_CODE INNERJOIN TBM_BANK bank ON typ.BANK_CODE = bank.BANK_CODEJOIN HBL_OFFICE o on bank.OFFC = o.OFFC_CODEINNER JOIN APM_VENDOR v ON inv.VENDOR_UNO = v.VENDOR_UNO INNERJOIN APM_VENDOR rv ON v.VENDOR_UNO = rv.VENDOR_UNOLEFTJOIN HBA_NAME_BANK_ACCOUNT ba ON inv.BANK_ACCOUNT_UNO = ba.BANK_ACCOUNT_UNO/********************************************************************Mandatory Filter********************************************************************/WHERE inv.VENDOR_UNO > 0 --AND inv.EAP_INITIATED = 'Y' AND (inv.HOLD_DATE <=CONVERT(date,getdate())OR inv.HOLD_DATE ISNULL)AND inv.INVOICE_STATUS='O' AND inv.SCHEDULE_NUM=0AND inv.DUE_DATE <= CONVERT(date,getdate())/********************************************************************Mandatory Filter for multi select only********************************************************************/AND o.COMPANY_CODE = @company/********************************************************************Optional Filters********************************************************************/--AND inv.DUE_DATE <='2020-05-19' --AND typ.BANK_CODE = @schbank--AND inv.CURRENCY_CODE='USD' --AND inv.DUE_DATE = --AND typ.BANK_CODE = --AND inv.CURRENCY_CODE--AND 'PAYMENT TYPE' IN ()--AND inv.APTYPE_CODE IN ()--AND inv.DISCTERM_CODE = --AND inv.DISC_DATE = --AND inv.SEPARATE_CHECK = --AND inv.JURISDIC_CODE = --AND inv.BILL_PMT_REQD = --AND v.VENDOR_ID = --AND rv.VENDOR_ID = --AND v.VENDTYP_CODE = --AND v.OWNING_OFFC = || Step 2: Add multiple invoices1. Select to add multiple vendor invoiceCriteria form loaded2. Remove Bank Code and Currency Filter3. Select Search & Add | Expected: Invoice Items added for valid invoicesInvoice 1: Not added - Hold date is greater than today Invoice 2: Added - company matches and hold date is todayInvoice 3: Added - different bank but company matches and hold date is < todayInvoice 4: Not added - company doesn't match Invoice 5: Not added - due date is greater than todayInvoice 6: Not added - on a different schedule but not on a payment Invoice 7: Not Added - has a part payment where it was added to that payment manually and payment is not posted Invoice 8: Added - has a part payment where it was added to that payment manually and payment is posted Invoice 9: Not Added - has a part payment where it was added to that payment via a different schedule and payment is not posted Invoice 10: Added - has a part payment where it was added to that payment via a different schedule and payment is posted Invoice 11: Not added - on a schedule and on a payment and payment not posted Invoice 12: Not added - on a schedule and on a payment and payment posted

Title: New Invoice Workflow - Admin - Rush Payment Code
Steps: Step 1: Pre req - Have New Invoice Workflow configured. || Step 2: When Rush Payment Code is configured1. Setup Rush Payment Code = On Demand (OD) inAdmin > Accounts Payable > Workflow > New Invoice Workflow.2. Start a New Invoice Workflow. Tick Rush Payment checkbox. Set Payment Required by = Next Monday.3. Check the rest of the checkboxes and complete the form using vendor which DO NOT default to the same Payment Term Code.4. You will receive the next task, Code Invoice. Open it. | Expected: Invoice Payment Terms = OD. When invoice is for Rush Payment, it uses the Rush Payment Code as Payment Term. Else, it defaults this value from vendor.Due Date = Next Monday date.Discount Date = Invoice Date.Discount Amount = 0.00 || Step 3: When Rush Payment Code is NOT configured1. Setup Rush Payment Code = NULL. Delete the config in Configuration Manager > Technical > Applications > ExpertAP > Workflow > NewInvoice > RushPaymentCode.2. Start a New Invoice Workflow. Tick Rush Payment checkbox.3. Check the rest of the checkboxes and complete the form using vendor which DO NOT default to the same Payment Term Code.4. You will receive the next task, Code Invoice. Open it. | Expected: Invoice Payment Terms = Vendor's default payment term (APM_VENDOR.DISCTERM_CODE) Due Date = Depends on defaulted payment term.Discount Date = Depends on defaulted payment termDiscount Amount = Depends on defailted payment term

Title: Schedule - Employee: Electronic Banking - Add single and multiple Invoices validation
Area: ExpertSuite\Financials\Accounts Payable\Payment Schedule\Add to Schedule\Employee Invoices
Steps: Step 1: Expenses- Tested some in 164775 || Step 2: Invoice locked - Single1. Have two APs open and an expense report2. Create an employee payment schedule in both APs3. For one, click Add Invoices> Add Single Invoice and select the expense report but DO NOT SAVE4. In the other AP select the same expense report in the same manner | Expected: Red validation box around Invoice Number: "This item is already locked by [name]" || Step 3: Invoice locked - Mulitple1. Do the same as above but go through Add Multiple instead. | Expected: Locked invoice not added to the second payment schedule.Bug 190553: AP- Payment Schedule- Error when add multiple invoice whilst add single invoice so invoice is on two schedules || Step 4: Advances || Step 5: Advance locked - Single1. Have two APs open and an advance2. Create an employee payment schedule in both APs3. For one, click Add Invoices> Add Single Invoice and select the advance but DO NOT SAVE4. In the other AP select the same advance in the same manner | Expected: Red validation box around Advance Number: "This item is already locked by [name]" || Step 6: Advance locked - Mulitple1. Title: Invoice: Security Roles - Workflow
Steps: Step 1: AccountsPayable security- Open workflow task without AP security- Proxy to user without AP security to open workflow task | Expected: User need this security to perform task that required AP (Invoice coding)- Cannot open AP hence cannot perform workflow task tha required AP. Task which do not require AP can be open and work on (New Invoice, Approval task)- Able to open AP app, cannot work on the workflow, but they still can use other AP functionality. *bug to test on 191257 is fixed || Step 2: InitiateNewinvoiceWorkflow security | Expected: User with this security can kick off workflow from APUser without this security cannot kick off workflow from APThis security do not handle workflow kick off in Expert Assistant || Step 3: InitiateInvoiceApprovalWorkflow security | Expected: User without this security cannot kick off approval workflow from both Invoice List and Entry screen. Approval workflow that follow up from new invoice workflow should not be affected by this security. || Step 4: PerformAPApplicationTasks Added in 82SP1 | Expected: This permission allows the user to carry out any new invoice workflow tasks allocated to them with only the need to have the CreateInvoice (GL and/or Disbursement option) security permissions allocated as well. The task opens in the AP Application Invoice Entry screen and allows the user to make the necessary selections and Save and Complete the task if the entry screen is populated correctly.No other AP functions or features are available to the user. || Step 5: AccountsPayable, Invoice and ViewInvoice security | Expected: Viewinvoice security determines if user can view the invoice entry screen. Can only view the invoice but not coding it. || Step 6: AccountsPayable, Invoice and CreateInvoice security | Expected: Can view and edit code invoice task. || Step 7: AccountsPayable, Invoice, ViewInvoice and CreateInvoice security | Expected: Can view and edit code invoice task. || Step 8: AccountsPayable and ViewInvoice security, no Invoice security | Expected: Error on not having permission to access Invoices tab || Step 9: AccountsPayable and CreateInvoice security, no Invoice security | Expected: Error on not having permission to access Invoices tab || Step 10: Action | Expected: Security Needed/Expected || Step 11: Kicking off New Invoice Workflow from AP | Expected: Must have a minimum of AP security module to open up AP and InitiateNewInvoiceWorkflow security to kick off workflow from the app. || Step 12: Kicking off New Invoice Workflow from Expert AssistantSecurity Manager | Framework | Workflow | StartProcess | Aderant | Workflow | AP | Aderant.Workflow.AP.NewInvoice | Expected: Allowed when user has the role assigned, otherwise not allowed || Step 13: Kicking off New Invoice Workflow from EA Pro AssistantSecurity Manager | Framework | Workflow | StartProcess | Aderant | Workflow | AP | Aderant.Workflow.AP.NewInvoiceNote: You will need to use incognito otherwise you'll just see the menu the same as it was when you first opened EA Pro. You will need to log in each time.http://<machinename>.ap.aderant.com/Expert_Local/ApplicationServices/WebExpertAssistantProfessional | Expected: Allowed when user has the role assigned, otherwise not allowed || Step 14: Fill in the New invoice details. | Expected: No security needed || Step 15: Working on the Create Vendor task | Expected: No security needed || Step 16: Viewing invoice on code invoice task | Expected: AP and ViewInvoice security || Step 17: Working on Code Invoice task | Expected: AP, ViewInvoice and CreateInvoice Security || Step 18: Working on code invoice then Cancel workflow- When having CreateInvoice- When NOT having CreateInvoice | Expected: - Invoice is read-only with alert saying "The workflow is in the process of unlocking the invoice. Please close and reopen the Invoice to edit it."- Close the invoice and go back to invoice list screen. || Step 19: Kicking off Approval Workflow from AP | Expected: Must have minimum of AP security module to open AP and InitiateInvoiceApprovalWorkflow security to kick off workflow from the app. || Step 20: Approving details line. | Expected: No security needed || Step 21: Approving total invoice | Expected: No security needed

Title: Payment - Cancel to New: Cancel Validation
Steps: Step 1: Min/max steps waiting for bug 232919last 2 steps have been done || Step 2: Note: Most of this is tested in the Post and Cancel tests || Step 3: Transaction date is less than minimum1. Posted payment2. Select to cancel3. Enter cancel date that is < than the minimumSELECT MIN_DATE FROM APM_PARMS4. Cancel payment | Expected: Display error: Date is outside minimum and maximum rangeBug 232919 - Payment: Cancel to New date validation is throwing an exception || Step 4: Transaction date is greater than maximum1. Posted payment2. Select to cancel3. Enter cancel date that is < than the minimumSELECT MAX_DATE FROM APM_PARMS4. Cancel payment | Expected: Display error: Date is outside minimum and maximum range || Step 5: New Payment date is less than minimum1. Posted payment2. Select to cancel3. Enter new payment date that is < than the minimumSELECT MIN_DATE FROM APM_PARMS4. Cancel payment | Expected: Display error: Date is outside minimum and maximum range || Step 6: New Payment date is greater than maximum1. Posted payment2. Select to cancel3. Enter new payment date that is < than the minimumSELECT MAX_DATE FROM APM_PARMS4. Cancel payment | Expected: Display error: Date is outside minimum and maximum range || Step 7: Cancel failsIf the cancel fails for any reason, the new payment should not be created e.g. Detail line does not equal payment 1. Create a wire payment2. Add detail lines to match so that payment is completed3. Post the payment4. Close payment5. Refresh grid6. Alter the payment amount via sqlupdate APT_CHECK set TC_CHK_AMT = 11, CHK_AMT = 11 where REQUEST_NUM =7. Select the payment from the grid and attemp to to Cancel to New Display error: CHKENTRY_UNALLOCATEDCHKAMTSum of detail lines does not equal check amount | Expected: New payment is not createdJob error: CHKENTRY_UNALLOCATEDCHKAMTSum of detail lines does not equal ... || Step 8: Payment has disbursements on a matter that is set to for auto splits1. Set the up the auto split on the disbursement Entity Manager | Matter | Auto time and disb splits | Disb splits2. Enable auto splitsEnitity manager | Matter | Time and billing | DisbNote: Doesn't actually need this step for the cancel validation but have noted it here if you want to see the split happening3. Create a payment with a disb on the matter and post the payment- Disb will be split4. Attempt to cancel to New the payment | Expected: Display error:The Cancel to New option can not be used as there are disbursements that are set up to auto split. || Step 9: Payment has disbursements on a matter that is set to for delayed auto auto splits1. Set the up the auto split on the disbursement as delayedEntity Manager | Matter | Auto time and disb splits | Disb splits2. Enable auto splitsEnitity manager | Matter | Time and billing | DisbNote: Doesn't actually need this step for the cancel validation as the split doesn't happen until billed3. Create a payment with a disb on the matter and post the payment- Disb will be split4. Attempt tp cancel to New the payment | Expected: Display error:The Cancel to New option can not be used as there are disbursements that are set up to auto split.

Title: Smoke Test AP: New Invoice Workflow - End to End Best Case Scenario Run
Steps:
Step 1: Note: This is a positive run test which does not test most of the error handling/validations. In 82SP1. having issue with adding forms to package. Have to manually add the required SmartForms to the new workflow extension points. See attached screenshot. | Expected: Cannot be run in build pipeline currently || Step 2: Pre-req Work flow setupNeeds to be set up as per the Recommended Basic Setup Client/Matter 1Matter Billing Employee = your user. Vendor 1 - APTTYPE_CODE = INU (bank BUSD)- Has bank account for BUSD- remittance vendor = vendor 2 Vendor 2 - APTTYPE_CODE = INC (bank BCAD)- Does not have bank accounts for bank BUSD or no bank- Does have bank accounts for bank BCAD || Step 3: Initiate New Invoice Workflow- Open up AP > Invoices list screen.- From the ribbon, go to Initiate Workflow button > New Invoice. | Expected: open up New Invoice form as ribbon dropdown. || Step 4: Fill in the New Invoice form- Fill in the form as below :Vendor : Vendor 1 Invoice Number : WORKFLOWTEST (not valid if have existing invoice with same name)Invoice Date : Default to current dateCurrency : Default from VendorInvoice Amount : $400Tick 'Confirm goods or service received' and 'Return invoice for coding'OKCreate couple of New invoice WF tasks following the above steps. | Expected: Code Invoice Task received. It should come up in the backstage task list.Bug 286481: Expert Accounts Payable: fails to open 2nd task from App's backstage > Task Inbox, crashes app || Step 5: Open Code Invoice Task | Expected: Invoice created with no bank account selected It should open up a familiar Invoice Entry form but with yellow task bar at the top for you to distinguished them. Two tabs on the ribbon bar, one with invoice number have invoice related buttons, the other Task tab have workflow task related buttons.Bug 285925: Opening a task from EA only launches its respective app || Step 6: Complete Code Invoice Task- Enter FOUR detail lines to that the detail line total matched invoice amount1. GL - Account 61000, TLH, ADM (or AUD?) , $1002. GL - Account 61000, TLH, ADM (or AUD?) , $1003. Disb - Client/Matter 1, $1004. Disb - Client/Matter 1, $100- Set Tax Included = Yes on header. DO NOT calculate tax here.- Make sure the Approved flag is NOT checked on header.- Save and Complete Task | Expected: Accounting Review Task received. || Step 7: Accounting Review Task- Open Accounting Review Task. - Accept task- Calculate Tax- Complete Task | Expected: Received GL level 1 and Disb Level 2 approval tasks.Not getting Disb Level 1 approval tasks, because Multi approval is set to No for Disb detail line. (See Recommended Setup Step 4) || Step 8: Approve GL Level 1 taskCheck the checkboxes on each GL lines to approve them.Complete task*Tax lines are being approved as part of GL | Expected: Received GL level 2 tasks.Alert icon should be clear when GL lines are checked (approved). Bug 258041 - Modern OAuth: AP approvals WF - Can't open an approval task Fixed || Step 9: Approve GL Level 2 taskCheck the checkboxes on each GL lines to approve them.Complete task | Expected: No more GL approval tasks.Alert icon should be clear when GL lines are checked (approved). || Step 10: Approve Disb Level 2 taskCheck the checkboxes on each Disb lines to approve them.Complete task | Expected: Received Total Invoice Approval Level 1 task.No more Disb approval tasks.Alert icon should be clear when Disb lines are checked (approved). || Step 11: Approve Total Invoice Approval Level 1 taskEnsure that all detail lines are showing in the form.GL and Taxes line are showing under the GL grid. Disb lines are under Disb grid.Approve using the radio button.Complete task | Expected: Received Total Invoice Approval Level 2 task. Bug 208375 - (Merge 82sp1 to 82sp2) Approvals WF does not work correctly when launched from app due to the values saved on the config Fixed || Step 12: Approve Total Invoice Approval Level 2 taskEnsure that all detail lines are showing in the form.*GL and Taxes line are showing under the GL grid. Disb lines are under Disb grid.Approve using the radio button.Complete task | Expected: No more task.Open invoice to verify : Invoice is posted. Invoice and Detail lines are approved. Hover over to green tick to view approval details. Bank Account is not defaultedTested in 8241, if Vendor has default set up for Electronic payment, bank account will default from remit vendor's bank account setup. || Step 13: Graph API Email Sender Configuration:Navigate to Expert Administration > Email Settings. Select 'Microsoft Graph API' as the Default Email Sender. | Expected: Graph API is selected and saved successfully as the default email sender. || Step 14: Workflow:  Notification via Graph API
  Trigger workflow: notification emails using Graph API. | Expected: Workflow notification emails are sent successfully using Graph API. || Step 15: Send Task: Notification via Graph APITrigger task notification emails from Workflow module using Graph API. | Expected: Task notification emails are sent successfully using Graph API.

Title: Payment Items - Disbursement: Anticpated matching different currencies

Title: Create Payments: Invoice with Remit Vendor, Overriden Name and Address
Steps: Step 1: Pre reqVendor setup as below :  Vendor A and Vendor B. Vendor B have a different Remit Bendor.Vendor A - 1 Remittance Address- 1 Default Address- 1 Normal Address (Not Remit nor Default)- Have Related Payees setupVendor B- Have different Remit Vendor- 1 Remittance Address- 1 Default Address- 1 Normal Address (Not Remit nor Default)- Have Related Payees setup || Step 2: Create 6 Invoices as belowInvoice 1 for Vendor A with no overrideInvoice 2 for Vendor A with Name and Address OverridenInvoice 3 for Vendor A with Address OverridenInvoice 4 for Vendor B with no overrideInvoice 5 for Vendor B with Name and Address OverridenInvoice 6 for Vendor B with Address Overriden || Step 3: Put these invoices into Payment Schedule and Create Request. || Step 4: Result : -Invoice 1 for Vendor A with no override-Invoice 2 for Vendor A with Name and Address Overriden-Invoice 3 for Vendor A with Address Overriden-Invoice 4 for Vendor B with no override-Invoice 5 for Vendor B with Name and Address Overriden-Invoice 6 for Vendor B with Address Overriden | Expected: -Invoice 1 creates payment request with Vendor A and Default Address.-Invoice 2 creates payment request with Overriden Name and Address.-Invoice 3 creates payment request with Vendor A and Overriden Address.-Invoice 4 creates payment request with Remit Vendor Name of Vendor B and Remit Address.-Invoice 5 creates payment request with Overriden Name and Address.-Invoice 6 creates payment request witth Vendor B and Overriden Address. (Name should set to the name of the address belongs to)*Changes from Bug 188109 - Vendor address change does not stick on check

Title: Payment - Cancel to New: Look and Feel
Steps: Step 1: Note: Most of this is tested in the Post and Cancel tests || Step 2: General - cancel form | Expected: - Employee is mandatory and defaults to logged on user- Cancel date is mandatorySELECT MIN_DATE,MAX_DATE FROM APM_PARMS- Reason is mandatory- Comments is optional- Comments Supports spellcheck and Expansion codes- Comments Max characters = 15000SELECT*FROM ACT_TEXT ORDERBY TEXT_ID desc- New payment date disabled when Cancel to New is off otherwise it's mandatory and defaults to selected payment's payment dateSELECT MIN_DATE,MAX_DATE FROM APM_PARMS- Cancel button enabled, cancels the form- Cancel Payment button only enabled when all mandatory fields entered || Step 3: Cancel to New | Expected: - Cancel to new payment only enabled when form called from payment  form or when only one payment selected from the grid || Step 4: Cancel Button from grid ribbon bar - Check and Manual Payments | Expected: - enabled when all selected items are posted || Step 5: Cancel Button from payment ribbon bar - Check and Manual payments | Expected: - enabled when item is posted || Step 6: Cancel Button from grid ribbon bar - wire and electronic paymentsSELECT AUTO_RECONCILE_WIRE,*FROM APM_PARMS--UPDATE APM_PARMS SET AUTO_RECONCILE_WIRE = 'Y' | Expected: - Enabled when all selected items are posted - Enabled when all selected items are Posted or Reconciled if auto reconcile is on, other disabled || Step 7: Cancel Button from payment ribbon bar - wire and electronic paymentsSELECT AUTO_RECONCILE_WIRE,*FROM APM_PARMS--UPDATE APM_PARMS SET AUTO_RECONCILE_WIRE = 'Y' | Expected: - Enabled item is posted - Enabled when item is Posted or Reconciled if auto reconcile is on, other disabled || Step 8: Cancel to New process | Expected: - When canceling to new from the payment form, the canceled payment remains open and the new payment will be created and opened- When canceling to new from the grid, the new payment will be created and openedBug 239056 - Cancel to New from the Payment List screen does not automatically open the newly created payment

Title: Payment - Cancel to New: Client Credit
Steps: Step 1: Note: Testing of the cancel part of the payment is covered by the cancel test cases. Here, we need to reconcile the New part of the process as New payment would normally be done via the UI so we need to ensure that the creation of the New payment via code has the same outcome || Step 2: Pre preqsCAD RatesRate: 1.092007784100000Reciprocal: 0.915744388053213Client- CAD currency- has avail client credit of at least C$100 in CAD currency || Step 3: Create payment with client credit1. Create client payment- Bank = CAD currency- Currency = CAD- Amount = C$100- other mandatory fields2. Add a client credit item- Amount = C$100- enter all other fields | Expected: Payment created with client credit || Step 4: Query the tables and copy results to spread sheetSELECT TOP(1)* FROM ACT_TRAN ORDER BY TRAN_UNO DESCSELECT TOP(1)* FROM ACT_TRAN_CR_CL ORDER BY TRAN_UNO DESC || Step 5: Query the credit balance/avail balance and copy results to spread sheetDECLARE @client as VARCHAR (2000)='' -- client codeDECLARE @displaycur as VARCHAR (10)='CAD'DECLARE @clientuno as INT= (SELECT CLIENT_UNO FROM HBM_CLIENT WHERE CLIENT_CODE = @client)EXEC [APP_CALCULATE_CLIENT_BALANCES] @clientuno, @displaycur || Step 6: Post payment | Expected: Payment is posted || Step 7: Cancel to New | Expected: Payment is canceled and New payment created- New Payment has client credit item || Step 8: Reconcile tablesQuery tables and reconcile results from the original payment SELECTTOP(1)*FROM ACT_TRAN ORDERBY TRAN_UNO DESCSELECTTOP(1)*FROM ACT_TRAN_CR_CL ORDERBY TRAN_UNO DESC | Expected: Tables and fields matchACT_TRAN_CR_CL - Last modified is set, not copied from original- All other fields that should match, do- All other fields that won't match e.g. unos, are populated with the appropriate valuesACT_TRAN- Last modified is set, not copied from original- All other fields that should match, do- All fields that won't match e.g. unos, are populated with the appropriate values || Step 9: Reconcile the balancesReconcile results from original paymentDECLARE @client as VARCHAR (2000)='' -- client codeDECLARE @displaycur as VARCHAR (10)='CAD'DECLARE @clientuno as INT= (SELECT CLIENT_UNO FROM HBM_CLIENT WHERE CLIENT_CODE = @client)EXEC [APP_CALCULATE_CLIENT_BALANCES] @clientuno, @displaycur | Expected: Balances match

Title: Payment - Cancel to New: Matter Credit
Steps: Step 1: Note: Testing of the cancel part of the payment is covered by the cancel test cases. Here, we need to reconcile the New part of the process as New payment would normally be done via the UI so we need to ensure that the creation of the New payment via code has the same outcome || Step 2: Pre preqsCAD RatesRate: 1.092007784100000Reciprocal: 0.915744388053213Matter- CAD currency- has avail matter credit of at least C$100 in CAD currency || Step 3: Create payment with matter credit1. Create client payment- Bank = CAD currency- Currency = CAD- Amount = C$100- other mandatory fields2. Add a matter credit item- Amount = C$100- enter all other fields | Expected: Payment created with matter credit || Step 4: Query the tables and copy results to spread sheetSELECT TOP(1)*FROM ACT_TRAN ORDER BY TRAN_UNO DESCSELECT TOP(1)*FROM ACT_TRAN_CR_MA ORDER BY TRAN_UNO DESC || Step 5: Query the credit balance/avail balance and copy results to spread sheetDECLARE @clientmatter as VARCHAR (2000)='tst1.1' DECLARE @displaycur as VARCHAR (10)='CAD'DECLARE @matteruno as INT= (SELECT MATTER_UNO FROM HBM_MATTER WHERE CLNT_MATT_CODE = @clientmatter)EXEC [APP_CALCULATE_MATTER_BALANCES] @matteruno, @displaycur || Step 6: Post payment || Step 7: Cancel to New | Expected: Payment is canceled and New payment created- New Payment has matter credit item || Step 8: Reconcile tablesQuery tables and reconcile results from the original payment SELECTTOP(1)*FROM ACT_TRAN ORDERBY TRAN_UNO DESCSELECTTOP(1)*FROM ACT_TRAN_CR_MA ORDERBY TRAN_UNO DESC | Expected: Tables and fields matchACT_TRAN_CR_MA- Last modified is set, not copied from original- All other fields that should match, do- All other fields that won't match e.g. unos, are populated with the appropriate valuesACT_TRAN- Last modified is set, not copied from original- All other fields that should match, do- All fields that won't match e.g. unos, are populated with the appropriate values || Step 9: Reconcile the balancesReconcile results from original paymentDECLARE @clientmatter as VARCHAR (2000)='tst1.1' DECLARE @displaycur as VARCHAR (10)='CAD'DECLARE @matteruno as INT= (SELECT MATTER_UNO FROM HBM_MATTER WHERE CLNT_MATT_CODE = @clientmatter)EXEC [APP_CALCULATE_MATTER_BALANCES] @matteruno, @displaycur | Expected: Balances match

Title: Payment - Cancel to New: Wire Number
Steps: Step 1: Note: Testing of the cancel part of the payment is covered by the cancel test cases. Here, we need to reconcile the New part of the process as New payment would normally be done via the UI so we need to ensure that the creation of the New payment via code has the same outcome || Step 2: Wire number is not set to auto assign1. Create a Wire or Electronic payment- Bank is set to use wire number but not auto assignUPDATE TBM_BANK SET ASSIGN_WIRE_NUMBER ='Y',AUTO_WIRE_NUM ='N'WHERE BANK_CODE =''- Enter other mandatory fields- Add item to match payment amountWire number is set to NULL2. Enter wire number3. Post4. Cancel to New | Expected: New payment is createdWIRE_NUM = NULL || Step 3: Wire number is set to auto assign1. Create a Wire or Electronic payment- Bank is set to use wire number and auto assignUPDATE TBM_BANK SET ASSIGN_WIRE_NUMBER ='Y',AUTO_WIRE_NUM ='Y'WHERE BANK_CODE =''- Enter other mandatory fields- Add item to match payment amount2. Post3. Cancel to New | Expected: New payment is created WIRE_NUM = next wire number SELECT WIRE_NUM,BANK_CODE,* FROM APT_CHECK ckWHERE ck.BANK_CODE = ''ORDER BY ck.BANK_CODE,ck.WIRE_NUM DESC

Title: Payment - Cancel to New: Tax calculated
Steps: Step 1: Note: Testing of the cancel part of the payment is covered by the cancel test cases. Here, we need to reconcile the New part of the process as New payment would normally be done via the UI so we need to ensure that the creation of the New payment via code has the same outcome || Step 2: Create payment and calculate tax- Create a payment in non system currency- Add a GL item- Set Tax included = Y- Save- Calculate tax | Expected: Tax is calculatedTax items addedGL Item amount updatedTax included is set to Removed || Step 3: Post the payment | Expected: Payment posted || Step 4: Cancel to New | Expected: Existing payment canceled and new payment createdNew Payment- GL item with the same amount as the canceled payment (taking into account it's not system currency any more)- Tax item with same amount as cancel payment (taking into account it's  not system currency any more)- Tax included is set to removed

Title: Payment - Cancel to New: New Validation
Steps: Step 1: Unposted client credit1. Create client payment (payment 1)2. Add client credit item3. Post payment 4. Create client payment (payment 2)5. Add client credit item for same client as used in payment 16. Cancel to New (payment 1) | Expected: Display error: Unable to apply a recreated client credit (ID x) for this payment as there are other unposted credits for the client- Payment canceled- New payment is created- Client credit item is not created- Error displayed against new payment || Step 2: Unposted matter credit1. Create client payment (payment 1)2. Add matter credit item3. Post payment 4. Create client payment (payment 2)5. Add matter credit item for same matter as use in payment 16. Cancel to New payment | Expected: Display error: Unable to apply a recreated matter credit (ID x) for this payment as there are other unposted credits for the matter- Payment canceled- New payment is created- Matter credit item is not created- Error displayed against new payment || Step 3: GL office is inactive1. Create payment 2. Add a GL item 3. Post payment4. Inactivate the GL item office 5. Cancel to New payment | Expected: Display error: TRN_INVALID_OFFOffice is inactive or invalid- Payment canceled- New payment created- Error displayed against new payment || Step 4: Tax office is inactive1. Create payment 2. Add a Tax item 3. Post payment4. Inactivate the Tax item office 5. Cancel to New payment | Expected: Display error: TRN_INVALID_OFFOffice is inactive or invalid- Payment canceled- New payment created- Error displayed against new payment

Title: Payment - Check print: Report Writer - Extra command line options
Steps: Step 1: #502214, Command Line Options Available for A/P Check Printing: Found in salesforcehttps://aderant.my.salesforce.com/kA4C000000004rU?srPos=0&srKp=ka4&lang=en_USA/P Check Printing Command Line Options and the Privilege Level "1" User: Found in I-Knowhttps://aderant.sharepoint.com/:w:/r/sites/Iknow/Expert/_layouts/15/WopiFrame.aspx?sourcedoc=%7B949020F2-10FE-440E-8E60-4928DF0EF7E1%7D&file=AP%20Check%20Printing%20Command%20Line%20Options%20and%20the%20Privilege%20Level%201%20User.docx&action=default&DefaultItemOpen=1 | Expected: If doing this in Classic, it requires you to Tools> Load Menu after you create a copy.In Entity Manager Allow Selection of Printer does not affect Report Writer and causes an error saying that the printer could not be found. This is handled by PICKPRINTER command line In Expert Administration Check Formats the Pages to Print option does not affect Report Writer. This is handled by NOSUPPRESSIf the command is mis-spelled then it will not take effect || Step 2: Note: You can see if the commands have been passed through using Task Manager while the Print Checks window is still up. Task Manager> Details> Command Line column. || Step 3: Adding command line options to Report Writer printing:1. Configuration Manager> All Settings> Technical> Applications> ExpertAccountsPayable> Options    a. ReportWriterCheckPrintCommand    b. ReportWriterCheckReprintCommandDouble click the Value to create an editable copy of it | Expected: a. Affects the first Print Check Window that occurs when the check has not been printed yet. (From Print Payments button)Default: apchprint.exe PrintSession={0} BankCode={1}b. Affects subsequent Print Check Windows from Reprint Check button.Default: apchprint.exe PrintSession={0} BankCode={1} Reprint=1 AssignNewCheckNumber={2} || Step 4: PICKPRINTERAdd PICKPRINTER to the end of the default values and save it at Firm level:apchprint.exe PrintSession={0} BankCode={1} PICKPRINTER | Expected: Upon print or reprint (depending on which value modified) Run Report window shows twice after clicking Print on Print Checks window. Cancelling the first Run Report window will result in no checks being printed. || Step 5: NOSUPPRESSAdd NOSUPPRESS to the end of the default values and save it at Firm level:apchprint.exe PrintSession={0} BankCode={1} NOSUPPRESS | Expected: If the check is longer than one page (requires a mix 15 GL and disbursment lines) then it will print two pages instead of stopping at the first page || Step 6: NOSTUBAdd NOSTUB to the end of the default values and save it at Firm level:apchprint.exe PrintSession={0} BankCode={1} NOSTUB | Expected: Run Report screen will no longer occur after printing the check (if used in conjunction with PICKPRINTER then Run Report screen will show only once)Bug 189393: Check Print does not support ToFile and NoStub in print session mode || Step 7: TOFILE1. Classic> Hub Setup> Time and Billing Setup> Banks> File Format2. Add NOSTUB to the end of the default values and save it at Firm level:apchprint.exe PrintSession={0} BankCode={1} TOFILE | Expected: 1. Ensure that the file format has the correct file path. Does not seem to show in Entity Manager.2. After the initial Print Check window the Run Report window will show. To File is automatically checked.

Title: Payment Schedule - Print Payment -  Print Checks using Report Writer
Steps: Step 1: Follow the same steps for Reprint. Most of Report Writer is checked in Payments:188777, 189081 and from running through the other Print Payment test cases with Report Writer. || Step 2: Create an invoice using an AP Type that has a bank with a Report Writer check format. || Step 3: Post the invoice and place on a payment schedule || Step 4: Click Create Payments || Step 5: Click Print Payments> Print Checks> Print | Expected: Classic Print Checks window comes up || Step 6: Click Print | Expected: Checks are printed and Run Report window comes up || Step 7: Check Printer and click Print | Expected: Check and stub are printed

Title: Payment - Check print: Report Writer Validation
Steps: Step 1: Incorrect configuration Configuration Manager> All Settings> Technical> Applications> ExpertAccountsPayable> Options:-ReportWritercheckPrintCommand-ReportWriterCheckReprintCommand 1. Add a configuration that is incorrect by doublec clicking the config value e.g. "This should not work"2. In AP print or reprint a check payment that uses Report Writer | Expected: Error Message upon clicking Print (before the classic Print Checks window shows)"The system cannot find the file specified"( djo - bug 234519. In my case the application crashes rather than failing with an elegant error message. Low priority bug ) || Step 2: Incorrect File Path1. Expert Admin> Accounts Payable> Payment Formats> Check Formats2. Put in an incorrect Filename (i.e one that does not exist)3. In AP print or reprint a check from a bank that uses the modified check format | Expected: Information window: The check format filename for this bank, [file_name] does not exist. You will not be able to print checks for this bank. || Step 3: Correct File, Wrong Input1. PrintSessione.g. PrintSession=a2. BankCodee.g. BankCode=a3. Reprinte.g. Reprint=a4. AssignCheckNumbere.g. AssignCheckNumber=a | Expected: The app should not crash and this should be handled by Report Writer1. Mass print check/ reprint check window shows 2. Error that check format for bank ',' cannot be found 3. Get taken through Print check. Assign new check number box does not take effect. (Starting and Ending Check Number always displayed) 4. Assign new check number box does not take effect. (Starting and Ending Check Number never displayed).

Title: Payment Items - Disbursement: Anticpated matching threshold
Steps: Step 1: Note: the prebills need to be created in classic until expert billing has been enhanced for anticipated disbsNote: The % is calculated from the payment amount not the billed amount || Step 2: Pre req Disbursement Cost Code (Type) - Auto Match on Anticipate Item e.g. ANT- Allows hard disb- Threshold = 10 || Step 3: Disb is > 10% threshold1. Create a prebill- currency = USD2. Add an anticipated disbursement - HardSoft = Hard- Costcode = ANT- Matter- Vendor- Amount = $110.014. Prep and post the bill5. Create a payment- vendor is same as prebill disbs- Currency = USD- amount = $100.006. Add a disb - Matter = same as bill disb- amount = $100.007. Post the payment | Expected: Payment's disb is not matched || Step 4: Disb is < 10% threshold1. Create a prebill- currency = USD2. Add an anticipated disbursement - HardSoft = Hard- Costcode = ANT- Matter- Vendor- Amount = $89.994. Prep and post the bill5. Create a payment- vendor is same as prebill disbs- Currency = USD- amount = $100.006. Add a disb - Matter = same as bill disb- amount = $100.007. Post the payment | Expected: Payment's disb is not matched || Step 5: Disb is within the upper 10% threshold1. Create a prebill- currency = USD2. Add an anticipated disbursement - HardSoft = Hard- Costcode = ANT- Matter- Vendor- Amount = $110.004. Prep and post the bill5. Create a payment- vendor is same as prebill disbs- Currency = USD- amount = $100.006. Add a disb - Matter = same as bill disb- amount = $100.007. Post the payment | Expected: Payment's disb is matched || Step 6: Disb is within the lower 10% threshold1. Create a prebill- currency = USD2. Add an anticipated disbursement - HardSoft = Hard- Costcode = ANT- Matter- Vendor- Amount = $90.004. Prep and post the bill5. Create a payment- vendor is same as prebill disbs- Currency = USD- amount = $100.006. Add a disb - Matter = same as bill disb- amount = $100.007. Post the payment | Expected: Payment's disb is matched to disb 2

Title: Invoice List - Workflow Assigned To column and filter
Steps: Step 1: Pre req- New Invoice Workflow- Approval Invoice Workflow with disbursement level 1 approver = Matter Billing Employee- Three matters which each have different Matter Billing EmployeeAccounting Review task performer = AP Workgroup1. TTQA1 and TTQA2 attached to AP Workgroup2. Set AP workgroup as Accounting Review task performer in Admin | AP | Workflow | New Invoice Workflow || Step 2: Invoice with single task assigned to One task performer1. Kick off New Invoice Workflow2. Forward invoice to one user, TTQA1 | Expected: Displaying the one and only task assigned user.Assigned To = TTQA1WFM_TASK.PARTICIPANTS = TTQA1 || Step 3: Invoice with single task assigned to a workgroup1. Kick off New Invoice Workflow and proceed to Account Review task. | Expected: Displaying the assigned work groupAssigned To = APWFM_TASK.PARTICIPANTS = Accounts PayableWFM_OWNERID = NULL || Step 4: Invoice with single task assigned to a workgroup AND task is ACCEPTED by one of workgroup user1. Kick off New Invoice Workflow and proceed to Account Review task.2. As TTQA1, accept the workflow task. | Expected: Displaying the user who accepted the task.After the task have been accepted, the other users (TTQA2) under the workgroup will no longer have the task sitting in their list.Assigned To = TTQA1WFM_TASK.PARTICIPANTS = Accounts PayableWFM_TASK.OWNERID = TTQA1 ID || Step 5: Invoice with single task assigned to two task performers.1. Kick off New Invoice Workflow.2. Open Workflow Admin and assign another additional user TTQA1 to the workflow task. | Expected: Displaying two of the task performers names.Assigned To = 'Way,Wong ; TTQA1'Workflow have one task only.WFM_TASK.PARTICIPANTS = name of the two users assigned, separated by semicolonWFM_OWNER_ID = NULL || Step 6: Invoice with single task assigned to more than two task performers.1. Kick off New Invoice Workflow.2. Open Workflow Admin and assign another two more users TTQA1 and TTQA2  to the task | Expected: Displaying as 'Multiple Assignee'Assigned To = 'Multiple Assignee'Workflow have one task only.WFM_TASK.PARTICIPANTS = name of the three users assigned, separated by semicolonWFM_OWNER_ID = NULL || Step 7: Invoice with parallel tasks assigned to multiple user 1. Create invoice with three disbursement lines using matter with different Matter Billing Employee.2. With the invoice still not being approved, initiate the Approval Workflow. 3. Each Billing Employee only get their task for the matter they got. | Expected: Displaying as 'Multiple Assignee'Assigned To = 'Multiple Assignee'Workflow have three parallel tasks, these tasks have the same workflow instance uno.WFM_TASK.PARTICIPANTS = each of their billing employees.WFM_OWNER_ID = billing employees' ID || Step 8: Search task performers from the invoice list1. Search invoice with one assignee.2. Search invoice with two assignees.3. Search invoice with more than two assignees using one of the assignee name.4. Search invoice with user group. | Expected: Invoice which assignee is involved in is return from search.*Bug 189903Invoice List - Cannot search invoices using the Assigned To filter when using user group.

Title: Payment - Cancel to New: Reuse check number
Steps: Step 1: Note: Testing of the cancel part of the payment is covered by the cancel test cases. Here, we need to reconcile the New part of the process as New payment would normally be done via the UI so we need to ensure that the creation of the New payment via code has the same outcome || Step 2: Document type = C1. Create Check payment- Enter mandatory fields- Add item to match payment amount2. Print check3. Post4. Cancel to New | Expected: New payment is created CHECK_NUM = 0should the check original check be voided? || Step 3: Document type = M1. Create Check payment- Enter next check num- Enter mandatory fields- Add item to match payment amount2. Post3. Cancel to NewDECLARE @bank asvarchar (10)=''SELECT TOP(1) ''[APT_CHECK_FORM],cf.CHECK_NUM, cf.FORM_STATUS,cf.FORM_USE,cf.STATUS_SOURCE,CHECK_TRAN_UNO,FORM_UNO,NEW_FORM_UNO,LAST_MODIFIED--,cf.* FROM APT_CHECK_FORM cfWHERE cf.FORM_STATUS NOT IN ('A','V') AND CHECK_NUM > (SELECTTOP(1) CHECK_NUM FROM APT_CHECK_FORM WHERE FORM_STATUS IN ('A','V')AND BANK_CODE = @bank ORDERBY CHECK_NUM DESC)AND cf.BANK_CODE = @bankORDERBY cf.BANK_CODE,cf.CHECK_NUM ASC | Expected: New payment is createdCHECK_NUM = copied from original paymentPayment 1's check number record APT_CHECK_FORM- FORM_STATUS = V- NEW_FORM_UNO = Payment 2's FORM_UNOPayment 2's check number record APT_CHECK_FORM- FORM_STATUS = A- NEW_FORM_UNO = 0- CHECK_NUM = Payment 1's CHECK_NUM DECLARE @bank asvarchar (10)=''SELECT FORM_UNO,NEW_FORM_UNO,cf.BANK_CODE,cf.CHECK_NUM, cf.FORM_STATUS,cf.FORM_USE,cf.STATUS_SOURCE,CHECK_TRAN_UNO,TIMES_PRINTED,LAST_MODIFIED--,cf.* FROM APT_CHECK_FORM cfWHERE cf.BANK_CODE = @bankORDERBY cf.BANK_CODE,cf.CHECK_NUM ASC

Title: New Invoice Workflow - Accounting Review Task - Getting the Accounting Review Task validation
Steps: Step 1: Is Accounting Review Always Required flag -Admin > Workflow > New Invoice Workflow || Step 2: Invoice will require Account Review when- Details amount not matching Invoice amount- Tax are not calculated || Step 3: Is Accounting Review Always Required = Y, Invoice fully coded.1. Kick off New Invoice Workflow.2. Code invoice so that amount are match and tax are calculated.3. Complete task. | Expected: Accounting Review Task received. || Step 4: Is Accounting Review Always Required = N, Invoice fully coded1. Kick off New Invoice Workflow.2. Code invoice so that amount are match and tax are calculated.3. Complete task. | Expected: Accounting Review Task not received. || Step 5: Is Accounting Review Always Required = N, Amount NOT matched.1. Kick off New Invoice Workflow.2. Code invoice but invoice and details amount are not match.3. Complete task. | Expected: Accounting Review Task received. || Step 6: Is Accounting Review Always Required = N, Amount matched, Tax NOT calculated1. Kick off New Invoice Workflow.2. Code invoice, match the amounts but without tax calculated, eg, Tax Included <> Not Applicable3. Complete task. | Expected: Accounting Review Task received.

Title: Workflow - Approval Workflow - InitiateInvoiceApprovalWorkflow security
Steps: Step 1: Having InitiateInvoiceApprovalWorkflow | Expected: Approval Workflow button is visible under Initiate Workflow ribbon button drop down.Approval Workflow button only enabled on Unapproved invoice. || Step 2: Do not have InitiateInvoiceApprovalWorkflow | Expected: Initiate Workflow button in Invoice Entry is disabled even if invoice is valid to be send to approve.Approval Workflow button in Invoice List screen is disabled even if invoice is valid to be send to approve.

Title: New Invoice Workflow - Canceling and Terminate Workflow
Steps: Step 1: Cancel workflow when invoice is created1. Start New Invoice workflow.2. Go through until Code Invoice task.3. Cancel workflow | Expected: Created invoice record not deleted. Invoice status remain the same.Lock is released. || Step 2: Cancel workflow when invoice is NOT created1. Start New Invoice workflow.2. In New Invoice task, cancel workflow | Expected: Invoice record is not created. || Step 3: Cancel workflow when invoice is in Accounting Review1. Start New Invoice workflow.2. Go through until Accounting Review task.3. Cancel workflow | Expected: Created invoice record not deleted. Invoice status remain the same.Lock is released.Coded invoice is not lost. || Step 4: Terminate workflow when invoice is created1. Start New Invoice workflow.2. Go through until Code Invoice task.3. Terminate workflow | Expected: Created invoice record not deleted. Invoice status remain the same.Lock should be release when you have the invoice is open, lock is not release when you terminate workflow from somewhere else (task list, workflow admin).

Title: Workflow - Approval Workflow - Initiating workflow on Invoice List screen
Steps: Step 1: Pre req- Approval Workflow- InitiateApprovalWorkflow security permission || Step 2: Invoice with validation error - Date out of range1. Create or locate an unapproved invoice with invoice date out of min and max range.2. Initiate Workflow. | Expected: Approval Workflow button enabled.  Still allow you to get the invoice approved. Receive Accounting Correction task after approval due to the validation error. || Step 3: Invoice with detail lines not complete1. Create or locate an unapproved invoice with invoice amount <> total details amount.2. Initiate Workflow. | Expected: Approval Workflow button disabled. || Step 4: Invoice with detail lines complete1. Create or locate an unapproved invoice with invoice amount = total details amount.2. Initiate Workflow. | Expected: Approval Workflow button enabled. || Step 5: Invoice already in workflow1. Create or locate an unapproved invoice with invoice amount = total details amount.2. Initiate Workflow. | Expected: Approval Workflow button disabled. || Step 6: Invoice with tax not calculated1. Create or locate an unapproved invoice with Tax 2. Initiate Workflow. | Expected: Approval Workflow button enabled.  Still allow you to get the invoice approved. Receive Accounting Correction task after approval due to the validation error.

Title: Smoke Test AP: Customization - add an office field to invoice
Description: Open DBEditor, select version 82Click Tables > APT_INVOICE, Right Click > ReviseAdd a new columnName: _OFFCSize: 3Nulls: TrueSave and generate the customizationOpen Expert Share > Domain Wizard Select Extend an existing entity > APT_INVOICE > _OFFCComplete the wizardOpen Deployment Manager > Select Packages tab > Click Ribbon Apply CustomizationsWhen applied and deployed open Design StudioAccounts Payable > Forms > Invoice Entry > Invoice EntryAdd new Search Box, bind to Invoice.OFFC select Office Data Provider. Save and exit.Open AP, create new Invoice, select an Office in the custom office search box and save(If the office is not present when you reload it, you need to generate it as a foreign key property, from this http://tfs.ap.aderant.com:8080/tfs/ADERANT/ExpertSuite/_workitems?id=193418&_a=edit)
Steps: Step 1: Scenario:- add field _OFFC to APT_INVOICE- add office data provider to invoice form- there is no validation other than you can't add an inactive office || Step 2: Open DBEditor, select version 82 || Step 3: Click Tables > APT_INVOICE, Right Click > Revise || Step 4: Add a new column Name: _OFFC ID: 901 (if this is the first custom column for this table)Type: StringSize: 3 Nulls: True || Step 5: Save and generate the customizationNote: If you want to save it for a future test, find the table again, Right click> Export and save it. || Step 6: Open Expert Share > Domain Wizard Select Extend an existing entity > APT_INVOICE > _OFFC Complete the wizard || Step 7: Open Deployment ManagerGo to the pacakges tab and then click Apply Customizations in the ribbon panelClick yes to create the package and yes again after to deploy the customizations. || Step 8: When applied and deployed (via deployment manager) open Design Studio Accounts Payable > Forms > Invoice Entry > Invoice Entry Add new Search Box, bind to Invoice.OFFC select Office Data Provider. Save and exit. || Step 9: Open AP, create new Invoice, select an Office in the custom office search box and save Note: (If the office is not present when you reload it, you need to generate it as a foreign key property, from this http://tfs.ap.aderant.com:8080/tfs/ADERANT/ExpertSuite/_workitems?id=193418&_a=edit) | Expected: Office field is on the form- Data provider returns offices- Selected office is saved to the new DB fields

Title: Invoice Edit- Change Vendor- Not Posted- General Validation on changing Vendor
Area: ExpertSuite\Financials\Accounts Payable\Invoices\Invoice Entry and Edit\Vendor and Invoice Number
Steps:
Step 1: Create 3 Vendors: 2 vendors (1) (2) Inactive vendor | Expected: 3 vendors, two of which are active but have different properties like Jurisdiction etc || Step 2: Make an invoice with the first vendor (1). | Expected: A saved invoice. || Step 3: Change the vendor (1) to the other Vendor (2). | Expected: A warning message that says 'New Vendor Defaults will be applied'.Cancel should leave the vendor(1) as is.OK should change the vendor to the other vendor(2).Confirmation box asking if you want to re-evaluate the Discount Date, Discount Amount and due DateIt will update ACT_TRAN.TRANS_NAME_UNO to vendor(2) name_uno.Bug 275541: BUG: Vendor change on Invoice in AP does not update the TRANS_NAME_UNO in ACT_TRANRun SQL to confirm,select ai.invoice_num,hn.name_sort,at.trans_name_uno,av.NAME_UNO,ai.NAME_UNO,ai.VENDOR_UNO,ai.REMIT_VENDOR_UNO,* from ACT_TRAN at
left join APT_INVOICE ai on at.tran_uno=ai.tran_uno
left join apm_vendor av on av.vendor_uno = ai.VENDOR_UNO
left join hbm_name hn on hn.NAME_UNO = at.TRANS_NAME_UNO
where ai.TRAN_UNO > XX
order by ai.LAST_MODIFIED desc || Step 4: Make a second invoice created using vendor (2).Compare the fields and SQL. They should be the same in both invoices. | Expected: Using the SQL script attached, check the fields match the columns.Vendor Name     #VENDOR_NAMEAP Type              #APTYPE_CODEPayment Terms   #DISCTERM_CODE1099 Type          #TEN99_CODESeperate Check  #SEPERATE_CHECKWithhold Tax      #HOLD_TAX             NOTE: Requires CMS_OPTION to be updated. Can be found in SQL attached.Client Bill Payment Required #BILL_PMT_REQDCurrency of Invoice Amount #CURRENCY_CODE and #TC_CODEJurisdiction           #JURISDIC_CODEFollowing Fields reset if using Vendor Override:USE_OVERRIDE = 'N'NAME_UNO = 0ADDRESS_UNO = 0USE_NAME_OVERRIDE = 'N'USE_ADDRESS OVERRIDE  ='N' || Step 5: Look for the Inactive vendor. | Expected: Should not be shown. || Step 6: Check different tax jurisdictions between vendors.Change the Tax Include to Yes and add a GL Line.Click Calculate Tax.Change vendor(2) to vendor (1). | Expected: Error that the tax jurisdictions are not the same. Clicking OK reverts it back to vendor(2).Chanigng Tax Include to 'No' should let you change vendor. || Step 7: Check duplicate vendor/invoice number combinationChange invoice number to one that already exists.Change the vendor to be the same vendor from the invoice you got the invoice number from. | Expected: Red box appears around the invoice number and  says that it is a duplicate. || Step 8: Vendor that has been set up for FPCC 1. Create invoice- Vendor is the one set up with FPCC2. Save | Expected: FPCC Check box - Check box appears when vendor is added- Check box remains when invoice savedBug 255555 - Invoice Entry - FPCC checkbox disappear after invoice saves

Title: Invoice Edit- Change Vendor - Not posted - General Detail Line Validation on changing Vendor
Area: ExpertSuite\Financials\Accounts Payable\Invoices\Invoice Entry and Edit\Vendor and Invoice Number
Steps: Step 1: Pre req dataVendor 1 (no limits)- Has no disbursement code or GL Account limits. Vendor 2 (limits)- Has limited disbursement codes and GL Accounts from Entity Manager. - Ensure that it has a jurisdiction different to the other vendor. || Step 2: GL Account, Disbursements, Taxes changes1. Make a new invoice using vendor 2 (limited).2. Add a Disbursement, a GL Account and a Tax.3. Change the vendor to vendor 1 )Non-limited vendor) | Expected: Line items updated- All the Jurisdictions  changed to the Jurisdiction of the Non-Limited vendor on all Detail Lines. (#TAXIN_JURISDIC)- Currency of the detail lines are the correct currency (corresponding to the vendor). Look on the detail line tabs, the details and the grids for all three. (#TC_CODE)- Auto-Narrative fields of all three have been updated with the non-limited vendor. Can be found in attached SQL.Check against the database using the attached SQL. || Step 3: Vendor with no limits to Vendor with limits1. Create an invoice for vendor 1- GL item for account that vendor 2 does not have- Disb item for cost code that vendor 2 does not have2. Change the vendor to Vendor 2 | Expected: Alerts created - Yellow alert triangle on the main invoice tab.- Yellow alert triangle on GL tab- Yellow alert triangle on Disb tab- Yellow alert triangle on GL item- Yellow alert triangle on Disb item- Two new records in APT_MESSAGE. || Step 4: Vendor with limits to Vendor with no limits1. Can use invoice as set in previous step2. Change the vendor 2 to Vendor 1 | Expected: Alerts removed- Yellow alert triangle on the main invoice tab removed- Yellow alert triangle on GL tab removed- Yellow alert triangle on Disb tab removed- Yellow alert triangle on GL item removed- Yellow alert triangle on Disb item removed- Both APT_MESSAGE records removed

Title: Invoice Edit- Change Invoice number- UI/Behaviour on Invoice Number change
Area: ExpertSuite\Financials\Accounts Payable\Invoices\Invoice Entry and Edit\Vendor and Invoice Number
Steps: Step 1: Before release | Expected: Invoice number remains editable. If changed to an invoice number already used by the same vendor, a red box should appear around the invoice number and hovering will say that it is a duplicate invoice number. || Step 2: Released | Expected: No longer editable. Needs to be Unreleased before it can be edited. || Step 3: Posted | Expected: Only after clicking the Edit button in the ribbon panel.If changed to an invoice number that is not unique, the red box appears

Title: Invoice Edit- Change Invoice Number- Validation on Invoice Number change
Area: ExpertSuite\Financials\Accounts Payable\Invoices\Invoice Entry and Edit\Vendor and Invoice Number
Steps: Step 1: Create a new invoice | Expected: Requires CreateInvoice security permission || Step 2: Change the invoice number | Expected: If unique to the vendor, then it is updated correctly in APT_INVOICE and ACT_TRAN || Step 3: Release and Post | Expected: Requires EditPostedInvoice security permissionNow only editible after clicking the edit buttonIf unique, updates APT_INVOICE #INVOICE_NUM and ACT_TRAN #TRANS_NUMBER

Title: Performance - Post Payment Schedule with bulk invoices
Steps: Step 1: 2000 invoices with 1 GL and 1 Disb | Expected: Performance environment 30 mins - using 822 32 mins - using version 83 with changes to the rule point processing + active rule 24/7/202028 mins - using version Master 5/2/202159 mins - using version Master (EX0006) 28/5/2021 (EB) 47 mins - using version 822 EX0006 18/6/2021 (EB)25 mins - using version 822 EX0007 6/9/2021 (EB)33 mins - using version 822 EX0011 9/5/2023 (EB)Bug 206983 - Performance: Post payments takes longer than expected 38 mins - using version 82SP4 21/3/2024 (Check)Loeb Performance environment - 82sp4 - 500 payments 2 mins 22 secs - using version 82SP4 13/6/2024 (Check) || Step 2: Post a payment schedule with 2000 invoices with 10 disbs | Expected: 0:25  (00:19.11 12/11/2018 local)(00:44.01 13/11/2018 old perf) || Step 3: Loeb Performance environment - 82sp4 - 2000 payments Group test | Expected: 50 mins 35 secs

Title: Jobs: Open invoice with job lock
Steps: Step 1: Create a job lockNote: the job run too quickly to attempt this test so manually add a job lock for the same user that will be opening the record e.g.exec [dbo].[sp_cmsmakelockcio] @table='APT_INVOICE',@networkID=' ',@login_id='Guid',@kpid=0,@module_name='AP',@lock_owner='B',@guid='1681acf7-73f1-44f9-9a68-9979b3cbbc29',@jobuno=160,@lock_reason='Invoice Release',@lockTimeout=20,@LOCK_ROW_UNO_LIST01='34437' | Expected: *Job lock exists || Step 2: Open invoice that has a job lockOpen with same user as the one used by job. | Expected: *job lock remains*invoice displays as disabled*lock alert displays in yellow alert bar

Title: Jobs: Payment Schedule - Open with job lock
Steps: Step 1: Create a job lockNote: the job run too quickly to attempt this test so manually add a job lock for the same user that will be opening the record e.g. exec [dbo].[sp_cmsmakelockcio] @table='APS_SCHEDULE_Z',@networkID=' ',@login_id='Guid',@kpid=0,@module_name='AP',@lock_owner='B',@guid='1681acf7-73f1-44f9-9a68-9979b3cbbc29',@jobuno=160,@lock_reason='Check Schedule Create Payments',@lockTimeout=20,@LOCK_ROW_UNO_LIST01='2303' | Expected: *Job lock exists || Step 2: Open schedule that has a job lockOpen with same user as the one used by job. | Expected: *job lock remains*payment schedule displays as disabled*lock alert displays in yellow alert bar

Title: Invoice: Lock - Locked state and expired locks
Steps: Step 1: Open the invoice with a different user1. Open invoice with user 12. Open invoice with user 23. Close invoice opened by user 2 | Expected: * guid lock is applied for user 1* lock remains with user 1 * invoice displays as disabled for user 2* lock alert displays in yellow alert bar for user 2SELECT * FROM CMS_LOCK || Step 2: Open the invoice with same user as locked by1. Open invoice with user 12. Open invoice with user 1 in another session3. Close invoice opened by user 1 in second session | Expected: * guid lock is applied * lock remains when opened in second session* invoice displays as enabled* lock warning displays in yellow alert bar * lock is removed when record in second session is closed || Step 3: Run a job when record locked by same user1. Open invoice that is unreleased2. Select to release invoice from grid | Expected: * guid application lock is applied* job has a failure processing the record* application lock remains || Step 4: Run a job when record has expired lock1. Insert an expired lock on a completed invoice (make sure its not for a release job or make the job a different number)2. Select to release invoice from grid | Expected: * Expired lock is removed* New job lock appliedNote: As the job process is quick, there is no time to check that the lock occurred so need to check using sql profilter: search for: sp_cmsmakelockcio || Step 5: Open a invoice a when record has expired lock1. Insert an expired lock on a completed invoice 2. Open invoice | Expected: * Expired lock is removed* New application lock appliedBug 175894 - Invoice - Lock created by Job doesn't get released even after expiry dates.

Title: Invoice : Lock - Delete
Steps: Step 1: Open non posted invoiceSELECT * FROM CMS_LOCK | Expected: * lock is applied || Step 2: Delete lockNote: a delete lock won't be applied if one already exists so to test this we need to remove the lock | Expected: * no lock exists || Step 3: Delete invoiceNote: As the process is quick, there is no time to check that the lock occurred so need to check using sql profilter: search for: sp_cmsmakelockcio | Expected: * lock applied with no expiry* invoice deleted* no lock exists

Title: Payment Schedule: Lock - Locked state and expired locks
Steps: Step 1: Open the payment schedule with a different user1. Open payment schedule with user 12. Open payment schedule with user 23. Close payment schedule opened by user 2 | Expected: * guid lock is applied for user 1* lock remains with user 1 * payment schedule displays as disabled for user 2* lock alert displays in yellow alert bar for user 2 SELECT * FROM CMS_LOCK || Step 2: Open the payment schedule with same user as locked by1. Open payment schedule ith user 12. Open payment schedule with user 1 in another session3. Close payment schedule opened by user 1 in second session | Expected: * guid lock is applied * lock remains when opened in second session* Payment schedule displays as enabled* lock warning displays in yellow alert bar * lock is removed when record in second session is closed || Step 3: Run a job when record locked by same user1. Open payment 176531-1schedule that is unreleased2. Select to release payment schedule from grid | Expected: * guid application lock is applied* job has a failure processing the record* application lock remains || Step 4: Run a job when record has expired lock1. Insert an expired lock on a completed payment schedule2. Open payment | Expected: * Expired lock is removed* New application lock appliedBug 175894 - Invoice - Lock created by Job doesn't get released even after expiry dates.djo 8/1/2020 - this bug has been fixed
