Title: AP: Unicode - Invoices
Steps: Step 1: Get a unicode character | Expected: ֍ Use this one or google unicode table || Step 2: Invoice Entry screen Make a new invoice using an FPCC vendor.Put some text with hardcoded return and unicode in the following areas:1. Narrative of entry screen.2. Narrative of GL account.3. Narrative and Prebill Comments of a Disbursement.4. Narrative of Taxes5. Narrative of Firm Paid Credit Card. | Expected: In the detail line grids the unicode characters should also come up- ensure that you can see the Narrative and Prebill Comments columns.If the Unicode is replaced by '?' then there is an issue.1. APT_TEXT  String with unicode will be stored in  #TXT_N ,  #TXT1 should have <<Unicode>> and the rest of the TXT[2-6] should be NULL. Link from APT_Invoice2. ACT_TEXT String with unicode will be stored in  #TXT_N ,  #TXT1 should have <<Unicode>> and the rest of the TXT[2-6] should be NULL. Link from APT_Tran_Je3. CDT_TEXT String with unicode will be stored in  #TXT_N ,  #TXT1 should have <<Unicode>> and the rest of the TXT[2-6] should be NULL. Link from CDT_Disb4. ACT_TEXT String with unicode the same way as GL account.5. ACT_TEXT String with unicode the same way as GL account. || Step 3: Edit Report from invoice1. Click on Edit list | Expected: All text fields display with text as entered (not with text '<<Unicode>>') || Step 4: Edit report from payment schedule1. Post the invoice2. Add to schedule3. Click on Edit list | Expected: All text fields display with text as entered (not with text '<<Unicode>>') || Step 5: Deletion of unicode charactersMake a new invoice using an FPCC vendor.Put some text with hardcoded return and unicode in the following areas:1. Narrative of entry screen.2. Narrative of GL account.3. Narrative and Prebill Comments of a Disbursement.4. Narrative of Taxes5. Narrative of Firm Paid Credit Card.6. Title: Invoice Edit- Change Vendor- Not Posted - Validation on Changing FPCC Vendor
Area: ExpertSuite\Financials\Accounts Payable\Invoices\Invoice Entry and Edit\Vendor and Invoice Number
Steps: Step 1: SetupCreate two vendors with different Accounts, Offices, Departments, Profit centers for their FPCC setup in Entity Manager. || Step 2: Change from Non-FPCC to FPCC VendorCreate a new invoice with a non FPCC vendor.Add a Disbursements detail line.Change the vendor to one of the FPCC vendors. | Expected: The Firm Paid Credit Card option should be disabled. || Step 3: Change from FPCC to FPCC Vendor when having FPCC detail line1. Remove the disbursement detail line.2. Add an FPCC detail line.3. Change the vendor to the other FPCC vendor.4. Open the FPCC detail card.5. Make another FPCC invoice with the second FPCC vendor and FPCC detail line.6. Compare the two FPCC detail lines between the invoices. | Expected: Invoice stays checked as FPCC. (#FIRM_PAID_CC)Jurisdiction changed to the other vendors.Transaction currency changed to match the vendor default.Account (#VENDOR_NAME), Office (#OFFC), Department (#DEPT), Profit center (#PROF) and Source Office codes are changed to the new Vendors defaults (APA_VENDOR_BOOK).  Check against the second invoice made, they should be the same. SELECT ROW_UNO, BOOK, VENDOR_NAME, dbo.APA_VENDOR_BOOK.ACCT_UNO, dbo.APA_VENDOR_BOOK.OFFC,dbo.APA_VENDOR_BOOK.DEPT, dbo.APA_VENDOR_BOOK.PROF FROM APA_VENDOR_BOOKLEFTJOIN APM_VENDOR ON APA_VENDOR_BOOK.VENDOR_UNO = APM_VENDOR.VENDOR_UNOORDERBY DBO.APA_VENDOR_BOOK.LAST_MODIFIED DESC || Step 4: Change from FPCC Vendor to Non-FPCC VendorChange the vendor to a non- FPCC vendor. | Expected: Error message that the vendor is not an FPCC vendor. Clicking OK reverts it back to the FPCC vendor.

Title: Invoices - Taxes - Tax not in use.
Steps: Step 1: Pre reqsSet a valid GL account for tax codes e.g.UPDATE TBL_TAX_BOOK SET ACCT_UNO = 127 WHERE BOOK = 1Set taxes not in useUPDATE CMS_OPTION SET FLAG_VALUE ='N'WHERE OPTION_CODE ='TAXES_IN_USE'UPDATE APM_PARMS SET RECOV_CONT_REQD ='N'Ensure there is no NA JurisdictionUPDATE TBL_JURISDIC SET JURISDIC_CODE ='NA1'where JURISDIC_CODE ='NA' || Step 2: Create a new vendor through Entity Manager or ApShell. | Expected: APM_VENDOR.JURISDIC_CODE = empty string || Step 3: Create New Invoice. || Step 4: Fill out required fields and Save. Add a GL and Disbursement item. || Step 5: Invoice Entry form | Expected: - Calculate Tax ribbon not visible.- Jurisdiction field not visible, APT_INVOICE.JURISDIC_CODE=  NULL -In Classic it is an empty string- Tax Include field not visible, based on select DEFAULT_TAX_IN from APM_PARMS.- Tax Report field not visible, default to 'C' (Claim) in table.- Tax Claim Date not visible, default to NULL in table.- Recoverable tax not visible, default to 0 in table. || Step 6: GL Details form | Expected: - Jurisdiction field not visible, ACT_TRAN_JE.TAXIN_JURISDIC = Empty string (Classic is same) || Step 7: GL Details grid | Expected: - Jurisdiction column is blank and disabled. || Step 8: Disbursement Details form | Expected: - Jurisdiction field not visible, default to Vendor's JurisdictionCDT_DISB.TAXABLE= empty string,  TAXIN_JURISDIC= empty string (Classic is same) || Step 9: Disbursement Details grid | Expected: - Jurisdiction column is blank and disabled. || Step 10: Remove disbursement item and add FPCC item || Step 11: FPCC Details form | Expected: - Jurisdiction field not visible, ACT_TRAN_JE.TAXIN_JURISDIC = Empty string (Classic is same)Bug 187039: Invoices- FPCC- Jurisdiction field should not be shown and required when TAX_IN_USE='N' || Step 12: FPCC Details grid | Expected: - Jurisdiction field is blank and disabledBug 187039: Invoices- FPCC- Jurisdiction field should not be shown and required when TAX_IN_USE='N'

Title: Invoices - Taxes - Tax included = Y, Recoverable and Not Recoverable Tax Codes
Steps: Step 1: Pre req setup Set a valid GL account for tax codes e.g: UPDATE TBL_TAX_BOOK SET ACCT_UNO = 127 WHERE BOOK = 1 Set taxes in use tax on with : UPDATE CMS_OPTION SET FLAG_VALUE ='Y'WHERE OPTION_CODE ='TAXES_IN_USE'UPDATE APM_PARMS SET DEFAULT_TAX_IN ='X'--Q,X,Y,NUPDATE APM_PARMS SET RECOV_CONT_REQD ='N' || Step 2: Pre req data Tax JurisdictionTax code 1- Seq 1- Recoverable- Recoverable account- Disb 15% Tax code 2- Seq 2- Not recoverable- Disb 10% || Step 3: Select to create New invoice1. Fill out mandatory fields- Amount = $200- Set Tax Included = Y3. Add a GL item with tax jurisdiction- $1004. Add Disb item with tax jurisdiction- $100 | Expected: Payment details* Jurisdiction is mandatory and defaulted from vendor* Tax included is defaulted as per SELECT DEFAULT_TAX_IN FROM APM_PARMS* Recoverable tax is mandatory GL item* Jurisdiction is defaulted from header but can changed by the user Disb item* Jurisdiction is defaulted from header but can changed by the user Database* Jurisdiction is value from form* Tax included is defaulted based on SELECT DEFAULT_TAX_IN FROM APM_PARMS* Recoverable tax is 0 Database - GL* Jurisdiction is value from form Database - Disb* Jurisdiction is value from form || Step 4: Calculate tax Note: Button won't be enabled until you save or the auto save kicks in Note: To work out how much tax should be removed based on %Example of 15% tax = 13.04%1. if I had amount of 100 and add 15% that will be 1152. 15/115%= 13.04 so 13.04% is the reciprocal of 15%3. If amount is to include tax it will be amount of 100 and take off 13.04 Example 10% = 9.09% | Expected: Payment details * Calculate tax button is disabled* Amount = $200* Tax Included = Removed GL itemNote: because we are striping out the tax, we remove in reverse seq order of the tax codes 1. Increased based on seq 2100 - 9.09% = 90.91 2. Reduce based on seq 190.91 - 13.04% = $79.05Taxable amount = $79.05Tax amount = $11.86 Disb ItemNote: because we are striping out the tax, we remove in reverse seq order of the tax codes 1. Reduce based on seq 2100 - 9.09% = 90.91 2. Reduce based on seq 190.91 - 13.04% = $79.05Taxable amount = $79.05Tax amount = $11.86 Tax itemsItem = $23.72 (seq 1 from GL and Disb) for account from tax code 1 || Step 5: Set Tax back to Not Applicable but cancel thatWhen prompted, select cancel | Expected: No changes || Step 6: Set Tax back to Not ApplicableWhen prompted, select continue | Expected: Payment details* Calculate tax button is disabled* Tax Included = Not applicable* Invoice amount remains the same* GL items remain the same* Disb items remain the same* Tax items are removed* Remaining balance recalculated

Title: Invoice Edit- Change Vendor- Not Posted- Changing Electronic Banking vendor to non Electronic Banking vendor
Area: ExpertSuite\Financials\Accounts Payable\Invoices\Invoice Entry and Edit\Vendor and Invoice Number
Steps: Step 1: Setup Three Different Vendors- Two Vendors with different electronic bank accounts.- One vendor that does not have an electronic bank account. || Step 2: Create a new electronic banking invoice.- Create a new invoice with a vendor that has electronic banking setup- Check Pay By Electronic Banking || Step 3: Change the Vendor to the other Electronic banking vendor | Expected: Pay By Electronic Banking stays checked if it is the preferred payment method of the new vendorUpdates the bank details to the default of the new vendor on the UIUpdates the APT_INVOICE #BANK_ACCOUNT_UNO  with the defaults of #NAME_UNO (from #REMIT_VENDOR). Title: Invoices - Taxes - Tax included = N, Recoverable and Not Recoverable Tax Codes
Steps: Step 1: Pre req setupSet a valid GL account for tax codes e.g:UPDATE TBL_TAX_BOOK SET ACCT_UNO = 127 WHERE BOOK = 1Set taxes in use tax on:UPDATE CMS_OPTION SET FLAG_VALUE ='Y'WHERE OPTION_CODE ='TAXES_IN_USE'UPDATE APM_PARMS SET DEFAULT_TAX_IN ='X'--Q,X,Y,NUPDATE APM_PARMS SET RECOV_CONT_REQD ='N' || Step 2: Pre req dataTax JurisdictionTax code 1- Seq 1- Recoverable- Recoverable account- Disb 15% Tax code 2- Seq 2- Not recoverable- Disb 10% || Step 3: Select to create New invoice1. Fill out mandatory fields- Amount = 158.10- Set Tax Included = N3. Add a GL item with tax jurisdiction- $79.054. Add Disb item with tax jurisdiction- $79.05 | Expected: Invoice details* Jurisdiction is mandatory and defaulted from vendor* Tax included is defaulted as per SELECT DEFAULT_TAX_IN FROM APM_PARMS* Recoverable tax is mandatoryGL item* Jurisdiction is defaulted from header but changed by the userDisb item* Jurisdiction is defaulted from header but changed by the userDatabase* Jurisdiction is value from form* Tax included is defaulted based on SELECT DEFAULT_TAX_IN FROM APM_PARMS* Recoverable tax is 0Database - GL* Jurisdiction is value from formDatabase - Disb* Jurisdiction is value from form || Step 4: Calculate tax Note: Button won't be enabled until you save or the auto save kicks in | Expected: Invoice details* Calculate tax button is disabled* Tax Included = AddedInvoice amount is total amount calculated from total GL amount and total DISB amount  - see below$100 + $100 = $200GL item1. Value used for the Tax item is % amount increased by seq 1  (15%)79.05 + Tax amount = 90.9179.05 + (15% of 79.05) = 90.91Tax amount = $11.862.  Value used for the invoice amount is amount increased by seq 1 (15%) then. increased by seq 2 (10%)Value increased by Seq1= 90.9190.91 + (10% of 90.91) =100,Total GL amount = $1003. GL Amount and value used for Taxable amount is total GL amount minus tax amount100 - 11.86 = 88.14Taxable Amount =$88.14Disb Item1. Value used for the Tax item is % amount increased by seq 1  (15%)79.05 + Tax amount = 90.9179.05 + (15% of 79.05) = 90.91Tax amount = $11.862.  Value used for the invoice amount is amount increased by seq 1 (15%) then. increased by seq 2 (10%)Value increased by Seq1= 90.9190.91 + (10% of 90.91) =100,Total DISB amount = $1003. GL Amount and value used for Taxable amount is total DISB amount minus tax amount100 - 11.86 = 88.14Taxable Amount =$88.14Tax itemsTax amount is total Tax amount from GL and Disb, Only Recoverable Tax Code line is created.11.86 + 11.86 = $23.72 Taxable amount is total taxable amount from GL and Disb88.14 + 88.14 = $158.10 || Step 5: Set Tax back to Not Applicable but cancel thatWhen prompted, select cancel | Expected: No changes || Step 6: Set Tax back to Not ApplicableWhen prompted, select continue | Expected: Invoice details* Calculate tax button is disabled* Tax Included = Not applicable* Invoice amount remains the same* GL items remain the same* Disb items remain the same* Tax items are removed* Remaining balance recalculated

Title: Payment Items - Trust: Non system currency with receipts having different DRUNOs
Steps: Step 1: Pre ReqsCAD Rates - currentRate: 1.092007784100000Reciprocal: 0.915744388053213CAD Rates - old DRUNO 100025Rate: 0.935340004000000Reciprocal: 1.069129937481000 || Step 2: Create a trust for the matter - in C$ - C$100 deposited 2 July 2014 (DRUNO 100025)- C$100 deposited today (DRUNO 100026)Note: you may need to fix the TRM_TRUST amounts as AR has bugs with currency conversion but they may only show if the trust has had previous transactionsDECLARE @trustcur ASVARCHAR(50)DECLARE @druno ASINTDECLARE @transamount ASINTSET @trustcur ='CAD'-- e.g. the currency a time entry was entered inSET @druno ='100025'SET @transamount = 100-- Trans currency to system currency (same druno)SELECTCONVERT(DECIMAL(15,10),ROUND(@transamount / (SELECT RATE FROM TBL_CURR_RATE WHERE CURRENCY_CODE = @trustcur AND DRUNO = @druno),10)) | Expected: TRM_TRUST after the first receiptNote: There are bugs in AR but they may only show if the trust has had previous transactionsBALANCE = 106.9129937481 but got this 106.9107997214 AVAILABLE_AMT = 106.9129937481 but got this 106.9107997214 MIN_BALANCE = 0HOLD_AMT = 0TRM_TRUST after the second receiptNote: There are bugs in ARBALANCE = 106.9129937481 + 91.5744388053 = 198.4874325534 but got 198.4852385267AVAILABLE_AMT = 106.9129937481 + 91.5744388053 = 198.4874325534 but got 198.4852385267MIN_BALANCE = 0HOLD_AMT = 0ACT_TRAN_TRUST row 1DRUNO = 100025SIGN = 1AMOUNT = 106.9129937481 TC_CODE = CADTC_AMOUNT = 100.00TRAN_TYPE = CRACT_TRAN_TRUST row 2DRUNO = 100026SIGN = 1AMOUNT = 91.5744388053TC_CODE = CADTC_AMOUNT = 100.00TRAN_TYPE = CRDECLARE @clientmatters asVARCHAR (2000)=''DECLARE @nom1 asVARCHAR (2000)=''DECLARE @DisplayCurrency asvarchar (10)='CAD'---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------Bank account minimum Title: Payment Items - Trust:
Invoices - Taxes - Tax included = Y, Different recoverable accounts
Steps: Step 1: Pre req setupSet a valid GL account for tax codes e.g:UPDATE TBL_TAX_BOOK SET ACCT_UNO = 127 WHERE BOOK = 1Set taxes in use tax on:UPDATE CMS_OPTION SET FLAG_VALUE ='Y'WHERE OPTION_CODE ='TAXES_IN_USE'UPDATE APM_PARMS SET DEFAULT_TAX_IN ='X'--Q,X,Y,NUPDATE APM_PARMS SET RECOV_CONT_REQD ='N' || Step 2: Pre req dataTax JurisdictionTax code 1- Seq 1- Recoverable- Recoverable account- Disb 15% Tax code 3- Seq 2- Recoverable- Recoverable account different to tax code 1- Disb 20% || Step 3: Select to create New vendor invoice1. Fill out mandatory fields- Amount = $200- Set Tax Included = Y3. Add a GL item - $1004. Add Disb item - $100 | Expected: Invoice details* Jurisdiction is mandatory and defaulted from vendor* Tax included is defaulted as per SELECT DEFAULT_TAX_IN FROM APM_PARMS* Recoverable tax is mandatoryGL item* Jurisdiction is defaulted from vendor but changed by the userDisb item* Jurisdiction is defaulted from vendor but changed by the userDatabase* Jurisdiction is value from form* Tax included is defaulted based on SELECT DEFAULT_TAX_IN FROM APM_PARMS* Recoverable tax is 0Database - GL* Jurisdiction is value from formDatabase - Disb* Jurisdiction is value from form || Step 4: Calculate tax Note: Button won't be enabled until you save or the auto save kicks inNote: To work out how much tax should be removed based on %Example of 15% tax = 13.041. if I had amount of 100 and add 15% that will be 1152. 15/115%= 13.04 so 13.04% is the reciprocal of 15%3. If amount is to include tax it will be amount of 100 and take off 13.04 Example 20% = 16.67% | Expected: Payment details* Calculate tax button is disabled* Amount = $200* Tax Included = RemovedGL itemNote: because we are striping out the tax, we remove in reverse seq order of the tax codes1. Reduce based on seq 2100 - 16.67% = 83.33Taxable amount = $83.33Tax amount = $16.672. Reduce based on seq 183.33 - 13.04% = 72.46Taxable amount = $72.46Tax amount = $10.87Disb ItemNote: because we are striping out the tax, we remove in reverse seq order of the tax codes1. Reduce based on seq 2100 - 16.67% = 83.33Taxable amount = $83.33Tax amount = $16.671. Reduce based on seq 183.33 - 13.04% = 72.46Taxable amount = $72.46Tax amount = $10.87Tax itemsItem 1 = $21.74 (seq 1 from GL and Disb) for account from tax code 1Item 2 = $33.34 (seq 2 from GL and Disb) for account from tax code 2 || Step 5: Set Tax back to Not Applicable but cancel thatWhen prompted, select cancel | Expected: No changes || Step 6: Set Tax back to Not ApplicableWhen prompted, select continue | Expected: Payment details* Calculate tax button is disabled* Tax Included = Not applicable* Payment amount remains the same* GL items remain the same* Disb items remain the same* Tax items are removed* Remaining balance recalculated

Title: Invoices - Taxes - Tax included = N, Different recoverable accounts
Steps: Step 1: Pre req setupSet a valid GL account for tax codes e.g:UPDATE TBL_TAX_BOOK SET ACCT_UNO = 127 WHERE BOOK = 1Set taxes in use tax on:UPDATE CMS_OPTION SET FLAG_VALUE ='Y'WHERE OPTION_CODE ='TAXES_IN_USE'UPDATE APM_PARMS SET DEFAULT_TAX_IN ='X'--Q,X,Y,NUPDATE APM_PARMS SET RECOV_CONT_REQD ='N' || Step 2: Pre req dataTax JurisdictionTax code 1- Seq 1- Recoverable- Recoverable account- Disb 15% Tax code 3- Seq 2- Recoverable- Recoverable account different to tax code 1- Disb 20% || Step 3: Select to create New vendor payment1. Fill out mandatory fields- Amount = $144.92- Set Tax Included = N3. Add a GL item - $72.464. Add Disb item - $72.46 | Expected: Payment details* Jurisdiction is mandatory and defaulted from vendor* Tax included is defaulted as per SELECT DEFAULT_TAX_IN FROM APM_PARMS* Recoverable tax is mandatoryGL item* Jurisdiction is defaulted from vendor but changed by the userDisb item* Jurisdiction is defaulted from vendor but changed by the userDatabase* Jurisdiction is value from form* Tax included is defaulted based on SELECT DEFAULT_TAX_IN FROM APM_PARMS* Recoverable tax is 0Database - GL* Jurisdiction is value from formDatabase - Disb* Jurisdiction is value from form || Step 4: Calculate tax Note: Button won't be enabled until you save or the auto save kicks in | Expected: Payment details* Calculate tax button is disabled* Tax Included = Removed* The Tax Value of same accounts will be total up and show in one line.Payment amount is total amount calculated from GL and Disb - see below$100 + $100 = $200GL item1. Value used for the Tax item 1 tax amount is amount + seq 1 % + seq 2 %72.46 + 15% (10.87) Tax amount = $10.87 2. Value used for the Tax item 2 tax amount is amount + seq 1 % + seq 2 %72.46 + 15% (10.87) = 83.3383.33 + 20% (16.67) Tax amount = $16.67 3. Value used for the payment amount is amount increased by seq 1% then increased by seq 2%72.46 + 15% (10.87) = 83.3383.33 + 20% (16.67) = 100.004. Value used for tax item 1 Taxable amount is new payment amount minus seq 1 and 2 tax amounts 100 - 10.87 - 16.67 = 72.46Taxable =$72.465. Value used for tax item 2 Taxable amount is new payment amount minus 2 tax amount 100 - 16.67 = 83.33Taxable =$83.33Disb Item1. Value used for the Tax item 1 tax amount is amount + seq 1 % + seq 2 %72.46 + 15% (10.87) Tax amount = $10.87 2. Value used for the Tax item 2 tax amount is amount + seq 1 % + seq 2 %72.46 + 15% (10.87) = 83.3383.33 + 20% (16.67) Tax amount = $16.67 3. Value used for the payment amount is amount increased by seq 1% then increased by seq 2%72.46 + 15% (10.87) = 83.3383.33 + 20% (16.67) = 100.004. Value used for tax item 1 Taxable amount is new payment amount minus seq 1 and 2 tax amounts 100 - 10.87 - 16.67 = 72.46Taxable =$72.465. Value used for tax item 2 Taxable amount is new payment amount minus 2 tax amount 100 - 16.67 = 83.33Taxable =$83.33Tax itemsTax amount for tax item 1 is tax amounts from GL and Disb10.87+ 10.87 = $21.74Tax amount for tax item 1 is tax amounts from GL and Disb16.67+ 16.67 = $33.34Taxable amount for tax item 1 is taxable amount from GL and Disb72.46 + 72.46 = $144.92Taxable amount for tax item 1 is taxable amount from GL and Disb83.33 + 83.33 = $166.66 || Step 5: Set Tax back to Not Applicable but cancel thatWhen prompted, select cancel | Expected: No changes || Step 6: Set Tax back to Not ApplicableWhen prompted, select continue | Expected: Payment details* Calculate tax button is disabled* Tax Included = Not applicable* Payment amount remains the same* GL items remain the same* Disb items remain the same* Tax items are removed* Remaining balance recalculated

Title: Invoices - Taxes - Tax included = Y with negative GL
Steps: Step 1: Pre req setupSet a valid GL account for tax codes e.g:UPDATE TBL_TAX_BOOK SET ACCT_UNO = 127 WHERE BOOK = 1Set taxes in use tax on:UPDATE CMS_OPTION SET FLAG_VALUE ='Y'WHERE OPTION_CODE ='TAXES_IN_USE'UPDATE APM_PARMS SET DEFAULT_TAX_IN ='X'--Q,X,Y,NUPDATE APM_PARMS SET RECOV_CONT_REQD ='N' || Step 2: Pre req dataTax JurisdictionTax code 1- Seq 1- Recoverable- Recoverable account- Disb 10% || Step 3: Select to create New vendor payment1. Fill out mandatory fields- Amount = $90- Set Tax Included = Y3. Add a GL item with tax jurisdiction- $1004. Add Disb item with tax jurisdiction- neg$10 | Expected: Invoice details* Jurisdiction is mandatory and defaulted from vendor* Tax included is defaulted as per SELECT DEFAULT_TAX_IN FROM APM_PARMS* Recoverable tax is mandatoryGL item* Jurisdiction is defaulted from vendor but changed by the userDisb item* Jurisdiction is defaulted from vendor but changed by the userDatabase* Jurisdiction is value from form* Tax included is defaulted based on SELECT DEFAULT_TAX_IN FROM APM_PARMS* Recoverable tax is 0Database - GL* Jurisdiction is value from formDatabase - Disb* Jurisdiction is value from form || Step 4: Calculate tax Note: Button won't be enabled until you save or the auto save kicks inNote: To work out how much tax should be removed based on %Example of 10% tax = 9.09%1. if I had amount of 100 and add 10% that will be 1102. 10/110%= 9.09 so 9.09% is the reciprocal of 10%3. If amount is to include tax it will be amount of 100 and take off 9.09%100 - 9.09 = 90.91 | Expected: Invoice details* Calculate tax button is disabled* Amount = $90* Tax Included = RemovedGL itemReduced based on seq 1100 - 9.09% (9.09) = 90.91Disb Item1. Reduce based on seq 1-10 - 9.09% (-.91)= -9.09Tax itemsTax mount is tax on GL and Disb9.09 - .91 = $8.18Taxable amount is invoice amount - tax90.00 - 8.18 = 81.82

Title: Invoices - Taxes - Tax included - Invoice Release validation on Tax Calculation
Steps: Step 1: Pre req setup Set a valid GL account for tax codes e.g: UPDATE TBL_TAX_BOOK SET ACCT_UNO = 127 WHERE BOOK = 1 Set taxes in use tax on: UPDATE CMS_OPTION SET FLAG_VALUE ='Y'WHERE OPTION_CODE ='TAXES_IN_USE'UPDATE APM_PARMS SET DEFAULT_TAX_IN ='X'--Q,X,Y,NUPDATE APM_PARMS SET RECOV_CONT_REQD ='N' || Step 2: Pre req data Tax JurisdictionTax code 1- Seq 1- Recoverable- Recoverable account- Has Disb % || Step 3: Can't release when tax not calculated on GL or Disb- Set Tax Included = Yes or No- Invoice has GL and Disb items1. Release | Expected: Release error'Invoice contains recoverable taxes.'- Release button in list and entry screen should be disabled when tax is not calculated || Step 4: Can release when tax calculated on GL or Disb- Set Tax Included = Yes or No- Invoice has GL and Disb items1. Calculate tax- Tax Included = Added or Removed2. Release | Expected: Invoice Released || Step 5: Can't release when Recoverable Tax field not matched with calculated tax- Set UPDATE APM_PARMS SET RECOV_CONT_REQD ='Y'- Restart app.- Set Tax Included = Yes or No- Invoice has GL and Disb items1. Calculate tax- Tax Included = Added or Removed2. Release | Expected: Release error'Tax details do not match' || Step 6: Can release when Recoverable Tax field matched with calculated tax- Set UPDATE APM_PARMS SET RECOV_CONT_REQD ='Y'- Restart app.- Set Tax Included = Yes or No- Invoice has GL and Disb items1. Calculate tax- Tax Included = Added or Removed   - Enter Recoverable Tax = Total Tax amount.2. Release | Expected: Invoice Released

Title: Invoices - Taxes - Recoverable Tax, including multi currency
Steps: Step 1: Pre req setupSet a valid GL account for tax codes e.g:UPDATE TBL_TAX_BOOK SET ACCT_UNO = 127 WHERE BOOK = 1Set taxes in use tax on:UPDATE CMS_OPTION SET FLAG_VALUE ='Y'WHERE OPTION_CODE ='TAXES_IN_USE'UPDATE APM_PARMS SET DEFAULT_TAX_IN ='X'--Q,X,Y,NUPDATE APM_PARMS SET RECOV_CONT_REQD ='Y' | Expected: Bug 241749 - AP- Cannot add tax detail line to an invoice that has not yet been saved for the first time. || Step 2: New invoice default | Expected: * Recoverable tax is set to 0* Recoverable tax is mandatory || Step 3: Recoverable tax does not equal to tax items1. Fill out mandatory fields2. Set recoverable tax = 03. Add multiple tax itemsNote: Ensure invoice amount matches total items4. Save5. ReleaseNote: Ensure invoice amount matches total items | Expected: 1. Invoice saved- Recoverable tax amount saved2. Release failsError: Tax details do not match || Step 4: Recoverable Tax is positive and equals tax items1. Fill out mandatory fields2. Add multiple tax items so total is positiveNote: Ensure invoice amount matches total items3. Set recoverable tax = total tax items4. Save5. Release | Expected: 1. Invoice saved2. Release succeeds || Step 5: Recoverable Tax is negative and equals tax items1. Fill out mandatory fields2. Add multiple tax items so total is negativeNote: Ensure invoice amount matches total items3. Set recoverable tax = total tax items4. Save5. Release | Expected: 1. Invoice saved2. Release succeeds || Step 6: Multi Currency1. New invoice that is not system currency e.g. CAD2. Add tax item e.g. 10.003. Enter recoverable tax = total tax item4. Save and post | Expected: Payment posted* Recoverable tax amount converted to system currency (compare to classic)e.g. entered C$10.00 is now on database as 9.1574438805* Recoverable tax amount is still displayed in system currency  e.g.C$10

Title: Invoices- Taxes - Sales Use tax, including multi currency
Steps: Step 1: Set sales tax onUPDATE CMS_OPTION SET FLAG_VALUE = 'Y' WHERE OPTION_CODE = 'SALES_USE_TX' || Step 2: Create New Invoice1. Fill out mandatory fields2. Enter value in sales taxSave | Expected: Invoice saved- sales tax amount saved || Step 3: Multi Currency1. New invoice for bank that is not system currency e.g. CAD2. Fill out mandatory fields3. Title: Invoice Edit - Change Vendor - Posted- Vendor address override
Area: ExpertSuite\Financials\Accounts Payable\Invoices\Invoice Entry and Edit\Vendor and Invoice Number
Steps: Step 1: Create a new invoice with a vendor that you can override their address and vendor name || Step 2: Change the vendor name and address- Click the blue ellipses next to the Vendor address | Expected: Check the following columns in APT_INVOICE #VENDOR_UNO Corresponds to the vendor you changed to in APM_VENDOR#USE_OVERRIDE ='Y' #NAME_UNO Corresponds to the vendor name you overrode to in HBM_NAME#ADDRESS_UNO Corresponds to the Address you overrode to in HBM_ADDRESS#USE_NAME_OVERRIDE ='Y' #USE_ADDRS_OVERRIDE ='Y'Ensue that it is displayed correctly in the UINote: When not overriden, NAME_UNO and ADDRESS_UNO are 0 || Step 3: Change to another vendor | Expected: Following Fields reset in APT_INVOICEUSE_OVERRIDE = 'N'NAME_UNO = 0ADDRESS_UNO = 0USE_NAME_OVERRIDE = 'N'USE_ADDRESS OVERRIDE  ='N'  Bug:167904 Vendor override in Invoice Entry - should set related columns back to default value when invoice not using override || Step 4: Change the vendor back and change the vendor name and address || Step 5: Post the invoice and override the vendor name and address- Click Edit Invoice in the ribbon panel- Click the blue ellipses next to the Vendor address | Expected: Check the following columns in APT_INVOICE #VENDOR_UNO Corresponds to the vendor you changed to in APM_VENDOR#USE_OVERRIDE ='Y' #NAME_UNO Corresponds to the vendor name you overrode to in HBM_NAME#ADDRESS_UNO Corresponds to the Address you overrode to in HBM_ADDRESS#USE_NAME_OVERRIDE ='Y' #USE_ADDRS_OVERRIDE ='Y'Check that the remit vendor is updated in APT_INVOICE_AMTCheck that APH_VENDOR_YEAR and APH_VENDOR_SUMM tables have the following fields updated based on the new vendor    If a credit note:    - #CRNOTE_COUNT    - #CRNOTE_AMT    - #AP_NET_AMT    Not a credit note    - #INVOICE_COUNT    - #INVOICE_AMT    - #AP_NET_AMT

Title: Invoices - Taxes - Withholding Tax, including multi currency
Steps: Step 1: Set 10% Withholding Tax  UPDATE CMS_OPTION SET FLAG_VALUE = 'Y' WHERE OPTION_CODE = 'WHTAX_IN_USE' UPDATE APM_PARMS SET WHOLD_PCNT ='10.0000' || Step 2: Create New Invoice with Withhold Tax and add into payment1. Fill out mandatory fields2. Check the Withhold Tax flag. 3. Put in detail lines and Post it. Make a Vendor Payment for this invoice. | Expected: Invoice posted- APT_INVOICE.Hold_Tax = 'Y'.- When this item added to Vendor Payment, Withheld Amount = 10% of Invoice Amount is defaulted. (saved as APT_INV_AMT.WHELD_AMT when TRAN_TYPE = 'CH') || Step 3: Multi Currency1. New invoice for bank that is not system currency e.g. CAD2. Fill out mandatory fields3. Set invoice amount e.g.1004. Enter line item to match the invoice amount e.g. 1005. PostMake a Vendor Payment for this invoice. | Expected: Invoice posted and added to payment- APT_INVOICE.Hold_Tax = 'Y'.- When this item added to Vendor Payment, Withheld Amount = 10% of Invoice Amount is defaulted. (saved as APT_INV_AMT.WHELD_AMT when TRAN_TYPE = 'CH')- Withheld amount is still displayed in invoice currency when invoice added to payment  e.g.C$10- After posting payment, Withheld amount display as invoice currency on UI and system currency in database.e.g. entered C$10.00 is now on database as 9.1574438805

Title: Invoices - Taxes - Tax Included = Y, Withholding Tax (Negative Tax) in Jurisdiction Code
Steps: Step 1: Pre req setup Set a valid GL account for Withholding tax codes e.g: UPDATE TBL_TAX_BOOK SET ACCT_UNO = 127 WHERE BOOK = 1 Set taxes in use tax on with : UPDATE CMS_OPTION SET FLAG_VALUE ='Y'WHERE OPTION_CODE ='TAXES_IN_USE'UPDATE APM_PARMS SET DEFAULT_TAX_IN ='Y'--Q,X,Y,NUPDATE APM_PARMS SET RECOV_CONT_REQD ='N' || Step 2: Pre req data Tax JurisdictionWithholding Tax code 1- Seq 1- Recoverable- Recoverable account- Fee Withholding Tax = 10%- Disb Withholding Tax = 10% || Step 3: Select to create New invoice1. Fill out mandatory fields- Amount = $200- Set Tax Included = Y3. Add a GL item with tax jurisdiction- $1004. Add Disb item with tax jurisdiction- $100 | Expected: invoice details* Jurisdiction is mandatory and defaulted from vendor* Tax included is defaulted as per SELECT DEFAULT_TAX_IN FROM APM_PARMS* Recoverable tax is mandatory GL item* Jurisdiction is defaulted from vendor but can changed by the user Disb item* Jurisdiction is defaulted from vendor but can changed by the user Database* Jurisdiction is value from form* Tax included is defaulted based on SELECT DEFAULT_TAX_IN FROM APM_PARMS* Recoverable tax is 0 Database - GL* Jurisdiction is value from form Database - Disb* Jurisdiction is value from form || Step 4: Calculate tax Note: Button won't be enabled until you save or the auto save kicks in Note: To work out how much tax should be added based on % (Withholding Tax is Negative Tax)Example of -10% tax = -11.11%1. if I had amount of 100 and add-10% that will be 90.2. -10/90= -11.11% is the reciprocal of -10%3. If amount is to include tax it will be amount of 100 and minus -11.11% | Expected: Payment details * Calculate tax button is disabled* Amount = $200* Tax Included = Removed GL itemReduce based on seq 1100 - (-11.11% of 100) = 100 - ( -11.11) = 100 + 11.11 = 111.11Taxable amount = $111.11Tax amount = -$11.11 Disb ItemReduce based on seq 1100 - (-11.11% of 100) = 100 - ( -11.11) = 100 + 11.11 = 111.11Taxable amount = $111.11Tax amount = -$11.11 Tax itemsTax Amout = -11.11 + (-11.11) = -$22.22Taxable Amount = 111.11 + 111.11 = $222.22 || Step 5: Set Tax back to Not Applicable but cancel thatWhen prompted, select cancel | Expected: No changes || Step 6: Set Tax back to Not ApplicableWhen prompted, select continue | Expected: Payment details* Calculate tax button is disabled* Tax Included = Not applicable* Invoice amount remains the same* GL items remain the same* Disb items remain the same* Tax items are removed* Remaining balance recalculated

Title: Invoice - Post - Multicurrency Invoice with GL item.
Steps: Step 1: Pre-reqExpert Invoice C$100 :- one C$100 GL item - 1099 Amount = C$100Classic Invoice C$100 :- one C$100 GL item - 1099 Amount = C$100 || Step 2: Post these invoice on where they are created. Reconcile. | Expected: These records should be identical, unless specified as below || Step 3: Listed below are field getting update on Posting Invoice with GL item. || Step 4: Invoice details updated. APT_INVOICE- Latest_period, updated with current period.- Latest_Date, updated with posting date.- Period, updated with current period- Balance, now in system currency = 91.57- Original_amt, now in system currency = 91.57- Inv_amt, now in system currency = 91.57- Tax_amt, not update as no tax entered.- Ten99_amt, now in system currency = 91.57- Druno, updated with current druno- Expert_Invoice_Status, update to 'O'- Invoice_Status, update to 'O'- Last_modified || Step 5: GL entry updated.ACT_TRAN_JE- Period, updated with current period- Druno, updated with current druno- Debit, now in system currency = 91.57- Credit, not updated because only update on credit GL line (negative amount GL line) - Taxable_amt, not updated as no tax entered.- Last_modified. || Step 6: Transaction Entry updated.ACT_TRAN- Trans_Period , updated with current period- Trans_Post_Date, update with posting date- Author_Empl_uno, updated with employee initated the post.- Last_modified || Step 7: Invoice Session updated.APS_INVOICE_Z- Status, now as Posted- Last_modified || Step 8: Vendor Year updated (insert a new line if vendor don't have an existing record for that fiscal year)APH_VENDOR_YEAR- AP_net_amt = previous amt + invoice amount in system currency (91.57)- Invoice_Amt = previous amt + invoice amount in system currency (91.57)- Invoice_count = previous count + 1 - Last_inv_date = if last invoice date less than its posting date, then this column populated with posting date (trans_post_date). Else use last invoice date. || Step 9: Vendor Summary updated (insert a new line if vendor don't have an existing record in the table)APH_VENDOR_SUMM- AP_balance = previous balance + invoice amount in system currency (91.57) - Invoice_amt = previous amount + invoice amount in system currency (91.57)- Invoice_count = previous count + 1- Last_inv_date = if last invoice date less than its posting date, then this column populated with posting date (trans_post_date). Else use last invoice date.

Title: Invoice - Post - Multicurrency on Invoice Details

Reconcile. | Expected: These records should be identical, unless specified as per || Step 3: Listed below are field in APT_INVOICE getting update on Posting Invoice. || Step 4: Invoice details updated. Title: Invoice - Post - Auto Split Disbursement
Steps: Step 1: Pre-reqSetup Matter to have Auto Split disbursement setup.Matter 1 - Source Matter- Auto splits enabled in Entity Manager > Time and Billing > Auto Split flagMatter 2 - Child matter- 30% splitMatter 3- Child matter- 50% split.*See attached SQL for split disbursement related tables || Step 2: Create an invoice with a disbursement line, using the Matter 1.Post it || Step 3: CDT_DISBOriginal record in CDT_DISB gets updated.Another two records created. | Expected: Record 1 (Original record) :- Source Matter- 20% of entered amount. (the 20% which unassigned to any matter).- Transferred = 'N'Record 2 (Split record 1) :- Child Matter- 30% of entered amount. - Transferred = 'S'Record 3 (Split record 2) :- Child Matter- 50% of entered amount.- Transferred = 'S' || Step 4: CDT_DISB_NEWA new record created after post. | Expected: Base_Amt, Tobill_amt and std_amt are the amount before split.Type = 'N', Regular disbursement || Step 5: CDT_DISB_ORIGA new record for before split. (Split are done after post) | Expected: Base_Amt, Tobill_amt and std_amt are the amount before split.Type = 'N', Regular disbursement || Step 6: CDT_DISB_MODThree records created. | Expected: Record 1 - (-80) on the amount fields. Indicate  80% ($80) of original amount has been splitted out and deducted from the source matter.- Type = 'O', Split outRecord 2 - 30 on the amount fields. Indicate 30% ($30) has been splitted out from source matter and added to the child matter. - Type = 'I', Split In.Record 3- 50 on the amount fields. Indicate 50% ($50) has been splitted out from source matter and added to the child matter.- Type = 'I'. Split In. || Step 7: CDH_SUMMARY_GLThree records updated/created for each matter,cost_code and period combination | Expected: Record 1- Source Matter- Base_New = previous amount + 100- Base_Mod = previous amount + (-80), 80% has been splitted to child matters- Tobill_New = previous amount + 100- Tobill_Mod= previous amount + (-80)Record 2- Child Matter- Base_Mod = previous amount + 30, 30% splitted from source matter- Tobill_mod = previous amount + 30, 30% splitted from source matterRecord 3- Child Matter- Base_Mod = previous amount + 50, 50% splitted from source matter- Tobill_mod = previous amount + 50, 50% splitted from source matter || Step 8: TBH_MATTER_SUMMThree records updated/created for each matters | Expected: Record 1- Source Matter- Hard_Tot = previous amount + 20, 20% which not assigned to anyone- Hard_Count = previous count + 1- Hard_Wip_Bal = previous amount + 20Record 2- Child Matter- Hard_Tot = previous amount + 30, 30% splitted from source matter- Hard_Count = previous count + 1- Hard_Wip_Bal = previous amount + 30Record 3- Child Matter- Hard_Tot = previous amount + 50, 50% splitted from source matter- Hard_Count = previous count + 1- Hard_Wip_Bal = previous amount + 50 || Step 9: APH_VENDOR_YEAR updated || Step 10: APH_VENDOR_SUMM updated || Step 11: ACT_TRANupdated || Step 12: APS_INVOICE_ZStatus updated to P

Title: Invoice - Post - Anticipated disbursement Auto Matched with matched item
Steps: Step 1: Pre req  The matter should not have auto split enabled Disbursement Code- Auto Match on Anticipate Item || Step 2: In Expert AP, create invoice with disbursement.*The Vendor, Disbursement code and Bill Amount have to be identical with anticipated disbursement entry to be matched.*The Antic Disb must have a vendor otherwise the auto match cannot happen | Expected: CDT_DISB- Record created with WIP_STATUS = 'N' || Step 3: Post the invoice. | Expected: Record MatchedCDT_DISB- Record from Step 3 update WIP_STATUS = 'W' with PERIOD, LATEST_PERIOD and DRUNO populated.- Another identical record created with Negative TOBILL_AMT to balance the anticipated disbursement that has been billed. It is a posted record with WIP_STATUS = 'W', Periods and Drunos populated. CDT_DISB_ANTIC- Original record from Billing updated STATUS = 'M' (Matched)- New record created with Status = 'F' (Final Matching Disbursement) with Negative DISB_AMT, MATCH_AMT and MATCH_DISB_UNO populated from Original Antic record in BIlling.  CDT_DISB_NEW- Two new records created. One for disb posted in AP and another to balance the billed amount (BILL_AMT)*Bug 208324 Wrong CDT_DISB_NEW.Type when automatic matching anticipated disbursements- Type = N for entered disbursement in Expert disb- Type = M for record with negative tobill_amt  CDH_SUMMARY_GL- BASE_NEW and TOBILL_NEW (no changes in value as it has balanced out) updated*Bug 179465 CDH_SUMMARY_GL.TOBILL_NEW updated when posting Expert invoices with matched disbursement TBH_MATTER_SUMM- HARD_TOTAL updated APH_VENDOR_YEAR- INVOICE_COUNT, INVOICE_AMT, AP_NET_AMT updated APH_VENDOR_SUMM- INVOICE_COUNT, INVOICE_AMT, AP_BALANCE updated || Step 4: Create another bill for the Client.Matter. | Expected: The matched disbursement is balanced out and not billed to the client.

Title: Payment - Check reprint: Button
Steps: Step 1: Reprint checks button on List screen - when is button enabled | Expected: - payments must all be for the same bank- payment method = check- payment status is R or O- check number <> 0 || Step 2: Reprint checks button on payment screen - when is button enabled | Expected: - payments must all be for the same back- payment method = check- payment status is R or O- check number <> 0

Title: Invoice - Post - Posting Validation
Steps: Step 1: Display of error- Via a job- Via an invoice | Expected: Display in Recent Activities tab.Display in red alert bar at the top of Invoice Entry screen. || Step 2: LockingInvoice is already locked1. Open an invoice that is C/R.2. Keep the invoice open and go to the grid and select the invoice.3. Attempt to post the invoice. Display error: 'Opened and locked in another view'Can't lock the invoice | Expected: Display error: 'Opened and locked in another view/by USER'Can't lock the invoice. || Step 3: Validate Approved FlagInvoice must be Approved to post.1. Create a C/R invoice.2. Update Approved = N via sql3. Post. | Expected: Display error : 'The invoice was not approved for posting'Post failed.*Bug 176922 - Invoice Post - change expense report error message to vendor invoice related. || Step 4: Validate PeriodPeriod must be 0 to post.1. Create a C/R invoice.2. Update Period <>0 via sql.3. Post | Expected: Display error : 'The period associated with this invoice is invalid'Post failed.*Bug 176922 - Invoice Post - change expense report error message to vendor invoice related. || Step 5: Validate Invoice StatusInvoice Status must be in Release (R) or Ready for Posting (C) to post.1. Create a C/R invoice.2. Update Expert_invoice_status <> C,R.3. Post | Expected: Display error : The invoice status is invalid.Post failed.*Bug 176922 - Invoice Post - change expense report error message to vendor invoice related. || Step 6: The rest of validations reuse of Invoice Release validation. Induce an error that should be caught by Invoice Release to make sure the Release SP gets run on Posting too.eg, Validate Invoice Date with min and max parms date.Post an invoice with invalid invoice date, this validation is a part of Release SP only. If the invalid invoice date error get caught, then it means that Release SP is running as a part of Post SP. | Expected: Release SP is tested as part of linked Test Cases :131455 - Release Validation176366 - User must have security to all the books used by invoice.176367 - User must have security to all the accounts used by invoice.176380 - GL Interbook and ODPC link validation || Step 7: Validate Name uno of the remit vendor matches the one linked to the bank account.1 .Have a vendor(1) with a bank account.2. Have another vendor(2) that uses the first vendor(1) as a remittance vendor and also has bank account details.3. Create a complete invoice with the second vendor(2) and the AP Type that corresponds to the first vendors (1) bank.4. Release the invoice5. Using SQL, change the bank account uno to the second vendors(2) bank account.6. Post the invoice. | Expected: Invoice is not postedError that the bank account is not related to the remit vendor. || Step 8: Validate Bank account from a different bank then the AP Types bank.1. Have a vendor with a bank account (e.g. for BOT).2. Create an invoice with an AP Type that has a bank that does not correspond to the bank accounts (e.g. INE).3. Release the invoice4. Change the Bank_Acct_Uno in SQL to the bank account in step 1.5. Post the invoice. | Expected: Invoice is not posted.Errors that the bank for the invoice and bank details are different.

Title: Invoice - Post - Delayed Split Disbursement
Steps: Step 1: Create an invoice with disbursement using the split source matter || Step 2: Post the invoice.Use attached sequal to check if disbursement is splitted | Expected: Disbursement entry not splitted. (No new disbursement entry created in CDT_DISB, CDT_DISB_MOD and CDT_DISB_ORIG)When the source matter enabled Delayed Split, it will override the Auto Split option. Hence the disbursement do not get split until billed.

APT_INVOICE- Latest_period, updated with current period.- Latest_Date, updated with posting date.- Period, updated with current period- Balance, now in system currency = 91.57- Original_amt, now in system currency = 91.57- Inv_amt, now in system currency = 91.57- Tax_amt, now in system currency = 91.57- Ten99_amt, now in system currency = 91.57- Druno, updated with current druno- Expert_Invoice_Status, update to 'O'- Invoice_Status, update to 'O'- Last_modifiedGL entry updated.ACT_TRAN_JE- Period, updated with current period- Druno, updated with current druno- Debit, now in system currency = 91.57- Credit, not updated because only update on credit GL line (negative amount GL line) - Taxable_amt, now in system currency = 91.57- Last_modified.Transaction Entry updated.ACT_TRAN- Trans_Period , updated with current period- Trans_Post_Date, update with posting date- Author_Empl_uno, updated with employee initated the post.- Last_modifiedInvoice Session updated.APS_INVOICE_Z- Status, now as Posted- Last_modifiedVendor Year updated (insert a new line if vendor don't have an existing record for that fiscal year)APH_VENDOR_YEAR- AP_net_amt = previous amt + invoice amount in system currency (91.57)- Invoice_Amt = previous amt + invoice amount in system currency (91.57)- Invoice_count = previous count + 1 - Last_inv_date = if last invoice date less than its posting date, then this column populated with posting date (trans_post_date). Title: Payment - Check print: reuse canceled check
Steps: Step 1: Data pre reqsPayment 1- Check payment that has been printed- Posted and Canceled || Step 2: Create another payment (payment 2)1. Create payment - Payment Method = manual - Check number = same as was used for payment 12. Save | Expected: Check number reused- Payment 2 has the same check number as payment 1Payment 1's check number record APT_CHECK_FORM- FORM_STATUS = V- NEW_FORM_UNO = Payment 2's FORM_UNOPayment 2's check number record APT_CHECK_FORM- FORM_STATUS = A- NEW_FORM_UNO = 0- CHECK_NUM = Payment 1's CHECK_NUM DECLARE @bank asvarchar (10)=''SELECT FORM_UNO,NEW_FORM_UNO,cf.BANK_CODE,cf.CHECK_NUM, cf.FORM_STATUS,cf.FORM_USE,cf.STATUS_SOURCE,CHECK_TRAN_UNO,TIMES_PRINTED,LAST_MODIFIED--,cf.* FROM APT_CHECK_FORM cfWHERE cf.BANK_CODE = @bankORDERBY cf.BANK_CODE,cf.CHECK_NUM ASC || Step 3: Create another payment (payment 3)1. Post and cancel payment 22. Create payment - Payment Method = manual - Check number = same as was used for payment 1 and 23. Save | Expected: Check number reused- Payment 3 has the same check number as payment 1 and 2Payment 1's check number record APT_CHECK_FORM- FORM_STATUS = V- NEW_FORM_UNO = Payment 2's FORM_UNO Payment 2's check number record APT_CHECK_FORM- FORM_STATUS = V- NEW_FORM_UNO = Payment 3's FORM_UNO- CHECK_NUM = Payment 1 and 2's CHECK_NUM Payment 3's check number record APT_CHECK_FORM- FORM_STATUS = A- NEW_FORM_UNO = 0- CHECK_NUM = Payment 1 and 2's CHECK_NUM

Title: Recurring Invoice - grid: Data

Steps: Step 1: Note: The generic granula tests to save search are in Framework Area: Recurring Invoices Data stored: in configuration  EXECSECURITY.SetContextByName '' SELECT n.Path,n.Name,v.Content FROM Configuration.ConfigName n INNER JOIN Configuration.ConfigValue v ON n.Id = v.NameIdWHERE Path LIKE 'Preference.SavedSearches.RecurringInvoicesGridInstances.ExpertAccountsPayable%' || Step 2: Save search | Expected: * Creates can be saved per user* Creates can be saved per firm (if the user has permissions)* Can create a new saved search including any of the items in the data provider section || Step 3: Load search | Expected: * Can see and load your owned saved searches* Can see and load firm searches

Create a manual payment (payment 2) - Payment Method = manual - Check number = same as was used for payment 1 | Expected: UI errorCheck number is already in use || Step 3: Service validation1. Enter a valid check number for payment 2 2. Add detail items so the payment is ready for posting3. Close the payment 4. Change the check number in sql to be the same as payment 15. Release the payment from the grid | Expected: Job alertRelease fails with alert re check number already in use

Title: Recurring Invoice: Field Validation
Steps: Step 1: Refer to wiki - field by field descriptions | Expected: https://aderant.sharepoint.com/RD/AP/Moscow%20Design%20Wiki/Recurring%20Invoices.aspxAll the fields store to APM_RECINV || Step 2: Bill Payment Required? | Expected: Defaults to N and is not shown in the UI || Step 3: Header || Step 4: Vendor | Expected: #VENDOR_UNO RequiredOnly returns active vendorsValidation error if invalidSearches by name or numberOnce saved, cannot be changedBug: 206057 - Recurring Invoice Entry - Can use inactive vendor to save/generate if it's in the MRU - Fixed || Step 5: Template | Expected: #INV_TEMPLATERequiredMax of 8 charactersValidation on tabIf vendor, template and book are not unique then a red box around the book field with 'A template already exists with this combination of Vendor, Template Code and Book. Please selected a unique combination.' (if firm does support multibook. Otherwise the validation is around the Template field.)Once saved, cannot be changed || Step 6: Book | Expected: #BOOKOnly enabled if firm supports multibookRequiredDisplays active booksIf vendor, template and book are not unique then a red box around the book field with 'A template already exists with this combination of Vendor, Template Code and Book. Please selected a unique combination.'Once saved, cannot be changed || Step 7: Invoice Amount and Currency | Expected: #INV_AMTRequiredMust be =>0, cannot be negativeWill be the default for 1099 Amount (if it is displayed)#CURRENCY_CODEDefault from vendor || Step 8: Generate Invoice Every | Expected: #FREQ_VALUERequiredInteger between 1 and 12#FREQ_TYPEMonthly (M) or Weekly (W) || Step 9: Generation Method | Expected: #STATUSDo Not Generate (H), Manual (M), Automatic (A) || Step 10: First Invoice Date | Expected: #INV_START_DATERequired || Step 11: Last Invoice Date | Expected: #INV_END_DATERequiredCannot be a date prior to First Invoice Date || Step 12: General || Step 13: AP Type | Expected: #APTYPE_CODERequiredDefaulted from vendor || Step 15: Reference | Expected: #REF_NUMOptionalFree format, 30 char limitBug: 206060 - Recurring Invoices - Reference field limited to 12 characters when it should be 30 - Fixed || Step 16: Payment Terms | Expected: #DISCTERM_CODERequiredDefaults from vendorAny discount based on invoice amount and payment terms || Step 17: Discount Amount | Expected: #DISC_AMTAutomatically calculated from the amount and payment termsCan be overriden but if invoice amount or payment terms are changed, then it is recalculated || Step 18: Seperate Check | Expected: #SEPERATE_CHECKY or NDefaults from vendor and can be modified || Step 19: Tax || Step 20: Jurisdiction | Expected: #JURISDIC_CODEOnly if #TAXES_IN_USE option is Y in CMS_OPTION tableDefaults from vendor but can be modified || Step 21: Tax Include | Expected: #TAX_INOnly if #TAXES_IN_USE option is Y in CMS_OPTION tableDefault from APM_PARMS.Three optionsYes (Y)No (N) Not Applicable (X) || Step 22: Sales/ Use Tax | Expected: #SALES_USE_TAXOnly if #SALES_USE_TX is Y in CMS_OPTION tableNo default || Step 23: Withhold Tax | Expected: #HOLD_TAXOnly if #WHTAX_IN_USE option is Y in CMS_OPTION tableDefaults from vendor, can be modified || Step 24: 1099 || Step 25: 1099 Type | Expected: #TEN99_CODEOnly if #1099_IN_USE in CMS_OPTION is YDefault from vendor, can be modified || Step 26: 1099 Amount | Expected: #1099_AMTOnly if #1099_IN_USE in CMS_OPTION is YDefault from Invoice Amount. Can be modified.If invoice amount is modified then 1099 Amount also modifiedMust be between 0 and Invoice Amount. || Step 27: Narrative | Expected: #TEXT_IDLinks to APM_TEXTSpell check and  expansion codes workLimit of 15,000 characters.

Title: Invoice - Post - Multicurrency Invoice with Disbursement item.
Steps: Step 1: Pre-reqExpert Invoice C$100 :- one C$100 Disb item Classic Invoice C$100 :- one C$100 Disb item || Step 2: Post these invoice on where they are created. Reconcile. | Expected: These records should be identical, unless not applicable (eg,Expense Report related fields) || Step 3: Listed below are fields getting update on Posting Invoice with FPCC item. || Step 4: Invoice details updated. APT_INVOICE- Latest_period, updated with current period.- Latest_Date, updated with posting date.- Period, updated with current period- Balance, now in system currency = 91.57- Original_amt, now in system currency = 91.57- Inv_amt, now in system currency = 91.57- Tax_amt, not update as no tax entered.- Ten99_amt, not update as no amt entered.- Druno, updated with current druno- Expert_Invoice_Status, update to 'O'- Invoice_Status, update to 'O'- Last_modified || Step 5: Disb entry updated.CDT_DISB- WIP_Status, updated to 'W'.- Post_Date,updated with posting date.- Latest_period, updated with current period.- Base_amt, now in system currency = 91.57.- Tobill_amt, now in system currency = 91.57.- Std_amt, now in system currency = 91.57.- Taxable, update and default from CDL_COST.TAX_OUT- Offc, default depended on CDM_PARMS.INCOME_OFFC_ONE and RATE_ONCOME_OFFC_TWO- Dept, default depended on CDM_PARMS.INCOME_DEPT_ONE and RATE_ONCOME_DEPT_TWO- Prof, default depended on CDM_PARMS.INCOME_PROF_ONE and RATE_ONCOME_PROF_TWO- Druno, update with current druno.- Period, update with current period.- Entry_Amt, now in system currency = 91.57. (This field is consume by Expenses only so we will change it)- Expert_Disb_Status, update to 'W'- Last_Modified || Step 6: Transaction Entry updated.ACT_TRAN- Trans_Period , updated with current period- Trans_Post_Date, update with posting date- Author_Empl_uno, updated with employee initated the post.- Last_modified || Step 7: Invoice Session updated.APS_INVOICE_Z- Status, now as Posted 'P'- Last_modified || Step 8: Vendor Year updated (insert a new line if vendor don't have an existing record for that fiscal year)APH_VENDOR_YEAR- AP_net_amt = previous amt + invoice amount in system currency (91.57)- Invoice_Amt = previous amt + invoice amount in system currency (91.57)- Invoice_count = previous count + 1 - Last_inv_date = if last invoice date less than its posting date, then this column populated with posting date (trans_post_date). Else use last invoice date. || Step 9: Vendor Summary updated (insert a new line if vendor don't have an existing record in the table)APH_VENDOR_SUMM- AP_balance = previous balance + invoice amount in system currency (91.57) - Invoice_amt = previous amount + invoice amount in system currency (91.57)- Invoice_count = previous count + 1- Last_inv_date = if last invoice date less than its posting date, then this column populated with posting date (trans_post_date). Else use last invoice date. || Step 10: Disbursement Summary Updated (insert a new line if vendor don't have an existing record in the table)CDH_SUMMARY_GL- Base_New = previous amount + disbursement amount (91.57)- Tobill_new = previous amount + disbursement amount (91.57)- Last Modified || Step 11: Matter Summary updated (insert a new line if matter don't have an existing record in the table)TBH_MATTER_SUMM- Hard_TOT = Previous amount + disbursement amount (91.57)- Hard_Count = Previous count + 1- Hard_WIP_Balance = previous amount + disbursement amount (91.57)- Last_modified || Step 12: New APT_INVOICE_AMT entry created, - Amount fields will be in system currency.- Tran_Type = AP.- Period = current period.- Sign = 1.- Druno = Current Druno.- TC_Code = Invoice Currency (CAD) || Step 13: New CDT_DISB_NEW entry created- Should have identical values as CDT_DISB.- Type = 'N' (New)

Title: Payment - EB: Recreate bank file using docudraft
Area: ExpertSuite\Financials\Accounts Payable\Payments\Payment Create Electronic Bank File
Steps: Step 1: Pre req dataEB Payments- Different statuses R,O and M- Different vendors and Same vendors- Same bank- Different payment types- Bank files have been createdNote: To get reconciles payments, set the auto reconcile on UPDATE APM_PARMS SET AUTO_RECONCILE_WIRE ='Y' || Step 2: Process all the paymentsNote: Auto reconcile will need to be on at this point to enable the ribbon button1. Select the payments2. Select Recreate Bank fileCreate bank File list of payments3. Select Create File | Expected: Files created- 1 file per bank/payment type- files created from templates as set in TBM_FMT_EBF- saved to the path as set in HBA_BANK_PAYTYP - file names created based on the values set in HBA_BANK_PAYTYP - file number generated from unique keys TBNAME = _TBM_BANK_<payment type code>.<bank code>Bug 206560 - EB: Last_Modified is not updated for bank file last key in CMS_UNIQUE_KEYSSELECT*FROM CMS_UNIQUE_KEYS WHERE TBNAME like'_TBM_BANK_%'SELECT bs.BANKING_SYSTEM_CODE,pt.PAYTYP_CODE,ptlink.BANK_CODE,ptlink.CH_FMT,f.FILENAME,ptlink.FILE_PREFIX,ptlink.FILE_SUFFIX,ptlink.FILE_PATHFROM HBL_BANK_PAYTYP ptJOIN HBL_BANKING_SYSTEM bs ON pt.BANKING_SYSTEM_UNO = bs.BANKING_SYSTEM_UNOLEFT JOIN HBA_BANK_PAYTYP ptlink ON pt.PAYTYP_CODE = ptlink.PAYTYP_CODE LEFT JOIN TBM_FMT_EBF f ON ptlink.CH_FMT = f.FORMAT_CODEORDER BY BANKING_SYSTEM_CODEAudit records created- audit record created in APT_CHECK_EBTRAN for each payment processedSELECT * FROM APT_CHECK_EBTRANPayment record updated- fields updated in APT_CHECKSELECT EB_LAST_DATE,EB_SENT,LAST_EB_FILE,*FROM APT_CHECK WHERE REQUEST_NUM IN ()

APT_INVOICE- Latest_period, updated with current period.- Latest_Date, updated with posting date.- Period, updated with current period- Balance, now in system currency = 100- Original_amt, now in system currency = 100- Inv_amt, now in system currency = 100- Tax_amt, not update as no tax entered.- Ten99_amt, not update as no amt entered.- Druno, updated with current druno- Expert_Invoice_Status, update to 'O'- Invoice_Status, update to 'O'- Last_modified || Step 6: Disb entry updated.CDT_DISB- WIP_Status, updated to 'W'.- Post_Date,updated with posting date.- Latest_period, updated with current period.- Base_amt, now in system currency = 100- Tobill_amt, now in system currency = 100- Std_amt, now in system currency = 100- Taxable, update and default from CDL_COST.TAX_OUT- Offc, default depended on CDM_PARMS.INCOME_OFFC_ONE and RATE_ONCOME_OFFC_TWO- Dept, default depended on CDM_PARMS.INCOME_DEPT_ONE and RATE_ONCOME_DEPT_TWO- Prof, default depended on CDM_PARMS.INCOME_PROF_ONE and RATE_ONCOME_PROF_TWO- Druno, update with current druno.- Period, update with current period.- Entry_Amt, remain zero - Expert_Disb_Status, update to 'W'- Last_Modified | Expected: Bug 181108: Accounting Journal Transactions and Disbursements should not reference or populate Entry Amount || Step 7: Transaction Entry updated.ACT_TRAN- Trans_Period , updated with current period- Trans_Post_Date, update with posting date- Author_Empl_uno, updated with employee initated the post.- Last_modified || Step 8: Invoice Session updated.APS_INVOICE_Z- Status, now as Posted 'P'- Last_modified || Step 9: Vendor Year updated (insert a new line if vendor don't have an existing record for that fiscal year)APH_VENDOR_YEAR- AP_net_amt = previous amt + invoice amount (100)- Invoice_Amt = previous amt + invoice amount (100)- Invoice_count = previous count + 1 - Last_inv_date = if last invoice date less than its posting date, then this column populated with posting date (trans_post_date). Else use last invoice date. || Step 10: Vendor Summary updated (insert a new line if vendor don't have an existing record in the table)APH_VENDOR_SUMM- AP_balance = previous balance + invoice amount (100)- Invoice_amt = previous amount + invoice amount (100)- Invoice_count = previous count + 1- Last_inv_date = if last invoice date less than its posting date, then this column populated with posting date (trans_post_date). Else use last invoice date. || Step 11: Disbursement Summary Updated (insert a new line if vendor don't have an existing record in the table)CDH_SUMMARY_GL- Base_New = previous amount + disbursement amount (100)- Tobill_new = previous amount + disbursement amount (100)- Last Modified || Step 12: Matter Summary updated (insert a new line if matter don't have an existing record in the table)TBH_MATTER_SUMM- Hard_TOT = Previous amount + disbursement amount (100)- Hard_Count = Previous count + 1- Hard_WIP_Balance = previous amount + disbursement amount (100)- Last_modified || Step 13: New APT_INVOICE_AMT entry created, - Amount fields will be in system currency.- Tran_Type = AP.- Period = current period.- Sign = 1.- Druno = Current Druno.- TC_Code = Invoice Currency || Step 14: New CDT_DISB_NEW entry created- Should have identical values as CDT_DISB.- Type = 'N' (New)

TBM_MATTER.ALLOW_DISB = 'S' (only allow soft) | Expected: DISBDETAIL_CM_NOAUTH_HARDError: This Client/Matter combination is not authorized to have Hard DisbursementsEntry validation too || Step 4: Validate Hard/Soft Matter 2When Matter doesn't allow Soft. | Expected: Not valid as we do not enter Soft in AP || Step 5: Validate Hard/Soft Matter 3When matter do not allow disbursement. | Expected: Throw DISBDETAIL_CM_NOAUTHDISBError: This Client/Matter combination is not authorized to have Disbursements || Step 6: Validate Matter InactiveWhen matter is inactive | Expected: Throw DISBDETAIL_CM_INACTIVEError: This Client/Matter combination is inactiveBug: 206431 - Disbursement and Recurring Invoice Disbursements - Missing client side inactive matter validation || Step 7: Validate Client Entity TypeWhen client entity type is not C or F | Expected: Throw DISBDETAIL_CM_INACTIVEError: This Client/Matter combination is inactive || Step 8: Validate Authorization EmployeeWhen not using the authorize employee being setup | Expected: Throw DISBDETAIL_AU_NOAUTHError: The AUTHORIZING EMPLOYEE is not allowed to authorize this CLIENT or MATTEREntry validation too || Step 9: Validate Phase Task MatterWhen matter has task plan and phase/task not selectedWhen selected phase/task is not valid for matter plan code | Expected: Throw WESSTUFF_PHUNO_REQUIRED Error: A task plan code exists for this matter so a Phase/Task code is required.Throw WESTUFF_NOVALIDATE Error: Could not validate Phase.Task || Step 10: Validate Disbursement Code allowedSelect allowed Disubursement codes in Entity Manager under Vendor tabMake new invoice using the vendor that has limited disbursement codesMake a new disbursment detail line In Enitity Manager, remove the disbursement code that you used in the invoiceResave the invoice in AP | Expected: Throws DISBURSEMENTAVAILABLE Error: The Disbursement Type [disbursement_code] is not available for this vendor || Step 11: Validate Prebill Comments and Narrative FieldsEnsure that spellcheck and expansion codes work | Expected: Bug: 206384 - Inline editing of narrative fields - Expansion codes and spellcheck not working || Step 12: When Client Matter is Nonbillable1. Appshell> Matter Management> Time and Billing> Disbs> Disb Class | Expected: Disbursement is still valid but Bill Amount is disabled and set to 0

Title: Payment Items - Disbursement: Anticpated matching exact amount
Steps: Step 1: Note: the prebills need to be created in classic until expert billing has been enhanced for anticipated disbs || Step 2: Pre req Disbursement Cost Code (Type) - Auto Match on Anticipate Item e.g. ANT- Allows hard disb- Threshold = not set || Step 3: Multiple billed disbs that are a potential exact match1. Create a prebill- currency = USD2. Add an anticipated disbursement 1- HardSoft = Hard- Costcode = ANT- Matter- Office- Vendor- Amount = $103. Add an anticpated disbursement 2- HardSoft = Hard- Costcode = ANT- Matter = same as disb 1- Office - Vendor = same as disb 1- Amount = $104. Prep and post the bill5. Create a payment- vendor is same as prebill disbs- Currency = USD- amount = $106. Add a disb- Matter = same as bill disbs- amount = $107. Post the payment | Expected: Payment's disb is matched - Aniticpated disb 1 is matched with the payment disb- Aniticpated disb 2 is not matched--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- Anticpated Disbs/*- Set up disb cost code to allow Auto match (they can allow no matching, auto match or manual match)- For auto match you can set a threshold. 0 will be exact match. 90 will match within 90% either way- Create a bill with a disb that uses a cost code with auto match and post that bill. Source type = AD and only has BILLED_AMT- Create an invoice or payment and add a disb for the same vendor/matter/currency/amount/costcode/hardsoft (we only used hard in AP)   office? and post the invoice- Status was N but now (if matched status = M)- Should now be 3 rows in CDT_DISB?- If fully matched CDT_DISB_ANTIC.DISB_BALANCE will be zero (might just be zero anyway for an auto?)- If manual match and not fully matched but closed was checked on manual match form then CDT_DISB_ANTIC.DISB_BALANCE will be zero- If manual match and not fully matched and closed not checked on manual match form then CDT_DISB_ANTIC.DISB_BALANCE will not be zero and another disb created for the remainder to be billed */------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------ Declarations---------------------------------------------------------------------------------DECLARE @paydisb as int = 3510 --Payment disbDECLARE @vendor as varchar(100) = 'tst1'DECLARE @matteruno as int = (SELECT MATTER_UNO FROM CDT_DISB WHERE DISB_UNO =  @paydisb)DECLARE @currency as varchar (20) = (SELECT CURRENCY_CODE FROM CDT_DISB WHERE DISB_UNO =  @paydisb)DECLARE @billdisb as int = (SELECT DISTINCT ANTIC_DISB_NUM FROM CDT_DISB_ANTIC WHERE MATCH_DISB_UNO = @paydisb)DECLARE @period as int = (SELECT PERIOD FROM CDT_DISB WHERE DISB_UNO =  @paydisb)DECLARE @hardsoft as varchar (5) = (SELECT HARDSOFT FROM CDT_DISB WHERE DISB_UNO = @paydisb)DECLARE @costcode as varchar (5) = (SELECT COST_CODE FROM CDT_DISB WHERE DISB_UNO = @paydisb)DECLARE @wip as varchar (5) = (SELECT WIP_STATUS FROM CDT_DISB WHERE DISB_UNO = @paydisb)DECLARE @vendoruno as int = (SELECT VENDOR_UNO FROM APM_VENDOR WHERE VENDOR_ID = @vendor)DECLARE @clientuno as int = (SELECT CLIENT_UNO FROM HBM_MATTER WHERE MATTER_UNO = @matteruno)--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- Cost Codes-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------SELECT COST_CODE, COST_DESC,ANTICIPATE_ITEM,MARKUP_BASE,INEMP_REQD ,HAS_UNIT_RATE,ALLOW_BASE_EDIT,MATCH_THRESHOLD--,*FROM CDL_COST cc WHERE INACTIVE!='Y'--AND ALLOW_HARD='Y'AND ANTICIPATE_ITEM = 'A' -- A,M,NORDER BY cc.COST_CODE--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- Disbs-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------SELECT @paydisb[Payment Disb],@billdisb [Matched Anticipated Bill Disb],@costcode[cost code],@matteruno[matter uno],@vendoruno[vendor uno],@currency[currency],(SELECT TOBILL_AMT FROM CDT_DISB WHERE DISB_UNO =  @paydisb)[To bill amount],@period[period],@wip[WIP Status],@hardsoft[disb type],@vendor[vendor], @clientuno [client uno],(SELECT BASE_AMT FROM CDT_DISB WHERE DISB_UNO =  @paydisb)[Base amount]--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- Possible matches-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------SELECT ''[Possible matches],ad.ROW_UNO,ad.ANTIC_DISB_NUM,ad.DISB_UNO,d.COST_CODE,d.MATTER_UNO,ad.VENDOR_UNO,d.CURRENCY_CODE,d.BILLED_AMT,d.BILL_TRAN_UNO,ad.DISB_AMT,ad.MATCH_AMT,ad.DISB_BALANCE,ad.PERIOD[Ant Period],d.WIP_STATUS,d.HARDSOFT,ad.STATUS[Ant Status],ad.REVERSED[Ant Reversed],ad.MATCH_DISB_UNO,d.DISB_REF,ad.LAST_MODIFIED--FROM CDT_DISB d--JOIN CDT_DISB_ANTIC ad ON d.DISB_UNO = ad.ANTIC_DISB_NUM AND STATUS = 'N'FROM CDT_DISB_ANTIC adJOIN CDT_DISB d ON d.DISB_UNO = ad.ANTIC_DISB_NUM AND STATUS = 'N'WHERE WIP_STATUS = 'B'AND d.HARDSOFT = 'H'AND ad.STATUS = 'N'AND ad.VENDOR_UNO = @vendorunoAND d.MATTER_UNO = @matterunoAND d.CURRENCY_CODE = @currencyAND d.COST_CODE = @costcode----------------------------------------------------------------------------------- CDT_DISB_ANTIC created on post bill and matched on post payment---------------------------------------------------------------------------------SELECT ''[CDT_DISB_ANTIC],ROW_UNO,ANTIC_DISB_NUM,DISB_UNO,MATCH_DISB_UNO,STATUS,REVERSED,HEADER,SOURCE_TRAN_TYP,SOURCE_TRAN_UNO,VENDOR_UNO,DISB_AMT,MATCH_AMT,DISB_BALANCE,PERIOD,HEADER,GL_AUDIT_NUM,LAST_MODIFIED,* FROM CDT_DISB_ANTIC ad--WHERE MATCH_DISB_UNO = @paydisbWHERE ANTIC_DISB_NUM = @billdisbORDER BY ad.ANTIC_DISB_NUM desc, ad.ROW_UNO desc----------------------------------------------------------------------------------- CDT_DISB---------------------------------------------------------------------------------SELECT ''[Disbs and contra entries],d.DISB_UNO,d.DISB_REF,d.WIP_STATUS,d.ACTIVITY_COUNT,d.SOURCE_TRAN_TYP,d.SOURCE_TRAN_UNO,d.COST_CODE,d.HARDSOFT,d.BILL_TRAN_UNO,d.CURRENCY_CODE,d.BILLED_AMT,d.TOBILL_AMT,--d.BASE_AMT,PERIOD,DRUNO,MERGE_DISB_UNO--,*FROM CDT_DISB d--JOIN CDT_DISB_ANTIC ad ON ANTIC_DISB_NUM = @billdisbWHERE DISB_UNO IN (SELECT DISB_UNO FROM CDT_DISB_ANTIC WHERE ANTIC_DISB_NUM = @billdisb)OR DISB_UNO = @paydisbORDER BY DISB_UNO desc----------------------------------------------------------------------------------- CDT_DISB_NEW---------------------------------------------------------------------------------SELECT ''[CDT_DISB_NEW],TYPE,* from CDT_DISB_NEW WHERE DISB_UNO IN (SELECT DISB_UNO FROM CDT_DISB_ANTIC WHERE ANTIC_DISB_NUM = @billdisb)OR DISB_UNO = @paydisbORDER BY DISB_UNO desc----------------------------------------------------------------------------------- CDT_DISB_MOD---------------------------------------------------------------------------------SELECT ''[CDT_DISB_MOD],d.DISB_UNO,d.SOURCE_TRAN_TYP,d.SOURCE_TRAN_UNO,TYPE,BASE_AMT_VAR,TOBILL_AMT_VAR,STD_AMT_VAR,d.COST_CODE,d.HARDSOFT,PERIOD,DRUNO,d.*FROM CDT_DISB_MOD d--JOIN CDT_DISB_ANTIC ad ON ANTIC_DISB_NUM = @billdisbWHERE DISB_UNO  IN (SELECT DISB_UNO FROM CDT_DISB_ANTIC WHERE ANTIC_DISB_NUM = @billdisb)OR DISB_UNO = @paydisbORDER BY d.DISB_UNO desc----------------------------------------------------------------------------------- Summaries---------------------------------------------------------------------------------SELECT ''[CDH_SUMMARY_GL],BASE_BIL ,BASE_NEW ,TOBILL_NEW,BASE_MOD,*FROM CDH_SUMMARY_GL WHERE MATTER_UNO = @matteruno AND COST_CODE = @costcode and PERIOD = @periodSELECT ''[TBH_MATTER_SUMM],BILLED_HARD,ARBAL_TOTAL,LAST_BLTRAN_UNO,HARD_TOT,HARD_COUNT, * FROM TBH_MATTER_SUMM WHERE MATTER_UNO = @matteruno----------------------------------------------------------------------------------- Misc---------------------------------------------------------------------------------/*SELECT ''[CDT_DISB],* FROM CDT_DISB ORDER BY DISB_UNO descSELECT ''[CDT_DISB_NEW],* FROM CDT_DISB_NEW ORDER BY DISB_UNO descSELECT ''[CDT_DISB_MOD],* FROM CDT_DISB_MOD ORDER BY DISB_UNO descSELECT ''[CDT_DISB_BIL],* FROM CDT_DISB_BIL ORDER BY DISB_UNO desc --(created on post bill)SELECT ''[CDT_DISB_ANTIC], ROW_UNO,ANTIC_DISB_NUM,DISB_UNO,MATCH_DISB_UNO,STATUS,REVERSED,HEADER,SOURCE_TRAN_TYP,SOURCE_TRAN_UNO,VENDOR_UNO,DISB_AMT,MATCH_AMT,DISB_BALANCE,PERIOD,HEADER,GL_AUDIT_NUM,LAST_MODIFIEDFROM CDT_DISB_ANTIC adORDER BY ad. ANTIC_DISB_NUM desc, ad.DISB_UNO desc --(created on post bill and matched on post payment)*//*SELECT DISB_UNO,TOBILL_AMT, BILLED_AMT, CURRENCY_CODE,MATTER_UNO,COST_CODE,SOURCE_TRAN_TYP,WIP_STATUS,* FROM CDT_DISB d order by d.disb_uno descSELECT ROW_UNO,ANTIC_DISB_NUM,DISB_UNO,MATCH_DISB_UNO,DISB_AMT,DISB_BALANCE,MATCH_AMT,* FROM CDT_DISB_ANTIC ad order by ad.row_uno desc*/ || Step 4: Billed disb is soft1. Create a prebill- currency = USD2. Add an anticipated disbursement - HardSoft = SOFT- Costcode = ANT- Matter- Vendor- Amount = $104. Prep and post the bill5. Create a payment- vendor is same as prebill disbs- Currency = USD- amount = $106. Add a disb- Matter = same as bill disb- amount = $107. Post the payment | Expected: Payment's disb is not matched || Step 5: Matter is not the same1. Create a prebill- currency = USD2. Add an anticipated disbursement - HardSoft = HARD- Costcode = ANT- Matter- Vendor- Amount = $104. Prep and post the bill5. Create a payment- vendor = same as prebill disbs- Currency = USD- amount = $106. Add a disb- Matter = not same as bill disb- amount = $107. Post the payment | Expected: Payment's disb is not matched || Step 6: Vendor is not the same1. Create a prebill- currency = USD2. Add an anticipated disbursement - HardSoft = HARD- Costcode = ANT- Matter- Vendor - Amount = $104. Prep and post the bill5. Create a payment- vendor = not the same as bill disb - Currency = USD- amount = $106. Add a disb- Matter = same as bill disb- amount = $107. Post the payment | Expected: Payment's disb is not matched || Step 7: Currency is not the same1. Create a prebill- currency = USD2. Add an anticipated disbursement - HardSoft = HARD- Costcode = ANT- Matter- Vendor- Amount = $104. Prep and post the bill5. Create a payment- vendor = same as bill disb- Currency = CAD- amount = C$106. Add a disb- Matter = same as bill disb- amount = C$107. Post the payment | Expected: Payment's disb is not matched

not an issue as can't process the expert payment in classic || Step 3: Post the payment | Expected: Payment posted APT_CHECK (updated) ENTRY_STATUS = REXPERT_PAYMENT_STATUS = OSOURCE = MREVERSAL = NPAYEE_TYPE = VDOCUMENT_TYPE = WWIRE_NUM = as enteredBANK_ACCOUNT_UNO = 0PERIOD = latest periodDRUNO = current drunoTC_CODE = USDTC_CHK_AMT = 100CURRENCY_CODE = USDORIGINAL_AMT = 0CHK_AMT = 100.00 (system currency)TEN99_AMT = 100.00 (system currency)SALES_USE_TAX = 100.00 (system currency)TAX_AMT = 0 || Step 4: Cancel the payment- today as transaction date- comments | Expected: Payment canceled  APT_CHECK (updated) ENTRY_STATUS = REXPERT_PAYMENT_STATUS = XSOURCE = MREVERSAL = NPAYEE_TYPE = VDOCUMENT_TYPE = WWIRE_NUM = as enteredBANK_ACCOUNT_UNO = 0PERIOD = latest periodDRUNO = current drunoTC_CODE = USDTC_CHK_AMT = 100CURRENCY_CODE = USDORIGINAL_AMT = 0CHK_AMT = 100.00 (system currency)TEN99_AMT = 100.00 (system currency)SALES_USE_TAX = 100.00 (system currency)TAX_AMT = 0 APT_CHECK  for contra entry created with same REQUEST_NUM ENTRY_STATUS = REXPERT_PAYMENT_STATUS = MSOURCE = MREVERSAL = YPAYEE_TYPE = VDOCUMENT_TYPE = WWIRE_NUM = copied from originalBANK_ACCOUNT_UNO = 0 PERIOD = latest periodDRUNO = current drunoTC_CODE = USDTC_CHK_AMT = -100CURRENCY_CODE = USDORIGINAL_AMT = 0CHK_AMT = -100.00 (system currency)TEN99_AMT = -100.00 (system currency)SALES_USE_TAX = -100.00 (system currency)TAX_AMT = 0

Steps: Step 1: Setup projects | Expected: Recurring invoice data saved in APM_RECINV_DISB table || Step 2: Note You also need to do Invoices disbursement validation as the code is different. || Step 3: Data pre reqs Projects is onSELECT USE_PROJ_ACC,*FROM TBM_PARMSUPDATE TBM_PARMS SET USE_PROJ_ACC ='Y' Generate narrative text is onSELECT GEN_DISB_TEXT,*FROM APM_PARMSUPDATE APM_PARMS SET GEN_DISB_TEXT ='Y' Min/max dates are setSELECT MIN_DATE,MAX_DATE,*FROM CDM_Parms || Step 4: Add disb 1, cost code does not have a unit rate1. Create a recurring invoice2. Add a disb- e.g. code = HDISB- enter all fields3. Save & Add SELECT COST_CODE, COST_DESC,MARKUP_BASE,INEMP_REQD ,HAS_UNIT_RATE,*FROM CDL_COST cc WHERE INACTIVE!='Y'AND ALLOW_HARD='Y'ORDERBY cc.COST_CODE | Expected: Disb saved* Project Field visible (due to projects in use field on)* Disb saved with all fields that were entered* Disb form reset for new || Step 5: Add disb 2, cost code does have a unit rate1. Create a Recurring invoice2. Add a disb- e.g. code = COPY- enter all fields3. Save & Add  SELECT dr.COST_CODE,RATE_LEVEL,GROUP_TYPE,ALLOW_HARD,ALLOW_SOFT,dr.OFFC,CASE WHEN dr.CLIENT_UNO <> 0 THEN c.CLIENT_CODE + ': ' + c.CLIENT_NAME + ' (' + CAST(c.CLIENT_UNO AS nvarchar) + ')' ELSE '' END[Client], CASEWHEN dr.MATTER_UNO <> 0 THEN m.MATTER_CODE +': '+ m.MATTER_NAME +' ('+CAST(m.MATTER_UNO ASnvarchar)+')'ELSE''END[Matter],CURRENCY_CODE,UNIT_COST,EFF_DATE,UNIT_COST_2,UNIT_COST_3,UNIT_COST_4,UNIT_COST_5,THRESHOLD_1,THRESHOLD_2,THRESHOLD_3,THRESHOLD_4,INEMP_REQD,ALLOW_BASE_EDIT,dr.ROW_UNO,dr.* FROM TBM_RATE_DISB drJOIN CDL_COST cc ON dr.COST_CODE = cc.COST_CODELEFTJOIN HBM_CLIENT c ON dr.CLIENT_UNO = c.CLIENT_UNOLEFTJOIN HBM_MATTER m ON dr.MATTER_UNO = m.MATTER_UNO | Expected: Disb saved* When code entered, the base and bill amounts are populated*Auto Calculation checked when code entered* Project Field visible (due to projects in use field on)* Disb saved with all fields that were entered* Disb form reset for new || Step 6: Edit disb 11. Change disb code to one that has a rate- disb code = COPY2. Change other fields (not quantity base or bill amounts)3. Save & Add | Expected: Disb updated* Base and bill amounts updated due to cost code has a rate and Auto Calculation checked.* Other fields are updated as per edits || Step 7: Delete Disb | Expected: Disb deletedAPM_RECINV_DISB  Recurring Invoice updatedRemaining balance

Title: Recurring Invoice: Security roles

P1s are considered as in the admin group and most users will be p0. || Step 2: RecurringInvoices1. Security not checked2. Security checked | Expected: 1. No Recurring Invoices tab2. Recurring Invoices tab present and accessible* Only Open and Export buttons enabled when recurring invoice is selected.* Able to search and open recurring invoices but they are not editable. || Step 3: Create Recurring Invoice1. Security not checked2. Security checked | Expected: Note: Recurring Invoices security permission needs to be checked as it is a level higher1. Not able to create or edit recurring invoice templates* New Recurring Invoice and Delete buttons disabled.* Able to search and open recurring invoices but they are not editable.2. Able to create and edit recurring invoice templates* New Recurring Invoice and Delete buttons enabled.* Able to search, open and edit recurring invoices. || Step 4: GenerateRecurringInvoice1. Security not checked2. Security checked | Expected: Note: Recurring Invoices security permission needs to be checked as it is a level higher 1. Cannot generate recurring invoice from list and entry* Generate Next Invoice button disabled.* Able to search and open recurring invoices but they are not editable unless you have Create Recurring Invoice permission.2. Can generate recurring invoice from list and entry* Generate Next Invoice button enabled when Generation Method is not Do Not Generate (H) and no errors.* Able to search and open recurring invoices but they are not editable.
