Title: Payment Items - Employee Advance: Post/Cancel and reconcile summary tables
Steps: Step 1: System pre reqs* Expenses is deployed* Expense licence imported* Expense workflows imported* Workflow approvals are turned off - Admin | Expenses | Employee Advance Workflow Options - Admin | Expenses | Expense Workflow Options* Employee's office has an Expenses AP Type - Admin | Hub Setup | Firm Setup | Offices || Step 2: Data pre reqsCAD RatesRate: 1.092007784100000Reciprocal: 0.915744388053213Employee Advance- CAD cur- Approved- Amount = $100 | Expected: APT_ADVANCEAMOUNT= 100.00 (transaction currency)ADV_BALANCE= NULLTC_AMOUNT= 100.00 (transaction currency)CURRENCY_CODE = CADADV_STATUS = ASCHEDULE_NUM = 0Note: Unlike other credit items, creating an advance does not create a credit row in APT_ADVANCE_AMT. This is not created until the advance has been applied to payment, the payment posted then the advance applied to an expense.DECLARE @advance asvarchar (100)='7'DECLARE @emplcode asvarchar (50)='NZ29'DECLARE @employee asint= (SELECT EMPL_UNO FROM HBM_PERSNL WHERE EMPLOYEE_CODE = @emplcode)----------------------------------------------------------------------------------- Advance ---------------------------------------------------------------------------------SELECT''[APT_ADVANCE],adv.ADV_UNO,adv.SCHEDULE_NUM,adv.ADV_STATUS,adv.AMOUNT,adv.ADV_BALANCE,TC_AMOUNT,DRUNO,PERIOD,adv.CURRENCY_CODE,* FROM APT_ADVANCE advWHERE ADV_UNO = @advance----------------------------------------------------------------------------------- Advance Amount ---------------------------------------------------------------------------------SELECT''[APT_ADVANCE_AMT],ROW_UNO,ADV_UNO,SOURCE_TRAN_UNO,SIGN,AMOUNT,TC_AMT,TC_CODE,DRUNO,PERIOD,LAST_MODIFIED,* FROM APT_ADVANCE_AMT advaWHERE ADV_UNO = @advanceORDER BY adva.ROW_UNO ----------------------------------------------------------------------------------- Summary tables---------------------------------------------------------------------------------SELECT''[APH_PERSNL_SUMM],*FROM APH_PERSNL_SUMM WHERE EMPL_UNO = @employeeSELECT''[APH_PERSNL_YEAR],*FROM APH_PERSNL_YEAR WHERE EMPL_UNO = @employee || Step 3: Query the summary tables for the employeeDECLARE @emplcode asvarchar (50)=''DECLARE @employee asint= (SELECT EMPL_UNO FROM HBM_PERSNL WHERE EMPLOYEE_CODE = @emplcode)SELECT''[APH_PERSNL_SUMM],ADVANCE_COUNT,ADVANCE_AMT,ADVANCE_BALANCE,ADV_PAID_BY_CASH_AMT,ADV_PAID_BY_CHECK_AMT,ADV_REFUND_AMT,ADV_ALLOCATED_AMT,LAST_ADVANCE_DATE,LAST_ADV_CHECK_DATE,*FROM APH_PERSNL_SUMM WHERE EMPL_UNO = @employeeSELECT''[APH_PERSNL_YEAR],ADVANCE_COUNT,ADVANCE_AMT,ADVANCE_BALANCE,ADV_PAID_BY_CASH_AMT,ADV_PAID_BY_CHECK_AMT,ADV_REFUND_AMT,ADV_ALLOCATED_AMT,LAST_ADVANCE_DATE,LAST_ADV_CHECK_DATE,*FROM savedAPT_ADVANCE AMOUNT= 100.00 (transaction currency)ADV_BALANCE= NULLTC_AMOUNT= 100.00 (transaction currency)CURRENCY_CODE = CADAPT_ADVANCE_AMT AMOUNT = 100.00 (transaction currency)SIGN = -1TC_AMT Employee field enabled and remain defaulted to the value before. || Step 13: Office entered or changed || Step 14: Validate Interbook SubledgerSetup interbook to point to a subledger account by hijacking GLA_ACCT_INTERBOOK. The book pointed to must have the same office as same account to be enter in office. eg, Both book has the same Office - TLHIn Expert, create GL details and put in the account number which you set.Choose the office other than TLH. then Change to TLH. | Expected: When switching office to TLH, Department and Profit Center data provider will show as error.If manages to save before Saves disabled, the status column will show XPNS_SUBLEDGER_DEST_ACCT || Step 15: Employee Code entered or changedWhen using Employee Default When selected account DO NOT required a department. When selected account DO NOT required a profit center. | Expected: Changing employee will change the Office, Department and Profit center of the new
selected Employee only if these fields are empty. Not changing the Department field. Will disabled and default to parms. Not changing the Profit Center field. Will disabled and default to parms. || Step 16: Department Code changedMust have link in GLA_ACCT_DEPT | Expected: Validation error on this field, complaining Office, Dept and Account || Step 17: Profit Center code changedMust have link in GLA_ACCT_PROF | Expected: Validation error on this field, complaining Office, Prof and Account || Step 18: Debit changed | Expected: Not Applicable || Step 19: Credit changed | Expected: Not Applicable

Title: Payment - Cancel to New: Expense report
Steps: Step 1: Note: Testing of the cancel part of the payment is covered by the cancel test cases. Here, we need to reconcile the New part of the process as New payment would normally be done via the UI so we need to ensure that the creation of the New payment via code has the same outcome || Step 2: System pre reqs* Expenses is deployed* Expense licence imported* Expense workflows imported* Workflow approvals are turned off - Admin | Expenses | Employee Advance Workflow Options - Admin | Expenses | Expense Workflow Options* Employee's office has an Expenses AP Type - Admin | Hub Setup | Firm Setup | Offices || Step 3: Pre preqsCAD RatesRate: 1.092007784100000Reciprocal: 0.915744388053213 || Step 4: Data pre reqsExpense report- CAD cur- Approved- Amount - C$100- Billable item (MEAL) C$70- Non Billable item (SUPP) C$30 | Expected: APT_INVOICEINV_AMT = 91.5744388053 (system currency)BALANCE = 91.5744388053 (system currency)ORIGINAL_AMT = 91.5744388053 (system currency)EXP_RPT_AMT = 91.5744388053 (system currency)EXP_RPT_BILLABLE_AMT = 64.1021071637 (system currency)EXP_RPT_NON_BILLABLE_AMT = 27.4723316416 (system currency)TC_INV_AMT = 100.00 (transaction currency)CURRENCY_CODE = CADTC_CODE = CADAPT_INVOICE_AMT (record 1)AP_AMT = 91.5744388053 (system currency)PAID_AMT = 0TC_AP_AMT = 100TC_PAID_AMT = 0TC_CODE = CADSIGN = 1TRAN_TYPE = APCDT_DISB for expense receipt 1BASE_AMT = 64.1021071637 (system currency)TOBILL_AMT = 64.1021071637 (system currency)STD_AMT = 64.1021071637 (system currency)HELD_BY_AP = NACT_TRAN_JE for expense receipt 2DEBIT = 27.4723316416(system currency)TAXABLE_AMT = 27.4723316416(system currency)TC_DEBIT = 30.00 (system currency) || Step 5: Create a payment with an employee expense item- Employee payment- Bank has same company as expense report- CAD Cur- C$100DECLARE @bank as varchar(100) = 'bcad' --bank to be used on payment--Employee/Invoice (their invoices will be the same)SELECT e.EMPLOYEE_NAME,o.COMPANY_CODE,e.LOGIN,e.EMPLOYEE_CODE,e.OFFC,o.EXP_APTYPE_CODE,apt.BANK_CODE--,* FROM HBM_PERSNL eLEFT JOIN HBL_OFFICE o ON e.OFFC = o.OFFC_CODELEFT JOIN APL_APTYPE apt ON o.EXP_APTYPE_CODE = apt.APTYPE_CODEORDER BY EMPLOYEE_NAME-- Bank's company and currencySELECT ''[Payment Bank],BANK_CODE,b.CURRENCY_CODE,b.OFFC,o.COMPANY_CODEFROM TBM_BANK bJOIN HBL_OFFICE o on b.OFFC = o.OFFC_CODEWHERE BANK_CODE = @bank | Expected: Payment created with employee expense reportAPT_INVOICE_AMT (record 2)AP_AMT = 100 (transaction currency)PAID_AMT = 100TC_AP_AMT = 100TC_PAID_AMT = 100TC_CODE = CADSIGN = -1TRAN_TYPE = CH || Step 6: Query the tables and copy results to spread sheetSELECT TOP(1)*FROM APT_INVOICE ORDER BY TRAN_UNO DESCSELECT TOP(2)*FROM APT_INVOICE_AMT ORDER BY ROW_UNO DESCSELECT TOP(1)*FROM ACT_TRAN_JE ORDER BY GL_ROW_UNO DESCSELECT TOP(1)*FROM CDT_DISB ORDER BY DISB_UNO DESCSELECT TOP(2)*FROM ACT_TRAN ORDER BY TRAN_UNO DESCSELECT TOP(1)*FROM ACT_TEXT ORDER BY TEXT_ID DESCUPDATE HBL_OFFICE SET EXP_APTYPE_CODE = 'INC', COMPANY_CODE = 'TOR' WHERE OFFC_CODE = 'TOR' || Step 7: Post the payment | Expected: Payment posted || Step 8: Cancel to New | Expected: Payment is canceled and New payment created- New Payment has employee expense item || Step 9: Reconcile tablesQuery tables and reconcile results from the original payment SELECT TOP(1)*FROM APT_INVOICE ORDER BY TRAN_UNO DESCSELECT TOP(4)*FROM APT_INVOICE_AMT ORDER BY ROW_UNO DESCSELECT TOP(1)*FROM ACT_TRAN_JE ORDER BY GL_ROW_UNO DESCSELECT TOP(1)*FROM CDT_DISB ORDER BY DISB_UNO DESCSELECT TOP(2)*FROM ACT_TRAN ORDER BY TRAN_UNO DESCSELECT TOP(1)*FROM ACT_TEXT ORDER BY TEXT_ID DESC | Expected: Tables and fields matchAPT_INVOICE- Last modified is updated- All other fields should be the sameAPT_INVOICE_AMT (record 1)UnchangedAPT_INVOICE_AMT (record Title: Recurring Invoices Item- Disbursement: Data Providers Validation
Steps: Step 1: Client/Matter | Expected: Search list. Return active matter || Step 2: Phase/Task | Expected: filter list. Return Phase/Task.Return Phase/Task associated to Plan Code only.Return all Phase/Task from TBL_PHTASK || Step 3: Disb Code | Expected: Required. Filter list.Return CDL_COST.ALLOW_HARD = 'Y'If vendor has limited Disb Codes in Entity Manager then the list will only show those allowed. If none are chosen then all are allowed.Can check which are allowed by which vendor with  select VENDOR_NAME, COST_CODE from APA_VENDOR_COST left join APM_VENDOR on APA_VENDOR_COST.VENDOR_UNO = APM_VENDOR.VENDOR_UNO || Step 4: Reference | Expected: Optional. Text boxallow up to 20 characters. || Step 5: Auto CalculationSelected Disb Code has no rateSelected Disb Code has fixed rateManually enter Bill/Base Amount | Expected: Flag. default to Checked.UncheckChecked. Amount field calculated automatically when enter QuantityUncheck even if it has been calculated before. || Step 6: Quantity | Expected: Numeric box, no default.Allow up to 4 decimal places.Bug 206422: Recurring Invoice Disbursements - Quantity field not limited to 10 digits in smartform || Step 7: Currency | Expected: Default to Invoice Currency and disabled. || Step 8: Base Amount | Expected: Numeric box. Allow up to 2 decimal pointspopulate automatically when using disb code with unit rate (subject to currency) || Step 9: Bill Amount | Expected: Numeric box. Allow up to 2 decimal points.Default from Base Amount but can be modified. (subject to disbursement type set up) || Step 10: Office | Expected: Filter list. Required field with no default || Step 11: Employee | Expected: Search list. Return all active employee. Required when CDL_COST_INEMP_REQD = 'Y' || Step 12: Authorized By | Expected: Search list. Return all active employeeRequired when CDL_COST.AUEMP_REQD = 'Y' || Step 13: Location | Expected: Filter list. If have value on CDL_COST_LOC, will default to it when empty. || Step 14: Project | Expected: Optional, display when TBM_Parms.Use_Proj_Acc is set to 'Y' || Step 15: Jurisdiction | Expected: Default from Reccuring Invoice. Required || Step 16: Narrative | Expected: Text field. Allows unicode.15000 limitNot required. Can edit. Store in APM_Text with linking text ID || Step 17: Prebill Comment | Expected: Text field. Allows unicode. No default. Also saved to APM_text with linking text ID

Title: Recurring Invoice Item- Disbursement: Editing Values Validation
Steps: Step 1: Office Code Found in Classic>Client Disbursement> Disbursement Types> Location radio button. | Expected: Change location based on office default if empty || Step 2: Disb Code | Expected: If cost code has unit rates, recalculate the disb. Employee and Authorized Employee field will mark as Required depending if incurring or authorizing employee is required || Step 3: Matter | Expected: When matter is not billable, set billable_flag = N. Bill Amount field disabled. || Step 4: Employee | Expected: set BL_EMPL_UNO = DI_EMPL_UNO. (Not applicable for editing employee --> this will be set on invoice generation) || Step 5: Currency Code | Expected: Disabled, cannot change currency in disb || Step 6: Phase/Task Code | Expected: determine if phase/task is valid / if in matter plan || Step 7: Auto Calc change | Expected: recalculate the disb amount || Step 8: Authorize Employee | Expected: validate authorising employee || Step 9: Quantity | Expected: recalculate the disb amount || Step 10: Amount | Expected: auto calculate flag uncheck. ST_Amt to set to Base_amount. || Step 11: Bill Amount | Expected: Auto calc flag uncheck.

Title: Recurring Invoices Item- Disbursement: Entering Disbursement with unit rates
Steps: Step 1: Setup Unit RateClassic > Client Disbursement > Setup > Disbursement SetupMake sure to check the 'Has Unit Rate' flag.In Detail section, add Rates.Fill in the required field and the Unit Rates threshold.usd100 for first 10 units, usd 50 for next 5 unites, 20 for 2, 10 for 1, 0.5 for the rest. || Step 2: Open Expert AP > Recurring Invoice > Disbursement card. || Step 3: Ensure Auto Calculation flag is checked. || Step 4: Select Disb Code that you setup in Step 1. || Step 5: Put in Quantity = 50 | Expected: Base and Bill Amount default to USD 1316 || Step 6: Change Quantity | Expected: Base and Bill Amount wil default to new amount || Step 7: Delete existing set and set another set of rates which effective date is in future. Create a disb with today's date | Expected: Amount fields will not default

Title: Recurring Invoice Item- Disbursement: Create Disbursement with a matter that has a rate set.
Steps: Step 1: Note: Needs to be a new Recurring Invoice as existing ones will not use the new rates || Step 2: Setup Disb Rate SetClassic > Hub setup > Time and Billing Setup > Rate Set> Disb rates radio buttonSetup two Disb Rates1. Type - COPY, Markup %- 100%2. Type - COUR, Markup amount - 100 || Step 3: Setup Matter to use Disb Rate SetClassic > Matter Management > Time and Billing > Enter Matter > Disbs Tab > Select Disb Rate Set || Step 4: Create disb with COPY, $200 for Matter | Expected: Bill Amount defaul to $400 || Step 5: COPY, $200, Different matter | Expected: $200 || Step 6: COUR, $200 for matter | Expected: $300 || Step 7: COUR, $200, different matter | Expected: $200

Title: Recurring Invoices Item- Disbursements: Inline Editing
Steps: Step 1: General | Expected: https://aderant.sharepoint.com/RD/AP/Moscow%20Design%20Wiki/Disbursement%20Detail%20Form.aspx * Field validation as per the form which is specified on the WIKI* ID is not editable- Markup amount applied where appropriate. If there is a markup % for the cost code then that will impact on bill amount. If CDL_COST.MARKUP_BASE = Y then impact on base amount also.Bug 178637: Recurring Invoices- Disbursement Inline Edit: Does not apply Rates when doing inline edit of Base Amount- fixed- Rates for disb are recalculated when employee is changed as the employee's office may change and there may be rates per office *- Rates for disb are recalculated when cost code is changed as a cost code may have a unit rate- Project is avail if projects are on- Phase/task is mandatory if matter has a matter plan where phase/task is required- If employee required for disbursement code then it should become required. Bug 206438: Disbursements - Inline editing Disb Code where original has Apply Markup To Base is incorrectly updating Base Amount - FIXED || Step 2: Save | Expected: * Save should kick in 3 secs after tab out of fields being edited* Save won't kick in if mandatory fields have been cleared- Employee is only mandatory if the CDL_COST.INEMP_REQD = Y- Authorized Employee is only mandatory if the CDL_COST.AUEMP_REQD = Y- Bill amount is not allowed for non-billable matter || Step 3: Close Recurring Invoice with Unsaved Items | Expected: * Close is stopped and user is presented with the Do You Want to Save etc dialog || Step 4: Validation Errors | Expected: * Validation matches the form validation* Error inline is fixed in the form reflects the change back in the grid* No auto save if client side validation fails. Can still save from ribbon panel.  Bug 206493: Disbursements - Disb Code validation error doesn't show on inline editing grid

Title: Payment - Cancel to New: Employee Advance

Here, we need to reconcile the New part of the process as New payment would normally be done via the UI so we need to ensure that the creation of the New payment via code has the same outcome || Step 2: System pre reqs* Expenses is deployed* Expense licence imported* Expense workflows imported* Workflow approvals are turned off - Admin | Expenses | Employee Advance Workflow Options - Admin | Expenses | Expense Workflow Options* Employee's office has an Expenses AP Type - Admin | Hub Setup | Firm Setup | Offices || Step 3: Data pre reqsCAD RatesRate: 1.092007784100000Reciprocal: 0.915744388053213Employee Advance- CAD cur- Approved- Amount = C$100 | Expected: APT_ADVANCEAMOUNT= 100.00 (transaction currency)ADV_BALANCE= NULLTC_AMOUNT= 100.00 (transaction currency)CURRENCY_CODE = CADADV_STATUS = ASCHEDULE_NUM = 0Note: Unlike other credit items, creating an advance does not create a credit row in APT_ADVANCE_AMT. created)AMOUNT = 100.00 (transaction currency)SIGN = -1TC_AMT = 100.00 (transaction currency)TC_CODE = CADSCHEDULE_NUM = 0TRAN_TYPE = CH || Step 5: Query the tables and copy results to spread 91.5744388053 (system currency)ADV_BALANCE= 91.5744388053 TC_AMOUNT= 100.00 (transaction currency)CURRENCY_CODE = CADADV_STATUS = P APT_ADVANCE_AMTAMOUNT = 91.5744388053 (system currency)SIGN = -1TC_AMT = 100.00 (transaction currency)TC_CODE = CADTRAN_TYPE = CH || Step 7: Cancel payment to new | Expected: Payment 1 CanceledAPT_ADVANCE_AMT (record 1 not updated)AMOUNT = 91.5744388053 (system Steps: Step 1: Note: Testing of the cancel part of the payment is covered by the cancel test cases. Here, we need to reconcile the New part of the process as New payment would normally be done via the UI so we need to ensure that the creation of the New payment via code has the same outcome || Step 2: Pre preqsCAD RatesRate: 1.092007784100000Reciprocal: 0.915744388053213 || Step 3: Create payment with GL item1. Create vendor payment- Bank = CAD currency- Currency = CAD- Amount = C$100- other mandatory fields2. Add a GL item- Amount = C$100- enter all other fields | Expected: Payment created with GL item || Step 4: Query the tables and copy results to spread sheetSELECT TOP(1) * FROM ACT_TRAN_JE ORDER BY TRAN_UNO DESCSELECT TOP(1) * FROM ACT_TRAN ORDER BY TRAN_UNO DESCSELECT TOP(1) * FROM ACT_TEXT ORDER BY TEXT_ID DESC || Step 5: Post payment || Step 6: Cancel to New | Expected: Payment is canceled and New payment created- New Payment has GL item || Step 7: Reconcile tablesQuery tables and reconcile results from the original payment SELECTTOP(1)*FROM ACT_TRAN_JE ORDERBY TRAN_UNO DESCSELECTTOP(1)*FROM ACT_TRAN ORDERBY TRAN_UNO DESCSELECTTOP(1)*FROM ACT_TEXT ORDERBY TEXT_ID DESC | Expected: Tables and fields matchACT_TRAN_JE- Last modified is set, not copied from original- All fields that should match, do- All fields that won't match e.g. unos, are populated with the appropriate valuesACT_TRAN- Last modified is set, not copied from original- All fields that should match, do- All fields that won't match e.g. unos, are populated with the appropriate valuesACT_TEXT - Last modified is set, not copied from original- All fields that should match, do- All fields that won't match e.g. unos, are populated with the appropriate valuesWe're getting the old text copied over but it also may have the old default and therefore an old date. Should we prefix it with a new default text? Question to Dave

Title: Payment Items - Expense report: Cancel Validation
Payment Items - Disbursement: Cancel validation
Steps: Step 1: Matter is inactive1. Create a payment with multiple disbs- add a few with different matters2. Post the payment3. Inactivate the disb's matters for some of the disbs4. Cancel the Payment | Expected: Error: Payment cannot be canceled as one or more disbursements have an inactive matter. The following matters are inactive: x || Step 2: Matter is inactive on a canceled split1. Create a payment with a disb2. Post the payment3. Split the disb using the disb application4. Undo the split5. Inactivate the matter that the disb was split to6. Cancel the Payment | Expected: Payment is canceledValidation has filtered out the canceled spilts so they are not taken into account when checking for inactive matter || Step 3: Matter disbursement is locked by expertNote: This is hard to test as any locks at this point will be job locks so will be applied and removed quite quickly. Therefore you need to poke a lock into the lock table via sql 1. Create a payment with disb2. Post the payment3. Lock the matter/disb with an expert lock4. Cancel the Payment e.g.INSERT INTO CMS_LOCK (TABLE_NAME,TABLE_ROW_UNO,LOGIN_ID,GUID,LOCK_OWNER,MODULE_NAME,LOCK_REASON,LAST_MODIFIED)VALUES ('TBM_MATTER.DISB', YOUR_MATTER_UNO_HERE,'Guid','01905f35-c902-4f5d-a1ec-9a76d150466b', 'B','CDN','Disb lock test',GETDATE()) | Expected: Error: Payment cannot be canceled as one or more disbursements are locked. || Step 4: Matter disbursement is locked by classicNote: This is hard to test as any locks at this point will be job locks so will be applied and removed quite quickly. Therefore you need to poke a lock into the lock table via sql 1. Create a payment with disb2. Post the payment3. Lock the matter/disb with a classic lock4. Cancel the Payment e.g.INSERT INTO CMS_LOCK (TABLE_NAME,TABLE_ROW_UNO,LOGIN_ID,GUID,LOCK_OWNER,MODULE_NAME,LOCK_REASON,LAST_MODIFIED)VALUES ('TBM_MATTER.DISB',YOUR_MATTER_UNO_HERE,'CMSjan.lawson','', 'B','CDN','Disb lock test',getdate()) | Expected: Error: Payment cannot be canceled as one or more disbursements are locked. || Step 5: Transaction date is less than the min date1. Create a payment with multiple disbs- add a few with different matters2. Post the payment3. Select to cancel payment4. Enter Cancel Date (Transaction Date) that is older than min date set in parmsNote: UI will now prevent this so you need to enter the date then update the parms in sqlSELECT'APM_PARMS',*FROM APM_PARMS -- Accounts payable5. Cancel | Expected: Error: Date is outside minimum and maximum range || Step 6: Transaction date is greater than the max date1. Create a payment with multiple disbs- add a few with different matters2. Post the payment3. Select to cancel payment4. Enter Cancel Date (Transaction Date) that is after than max date set in parmsNote: UI will now prevent this so you need to enter the date then update the parms in sqlSELECT'APM_PARMS',*FROM APM_PARMS -- Accounts payable5. Cancel | Expected: Error: Date is outside minimum and maximum range

Title: Invoice - Post - Anticipated disbursement with Auto Match Threshold
Steps: Step 1: Pre req  Disbursement Code- Auto Match with 10% Treshold on Anticipate Item- Antic disb Bill Amount = $100 || Step 2: In Expert AP, create invoice with disbursement BIll Amount = $90. Post. | Expected: Not matched. 10% of $90 = 9. Hence matching Antic disb between 81 (90-9) to 99 (90+9), Antic disb Bill Amount = 100 is not in range. || Step 3: Disbursement Bill Amount = 110 | Expected: Matched.10% of $110 = 11. Hence matching Antic disb between 99 (110-11) to 121 (110+11). || Step 4: Disbursement Bill Amount = 90.91 | Expected: Matched.10% of $90.91 = 9.09. Hence matching Antic disb between 81.82 (90.91 - 9.09) to 100 (90.91+9.09) || Step 5: Disbursement Bill Amount = 111.11 | Expected: Matched.10% of $111.11 = 11.11. Hence matching Antic disb between 100(111.11 -11.11) to 122.22 (+11.11)

Title: AP Setup - Firm Options
Steps: Step 1: GeneralEdit fields and save** You can use the script included to easily see that the data you have modified is correctly persisted in the database.** Steps below indicate how you can check thatthe change i settings affect AP as expect, however they are not part of this test suite and do not need to be tested.* Change a field* Run script to confirm the change is reflected in the database | Expected: https://aderant.sharepoint.com/RD/AP/Moscow%20Design%20Wiki/Firm%20Options.aspx Changes are savedSELECT*FROM APM_PARMSOR Use the attached script 'Displayable APM_PARMS Query.sql' to verify changes are as expected || Step 2: Current Period Cutoff Date** You can test the validations from within Expert Administration** Press tab after entering a date or it wont be picked up by the Date Control * Change this date to any day before Minimum Allowable Transaction Date * Click Save, a pop up should prevent you from saving* Change this date to be equal to the Minimum Allowable Transaction Date * Click Save, should Save | Expected: CUT_DATE- Date control- Cuf off date must be equal to or greater than Minimum Allowable Transaction Date date. || Step 3: Minimum Allowable Transaction Date** You can test the validations from within Expert Administration** You can test the validations from the Invoice Entry page** Press tab after entering a date or it wont be picked up by the Date Control Expert Administration* Change this date to be a day after the Maximum Allowable Transaction Date* Click Save, a pop up should prevent you from saving* Change the date to equal the Maximum Allowable Transaction Date* Click Save, should save.* Change the date to be any day before the Maximum Allowable Transaction Date* Click Save, should save.Expert Accounts Payable* In AP change or create an Invoice with an Invoice Date before the minimum * A red box should indicate there is a problem | Expected: MIN_DATE- Date control- Cannot be after Maximum Allowable Transaction Date- Transaction dates in AP e.g. Invoice Dates cannot be before this date || Step 4: Maximum Allowable Transaction Date** You can test the validations from within Expert Administration** You can test the validations from the Invoice Entry page** Press tab after entering a date or it wont be picked up by the Date Control Expert Administration* Change this date to be a day before the Minimum Allowable Transaction Date* Click Save, a pop up should prevent you from saving* Change the date to equal the Minimum Allowable Transaction Date* Click Save, should save.Expert Accounts Payable* In AP change or create an Invoice with an Invoice Date after the Maximum Allowable Transaction Date* A red box should indicate there is a problem | Expected: MAX_DATE- Date control- Cannot be before Minimum Allowable Transaction Date- Transaction dates in AP e.g Invoice Date cannot be after this date || Step 5: Aging SetClassic * Additional aging sets can be added through Classic | Hub Setup | Time and Billing Parameters* Click on the "..." next to WIP Reports* New* Fill in a Unique Aging Set name to create a new Entry* When you are done, reset Expert Administration Expert AdministrationAccounts Payable | Accounts Payable Options | Firm Options* You should be able to select the new Aging Set you created in Expert Administration | Expected: AP_AGE_ID- SELECT AP_AGE_ID FROM APM_PARMS- Value in database should reflect this change || Step 6: Witholding Tax Percentage** Controls the percentage of withholding tax applied to an invoice when it is attached to a payment ** This field is dependent on [CMS_OPTION].[WHTAX_IN_USE] = 'Y',If it is 'N' then the  Withholding Tax Percentage field does not do anything and there should not be a check box on Invoice Entries called Withhold Tax.DatabaseUPDATE CMS_OPTIONSET FLAG_VALUE = 'Y'WHERE OPTION_CODE = 'WHTAX_IN_USE'  Expert AdministrationAccounts Payable | Accounts Payable Options | Firm Options* Set Withholding Tax Percentage to 10 (This means 10% of the Invoice amount)Expert Accounts Payable-- INVOICE ENTRY SCREEN --* Create a new Invoice * Include a detail line so the Invoice is in a state which can be Posted. * Tick the check box "Withhold Tax"* Post and Quick Pay the Invoice -- PAYMENT ENTRY SCREEN --* Payment Entry screen should open at this point, navigate to Invoice Payments detail tab* Select the Invoice Payments line and you should see Withheld Amount is in the detail grid, and should be equal to Invoice Amount * (Withholding Tax Percentage  / 100)100 * (10 / 100) = 10* Click "Edit" on the Invoice Payments | Expected: Column name: WHOLD_PCNT- When you quick pay an Invoice with Withhold Tax flag on, the Withholding Tax Percentage should be applied to the Invoice Amount- The Withheld amount is correct- With [CMS_OPTION].[WHTAX_IN_USE] = 'Y' -- The Invoice Entry screen should include a check box in Tax called "Withhold Tax".-- The Payment Entry Invoice Payments detail section should contain a column called "Withheld Amount"-- The Invoice Payments detail smartform should have a field called "Withheld Amount" || Step 7: Tax Include | Expected: DEFAULT_TAX_IN- The value that Tax Include on Invoices, Payments and Recurring Invoices defaults to || Step 8: Default Image File Extension | Expected: DEF_IMAGE_EXTENDefault extension for image files with no specific formatCan be NULL || Step 9: Assign Internal ReferenceNote: Added in 82SP2** Recommend testing this step with step 10** Test each of the different Assign Internal Reference options to ensure they trigger when expected* Create an Invoice and fill in required fields (Detail lines are needed to test N and P)N - We do not expect an internal reference number to be generatedS - We expect an internal reference number to be generated when we SaveP - We expect an internal reference number to be generated when we Post | Expected: Options: Not Applicable (N) - defaultOn Invoice Save (S)On Invoice Post (P) || Step 10: Internal Reference SourceNote: Added in 82SP2** Recommend testing this step with step 9* Create a new Invoice, you do not need to complete the detail lines* Based on the setting you have chosen, if the above is S or P we expect an internal reference number to be generated when we (S)ave or (P)ost:N - We do not expect an internal referenceF - A numberB - Banks Office Code appended with a number (e.g AUK - 1)E - Employees Office Code appended with a number (e.g AUK - 1)V - Vendors Office Code appended with a number (e.g AUK - 1)* We should also see an associated update with the following query:SELECT * FROM CMS_UNIQUE_KEYS ORDER BY LAST_MODIFIED DESC | Expected: Disable and set to Not Applicable when the field above, Assign Internal Reference = Not Applicable.Options :Not Applicable (N) - defaultFirm (F)Bank Office (B)Employee Office (E)Vendor Office (V) || Step 11: Edit List Required** Recommend testing Edit_List = 'Y' first* Create a new Invoice and put it in a state to be posted* Click Release* If Edit List Required is checked we expect a pop up prventing us from releasingand If not then we expect to be able to release | Expected: EDIT_LIST- Whether you need to click Edit List before you release an invoice or create payments for a payment schedule. || Step 12: Generate Disbursement Text** This and step 13 can easily be tested together* Create an Invoice (or anything with a disbursement detail line)* The invoice must be valid before detail lines will become enabled* Once detail lines are enabled, click on the Disbursement detail tab* Click Add New and you should see some auto generated text in the Narrative field | Expected: GEN_DISB_TEXT- Whether disbursement narratives for invoices and payments are automatically generated || Step 13: Generate General Ledger Text** This and step 12 can easily be tested together* Create an Invoice (or anything with a GL detail line)* The invoice must be valid before detail lines will become enabled* Once detail lines are enabled, click on the GL detail tab* Click Add New and you should see some auto generated text in the Narrative field | Expected: GEN_GL_TEXT- Whether GL narratives for invoices and payments are automatically generated || Step 14: Take Overdue Discount* Create a valid Invoice where detail lines equal an Amount* Add a discount for a date and amount before the current dateIf the discount applies we expect any payment to equal the Amount - Discount.* Post your Invoice* Click Quick Pay on the Ribbon Panel* A Payment should open up* On the detail section of the payment confirm that Invoice Payments equalAmount - Discount (If discount is applied) otherwise Amount | Expected: TAKE_DISCOUNT- Y- If the Discount Date is before the invoice date we still apply the discount amount to the invoice when we put in on a payment || Step 15: Auto-release Recurring Invoices Note: Added in 82SP2* Create a valid Recurring Invoice where detail lines balance the amount.* If the recurring invoice is valid, then generation method should editable, this should be changed to manual.* Generate the next Invoice* Open the generated Invoice when priompted* Check the Release status | Expected: AUTO_RELEASE_RECUR_INV- Set as 'Y' by default. - Set to 'N', generated recurring invoice will be in Ready to Post state || Step 16: Auto- reconcile Wire Transfers | Expected: AUTO_RECONCILE_WIRE- Y- After posting automatically reconcile Wire Transfers || Step 17: Allow Spot Rate for Quick Pay | Expected: CHK_SPOT_RATES- Y- Spot rate button on created payments is visible || Step 18: Allow Spot Rate for Invoice | Expected: INV_SPOT_RATES- Y - Spot rate button is visible on invoices || Step 19: Allow Miscellaneous Payments to VendorsNote: Added in 82SP2 | Expected: ALLOW_MISC_VENDOR_PAYT- Y - Vendors can be paid via the Miscellaneous Payments feature. || Step 20: Withhold Disbursement Cash Reciept until Vendor is Paid | Expected: HOLD_DISB-Reciept cannot be made against a disbursement until it has been paid - Disabled and checked if Withhold Disbursement Cash Reciept until Check is Reconciled is checked. || Step 21: Withhold Disbursement Cash Reciept until Check is Reconciled | Expected: HOLD_DISB_CHECK_RECONCILE-Same as above but check needs to be reconciled before a reciept can be made against it. || Step 22: Hold invoice for Full Bill Payment | Expected: INV_PAYFULL_RELEASE- Require full payment of the disbursement if Client Bill Payment Required is checked and there is a disbursement on the invoice- Disabled and unchecked if either Withhold Disbursement Cash Reciept until Vendor or Check is paid (the two options above it) || Step 23: Enable Invoice Approval Field | Expected: INVOICE_APPROVAL_FIELD_ENABLED- Whether the Approved field on invoices is enabled || Step 24: Default New Invoice to Approved | Expected: DEFAULT_INT_TO_APPROVED- If a new invoice defaults to approved or not || Step 25: Display Anticipated DisbursementsGrid on Disbursement CardsNote: Added in 82SP2** This is intentional set to Y in the dacpac DB for integration testing purposes. It will be 'N' by default in the client's DB when installed/upgraded as they have to opt in to the feature.Expert Administration* Set to Y (checked) Expert Accounts Payable* Fill in required fields on an Invoice until you can add detail lines* Click Add New on the Disbursement detail line tab | Expected: DISPLAY_ANT_DISB_GRID - There should be an Anticipated Disbursements grid if the value is checked.- There should not be if it is unchecked. || Step 26: Recoverable Tax Control Required** Recommend testing this with Step 27Expert Administration* Set to Y (checked)Expert Accounts Payable* Verify from both the Invoice Entry screen and the Payment Entry screen that there is a Recoverable Tax field. | Expected: RECOV_CONT_REQUIRED- There should be a Recoverable Tax field if the Recoverable Tax Control Required is checked.- There should not be a Recoverable Tax field if the Recoverable Tax Control Required is unchecked. || Step 27: Recoverable Tax Tolerence** Recommend testing this with Step 26** Disabled unless Recoverable Tax Control Required is checked Expert Administration* Set Recoverable Tax Control to Y (Checked)* Set to 1 (This means the difference between Recoverable Tax and the Tax Detail Total must be within this amount. It is not a %)Expert Accounts Payable* All fields can be as you see fit except:Invoice Amount: 100Jurisdiction: GST (GST)Tax Included: Yes (Y)Tax Report: Claim (C)* In the general ledger detail section click Add New* Fields can be as you see fit except:Amount = 100Jurisdiction = GST (GST)* Save and Add the detail line* Save the Invoice* Calculate Tax should now be enabled, if it is not, then your invoice is incomplete or alternatively your Tax Included value is not Yes (Y). Click it and your general ledger detail line should go from 100 -> 93.46 and your Taxes should become 6.54.* Set Recoverable Tax to 7.55 (which is greater than Tax Total + Tolerance)* Attempt to Post, an alert should be raised "Difference between recoverable tax control amount and that total tax amount exceeds tax control tolerance"* Set Recoverable Tax to 7.54 and Post | Expected: RECOV_CONT_TOLERANCE - The Recoverable Tax field amount should be within: Tax Detail total - Tolerance <= Recoverable Tax <= Tax Detail total + Tolerance

Title: Payment - Cancel to New: Disbursement
Steps: Step 1: Note: Testing of the cancel part of the payment is covered by the cancel test cases. Here, we need to reconcile the New part of the process as New payment would normally be done via the UI so we need to ensure that the creation of the New payment via code has the same outcome || Step 2: Setup pre reqs Turn off holds SELECT INV_PAYFULL_RELEAS,HOLD_DISB_CHECK_RECONCILE,HOLD_DISB FROM APM_PARMSUPDATE APM_PARMS SET INV_PAYFULL_RELEAS ='N',HOLD_DISB_CHECK_RECONCILE ='N',HOLD_DISB ='N' || Step 3: Pre preqs CAD RatesRate: 1.092007784100000Reciprocal: 0.915744388053213 || Step 4: Create payment with Disb item1. Create vendor payment- Bank = CAD currency- Currency = CAD- Amount = C$100- other mandatory fields2. Add a Disb item- Amount = C$100- enter all other fields | Expected: Payment created with Disb item || Step 5: Query the tables and copy results to spread sheet SELECT TOP(1)*FROM CDT_DISB ORDER BY DISB_UNO DESCSELECT TOP(1)*FROM ACT_TRAN ORDER BY TRAN_UNO DESCSELECTTOP(1)*FROM CDT_TEXT ORDER BY TEXT_ID DESC || Step 6: Post payment | Expected: Payment posted || Step 7: Cancel to New | Expected: Payment is canceled and New payment created- New Payment has Disb item || Step 8: Reconcile tablesQuery tables and reconcile results from the original payment | Expected: Tables and fields match CDT_DISB- Last modified is set, not copied from original- All fields that should match, do- All fields that won't match e.g. unos, are populated with the appropriate valuesNote: OFFC, DEPT and PROF are blank on created and get populated on post based on the CDT parms. We're copying these values over to the new disb which we probably shouldn't, however they are re-valuated on post and correct at that point so there doesn't appear to be an impact.  ACT_TRAN- Last modified is set, not copied from original- All fields that should match, do- All fields that won't match e.g. unos, are populated with the appropriate values CDT_TEXT - Last modified is set, not copied from original- All fields that should match, do- All fields that won't match e.g. unos, are populated with the appropriate values-A new row is added to the CDT_Text with appropriate TXT columnWe're getting the old text copied over but it also may have the old default and therefore an old date. Should we prefix it with a new default text? Question to Dave

Title: Payment - Cancel to New: Disbursement with Anticipated
Steps: Step 1: Note: Testing of the cancel part of the payment is covered by the cancel test cases. Here, we need to reconcile the New part of the process as New payment would normally be done via the UI so we need to ensure that the creation of the New payment via code has the same outcomeNote: the prebills need to be created in classic until expert billing has been enhanced for anticipated disbs || Step 2: Pre req Disbursement Cost Code (Type) - Auto Match on Anticipate Item e.g. ANT || Step 3: Create aniticipated disbNote: this will need to be done in classic until expert billing has been enhanced for anticipated disbs1. Create a prebill- currency = USD2. Add an anticipated disbursement- HardSoft = Hard- Costcode = ANT- Matter- Vendor- Amount = $10.003. Prep and post the bill | Expected: Anticipated disbursement is createdSee sql belowCDT_DISB for anticipated disb (created)Note: No CDT_DISB_NEW record is createdHARDSOFT = HWIP_STATUS = BSOURCE_TRAN_TYPE = ADCURRENCY_CODE = USDBILLED_AMT = 10.00CDT_DISB_ANTIC for billed disb (created)DISB_UNO = ANTIC_DISB_UNOSTATUS = NREVERSED = NULLHEADER = YSOURCE_TRAN_TYP = BLPERIOD = from disbDISB_AMT = 10.00MATCH_AMT = 0DISB_BALANCE = 10.00--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- Anticpated Disbs/*- Set up disb cost code to allow Auto match (they can allow no matching, auto match or manual match)- For auto match you can set a threshold. 0 will be exact match. 90 will match within 90% either way- Create a bill with a disb that uses a cost code with auto match and post that bill. Source type = AD and only has BILLED_AMT- Create an invoice or payment and add a disb for the same vendor/matter/currency/amount/costcode/hardsoft (we only used hard in AP)   office? and post the invoice- Status was N but now (if matched status = M)- Should now be 3 rows in CDT_DISB?- If fully matched CDT_DISB_ANTIC.DISB_BALANCE will be zero (might just be zero anyway for an auto?)- If manual match and not fully matched but closed was checked on manual match form then CDT_DISB_ANTIC.DISB_BALANCE will be zero- If manual match and not fully matched and closed not checked on manual match form then CDT_DISB_ANTIC.DISB_BALANCE will not be zero and another disb created for the remainder to be billed */------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------ Declarations---------------------------------------------------------------------------------DECLARE @paydisb asint= 66358DECLARE @vendor asvarchar(100)='TST2'DECLARE @matteruno as int = (SELECT MATTER_UNO FROM CDT_DISB WHERE DISB_UNO =  @paydisb)DECLARE @currency as varchar (20) = (SELECT CURRENCY_CODE FROM CDT_DISB WHERE DISB_UNO =  @paydisb)DECLARE @billdisb asint= (SELECT ANTIC_DISB_NUM FROM CDT_DISB_ANTIC WHERE MATCH_DISB_UNO = @paydisb)DECLARE @period as int = (SELECT PERIOD FROM CDT_DISB WHERE DISB_UNO =  @paydisb)DECLARE @hardsoft asvarchar (5)= (SELECT HARDSOFT FROM CDT_DISB WHERE DISB_UNO = @paydisb)DECLARE @costcode asvarchar (5)= (SELECT COST_CODE FROM CDT_DISB WHERE DISB_UNO = @paydisb)DECLARE @wip asvarchar (5)= (SELECT WIP_STATUS FROM CDT_DISB WHERE DISB_UNO = @paydisb)DECLARE @vendoruno asint= (SELECT VENDOR_UNO FROM APM_VENDOR WHERE VENDOR_ID = @vendor)DECLARE @clientuno asint= (SELECT CLIENT_UNO FROM HBM_MATTER WHERE MATTER_UNO = @matteruno)--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- Cost Codes-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------SELECT COST_CODE, COST_DESC,ANTICIPATE_ITEM,MARKUP_BASE,INEMP_REQD ,HAS_UNIT_RATE,ALLOW_BASE_EDIT--,*FROM CDL_COST cc WHERE INACTIVE!='Y'--AND ALLOW_HARD='Y'AND ANTICIPATE_ITEM ='A'-- A,M,NORDERBY cc.COST_CODE--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- Disbs-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------SELECT @paydisb[Payment Disb],@billdisb [Matched Anticipated Bill Disb],@costcode[cost code],@matteruno[matter uno],@vendoruno[vendor uno],@currency[currency],(SELECT TOBILL_AMT FROM CDT_DISB WHERE DISB_UNO =  @paydisb)[To bill amount],@period[period],@wip[WIP Status],@hardsoft[disb type],@vendor[vendor], @clientuno [client uno],(SELECT BASE_AMT FROM CDT_DISB WHERE DISB_UNO =  @paydisb)[Base amount]--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- Possible matches-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------SELECT''[Possible matches],ad.ROW_UNO,ad.ANTIC_DISB_NUM,ad.DISB_UNO,d.COST_CODE,d.MATTER_UNO,ad.VENDOR_UNO,d.CURRENCY_CODE,d.BILLED_AMT,d.BILL_TRAN_UNO,ad.DISB_AMT,ad.MATCH_AMT,ad.DISB_BALANCE,ad.PERIOD[Ant Period],d.WIP_STATUS,d.HARDSOFT,ad.STATUS[Ant Status],ad.REVERSED[Ant Reversed],ad.MATCH_DISB_UNO,d.DISB_REF,ad.LAST_MODIFIED--FROM CDT_DISB d--JOIN CDT_DISB_ANTIC ad ON d.DISB_UNO = ad.ANTIC_DISB_NUM AND STATUS = 'N'FROM CDT_DISB_ANTIC adJOIN CDT_DISB d ON d.DISB_UNO = ad.ANTIC_DISB_NUM ANDSTATUS='N'WHERE WIP_STATUS ='B'AND d.HARDSOFT ='H'AND ad.STATUS='N'AND ad.VENDOR_UNO = @vendorunoAND d.MATTER_UNO = @matterunoAND d.CURRENCY_CODE = @currencyAND d.COST_CODE = @costcode----------------------------------------------------------------------------------- CDT_DISB_ANTIC created on post bill and matched on post payment---------------------------------------------------------------------------------SELECT''[CDT_DISB_ANTIC],ROW_UNO,ANTIC_DISB_NUM,DISB_UNO,MATCH_DISB_UNO,STATUS,REVERSED,HEADER,SOURCE_TRAN_TYP,SOURCE_TRAN_UNO,VENDOR_UNO,DISB_AMT,MATCH_AMT,DISB_BALANCE,PERIOD,HEADER,GL_AUDIT_NUM,LAST_MODIFIED,* FROM CDT_DISB_ANTIC ad--WHERE MATCH_DISB_UNO = @paydisbWHERE ANTIC_DISB_NUM = @billdisbORDERBY ad.ANTIC_DISB_NUM desc, ad.ROW_UNO desc----------------------------------------------------------------------------------- CDT_DISB---------------------------------------------------------------------------------SELECT''[Disbs and contra entries],d.DISB_UNO,d.DISB_REF,d.WIP_STATUS,d.ACTIVITY_COUNT,d.SOURCE_TRAN_TYP,d.SOURCE_TRAN_UNO,d.COST_CODE,d.HARDSOFT,d.BILL_TRAN_UNO,d.CURRENCY_CODE,d.BASE_AMT,d.TOBILL_AMT,d.BILLED_AMT--,*FROM Title: Invoice Import Setup
Steps: Step 1: Daves documentation: https://aderant.sharepoint.com/RD/AP/_layouts/15/WopiFrame.aspx?sourcedoc=%7BFBB4FCF8-CE53-4C3A-B91A-3FC15EFA619B%7D&file=Accounts%20Payable%205%20-%20Invoice%20Import%20Wizard.docx&action=default || Step 2: Setup1. .xlsx file format (Excel)2. Tab name- Invoice (Headers)-General Ledger (GL Details lines)- Disbursements (Disbursement Detail Lines)- Firm Paid Credit Card (FPCC Detail Lines)3. One record per line with information required | Expected: Tab names need to be exact.Import stops on the first blank line. || Step 3: Import Wizard1. Upload the .xlsx file2. Create new mapping profile3. Map columns to fields

Title: Invoice Import - Header: Shown Fields
Steps: Step 1: Select INVOICE_NUM, * from APT_INVOICE order by LAST_MODIFIED desc || Step 2: Required || Step 3: Vendor Code | Expected: Either Vendor Code or Vendor Name is required. || Step 4: Temporary Vendor Name | Expected: Will create a temporary vendor name if there is not one set up Bug 187190: Invoice Import- Change Placeholder Vendor Name to Temporary Vendor Name- fixed || Step 5: Invoice Number | Expected: Unique otherwise error after import || Step 6: Invoice Date | Expected: Between min/max dates in APM_PARMS otherwise pre- validation rejection || Step 7: Invoice Amounts | Expected: Copies to ORIGINAL_AMT, OPTIONAL, TC_INV_AMT || Step 8: Optional || Step 9: Currency Code || Step 10: Spot Rate || Step 11: Approved || Step 12: Narrative | Expected: Optional || Step 13: Reference Number | Expected: Optional || Step 14: AP Type || Step 15: Due Date | Expected: Defaults from calculation based on Invoice Date and Payment TermsNote: When manually entered it accepts date prior to invoice date??? || Step 16: 1099 Code || Step 17: 1099 Amount || Step 18: Jurisdiction || Step 19: Tax Amount | Expected: Defaults to 0, Field only used if APM_PARMS setting || Step 20: Values Tax Inclusive || Step 21: Withhold Tax || Step 22: Sales Use Tax || Step 23: Tax Report || Step 24: Bill Payment Required || Step 25: Seperate Check || Step 26: Hold Date | Expected: Optional, if entered must be >=TodayNote: It accepts date prior to today???? || Step 27: Firm Paid Credit Card | Expected: Bug 180394: Invoice Import- Header mapping does not have Firm Paid Credit Card field- fixed || Step 28: Name Override | Expected: Default to 0, If entered it must be valid for the vendor in APA_VENDOR_RELATED_PAYEE || Step 29: Address Override | Expected: Optional. If empty will default to 0. If entered it must be valid for the related Payee. || Step 30: Expert Image ID | Expected: Defaults to empty string. || Step 31: Remit Vendor Code | Expected: Optional. If empty, defaults from Vendor.User Story 276235: As a user, I want to define and review a Remit Vendor via Import wizard so it can be imported as part of Invoice. || Step 32: Custom Columns - Added in 82SP2 | Expected: Custom columns added into APT_INVOICE, once the customization process is completed, will become available to be mapped to the Excel columns.

Title: Invoice Import - Header: Default Values NEEDS FIXED
Steps: Step 2: Currency Code | Expected: Defaults from Vendor || Step 3: Spot Rate | Expected: Defaults to 0.0000000 Bug 180522: Invoice Import- When entered spot rate is negative it should default to 0- fixed || Step 4: ApprovedAdmin app>AP Options> Firm OptionsDefault New Invoice to Approved1. Checked2. Not checked | Expected: 'Y''N' || Step 5: AP Type | Expected: Defaults from Vendor || Step 6: Book | Expected: Defaults from banks default || Step 7: Payment Terms | Expected: Defaults from Vendor || Step 8: Due Date | Expected: Defaults from calculation based on Invoice Date and Payment Terms || Step 9: 1099 Code | Expected: Defaults from Vendor || Step 10: 1099 Amount | Expected: Defaults from Invoice Amount || Step 11: Jurisdiction | Expected: Defaults from Vendor || Step 12: Tax Amount | Expected: Defaults to 0, Field only used if APM_PARMS setting || Step 13: Values Tax Inclusive | Expected: Default based on APM_PARMS || Step 14: Withhold Tax | Expected: Default from Vendor || Step 15: Sales Use Tax | Expected: Default to 0 || Step 16: Tax Report | Expected: Default to 'C' - Claim || Step 17: Bill Payment Required | Expected: Default from Vendor Bug 180425: Invoice Import- Header- Bill Payment Required and Seperate Check should default from vendor if invalid value provided- fixed || Step 18: Seperate Check | Expected: Default from Vendor Bug 180425: Invoice Import- Header- Bill Payment Required and Seperate Check should default from vendor if invalid value provided - fixed || Step 19: Firm Paid Credit Card | Expected: Defaults to 'N' || Step 20: Name Override | Expected: Default to 0, If entered it must be valid for the vendor in APA_VENDOR_RELATED_PAYEE || Step 21: Address Override | Expected: Same as above. || Step 22: Expert Image ID | Expected: Defaults to empty string. Note: Is defaulted to 0 -TK 12/19 || Step 23: Not Shown || Step 24: INVOICE_STATUS | Expected: N- not posted || Step 25: ORIGINAL_AMT | Expected: INV_AMT || Step 26: BALANCE | Expected: 0 until posted, then INV_AMT || Step 27: LATEST_DATE | Expected: NULL || Step 28: USE_OVERRIDE | Expected: If name or address override used, then 'Y' || Step 29: TC_INV_AMT | Expected: INV_AMT || Step 30: TC_CODE | Expected: CURRENCY_CODE || Step 31: USE_NAME_OVERRIDE | Expected: If name override used then 'Y' || Step 32: USE_ADDRESS_OVERRIDE | Expected: If address override used then 'Y' || Step 33: APPROVED_DATE | Expected: If Approved = Y, then set to Today. Otherwise 01/01/1800 || Step 34: ENTRY_EMPL_UNO | Expected: Default to user running import. If from Job then default from GLM_PARMS || Step 35: CREATE_DATE | Expected: Todays date and current time || Step 36: SOURCE | Expected: 'II' || Step 37: SOURCE_REF | Expected: CMS_UNIQUE_KEYS where TBNAME = APT_INVOICE.ImportSession || Step 38: Multibook = Nupdate CMS_MODULE set AVAILABLE='N' where MODULE_ID='45003' | Expected: Default Firm Book (1) saved. || Step 39: Taxes_In_Use = Nupdate CMS_OPTION set FLAG_VALUE='N' where OPTION_CODE = 'TAXES_IN_USE' | Expected: Defaults the values in the same way as a manually done invoice.Note: If APM_PARMS.DEFAULT_TAX_IN is not X then you will not be able to release or post the invoices as it will think that you have to Calculate Tax. This should not be a major problem as firms not using taxes should have it set to X. This is the same behaviour as a manually created invoices currently. (16/6/2018) || Step 40: 1099_IN_USEupdate CMS_OPTION set FLAG_VALUE='N' where OPTION_CODE='1099_IN_USE' | Expected: Defaults the values in the same way as a manually done invoice. || Step 41: SALES_USE_TXupdate CMS_OPTION set FLAG_VALUE='N' where OPTION_CODE='SALES_USE_TX' | Expected: Defaults the values in the same way as a manually done invoice. || Step 42: WHTAX_IN_USEupdate CMS_OPTION set FLAG_VALUE='N' where OPTION_CODE='WHTAX_IN_USE' | Expected: Defaults the values in the same way as a manually done invoice. || Step 43: Withhold Tax invalid - For example 'E' | Expected: Defauts to N || Step 44: Sales Use Tax | Expected: Defaults to 0 for invalid values || Step 45: Bill Payment Required | Expected: Defaults from vendor value || Step 46: Seperate Check | Expected: Defaults from vendor value || Step 47: Validate Spot Rate1, System currency = invoice currency2. System currency does not equal invoice currency3. Negative spot rate4. When the below ='N'Req: APM_PARMS.INV_SPOT_RATES flag = 'Y' | Expected: 1. Spot rate is hidden in entry screen. Still imported.2. Spot rate can be viewed in entry screen. Imported.3. Spot rate defaults to 0. || Step 48: Negative Spot rate | Expected: Should default to 0 Bug 180522: Invoice Import- When entered spot rate is negative it should default to 0- fixed

'E') | Expected: Should default based on setting in Administration>AP>AP Options>Firm Options>Default New Invoice to Approved. || Step 18: Invalid Discount Amount- Enter a negative number | Expected: Cannot accept negative valuesShows on screen validation || Step 19: Invalid 1099 Code | Expected: Saves invalid value, shows box blank and required with a warning: "1099 Type Invalid" || Step 20: 1099 Amount1. 1- Invoice_Amt = previous amount - invoice amount in system currency (91.57)- AP_balance = previous amount - invoice amount in system currency (91.57) | Expected: Bug 179801 Invoice Cancel - Vendor summary tables updated as invoice currency instead of system currency FIXED || Step 12: Comment for cancellation transaction createdACT_TEXT- Source_uno = uno from cancelled transaction.

Title: Invoice - Cancel - Invoice Cancel validation
Steps: Step 1: Display of error- Via a job- Via an invoice* '%S' is string value. | Expected: Display in Recent Activities tab.Display in red alert bar at the top of Invoice Entry screen. || Step 2: Validate GL Row SecurityUser must have security on all the GL Accounts in invoice detail lines1. Set other user to have HBM_PERSN.PRIVILEGE_LEVEL = 0.2. Set custom security on account to disallow user Classic | General Ledger | G/L Setup | Chart of Book maintenance- Custom security- Set user to X3. As the user, cancel invoice. | Expected: Display error : 'Cannot access GL Account'.Cancel failed. || Step 3: Validate Disbursement Matter Inactive StatusCannot cancel invoice disbursement if Client.Matter is inactive.1. Title: Payment Items - Invoice: warn if invoice disbursement not paid or full bill not paid
Steps: Step 1: AP Pre reqs Admin | Accounts Payable | Accounts payable options | Firm options- Withhold disbursement cash receipt until vendor is paid (HOLD_DISB) = Off- Withhold disbursement cash receipt until check is reconciled (HOLD_DISB_CHECK_RECONCILE) = Off- Hold Invoice for Full Bill Payment = OffNote: Pub database comes with defaults:- Withhold disbursement cash receipt until vendor is paid = On- Withhold disbursement cash receipt until check is reconciled = Off- Hold invoice for full bill payment (INV_PAYFULL_RELEAS) = OffSELECT INV_PAYFULL_RELEAS,HOLD_DISB_CHECK_RECONCILE,HOLD_DISB FROM APM_PARMSUPDATE APM_PARMS SET INV_PAYFULL_RELEAS ='N',HOLD_DISB_CHECK_RECONCILE ='N',HOLD_DISB ='Y'--DefaultUPDATE APM_PARMS SET INV_PAYFULL_RELEAS ='N',HOLD_DISB_CHECK_RECONCILE ='N',HOLD_DISB ='N'--Don't need full bill paidUPDATE APM_PARMS SET INV_PAYFULL_RELEAS ='Y',HOLD_DISB_CHECK_RECONCILE ='N',HOLD_DISB ='N'--Need full bill paid || Step 2: Disb not billed - disb payment not required (full bill payment not required)1. Full bill payment required = Off2. Create an invoice3. Set Client Bill Payment Required = Off- APT_INVOICE.BILL_PMT_REQD = N4. Add a disb item5. Post the invoice6. Create a vendor payment7. Add the invoice | Expected: No message displayed || Step 3: Disb not billed - disb payment required (full bill payment not required)1. Full bill payment required = Off2. Create an invoice3. Set Client Bill Payment Required = On- APT_INVOICE.BILL_PMT_REQD = Y4. Add a disb item5. Post the invoice6. Create a vendor payment7. Add the invoice | Expected: Warning: Client disbursements have not been paid. Do you want to continue?INVPMT_UNPAIDDISB || Step 4: Disb has been billed but not paid - disb payment required but (full bill payment not required)1. Full bill payment required = Off2. Create an invoice3. Set Client Bill Payment Required = On- APT_INVOICE.BILL_PMT_REQD = Y4. Add a disb item5. Post the invoice6. Create a bill- add the disb7. Post the bill8. Create a vendor payment9. Add the invoice | Expected: Warning: Client disbursements have not been paid. Do you want to continue?INVPMT_UNPAIDDISB || Step 5: Disb has been billed but not fully paid and paid amt is not posted - disb payment required (full bill payment not required)Note: Payments are made via classic Account Receivable against the bill1. Set APM_PARMS.INV_PAYFULL_RELEAS = N 2. Create an invoice3. Set Client Bill Payment Required = On- APT_INVOICE.BILL_PMT_REQD = Y4. Add a disb item5. Post the invoice6. Create a bill- add the invoice7. Post the bill8. Pay some of the bill (via Accounts Receivable) but not enough to cover the full disb amount. - disb has not been fully paid based on BLH_PAID_DISBNote: Do NOT Post the bill payment9. Create a vendor payment10. Add the invoice | Expected: Warning: Client disbursements have not been paid. Do you want to continue?INVPMT_UNPAIDDISBNote: the message is displayed because altho some bill payment has been made to the disb, the bill payment has not been posted (logic added in 83) || Step 6: Disb has been billed but not fully paid - disb payment required (full bill payment not required)Note: Payments are made via classic Account Receivable against the bill1. Set APM_PARMS.INV_PAYFULL_RELEAS = N 2. Create an invoice3. Set Client Bill Payment Required = On- APT_INVOICE.BILL_PMT_REQD = Y4. Add a disb item5. Post the invoice6. Create a bill- add the invoice7. Post the bill8. Pay some of the bill (via Accounts Recievable) but not enough to cover the full disb amount. - disb has not been fully paid based on BLH_PAID_DISB9. Post the bill payment10. Create a vendor payment11. Add the invoice | Expected: No message displayed because some bill payment has been made and posted to the disb even tho its not the full amount || Step 7: Disb has been billed and fully paid and paid amt is not posted - disb payment required (full bill payment not required)1. Set APM_PARMS.INV_PAYFULL_RELEAS = N 2. Create an invoice3. Set Client Bill Payment Required = On- APT_INVOICE.BILL_PMT_REQD = Y4. Add a disb item5. Post the invoice6. Create a bill- add the disb7. Post the bill8. Pay the full disb amount on the bill (via Accounts Receivable) BLH_PAID_DISBNote: Do NOT Post the bill payment9. Post the bill payment10. Create a vendor payment11. Add the invoice | Expected: Warning: Client disbursements have not been paid. Do you want to continue?INVPMT_UNPAIDDISBNote: the message is displayed because altho bill payment has been made to the disb for the full disb amt, the bill payment has not been posted (logic added in 83) || Step 8: Disb has been billed and fully paid - disb payment required (full bill payment not required)1. Set APM_PARMS.INV_PAYFULL_RELEAS = N 2. Create an invoice3. Set Client Bill Payment Required = On- APT_INVOICE.BILL_PMT_REQD = Y4. Add a disb item5. Post the invoice6. Create a bill- add the disb7. Post the bill8. Pay the full disb amount on the bill (via Accounts Receivable) BLH_PAID_DISB9. Post the bill payment10. Create a vendor payment11. Add the invoice | Expected: No message displayed || Step 9: Disb has not been billed - disb payment not required (full bill payment required)1. Set APM_PARMS.INV_PAYFULL_RELEAS = Y2. Create an invoice3. Set Client Bill Payment Required = Off- APT_INVOICE.BILL_PMT_REQD = N4. Add a disb item5. Post the invoice6. Create a vendor payment7. Add the invoice | Expected: No message displayed || Step 10: Disb has not been billed - disb payment required (full bill payment is required)1. Set APM_PARMS.INV_PAYFULL_RELEAS = Y 2. Create an invoice3. Set Client Bill Payment Required = On- APT_INVOICE.BILL_PMT_REQD = Y4. Add a disb item5. Post the invoice6. Create a vendor payment7. Add the invoice | Expected: Warning: Client disbursements have not been paid. Do you want to continue?INVPMT_UNPAIDDISB || Step 11: Disb has been billed and the bill has not been fully paid - disb payment required (full bill payment required)1. Set APM_PARMS.INV_PAYFULL_RELEAS = Y 2. Create an invoice3. Set Client Bill Payment Required = On- APT_INVOICE.BILL_PMT_REQD = Y4. Add a disb item5. Post the invoice6. Create a bill- add the disb- add a time entry7. Post the bill8. Pay part of the bill (via Accounts Recievable - ensure some of the allocation is against the disb)10. Post the bill payment11. Create a vendor payment12. Add the invoice | Expected: Warning: Client disbursements have not been paid. Do you want to continue?INVPMT_UNPAIDDISB || Step 12: Disb has been billed and the bill has been fully paid - disb payment required (full bill payment required)1. Set APM_PARMS.INV_PAYFULL_RELEAS = Y 2. Create an invoice3. Set Client Bill Payment Required = On- APT_INVOICE.BILL_PMT_REQD = Y4. Add a disb item5. Post the invoice6. Create client (or vendor) payment- Bank = bank 1- Type = Electronic- Bank account- Trust Bank Id- Trust Acct- Trust Acct Name- Trust Pay Name2. Save | Expected: Payment is saved with the trust dataWhen the bank and payment type are entered, APA Trust bank fields are enabledNote: The fields are mandatory because the bank has 'Require Trust EFT' set onTrust Bank IdTrust AcctTrust Acct NameTrust Pay Name || Step 3: Bank trust is optional, payent method is Wire1. Create client (or vendor) payment- Bank = bank 2- Type = Wire- Bank account- Trust Bank Id- Trust Acct- Trust Acct Name- Trust Pay Name2. Save | Expected: Payment is saved with the trust dataWhen the bank and payment type are entered, APA Trust bank fields are enabledNote: The fields are optional because the bank has 'Require Trust EFT' set offTrust Bank IdTrust AcctTrust Acct NameTrust Pay Name

Title: Classic - Checking Expert_Invoice_Status column for invoices created/processed in Classic
Steps: Step 1: In classic AP, create new invoice.Check APT_INVOICE. | Expected: Expert_invoice_status = 'I' || Step 2: Add in detail lines. Ensure that total details amount is matching the invoice amount. | Expected: Expert_invoice_status = 'C' || Step 3: Remove the detail lines. Details amount <> invoice amount. | Expected: Expert_invoice_status = 'I' || Step 4: Add the detail lines back so that expert invoice status is now 'C'. || Step 5: Release invoice | Expected: Expert_invoice_status = 'R' || Step 6: Unrelease invoice | Expected: Expert_invoice_status = 'C' || Step 7: Post invoice | Expected: Expert_invoice_status = 'O' || Step 8: Pay part of the invoice amount. | Expected: Expert_invoice_status = 'P' || Step 9: Pay the rest of the invoice amount | Expected: Expert_invoice_status = 'S' || Step 10: Cancel one of the payment | Expected: Expert_invoice_status = 'P' || Step 11: Cancel all the payment made for this invoice | Expected: Expert_invoice_status = 'O' || Step 12: Cancel the invoice | Expected: Expert_invoice_status = 'X'

Steps: Step 1: In classic AP, create new payment.Check APT_check. | Expected: Expert_payment_status = 'I' || Step 2: Add in detail lines. Ensure that total details amount is matching the payment amount. | Expected: Expert_payment_status = 'C' || Step 3: Remove the detail lines. Details amount <> payment amount. | Expected: Expert_payment_status = 'I' || Step 4: Add the detail lines back so that expert payment status is now 'C'. || Step 5: Release payment | Expected: Expert_payment_status = 'R' || Step 6: Unrelease payment | Expected: Expert_payment_status = 'C' || Step 7: Post payment | Expected: Expert_payment_status = 'O' || Step 8: Repeat for the other type of payments (Vendor, Employee, Client, Misc) || Step 9: Reconcile Payment | Expected: Expert_payment_status = 'M' || Step 10: Unreconcile Payment | Expected: Expert_payment_status = 'O' || Step 11: Cancel one of the payment | Expected: Expert_payment_status = 'X', with one reversal entry created with Expert_payment_status = 'M'

Title: Payment Items - Disbursement: Save validation
Steps: Step 1: Pre-Reqs A Client/Matter/Vendor which we can modify.Otherwise you will need to do the following in Expert Entity Managerfilling in required fields:- Create a new Client to attach a matter to- Create a new Matter which we will modify in following steps so you will need to know the matter uno    UPDATE TBM_MATTER     SET ALLOW_DISB = 'Y' -- Allow Disbursements    WHERE MATTER_UNO = YOUR_MATTER_UNO_HERE- Create a new Vendor. || Step 2: Matter allows Soft Disbursements only 1. Create a new Vendor Payment and fill in required fields2. Add a disbursement detail line to the Payment.3. Fill in required fields.4. Before saving set Matter to only allows only soft disbursements:    UPDATE TBM_MATTER     SET ALLOW_DISB = 'S' -- Only allow soft Disbursements    WHERE MATTER_UNO = YOUR_MATTER_UNO_HERE5. Click Save & Close and a validation error should appear on the detail line. Bug: 206354 - Can't set the allow disb to Hard or Soft for a matter SELECT m.CLNT_MATT_CODE,m.MATTER_UNO,m.STATUS_CODE,tm.ALLOW_DISB,tm.* FROM TBM_MATTER tmJOIN HBM_MATTER m on tm.MATTER_UNO = m.MATTER_UNOWHERE m.CLNT_MATT_CODE ='' | Expected: Error:  DISBDETAIL_CM_NOTAUTH_HARDThe CLient/Matter combination is not authorized to have hard disbursements || Step 3: Matter does not allow Disbursements 1. Select a matter that allows disbs SELECT tm.MATTER_UNO,tm.ALLOW_DISB,m.CLNT_MATT_CODE FROM TBM_MATTER tm JOIN HBM_MATTER m on tm.MATTER_UNO = m.MATTER_UNOWHERE ALLOW_DISB ='Y'2. Select to Add a New Disbursement3. Fill in the required fields4. Set the matter to not allow disbsUPDATE TBM_MATTER SET ALLOW_DISB = 'N' WHERE MATTER_UNO =4. Save and Close the Disbursement | Expected: Error:  DISBDETAIL_CM_NOAUTHDISBThe Client/Matter combination is not authorized to have disbursements || Step 4: Matter is inactiveIn Expert Entity Manager1. Matters | Matter | Details | Matter DetailsEnsure that the Active flag can be edited and is set to Active. If it cannot check that no closing date is set. You may need to ensure that all disbursements that reference this matter are deleted before saving.In Expert Accounts Payable2, Create a new Payment or use the existing Payment and add a new Disbursement detail line.3. Fill in required fields.In Expert Entity Manager4. Set the Matter Active flag to Inactive (unchecked) and Save.In Expert Accounts Payable5. Click Save & Close on the Disbursement | Expected: Error: DISBDETAIL_CM_INACTIVEThis Client/Matter combination is inactive. || Step 5: Client Entity Type is invalidIn SQL Server Management Studio1. Ensure the Client Entity Type of the Client you are using on Disbursements is set to 'C' or 'F'.    UPDATE CXV_CLIENT    SET SET_ENTITY_TYPE = 'C' -- Client    WHERE CLIENT_UNO = YOUR_CLIENT_UNO_HERE In Expert Accounts Payable2, Create a new Payment or use the existing Payment and add a new Disbursement detail line.3. Fill in required fields.In SQL Server Management Studio4. Ensure the Client Entity Type of the Client you are using on Disbursements is set to 'C' or 'F'.    UPDATE CXV_CLIENT    SET SET_ENTITY_TYPE = 'B' -- Billing Payor    WHERE CLIENT_UNO = YOUR_CLIENT_UNO_HEREIn Expert Accounts Payable5. Click Save & Close on the Disbursement | Expected: Error: DISBDETAIL_CM_INACTIVEThis Client/Matter combination is inactive. || Step 6: Authorizing Employee is invalidAuthorising employee can be set at client or matter level. As this is at matter level, if you set a different employee at both client and matter level, either is a valid authorizer. If one is not set then any employee can authorise otherwise is limited to those setDECLARE @clientmattercode as varchar (50) = 'TST1.1'DECLARE @matter as int = (SELECT MATTER_UNO FROM HBM_MATTER WHERE CLNT_MATT_CODE = @clientmattercode)DECLARE @client as int = (SELECT CLIENT_UNO FROM HBM_MATTER WHERE CLNT_MATT_CODE = @clientmattercode)SELECT TCA1.CLIENT_UNO,TCA1.MATTER_UNO,TCA1.ROW_UNO,TCA1.EMPL_UNO , emp.EMPLOYEE_NAMEFROM TBM_CLMAT_AUEMP TCA1 JOIN HBM_PERSNL emp on TCA1.EMPL_UNO = emp.EMPL_UNOWHERE TCA1.MATTER_UNO = @matter OR TCA1.CLIENT_UNO = @clientThis needs some workIn Expert Accounts Payable1, Create a new Payment or use the existing Payment and add a new Disbursement detail line.2. Set Authorizing Employee to Employee 1 and fill in required fields.In Expert Entity Manager3. Clients | Client | Other Employees | Authorizing EmployeesAdd Employee 2 to the Authorizing Employees list.In Expert Accounts Payable4. Click Save and Close. | Expected: Error: DISBDETAIL_AU_NOAUTH The Authorized By employee for this client or matter. || Step 7: Disbursement Date is outside the Matter Open/Close Date and Allow Disb Before Matter Open is false (unchecked).In Expert Accounts Payable1, Create a new Payment or use the existing Payment and add a new Disbursement detail line.  2. Set the Date field to a value before the Open date you will set in step 3.In SQL Server Management Studio3. Set the Open and Close dates with the following SQL.    UPDATE HBM_MATTER    SET OPEN_DATE = 'YYYY/MM/DD', CLOSE_DATE = 'YYYY/MM/DD'    WHERE MATTER_UNO = -- YOUR MATTER UNO HERE  NOTE: Setting a close date in Entity Manager will automatically set the Matter to inactive and is not appropriate for this test.In Expert Administration4, Disbursements | Disbursement Options | Firm OptionsEnsure "Allow Disb Before Matter Open" flag is unchecked.In Expert Accounts Payable5. Click Save and Close.Repeat this step with a disbursement date after the Close date you set in step 3. | Expected: Error: DISBDETAIL_TRAN_NOTWITHINThe TRANSACTION DATE is not within the Client/Matter's OPEN and CLOSE dates || Step 8: Disbursement Date is greater than the Matters Close Date and Allow Disb Before Matter Open is True (checked)In Expert Accounts Payable1, Create a new Payment or use the existing Payment and add a new Disbursement detail line.  2. Set the Date field to a value before the Open date you will set in step 3.In SQL Server Management Studio3. Set the Open and Close dates with the following SQL.    UPDATE HBM_MATTER    SET OPEN_DATE = 'YYYY/MM/DD', CLOSE_DATE = 'YYYY/MM/DD'    WHERE MATTER_UNO = -- YOUR MATTER UNO HERE  NOTE: Setting a close date in Entity Manager will automatically set the Matter to inactive and is not appropriate for this test. In Expert Administration4, Disbursements | Disbursement Options | Firm OptionsEnsure "Allow Disb Before Matter Open" flag is checked.In Expert Accounts Payable5. Click Save and Close. | Expected: Error: DISBDETAIL_TRAN_NOTLESSThe TRANSACTION DATE is not less than the Client/Matter's CLOSE date || Step 9: Transaction Date is outside the Employee Hire/Terminate DateIn Expert Accounts Payable1, Create a new Payment or use the existing Payment and add a new Disbursement detail line.  2. Set the Date field to a value before the hire date of the employee you will set in step 3.Set the Employee field to the employee you will modify in step 3.In SQL Server Management Studio3. Set the Hire and Terminate dates with the following SQL.    UPDATE HBM_PERSNL    SET HIRE_DATE = 'YYYY/MM/DD', TERMINATE_DATE = 'YYYY/MM/DD'    WHERE EMPLOYEE_CODE = -- YOUR EMPLOYEE UNO HERE  NOTE: Setting a terminate date in Entity Manager will automatically set the Employee to inactive and is not appropriate for this test.In Expert Accounts Payable4, Click Save and AddRepeat this step with a disbursement date after the Terminate date you set in step 3. | Expected: Error: DISBDETAIL_DATE_NOVALIDFOREMP The TRANSACTION DATE is not within this employee's HIRE and TERMINATION datesError: DISBDETAIL_DATE_NOVALIDFOREMP The TRANSACTION DATE is not within this employee's HIRE and TERMINATION datesBug 234244 - Employees without previous hire dates are always considered in a Disbursements Transaction Date || Step 10: Authorizing Employee is inactive 1. Matter has authorised employee set up2. Ensure you have used the employee previous to authorise a disb so that the employee is on the MRU list3. Create a payment4. Select to add a disb- enter the mandatory data- select the authorize by employee5. Inactivate the employee record6. Save & Close the Disbursement window. | Expected: Error: Inactive employee with code .... || Step 11: Task plan and phase/task not selectedNote: Add a plan to the matter via entity manager under the Time and Billing | Billing | Expected: Error:  WESSTUFF_PHUNO_REQUIRED || Step 12: Phase/task is not valid for matter plan codeNote: Add a plan to the matter via entity manager under the Time and Billing | Billing | Expected: Error: WESSTUFF_NOVALIDATE || Step 13: Disbursement Code not available1. Select allowed Disbursement codes in Entity Manager under Vendor tab2. Make new payment using the vendor that has limited disbursement codes3. Make a new disbursment detail line 4. In Enitity Manager, remove the disbursement code that you used in the invoice5. Resave the invoice in AP | Expected: Error: DISBURSEMENTAVAILABLE || Step 14: Max amount1. Add payment with the max base amount (99999999999999) then Save & Add the disb2. Repeat for a second disbSave fails in the background3. Cancel  the disb formFail to save error icon is displayed4. Reopen the the disb to the error | Expected: Error: Max amount reached Notes: Seems that the max allowed has been increased but not sure this is correct tho. Not failing in AP but not sure the ramifications in GL || Step 15: Vendor Limited Disb types1. Add limited accounts for a vendor (in entity manager)2. Add GL item3. Check that accounts are limited to those set in entity manager and choose one. Save & Close4. Remove the account it in Entity Manager and save there.5. Edit the GL item and save- amount | Expected: Error: Account is not valid for this vendor
