Title: Payment Items - Tax: Save Validation
Steps: Step 1: Inactive OfficeNote: Office comes from the payment's bankExample: Use bank BOJ1 which has an inactive office TOK | Expected: Error: Office in inactive or invalid || Step 2: Invalid Office/Dept linkNote: Office comes from payment's bankNote: Dept comes from tax code's recoverable accountNote: Links are set in Classic | General Ledger | G/L Setup | Links- Add a tax item where the account is not linked to the payment bank's office/tax item's dept | Expected: Error: Office, Department and Account are not linked || Step 3: Invalid Office/Prof linkNote: Office comes from payment's bankNote: Prof comes from tax code's recoverable accountNote: Links are set in Classic | General Ledger | G/L Setup | Links- Add a tax item where the account is not linked to the payment bank's office/tax item's prof center | Expected: Error: Office, Prof Center and Account are not linked

Title: Invoice - Tax Detail grid
Steps: Step 1: Run attached sql to check the screen value || Step 2: Tax ID || Step 3: Jurisidiction || Step 4: Tax Code || Step 5: Account || Step 6: Taxable Value || Step 7: Tax Amount || Step 8: Not DefaultedOffice DepartmentProfit CenterSource OfficeNarrativeEmployee

Title: Invoice - Tax detail form
Steps: Step 1: Field should be at the following order: || Step 2: Jurisidiction | Expected: List Control, default from Invoice Header. Required field. || Step 3: Taxable Value | Expected: Currency field. Limit to 14 digit || Step 4: Tax Code | Expected: Required with List control. || Step 5: Tax Value | Expected: Currency field. Limit to 14 digit.  <0 to save in credit field, >0 to save in debit field || Step 6: Read OnlyAccountEmployee Source OfficeOfficeDepartmentProfit Center | Expected: See attachment on where does it default from.Only Source Office and Office is populated on form initialization. The rest of the fields populated based on the Tax Code selected above.Employee availability depends on GLM_CHART.Emp_Reqd column. When Account require employee, this field will enabled, required and populated to setup in GLM_PARMS.SELECT ''[Source Office and Office],o.OFFC_CODE FROM APT_INVOICE invJOIN APL_APTYPE ap ON inv.APTYPE_CODE = ap.APTYPE_CODE JOIN TBM_BANK bk ON ap.BANK_CODE = bk.BANK_CODEJOIN HBL_OFFICE o ON bk.OFFC = o.OFFC_CODEWHERE inv.INVOICE_NUM = 'aug13'SELECT ''[Source Office and Office],o.OFFC_CODE  FROM APL_APTYPE apJOIN TBM_BANK bk ON ap.BANK_CODE = bk.BANK_CODEJOIN HBL_OFFICE o ON bk.OFFC = o.OFFC_CODEWHERE ap.APTYPE_CODE = 'INU' || Step 7: Narrative | Expected: No default.  Supports spellcheck and expansion codes. Up to 15000 characters

Title: Payment Items - matter credit: multi currency
Steps: Step 1: Pre preqs CAD Rates Rate: 1.092007784100000Reciprocal: 0.915744388053213 Matter 1Matter credit = USD 100 Matter 2Matter credit = CAD 100 | Expected: Matter 1 Credit ACT_TRAN_CR_MA.AMOUNT = 100.00 System currency because it's postedACT_TRAN_CR_MA.TC_AMOUNT = 100.00ACT_TRAN_CR_MA.TC_CODE = USDACT_TRAN_CR_MA.SIGN = 1ACT_TRAN_CR_MA.TRAN_TYPE = CR Matter 2 Credit ACT_TRAN_CR_MA.AMOUNT = 91.5744388053 System currency because it's postedACT_TRAN_CR_MA.TC_AMOUNT = 100.00ACT_TRAN_CR_MA.TC_CODE = CADACT_TRAN_CR_MA.SIGN = 1ACT_TRAN_CR_MA.TRAN_TYPE = CR DECLARE @clientmatter asVARCHAR (2000)=''DECLARE @displaycur asVARCHAR (10)='' DECLARE @matteruno asINT= (SELECT MATTER_UNO FROM HBM_MATTER WHERE CLNT_MATT_CODE = @clientmatter) --------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- Matter credits------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- -- Matter credits SELECT''[ACT_TRAN_CR_MA],cr.TRAN_UNO,chq.REQUEST_NUM,b.PREBILL_NUM,cr.PERIOD,mc.CREDIT_TYPE_DESC,cr.TRAN_TYPE,cr.SIGN,cr.AMOUNT,cr.TC_AMOUNT,cr.TC_CODE,m.CLNT_MATT_CODE,cr.MATTER_UNO,cr.DRUNO,cr.DATA_TYPE,cr.ROW_UNO,cr.LAST_MODIFIED--,cr.*FROM ACT_TRAN_CR_MA crJOIN HBM_MATTER m ON cr.MATTER_UNO = m.MATTER_UNOJOIN TBM_MULT_CREDIT mc ON cr.DATA_TYPE = mc.CREDIT_TYPELEFTJOIN BLT_BILL b ON cr.TRAN_UNO = b.TRAN_UNOLEFTJOIN APT_CHECK chq ON cr.TRAN_UNO = chq.TRAN_UNOINNERJOIN SplitByDelimiter (@clientmatter,',') s ON s.items = m.CLNT_MATT_CODEORDER BY cr.TRAN_UNO  -- Are there any unposted items? These will prevent using any more of the creditselect''[Number Unposted],count(*) [Matter Credits]from ACT_TRAN_CR_MA crJOIN HBM_MATTER m ON cr.MATTER_UNO = m.MATTER_UNOINNERJOIN SplitByDelimiter (@clientmatter,',') s ON s.items = m.CLNT_MATT_CODEwhere DATA_TYPE = 'C' and PERIOD = 0  EXEC [APP_CALCULATE_MATTER_BALANCES]@matteruno, @displaycur || Step 2: Add credit to CAD payment 1 from USD credit1. Create paymentType = ClientBank = CAD CurrencyAmount = C$202. Add creditClient/Matter = Matter 1Amount = C$10 | Expected: Details formBalance = C$109.20Available = C$109.20Remaining balance = C$10.00 Applied CreditACT_TRAN_CR_MA.AMOUNT = 10.00 Transaction currency because it's not postedACT_TRAN_CR_MA.TC_AMOUNT = 10.00ACT_TRAN_CR_MA.TC_CODE = CADACT_TRAN_CR_MA.SIGN = -1ACT_TRAN_CR_MA.TRAN_TYPE = CH SP: APP_CALCULATE_CLIENT_BALANCES (CAD)Balance = 109.20Available = 99.20 || Step 3: Add credit to CAD payment 1 from CAD credit1. Create paymentType = ClientBank = CAD Currency Amount = $202. Add creditClient/Matter = Matter 2Amount = C$10 | Expected: Details formBalance = C$100.00Available = C$100.00Remaining balance = C$0Bug 252013 - Payment: Matter credit - invalid error. Looks like it was attempting to insert a duplicate Applied CreditACT_TRAN_CR_MA.AMOUNT = 10.00ACT_TRAN_CR_MA.TC_AMOUNT = 10.00ACT_TRAN_CR_MA.TC_CODE = CADACT_TRAN_CR_MA.SIGN = 1ACT_TRAN_CR_MA.TRAN_TYPE = CH SP: APP_CALCULATE_CLIENT_BALANCES (CAD)Balance = 100.00Available = 90.00 || Step 4: Add credit to USD payment 2 from USD creditClient/Matter = Matter 1Amount = $10 | Expected: Details formError on matter due to unposted creditBalance = $100.00Available = $90.84 (100.00 - 9.1574438805) $90.00Remaining balance = C$20.00Bug 170495 - Matter Credit Item: Currency conversion issue with unposted itemsdjo - the above bug has not been fixed, but has been closed. The problem is a known one, and is the same in Classic. We cannot convert the previous CAD payment to USD as we do  SP: APP_CALCULATE_CLIENT_BALANCES (USD)Balance = 100.00Available = $90.84 (100.00 - 9.1574438805) $90.00not have a DRUNO to use for the conversion. || Step 5: Add credit to USD payment 2 from CAD creditClient/Matter = Matter 2Amount = $10 | Expected: Details formError on matter due to unposted creditBalance = $91.57Available = $82.42 (91.5744388053 - 9.1574438805) $81.57Remaining balance = C$20.00Bug 170495 - Matter Credit Item: Currency conversion issue with unposted items SP: APP_CALCULATE_CLIENT_BALANCES (CAD)Balance = 91.57Available = 82.42 (91.5744388053 - 9.1574438805) $81.57 || Step 6: Post payment 1 | Expected: Applied Credit from Matter 1ACT_TRAN_CR_MA.AMOUNT = 9.1574438805 System currency because it's postedACT_TRAN_CR_MA.TC_AMOUNT = 10.00ACT_TRAN_CR_MA.TC_CODE = CADACT_TRAN_CR_MA.SIGN = 1ACT_TRAN_CR_MA.TRAN_TYPE = CH Applied Credit from Matter 2ACT_TRAN_CR_MA.AMOUNT = 9.1574438805 System currency because it's postedACT_TRAN_CR_MA.TC_AMOUNT = 10.00ACT_TRAN_CR_MA.TC_CODE = CADACT_TRAN_CR_MA.SIGN = 1ACT_TRAN_CR_MA.TRAN_TYPE = CH || Step 7: Add credit to USD payment 2 from USD creditClient/Matter = Matter 1Amount = $10 | Expected: Details formBalance = $90.84Available = $90.84 Remaining balance = $10.00 Applied CreditACT_TRAN_CR_MA.AMOUNT = 10.00 Transaction currency because it's not postedACT_TRAN_CR_MA.TC_AMOUNT = 10.00ACT_TRAN_CR_MA.TC_CODE = CADACT_TRAN_CR_MA.SIGN = 1ACT_TRAN_CR_MA.TRAN_TYPE = CH SP: APP_CALCULATE_CLIENT_BALANCES (USD)Balance = 90.84Available = 80.84 || Step 8: Add credit to USD payment 2 from CAD creditClient/Matter = Matter 2Amount = $10 | Expected: Details formBalance = $82.42 82.41Available = $82.42 82.41Remaining balance = C$0 Applied CreditACT_TRAN_CR_MA.AMOUNT = 10.00 Transaction currency because it's not postedACT_TRAN_CR_MA.TC_AMOUNT = 10.00ACT_TRAN_CR_MA.TC_CODE = CADACT_TRAN_CR_MA.SIGN = 1ACT_TRAN_CR_MA.TRAN_TYPE = CH SP: APP_CALCULATE_CLIENT_BALANCES (USD)Balance = 82.42 82.41Available = 72.42 72.41 || Step 9: Post payment 2 | Expected: Applied Credit from Matter 1ACT_TRAN_CR_MA.AMOUNT = 10.00 System currency because it's postedACT_TRAN_CR_MA.TC_AMOUNT = 10.00ACT_TRAN_CR_MA.TC_CODE = USDACT_TRAN_CR_MA.SIGN = 1ACT_TRAN_CR_MA.TRAN_TYPE = CH Applied Credit from Matter 2ACT_TRAN_CR_MA.AMOUNT = 10.00 System currency because it's postedACT_TRAN_CR_MA.TC_AMOUNT = 10.00ACT_TRAN_CR_MA.TC_CODE = USDACT_TRAN_CR_MA.SIGN = 1ACT_TRAN_CR_MA.TRAN_TYPE = CH

Title: Payment Items - client credit: multi currency
Steps: Step 1: Pre preqs CAD RatesRate: 1.092007784100000Reciprocal: 0.915744388053213 Client 1Client credit = USD 100 Client 2Client credit = CAD 100 Payment 1Type = ClientBank = CAD CurrencyAmount = C$20 Payment 2Type = ClientBank = USD CurrencyAmount = $20 | Expected: Client 1 Credit ACT_TRAN_CR_CL.AMOUNT = 100.00 System currency because it's postedACT_TRAN_CR_CL.TC_AMOUNT = 100.00ACT_TRAN_CR_CL.TC_CODE = USDACT_TRAN_CR_CL.SIGN = 1ACT_TRAN_CR_CL.TRAN_TYPE = CR Client 2 Credit ACT_TRAN_CR_CL.AMOUNT = 91.5744388053  System currency because it's postedACT_TRAN_CR_CL.TC_AMOUNT = 100.00ACT_TRAN_CR_CL.TC_CODE = CADACT_TRAN_CR_CL.SIGN = 1ACT_TRAN_CR_CL.TRAN_TYPE = CR DECLARE @clientmatter asVARCHAR (2000)=''DECLARE @displaycur asVARCHAR (10)='' DECLARE @client asVARCHAR (2000)= (SELECT CLIENT_CODE FROM HBM_MATTER WHERE CLNT_MATT_CODE = @clientmatter)DECLARE @clientuno asINT= (SELECT CLIENT_UNO FROM HBM_MATTER WHERE CLNT_MATT_CODE = @clientmatter) --------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- Client credits--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- Client credits SELECT''[ACT_TRAN_CR_CL],cr.TRAN_UNO,chq.REQUEST_NUM,b.PREBILL_NUM,cr.PERIOD,mc.CREDIT_TYPE_DESC,cr.TRAN_TYPE,cr.SIGN,cr.AMOUNT,cr.TC_AMOUNT,cr.TC_CODE,c.CLIENT_CODE,cr.CLIENT_UNO,cr.DRUNO,cr.DATA_TYPE,cr.ROW_UNO,cr.LAST_MODIFIED--,cr.*FROM ACT_TRAN_CR_CL crJOIN HBM_CLIENT c ON cr.CLIENT_UNO = c.CLIENT_UNOJOIN TBM_MULT_CREDIT mc ON cr.DATA_TYPE = mc.CREDIT_TYPELEFTJOIN BLT_BILL b ON cr.TRAN_UNO = b.TRAN_UNOLEFTJOIN APT_CHECK chq ON cr.TRAN_UNO = chq.TRAN_UNOINNERJOIN SplitByDelimiter (@client,',') s ON s.items = c.CLIENT_CODEORDER BY cr.TRAN_UNO  -- Are there any unposted items? These will prevent using any more of the creditselect ''[Number Unposted],count(*)[Client Credits] from ACT_TRAN_CR_CL crJOIN HBM_CLIENT c ON cr.CLIENT_UNO = c.CLIENT_UNOINNERJOIN SplitByDelimiter (@client,',') s ON s.items = c.CLIENT_CODEwhere DATA_TYPE = 'C' and PERIOD = 0  EXEC [APP_CALCULATE_CLIENT_BALANCES] @clientuno, @displaycur || Step 2: Add credit to CAD payment 1 from USD credit Client = Client 1Amount = C$10 | Expected: Details formBalance = C$109.20Available = C$109.20Remaining balance = C$10.00 Applied CreditACT_TRAN_CR_CL.AMOUNT = 10.00 Transaction currency because it's not postedACT_TRAN_CR_CL.TC_AMOUNT = 10.00ACT_TRAN_CR_CL.TC_CODE = CADACT_TRAN_CR_CL.SIGN = -1 ACT_TRAN_CR_CL.TRAN_TYPE = CH SP: APP_CALCULATE_CLIENT_BALANCES (CAD)Balance = 109.20Available = 99.20 || Step 3: Add credit to CAD payment 1 from CAD credit Client = Client 2Amount = C$10 | Expected: Details formBalance = C$100.00Available = C$100.00Remaining balance = C$0 Applied CreditACT_TRAN_CR_CL.AMOUNT = 10.00ACT_TRAN_CR_CL.TC_AMOUNT = 10.00ACT_TRAN_CR_CL.TC_CODE = CADACT_TRAN_CR_CL.SIGN = -1ACT_TRAN_CR_CL.TRAN_TYPE = CH SP: APP_CALCULATE_CLIENT_BALANCES (CAD)Balance = 100.00Available = 90.00 || Step 4: Add credit to USD payment 2 from USD creditClient = Client 1Amount = $10 | Expected: Details formError on clientdue to unposted creditBalance = $100.00 Available = 90.84 (100.00 - 9.1574438805) $90.00Remaining balance = C$20.00 SP: APP_CALCULATE_CLIENT_BALANCES (USD)Balance = 100.00Available = $90.84 (100.00 - 9.1574438805) $90.00 Bug 170495 - Matter Credit Item: Currency conversion issue with unposted itemsdjo - this bug has not moved on since last regression, and Tonia has indicated that she does not want to do anything about this. The user cannot save the transaction - and we have no way of accurately calculating the outstanding balance || Step 5: Add credit to USD payment 2 from CAD creditClient = Client 2Amount = $10 | Expected: Details formError on clientdue to unposted creditBalance = $91.57Available = $82.42 (91.5744388053 - 9.1574438805) $81.57Remaining balance = C$20.00 SP: APP_CALCULATE_CLIENT_BALANCES (USD)Balance = 91.57Available = 82.42 (91.5744388053 - 9.1574438805) $81.57 Bug 170495 - Matter Credit Item: Currency conversion issue with unposted itemsdjo - as above || Step 6: Post payment 1 | Expected: Applied Credit from Client 1ACT_TRAN_CR_CL.AMOUNT = 9.1574438805 System currency because it's postedACT_TRAN_CR_CL.TC_AMOUNT = 10.00ACT_TRAN_CR_CL.TC_CODE = CADACT_TRAN_CR_CL.SIGN = 1ACT_TRAN_CR_.TRAN_TYPE = CH Applied Credit from Client 2ACT_TRAN_CR_CL.AMOUNT = 9.1574438805 System currency because it's postedACT_TRAN_CR_CL.TC_AMOUNT = 10.00ACT_TRAN_CR_CL.TC_CODE = CADACT_TRAN_CR_CL.SIGN = 1ACT_TRAN_CR_.TRAN_TYPE = CH( djo - sign should be -1 as above ) || Step 7: Add credit to USD payment 2 from USD credit Client = Client 1Amount = $10 | Expected: Details formBalance = $90.84Available = $90.84 Remaining balance = $10.00 Applied CreditACT_TRAN_CR_CL.AMOUNT = 10.00 Transaction currency because it's not postedACT_TRAN_CR_CL.TC_AMOUNT = 10.00ACT_TRAN_CR_CL.TC_CODE = CADACT_TRAN_CR_CL.SIGN = 1ACT_TRAN_CR_CL.TRAN_TYPE = CH SP: APP_CALCULATE_CLIENT_BALANCES (USD)Balance = 90.84Available = 80.84 || Step 8: Add credit to USD payment 2 from CAD credit Client = Client 2Amount = $10 | Expected: Details formBalance = $82.42 82.41Available = $82.42 82.41Remaining balance = C$0 Applied CreditACT_TRAN_CR_CL.AMOUNT = 10.00 Transaction currency because it's not postedACT_TRAN_CR_CL.TC_AMOUNT = 10.00ACT_TRAN_CR_CL.TC_CODE = CADACT_TRAN_CR_CL.SIGN = 1ACT_TRAN_CR_CL.TRAN_TYPE = CH SP: APP_CALCULATE_CLIENT_BALANCES (USD)Balance = 82.42 82.41Available = 72.42 72.41 Bug 170495 - Matter Credit Item: Currency conversion issue with unposted itemsdjo - with respect to the rounding above. We are showing the same values as classic for this scenario so we are calculating the values the same way. The issue seems to be that we are looking at each of the transaction for this credit and converting each to the target currency using the druno from the transaction. Each of these values is rounded, then they are summed to give the outstanding value. This is a different result to what you would get if you add the unrounded values then round the sum to 2 decimal places. The problem is that if the outstanding value is 82.4169... ( as in the scenario above ) and you then allow them to allocate 82.42, you are allowing them to overallocate. This MAY be picked up in the fx rounding routine, but I am not sure ( would require some testing ). This has not been reported from clients at this stage, so will not change it now.

Title: Payment Items - Matter Credit: Save Validation
Steps: Step 1: Amount < 0 1. Create a client payment2. Add a matter credit where the amount < 0 | Expected: Error: Amount can't be less than zero AMT_CANT BE LESS THAN ZEROCan no longer be tested via the UI as of 821 as the UI now does validation || Step 2: Amount = 0 1. Create a client payment2. Add a matter credit where the amount = 0 | Expected: Zero is allowed || Step 3: Payment where unposted matter credit exists on a payment1. Create a client payment2. Add a matter credit where the amount > 03. Create a second client payment4. Add a matter credit from the same matter for the same credit  type where the amount > 0 | Expected: Error: Unposted credit exists || Step 4: Posted Payment where unposted matter credit exists on a payment1. Create a client payment2. Add a matter credit where the amount > 03. Post the payment4. Create a second client payment5. Add a matter credit from the same matter for the same credit  type where the amount > 06. Open the matter credit on the first payment | Expected: No alerts on the posted paymentThe payment details are not revalidated so no alerts are displayed || Step 5: Payment where unposted matter credit exists on a bill1. Create a bill2. Add a matter credit where the amount > 03. Create a client payment4. Add a matter credit from the same matter for the same credit  type where the amount > 0 | Expected: Error: Unposted credit exists || Step 6: Amount is more than avail balance1. Create a client payment that is not system currency2. Add a matter credit where the amount > avail balance | Expected: Error: Amount is greater than available funds || Step 7: Inactive matter - line item 822 EX0011Note: This test is here because there is a restriction for Billing and AR but not for AP1. Create a payment with header details and don't save2. Add a matter credit and don't save3. Inactive that matter used for the line item4. Save | Expected: Payment is saved with no errors

Title: Invoice - Tax detail form validation
Steps: Step 1: Entering tax with Tax code not having recoverable offsets on current book which invoices header uses. | Expected: Validation error on Tax code field with error message :'No recoverable Tax Control Account for Book % and Tax Code %' || Step 2: Entering tax with Tax code which recoverable tax account is set to subledger | Expected: Subledger account is allowed, changes made in below bug.Bug 170813: Tax Details - Incorrect Subledger Account validation being applied to General ledger Account - fixed || Step 3: Entering tax with zero Tax Amount | Expected: Zero Tax Amount allowed. || Step 4: Entering tax with office not mapped on interbook mapping | Expected: Validation error  on saving tax detail with error message : 'The selected Office participated in Book(s) % and does not have a Destination Account(s) mapped.' || Step 5: Entering tax with invalid office department link | Expected: Validation error on saving tax detail with error message : 'The Office, Department, and Account are not linked' || Step 6: Entering tax with invalid office department link on destination book | Expected: Validation error on saving tax detail with error message : 'The Office, Department, and Destination Account % are not linked for the Destination Book 1000.' || Step 7: Entering tax with invalid office profit center link | Expected: Validation error  on saving tax detail with error message : 'The Office, Profit Center, and Account are not linked'Bug 182574: Supplier Invoice Entry - If an office is used that is not a member of the book on the invoice header, the system will not allow the entry - fixed || Step 8: Entering tax with invalid office profit center linkon destination book | Expected: Validation error on saving tax detail with error message : 'The Office, Profit Center, and Destination Account % are not linked for the Destination Book 1000.' || Step 9: Entering tax with Profit center not attached to the Department, follow below steps: 1. Create a tax detail line in Invoice. Note what profit center and department the tax code that auto populate2. Unlink a profit center for a department in Expert Admin->Hub Setup-> Firm Setup->Departments from step 13. Re-save the tax detail dialog, | Expected: It should have a validation message.Validation error on saving tax detail with error message: 'Profit Centre is not attached to the department.' Upon resaving tax detail line with validation error message Expert AP app should not crashBug 279139: Expert Accounts Payable detail line save in detail edit dialog crashes AP when there is an existing validation error || Step 10: Entering tax then change employee code when CMS_OPTION.JE_ODPC_DEF = 'Y' | Expected: The changing of employee should not effect the Office, Department, and Profit Center.

Title: Jobs: Recent Activites grid
Steps: Step 1: General Checks | Expected: * Tabbing* Scroll bars* Column sorting* Row selection* Grouping* Numbers, amounts and dates right aligned* Text left aligned* Money displays currency symbol* Date has time* Status displays text || Step 2: Select | Expected: * select all * reverse * select * select none * Shift + click - selects all between the two selected * Ctrl + A - selects all || Step 3: Customising the columns | Expected: * Available columns (settings maintained)* Column order (settings maintained)* Column width (settings maintained)* Freeze columns (settings maintained) || Step 4: Right click menu | Expected: * Select All* Select None* Reverse Select-----------------------* Columns* Grouping* Freeze Columns || Step 5: Messages | Expected: * Messages display while job is running || Step 6: Alerts | Expected: * Number of errors is populated* Select of Job displays it's associated alerts in the alert grid || Step 7: Icons | Expected: * Icons are displayed for Completed with errorsCompleted with no errorsCanceled || Step 8: Clear selected jobs | Expected: * Sets the selected jobs to reviewed so they won't display on the gridAPE_JOB_QUEUE.IS_REVIEWED || Step 9: Clear all jobs | Expected: * Sets all jobs to reviewed so they won't display on the gridAPE_JOB_QUEUE.IS_REVIEWED

Title: Accounts Payable Automated Sanity Test
Steps: Step 1: Create Simple InvoiceCreate New Invoice from Invoice List screen ribbon.Fill in all required fields.Add a GL and Disbursement detail line. The detail line total must equal to invoice amount to proceed.Release Invoice.Post Invoice.Cancel Invoice. || Step 2: Create Simple Vendor InvoiceCreate New Vendor Payment from Payments List screen ribbon.Fill in all required fields.Add a GL and Disbursement detail line. The detail line total must equal to payment amount to proceed.Release Payment. || Step 3: Create Vendor Payment ScheduleCreate New Vendor Payment Schedule from Payment Schedule List screen ribbon.Fill in all required fields.Open up Add Single Invoice form.Cancel the form.Open up Add Multiple Invoices form.Cancel the form.

Title: Invoice: Security Roles
Steps: Step 1: Pre reqs User must have ExpertAccountsPayableApplication role assigned || Step 2: CreateInvoice | Expected: Allowed when user has the role assigned, otherwise not allowed Note: Using the enter button on the keyboard repects the security setting Using the double click respects the security setting Buttons/Right Click Menu allowed in grid - New Invoice - Open Invoice- Quick Pay Short cut keys allowed in grid - Ctrl+0 (Open) Functionality allowed in invoice- Save, Save & Close, Close & Add, Delete, Quick Pay || Step 3: CreatePaymentSchedule | Expected: Allowed when user has the role assigned, otherwise not allowed Buttons allowed in grid - Create Payment Schedule || Step 4: CancelInvoice | Expected: Allowed when user has the role assigned, otherwise not allowed Buttons/Right Click Menu allowed in grid - Cancel Functionality allowed in Invoice- Cancel || Step 5: DeleteInvoice | Expected: Note: This was removed so make sure it isn't avail in security manager (will be if you upgraded during the dev cycle) || Step 6: EditPostedInvoiceMust have CreateInvoice | Expected: Allowed when user has the role assigned, otherwise not allowed Functionality allowed in invoice- Edit Invoice (button is displayed) Bug - 206574 - Invoices - Edit posted invoice button is not visible when user doesn't have the CreateInvoice permissionNote - The above bug was reviewed, and although not as designed, current functionality is acceptable. TK 05/12/19 || Step 7: InvoiceImport | Expected: Allowed when user has the role assigned, otherwise not allowed Buttons allowed in grid - Invoice Import Functionality allowed in invoice- Invoice Import || Step 8: ReleaseInvoice | Expected: Allowed when user has the role assigned, otherwise not allowed Buttons/Right Click Menu allowed in grid - Release Functionality allowed in invoice- Release || Step 9: PostInvoice | Expected: Allowed when user has the role assigned, otherwise not allowed Buttons/Right Click Menu allowed in grid - Post Functionality allowed in invoice- Post || Step 10: ViewInvoiceRemove CreateInvoice to see this working | Expected: Allowed when user has the role assigned, otherwise not allowedNote: Using the enter button on the keyboard repects the security setting Using the double click respects the security setting Buttons/Right Click Menu allowed in grid - Open Short cut keys allowed in grid - Ctrl+0 (Open) Functionality allowed in invoice- view in read only mode

Title: Invoice Edit - Editibility Unreleased / Released Invoices.
Steps: Step 1: Make a new Invoice | Expected: All fields editable apart from*Tax claim date - requires Tax report to be Hold*Bank - requires bank account details to be attached to the vendor || Step 2: Unreleased Invoices. | Expected: All fields are editable as long as user have CreateInvoice security permission. || Step 3: Release Invoices. | Expected: All fields are NOT editable. Regardless of any security permission is available

Title: Invoice Edit - Posted Invoice - Edit Invoice button on ribbon validation
Area: ExpertSuite\Financials\Accounts Payable\Invoices\Invoice Entry and Edit\Posted Invoice Edit
Steps: Step 1: Paid Invoice. | Expected: Edit Invoice button enabledOnly these fields are available :Invoice NumberTax ReportTax Claim Date || Step 2: Invoice on a payment or schedule | Expected: Edit Invoice button enabledOnly these fields are available :Invoice NumberTax ReportTax Claim Date || Step 3: Posted invoice not paid and not on schedule run | Expected: Can be edit, Edit Invoice ribbon enabled when user have EditPostedInvoice permission. || Step 4: Posted invoice | Expected: Edit Invoice button enabled.See TC 171458 for editable fields || Step 5: Unposted invoice (Include Incomplete, Complete, Released invoices) | Expected: Can be edit but not through Edit Invoice ribbon.

Steps: Step 1: Require CreateInvoice + EditPostedInvoice security permission. || Step 2: Listed below are fields available to edit on a Posted Invoice. || Step 3: When invoice is not in payment : || Step 4: Invoice Number | Expected: Validates duplication || Step 5: Invoice Date | Expected: Re-evaluation of discount values confirmation dialog pops up.If clicked Yes, Due Date, Discount Date and Discount Amount will be recalculated based on new term code.If clicked No, none of these fields are recalculated. || Step 6: Reference | Expected: No extra validation when edit. || Step 7: Payment Terms | Expected: Re-evaluation of discount values confirmation dialog pops up.If clicked Yes, Due Date, Discount Date and Discount Amount will be recalculated based on new term code.If clicked No, none of these fields are recalculated. || Step 8: Hold Date | Expected: No extra validation when edit. || Step 9: Discount Date | Expected: No extra validation when edit. || Step 10: Due Date | Expected: No extra validation when edit. || Step 11: Discount Amount | Expected: No extra validation when edit. || Step 12: 1099 Amount | Expected: No extra validation when edit. || Step 13: 1099 Type | Expected: No extra validation when edit. || Step 14: Sales & Use Tax | Expected: No extra validation when edit. || Step 15: Tax Report | Expected: When changed from Claim to Hold, Tax Claim Date become available. || Step 16: Tax Claim Date | Expected: When Tax Report change from Hold to Claim, this field will be removed and default to Null in database. || Step 17: Use Name / Address Override | Expected: No extra validation when edit. || Step 18: Client Bill Payment Reqd | Expected: No extra validation when edit. || Step 19: Withhold Tax | Expected: No extra validation when edit. || Step 20: Withhold State Tax | Expected: No extra validation when edit. || Step 21: Separate Check | Expected: No extra validation when edit. || Step 22: Narrative | Expected: No extra validation when edit. || Step 23: Bank details | Expected: In the user story, we can change the bank details. But Mark assured us that they are not editable. Raised as bug 172937 || Step 24: All other fields include the detail grids and forms are not editable. || Step 26: When invoice is in payment || Step 27: Invoice Number | Expected: Validates duplication || Step 28: Tax Report | Expected: When changed from Claim to Hold, Tax Claim Date become available. || Step 29: Tax Claim Date | Expected: When Tax Report change from Hold to Claim, this field will be removed and default to Null in database.

Title: Jobs: Payment Performance WAITING FOR NEW BUILD
Steps: Step 1: Release 2000 payments | Expected: Approx 3 mins 50 seconds || Step 2: Print 2000 check payments | Expected: Bug 171514 - Jobs: Print has service failure at approx 10 mins into the processing || Step 3: Post 2000 payments | Expected: Not working well so need to retest after next build || Step 4: Print 2000 with remittance to email | Expected: Crashes the app sometimes so need new build

Title: Jobs: Release Payments
Steps: Step 1: Note: As the job process is quick, there is no time to check that the lock occurred so need to check using sql profilter: search for: sp_cmsmakelockcio || Step 2: General | Expected: * Job created from grid no matter how many items selected || Step 3: Start job | Expected: Job runs* Local notification sent so notification form displays * Job starts processing* Each item is locked, processed then unlocked- Lock Owner = B- lock applied with 20 min expiry* Job status = R while processing* Service sends notifications to notification form and recent activity grid* All selected items processed* Job status = C when completed* There are no orphaned locks when job is completed* Grid refreshed at end of job---------------------------------------------------------------------- Get the most recent job--------------------------------------------------------------------DECLARE @job asintSET @job = (SELECTTOP (1) JOB_QUEUE_UNO FROM APE_JOB_QUEUE ORDERBY JOB_QUEUE_UNO DESC)--SET @job = 3032---------------------------------------------------------------------- Job--------------------------------------------------------------------SELECT'JOB'[JOB],j.JOB_QUEUE_UNO,j.JOB_PARAMETER_UNO,j.JOB_TYPE,j.JOB_STATUS,UPDATE_MESSAGE,j.TOTAL_ITEMS,j.PROCESSED_ITEMS,FAILED_ITEMS,ERROR_COUNT,j.INITIATED_BY, IS_REVIEWED,IS_CANCELLED,DATEDIFF(mi,j.INITIATED_DATE,j.LAST_MODIFIED)[Process Mins],j.INITIATED_DATE,j.LAST_MODIFIEDFROM APE_JOB_QUEUE j WHERE j.JOB_QUEUE_UNO = @job --AND JOB_TYPE = 'PAYPRTCH'ORDER BY j.JOB_QUEUE_UNO DESC ---------------------------------------------------------------------- Parameters--------------------------------------------------------------------SELECT jp.* FROM APE_JOB_PARAMETER jpLEFTJOIN APE_JOB_QUEUE j ON j.JOB_PARAMETER_UNO = jp.JOB_PARAMETER_UNOWHERE j.JOB_QUEUE_UNO = @job---------------------------------------------------------------------- PAYMENT ALERTS--------------------------------------------------------------------SELECTDISTINCT'ALERTS'[ALERTS],a.SOURCE_TYPE,a.SOURCE_UNO,chq.REQUEST_NUM,a.MESSAGE_KEY,a.MESSAGE_CONTEXT,a.MESSAGE_INTERNAL,a.JOB_QUEUE_UNO, a.JOB_ALERT_UNO,a.ALERT_LEVEL,a.CREATE_DATEFROM APE_JOB_ALERT aLEFTJOIN APE_JOB_ALERT j ON j.JOB_QUEUE_UNO = a.JOB_QUEUE_UNOLEFTJOIN APT_CHECK chq ON a.SOURCE_UNO = chq.TRAN_UNO AND a.SOURCE_TYPE ='PAY'LEFTJOIN APT_INVOICE inv ON a.SOURCE_UNO = inv.TRAN_UNO AND a.SOURCE_TYPE ='INV'WHERE a.JOB_QUEUE_UNO = @jobORDERBY a.JOB_QUEUE_UNO DESC,a.SOURCE_UNO--, a.ALERT_UNO DESC || Step 4: Cancel JobCreate a volume of payments so you can see the multiple processing steps display in  the recent activities grid | Expected: Job is canceled* Job status = X* Jobs stops processing* There are no orphaned locks when job is stopped* Grid refreshed at end of job

job---------------------------------------------------------------------- Get the most recent job--------------------------------------------------------------------DECLARE @job asintSET @job = (SELECTTOP (1) JOB_QUEUE_UNO FROM APE_JOB_QUEUE ORDERBY JOB_QUEUE_UNO DESC)--SET @job = 3032---------------------------------------------------------------------- Job--------------------------------------------------------------------SELECT'JOB'[JOB],j.JOB_QUEUE_UNO,j.JOB_PARAMETER_UNO,j.JOB_TYPE,j.JOB_STATUS,UPDATE_MESSAGE,j.TOTAL_ITEMS,j.PROCESSED_ITEMS,FAILED_ITEMS,ERROR_COUNT,j.INITIATED_BY, IS_REVIEWED,IS_CANCELLED,DATEDIFF(mi,j.INITIATED_DATE,j.LAST_MODIFIED)[Process Mins],j.INITIATED_DATE,j.LAST_MODIFIEDFROM APE_JOB_QUEUE j WHERE j.JOB_QUEUE_UNO = @job --AND JOB_TYPE = 'PAYPRTCH'ORDER BY j.JOB_QUEUE_UNO DESC ---------------------------------------------------------------------- Parameters--------------------------------------------------------------------SELECT jp.* FROM APE_JOB_PARAMETER jpLEFTJOIN APE_JOB_QUEUE j ON j.JOB_PARAMETER_UNO = jp.JOB_PARAMETER_UNOWHERE j.JOB_QUEUE_UNO = @job---------------------------------------------------------------------- PAYMENT ALERTS--------------------------------------------------------------------SELECTDISTINCT'ALERTS'[ALERTS],a.SOURCE_TYPE,a.SOURCE_UNO,chq.REQUEST_NUM,a.MESSAGE_KEY,a.MESSAGE_CONTEXT,a.MESSAGE_INTERNAL,a.JOB_QUEUE_UNO, a.JOB_ALERT_UNO,a.ALERT_LEVEL,a.CREATE_DATEFROM APE_JOB_ALERT aLEFTJOIN APE_JOB_ALERT j ON j.JOB_QUEUE_UNO = a.JOB_QUEUE_UNOLEFTJOIN APT_CHECK chq ON a.SOURCE_UNO = chq.TRAN_UNO AND a.SOURCE_TYPE ='PAY'LEFTJOIN APT_INVOICE inv ON a.SOURCE_UNO = inv.TRAN_UNO AND a.SOURCE_TYPE ='INV'WHERE a.JOB_QUEUE_UNO = @jobORDERBY a.JOB_QUEUE_UNO DESC,a.SOURCE_UNO--, a.ALERT_UNO DESC || Step 4: Cancel JobCreate a volume of payments so you can see the multiple processing steps display in  the recent activities grid | Expected: Job is canceled* Job status = X* Jobs stops processing* There are no orphaned locks when job is stopped* Grid refreshed at end of job

From 82sp2* seperate test case for the default value (default based on invoice and system settings)* can be edited* must be >= 0 * Can't be greater than invoice balance || Step 5: Discount amount | Expected: * seperate test case for the default value (default from invoice)* can be edited* must be >= 0 * Can't be greater than invoice balance || Step 6: 1099 amount | Expected: * seperate test case for the default value (default from invoice)* Must be  <= (payment amount + withheld amount) || Step 7: Payment amount (on invoice details) | Expected: * seperate test case for the default value* can be edited* payment amount + discount + withheld must be <= balance remaining as per the balance displayed || Step 8: Today's date < hold date | Expected: Warning: Today's date is less than the hold date. Do you want to continue?INVPMT_EARLYPYMT || Step 9: State Withheld Amt (from 82sp2) | Expected: *Hidden when CMS_OPTION.OPTION_CODE = 'ST_WHTAX' is N*Disable when form initialize. enable when selected invoice has State Withhold Tax flag checked.*separate test case for the default value*can be edited*must be >= 0*Can't be greater than invoice balance*Field reset/recalculate when changing invoice

Steps: Step 1: Vendor with GL Default only | Expected: GL line defaulted || Step 2: Vendor with inactive GL account as default. | Expected: GL line still getting defaulted but with validation error. || Step 3: Vendor with GL and FPCC Default | Expected: When FPCC flag unchecked, GL line defaultedWhen FPCC flag checked, GL line NOT defaulted || Step 4: Vendor with two lines of GL Defaults, each line setup for different Book*Change the default Book before entering Invoice Amount field to get the right GL line defaulted. | Expected: When using Book 1, GL line default to setup for Book 1.When using multi-book, GL line default to setup for that selected book on invoice header.*Bug 175530 GL line not default when using multi-book - fixed || Step 5: Vendor with GL Plan default with GL plan having multiple accounts set up. | Expected: All GL rows of multiple accounts defaulted. The value percentage distributed as expected. || Step 6: Vendor with GL Plan default for different Book | Expected: When using Book 1, GL line default to setup for Book 1.When using multi-book, GL line default to setup for that selected book on invoice header.*Bug 175530 GL line not default when using multi-book - fixed || Step 7: Vendor with GL Plan default but GL Plan inactive | Expected: Still default regardless if the plan is inactive or not. Title: AP Setup - Payment Terms
Steps: Step 1: Look and Feel and Validation | Expected: New format's fields are displayed* Active flag defaults to on* Invoice Due is defaulted to 'Number of days after invoice date'* Validation:- Code: max length = 4 - Code: can't be a duplicate- Description: max length = 80* Last 3 fields display for 'Number of days after invoice date':- Invoice Due Days (mandatory, max value is 999)- Discount days (max value is 999)- Discount % (mandatory, must be between 0 and 100)* Last 3 fields display for 'Specified day of the following month':- Invoice Due Days (disabled)- Day of following month (max value is 999)- Discount % (mandatory, must be between 0 and 100) || Step 2: Create for 'Number of days after invoice date'- Code- Description- Invoice due = 'Number of days after invoice date'- Invoice due days- Discount days- Discount % | Expected: Record is created- Code is not editable- Term type saved as: N- Invoice due days saved to: NET_DUE_DAYS- Discount days saved to : TERM_DAY- Discount % saved to DISC_PCNT DECLARE @payterm as varchar (4)='YOUR_TEST_CODE_HERE'SELECT DISCTERM_CODE,DISCTERM_DESC,INACTIVE,TERM_TYPE,TERM_DAY,NET_DUE_DAYS,DISC_PCNT,LAST_MODIFIEDFROM APL_DISCTERM AD1 WHERE  AD1.DISCTERM_CODE = @payterm || Step 3: Create for 'Specified day of the following month'- Code- Description- Invoice due = 'Specified day of the following month'- Day of following month- Discount % | Expected: Record is created- Code is not editable- Term type saved as: D- Invoice due days value of 0 saved to: NET_DUE_DAYS- Day of following month saved to : TERM_DAY- Discount % saved to DISC_PCNT || Step 4: Edit the details and save- change invoice due- Change all other editable fields | Expected: Changes are saved- When changing from 'Number of days after invoice date' to 'Specified day of the following month' then Invoice due days needs to default to 0 otherwise the save will fail || Step 5: Inactivate/Activate | Expected: Record is Inactivated/Activated || Step 6: Delete a Payment Term | Expected: Record is deleted || Step 7: Attempt to delete a Payment Term that is being used | Expected: Error messageCan't delete Payment term as it's being used

Title: Payment Items - Invoice: Add/Edit/Delete
Steps: Step 1: Pre preqs Invoice 1- Has a GL item - Has a disb- Has a tax item- Invoice is Posted- On Payment Schedule 1 Invoice 2- Not on a schedule- Has a GL item- Invoice is PostedPayment Schedule 1- Type: Vendor- Payment Date: Today- Date to Print: Today- Invoice 1 has been added. | Expected: Use: INV - tables.sqlInvoice 1APT_INVOICE1 RowEXPERT_INVOICE_STATUS = OINVOICE_STATUS = OEXP_RPT_STATUS = NULL Classic is empty but Dave is Ok with this SCHEDULE_NUM = the number of the Payment Schedule 1 APT_INVOICE_AMT 2 RowsINV_TRAN_UNO = Invoice 1.TRAN_UNOTRAN_TYPE = CHAND INV_TRAN_UNO = Invoice 1.TRAN_UNOTRAN_TYPE = APNote: This step suggested there should only be one row here. This is true until the point where Invoice 1 is added to Payment Schedule 1 at which point a second line is created. I have modified this step- Sam P CDT_DISB1 RowSOURCE_TRAN_TYPE = APSOURCE_TRAN_UNO = Invoice 1.TRAN_UNO CDT_DISB_NEW1 RowSOURCE_TRAN_TYPE = APSOURCE_TRAN_UNO = Invoice 1.TRAN_UNO ACT_TRAN_JE2 Rows (1 for TAX, 1 for GL)SOURCE_TRAN_TYPE = APTRAN_UNO = Invoice 1.TRAN_UNOACCT_UNO = 151 (GL)ANDSOURCE_TRAN_TYPE = APTRAN_UNO = Invoice 1.TRAN_UNOACCT_UNO = 353 (TAX)Invoice 2APT_INVOICE1 RowEXPERT_INVOICE_STATUS = OINVOICE_STATUS = OEXP_RPT_STATUS = NULL Classic is empty but Dave is Ok with this SCHEDULE_NUM = 0 APT_INVOICE_AMT1 RowINV_TRAN_UNO = Invoice 2.TRAN_UNO TRAN_TYPE = AP ACT_TRAN_JE 1 RowINV_TRAN_UNO = Invoice 2.TRAN_UNO TRAN_TYPE = APACCT_UNO = 151 (GL)--Useful Script-- Set your invoice ids hereDECLARE @invoiceId1 AS INT = 1959DECLARE @invoiceId2 AS INT = @invoiceId1 + 1-- APT_INVOICESELECT CASE TRAN_UNO WHEN @invoiceId1 THEN 'Invoice 1' WHEN @invoiceId2 THEN 'Invoice 2' END as INVOICE, EXPERT_INVOICE_STATUS, INVOICE_STATUS, EXP_RPT_STATUS, SCHEDULE_NUM, * FROM APT_INVOICE WHERE TRAN_UNO IN (@invoiceId1 , @invoiceId2)ORDER BY LAST_MODIFIED DESC-- APT_INVOICE_AMTSELECT CASE INV_TRAN_UNO WHEN @invoiceId1 THEN 'Invoice 1'WHEN @invoiceId2 THEN 'Invoice 2'END as Title: Payment - Remittance: copy for ExpertImage
Steps: Step 1: Note: There is an issue which requires you to have to save the Expert Imaging Admin after a  deployment in order to populate the view FirmModel.ExpertImageAdmin | System | Expert ImagingMake a change and then change it back and save || Step 2: Set Expert Image OnAdmin | System | Expert Imaging| Accounts Payable || Step 3: Print a non check payment1. Select to print a completed electronic, wire or manual payment2. Proceed throught the print options screen and print the remittance | Expected: Copy of the PDF file in ExpertImage folder- Print remittance process is completed- PDF is created - Copy of the PDF is copied to the ExpertImage folderSELECT * FROM CMS_UNIQUE_KEYS WHERE TBNAME ='APT_CHECK.PRINT_SESSION'SELECT * FROM DDM_PATHSSELECT * FROM DDS_DRAFTSELECT * FROM APT_CHECK_FORM WHERE BANK_CODE = '' AND CHECK_NUM = EXECSECURITY.SetContextByName ''SELECT n.Path,n.Name,v.Content,v.Scope,v.UserOrGroupDisplayName,v.Id FROM Configuration.ConfigName n INNERJOIN Configuration.ConfigValue v ON n.Id = v.NameIdWHERE Path LIKE 'Technical.Applications.ExpertAccountsPayable.Options.ExpertImage%' || Step 4: Print the same again1. Select to print a completed electronic, wire or manual payment2. Proceed throught the print options screen and print the remittance | Expected: Copy of the PDF file in ExpertImage folder- Print remittance process is completed- PDF is created - Copy of the PDF is copied to the ExpertImage folder and overwrites the original file

Title: Performance - Create EB Files
Steps: Step 1: Pre req data Vendor 1- Bank Account for bank that will be used on payments Vendor 2- Bank Account for bank that will be used on payments- bank account is for same payment type as vendor 1's Vendor 3- Bank Account for bank that will be used on - bank account is for different payment type than vendor 1's 2000 wire payments All on same bankSome for each of the 3 vendorsStatus = ReleasedDisbs = 10GL = 10 SELECT distinct n.NAME,ven.VENDOR_ID,c.CLIENT_CODE,p.EMPLOYEE_CODE,ba.BANK_CODE,ba.IS_DEFAULT[BA Default],ba.INACTIVE[BA Inactive],bs.BANKING_SYSTEM_CODE,bs.INACTIVE[BS Inactive],bs.IS_DEFAULT[BS Default],ba.PAYMENT_TYPE_CODE,ptlink.CH_FMT,pt.INACTIVE[PT Inactive],ptlink.IS_DEFAULT[PT Default],ba.SEGMENT_1,ba.SEGMENT_2,ba.SEGMENT_3,ba.SEGMENT_4,ba.SEGMENT_5,ba.SEGMENT_6,ba.SEGMENT_7,ba.SEGMENT_8,ba.SEGMENT_9,ba.SEGMENT_10,ba.NAME_UNO,ba.BANK_ACCOUNT_UNO,ba.LAST_MODIFIED FROM HBA_NAME_BANK_ACCOUNT baJOIN HBM_NAME n on ba.NAME_UNO = n.NAME_UNOLEFT JOIN APM_VENDOR ven on ba.NAME_UNO = ven.NAME_UNOLEFT JOIN HBM_CLIENT c ON ba.NAME_UNO = c.NAME_UNOLEFT JOIN HBM_PERSNL p ON ba.NAME_UNO = p.NAME_UNO JOIN HBL_BANK_PAYTYP pt ON ba.PAYMENT_TYPE_CODE = pt.PAYTYP_CODEJOIN HBL_BANKING_SYSTEM bs ON pt.BANKING_SYSTEM_UNO = bs.BANKING_SYSTEM_UNOJOIN HBA_BANK_PAYTYP ptlink ON ba.PAYMENT_TYPE_CODE = ptlink.PAYTYP_CODE AND ba.BANK_CODE = ptlink.BANK_CODEORDER BY n.NAME, bs.BANKING_SYSTEM_CODE,ba.PAYMENT_TYPE_CODE UPDATE HBA_NAME_BANK_ACCOUNT SET IS_DEFAULT = 'Y' WHERE BANK_ACCOUNT_UNO IN () || Step 2: Make sure actual printing is turned off or select a fake printer from the network | Expected: EXEC SECURITY.SetContextByName ''SELECT n.Path,n.Name,v.Content,v.Scope,v.UserOrGroupDisplayName,v.Id FROM Configuration.ConfigName n INNER JOIN Configuration.ConfigValue v ON n.Id = v.NameIdWHERE Path LIKE 'Technical.Applications.ExpertAccountsPayable.Options%'AND NAME = 'PrintingEnabled' || Step 3: Create a payment using Quick Pay option in Invoice Grid | Expected: Performance environment 4 mins 23 secs - using version 824SP4 20/03/2024. || Step 4: 2000 payments same vendor | Expected: Performance environment2 mins - using version 822- using version 822 EX0006 21/6/2021 Create bank file grid took 2 mins 50 secs to load20 secs- using version 822 EX0007 6/9/2021 Create bank file grid took 1 mins 20 secs to load1 1/2 mins - using version 822 EX0011 9/5/2023  24 secs - using version 824SP4 20/03/202417 secs - using version 824SP4 recreated Bank file 21/03/2024 || Step 5: 2000 payments 3 vendorsSelect to create bank files using the bank of the payments Pre req data Vendor 1- Bank Account for bank that will be used on payments Vendor 2- Bank Account for bank that will be used on payments- bank account is for same payment type as vendor 1's Vendor 3- Bank Account for bank that will be used on - bank account is for different payment type than vendor 1's 2000 wire payments All on same bankSome for each of the 3 vendorsStatus = ReleasedDisbs = 10GL = 10 SELECTdistinct n.NAME,ven.VENDOR_ID,c.CLIENT_CODE,p.EMPLOYEE_CODE,ba.BANK_CODE,ba.IS_DEFAULT[BA Default],ba.INACTIVE[BA Inactive],bs.BANKING_SYSTEM_CODE,bs.INACTIVE[BS Inactive],bs.IS_DEFAULT[BS Default],ba.PAYMENT_TYPE_CODE,ptlink.CH_FMT,pt.INACTIVE[PT Inactive],ptlink.IS_DEFAULT[PT Default],ba.SEGMENT_1,ba.SEGMENT_2,ba.SEGMENT_3,ba.SEGMENT_4,ba.SEGMENT_5,ba.SEGMENT_6,ba.SEGMENT_7,ba.SEGMENT_8,ba.SEGMENT_9,ba.SEGMENT_10,ba.NAME_UNO,ba.BANK_ACCOUNT_UNO,ba.LAST_MODIFIED FROM HBA_NAME_BANK_ACCOUNT baJOIN HBM_NAME n on ba.NAME_UNO = n.NAME_UNOLEFTJOIN APM_VENDOR ven on ba.NAME_UNO = ven.NAME_UNOLEFTJOIN HBM_CLIENT c ON ba.NAME_UNO = c.NAME_UNOLEFT JOIN HBM_PERSNL p ON ba.NAME_UNO = p.NAME_UNO JOIN HBL_BANK_PAYTYP pt ON ba.PAYMENT_TYPE_CODE = pt.PAYTYP_CODEJOIN HBL_BANKING_SYSTEM bs ON pt.BANKING_SYSTEM_UNO = bs.BANKING_SYSTEM_UNOJOIN HBA_BANK_PAYTYP ptlink ON ba.PAYMENT_TYPE_CODE = ptlink.PAYTYP_CODE AND ba.BANK_CODE = ptlink.BANK_CODEORDERBY n.NAME, bs.BANKING_SYSTEM_CODE,ba.PAYMENT_TYPE_CODE UPDATE HBA_NAME_BANK_ACCOUNT SET IS_DEFAULT = 'Y' WHERE BANK_ACCOUNT_UNO IN () | Expected: :08 secs originallyrelease 821 = 27 secs

Title: Invoice - GL details - Error message translation
Steps: Step 1: On how to trigger these error messages, refer to 165051. || Step 2: Note that '%s' indicate passing string || Step 3: Validate GL AccountXPNS_CANT_SPECIFY_HEADER_ACCTXPNS_CANT_SPECIFY_SUBLEDGER_ACCTGLACCOUNTNOTAVAILABLE | Expected: "Cannot specify a Header Account""Cannot specify a Subledger Account""The GL Account is not available on this Entity" || Step 4: Validate Interbook SubledgerXPNS_SUBLEDGER_DEST_ACCT | Expected: "Cannot specify a Subledger Account. The specified Account maps to Subledger Destination Account % in Destination Book %s." || Step 5: Validate Debit and Credit | Expected: Debit and credit validation is not valid in Expert. || Step 6: Validate Interbook MappingXPNS_OFFC_PARTICIPATES | Expected: "The selected Office participated in Book(s) %s and does not have a Destination Account(s) mapped" || Step 7: Validate Office Department LinkXPNS_DEST_DEPT_ACCT_NOT_LINKXPNS_OFFC_DEPT_ACCT_NOT_LINKED | Expected: "The Office, Department, and Destination Account %s are not linked for the Destination Book %s." || Step 8: Validate Office Profit Center LinkXPNS_DEST_PROFACCT_ACCT_NOT_LINKXPNS_OFFC_PC_ACCT_NOT_LINKED | Expected: "The Office, Profit Center, and Destination Account %s are not linked for the Destination Book %s."

Then can override the rule errors, warnings?Need to confirm this stuff || Step 2: Failure indicator on detail item grid rowExample (UI Won't allow this now so need to find another example)1. Add a Disb item with invalid amount 99999999999999999999999999992. Save | Expected: Red Triangle with Hover textSave failed || Step 3: Rule failure on detail item grid rowExample1. Add a rule on GL Save to error when amount exceeds a certain amount2. Add a GL item for an amount that exceeds the rule3. Save & Close | Expected: Red Flag with hover text || Step 4: Rule failure overridenExample1. Add a rule on GL Save to error when amount exceeds a certain amount2. Add a GL item for an amout that exceeds the rule3. Save & Close4. Open the GL item5. Click on the error bar and enter comments6. Save | Expected: White flag with hover text || Step 5: Rule message on detail item grid rowExample1. Add a rule on GL Save to message when amount exceeds a certain amount2. Add a GL item for an amount that exceeds the rule3. Save & Close | Expected: Message icon hover text || Step 6: Alert indicator on detail item grid fieldExample1. CMS_OPTION.JE_ODPC_DEF = Y2. Add a GL item3. Use an account where employee is set to mandatory4. Select an employee where employee's is not valid (e.g. CIOEB has TOK which is inactive)SELECT * FROM CMS_OPTION WHERE OPTION_CODE ='JE_ODPC_DEF'SELECT*FROM GLM_CHART WHERE BOOK = 1 AND ACCT_CODE ='40110'UPDATE GLM_CHART SET SUBLEDGER ='Y'WHERE BOOK = 1 AND ACCT_CODE ='40110' | Expected: Yellow Triangle with Hover text || Step 7: Alert indicators on Item details tabs when detail items | Expected: Alert displayedDisplays based on the highest alert item || Step 8: Alert indicators on navigation tabs when detail items Example1. CMS_OPTION.JE_ODPC_DEF = Y2. Add a GL item3. Use an account where employee is set to mandatory4. Select an employee where employee's is not valid (e.g. CIOEB has TOK which is inactive) | Expected: Yellow Triangle || Step 9: Yellow alerts barExample1. Open payment in expert2. Open the payment in an other expert session | Expected: Yellow alert bar above the payment header in the second sessionTriangle and alert text || Step 10: Red alerts barExample1. Create a completed EB payment2. Inactivate the bank account3. From the payment details form, select release | Expected: Red alert bar above the payment header Triangle and alert text || Step 11: Alerts column of payment gridExample1. Create a completed wire payment2. Inactivate the bank account3. From the payment grid, select release | Expected: Triangle with hover textJob failed with error

IS_DEFAULT = 'Y' WHERE BANK_CODE = '' AND PAYTYP_CODE = 'NA1' || Step 4: Form load defaultSelect to create new vendor invoiceUPDATE HBL_BANKING_SYSTEM SET IS_DEFAULT ='N'WHERE BANKING_SYSTEM_CODE Title: Recurring Invoice Item - GL: Look and Feel

Title: Recurring Invoice: Look and Feel
Steps: Step 1: Buttons | Expected: All Buttons work as expected*Save-Save the recurring invoice-Enabled when required fields are filled out correctly and/or something has been edited*Save and Close- Save the recurring invoice and close if successful otherwise return it to the recurring invoice-Enabled when required fields are filled out correctly and/or something has been edited*Close and Add-Close recurring invoice if form is not dirty-Prompt user to save if it is dirty- Open new recurring invoice*Close-Close recurring invoice if form is not dirty-Prompt user to save if it is dirty-Close the recurring invoice*Generate Next Invoice-Generates the next invoice due based on the recurring invoice template-Disabled when there is alerts or the Next Invoice Date is NULL or Generation Method is Do Not Generate (H)*Delete-Delete the recurring invoice- Only enabled if generation method is Do Not Generate (H) || Step 2: Vendor,  Template, Book | Expected: Not editible after the first save.Needs to be uniqueIf not unique, a red box on Book field with error that says the combination needs to be uniqueNo overriding of the vendor on the recurring invoice. Only supported after creation of the real invoice || Step 3: Currency | Expected: Always enabled with no Spot Rate even if it is not the system currency || Step 4: Amount | Expected: Must be >0. Negative is not supportedMax value is 999999999999999.00 || Step 5: Generate Invoice Every | Expected: Must be an integer between 1-12 || Step 6: Status | Expected: *Do Not Generate (H)- Default value and disabled until all detail lines for invoice have been entered- invoice total= invoice details*Manual (M)-Invoices only able to be generated from within application using Generate Next Invoice*Automatic (A)-Not able to be edited- Invoices generated by Generate Next Invoice button or using a Scheduled Job || Step 7: Discount Amount | Expected: Max value is 999999999999999.00 || Step 8: 1099 Type and AmountsSELECT FLAG_VALUE FROM CMS_OPTION WHERE OPTION_CODE ='1099_IN_USE' | Expected: Only shown if FLAG_VALUE = 'Y'Defaults from Vendor recordMax value is 999999999999999.00 || Step 9: JurisdictionSELECT FLAG_VALUE FROM CMS_OPTION WHERE OPTION_CODE ='TAXES_IN_USE' | Expected: * Mandatory if taxes in use = Y otherwise not visibleDefaults from Vendor record || Step 10: Tax IncludedSELECT FLAG_VALUE FROM CMS_OPTION WHERE OPTION_CODE ='TAXES_IN_USE'SELECT DEFAULT_TAX_IN FROM APM_PARMS | Expected: * Mandatory if taxes in use = Y otherwise not visible- Defaults to value set in parmsN = 'No'Y = 'Yes'X = 'Not Applicable' || Step 11: Sales / Use TaxUPDATE CMS_OPTION SET FLAG_VALUE ='Y'WHERE OPTION_CODE ='SALES_USE_TX' | Expected: * Mandatory if Sales Use Tax = Y otherwise not visibleMax value is 999999999999999.00 || Step 12: Withhold TaxSELECT FLAG_VALUE FROM CMS_OPTION WHERE OPTION_CODE ='WHTAX_IN_USE' | Expected: Only applicable if in use =Y || Step 13: Remaining balance when currency set to use a comma1. Change Regional settingsRegion | Advanced SettingsDecimal symbol = ,2. Create Payment amount > 1000 | Expected: Displays with correct formating Remaining balance displays with decimal as comma instead of full stop

Title: Recurrring Invoice: Generate Invoice
Steps: Step 1: Pre ReqsVendor has a remmittance address set in enity manager || Step 2: Manual Generation | Expected: Bug 206207: Recurring Invoices and Payment Schedules grids - missing default Created In Expert value - Fixed || Step 3: Create a new Recurring Invoice1. Fill in all the required fields.2. Save. || Step 4: Add a detail line that balances the invoice1. The Remaining Balance = $0.002. Change Generation Method to Manual (M). | Expected: Generate Next Invoice button becomes enabled. || Step 5: Generate Next Invoice - Go to invoice1. Choose the option to go to the newly made invoice | Expected: - Confirmation that next invoice has been created.- New invoice number is the template name -1 (increments with each new generation)- Fields filled out with the same details from the recurring invoice. Can do a validation with:- Invoice should be released.- Has the same detail line(s) attachedAPT_INVOICESOURCE = RPUSE_OVERRIDE = NUSE_NAME_OVERRIDE = NUSE_ADDRESS_OVERRIDE = NNAME_UNO = 0ADDRESS_UNO = 0Invoice: select*from APT_INVOICE orderby LAST_MODIFIED descGL Account: select*from ACT_TRAN_JE orderby LAST_MODIFIED descDisbursement: select*from APM_RECINV_JE orderby LAST_MODIFIED desc || Step 6: Generate Next Invoice- Stay on page1. Choose the option to stay on the page2. Go to Invoices tab and open newly made invoice | Expected: 1.Confirmation dialogue closes and user stays on the Recurring Invoice page.2. New invoice is shown and fields filled out correctly like above step || Step 7: Automatic Generation || Step 8: Create a new Recurring Invoice1. Fill in all the required fields and make sure the First Invoice Date is today or earlier.2. Save. || Step 9: Add a detail line that balances the invoice1. The Remaining Balance = $0.002. Change Generation Method to Automatic (A). | Expected: Generate Next Invoice button becomes enabled. || Step 10: Schedule the Job1. Close the recurring invoice2. Go Schedule Manager3. Click Add> RECINGEN- Generate Recurring Invoices4. Leave the fields as what they defaulted to and click OK5. Wait for the job to finish (May need to click refresh to check)6. Right click the job row that ran> Review> Open the review row (might need to scroll to find it) | Expected: Can see the log of the job. Will say whether it suceeded and which invoices were generated along with their invoice numbers.Any validations caused by attempting to release the invoice and failing will be in the logs as well. || Step 11: Check the Invoice1. Go back to AP> Invoices tab2. Search for the Invoice that should have been created Invoice number = template name -1 (increments with each new generation)3. Open the invoice and check the details | Expected: - Confirmation that next invoice has been created.- New invoice number is the template name -1 (increments with each new generation)- Fields filled out with the same details from the recurring invoice. Can do a validation with:select*from APT_INVOICE orderby LAST_MODIFIED desc- Has the same detail line(s) attachedCheck with GL Account: select*from ACT_TRAN_JE orderby LAST_MODIFIED descDisbursement: select*from APM_RECINV_JE orderby LAST_MODIFIED desc- Invoice should be released.APT_INVOICE.SOURCE = RP

Title: Recurrring Invoice: Generate Invoice - button
Steps: Step 1: Status = Do Not Generate1.Make a recurring invoice and fill out all the required fields.2. Change the Generate Method to Manual.3. Change the Generate Method to Do Not Generate. | Expected: Generate Next Invoice button should be disabled in the entry screen and list screen. || Step 2: Select Multiple Recurring Invoices1. In the list screen select multiple recurring invoices with Manual or Automatic generation methods.2. Add to the selection one that has a generation method of Do No Generate. | Expected: 1. Generate Next Invoice button enabled.2. Generate Next Invoice button disabled. || Step 3: Errors in Recurring Invoice1. Create a new recurring invoice with all the required fields filled out including a GL line.2. Change the Generation Method to Manual.3. In Entity Manager restrict the GL account that you put into the recurring invoice.4. Resave the recurring invoice | Expected: An error should occur.Generate Next Invoice button should be disabled in the entry screen and list screen. || Step 4: Next Invoice Date = NULL1. Create a new recurring invoice with the first invoice date and last invoice date within a week of each other.2. Fill in all the required fields and balance with a detail line.3. Change Generation Method to Manual or Automatic.4. Generate the next invoice.5. Try and change the Generation Method back to Manual or Automatic. | Expected: An error that 'The Recurring Invoice has no Next Invoice Date and therefore cannot be generated.' The Generation Method defaults back to Do Not Generate (H).The Generate Next Invoice button should be disabled in the entry screen and list screen. || Step 5: GenerateRecurringInvoice Security Permission1. Open Security Manager and have GenerateRecurringInvoice permission unchecked.2. Open AP | Expected: Generate Next Invoice Button disabled in entry and list screen. || Step 6: Validation errors in any of the detail items | Expected: Button is disabled on both list and entry screen.

Title: Recurring Invoice: Validation

Bug: 206391 - Recurring Invoice Entry - Incorrect validation message when Last Invoice Date is before the First Invoice Date - FIXED || Step 4: Unique Vendor, Template and Book combination.1. Create a recurring invoice with the same vendor, template and book the same as another2. Make two recurring invoices with the same Vendor, Template and Book.Save one then the other | Expected: Int- SaveExpertRecurringInvoiceJournalWithDuplicateTemplateCodeFailsToSave1. Red box around Book (Multi book =Y) or template (Multi book=N)with an error saying that a template already exists with the combination of Vendor, Template and Book. 2. Red alert bar across the top saying that the recurring invoice already exists.Bug: 177157- Recurring Invoices- Not unique Vendor, Template, Book error. - FIXED || Step 5: Invoice dates outside APM_PARMS range1. Select the first and last Invoice dates to be outside the APM_PARMS range2. Complete the rest of the recurring invoice and save3. Generate the next invoice4. Open the generated invoice | Expected: 1. You are able to save the first and last invoice dates with no validation error  3. Window with error that the invoice failed to release4. Invoice date has red validation error: "Date is outside the minimum and maximum range." || Step 6: AP Type with bank not attached to book1. Setup multibook2. Create a new bank that uses a different book to Firm3. Create a new AP Type that uses that bank4. In a recurring invoice have the Book = Firm and AP Type = new AP Type made. | Expected: Red validation error around AP Type: "Type Code selected is associted with a Bank that is not attached to the Book selected. Please update." || Step 7: Validate Discount Amount1. Have a Discount Amount less than 0 | Expected: Red validation: "Discount Amount cannot be less than zero." || Step 8: Validate 1099 Amount 1. Have a 1099 Amount greater than the Invoice Amount2. Have the 1099 Amount less than 0 | Expected: Red validations: "The 1099 Amount must be between the Invoice Amount and Zero" || Step 9: Jurisdiction1. Create a new jurisdiction code Appshell> Hub Setup> Time and Billing Setup> Tax Jurisdiction Maintenance2. Tax In/Out = Out3. Create a recurring invoice and try and find the jurisdiction code created | Expected: New jurisdiction code cannot be found || Step 10: Classic Invoice1. Create a recurring invoice in Classic2. Open the recurring invoice in Expert AP select EAP_INITIATED,*from APM_RECINV | Expected: Warning that the Reccurring Invoice was created in the Classic Accounts Payable application and cannot be edited in Expert Accounts Payable.Nothing is editble Classic invoices have EAP_INITIATED flag as 'N'Expert AP Inititated (EAP_INITATED = 'Y') cannot be viewed in Classic (when information is input it clears itself)

Title: Payment - Cancel to New: Vendor
Steps: Step 1: Note: Testing of the cancel part of the payment is covered by the cancel test cases. Here, we need to reconcile the New part of the process as New payment would normally be done via the UI so we need to ensure that the creation of the New payment via code has the same outcome || Step 2: Pre reqsVendor- Has related payee with addressSELECT * FROM APA_VENDOR_RELATED_PAYEE || Step 3: Create vendor payment- Change the name and address to be used- Enter all other fields | Expected: Payment created || Step 4: Query the tables and copy results to spread sheetSELECT TOP(1) ORIGINAL_AMT,*from APT_CHECK ORDER BY REQUEST_NUM descSELECT TOP(1)*from APT_TEXT ORDER BY TEXT_ID desc || Step 5: Post payment | Expected: Payment posted || Step 6: Cancel to New | Expected: Payment is canceled and New payment created || Step 7: Reconcile tablesQuery tables and reconcile results from the original payment | Expected: Tables and fields matchAPT_CHECK- Name and address unos are copied from original payment- Last modified is set, not copied from original- All fields that should match, do- All fields that won't match e.g. unos, are populated with the appropriate values- ORIGINAL_AMT = 0Note: Original amount was NULL for the original payment and 0 for  the new one. As classic startes off with NULL then changes to 0 on post, we'll leave this as isAPT_TEXT- Last modified is set, not copied from original- SOURCE_UNO is set, not copied from original- All fields that should match, do- All fields that won't match e.g. unos, are populated with the appropriate values

A.PLAN_DESC, A.INACTIVE FROM GLM_PLAN A INNER JOIN GLM_PLAN_DET B on B.PLAN_CODE = A.PLAN_CODE INNER JOIN GLM_CHART C on C.ACCT_UNO = B.ACCT_UNO WHERE  C.BOOK=1 || Step 5: Employee | Expected: * Is Title: Rules - TEST CASES NOT FINISHED
Steps: Step 1: Note: This is currently a holding test case as the testing was done by the BA. We need to add the steps and split into more test cases || Step 2: Overvew of tests that have been performed:- changes to Design Studio so that when something is attachable you can then specify the entity types it is attachable to- upgrade script updates existing rules to be attached to Clients, Matters and Guidelines- removing an entity type displays the message box, and if Proceed, then deletes the existing attachments- in Entity Manager you only see the appropriate rules based on the Entity Type you are attaching to- Rule Exension Points- are all the extension points implemented as expected- do the extension points run where indicated- tested this by attaching a rule to each extension point then checking that the rule runs when expected- this included testing that detail rule points also run on both invoice save, release and post- did quite a bit of testing around invoice statuses, and ensuring that the status was set to the correct thing when a rule failed- I included both Error and Warning rules in the testing here to make sure that an info rule did not stop processing- tested to ensure that Post rule messages are removed when the invoice is set back to Released || Step 3: Evaluate from forms- tested from both payments and invoices- tested from both entry screens and list screens- tested to ensure that in all places, the correct rule points have been checked - i.e.- tested that detail rules were run- tested to ensure that invoice/payment save rules were run- tested to ensure that invoice/payment release rules were run- tested to ensure that the 'Evaluate Rules' button was only enabled for invoices/payment up until they are released- tested that the status of the items is updated correctly in each case - i.e.- if there are no rule failures then the item is updated to 'C'- if there are rule 'warnings' but no 'errors' then the item is updated to 'C' || Step 4: Override rules- tested security permission works - if you have permission you can override Error messages - OK- if you don't have the permission you can't override messages - OK- table updates ( to APT_Message ) all OK- reason updated OK- Override field updated OK- Override User updated OK- Error message will prevent further processing - OK- Overridden Error message will NOT prevent further processing - OK- Warning message wil NOT prevent further processing || Step 5: Create Invoice from recurring invoiceCreate Payment from quick payCreate Payment from schedule

Title: Payment - Tax: Tax included - Invoice and other item
Steps: Step 1: Pre req setupSet a valid GL account for tax codes e.g: 40120UPDATE TBL_TAX_BOOK SET ACCT_UNO = 127 WHERE BOOK = 1Set taxes in use tax on:UPDATE CMS_OPTION SET FLAG_VALUE ='Y'WHERE OPTION_CODE ='TAXES_IN_USE'UPDATE APM_PARMS SET DEFAULT_TAX_IN ='X'--Q,X,Y,NUPDATE APM_PARMS SET RECOV_CONT_REQD ='N' || Step 2: Pre req dataTax JurisdictionTax code 1- Seq 1- Recoverable- Recoverable account- Has Disb %Invoice- Posted || Step 3: Can't have Invoice with a GL or Disb item when taxes are to be calculated- Set Tax Included = Yes or No | Expected: Tax Included = Yes- Can have GL and Disb (but not with invoice)- Can have invoice (but not with GL or disb)Tax Included = No- Can have GL and Disb (but not with invoice)- Can have invoice (but not with GL or disb) || Step 4: Can't release when tax not calculated on GL or Disb- Set Tax Included = Yes or No- Payment has GL and Disb items1. Release | Expected: Release errorDialog Box: Tax has not yet been calculaterd on this Payment || Step 5: Can release when tax calculated on GL or Disb- Set Tax Included = Yes or No- Payment has GL and Disb items1. Calculate tax- Tax Included = Added or Removed2. ReleaseRelease | Expected: Payment Released || Step 6: Can release when tax not calculated on Invoice- Set Tax Included = Yes or No- Payment has GL and Disb items1. Release | Expected: Payment released- Tax included us changed to Not Applicable

Title: Jobs: Payment Schedule - Create Payments
Steps: Step 1: Pre reqsMultiple schedules each with multiple items || Step 2: Note: - Multi-select on grid no available for Create Request.- As the job process is quick, there is no time to check that the lock occurred so need to check using sql profilter: search for: lockcio || Step 3: General | Expected: * Job created from grid when one item is selected. || Step 4: Start job from payment scheduleSchedule has multiple items | Expected: Job runs* Schedule status = E* Local notification sent so notification form displays* User lock exists on schedule header- lock type =  S- expiry = NULL* Schedule header user lock removed* Job lock applied to schedule header- lock type =  B- expiry = NULL- reason = Check Schedule Create Payments* Job starts processing- Job status = R * Job message = Creating Payments?* Payments are created* Update Schedule Status to P Moved to here 822.Ex0007* Job Message =  Releasing Payments?REPEAT THIS FOR EACH ITEM* Lock item with a job lock - Lock Owner = B- Lock timeout = 20 - Reason = check release* Item job lock removedEND OF ITEM PROCESS* Schedule header job lock removed* Job status = C when completed* User lock applied to schedule header- lock owner=  S- expiry = NULL* Service sends notifications to notification form and recent activity grid* All selected items processed* There are no orphaned item locks when job is completed || Step 5: Start Job from payment gridSelect multiple schedules each with multiple items | Expected: Job runs* Local notification sent so notification form displays* Job lock applied to schedule header- lock type =  B- expiry = NULL- reason = Check Schedule Create Payments* Job starts processing- Job status = R * Job message = Creating Payments?* Payments are created* Update Schedule Status to P Moved to here 822.Ex0007* Job Message =  Releasing Payments?REPEAT THIS FOR EACH ITEM* Lock item with a job lock - Lock Owner = B- Lock timeout = 20 - Reason = check release* Item job lock removedEND OF ITEM PROCESS* Schedule header job lock removed* Job status = C when completed* User lock applied to schedule header- lock owner=  S- expiry = NULL* Service sends notifications to notification form and recent activity grid* All selected items processed* There are no orphaned item locks when job is completed* Grid refreshed at end of job || Step 6: Cancel JobCreate a volumne of invoices, attach to schedule then Create Request to see the processing display in recent activities grid. | Expected: Job NOT cancelled. It completes current transaction then stop before the next item start. Given that you cannot start multiple Check Schedule Check Creation jobs, you cannot cancel the only job that you are running.Jan - this seems odd. We need to look into what this should really be doing

Title: Upgrade - Moving bank accounts from Classic structure to new Expert
Steps: Step 1: Note: The script is not run during deployment || Step 2: Using the share step above make at least two Payment Type codes and use at least two different Banks. | Expected: At least 2 entries in HBM_NAME_BANK select * from HBM_NAME_BANK || Step 3: Set up the script in SQL under [your_database] | Programmability | Stored Procedures | dbo.APP_BankAccountConversion :1.  USE [Your_Database]2.  @Mode  varchar(1) = 'T'  -- 'T'=Test, 'U'=Update3. DECLARE @Seg1  varchar(40) = 'Column_Name' | Expected: Note: After running the first time, change CREATE PROCEDURE [dbo].[APP_BankAccountConversion] to ALTER PROCEDURE [dbo].[APP_BankAccountConversion] So when you run it again it updates your preferences. 'T' Means that you can see things being put in each segment are changed around and that it's running correctly.(This creates temporary tables which is why when you execute the script it has a large number of rows affected on different lines) || Step 4: Run the script || Step 5: Run the followng  SQL exec [APP_BankAccountConversion] 'BankCode', 'PayTypeCode', 'T''BankCode' and 'PayTypeCode'are optional parameters ('' for none). If they are left blank then everything in HBM_NAME_BANK will be transferred overThe last parameter can be 'T' or 'U'. 'T' will not update HBA_NAME_BANK_ACCOUNT and will just show a window with what is should look like if it is updated'U' Will update the table and can be checked with: select * from HBA_NAME_BANK_ACCOUNT | Expected: Check that either HBA_NAME_BANK_ACCOUNT or the box that pops up has been populated correctly Pay Type code is linked to the classic bank account through HBL_BAKN_PAYTYP || Step 6: Run the above SQL with the following iterations || Step 7: Bank code, no pay type code | Expected: Only entries with the corresponding bank code moved over. || Step 8: No bank code and a pay type codeTo make it easier to see can move some of the Seg's to be different | Expected: Only different entries with corresponding pay type code moved over (underneath the bank codes above )One of the numbers for 'rows affected' may be quite large (the number of banks you have) as it is searching each bank for an account with a paytype code || Step 9: No bank code, no pay type code | Expected: All other entries different to those already moved across will appear || Step 10: Do the above 3 steps in T and U mode. || Step 11: Check that they have been brought over in Expert Administration under Accounts Payable Options | Payment Types | Expected: Payment type codes that have been moved over in Update mode are present- 'Is Electronic Payment Type' is checked || Step 12: Add a banking system and save || Step 13: In AP create a new electronic vendor payment using the vendor that has the payment code attached | Expected: Are able to create an electronic payment with the Bank section autofilled with the right values brought over. || Step 14: Check Banks in Entity Manager | Expected: Payment Type code transferred correctly under Accounts Payable tab.

Title: AP: Vendor Business Card validation
Steps: Step 1: Overall look | Expected: The same style as Clients and Matters || Step 2: FieldsVendor Name (Vendor ID)Remit Vendor Name (Remit Vendor ID) Remit AddressRemit email addressVendor Customer No.AP Type CodeBank Name and codeOwning OfficeStatusTax NumberPreferred Payment method | Expected: Use the following SQL to check the valuesselect VENDOR_NAME, VENDOR_ID, REMIT_VEND_UNO , ADDRESS1, REMITTANCE_EMAIL, FIRM_ID, dbo.APM_VENDOR.APTYPE_CODE, BANK_CODE, CITY, STATE_CODE, COUNTRY_CODE, OWNING_OFFC, dbo.APM_VENDOR.INACTIVE, FED_ID_NUM, PREFERRED_PAYT_METHOD from HBM_ADDRESSLEFT JOIN APM_VENDOR on HBM_ADDRESS.ADDRESS_UNO= APM_VENDOR.ADDRESS_UNO leftjoin APL_APTYPE on APM_VENDOR.APTYPE_CODE = APL_APTYPE.APTYPE_CODENote: Vendor Customer number = FIRM_ID, Tax Number = FED_ID_NUM || Step 3: Pops up when hovering or selecting a vendor. Same places the Client and Matter cards come up
