Select release | Expected: Invoice releasedAPT_INVOICE.EXPERT_INVOICE_STATUS = RAPT_INVOICE.INVOICE_STATUS = NAPT_INVOICE_Z = RAPT_INVOICE.LAST_MODIFIED = updated *Bug 176394, last_modifed not updated on invoice release and unrelease. || Step 2: Unrelease one invoice1. Select one released invoice 2. Select unrelease | Expected: Invoice unreleasedAPT_INVOICE.EXPERT_INVOICE_STATUS = CAPT_INVOICE.INVOICE_STATUS = NAPT_INVOICE_Z = EAPT_INVOICE.LAST_MODIFIED = updated || Step 3: Release multiple invoice1. Select multiple completed invoice | Expected: Invoices releasedAPT_INVOICE.EXPERT_INVOICE_STATUS = RAPT_INVOICE.INVOICE_STATUS = NAPT_INVOICE_Z = RAPT_CHECK.LAST_MODIFIED = updated || Step 4: Unrelease multiple invoice1. Select multiple released invoice 2. Select unrelease | Expected: Invoices unreleasedAPT_INVOICE.EXPERT_INVOICE_STATUS = RAPT_INVOICE.INVOICE_STATUS = NAPT_INVOICE_Z = RAPT_CHECK.LAST_MODIFIED = updated

Title: Invoice - Release/Unrelease - User must have security to all the books used by the invoice
Steps: Step 1: Pre req System settings Allow row security for booksSELECT ROW_SECURITY,* FROM CMS_DD_TABLE WHERE TABLE_NAME like ('GLL_DATASET')UPDATE CMS_DD_TABLE SET ROW_SECURITY='Y' WHERE TABLE_NAME='GLL_DATASET' || Step 2: Pre reqs data securityNote: Reopen the app after making the changes, to pick up the security changes (not sure if this is required)User 1Set a user so that they have full privilegesUPDATE HBM_PERSNL SET PRIVILEGE_LEVEL = 1 WHERE LOGIN= ''User 2Set a user so that they don't have full privilegesUPDATE HBM_PERSNL SET PRIVILEGE_LEVEL = 0 WHERE LOGIN= ''BookSet custom security on book 1 to disallow user 2Classic | General Ledger | G/L Setup | Chart of Book maintenance- Custom security- Set user to X || Step 3: Create an invoiceUser 1- Add a GL item Note: Ensure sum of GL amount matches the invoice amountSELECT ''[Books - GLL_DATASET],* FROM GLL_DATASET WHERE DATASET_NUM IN (SELECTDISTINCT c.BOOK FROM act_tran_je gl INNERJOIN GLM_CHART c on gl.ACCT_UNO = c.ACCT_UNO WHERE gl.TRAN_UNO = @tran) | Expected: Invoice is createdStatus is completed || Step 4: Release invoice- User does not have security permisson to the BooksUser 21. Select the invoice created by user 12. Attempt to release the invoice | Expected: Release failsError message:Cannot access GL BookUser must have security permission to all the books used for the invoice. || Step 5: Release invoice- User has security permisson to the BooksUser 11. Select the invoice created by user 12. Attempt to release the invoice | Expected: Release succeeds || Step 6: Unrelease invoice- User has security permisson to the BooksUser 11. Select the invoice created by user 12. Attempt to release the invoice | Expected: Unrelease succeeds || Step 7: Clean upRemove security from book 1

Title: Invoice - Release/Unrelease - User must have security to all the accounts used by the invoice
Steps: Step 1: Pre req System settings Allow row security for accountsSELECT ROW_SECURITY,*FROM CMS_DD_TABLE WHERE TABLE_NAME='GLM_CHART'UPDATE CMS_DD_TABLE SET ROW_SECURITY='Y'WHERE TABLE_NAME='GLM_CHART' || Step 2: Pre reqs data securityNote: Reopen the app after making the changes, to pick up the security changes (not sure if this is required)User 1Set a user so that they have full privilegesUPDATE HBM_PERSNL SET PRIVILEGE_LEVEL = 1 WHERE LOGIN= ''User 2Set a user so that they don't have full privilegesUPDATE HBM_PERSNL SET PRIVILEGE_LEVEL = 0 WHERE LOGIN= ''Account 1Has no security setAccount 2Set custom security on an account to disallow user 2 e.g. 40110Classic | General Ledger | G/L Setup | Chart of Account- Custom security- Set user to XSELECT*FROM CMS_SECURE_PLAN ORDERBY SECURITY_ID DESCSELECT * FROM CMS_SECURE_ROW || Step 3: Create an invoiceUser 1- Add a GL item for an account the user has permisson to- Add a GL item for an account the user does not have permisson toNote: Ensure sum of GL amount matches the invoice amountSELECT ''[Accounts - GLM_CHART],* FROM GLM_CHART WHERE ACCT_UNO IN(SELECTDISTINCT ACCT_UNO FROM ACT_TRAN_JE gl WHERE gl.TRAN_UNO = @tran) | Expected: Invoice is createdStatus is completed || Step 4: Release invoice- User does not have security to all the accounts used by the GL items on the paymentUser 21. Select the invoice created by user 12. Attempt to release the invoice | Expected: Release failsError message:Cannot access GL Account.User must have security permission to all the accounts used for the invoice. || Step 5: Release invoice- User has security to all the accounts used by the GL items on the paymentUser 11. Select the invoice created by user 12. Attempt to release the invoice | Expected: Release succeeds || Step 6: Unrelease invoice- User has security to all the accounts used by the GL items on the paymentUser 11. Select the payment created by user 12. Attempt to release the invoice | Expected: Unrelease succeeds || Step 7: Clean upRemove security from account 2

Title: Payment - Check reprint: Validation
Steps: Step 1: Can't find the file1. edit the check format so that the file name is not correct 2. Attempt to reprint the payment | Expected: Display error: TEMPLATEFILENOTEXISTCan't find file || Step 2: Check Format is inactive1. Inactivate check format 2. Attempt to print the payment | Expected: Display error: Format is inactive || Step 3: Bank has no check format1. Remove check format from bank2. Attempt to reprint the payment | Expected: Display error: No such format exists || Step 4: Document is open1. Open the output pdf file2. Attempt to reprint the payment | Expected: Display error: can not access <file name> as its being used by another process || Step 5: Bank is lockedNote: This is job failure errorAttempt to print a check where the bank has a lock | Expected: Display error: Can't get a lock on the bank || Step 6: One or more payments are lockedNote: This is a job failure error1. Create 3 check payments and print them2. Open payments 1 and 2 (application locks on both)3. From payment 2, select to print and add payments 1 and 34. RePrint | Expected: Display error: Failed to aquire locks for all payments

Title: Invoice - Release/Unrelease - GL Interbook and ODPC link Validation
Steps: Step 1: Display of error- Via a job- Via an invoice | Expected: Display in Recent Activities tab.Display in red alert bar. || Step 2: Invoice with invalid BookCannot release with invalid Book1. Create an invoice with C status.2. Update Book to invalid Book via sql. 3. Refresh grid 4. Attempt to release invoice from grid | Expected: Display Error : Cannot access GL book.Invoice not released. || Step 3: Release with invalid Book on GL AccountCannot release with invalid Book on GL Account1. Create an invoice with C status.2. Update the Book of GL Account to invalid Book via SQL in GLM_CHART.BOOK.3. Refresh grid 4. Attempt to release invoice from grid | Expected: Display Error : Cannot access GL Account.Invoice not released. || Step 4: Release with Office not mapped to current bookGL line office not belong to current book.1. Create an invoice with C status.2. Set interbook on. 3. Set Office used in GL line not belong to current book. delete from GLA_OFFC_BOOK where BOOK = 1000 and OFFC ='TLH'4. Release Invoice. | Expected: Invoice not caught. Bug? Classic is not catching this too. || Step 5: Release with Office not mapped for interbookGL line office should be mapped to books using the same office.1. Set interbook on.2. Set interbook using same office.3. Create invoice with C status, with GL line using that office.4. Remove the interbook mapping of the Account used in GL line in GL > GL Setup > Interbook Account Mapping.5. Release invoice. | Expected: Display Error: All attached office are NOT correctly mapped for interbook.Invoice not released.*Bug 176306 -Invoice release - Incorrect error message text when having interbook mapping error || Step 6: Release with Account, Office and Dept not linkedGL lines should have Account, Office and Dept linked.1. Create invoice with C status.2. Remove the linking in Classic > GL > GL Setup > Links > Office/Department/Account3. Release invoice. | Expected: Display error: Account, office and department are not linked for all detail rows.Invoice not released. || Step 7: Release with Account, Office and Dept not linked on destination bookGL lines should have Account, Office and Dept linked on destination book.1. Set interbook on.2. Create invoice with C status.3. Remove the linking in Classic > GL > GL Setup > Links > Office/Department/Account on destination book.4. Release invoice. | Expected: Display error : The Office, Department and Destination Account % are not linked for the Destination Book %.Invoice not released.Bug 176345 - Invoice Release - Message translation error on ODPC not linked on destination book. || Step 8: Release with Account, Office and Profit Center not linkedGL lines should have Account, Office and Profit Center linked.1. Create invoice with C status.2. Remove the linking in Classic > GL > GL Setup > Links > Office/Profit Center/Account3. Release invoice. | Expected: Display error: Account, office and profit center are not linked for all detail rows.Invoice not released. || Step 9: Release with Account, Office and Profit Center not linked on destination bookGL lines should have Account, Office and Profit Center linked on destination book.1. Set interbook on.2. Create invoice with C status.3. Remove the linking in Classic > GL > GL Setup > Links > Office/Profit Center /Account on destination book.4. Release invoice. | Expected: Display error : The Office, Profit Center and Destination Account % are not linked for the Destination Book %.Invoice not released.Bug 176345 - Invoice Release - Message translation error on ODPC not linked on destination book.

Title: Invoice - Release/Unrelease - Unrelease Validation
Steps: Step 1: Unrelease invoice not in Released state.1. Create an Invoice and release.2. Update APT_INVOICE.EXPERT_INVOICE_STATUS <> 'R'.3. Attempt to release on grid. | Expected: Display error : INVOICE_STATUS_INVALID_UNREL

Title: AP: Default landing page
Steps: Step 1: User opens the application for the first time | Expected: Page opens to the first one that the user has security access to from these options:InvoicesPaymentsPayment SchedulesVendorsEXEC SECURITY.SetContextByName '<your logon>'SELECT Path,Name,Content,UserOrGroupDisplayName FROM Configuration.ConfigName n INNER JOIN Configuration.ConfigValue v ON n.Id = v.NameIdWHERE Path = 'Preference.Applications.ExpertAccountsPayable'AND NAME = 'AccountsPayableTabStartup' || Step 2: User opens the application after having closed the application - has security access to some pages | Expected: Page opens to the last page the user was on from these options:InvoicesPaymentsPayment SchedulesVendorsBug 161853 - Default opening page is not correct when user does not have access to all tabs || Step 3: User opens the application after having closed the application - has security access to all pages | Expected: Page opens to the last page the user was on from these options:InvoicesPaymentsPayment SchedulesVendors || Step 4: User opens the application after having closed the application - no longer has security access to that page | Expected: Page opens to the first one that the user has security access to from these options:InvoicesPaymentsPayment SchedulesVendorsBug 161853 - Default opening page is not correct when user does not have access to all tabs

Select payment method = Electronic Banking or  Wire transfer and bank = BUSD | Expected: Wire number displayed and editable15/2/2018- M.Y displayed but not editable || Step 14: Narrative | Expected: Limited to 15,000*Narrative field supports spellchecking and expansion codes || Step 15: Amounts | Expected: Limited to 999999999999999Electronic, Wire and Manual amount must be >0 || Step 16: Trust fields- Trust Bank Id- Trust Account- Trust Account Name- Trust Payment Name SELECT*FROM CMS_OPTION WHERE OPTION_CODE ='APA_TRUST'UPDATE CMS_OPTION SET FLAG_VALUE ='Y'WHERE OPTION_CODE ='APA_TRUST' SELECT USE_TRST_EFT, * FROM TBM_BANK | Expected: The state of the fields is set when bank is entered - When payment type is not wire or electronic then not visibleElse- When APA Trust is off then not visible- When APA Trust is on and the bank is not a trust bank then not visible- When APA Trust is on and the trust bank has Require Trust EFT off then enabled and optional - When APA Trust is on and the trust bank has Require Trust EFT on then enabled and required * Trust bank id - 25 characters* Trust account - 25 characters* Trust account name - 250 characters* Trust payment name - 250 characters || Step 17: Payee Name and Address- Select any vendor in Vendor field. | Expected: This will show vendor's address in default. You can only edit the address from the blue 'Modify Address' but only to the address of related payee. || Step 18: Payment Method- only has Check C, Manual M, Electronic E and Wire W || Step 19: Check Numberthis field affect by the value in Payment Method. | Expected: When select Check, Check number field will be disabled for read only. If select Manual, Check number field is enabled, user can enter any check number.If select Electronic or Wire Check number field will be hidden || Step 20: Payment Date- In appshell > AP > AP setup > Parameters. Check the Max and Min allowable transaction date.- Select a date within the Max and Min trans date.- Select a date which falls out of Max and Min trans date.- Manually type in a date which falls out of Max and Min trans date. | Expected: Only date which falls into Max and Min trans date is allowed. User is unable to select date outside of Max and Min trans date using the calender. if user manually change it to date outside of Max and Min trans date, user will be warn with red exclaimation mark and issue details when hover to it. Invoice saves will also be disabled. || Step 21: Date to Print- Change payment method to W and M - Change payment method to C, notice the difference in this field when switching payment method.- Enter yesterday's date- Enter today's date.- Enter tomorrow's date.- Enter next week date. | Expected: This field is only enabled when payment method = C.Entered date must be larger or equal to today. || Step 22: Amount- Insert any amount into the field- hover to the inserted amount | Expected: the hover should display the amount in words. (300 for three hundred etc.) || Step 23: Currency- This field is always disabled. - Note the currency being used here.- Change to different currency by changing the AP Type code with CAD currency in vendor setup (classic)- Now go back to to the payment entry screen. and check if currency is changed. | Expected: Currecy is affected by the Bank that is selected in payment || Step 24: Spot Rate - Suppose your system currency is USD, Select bank which also uses USD.-Now change to bank which uses CAD. | Expected: Only appear when bank currency is dfferent to system currency. || Step 25: Bank- Check if this field is defaulted to the bank of selected vendor.- Change to any vendor. | Expected: This field is automatically populated to Bank defaulted to selected vendor but only for the first time when a vendor is selected.It should not be defaulted to an inactive bankSELECT v.VENDOR_ID,v.VENDOR_NAME,v.APTYPE_CODE,typ.BANK_CODEFROM APM_VENDOR vJOIN APL_APTYPE typ ON v.APTYPE_CODE = typ.APTYPE_CODEJOIN TBM_BANK b ON typ.BANK_CODE = b.BANK_CODEWHERE v.VENDOR_ID = 'tst1' || Step 26: Requested by - Change to another user | Expected: Defaulted to the one who create payment but can also be change if desired. || Step 27: Jurisdiction- In CMS_Option table, set 'Y' for Taxes_In_Use- Check the Juridisction field in AP- Set 'N' for Taxes_In_use- Check the Juridisction field in AP again | Expected: This line should default from selected vendor.This field is gone when Taxes_In_use = N. || Step 28: 1099 Type- In CMS_Option table, set 'Y' for 1099_In_Use- Check the 1099 Type field in AP- Set 'N' for 1099_In_Use- Check the 1099 Type field in AP again | Expected: This line should default from selected vendor.This field is gone when 1099_In_use = N. || Step 29: Reference - Type in anything.- Don't type in anything at all. | Expected: This field is not required and not default from anything. || Step 30: Language- Change to French in Vendor Setup | Expected: Same with Currency field, it is defaulted from Vendor. So it should appear as French in the field when changed the Language value in Vendor setup. || Step 31: Tax Include | Expected: This field is defaulted from the same field in AP Parrameters || Step 32: 1099 Amount- In CMS_Option table, set 'Y' for 1099_In_Use- Check the 1099 Type field in AP- Set 'N' for 1099_In_Use- Check the 1099 Type field in AP again | Expected: Default to check amount.This field is gone when 1099 is not in use. || Step 33: Image Reference- more design required. || Step 34: Sales use Tax- In CMS_Option table, set 'Y' for sales_use_tx- Enter any value into the field. | Expected: This field only appear when set Y for sales_use_tx.Only numbers are allowed to enter into this field. || Step 35: Recoverable Tax- In APM_PARM, set 'Y' for Recov_cont_reqd or tick Recoverable Tax Control Reqd in AP Paramaters (Classic)- Enter total of tax- Enter tax for invoices. | Expected: This field is set as control for sum of tax lines.,*to be test when we can release/post' || Step 36: 1099 Total- Add two details line which have 300 and 200 as their 1099 amount. | Expected: This field is not available to edit. It is the sum total of 1099 amount in detail lines. So it should be 500. || Step 37: Narrative- Type in anything. | Expected: Can input any symbols, characters and numbers. || Step 38: Bank Details- edit and add in any details to be show on your eletronic banking record. | Expected: Can input any symbols, characters and numbers. Title: Payment - Client: look and feel

Title: Schedule - Employee: Make sure invoice selection is still still as per design doc when Currency field is remove from the Add Multiple Invoices Screen
Area: ExpertSuite\Financials\Accounts Payable\Payment Schedule\Add to Schedule\Employee Invoices
Steps: Step 1: Make sure your employee's Exp AP Type is 'INV' || Step 2: Ensure that Currency of Expense Report (ER) / advance is the same as currency of selected bank. || Step 3: Create an ER and Advance from Expenses with USD Currency. Get them approved. || Step 4: Go to Moscow AP > Payment Schedules > Create new Employee Schedule.Fill in the header and click Save.Make sure your bank is not a USD Bank | Expected: Add Invoices ribbon enabled. || Step 5: Click Add Invoices ribbon > Add Multiple.Click Done so that it will return all item. | Expected: No payments found. || Step 6: Change to USD Bank on the header and do Step 4 again. | Expected: ER and Advance created in Step 2 returned. || Step 7: Ensure ER/Advance is approved. || Step 8: Have a few ER and advance in submit, cancel status. Try to retrieve them through the add multiple invoices screen. | Expected: Only APPROVED ER and Advance will be return. || Step 9: Ensure ER/Advance is not on a payment schedule || Step 10: Attached one of ER/advance to a payment schedule, check if it still return when perform the search/add. | Expected: Item already attached to other payment schedule will not be available. || Step 11: Ensure expense report is for the same company as the selected bank account. || Step 12: Change bank to 'BOP' which have Office = PNS. Add items into the schedule again. | Expected: Only USD Advance report will be added. || Step 13: Change the office of BOP bank from PNL to TLH.You can do that from Hub Setup > Time and Billing > Bank. || Step 14: Perform search again. | Expected: Both ER and Advance in USD will be return.

Title: AP: Exit from backstage
Steps: Step 1: Exit when no pending changes | Expected: * Application and process are closed || Step 2: Exit when pending changes are valid And Discard1. Open a record2. Edit the record with valid changes3. Select Exit from backstage4. On the Pending Changes window Click Discard | Expected: * Pending changes are discarded and record is unlocked* Application and process are closed || Step 3: Exit when pending changes are valid And Save1. Open a record2. Edit the record with valid changes3. Select Exit from backstage4. On the Pending Changes window Click Save | Expected: * Pending changes are saved and record is unlocked* Application and process are closedBug 258944 - Expert Accounts Payable: On the Save/Discard/Cancel dialog, choose Save will also prevent the app from closing || Step 4: Exit when pending changes are not valid1. Open a record2. Edit the record with invalid changes3. Select Exit from backstage | Expected: * User is informed of an error and given the opportunity to discrd changes for return to the record to fix the issue

Title: Payment - Status Hover
Steps: Step 1: Status Indicator | Expected: U Orange when CHECK_STATUS = NX Red when CHECK_STATUS = XP Green when CHECK_STATUS = O or RDECLARE @payment as int= 2DECLARE @paymenttrans as int= (SELECT TRAN_UNO FROM APT_CHECK WHERE REQUEST_NUM = @payment )SELECTCASE WHEN chq.CHECK_STATUS ='N'THEN'U Orange'WHEN chq.CHECK_STATUS = 'X' THEN 'X RED' WHEN chq.CHECK_STATUS IN ('O','R') THEN 'P Green' END [Status Indicator],chq.REQUEST_NUM,look1.DISPLAY_TEXT[Status],-- Expert StatusCASEWHEN chq.DOCUMENT_TYPE ='W'THEN'Bank File Created'ELSE 'Check Printed'END [Item text],CASEWHEN chq.DOCUMENT_TYPE ='W'THEN CASE WHEN ISNULL(EB_SENT,0)> 0 THEN'Yes'ELSE 'No'ENDWHEN chq.DOCUMENT_TYPE <>'W'THEN CASEWHEN ISNULL(chq.CHECK_NUM,0)> 0 THEN'Yes'ELSE 'No'ENDEND [Item state],EB_SENT,p2.EMPLOYEE_NAME +' ('+ p2.EMPLOYEE_CODE +')'[Created]FROM APT_CHECK chq  LEFTJOIN CXL_CODE_LOOKUP look1 ON EXPERT_PAYMENT_STATUS = look1.DB_VALUE and look1.LOOKUP_GROUP ='ExpertPaymentStatus'LEFTJOIN HBM_PERSNL p2 ON chq.CREATE_EMPL_UNO = p2.EMPL_UNO -- created byWHERE chq.REQUEST_NUM = @payment || Step 2: Hover details | Expected: - Request Number and Status come from RequestNumber and CheckStatusEnum on the Check- Where the CheckDocumentTypeEnum = 'E' the Check Printed test should change to read 'Bank File Created'- If a Check ( 'C' or 'M' ) and the CheckNumber is populated ( not 0 or NULL ) – then the check has been printed- If an electronic payment ('E') and the EB_Sent field > 0 , then the Bank File has been created​ || Step 3: Tool tips off | Expected: Hover still displays

Title: Payment Items - Invoice: override name and address
Steps: Step 1: Pre preqs Vendor Vendor name has multiple addresses Name 1 (related to vendor)Has multiple addresses  Name 2 (related to vendor)Does not have any addressesBug 162198 - Invoice: system error and app crash when attempting to add an override name Invoice 1:  Type = VendorInvoice status = postedHas no overrides Invoice 2:  Type = VendorInvoice status = postedHas override name 1 and address Invoice 3:  Type = VendorInvoice status = postedHas override name 1 with no address Invoice 4:  Type = VendorInvoice status = postedHas override address Invoice 5:  Type = VendorInvoice status = postedHas override name 2 (so no address) || Step 2: No overrides on invoice1. Enter header details and saveType = VendorVendor = same as invoiceOther required fields2. Select to add invoice 1 | Expected: No prompt* On selection of the invoice the user is NOT prompted to use an alternative invoice name/address on the payment || Step 3: Don't use invoice overrides1. Enter header details and saveType = VendorVendor = same as invoiceOther required fields2. Select to add invoice 23. Choose NOT to use the alternate name/address | Expected: Alternate name/address is NOT used* On selection of the invoice the user is prompted to use the alternative invoice payee on the payment* User has chosen not to use the alternate so payee name/address is Not changed || Step 4: Use invoice override: has name and address1. Enter header details and saveType = VendorVendor = same as invoiceOther required fields2. Select to add invoice 23. Choose to use the alternate name/address | Expected: Alternate name/address is used* On selection of the invoice the user is prompted to use the alternative invoice payee on the payment* User has chosen to use the alternate payee so payee name/address is changed || Step 5: Use invoice override: has name only 1. Enter header details and saveType = VendorVendor = same as invoiceOther required fields2. Select to add invoice 33. Choose to use the alternate name/address | Expected: Alternate name is used* On selection of the invoice the user is prompted to use the alternative invoice payee on the payment* User has chosen to use the alternate payee so payee name* Address is removed as it doesn't belong to the alternate payee? || Step 6: Use invoice override: has address only1. Enter header details and saveType = VendorVendor = same as invoiceOther required fields2. Select to add invoice 43. Choose to use the alternate name/address | Expected: Alternate name/address is used* On selection of the invoice the user is prompted to use the alternative invoice address on the payment* User has chosen to use the alternate address so payee address is changed || Step 7: Payment has same override name and address as invoice1. Enter header details and saveType = VendorVendor = same as invoiceOther required fields2. Select an override name and address that matches the override on the invoice3. Select to add invoice 2 | Expected: No prompt* On selection of the invoice the user is NOT prompted to use an alternative invoice name/address on the payment || Step 8: Payment has same override address as invoice1. Enter header details and saveType = VendorVendor = same as invoiceOther required fields2. Select an override address that matches the override on the invoice3. Select to add invoice 4 4. Choose to use the alternate name/address | Expected: Alternate address is used* On selection of the invoice the user is prompted to use the alternative invoice payee on the payment* User has chosen to use the alternate payee so payee address is changeddjo - not sure I understand this one. Invoice 4 has not override name, just an override address, so if you have selected the same override address on the header you will not get a message when you add the invoice ( same scenario as step 7 above )

Title: Vendor Payment Schedule - Multi Currency - Scheduling a vendor payment with multi currency invoices using Add Single Invoice option.
Steps: Step 1: Pre reqEnsure your system currency is USD. We will put in one set of invoices into Classic and another to Expert so that we can reconcile the value.You will need two sets of invoice, one for Classic and one for Expert. Each set of invoices have three invoices outlined as below. Post it1Vendor = 1101Inv No = EXPERT1 / CLASSIC1Inv Amt = 100Inv Currency = CADGL detail = 50Disb = 502Vendor = 1101Inv No = EXPERT2 / CLASSIC2Inv Amt = 100Inv Currency = GBPGL detail = 50Disb = 503Vendor = 1101Inv No = EXPERT3 / CLASSIC3Inv Amt = 100Inv Currency = USDGL detail = 50Disb = 50 | Expected: Set A will have Invoice Num = Classic1, 2 and 3Set B will have Invoice Num =  Expert1, 2 and 3Your invoices should look as attached. (If created using Classic).Expert1 and Classic1 should haveAPT_INVOICE.INV_AMT = 91.57443881...APT_INVOICE. DRUNO <> 0Expert2 and Classic2 should haveAPT_INVOICE.INV_AMT = 168.3069596....APT_INVOICE. DRUNO <> 0Expert3 and Classic3 should haveAPT_INVOICE.INV_AMT = 100APT_INVOICE. DRUNO <> 0 || Step 2: In Classic, schedule a payment with GBP. Attach CLASSIC1,2 and 3 into the schedule.Use Add to add invoices in. Add all three invoices.Generate Request. || Step 3: In Expert, schedule a payment with GBP. Attach Expert1,2 and 3 into the schedule using the ADD SINGLE INVOICE screen. || Step 4: Generate RequestCompare the data in tables. || Step 5: New rows with TRAN_TYPE = CH have been inserted in APT_INVOICE_AMT | Expected: 2x3 = 6 rows of CH tran_type inserted, with SOURCE_TRAN_UNO = APT_CHECK.TRAN_UNO || Step 6: Compare entry in APT_INVOICE_AMT for that two sets of invoices too. Check attachment for example. || Step 7: Compare the Schedule Total Amount on APT_CHECK. A check should be created. | Expected: Ensure that the following columns on the table is MATCHED with each other. The value is just a reference as this might be different based on DRUNO.  As long as the request created in Classic and Expert matched. We should be good.APT_CHECK.CHK_AMT = 218.83APT_CHECK.CURRENCY = GBPAPT_CHECK.TEN99_AMT = 218.83APT_CHECK.TC_CHK_AMT = 218.83APT_CHECK.TC_CODE = GBPAPT_CHECK.EXPERT_PAYMENT_STATUS = 'I' || Step 8: Ensure that the check amount generated is matched. | Expected: Use attached REC - Check table.sql

Title: Payment - Client: Default address (Pre 822.EX0006)
Description:
The default address display in the payment screen for vendor payment should be as follow
 
Quote Dave's: 

For a Vendor Payment ( as opposed to Employee, Client or Misc ) we should first look for an Address_Uno on APM_Vendor and use that. 
If one is not present on APM_Vendor ( i.e. the uno is 0 ) then we look for the Address_Uno on the HBM_Name record for the Vendor ( i.e. where vendor.Name_Uno = name.Name_Uno ). 
If that address_Uno is also 0, then we look for the first address that we can find that is attached to the name record ( ie. from HBM_Address where address.Name_Uno = name.Name_Uno )
 
Since the search hiearchy is APM_vendor > hbm_name > hbm_address, we will test this from the lowest hierachy for minimal setup required.
Steps:
Step 1: Data pre reqs(Note: HBM_CLIENT.ADDRESS_UNO is not exposed anywhere in Expert - must be set through SQL) Client 1- Name record has multiple addresses- Name record has default address- Client record has different default address 
Client 2- Name record has multiple addresses- Name record has default address- Client record does not have default address Client 3- Name record has multiple addresses- Name record does not have default address- Client record has default address Client 4- Name record has multiple addresses- Name record does not have default address- Client record does not have default address SELECT ''[Client Name Addresses],c.CLIENT_CODE,n.NAME,CASE WHEN c.ADDRESS_UNO = a.ADDRESS_UNO Then 'Y' ELSE 'N' END [Client Addr Default],CASE WHEN n.ADDRESS_UNO = a.ADDRESS_UNO Then 'Y' ELSE 'N' END [Name Addr Default],a.ADDRESS1,a.ADDRESS2,a.ADDRESS3,a.ADDRESS4,a.CITY,a.STATE_CODE,a.COUNTY,a.REGION_CODE,a.COUNTRY_CODE,a.ADDRESS_CODE, a.ADDRESS_UNO,a.NAME_UNO,c.CLIENT_UNOFROM HBM_ADDRESS aJOIN HBM_NAME n ON a.NAME_UNO = n.NAME_UNOJOIN HBM_CLIENT c ON n.NAME_UNO = c.NAME_UNOWHERE a.ADDRESS_UNO <> 0 --AND c.CLIENT_CODE = 'tst1'ORDER BY c.CLIENT_CODE || Step 2: Client and Name have default addressCreate client payment- use client 1 | Expected: Address set from Name default || Step 3: Only Name has address defaultCreate client payment- use client 2 | Expected: Address set from Name default || Step 4: Only Client has address defaultCreate client payment- use client 3 | Expected: Address set from first one found (this could be a bit random)Note: Address not set in classic || Step 5: No defaultsCreate a client payment- use client 4 | Expected: Address set from first one found (this could be a bit random)Note: Address not set in classic

Add the advance through Add Invoices > Add Multiple Invoices. | Expected: Expense report is returned and added to details grid. || Step 3: Create another advance for us to reconcile with Classic, they should be similiar as Step 1's but with different report name so that we can identify them better. Classic1, CAD 100 || Step 4: Got it approved. || Step 5: In Classic AP, create a new payment schedule in Check Schedule. Also, using BCAD.Use "Generate" to add advance Classic1 | Expected: Advance added to schedule details grid. || Step 6: Compare the two advance entry in APT_ADVANCE_AMT. | Expected: They should be identical despite those unmatchable columns (LAST_MODIFIED) etc make sure they are match with their counterpart. Expert1 = Classic1 etc. || Step 7: Now post them. || Step 8: Reconcile the entries in APT_ADVANCE, APT_CHECK, APS_SCHEDULE_Z and APT_ADVAMCE_AMT. | Expected: APT_ADVANCE_AMT.BAL_ZERO_NO_FCA = Y for Classic1 and NULL for Expert1.

Classic1, CAD 100 || Step 4: Got the reports approved. Check the APT_ADVANCE to make sure they are match with their counterpart. Expert1 = Classic1 etc. || Step 5: In Classic AP, create a new payment schedule in Check Schedule. Also, using BCAD. Fill in the headers and click Ok. Will prompted with 'Expense and Advance Search Criteria', Cancel the window. Use 'Add' on the Detail grid instead. | Expected: Advance is returned and added to details grid. || Step 6: Compare the two Advance entry in APT_ADVANCE_AMT. | Expected: They should be identical beside these fields: DISCNT_AMT (NULL for Classic)WHELD_AMT (NULL for Classic)EXP_RPT_EMPL_UNO (zero for Classic)djo - these columns are not on APT_Advance_Amt ? || Step 7: Generate Request. || Step 8: Compare their value in APT_ADVANCE, APT_CHECK, APS_SCHEDULE_Z and APT_ADVANCE_AMT.

Create vendor payment- use vendor 12. Change Address3. Save4. Reopen payment | Expected: Address is overriden- An address is defaulted on create- Override address list displays only addresses for the vendor name- On reopen of payment, the selected override address is displayed || Step 3: Vendor has addresses and Override Name has addresses1. Create vendor payment- use vendor 12. Override name with name 13. Select a different address4. Save5. Reopen payment | Expected: Name and address is overriden- An address is defaulted on create- Override address list displays only addresses for the vendor name- Can override name with a related name (only names 1 and 2 will be in the list) and the vendor address will be cleared- When name 1 is selected, and address for that name will defaulted and user can choose other addresses that belongs to name 1 only- On reopen of payment, the selected override name and address are displayed || Step 4: Vendor has addresses and Override Name does not have addresses1. Create vendor payment- use vendor 12. Override name with name 23. Save4. Reopen payment | Expected: Name is overriden and address is blank- An address is defaulted on create- Override address list displays only addresses for the vendor name- Can override name with a related name (onlt names 1 and 2 will be in the list) and the vendor address will be cleared- When name 2 is selected, there are no avail addresses- On reopen of payment, the selected override name is displayed and the address is blank || Step 5: Vendor does not have addresses but Override Name has addresses1. Create vendor payment- use vendor 22. Override name with name 13. Select a different address4. Save5. Reopen payment | Expected: Name and address is overriden- An address is not defaulted on create- Override address list is blank- Can override name with a related name (only names 1 and 2 will be in the list) - When name 1 is selected, and address for that name will defaulted and user can choose other addresses that belongs to name 1 only- On reopen of payment, the selected override name and address are displayed || Step 6: Vendor does not have address and Override Name does not have addresses1. Create vendor payment- use vendor 1 (22/11/18 JL: vendor 1 does have an address - tested with vendor 2)2. Override name with name 23. Save4. Reopen payment | Expected: Name is overriden and address is blank- An address is not defaulted on create- Override address list is blank- Can override name with a related name (onlt names 1 and 2 will be in the list) - When name 2 is selected, there are no avail addresses- On reopen of payment, the selected override name is displayed and the address is blank || Step 7: Vendor has unrelated override name and addressNote: This is to support classic1. Create an invoice in classic for vendor 1 and use over name 3 with one of it's addresses2. Create a payment in expert for vendor 1 and add the invoice. When adding the invoice select yes to use the override name and address 3. Save the payment4. Create vendor payment- use vendor 12. Select an address that has an override name3. Save4. Reopen payment | Expected: Address is overriden and name displayed is the override name from the address- Address displays the override address- Override name is displaying the override name from the adress

Title: Payment - Client: Override address (Pre 822.EX0006)
Description:
The default address display in the payment screen for vendor payment should be as follow
 
Quote Dave's: 

For a Vendor Payment ( as opposed to Employee, Client or Misc ) we should first look for an Address_Uno on APM_Vendor and use that. 
If one is not present on APM_Vendor ( i.e. the uno is 0 ) then we look for the Address_Uno on the HBM_Name record for the Vendor ( i.e. where vendor.Name_Uno = name.Name_Uno ). 
If that address_Uno is also 0, then we look for the first address that we can find that is attached to the name record ( ie. from HBM_Address where address.Name_Uno = name.Name_Uno )
 
Since the search hiearchy is APM_vendor > hbm_name > hbm_address, we will test this from the lowest hierachy for minimal setup required.
Steps: Step 1: Data pre reqsClient 1- has multiple addressesClient 2- Does not have any addresses || Step 2: Client has addresses 1. Create client payment- use client 12. Change Address3. Save4. Reopen payment | Expected: Address is overriden- An address may be defaulted on create- Name can't be overridden- Override address list displays only addresses for the client name- On reopen of payment, the selected override address is displayed || Step 3: Client does not have addresses 1. Create client payment- use client 22. Edit the payment3. Save4. Reopen payment | Expected: Name and address is overriden- No address is defaulted- Name can't be overridden- No override addresses in the override address list - Payment can be saved with no address

Title: Payment Items - Invoice: withholding tax
Steps: Step 1: Note:Withholding tax is what the law firm deducts from the amount paid to the vendor and pays this withholding amount to the govt. || Step 2: Pre reqs1. Set the database to use withholding taxSELECT*FROM CMS_OPTION WHERE OPTION_CODE ='WHTAX_IN_USE'UPDATE CMS_OPTION SET FLAG_VALUE ='Y'WHERE OPTION_CODE ='WHTAX_IN_USE'2. Set the withholding tax % to 10%SELECT WHOLD_PCNT FROM APM_PARMSUPDATE APM_PARMS SET WHOLD_PCNT = 10 || Step 3: Create Invoice1. Create invoice- Payment terms is set to one that has a discount of 2%- Amount = 100- Withhold tax = ON2. Add invoice details3. Post the invoice | Expected: Invoice created || Step 4: Add the invoice to a payment1. Create payment2. Add the invoice | Expected: Invoice details added with withheld amount- Discount amount = 2.00- Withheld amount is 10% of the 100 balance - Discount (98.00) = 9.80- 1099 is balance - discount = 98.00- Payment amount is Balance - discount - withheld amount (100.00 - 2.00 - 9.80_) = 88.20

Save | Expected: Use: REC - Fields CDT_DISB.sql* Payment is saved in CAD* Disb is saved in CAD || Step 4: Create a vendor payment 3 - has rates not system currencyand compare record to release version Payment1. Title: Payment Items - Disbursement: look and feel
Steps: Step 1: Note: The majority of the validation has been tested under Invoices Items || Step 2: General | Expected: https://aderant.sharepoint.com/RD/AP/Moscow%20Design%20Wiki/Disbursement%20Detail%20Form.aspx * Save & Close and Save & Add are only enabled when mandatory fields are completed (not enabled when a saved disb is first opened)* Cancel is enabled and launches the Discard/Cancel dialog if there are changes* Date is defaulted to today* On Save & Add the form is reset* Once payment is released, the disb items are non editable || Step 3: Date | Expected: * Must fall within the parameters* Disbursement must not be after matter's close date* If disbursement parameters do not allow disbursement's prior to matter open date then the date must be on or after matter open date SELECT MIN_DATE,MAX_DATE, * FROM CDM_Parms || Step 4: Matter | Expected: * Active matters* Status must allow disbs || Step 5: Phase/Task- Has active and inactive records | Expected: * Optional - Lookup- Does not return record with UNO 0- Searches on phase code, task code code and description- Returns only Active items - Has MRUs SELECT pt.INACTIVE[PT Inactive],pt.PHASE_CODE,p.INACTIVE[P Inactive],p.PHASE_DESC,pt.TASK_CODE,t.INACTIVE [T Inactive],t.TASK_DESCFROM TBL_PHTASK pt LEFT OUTER JOIN TBL_PHASE p ON pt.PHASE_CODE = p.PHASE_CODE LEFT OUTER JOIN TBL_TASK t ON pt.TASK_CODE = t.TASK_CODE WHERE pt.PHTASK_UNO > 0 ORDERBY p.PHASE_DESC,t.TASK_DESC || Step 6: Disb Type | Expected: * Mandatory* Can only be hard disb || Step 7: Disb Code- Has active and inactive records | Expected: * Mandatory - Lookup - Does not return record with UNO 0- Returns Active items  - If vendor has a restricted list (set up in entity manager) then Data provider only returns restricted list of items - MRUs are suppressed for Vendor payment due to Vendor can have a restricted list SELECT COST_CODE, COST_DESC,*FROM CDL_COST cc WHERE INACTIVE!='Y'AND ALLOW_HARD='Y'ORDER BY cc.COST_CODE SELECT v.VENDOR_ID,v.VENDOR_NAME,cc.ALLOW_HARD,vc.* FROM APA_VENDOR_COST vcJOIN APM_VENDOR v on vc.VENDOR_UNO = v.VENDOR_UNOJOIN CDL_COST cc ON vc.COST_CODE = cc.COST_CODEORDERBY v.VENDOR_ID || Step 8: Employee | Expected: * Optional unless the incurring employee is required as set in the cost codeSELECT COST_CODE, COST_DESC,INEMP_REQD,*FROM CDL_COST cc WHERE INACTIVE!='Y'AND ALLOW_HARD='Y'AND INEMP_REQD = 'Y'ORDER BY cc.COST_CODE || Step 9: Office- Has active and inactive records | Expected: * Mandatory - Drop down- Active items - Has MRUs SELECT * FROM HBL_OFFICE || Step 10: Jurisdiction- Has active and inactive records | Expected: * Mandatory- Drop down- Searches on code and desc- Active items - Has MRUs- Is active and is not output tax SELECT * FROM TBL_JURISDIC TJ1 WHERE TJ1.INACTIVE != 'Y' AND TJ1.TAX_IN_OUT != 'O' || Step 11: Location- Has active and inactive records | Expected: * Optional- Drop down- Active items  SELECT TL1.INACTIVE,TL1.LOCATION_CODE,TL1.LOCATION_DESC FROM TBL_LOCATION TL1 WHERE ( ( TL1.LOCATION_CODE != '' ) ) AND (  ( NOT ( TL1.INACTIVE='Y' ) ) ) ORDER BY TL1.LOCATION_DESC || Step 12: Authorized By Employee1. Set the disb type to require authorizing2. Set the authorizing employee e.g. against a matter. In entity Manager under Other Employees | Expected: * Optional unless the authorised employee is required as set in the cost code* Authorising employee can be set at client or matter level. As this is at matter level, if you set a different employee at both client and matter level, either is a valid authorizer. If one is not set then any employee can authorise otherwise is limited to those set - Lookup- Does not return record with UNO 0- Searches on employee code and name- Returns Active items  - Has MRUs SELECT COST_CODE, COST_DESC,AUEMP_REQD,*FROM CDL_COST cc WHERE INACTIVE!='Y'AND ALLOW_HARD='Y'AND AUEMP_REQD ='Y'ORDERBY cc.COST_CODEDECLARE @clientmattercode asvarchar (50)='TST1.1'DECLARE @matter asint= (SELECT MATTER_UNO FROM HBM_MATTER WHERE CLNT_MATT_CODE = @clientmattercode)DECLARE @client asint= (SELECT CLIENT_UNO FROM HBM_MATTER WHERE CLNT_MATT_CODE = @clientmattercode)SELECT TCA1.CLIENT_UNO,TCA1.MATTER_UNO,TCA1.ROW_UNO,TCA1.EMPL_UNO , emp.EMPLOYEE_NAME, emp.EMPLOYEE_CODEFROM TBM_CLMAT_AUEMP TCA1 JOIN HBM_PERSNL emp on TCA1.EMPL_UNO = emp.EMPL_UNOWHERE TCA1.MATTER_UNO = @matter OR TCA1.CLIENT_UNO = @clientSELECT emp.EMPLOYEE_CODE,c.CLIENT_CODE,m.CLNT_MATT_CODE,mau.CLIENT_UNO,mau.MATTER_UNO,mau.ROW_UNO,mau.EMPL_UNO FROM TBM_CLMAT_AUEMP mau JOIN HBM_PERSNL emp ON mau.EMPL_UNO = emp.EMPL_UNOLEFT JOIN HBM_CLIENT c ON mau.CLIENT_UNO = c.CLIENT_UNOLEFT JOIN HBM_MATTER m ON mau.MATTER_UNO = m.MATTER_UNOORDER BY emp.EMPLOYEE_CODE || Step 13: Currency | Expected: Always default from incurring officehttps://aderant.sharepoint.com/sites/Iknow/Expert/Internal%20Docs/Salesforce/Soft%20Disbursements%20Without%20Unit%20Rates%20Inherit%20Currency%20from%20Incurring%20Office.PDF#search=Disbursement%20default%20currencyNote: Rules for defaulting currency differ depending on the source and if the cost code has rates For CDN type disbs (those originating from disb app, billing, classic disbs)Cost code has Unit rate - default hierachy is matter then CDM parmsCost code does not have unit rate - default from incurring office || Step 14: Project | Expected: Field visible when projects in useSELECT USE_PROJ_ACC,*FROM TBM_PARMSUPDATE TBM_PARMS SET USE_PROJ_ACC = 'Y' || Step 15: Base amount | Expected: - Max length 14- Disable when first opening the form.- Default to empty and mandatoryFrom 82SP2.EX0003 and 83 US 241218 - Set Disbursement Card Base and Bill Amount to required and blank field when initialise the form.enable on form initialization, fields are blank || Step 16: Bill amount | Expected: - Bill amount is defaulted from Base amount if Bill amount is editable - Where cost code has 100% markdown and apply to base is off,  the amount will be set to zero when base amount is populated- Max length 14From 82SP2.EX0003 and 83 US 241218 - Set Disbursement Card Base and Bill Amount to required and blank field when initialise the form.enable on form initialization, fields are blank || Step 17: Reference || Step 18: Narrative | Expected: * Supports spellcheck and expansion codesNote: you have to have expansion codes - right click in the narrative field to get the menu options. To use the expansion code, you need to type '=' which brimgs up the list of codes for you select from * Auto generated if parameter is set on e.g.'VENDOR : Vendor Name; DATE: Date'  SELECT GEN_DISB_TEXT,*FROM APM_PARMSUPDATE APM_PARMS SET GEN_DISB_TEXT ='Y' || Step 19: Prebill Comments | Expected: *Supports spellcheck and expansion codesNote: you have to have expansion codes - right click in the narrative field to get the menu options. To use the expansion code, you need to type '=' which brimgs up the list of codes for you select from

Title: Payment - Employee Manual: Create/Post/Cancel
Steps: Step 1: Pre reqs Set tax fields on:UPDATE CMS_OPTION SET FLAG_VALUE ='Y' WHERE OPTION_CODE ='SALES_USE_TX'UPDATE CMS_OPTION SET FLAG_VALUE ='Y'WHERE OPTION_CODE ='TAXES_IN_USE'UPDATE APM_PARMS SET DEFAULT_TAX_IN ='X'--Q,X,Y,N || Step 2: Create payment with detail itemType = EmployeeBank = BUSDPayment date = todayMethod = ManualCheck Number = next availAmount = 100Sales / Use Tax = 100Enter any other mandatory fieldsDetails Item amount = $100 | Expected: Payment created APT_CHECK ENTRY_STATUS = NEXPERT_PAYMENT_STATUS = CSOURCE = MREVERSAL = NPAYEE_TYPE = EDOCUMENT_TYPE = MCHECK_NUM = as enteredPERIOD = 0DRUNO = 0TC_CODE = USDTC_CHK_AMT = 100CURRENCY_CODE = USDORIGINAL_AMT = NULLCHK_AMT = 100.00 (payment currency)SALES_USE_TAX = 100.00 (payment currency)TAX_AMT = 0 Note: TEXT_ID is NULL in expert and 0 in classic - not an issue as can't process the expert payment in classic || Step 3: Post the payment | Expected: Payment posted APT_CHECK (updated) ENTRY_STATUS = REXPERT_PAYMENT_STATUS = OSOURCE = MREVERSAL = NPAYEE_TYPE = EDOCUMENT_TYPE = MCHECK_NUM = as enteredPERIOD = latest periodDRUNO = current drunoTC_CODE = USDTC_CHK_AMT = 100CURRENCY_CODE = USDORIGINAL_AMT = 0CHK_AMT = 100.00 (system currency)SALES_USE_TAX = 100.00 (system currency)TAX_AMT = 0 || Step 4: Cancel the payment- today as transaction date- comments | Expected: Payment canceled  APT_CHECK (updated) ENTRY_STATUS = REXPERT_PAYMENT_STATUS = XSOURCE = MREVERSAL = NPAYEE_TYPE = EDOCUMENT_TYPE = MCHECK_NUM = as enteredPERIOD = latest periodDRUNO = current drunoTC_CODE = USDTC_CHK_AMT = 100CURRENCY_CODE = USDORIGINAL_AMT = 0CHK_AMT = 100.00 (system currency)SALES_USE_TAX = 100.00 (system currency)TAX_AMT = 0 APT_CHECK  for contra entry created with same REQUEST_NUM ENTRY_STATUS = REXPERT_PAYMENT_STATUS = MSOURCE = MREVERSAL = YPAYEE_TYPE = EDOCUMENT_TYPE = MCHECK_NUM = copied from originalPERIOD = latest periodDRUNO = current drunoTC_CODE = USDTC_CHK_AMT = -100CURRENCY_CODE = USDORIGINAL_AMT = 0CHK_AMT = -100.00 (system currency)SALES_USE_TAX = -100.00 (system currency)TAX_AMT = 0 || Step 5: Reconcile the payments | Expected: APT_CHECK- All fields that should match, do- All fields that won't match e.g. unos, are populated with the appropriate values CHECK_LANGUAGE is set to NULL in classic on contra entry

Title: Payment - Cancel: Look and Feel
Steps: Step 1: Cancel Payment Form | Expected: - Employee is mandatory and defaults to logged on user- Cancel date is mandatorySELECT MIN_DATE,MAX_DATE FROM APM_PARMS- Reason is mandatory- Comments is optional- Comments Supports spellcheck and Expansion codes- Comments Max characters = 15000SELECT*FROM ACT_TEXT ORDER BY TEXT_ID desc- Cancel to new payment only enabled when form called from payment  form or when only one payment selected from the grid- New payment date disabled when Cancel to New is off otherwiser it's mandatory and defaults to selected payment's payment date- Cancel button enabled, cancels the form- Cancel Payment button only enabled when all mandatory fields entered || Step 2: Cancel Button from grid ribbon bar - Check and Manual Payments | Expected: - enabled when all selected items are posted || Step 3: Cancel Button from payment ribbon bar - Check and Manual payments | Expected: - enabled when item is posted || Step 4: Cancel Button from grid ribbon bar - wire and electronic paymentsSELECT AUTO_RECONCILE_WIRE,*FROM APM_PARMS--UPDATE APM_PARMS SET AUTO_RECONCILE_WIRE = 'Y' | Expected: - Enabled when all selected items are posted - Enabled when all selected items are Posted or Reconciled if auto reconcile is on, other disabled || Step 5: Cancel Button from payment ribbon bar - wire and electronic paymentsSELECT AUTO_RECONCILE_WIRE,*FROM APM_PARMS--UPDATE APM_PARMS SET AUTO_RECONCILE_WIRE = 'Y' | Expected: - Enabled item is posted - Enabled when item is Posted or Reconciled if auto reconcile is on, other disabled || Step 6: Transaction date is less than minimum1. Posted payment2. Select to cancel3. Enter transaction date that is < than the minimumSELECT MIN_DATE FROM APM_PARMS4. Cancel payment | Expected: Display error: Date is outside minimum and maximum range || Step 7: Transaction date is greater than maximum1. Posted payment2. Select to cancel3. Enter transaction date that is < than the minimumSELECT MAX_DATE FROM APM_PARMS4. Cancel payment | Expected: Display error: Date is outside minimum and maximum range

Title: Performance - Merge Vendor Wizard
Steps: Step 1: Data pre req - InvoicesUse VEN - Add bulk invoices for merge.sqlUse the above script to add bulk invoice headers. You can set the start number and how many invoices to add e.g. to add 100000 unique numbered invoices headers to each vendor:DECLARE @invoicenum1 as int = 1 DECLARE @invoicenum2 as int = 100001 DECLARE @numrecords1 as int = 100000 DECLARE @numrecords2 as int = 100000 | Expected: Vendor 1 100000 invoice headers starting from 1Vendor 2100000 invoice headers starting from 100001 || Step 2: Data pre req - Vendor ContactsUse VEN - Add bulk contacts for merge.sqlUse the above script to add bulb vendor contacts. e.g. to load half of the name records to vendor 1 and half of the name records to vendor 2:DECLARE @contactnumber1 as int = 1 DECLARE @lastcontactnumber1 as int = 401 DECLARE @contactnumber2 as int = 401 DECLARE @lastcontactnumber2 as int = 801 | Expected: Vendor 1 the first 400 name records Vendor 2the next 400 name records || Step 3: Run the vender merge wizardSelect the 2 vendors then select next | Expected: The validation for duplicate invoices runs within an accepted time || Step 4: Next | Expected: The merge completes within an accepted time

Title: Payment - Release/Unrelease: Look and Feel
Steps: Step 1: From Payment entry screen - release | Expected: Button Enabled if:- the user has the release payment security permission and- the payment is not in a work flow (unless it is the current wortkflow)and - the payment status is Completed (C) || Step 2: From Payment entry screen - unrelease | Expected: Button Enabled if:- the user has the release payment security permission and- the payment is not in a work flow (unless it is the current wortkflow)and - the payment status is Released (R) || Step 3: From Payment grid - release | Expected: Button Enabled if:- the user has the release payment security permission and- one or more payments are selectedand - the payments are not in a work flow and - the payment statuses are all Completed (C) || Step 4: From Payment grid - unrelease | Expected: Button Enabled if:- the user has the release payment security permission and- one or more payments are selectedand- the payments are not in a work flow and - the payment statuses are all Released (R) || Step 5: Payment grid | Expected: Grid updatedIf released/unreleased from grid then grid should update on completion || Step 6: Payment screen | Expected: Released- Header disabled- Details button disabled except for viewUnreleased- Back to editable state

Title: Invoice: Vendor Default Address
Description:
The default address display in the payment screen for vendor payment should be as follow
 
Quote Dave's: 

For a Vendor Payment ( as opposed to Employee, Client or Misc ) we should first look for an Address_Uno on APM_Vendor and use that. 
If one is not present on APM_Vendor ( i.e. the uno is 0 ) then we look for the Address_Uno on the HBM_Name record for the Vendor ( i.e. where vendor.Name_Uno = name.Name_Uno ). 
If that address_Uno is also 0, then we look for the first address that we can find that is attached to the name record ( ie. from HBM_Address where address.Name_Uno = name.Name_Uno )
 
Since the search hiearchy is APM_vendor > hbm_name > hbm_address, we will test this from the lowest hierachy for minimal setup required.
Steps: Step 1: Note: This test case is original used to test Vendor Default address in PAYMENT (Test Case 143076.) . It is modified to test on INVOICE. || Step 2: Setup Vendor Default address in Vendor > Remit AddressSetup Name Default address in Vendor > Name Entity window > Addresses || Step 3: Data pre reqsNote: Make sure the default addresses you set are not the first addresses so you know you're not just getting back the first address in the listVendor 1- Name record has multiple addresses- Name record has default address- Vendor record has different default addressVendor 2- Name record has multiple addresses- Name record has default address- Vendor record does not have default addressVendor 3- Name record has multiple addresses- Name record does not have default address- Vendor record has default addressVendor 4- Name record has multiple addresses- Name record does not have default address- Vendor record does not have default addressSELECT''[Vendor Name Addresses],v.VENDOR_ID,n.NAME,CASEWHEN v.ADDRESS_UNO = a.ADDRESS_UNO Then'Y'ELSE'N'END [Ven Addr Default],CASEWHEN n.ADDRESS_UNO = a.ADDRESS_UNO Then'Y'ELSE'N'END [Name Addr Default],a.ADDRESS1,a.ADDRESS2,a.ADDRESS3,a.ADDRESS4,a.CITY,a.STATE_CODE,a.COUNTY,a.REGION_CODE,a.COUNTRY_CODE,a.ADDRESS_CODE, a.ADDRESS_UNO,a.NAME_UNO,v.VENDOR_UNOFROM HBM_ADDRESS aJOIN HBM_NAME n ON a.NAME_UNO = n.NAME_UNOJOIN APM_VENDOR v ON n.NAME_UNO = v.NAME_UNOWHERE a.ADDRESS_UNO <> 0 --AND VENDOR_ID = 'JANA1'ORDERBY v.VENDOR_ID || Step 4: Vendor and Name have default addressCreate invoice for Vendor 1SELECT ''[Different Default Vendor and Name address],v.VENDOR_ID,v.VENDOR_NAME,NAME,v.ADDRESS_UNO[Vendor default address],n.ADDRESS_UNO[Name default address] FROM APM_VENDOR vJOIN HBM_NAME n ON v.NAME_UNO = n.NAME_UNOWHERE v.ADDRESS_UNO > 0AND n.ADDRESS_UNO > 0AND v.ADDRESS_UNO <> n.ADDRESS_UNO | Expected: Address set from Vendor default || Step 5: Only Name has address defaultCreate invoice for Vendor 2SELECT ''[Default Name address only],v.VENDOR_ID,v.VENDOR_NAME,NAME,n.ADDRESS_UNO[Name default address] FROM APM_VENDOR vJOIN HBM_NAME n ON v.NAME_UNO = n.NAME_UNOWHERE v.ADDRESS_UNO = 0AND n.ADDRESS_UNO > 0 | Expected: Address set from Name default || Step 6: Only Vendor has address defaultCreate invoice for Vendor 3SELECT''[Default Vendor address only],v.VENDOR_ID,v.VENDOR_NAME,NAME,v.ADDRESS_UNO [Vendor default address]FROM APM_VENDOR vJOIN HBM_NAME n ON v.NAME_UNO = n.NAME_UNOWHERE v.ADDRESS_UNO > 0AND n.ADDRESS_UNO = 0 | Expected: Address set from Vendor default || Step 7: No defaultsCreate invoice for Vendor 4 | Expected: Address set from first one found (this could be a bit random)Note: Address not set in classic

Title: Payment - Release/Unrelease: Validation
Steps: Step 1: Display of errors (release and unrelease) | Expected: - Via a job - display in Recent activities- Via a payment - display in red alert bar || Step 2: Can't get a lockPayment is already locked1. Open a payment that is Completed2. Keep the payment open and go to the grid and select the payment3. Attempt to release the payment | Expected: Display error: APCHPOST_UNABLETOLOCKCan't lock the payment || Step 3: Completed and Printed (release)Can't release when payment is printed 1. Start with a check payment that has been printed2. Update the payment to Completed via sqlUPDATE APT_CHECK SET EXPERT_PAYMENT_STATUS ='C'WHERE request_num = 3. Refresh the grid4. Attempt to release the payment from the grid | Expected: Display error: CHKENTRY_UNABLETORELNon-manual check must have check number set to 0 || Step 4: No detail line (release)Payment must have detail lines1. Create a payment with an amount <> 0 and no detail items2. Update the payment to Completed via sqlUPDATE APT_CHECK SET EXPERT_PAYMENT_STATUS ='C'WHERE request_num = 3. Refresh the grid4. Attempt to release the payment from the grid | Expected: Display error: CHKENTRY_NOOFFSETDetails incomplete || Step 5: Detail line does not equal payment (release)Detail lines must equal payment amount1. Create a wire transfer payment2. Add detail lines to match so that payment is completed3. Close payment4. Alter the payment amount via sqlupdate APT_CHECK set TC_CHK_AMT = 11, CHK_AMT = 11 where REQUEST_NUM =5. Select the payment from the grid and select to release | Expected: Display error: CHKENTRY_UNALLOCATEDCHKAMTSum of detail lines does not equal check amount || Step 6: Invalid payment amount for Electronic (release)Payment amount must be > 0 for Electronic banking 1. Create an electronic payment and a GL detail line to match2. Edit the via sql to set amount to zeroupdate APT_CHECK set TC_CHK_AMT = 0, CHK_AMT = 0 where REQUEST_NUM = update ACT_TRAN_JE set TC_DEBIT = 0, DEBIT = 0, TC_CREDIT = 0, CREDIT = 0 where GL_ROW_UNO = 3. Refresh the grid4. Attempt to release the payment from the grid | Expected: Display error: CHKENTRY_MANCHKSINVALIDAMTAmount must be greater than zero || Step 7: Invalid payment amount for Check, Wire or Manual (release)Payment amount must be >= 0 for Check, Wire or Manual 1. Create an check payment and a GL detail line to match2. Edit the via sql to set amount to -1update APT_CHECK set TC_CHK_AMT = -1, CHK_AMT = -1 where REQUEST_NUM = update ACT_TRAN_JE set TC_DEBIT = 0, DEBIT = 0, TC_CREDIT = 1, CREDIT = 1 where GL_ROW_UNO = 3. Refresh the grid4. Attempt to release the payment from the grid | Expected: Display error: CHKENTRY_MANCHKSINVALIDAMTCannot have neg amount || Step 8: Invalid Print Date (release)Date to print cannot be in the pastNote: This is only for payment type C. Should not validate for payment types of M, E and W1. Create a check payment2. Add detail lines to match so that payment is completed3. Close payment4. Alter the payment date to be older than today via sqlUPDATE APT_CHECK SET DATE_TO_PRINT =getdate()-1 WHERE request_num =5. Select the payment from the grid and select to release | Expected: This validation has been removedThe expected result  now is that the payment should be released with no error messageOld error: CHKENTRY_INVALIDPRINTDAYE || Step 9: Invalid payment date (release)Payment date must be within the valid range in PARMS1. Create a payment- payment date is yesterday2. Add detail lines to match so that payment is completed3. Close the payment4. Alter the min date allowed to be today via sqlUPDATE APM_PARMS SET MIN_DATE =getdate()5. Select the payment from the grid and select to release | Expected: Display error: CHKENTRY_INVALIDCHKDATERANGEDate must be between ... and ... || Step 10: Invalid Jurisdiction Code (release)If the jurisdiction is Output tax only (i.e. tax on client bills) then it's not valid for AP invoices1. Create a payment with details lines that match the amount 2. Using Tax Jurisdiction Maintenance, change the jurisdiction used so that Tax In /Out = Out3. Attempt to release the payment | Expected: Display error: AP_INVALIDJURISDICCODE || Step 11: Trust payment will reduce the account balance below the minimum (release)The payment is a trust payment so can not reduce the account balance below the min allowable balance for this bank1. Set the min amount on the bank that is being used for the trust paymentUPDATE TBM_BANK SET MIN_BALANCE =WHERE BANK_CODE = 2. Create a client payment3. Add a trust detail item where the avail trust - the details items amount < bank's min4. Attempt to release--Trust account balanceSELECTCONVERT(DECIMAL(25, 10),ROUND(a.AMOUNT * a.SIGN* b.RATE, c.DECIMAL_PLACES)*POWER(SIGN(d.AVAILABLE_AMT), 2))[Amount],d.*FROM ACT_TRAN_TRUST a, TBL_CURR_RATE b, TBL_CURRENCY c, TRM_TRUST d WHERE  d.TRUST_UNO = a.TRUST_UNO AND b.DRUNO = a.DRUNOAND d.BANK_CODE ='TBUSD' AND b.CURRENCY_CODE ='USD'and c.CURRENCY_CODE = b.CURRENCY_CODEAND ((a.PERIOD <> 0 AND a.HELD <>'Y')OR (a.PERIOD = 0 AND a.SIGN=-1))--Get the bank accounts minimum balanceSELECT MIN_BALANCE,*FROM TBM_BANK WHERE BANK_CODE ='TBUSD'If ( Available Balance - Check.CheckAmount ) < minimum balance | Expected: Display error: TRST_BANK_VIOLATE_MIN_BALANCEBug 195508 - Need a description for error TRST_BANK_VIOLATE_MIN_BALANCE || Step 12: Check number must be 0 for check paymentWhen payment is for a Check (C) check number must be 0 (release)1. Create a check payment2. Add details lines to match amount3. Set a check number that hasn't been usedupdate APT_CHECK set CHECK_NUM = 999999 where REQUEST_NUM =4. Attemp to release the payment | Expected: Display error: CHKENTRY_INVALIDCHKRANGENon manual check must have check number set to zero || Step 13: Payment for manual check has number that is already usedFor a manual check the number must not have already been used for this bank (release)1. Create a manual payment where details lines equal payment amount. Set the check number to the next avail.2. Alter the check number to one that has already been used by a posted paymentUPDATE APT_CHECK set CHECK_NUM = WHERE request_num = 3. Attempt to release the payment | Expected: Display error: PRINTCHK_INVALIDCHKNUMThe requested check number does not exist or is already in use || Step 14: Check number for manual payment is not enteredFor manual the number must be between 1 and 9999999981. Create a manual payment where details lines equal payment amount. Set the check number to the next avail.2. Alter the check number to 0UPDATE APT_CHECK set CHECK_NUM = 0 WHERE request_num = 3. Attempt to release the payment | Expected: Display error: PRINTCHK_INVALIDCHKNUM The requested check number does not exist or is already in use || Step 15: Check number for manual payment must in a valid rangeFor manual the number must be between 1 and 9999999981. Create a manual payment where details lines equal payment amount. Set the check number to the next avail.2. Alter the check number to 999999999UPDATE APT_CHECK set CHECK_NUM = 0 WHERE request_num = 3. Attempt to release the payment | Expected: Display error: CHKENTRY_INVALIDCHKRANGECheck number must be between 1 and 999999998, inclusive || Step 16: Payment has detail lines with validation messagesCreate a payment with detail lines where at least one detail item has a validaton message. If you have trouble creating this situation then just add a validation row to the table e.g.IF NOT EXISTS (SELECT * FROM CMS_UNIQUE_KEYS WHERE TBNAME = 'APT_MESSAGE')BEGININSERT INTO [dbo].[CMS_UNIQUE_KEYS] ([TBNAME]) VALUES ('APT_MESSAGE')ENDINSERT INTO APT_MESSAGE (ROW_UNO,COMMAND_ID,SOURCE_TYPE,SOURCE_UNO,INVOICE_UNO,PARENT_TYPE,ADVANCE_UNO,MODULE_ID,MESSAGE,IS_FATAL,RULE_KEY,REASON,EMPL_UNO,OVERRIDE,OVERRIDE_EMPL_UNO,CREATED_DATE,SEVERITY,LAST_MODIFIED)VALUES((SELECT LASTKEY + 1 FROM CMS_UNIQUE_KEYS WHERE TBNAME = 'APT_MESSAGE'),'E43881C6-F3E1-4402-B5DF-BAF983BDC7E2','AccountingJournalTransaction',390,1940,'Check',0,100150,'Test','N',NULL,NULL,0,NULL,0,NULL,NULL,getdate()) UPDATE CMS_UNIQUE_KEYS SET LASTKEY = LASTKEY + 1 WHERE TBNAME = 'APT_MESSAGE' | Expected: Display error: CHKENTRY_DET_HAS_ERRORPayment details have validation errorsIt actually just displayed the message from the message table - I guess that's ok || Step 17: Account must be linked1. Create a payment2. Add a GL item3. Save4. Unlink the account from  the office/dept that was used in  the GL itemClassic | General Ledger | G/L Setup | Links | Office/Department/Account5. Release | Expected: Display Error: Account, office and department are not linked for all detail rows

Title: Payment - Release/Unrelease: Release and Unrelease
Steps: Step 1: Release one payment1. Select one completed payment that has not been printed2. Select release | Expected: Payment releasedAPT_CHECK.EXPERT_PAYMENT_STATUS = RAPT_CHECK.ENTRY_STATUS = RAPT_CHECK.LAST_MODIFIED = updated || Step 2: Unrelease one payment1. Select one released payment that has not been printed2. Select unrelease | Expected: Payment unreleasedAPT_CHECK.EXPERT_PAYMENT_STATUS = CAPT_CHECK.ENTRY_STATUS = NAPT_CHECK.LAST_MODIFIED = updated || Step 3: Release multiple payments1. Select multiple completed payments that have not been printed2. Select release | Expected: Payments releasedAPT_CHECK.EXPERT_PAYMENT_STATUS = RAPT_CHECK.ENTRY_STATUS = RAPT_CHECK.LAST_MODIFIED = updated || Step 4: Unrelease multiple payments1. Select multiple released payments that have not been printed2. Select unrelease | Expected: Payments unreleasedAPT_CHECK.EXPERT_PAYMENT_STATUS = CAPT_CHECK.ENTRY_STATUS = NAPT_CHECK.LAST_MODIFIED = updated

Title: Create Payment - General Including validation
Steps: Step 1: Note: Make sure the ribbon is behaving the same in Entry and List screen. Test in both Vendor and Employee Schedule. || Step 2: Create Payment ribbon button | Expected: Disabled when - no invoice attachedor- APM_PARMS.EDIT_LIST = 'Y' and APS_SCHEDULE_Z.PRINTED = 'N'or Status = P Enabled when - Invoice attached and Status = EAnd(- APM_PARMS.EDIT_LIST = 'Y' and APS_SCHEDULE_Z.PRINTED = 'Y'or- APM_PARMS.EDIT_LIST = 'N' ) || Step 3: Create Payment ribbon button securityGenerateRequests security permission | Expected: Visible when on otherwise not visible || Step 4: Dialog messageOn a valid schedule, click Create Payments | Expected: Dialog indicating operation is final will show up with 'Do not show this message again' check box || Step 5: Validate payment datePayment date is outside the parameters e.g.1. Schedule with invoices where payments are not created yet and payment dates = today2. Update max dateUPDATE APM_PARMS SET MAX_DATE = getdate() -13. Attempt to create payments | Expected: Error messagePayment date is invalid || Step 6: Cancel Create Payments1. Payment schedule2. Add invoices3. Select to createt paymentsConfirmation dialog4. Cancel | Expected: Create payments job is not started Create payments button is enabledBug 254829 - AP - payment schedule entry ribbon buttons will become greyed out if the user chooses to cancel out of Create Payments || Step 7: Payments already exist - service validationNote: Due to the intermitant issues that some clients are having with duplicated payments being created, this extra validation had been added.1. Create and post some invoices2. Add the invoices to a payment schedule3. Create payments- Payments created- Payment schedule status will be se to 'P'4. Set the status back to 'E' so you can attempt to kick off the job againupdate APS_SCHEDULE_Z set status = 'E' where SCHEDULE_NUM =3. Select to Create payments | Expected: Create payments job is not startedError: Payments already exist || Step 8: Payments already exist - SP validationNote: Due to the intermitant issues that some clients are having with duplicated payments being created, this extra validation had been added.1. Create and post some invoices2. Add the invoices to a payment schedule3. Create payments- Payments created- Payment schedule status will be set to 'P'4. Run the Generate SPexec APP_GenerateRequests 16, '' | Expected: SP returns an error Msg 50000, Level 11, State 1, Procedure APP_GenerateRequests, Line 19 [Batch Start Line 3]PAYMENTS_ALREADY_EXIST Bug 265688: Persistent Issue - BUG: Duplicate payments created in Payment Schedule when generating payments in Expert AP || Step 9: Payments already exist - SP validation and error return to UINote: This is to test  that the error message does get returned and translated1. Create and post some invoices2. Add the invoices to a payment schedule3. Edit the SP so that it will always fail by commenting out the if exists checkBEGINTRY BEGINTRAN        declare @existingChecks int        select @existingChecks = count(1) from apt_check where SCHEDULE_NUM = @checkScheduleId        --if (@existingChecks > 0)        begin            raiserror('PAYMENTS_ALREADY_EXIST', 11, 1)            return;        end4. Select to Create payments | Expected: Job is started but fails with validation checkPayments Already ExistBug 265688: Persistent Issue - BUG: Duplicate payments created in Payment Schedule when generating payments in Expert AP

Title: Payment - Release/Unrelease: User must have security to all the books used by the payment
Steps: Step 1: Note: unsure as to whether or not this is a valid test case. Neither expert nor classic seem to check this security || Step 2: Pre req System settings Allow row security for booksSELECT ROW_SECURITY,* FROM CMS_DD_TABLE WHERE TABLE_NAME like ('GLL_DATASET')UPDATE CMS_DD_TABLE SET ROW_SECURITY='Y' WHERE TABLE_NAME='GLL_DATASET' || Step 3: Pre reqs data securityNote: Reopen the app after making the changes, to pick up the security changes (not sure if this is required)User 1Set a user so that they have full privilegesUPDATE HBM_PERSNL SET PRIVILEGE_LEVEL = 1 WHERE LOGIN= ''User 2Set a user so that they don't have full privilegesUPDATE HBM_PERSNL SET PRIVILEGE_LEVEL = 0 WHERE LOGIN= ''BookSet custom security on book 1 to disallow user 2Classic | General Ledger | G/L Setup | Book maintenance- Custom security- Set user to X || Step 4: Create a payment User 1- Vendor payment- Type = check- Add a GL item Note: Ensure sum of GL amount matches the payment amountSELECT ''[Books - GLL_DATASET],* FROM GLL_DATASET WHERE DATASET_NUM IN (SELECT DISTINCT c.BOOK FROM act_tran_je gl INNER JOIN GLM_CHART c on gl.ACCT_UNO = c.ACCT_UNO WHERE gl.TRAN_UNO = @tran) | Expected: Payment  is createdStatus is completed || Step 5: Release payment - User does not have security permisson to the BooksUser 21. Select the payment created by user 12. Attempt to release the payment | Expected: Release failsError message:CHKENTRY_SECURITY_VIOLATIONUser must have security permission to all the books used for the payment || Step 6: Release payment - User has security permisson to the BooksUser 11. Select the payment created by user 12. Attempt to release the payment | Expected: Release succeeds || Step 7: Unrelease payment - User has security permisson to the BooksUser 11. Select the payment created by user 12. Attempt to release the payment | Expected: Unrelease succeeds || Step 8: Clean upRemove security from book 1

Select the payment created by user 12. Attempt to release the payment | Expected: Release failsError message:CHKENTRY_SECURITY_VIOLATIONUser must have security permission to all the accounts used for the payment Bug 164466 - Payment Release/Unrelease: Validation on secured account is not working || Step 5: Release payment - User has security to all the accounts used by the GL items on the paymentUser 11. Select the payment created by user 12. Attempt to release the payment | Expected: Release succeeds || Step 6: Unrelease payment - User has security to all the accounts used by the GL items on the paymentUser 11. Select the payment created by user 12. Attempt to release the payment | Expected: Unrelease succeeds || Step 7: Clean upRemove security from account 2

Title: Payment - Release/Unrelease: Is Linking and Interbook Validation
Steps: Step 1: Release with Office not mapped to current bookGL line office not belong to current book. 1. Create a Payment with C status.2. Set interbook on. 3. Set Office used in GL line not belong to current book. delete from GLA_OFFC_BOOK where BOOK = 1000 and OFFC ='TLH'4. Release Payment. | Expected: This is not caught in Classic either. Leave as is. || Step 2: Release with Office not mapped for interbookGL line office should be mapped to books using the same office. 1. Set interbook on.2. Set interbook for an office in GL>GL Setup> Book Maintenance3. Create Payment with Firm (1) book with C status, with GL line using that office.4. Remove the interbook mapping of the Account used in GL line in GL > GL Setup > Interbook Account Mapping.5. Release Payment. | Expected: Display Error: All attached office are NOT correctly mapped for interbook.Payment not released. || Step 3: Release with Account, Office and Dept not linkedGL lines should have Account, Office and Dept linked. 1. Create Payment with C status.2. Remove the linking in Classic > GL > GL Setup > Links > Office/Department/Account3. Release Payment. | Expected: Display error: Account, office and department are not linked for all detail rows.Payment not released. || Step 4: Release with Account, Office and Dept not linked on destination bookGL lines should have Account, Office and Dept linked on destination book. 1. Set interbook on.2. Create Payment with Firm (1) book  with C status.3. Remove the linking in Classic > GL > GL Setup > Links > Office/Department/Account on destination book.4. Release Payment. | Expected: Display error : The Office, Department and Destination Account % are not linked for the Destination Book %.Payment not released. Validated || Step 5: Release with Account, Office and Profit Center not linkedGL lines should have Account, Office and Profit Center linked. 1. Create Payment with C status.2. Remove the linking in Classic > GL > GL Setup > Links > Office/Profit Center/Account3. Release Payment. | Expected: Display error: Account, office and profit center are not linked for all detail rows.Payment not released. || Step 6: Release with Account, Office and Profit Center not linked on destination bookGL lines should have Account, Office and Profit Center linked on destination book. 1. Set interbook on.2. Create Payment with Firm (1) book  with C status.3. Remove the linking in Classic > GL > GL Setup > Links > Office/Profit Center /Account on destination book.4. Release Payment. | Expected: Display error : The Office, Profit Center and Destination Account % are not linked for the Destination Book %.Payment not released.  Validated- needs translation

Step 1: 500 payments 1 invoice (1 disb and 1 gl) | Expected: CRT Performance Environment - Jones Day DBReleaseEB: 13 mins 38 secs (created payment in payment schedule and released in Payment grid) Nov'25
Unrelease  EB: 20 secs (created payment in payment schedule and unreleased in Payment grid) Nov'25 || Step 2: 2000 with 10 GL and 10 Disb | Expected: Performance Release2:30 - 821  (13/11/2018 17:45 old perf) Unrelease1:30 - 821 (13/11/2018 02:43 old perf) Local Unrelease1:13 locally 821 || Step 3: 2000 with 10 GL and 10 Disb - Release with errorsAll items in error | Expected: Local Release8:05 - 821 Expecting maybe a minute more than release with no errors but Dave is ok with this || Step 4: 2000 payments 1 invoice (1 disb and 1 gl) Group Performance Test | Expected: Performance Release32 mins Unrelease5 mins

Title: Payment - Release/Unrelease: Locks
Steps: Step 1: Note: As the process is quick, there is no time to check that the lock occurred so to see if the lock is being applied, use sql profilter and search for: sp_cmsmakelockcio || Step 2: Release one payment1. From the grid, Select one completed payment2. Select release | Expected: * lock applied* payment released* lock removed || Step 3: Unrelease one payment1. From the grid, Select one released payment 2. Select unrelease | Expected: * lock applied* payment unreleased* lock removed || Step 4: Release multiple payments1. From the grid, Select multiple completed payments 2. Select release | Expected: * locks applied to all payments* payments released* locks removed || Step 5: Unrelease multiple payments1. From the grid, Select multiple released payments 2. Select unrelease | Expected: * locks applied to all payments* payments unreleased* locks removed

Ensure that the validations are present.* Data are saved correctly to @DatabaseTable. || Step 3: Save | Expected: * Code is not editable* New codes are saved to the database* Edits are saved to the database || Step 4: Inactivate/Activate | Expected: Changes are saved || Step 5: Delete | Expected: * A type code that has been used on a vendor cannot be deleted., If the format has not been used, it should be removed from the list on the screen and the database

payment schedule, Filling out the required fields> Add Invoices> Add Single InvoiceLocate the payments made by searching the payment schedule number.Will need to update the Payment Date and Date To Print date every test run || Step 2: #1 Create two invoices with below criteria- Same Invoice Vendor- Same Remit Vendor- Separate Check = N- No Override Put them into Vendor Payment Schedule and same name, both override to same address | Expected: GroupedSchedule number: 28 || Step 12: #10 Same Invoice VendorSame Remit Vendor Sep Check = NNo name override, address override on one | Expected:
