Title: Payment - Post: Validation
Steps: Step 1: Note: Mostly the post is rerunning the release validation so that has been tested in release validation tests. We'll just test a few here as well as the post ones  to make sure the release validation code is running || Step 2: Invalid period1. Have 2 sessions open- there is a printed payment- post it in one session- post it in the other session2. Or just press the post button really quickly a few times and the post will kick in again before the wait cursor loads | Expected: Display error: CHKPOST_INVALIDPERIODThe period associated with this payment is invalid || Step 3: Unprinted checksPost a payment from the grid where status is Ready for Posting.  The payment hasn't been printed. | Expected: Display error: Checks have not been printed for all paymentsAltho the payment is in a releasible state, it is not released because the function the user was performing (Post) has failed || Step 4: Detail line does not equal payment - (release validation)Detail lines must equal payment amount1. Create a wire transfer payment2. Add detail lines to match so that payment is completed3. Close payment4. Refresh grid5. Alter the payment amount via sqlupdate APT_CHECK set TC_CHK_AMT = 11, CHK_AMT = 11 where REQUEST_NUM =4. Select the payment from the grid and select to post | Expected: Display error: CHKENTRY_UNALLOCATEDCHKAMTSum of detail lines does not equal check amount || Step 5: Payment for manual check has number that is already used - (release validation)For a manual check the number must not have already been used for this bank 1. Create a manual payment where details lines equal payment amount. Set the check number to the next avail.2. Alter the check number to one that has already been used by a posted paymentUPDATE APT_CHECK set CHECK_NUM = WHERE request_num = 3. Attempt to post the payment | Expected: Display error: PRINTCHK_INVALIDCHKNUMThe requested check number does not exist or is already in use

SELECT HPC1.PROF_CTR_CODE,HPC1.PROF_CTR_DESC FROM HBL_PROF_CTR HPC1 WHERE ( ( (INACTIVE != 'Y') AND PROF_CTR_CODE IN (SELECT DISTINCT PROF FROM GLA_ACCT_PROF WHERE OFFC = 'way' AND ACCT_UNO = 329) ) ) ORDER BY HPC1.PROF_CTR_CODE || Step 9: Only active Prof Center returned. | Expected: select * from HBL_PROF_CTR where INACTIVE = 'N' || Step 10: Hidden when GLM_PARMS.USE_PROF = 'N' || Step 11: AmountNumeric field. Title: Payment Items - Employee Advance: Look and Feel
Steps: Step 1: General | Expected: https://aderant.sharepoint.com/RD/AP/Moscow%20Design%20Wiki/Employee%20Advance%20Detail%20Form.aspx* Save & Close and Save & Add are only enabled when mandatory fields are completed* Cancel is enabled* On Save & Add the form is reset* Once payment is released, the advance items are non editable || Step 2: Employee data provider | Expected: * Defaults to employee enter in header but can be changed* Disabled once saved || Step 3: Advance Dataprovider | Expected: * Only returns approved advances that have not been paid or not on an unposted payment (if on unposted payment the scheduled will be -1)  * Advance must be approvedAP_EINVOICE_INVALID_STATUS_FOR_SEL* Advance <> 0AP_EINVOICE_INVALID_AMOUNT* Schedule number must be zero* Only advances where the employee's company matches the payment's bank's company, are validNote: the DP will return the items with a different office but will then display an error on the field* Only returns advances where the advance currency matches the payment's currencyAP_EINVOICE_INVALID_BANK_CURR* Does not have MRUs* Disabled once savedDECLARE @emplcode asvarchar (50)='nz10'DECLARE @bank asvarchar(100)='bcad'--bank to be used on paymentDECLARE @employee asint= (SELECT EMPL_UNO FROM HBM_PERSNL WHERE EMPLOYEE_CODE = @emplcode)DECLARE @empcomp asvarchar (100)= (SELECT o.COMPANY_CODE FROM HBM_PERSNL e JOIN HBL_OFFICE o ON e.OFFC = o.OFFC_CODE WHERE e.EMPLOYEE_CODE = @emplcode)DECLARE @paybankcomp asvarchar (100)= (SELECT o.COMPANY_CODE FROM TBM_BANK b JOIN HBL_OFFICE o ON b.OFFC = o.OFFC_CODE WHERE b.BANK_CODE = @bank)SELECT @empcomp[Employee Company],@paybankcomp[Company to be used on payment]SELECT''[Avail Employee Advances],adv.ADV_UNO,e.EMPLOYEE_CODE,adv.AMOUNT,adv.ADV_BALANCE,TC_AMOUNT,@paybankcomp[Pay Company],adv.CURRENCY_CODE,o.COMPANY_CODE,adv.DRUNO,e.EMPLOYEE_NAME,adv.DESCRIPTION,adv.APPROVED_DATE--,adv.*FROM APT_Advance adv LEFTOUTERJOIN HBM_PERSNL e ON adv.EMPL_UNO = e.EMPL_UNOLEFTJOIN HBL_OFFICE o ON e.OFFC = o.OFFC_CODEWHERE  adv.ADV_STATUS = 'A'AND ISNULL(adv.SCHEDULE_NUM,0) = 0 AND o.COMPANY_CODE = @paybankcompAND  e.EMPL_UNO = @employee || Step 4: Amount | Expected: * From advance* Disabled || Step 5: Approved date | Expected: * From advance* Disabled || Step 6: Advance Amount | Expected: * From advance* Disabled || Step 7: Balance | Expected: * Unpaid amount From advance* Disabled || Step 8: Description | Expected: * Description from advance* Disabled

Title: Payment Items - Expense report: Look and Feel
Steps: Step 2: General | Expected: https://aderant.sharepoint.com/RD/AP/Moscow%20Design%20Wiki/Employee%20Expense%20Report%20Detail%20Form.aspx* Save & Close and Save & Add are only enabled when mandtory fields are completed* Cancel is enabled* On Save & Add the form is reset* Once payment is released, the matter credit items are non editable || Step 3: Employee data provider | Expected: * Defaults to employee entered in header but can be changed || Step 4: Invoice data provider | Expected: * Only returns employee invoices * Invoice must be approvedAP_EINVOICE_INVALID_STATUS_FOR_SEL* Invoice <> 0AP_EINVOICE_INVALID_AMOUNT* Only returns invoices not fully paid but the partial payments must be posted* Only returns invoices where the employee's company (same as the company for the invoice) match the payment's bank's company* Only returns invoices where the invoice currency matches the payment's currencyAP_EINVOICE_INVALID_BANK_CURR* Does not have MRUsNote: This query doesn't take into account that there may be expense items on unposted paymentsDECLARE @invoice asvarchar (100)='NZ10-7764'DECLARE @bank asvarchar(100)='Busd'--bank to be used on paymentDECLARE @employee asint= (SELECT EXP_RPT_EMPL_UNO FROM APT_INVOICE WHERE INVOICE_NUM = @invoice)DECLARE @tran asint= (SELECT TRAN_UNO FROM APT_INVOICE WHERE INVOICE_NUM = @invoice)DECLARE @paybankcomp asvarchar (100)= (SELECT o.COMPANY_CODE FROM TBM_BANK b JOIN HBL_OFFICE o ON b.OFFC = o.OFFC_CODE WHERE b.BANK_CODE = @bank)DECLARE @paybankcur asvarchar (100)= (SELECT CURRENCY_CODE FROM TBM_BANK WHERE BANK_CODE = @bank)----------------------------------------------------------------------------------- Invoices avail for employee for payment's bank's company---------------------------------------------------------------------------------SELECT''[Avail Employee Invoices],o.COMPANY_CODE [Inv Company] ,@paybankcomp[Pay Bank Company],inv.CURRENCY_CODE[Inv Cur],inv.TC_CODE,@paybankcur[Pay Bank Cur],inv.TRAN_UNO,inv.INVOICE_NUM,EXP_RPT_NAME,INVOICE_DATE,inv.DRUNO,inv.INV_AMT,inv.BALANCE,inv.ORIGINAL_AMT,inv.EXP_RPT_AMT,inv.EXP_RPT_BILLABLE_AMT,inv.EXP_RPT_NON_BILLABLE_AMT,inv.TC_INV_AMT,inv.REF_NUM,inv.EXP_RPT_EMPL_UNO,e.EMPLOYEE_CODE,e.EMPLOYEE_NAME,inv.APTYPE_CODE,apt.BANK_CODE,o.COMPANY_CODE,inv.INVOICE_STATUS,inv.EXPERT_INVOICE_STATUS,inv.EXP_RPT_STATUS,inv.SCHEDULE_NUMFROM APT_INVOICE inv LEFTOUTERJOIN HBM_PERSNL e ON inv.EXP_RPT_EMPL_UNO = e.EMPL_UNOJOIN APL_APTYPE apt ON inv.APTYPE_CODE = apt.APTYPE_CODE JOIN TBM_BANK b ON apt.BANK_CODE = b.BANK_CODE -- bank from invoice's aptypeJOIN HBL_OFFICE o ON b.OFFC = o.OFFC_CODEWHERE inv.EXP_RPT_EMPL_UNO > 0AND inv.EXP_RPT_STATUS IN ('A')--P = paidAND inv.EXPERT_INVOICE_STATUS IN ('O','P')--O has no posted payments, P is partially paidAND inv.BALANCE <> 0AND e.EMPL_UNO = @employeeAND o.COMPANY_CODE = @paybankcompAND inv.CURRENCY_CODE = @paybankcurORDERBY EMPLOYEE_CODE, TRAN_UNO || Step 5: Amount | Expected: * Defaults to payment amount but can be changed* Can't be less than zero * Can't be greater than the balance of the expense report || Step 6: Approved date | Expected: * From expense report* Disabled || Step 7: Expense Amount | Expected: * From expense report* Disabled || Step 8: Balance | Expected: * Unpaid amount from expense report* Disabled || Step 9: Description | Expected: * Report Name from expense report* Disabled

In second session, select the payment on the grid and cancel | Expected: First SessionPayment is canceledSecond SessionJob Error: This application can only be used to reverse Outstanding payments.... || Step 2: Manual payment is not posted1. Create and Post a manual payment2. Open a second session and search on the payment3. In first session, cancel the payment and close the payment4. In second session, select the payment on the grid and cancel | Expected: First SessionPayment is canceledSecond SessionJob Error: This application can only be used to reverse Outstanding payments.... || Step 3: Wire payment is not posted - auto reconcile is off1. Turn auto reconcile offUPDATE APM_PARMS SET AUTO_RECONCILE_WIRE ='N'2. Create and Post wire payment3. Open a second session and search on the payment4. In first session, cancel the payment and close the payment5. In second session, select the payment on the grid and cancel | Expected: First SessionPayment is canceledSecond SessionJob Error: This application can only be used to reverse Outstanding payments.... || Step 4: Wire payment is reconciled - auto reconcile is off1. Turn auto reconcile offUPDATE APM_PARMS SET AUTO_RECONCILE_WIRE ='N'2. Create and Post wire payment3. Change status to reconciledUpdate APT_CHECK set CHECK_STATUS = 'R', EXPERT_PAYMENT_STATUS = 'M' where REQUEST_NUM = 4. Cancel the payment | Expected: Job Error: This application can only be used to reverse Outstanding payments.... || Step 5: Wire payment is reconciled - auto reconcile is on1. Turn auto reconcile on and restart the appUPDATE APM_PARMS SET AUTO_RECONCILE_WIRE ='Y'2. Create and Post wire payment- Payment is reconciled3. Cancel the payment | Expected: Payment is canceled || Step 6: Electronic payment is not posted - auto reconcile is off1. Turn auto reconcile offUPDATE APM_PARMS SET AUTO_RECONCILE_WIRE ='N'2. Create and Post a electronic payment3. Open a second session and search on the payment4. In first session, cancel the payment and close the payment5. In second session, select the payment on the grid and cancel | Expected: First SessionPayment is canceledSecond SessionJob Error: This application can only be used to reverse Outstanding payments.... || Step 7: Electronic payment is reconciled - auto reconcile is off1. Turn auto reconcile offUPDATE APM_PARMS SET AUTO_RECONCILE_WIRE ='N'2. Create and Post electronic payment3. Change status to reconciled Update APT_CHECK set CHECK_STATUS = 'R', EXPERT_PAYMENT_STATUS = 'M' where REQUEST_NUM = 4. Cancel the payment | Expected: Job Error: This application can only be used to reverse Outstanding payments.... || Step 8: Electronic payment is reconciled - auto reconcile is on1. Turn auto reconcile onUPDATE APM_PARMS SET AUTO_RECONCILE_WIRE ='Y'2. Create and Post electronic payment- Payment is reconciled3. Cancel the payment | Expected: Payment is canceled || Step 9: Detail line does not equal payment Detail lines must equal payment amount1. Create a wire payment2. Add detail lines to match so that payment is completed3. Post the payment4. Close payment5. Refresh grid6. Alter the payment amount via sqlupdate APT_CHECK set TC_CHK_AMT = 11, CHK_AMT = 11 where REQUEST_NUM =7. Select the payment from the grid and select to cancel | Expected: Display error: CHKENTRY_UNALLOCATEDCHKAMTSum of detail lines does not equal check amount || Step 10: Payment is locked1. Create and Post a electronic payment- keep payment open2. Open a second session and search on the payment3. In second session, select the payment on the grid and cancel | Expected: Job Error: Payment locked

Title: Payment - Post and Cancel: Electronic payment
Steps:
Step 1: Pre req Bank has wire number set to autoUPDATE TBM_BANK 
SET AUTO_WIRE_NUM = 'Y'
WHERE BANK_CODE = Useful TablesAPT_CHECK - Check/Payment tableTBM_BANK - Bank code TableHBA_NAME_BANK_ACCOUNT - Bank Account InformationUseful ScriptsThis script tells you what the currently assigned key is for a wire number.SELECT *  FROM CMS_UNIQUE_KEYS  WHERE TBNAME LIKE '%_TBM_BANK_WIRE_%' Note: Updating the Bank settings requires Accounts Payable to be reset. || Step 2: Create payment with detail itemType = VendorBank = BUSDPayment date = todayMethod = ElectronicAmount = 100Sales / Use Tax = 1001099 Amount = 100Enter any other mandatory fieldsDetails Item amount = $100 | Expected: Payment created APT_CHECK ENTRY_STATUS = NEXPERT_PAYMENT_STATUS = CSOURCE = MREVERSAL = NPAYEE_TYPE = VDOCUMENT_TYPE = EWIRE_NUM = next avail numberBANK_ACCOUNT_UNO = as enteredPERIOD = 0DRUNO = 0TC_CODE = USDTC_CHK_AMT = 100CURRENCY_CODE = USDORIGINAL_AMT = NULLCHK_AMT = 100.00 (payment currency)TEN99_AMT = 100.00 (payment currency)SALES_USE_TAX = 100.00 (payment currency)TAX_AMT = 0 Note: TEXT_ID is NULL in expert and 0 in classic - not an issue as can't process the expert payment in classic || Step 3: Post the payment | Expected: Payment posted APT_CHECK (updated) ENTRY_STATUS = REXPERT_PAYMENT_STATUS = OSOURCE = MREVERSAL = NPAYEE_TYPE = VDOCUMENT_TYPE = EWIRE_NUM = as enteredBANK_ACCOUNT_UNO = as enteredPERIOD = latest periodDRUNO = current drunoTC_CODE = USDTC_CHK_AMT = 100CURRENCY_CODE = USDORIGINAL_AMT = 0CHK_AMT = 100.00 (system currency)TEN99_AMT = 100.00 (system currency)SALES_USE_TAX = 100.00 (system currency)TAX_AMT = 0 || Step 4: Cancel the payment- today as transaction date- comments | Expected: Payment canceled  APT_CHECK (updated) ENTRY_STATUS = REXPERT_PAYMENT_STATUS = XSOURCE = MREVERSAL = NPAYEE_TYPE = VDOCUMENT_TYPE = EWIRE_NUM = as enteredBANK_ACCOUNT_UNO = as enteredPERIOD = latest periodDRUNO = current drunoTC_CODE = USDTC_CHK_AMT = 100CURRENCY_CODE = USDORIGINAL_AMT = 0CHK_AMT = 100.00 (system currency)TEN99_AMT = 100.00 (system currency)SALES_USE_TAX = 100.00 (system currency)TAX_AMT = 0 APT_CHECK  for contra entry created with same REQUEST_NUM ENTRY_STATUS = REXPERT_PAYMENT_STATUS = MSOURCE = MREVERSAL = YPAYEE_TYPE = VDOCUMENT_TYPE = EWIRE_NUM = copied from originalBANK_ACCOUNT_UNO = copied from originalPERIOD = latest periodDRUNO = current drunoTC_CODE = USDTC_CHK_AMT = -100CURRENCY_CODE = USDORIGINAL_AMT = 0CHK_AMT = -100.00 (system currency)TEN99_AMT = -100.00 (system currency)SALES_USE_TAX = -100.00 (system currency)TAX_AMT = 0

Title: Invoice Entry - Override - Default address for Alternative Payee name
Steps: Step 1: Testing the default address on selected vendor in Override vendor screen. || Step 2: Data pre reqs(From Original test case to test in PAYMENT TC 143075) Note: Make sure the default addresses you set are not the first addresses so you know you're not just getting back the first address in the listVendor 1- Name record has multiple addresses- Name record has default address- Vendor record has different default addressVendor 2- Name record has multiple addresses- Name record has default address- Vendor record does not have default addressVendor 3- Name record has multiple addresses- Name record does not have default address- Vendor record has default addressVendor 4- Name record has multiple addresses- Name record does not have default address- Vendor record does not have default addressSELECT''[Vendor Name Addresses],v.VENDOR_ID,n.NAME,CASEWHEN v.ADDRESS_UNO = a.ADDRESS_UNO Then'Y'ELSE'N'END [Ven Addr Default],CASEWHEN n.ADDRESS_UNO = a.ADDRESS_UNO Then'Y'ELSE'N'END [Name Addr Default],a.ADDRESS1,a.ADDRESS2,a.ADDRESS3,a.ADDRESS4,a.CITY,a.STATE_CODE,a.COUNTY,a.REGION_CODE,a.COUNTRY_CODE,a.ADDRESS_CODE, a.ADDRESS_UNO,a.NAME_UNO,v.VENDOR_UNOFROM HBM_ADDRESS aJOIN HBM_NAME n ON a.NAME_UNO = n.NAME_UNOJOIN APM_VENDOR v ON n.NAME_UNO = v.NAME_UNOWHERE a.ADDRESS_UNO <> 0 --AND VENDOR_ID = 'JANA1'ORDERBY v.VENDOR_ID || Step 3: Setup Vendor 1,2,3,4, to a related payee of the vendor of your choice. Do that in Entity Manager > Vendor > Related Payee. Or insert into APA_VENDOR_RELATED_PAYEE. || Step 4: Open up Expert AP, new invoice. Put in vendor.Click on "..." - Override button | Expected: Opens up 'Change Name and Address' form. || Step 5: Click the 'Select an alternative Payee name' dropdown | Expected: Return the current vendor and its related payees. || Step 6: Select Vendor 1. | Expected: Address set from Vendor default || Step 7: Select Vendor 2 | Expected: Address set from Name default || Step 8: Select Vendor 3 | Expected: Address set from Vendor default. || Step 9: Select Vendor 4 | Expected: Address set from the first one found.

completed* Cancel is enabled* On Save & Add the form is reset* Once payment is released, the Tax items are non editable || Step 2: Data providersJurisdictionTax CodeEmployee | Expected: Data providers return correct resultsSELECT JURISDIC_CODE,INACTIVE,JURISDIC_DESC,*FROM TBL_JURISDIC WHERE INACTIVE ='N'SELECT TAX_CODE,INACTIVE,TAX_DESC FROM TBL_TAX WHERE INACTIVE ='N'ORDER BY TAX_CODESELECT EMPLOYEE_NAME,EMPLOYEE_CODE,INACTIVE,* FROM HBM_PERSNL WHERE INACTIVE = 'N' || Step 3: Jurisdiction | Expected: * Defaults from payment header* Mandatory || Step 4: Tax Code | Expected: * Mandatory* Display error when selected tax code does not have recoverable offsets on current book e.g.KLJ* Tax code with recoverable offset account being a subledger is allowed Note: This is different to classicSELECT BOOK,SUBLEDGER,INACTIVE,ACCT_CODE,DEPT_REQD,PROF_REQD,EMPL_REQD--,* FROM GLM_CHART c ORDER BY c.ACCT_CODE || Step 5: Taxable Value | Expected: * Mandatory* Can be zero* Max length 14 || Step 6: Tax Value | Expected: * Mandatory* Can be zero* Max length 14 || Step 7: Account | Expected: * Defaulted from tax recoverable offsets* DisabledDECLARE @taxcode asvarchar(100)=''DECLARE @acct asint= (SELECT ACCT_UNO FROM TBL_TAX_BOOK WHERE TAX_CODE = @taxcode AND BOOK = 1)SELECT * FROM TBL_TAX WHERE TAX_CODE = @taxcodeSELECT * FROM TBL_TAX_BOOK WHERE BOOK = 1AND TAX_CODE = @taxcodeSELECT ACCT_CODE, INACTIVE,ACCT_DESC,EMPL_REQD,DEPT_REQD,PROF_REQD,ACCT_UNO FROM GLM_CHART acctWHERE BOOK = 1AND ACCT_UNO =  @acct || Step 8: OfficeNote: Office comes from the payment's bankExample of inactive offce: Use bank BOJ1 which has an inactive office TOK | Expected: * Defaulted from the office of the payment's bank* Disabled* Error display on tax code field if office is inactiveSELECT bank.OFFCFROM APT_CHECK chqJOIN TBM_BANK bank on chq.BANK_CODE = bank.BANK_CODEWHERE REQUEST_NUM = || Step 9: Employee | Expected: * Is enabled if selected account (from tax code) has the employee required flag set to ON* Is mandatory if selected account (from tax code)  has the employee required flag set to ON* Is disabled if selected account (from tax code) has the employee required flag set to OFF - When flag is off, Value defaults as set in parms Note: In classic, is always disabled after initial saveSELECT ACCT_CODE, INACTIVE,ACCT_DESC,EMPL_REQDFROM GLM_CHART acctWHERE BOOK = 1AND ACCT_CODE =''SELECT EMPLOYEE_CODE,EMPLOYEE_NAME,OFFC,EMPL_UNO FROM HBM_PERSNLWHERE EMPL_UNO = (SELECT OVH_EMPL_UNO FROM GLM_PARMS) || Step 10: Department | Expected: * Defaulted from the tax recoverable offset* DisabledSELECT MULTI_OFFC,DEF_OFFC,USE_DEPT,OVH_DEPT,USE_PROF,OVH_PROF,OVH_EMPL_UNOFROM GLM_PARMS parms || Step 11: Profit Center | Expected: * Defaulted from the tax recoverable offset* DisabledSELECT MULTI_OFFC,DEF_OFFC,USE_DEPT,OVH_DEPT,USE_PROF,OVH_PROF,OVH_EMPL_UNOFROM GLM_PARMS parms || Step 12: Source Office | Expected: * Defaulted from the office of the payment's bank* DisabledSELECT bank.OFFCFROM APT_CHECK chqJOIN TBM_BANK bank on chq.BANK_CODE = bank.BANK_CODEWHERE REQUEST_NUM = || Step 13: Narrative | Expected: * Supports spell check and expansion codes* If set to default then default text to payee name, request num and date; other wise default to nothingNote: In expert we don't insert the request number because we can add a tax item before the request is saved so don't have the number at that point* Max characters = 15000SELECT GEN_GL_TEXT,*FROM APM_PARMS

Office field hidden.  set to default office (not employee's, Classic is doing the same too)3. Office field shown with no default.4. Office field shown, default from employee when form initialize. || Step 5: DepartmentWhen GLM_Parms.Use_Dept = 'N'When GLM_Parms.Use_Dept = 'Y' | Expected: Field hidden. Set to default Dept when creating journal entryField shown || Step 6: Profit CenterWhen GLM_Parms.Use_Prof = 'N'When GLM_Parms.Use_Prof = 'Y' | Expected: Field hidden, Set to defailt Prof when creating journal entryField shown || Step 7: JurisidictionDefault from header || Step 8: Source OfficeDefault from office of the bank that is attached to the selected AP Type. || Step 9: NarrativeCan default by settings in Design Studio

Save.2. -Choose a subledger    - Hijack a subledger account into a GL lines. Save3. -Choose an inactive account.   - Hijack an inactive account into a GL lines. Save4. -Choose an account that vendor do not have permission on.   - Hijack an account that vendor do not have permission | Expected: 1. -Cannot select header account.    -Error complaining using a header account.2. -Cannot select subledger account.    -Error complaining using a subledger account.3. -Cannot select inactive account.    -Error complaining using an inactive account.4. -Cannot select account that vendor do not have permission on..    -Error complaining using an account not available for vendor.. || Step 2: Validate Interbook SubledgerEnable Multi-bookSet interbook mapping in Classic > GL > GL Setup > Interbook account mapping.Hijack GLA_ACCT_INTERBOOK.DEST_ACCT_UNO to one of the SUBLEDGER ACCOUNT.Create a GL details in Expert using that book and account. | Expected: Throw XPNS_SUBDLEDGER_DEST_ACCT validation error. || Step 3: Validate DebitCannot be negative amount | Expected: Invalid use case because Amount field will save as Debit when positive amount, Credit when negative amount || Step 4: Validate CreditCannot be negative amount | Expected: Invalid use case because Amount field will save as Debit when positive amount, Credit when negative amount || Step 5: Validate Debit and Credit | Expected: Amount entered can be zeo || Step 6: Validate Interbook Mapping | Expected: *See bug 166860 FIXED || Step 7: Validate Office Department LinkEnable Multi-bookSet interbook mapping in Classic > GL > GL Setup > Interbook account mapping.Link Department in Classic > GL > GL Setup > Links > Office/Dept/AccAdd GL Details line with the GL account, office, dept combination.Remove the Department Link. Add GL Details line again. | Expected: - No validation error- Show XPNS_DEST_DEPTACCT_NOT_LINK || Step 8: Disable Multi Book and using book > 2.Not possible to select book > 2 when not using multibook.Enable Multi Book and use Book <= 2Link Department in Classic > GL > GL Setup > Links > Office/Dept/AccAdd GL Details line with the GL account, office, dept combination.Remove the Department Link and Add GL Details line again. | Expected: - Show XPNS_OFFC_DEPT_ACC_NOT_LINKED || Step 9: Validate Office Profit Center Link - Make sure destination book is activeEnable Multi-bookSet interbook mapping in Classic > GL > GL Setup > Interbook account mapping.Link Department in Classic > GL > GL Setup > Links > Office/Profit Center/AccAdd GL Details line with the GL account, prof, dept combination.Remove the Profit Center Link. Add GL Details line again. | Expected: - No validation error- Show XPNS_DEST_PROFACCT_NOT_LINK || Step 10: Disable Multi Book and using book > 2.Not possible to select book > 2 when not using multibook.Enable Multi Book and use Book <= 2Link Department in Classic > GL > GL Setup > Links > Office/Profit Center/AccAdd GL Details line with the GL account, prof, dept combination.Remove the Profit Center Link and Add GL Details line again. | Expected: - Show XPNS_OFFC_PC_ACC_NOT_LINKED || Step 11: Validate Expansion codes and spellcheck in narrativeType in '='In narrative field do a spelling error | Expected: Option to choose an expansion code or make a new oneYellow background behind incorrectly spelled word || Step 12: Have an offset lineCreate an invoice with an offset lineRemove the offset line | Expected: Book field should be disabledBook field should be enabledBug 186267: Multibook - If there are offset lines then Book field should be disabled for Invoices

Title: Payment - Delete: Vendor with bank type = O or P
Steps: Step 1: Data pre reqsPayment - Type = Vendor- Bank type is O or P- Has narrative that has more than 1500 chrs- Has GL item with narrative that has more than 1500 chrs - Has Disb item narrative and prebill comments that have more than 1500 chrs- Has Tax item with narrative - Has Invoice item with narrative - Status is either Complete or IncompleteSELECT b.BANK_CODE,o.COMPANY_CODE,b.INACTIVE,b.ASSIGN_WIRE_NUMBER,b.AUTO_WIRE_NUM,b.ACCT_TYPE,b.BOOK,b.CHECK_LANGUAGEFROM TBM_BANK b JOIN HBL_OFFICE o ON b.OFFC = o.OFFC_CODE || Step 2: Query the tables and Title: Invoice Entry - Invoice Level Validation
Description: Different from 163444 which outline the validation on each fields - field level , this test case cover the validation on Invoice as a whole - Invoice level.
Steps: Step 1: Update 8/10/18 : Step 7, 8 and 15 still require Manual Testing, The rest are automated either by UI or Integration test.For details and explaination, refer to Validation doc on wiki.https://aderant.sharepoint.com/RD/AP/Shared%20Documents/Daves%20Design%20Documents/Validations.xlsx || Step 2: Validate Invoice DateSet Invoice Date outside APM_PARMS.MIN_DATE AND APM_PARMS.MAX_DATE. | Expected: Int- SaveInvoiceWithInvalidInvoiceDateError - Date Outside Range ErrorBug 211633: BUG: AP Invoice Due Date cannot be prior to Invoice Date- fixed || Step 3: Validate Invoice on ScheduleCreate a new invoice. Don't post it.Update APT_INVOICE.SCHEDULE_NUM = 1.Open invoice. | Expected: Not able to edit invoice. || Step 4: Validation Invoice NumberCreate an invoice with used invoice number. | Expected: Error - Duplicate Invoice Number || Step 5: Validate Invoice Amount Against Header TotalChange the Invoice Amount so that it is different with the details total. | Expected: Actions like Release and Post will be disabled until the Invoice Amount = Details Total || Step 6: AP Type | Expected: Validate for Inactive on select of AP Type and save invoice?Bug 260531 - BUG: Invoices can be posted with inactive default AP Type || Step 7: Validate AP Type and BookAP Type and Book must be the following combination, else, throw validation. select inv.APTYPE_CODE , bank.BOOK from apt_invoice invleft join APL_APTYPE ap on ap.APTYPE_CODE = inv.APTYPE_CODEleft join TBM_BANK bank on bank.BANK_CODE = ap.BANK_CODEwhere TRAN_UNO = @tranUno || Step 8: Validate AP Type and Bank CurrencyValidation done in Classic, when create invoice from check entry. Do not have this functionality in Expert. || Step 9: AP Type is not in this book 822.Ex00101. AP Type needs to have been used before so its in the MRU2. Select book3. Select AP Type that is not for this book | Expected: Error message: Type code selected is associated with a bank that is not attached to the booked selected || Step 10: AP Type is inactive 822.Ex00101. AP Type needs to have been used before so its in the MRU2. Select inactive AP Type | Expected: Error message: The selected AP Type is inactive || Step 12: Validate AP Type BankValidation done in Classic, when create invoice from check entry. Do not have this functionality in Expert. || Step 13: Validate Jurisidction Codeselect inv.JURISDIC_CODE, juri.TAX_IN_OUT fromAPT_INVOICE invleft join TBL_JURISDIC juri on juri.JURISDIC_CODE = inv.JURISDIC_CODEwhere TRAN_UNO = @tran_uno | Expected: Validation error when tbl_jurisdic.Tax_in_out = 'O' || Step 14: Validate Spot RateReq: APM_PARMS.INV_SPOT_RATES flag = 'Y'Disable and hide Spot Rate when invoice currency = system currency. || Step 15: Validate Discount AmountNot less than zero || Step 16: Validate 1099 Amount | Expected: This field will only appear if the 1099_IN_USE option is set in the CMS_OptionsWill initially default from the invoice amount but can be modified if required. || Step 17: Validate Tax included - New | Expected: This APM_PARMS value is just how we defaulting the values on Tax IncludedWhen flag value is Y, Tax Included default to Yes.When flag value is N, Tax Included default to No.When flag value is X, Tax Included default to Not Applicable.When flag value is Q, Tax Included is not defaulting to anything but required. || Step 18: Validate Tax included - Edit | Expected: Upon editting invoice/details, if Tax_in = 'Yes' or 'No', Release/Post will result with validation error. Relese/Post is not possible on screen, have to manually set them in SQL. || Step 19: Validate Tax included - After Tax Processing (ie, after clicking Calculate Tax) | Expected: When Tax_in = 'Removed' or 'Added'. Changing the field to 'Yes', 'No' or 'Not Applicable' will trigger Tax Reset dialog. || Step 20: Validate active vendorInactivate a vendor and use it on an invoice (may need to add from MRU) | Expected: Bug 214532: * BUG: Data Provider for new invoices does not filter out inactive vendors- fixedUpon save get warning that the vendor is inactive.Can still add detail lines. First one has a red traingle warning, the rest spin endlessly. They do not save.

Title: Payment Items - matter credit: look and feel
Steps: Step 1: General | Expected: https://aderant.sharepoint.com/RD/AP/Moscow%20Design%20Wiki/Matter%20Payment%20Detail%20Form.aspx* Save & Close and Save & Add are only enabled when mandtory fields are completed* Cancel is enabled* On Save & Add the form is reset* Once payment is released, the matter credit items are non editable || Step 2: Narrative | Expected: * Supports spellcheck only* Max characters = 200 || Step 3: Matter | Expected: * On change of matter, the other fields are cleared* Error if matter has unposted credit items (on another payment or a bill)* Values testing is covered under the other test cases || Step 4: Amount | Expected: * Can't exceed avail for selected item* Can't be negative

Title: Invoices - Multi Currency Invoices
Steps: Step 1: Pre reqEnsure your system currency is USD. We will put in one set of invoices into Classic and another to Expert so that we can reconcile the value.You will need two sets of invoice, one for Classic and one for Expert. Each set of invoices have three invoices outlined as below. Post it1Vendor = 1101Inv No = EXPERT1 / CLASSIC1Inv Amt = 100Inv Currency = CAD2Vendor = 1101Inv No = EXPERT2 / CLASSIC2Inv Amt = 100Inv Currency = GBP3Vendor = 1101Inv No = EXPERT3 / CLASSIC3Inv Amt = 100Inv Currency = USD | Expected: Set A will have Invoice Num = Classic1, 2 and 3Set B will have Invoice Num =  Expert1, 2 and 3Your invoices should look as attached. (If created using Classic).Expert1 and Classic1 should haveAPT_INVOICE.INV_AMT = 91.57443881...APT_INVOICE. DRUNO <> 0Expert2 and Classic2 should haveAPT_INVOICE.INV_AMT = 168.3069596....APT_INVOICE. DRUNO <> 0Expert3 and Classic3 should haveAPT_INVOICE.INV_AMT = 100APT_INVOICE. DRUNO <> 0 || Step 2: Compare the entry using REC - INV.sql

Title: Invoice - GL details - Validation when making changes
Steps: Step 1: Account entered or changed || Step 2: Validate GL Account1. Hijack and change account to header account, GLM_CHART.ACCT_TYPE = H. Enter the account in GL details.2. Hijack and change account to subledger account, GLM_CHART.SUBLEDGER = Y. Enter the account in GL details. | Expected: Not possible to change to header or subledger account as they are not available on data provider || Step 3: Validate Interbook SubledgerHijack GLA_ACCT_INTERBOOK so that Destination account is pointing to a subledger account. Change the existing account to the one you hijack-ed. | Expected: Show XPNS_SUBLEDGER_DEST_ACCT || Step 4: Reset DepartmentSet use_dept in GLM_parmsConfigure two GL accounts which- One with Dept_Reqd = 'N' eg, 95000- One with Dept_Reqd = 'Y'  eg, 99990 | Expected: Create new GL entry with 99990, then save. Then change Account = 95000. Department field disabled and defaulted.Create new GL entry with 95000, then save. Then change Account = 99990. Department field enabled. clearing the field and show as required. || Step 5: Reset Department when using Employee DefaultSet CMS_OPTION.JE_ODPC_DEF = 'Y' | Expected: Create new GL entry with 99990, then save. Then change Account = 95000. Department field disabled and defaulted.Create new GL entry with 95000, then save. Then change Account = 99990. Department field enabled and defaulted. || Step 6: Default to the department when only has one option. | Expected: *Dept and Prof has to be linked before it can be defaulted. || Step 7: Reset Department to empty when no office defaulted/entered. || Step 8: Reset Profit CenterSet use_prof in GLM_parmsConfigure two GL accounts which- One with prof_Reqd = 'N' eg, 95000- One with prof_Reqd = 'Y'  eg, 99990 | Expected: Create new GL entry with 99990, then save. Then change Account = 95000. Profit center field disabled and defaulted.Create new GL entry with 95000, then save. Then change Account = 99990. Profit center  field enabled and cleared and show as required.*blocked by 166591 FIXED || Step 9: Reset Department when using Employee DefaultSet CMS_OPTION.JE_ODPC_DEF = 'Y' | Expected: Create new GL entry with 99990, then save. Then change Account = 95000. Profit center field disabled and defaulted.Create new GL entry with 95000, then save. Then change Account = 99990. Profit center field enabled and defaulted. || Step 10: Reset Department to empty when no office defaulted/entered. || Step 11: Reset the EmployeeConfigure two GL accounts which- One with Empl_Reqd = 'N' eg, 95000- One with Empl_Reqd = 'Y'  eg, 99990 | Expected: Create new GL entry with 99990, then save. Then change Account = 95000. Employee field disabled and defaulted. Employee Office, Dept and Prof Center not defaulted.Create new GL entry with 95000, then save. Then change Account = 99990. Employee field enabled and remain defaulted to the value before.. || Step 12: Office entered or changed || Step 13: Validate Interbook SubledgerSetup interbook to point to a subledger account by hijacking GLA_ACCT_INTERBOOK. The book pointed to must have the same office as same account to be enter in office. eg, Both book has the same Office - TLHIn Expert, create GL details and put in the account number which you set.Choose the office other than TLH. then Change to TLH. | Expected: When switching office to TLH, Department and Profit Center data provider will show as error.If manages to save before Saves disabled, the status column will show XPNS_SUBLEDGER_DEST_ACCT || Step 14: Employee Code entered or changedWhen using Employee DefaultWhen selected account DO NOT required a department.When selected account DO NOT required a profit center. | Expected: Changing employee will change the Office, Department and Profit center of the new selected Employee only if these fields are empty.Not changing the Department field. Will disabled and default to parms.Not changing the Profit Center field. Will disabled and default to parms. || Step 15: Department Code changedMust have link in GLA_ACCT_DEPT | Expected: Validation error on this field, complaining Office, Dept and Account || Step 16: Profit Center code changedMust have link in GLA_ACCT_PROF | Expected: Validation error on this field, complaining Office, Prof and Account || Step 17: Debit changed | Expected: Not Applicable || Step 18: Credit changed | Expected: Not Applicable || Step 19: Jurisdiction | Expected: - Is active and is not output tax SELECT * FROM TBL_JURISDIC TJ1 WHERE TJ1.INACTIVE != 'Y' AND TJ1.TAX_IN_OUT != 'O'

Required || Step 19: Narrative | Expected: Text field. APM_Parms.Gen_Disb_Text  = 'Y' then the text is generated automatically as 'VENDOR : Vendor Name; INVOICE #: Invoice Number; DATE: Date'.Not required. Can edit. Store in CDT_TextNum of Max Char -15000 || Step 20: Prebill Comment | Expected: Text field. No default. Also save to cdt_textNum of Max Char -15000

Title: Payment - Check print: Validation
Steps:
Step 1: Already printed 1. Create a check payment and release it2. Close the payment3. Search so the payment is returned to the grid4. Open a second AP session and print the payment, close the payment5. From the grid in session 1, attempt to print the payment | Expected: Display error: PRINTCHKNOTPROCEEDSome or all of the checks have already been printed || Step 2: Can't find the file 1. edit the check format so that the file name is not correct 2. Attempt to print the payment | Expected: Display error: PRINTCHKNOTPROCEEDSpecified template file does not exist || Step 3: Check Format is inactive1. Inactivate check format so that the file name is not correct 2. Attempt to print the payment | Expected: Display error: Format is inactive || Step 4: Bank has no check format1. Remove check format from bank2. Attempt to print the payment | Expected: Display error: No such format exists || Step 5: Bank is with/ without address added in Expert Entity ManagerGo to Expert Entity Manager -> Banks -> Filter on the bank -> go to Details tab -> Click on Name maintenance
button to check if bank address is setupBug: 265349 (add customized view and template attached PAYTS.USR to C:\CMS\Current\DDRAFT.DB\DDVIEWS & KM_Check.docx & KM_CheckFace.docx to C:\CMS\Current\DDRAFT.DB\DDTMPLT) | Expected: Refer to resolved Bug 265349 - With or Without Bank address is setup in the Bank, Check print job will run and Print Check payment. Check Docudraft folder for the report || Step 6: Bank is lockedNote: This is job failure errorAttempt to print a check where the bank has a lock | Expected: Display error: Can't get a lock on the bank || Step 7: One or more payments are lockedNote: This is a job failure error1. Create 3 check payments and release them2. Open payments 1 and 2 (application locks on both)3. From payment 2, select to print and add payments 1 and 34. Print | Expected: Display error: Failed to aquire locks for all payments

Title: Payment - Check print: from payment
Steps: Step 1: Form is dirty1. Open a check payment with status C that has not had a check print2. Edit the payment | Expected: Print check button not enabled || Step 2: Open payment status is C, Other Payments Status is R, Method = C, bank is the same1. Open a check payment where status = C2. || Step 10: Cancel to New | Expected: Payment is cancel* Status = Cancelled* Ribbon Buttons enabled- Close & Add- Close Contra entry payment is createdNote: This entry can't be searched for so check on databaseselect*from APT_CHECK where REQUEST_NUM=[request_number]* Request number is same as original* Status = Reconciled New payment is created* Status = Ready for PostingCHECK_NUM = copied from Title: Smoke Test AP: Client Wire Payment for Trust
Steps: Step 1: Has some coverage by int tests but needs a UI test || Step 2: Data Pre Reqs Client/Matter - has trust set up Trust bank - Trust credit = $100.00 (Done through AR) || Step 3: Create a Client Payment1. New Client payment- Type = Wire- Bank is a trust bank- Amount = $100.00- Any Jurisdiction2. Save | Expected: New payment is saved* Status = Incomplete* Wire number  = set to next avail* Remaining balance = $100.00* Ribbon Buttons enabled- Close & Add- Close- Delete- Evaluate Rules* Item tabs enabled-Trust || Step 4: Add 2 Trust Credit detail lines to payment1. For Amount type = Interest (I)- Client/ Matter- Trust Number- Amount= $40- Amount Type = Interest (I)- Trust Tran Type2. For Amount type = Bank Charge (B)- Client/ Matter- Trust Number- Amount= $60- Amount Type = Bank charge (B)- Trust Tran Type | Expected: Int- SaveCheck_WithTrustTransaction_SucceedsPayment updated* Status = Ready for Posting* Remaining balance = $0* Ribbon Buttons enabled- Close & Add- Close- Release- Post- Delete- Print Payments- Evaluate Rules || Step 5: Post the payment | Expected: BANK_CHARGES in TRM_TRUST should have increased by the +ve value i-e '60'Bug 291344: Expert Accounts Payable - posting/cancelling a check with trust lines on it updates BANK_CHARGES incorrectly in TRM_TRUST  INT_EARNED in TRM_TRUST should have increased by -ve value i-e '-40' Check TRM_TRUST table: select balance, AVAILABLE_AMT, INT_EARNED, BANK_CHARGES, * from TRM_TRUST where trust_uno = XX order by LAST_MODIFIED desc || Step 6: Cancel the payment | Expected: BANK_CHARGES, INT_EARNED, balance, AVAILABLE_AMT have been back to the original value i-e prior to posting of the payment in step 5Check TRM_TRUST table: select balance, AVAILABLE_AMT, INT_EARNED, BANK_CHARGES, * from TRM_TRUST where trust_uno = XX order by LAST_MODIFIED desc Bug 291483: Expert Accounts Payable - cancelling a check with interest trust lines on it does not update the totals in TRM_TRUST correctlyBug 291344: Expert Accounts Payable - posting/cancelling a check with trust lines on it updates BANK_CHARGES incorrectly in TRM_TRUST

Title: Hub - Banking systems
Steps: Step 1: Note: This is just one part of the process to set up for electronic payments (step 3) || Step 2: Select to create a banking systemSELECT * FROM HBL_BANKING_SYSTEM | Expected: New banking system's fields are displayed* Active flag defaults to on* Default defaults to off* Code and Description are mandatory* Validation on max number of characters - Code = 20- Description = 50 || Step 3: Select to add an account formatSELECT * FROM HBA_BANK_ACCOUNT_FORMAT ORDERBY BANKING_SYSTEM_UNO, SORT_ORDER | Expected: New Account Format fields are displayed* Field Name, Type, Length and Sort Order are mandatory* Is Account Segment is unchecked* List Name field is disabled and is only enabled if List (L) is selected for the field Type* Mask Length field is disabled and is only enabled if Is Account Segment is checked and List (L) is not selected for the field Type* Validation on max number of characters etc- Field name = 20- Length = 1 to 100- Mask Length = If enabled then it must be equal to or less than the Length field- Sort Order is int* Sort order must be unique within this banking system || Step 4: Enter details CodeDesc | Expected: Record is created || Step 5: Add multiple formats and save | Expected: Banking system and formats are saved || Step 6: Edit the banking system details || Step 7: Edit the account formats and saveAdd newEdit exitingRemove | Expected: Changes are savedConfirmation prompt on delete || Step 8: Attempt to Uncheck default flag | Expected: Error messageMust have a default banking system || Step 9: Inactivate banking system | Expected: Banking system is inactivatedBanking system can only be set to Inactive and cannot be delete/remove. This is as designed as there might be items still using this system. || Step 10: Attempt to inactivate the default banking system | Expected: Error messageCan't inactivate the default banking system || Step 11: Set a banking system to be the default and save | Expected: Confirmation message* On save, the default is removed from the old default record and added to the new one* If setting an inactive banking system to be the default, it will also be set to activeNote: we don't want to end up with no default so the user must set a new one to be the default and will get an confirmation dialog telling them which one is currently the default

Title: Payment Items - Invoice: company
Steps: Step 1: Pre preqsInvoice for Vendor Company = xDECLARE @vendor asvarchar(100)=''SELECT''[Avail Vendor Invoices],inv.TRAN_UNO,inv.INVOICE_NUM,INVOICE_DATE,inv.DRUNO,inv.INV_AMT,inv.BALANCE,inv.REF_NUM,inv.APTYPE_CODE,o.COMPANY_CODE,inv.VENDOR_UNO,ven.VENDOR_ID,ven.VENDOR_NAME, ven.NAME_UNO[Vendor Name uno] ,n.NAME[Vendor Name],n2.NAME_UNO[Inv Name Uno],n2.NAME[Invoice Name],EXPERT_INVOICE_STATUS,inv.TEMP_VENDOR_NAMEFROM APT_INVOICE inv LEFT OUTER JOIN APM_VENDOR ven ON inv.VENDOR_UNO = ven.VENDOR_UNO LEFTJOIN HBM_NAME n ON ven.NAME_UNO = n.NAME_UNOLEFTJOIN HBM_NAME n2 ON inv.NAME_UNO = n2.NAME_UNOJOIN CXL_CODE_LOOKUP look ON EXPERT_INVOICE_STATUS = look.DB_VALUE and look.LOOKUP_GROUP ='ExpertInvoiceStatus'JOIN APL_APTYPE typ ON inv.APTYPE_CODE = typ.APTYPE_CODEJOIN TBM_BANK b ON Typ.BANK_CODE = b.BANK_CODEJOIN HBL_OFFICE o ON b.OFFC = o.OFFC_CODEWHERE  inv.EXPERT_INVOICE_STATUS = 'O' AND inv.VENDOR_UNO > 0AND inv.SCHEDULE_NUM = 0AND (inv.BALANCE <> 0 OR inv.INV_AMT = 0)AND  ven.VENDOR_ID = @vendorORDERBY INVOICE_NUM || Step 2: Create a payment- Type = Vendor- Vendor = same as invoice- Bank has different company to one used on the invoiceSELECT b.BANK_CODE,b.OFFC,o.COMPANY_CODE,b.INACTIVE,b.ASSIGN_WIRE_NUMBER,b.AUTO_WIRE_NUM,b.ALLOW_CHECK_PRINTER_SELECTION,b.ACCT_TYPE,b.BOOK,b.CHECK_LANGUAGEFROM TBM_BANK b JOIN HBL_OFFICE o ON b.OFFC = o.OFFC_CODE || Step 3: Select the invoice to add to the payment | Expected: ErrorInvoice belongs to a different company

Title: Payment - Remittance: Preferred remittance method for vendor (client side printing off)
Steps: Step 1: Pre reqs Client side printing onAdmin | System | Primter Settings | Clientside Printing || Step 2: Data pre reqs Note: all payments will need to have the same bank and be released Vendor 1- set to use 'Email'- has manual payments Vendor 2- set to 'Mail'- has manual payments Vendor 3- set to 'No' preference- Has manual payments Vendor 4- no preference set i-e NULL- Has manual payments SELECT VENDOR_ID,ven.APTYPE_CODE,ven.PREFERRED_PAYT_METHOD[Pay Method],ven.PREFERRED_REMIT_DELIV_METHOD[Deliver Method],ven.REMITTANCE_EMAIL[Email],typ.BANK_CODE,b.ACCT_TYPE,b.OFFC[Bank Offc],b.CURRENCY_CODE[Bank Cur],b.SHORT_NAME,b.ALLOW_CHECK_PRINTER_SELECTION[Select Printer],cf.FORMAT_CODE[Check Format],cf.FILENAME[Check File],rf.FORMAT_CODE[Remittance Format],rf.FILENAME[Remittance File],VENDOR_NAME--,ven.NAME_UNO,n2.NAME[Vendor Name]FROM APM_VENDOR venJOIN APL_APTYPE typ ON ven.APTYPE_CODE = typ.APTYPE_CODEJOIN TBM_BANK b ON Typ.BANK_CODE = b.BANK_CODEJOIN HBM_NAME n ON b.NAME_UNO = n.NAME_UNOJOIN HBM_NAME n2 ON ven.NAME_UNO = n2.NAME_UNOLEFTJOIN TBM_FMT_CH cf ON b.CH_FORMAT_UNO = cf.FORMAT_UNOLEFTJOIN TBM_FMT_RA rf ON b.RA_FORMAT_UNO = rf.FORMAT_UNOWHERE VENDOR_ID LIKE ('')ORDERBY VENDOR_ID --UPDATE APM_VENDOR SET PREFERRED_REMIT_DELIV_METHOD = '' WHERE VENDOR_ID =  --M,E,N--UPDATE APM_VENDOR SET REMITTANCE_EMAIL = '' WHERE VENDOR_ID = '' || Step 3: Print all1. Select payments2. Select to remit payments3. Set options- Print all- email = no | Expected: Remittances created and printed Remittances created for payments for all vendorsRemittances sent to printer for payments for all Vendors No remittances emailed || Step 4: Print Only1. Select payments2. Select to remit payments3. Set options- Print for mail only- email = no | Expected: Remittances created and printed Remittances created for payments for all vendorsRemittances sent to printer for payments for Vendors 2 No remittances emailed || Step 5: Print All and email1. Select payments2. Select to remit payments3. Set options- Print all- email = yes- email format | Expected: Remittances created and printed Remittances created for payments for all vendorsRemittances sent to printer for payments for all Vendors Emails sent for Vendor 1 || Step 6: Print to mail only and Email1. Select payments2. Select to remit payments3. Set options- Print for mail only- email = yes- email format | Expected: Remittances created and printed Remittances created for payments for all vendorsRemittances sent to printer for payments for Vendors 2 Emails sent for Vendor 1

Title: Invoice - Disb detail - Disbursement card UI validation
Steps: Step 1: For what each of the validation does, refer to Validation spreadsheet attached here. | Expected: Check errors in APT_MESSAGE || Step 2: Validate Transaction DateTran _date not between cdt_parms date | Expected: Throw DISBDETAIL_TRAN_BETWEEN || Step 3: Validate Hard/Soft Code | Expected: Not valid as cannot select anything other than hard costs. || Step 4: Validate Hard/Soft Matter 1When Matter doesn't allow Hard. TBM_MATTER.ALLOW_DISB = 'S' (only allow soft) | Expected: Throw DISBDETAIL_CM_NOTAUTH_HARD || Step 5: Validate Hard/Soft Matter 2When Matter doesn't allow Soft. | Expected: Not valid as we do not enter Soft in AP || Step 6: Validate Hard/Soft Matter 3When matter do not allow disbursement. | Expected: Throw DISBDETAIL_CM_NOAUTHDISB || Step 7: Validate Cost Code do not allow Hard Disbursement | Expected: Cannot select such cost code.Throw DISBDETAIL_COST_CANTBEHARD on existing record || Step 8: Validate Cost Code do not allow Soft Disbursement | Expected: Not valid as cannnot select anything other than hard cost code. || Step 9: Validate Matter InactiveWhen matter is inactive | Expected: Throw DISBDETAIL_CM_INACTIVE || Step 10: Validate Client Entity TypeWhen client entity type is not C or F | Expected: Throw DISBDETAIL_CM_INACTIVE*you cannot create matter for non C type client. || Step 11: Validate Authorization EmployeeWhen not using the authorize employee being setup | Expected: Throw DISBDETAIL_AU_NOAUTH *blocked by bug 172701 || Step 12: Validate Transaction Date MatterWhen not allow to have tran date before matter open date, and tran date is not between open and close dateWhen Allow to have tran date before matter open date, and tran date more than close date | Expected: Throw DISBDETAIL_TRAN_NOTWITHIN Throw DISBDETAIL_TRAN_NOTLESS. || Step 13: Validate Transaction Date EmployeeWhen tran_date is not between emp hire/terminate dateWhen tran_date is not between emp hire/terminate date and previous emp hire/terminate date | Expected: Throw DISBDETAIL_DATE_NOVALIDFOREMP Throw DISBDETAIL_DATE_NOVALIDFOREMP || Step 14: Validate Phase Task MatterWhen matter has task plan and phase/task not selectedWhen selected phase/task is not valid for matter plan code | Expected: Throw WESSTUFF_PHUNO_REQUIRED *bug 169806Throw WESTUFF_NOVALIDATE *bug 169806Bug 206605 Disb cards - Select Client.Matter with Matter plan clears Phase/Task field, which it shouldn't be || Step 15: Validate Disbursement Code allowedSelect allowed Disubursement codes in Entity Manager under Vendor tabMake new invoice using the vendor that has limited disbursement codesMake a new disbursment detail line In Enitity Manager, remove the disbursement code that you used in the invoiceResave the invoice in AP | Expected: Throws DISBURSEMENTAVAILABLE || Step 16: Validate Prebill Comments and Narrative FieldsEnsure that spellcheck and expansion codes work || Step 17: Jurisdiction | Expected: - Is active and is not output tax SELECT * FROM TBL_JURISDIC TJ1 WHERE TJ1.INACTIVE != 'Y' AND TJ1.TAX_IN_OUT != 'O'

Set a check printer on  the bankUPDATE TBM_BANK SET CH_PRINTER_UNO = (SELECT PRINTER_UNO FROM CMS_PRINTER WHERE PRINTER_ID ='DEV01')--DEV01,DEV02WHERE BANK_CODE ='' | Expected: Printer field mandatoryPrinter set on bank is the selectedPrinter can't  be changed || Step 4: Bank allows printer selection, printer not set on bank1. Remove check printer from the bankUPDATE TBM_BANK SET CH_PRINTER_UNO ='' WHERE BANK_CODE ='' | Expected: Printer field mandatoryPrinter not set Printer can be selected || Step 5: Bank does not allow printer selection, printer not set on bank1. Title: Invoice - Disb Detail - Initial default values
Steps: Step 1: Date | Expected: Defaulted from Invoice Date || Step 2: Hard/Soft | Expected: Hard || Step 3: Currency | Expected: - Field disabled when using multi currency and user not allowed to override currency during disbursement entry.- Currency Always defaults from incurring officehttps://aderant.sharepoint.com/sites/Iknow/Expert/Internal%20Docs/Salesforce/Soft%20Disbursements%20Without%20Unit%20Rates%20Inherit%20Currency%20from%20Incurring%20Office.PDF#search=Disbursement%20default%20currencyNote: Rules for defaulting currency differ depending on the source and if the cost code has rates For CDN type disbs (those originating from disb app, billing, classic disbs)Cost code has Unit rate - default hierachy is matter then CDM parmsCost code does not have unit rate - default from incurring office || Step 4: Jurisidiction | Expected: Default from Invoice Header || Step 5: Narrative | Expected: Autogenerating Narrative text when APM_PARMS.GEN_DISB_TEXT = Y || Step 6: Other*Refer to attached validation doc || Step 7: Base and Bill Amount are disabled on form initialization. From 8220.Ex0003- Fields are defaulted to empty and mandatory | Expected: - Bill amount is defaulted from Base amount if Bill amount is editable - Max length 14 Pre 8220.Ex0003Enabled when Client/Matter and Office are entered, value default to zero.  From 8220.Ex0005- Where cost code has 100% markdown the amount will be set to zero when base amount is populated  US 241218 - Set Disbursement Card Base and Bill Amount to required and blank field when initialise the form.

Title: Payment - Remittance: Validation
Steps: Step 1: Note: Most of the actual validation errors are processed on Release and they are covered in the release validation tests. There are included here just to test the process of how the remittance validation items are handled || Step 2: No email address foundEntity Manager | Vendor maintenancePrint email remittance for manual vendor payment | Expected: Error message displayed || Step 3: Exchange email settings not set correctlyAdmin | System | EmailPrint email remittance for manual vendor payment | Expected: Error message displayed || Step 4: AP email settings not set correctlyPrint email remittance for manual vendor payment | Expected: Error message : Cannot proceed printing remitancesError from remote server || Step 5: Vendor does not have an emailPrint email remittance for manual vendor payment where vendor's preferred remit method is email but they don't have an email address | Expected: - Error message: Recipient email missing- Remittance is created || Step 6: Invalid check number (release validation)1. Create a completed manual payment2. Alter the check number to 0UPDATE APT_CHECK set CHECK_NUM = 0 WHERE request_num = 3. Select to print remittance | Expected: - Error message : Check number invalid- Payment is not set to released- Remittance is not created || Step 7: Don't email remittance1. Create a manual, wire or electronic payment2. Release it3. Select to print4. Select NO to email the remittance advice | Expected: The remittance advice is not emailed and the email validations do not occur

Title: Invoice - Disb Detail - When processing and edit field values
Steps: Step 1: Transaction Date change. | Expected: Validate new date with matter and employee date. Recalculate the amounts if Auto Calc is on. || Step 2: Office Code Change | Expected: Change location default if empty.Recalculate the amounts if Auto Calc is on. || Step 3: Cost code change | Expected: If cost code has unit rates, recalculate the disb. Employee and Authorized Employee field will mark as required if selected cost code has been setup to have them as required.Recalculate the amounts if Auto Calc is on. || Step 4: Matter change | Expected: When matter is not billable, set billable_flag = N. Bill Amount field disabled.Recalculate the amounts if Auto Calc is on. || Step 5: Currency Code change | Expected: Invalid, cannot change currency in disb.Recalculate the amounts if Auto Calc is on. || Step 6: Phase/Task Code change. | Expected: determine if phase/task is valid / if in matter plan || Step 7: Auto Calc change | Expected: recalculate the disb amount.Recalculate the amounts if Auto Calc is on. || Step 8: Employee change | Expected: Recalculate the amounts if Auto Calc is on, if office is set to default from employee. || Step 9: Authorize Employee change | Expected: validate authorising employee || Step 10: Quantity change | Expected: Recalculate the amounts if Auto Calc is on. || Step 11: Amount change | Expected: auto calculate flag uncheck. ST_Amt to set to Base_amount. || Step 12: Bill Amount change. | Expected: Auto calc flag uncheck. || Step 13: Narrative change with typo and CDM_PARMS.FORCE_SPELLCHECK = 'Y' | Expected: Spell check activate and detected typo. (User Story 167708)

Make sure to check the 'Has Unit Rate' flag.In Detail section, add Rates.Fill in the required field and the Unit Rates treshold.usd100 for first 10 units, usd 50 for next 5 unites, 20 for 2, 10 for 1, 0.5 for the rest. || Step 2: Open Expert AP > Invoice > Disbursement card. || Step 3: Ensure Auto Calculation flag is checked. || Step 4: Select Disb Code that you setup in Step 1. || Step 5: Put in Quantity = 50 | Expected: Base and Bill Amount default to usd 1316 || Step 6: Change Quantity | Expected: Base and Bill Amount will default to new amount || Step 7: Delete existing set and set another set of rates which effective date is in future. Create a disb with today's date | Expected: Amount fields will not default

Title: Invoice - Disb Detail - Entering disb with Markup Amount and Percentage

Make sure to check the 'Has Unit Rate' flag.In Detail section, add Rates. || Step 2: Set Markup Amount - USD50. || Step 3: Create disb in invoice entry for today, put in USD100 in Base Amount. | Expected: Bill Amount default to USD100+50 = USD150. || Step 4: remove and create another rates with Markup Percentage = 50 || Step 5: Put in USD200 in disb entry. | Expected: Bill Amount default to USD200 + (50/100*200) = 300 || Step 6: Check the 'Apply markup to base' in disbursement type setting form. Create disb with USD200. | Expected: Both Bill and base amount default to USD300 || Step 7: Remove and create one with Markup Percentage = 50. Create disb with USD100. | Expected: Both Bill and base amount default to USD150.

Title: Payment - Check print: Check numbers
Steps: Step 1: No avail checks1. No Checks numbers are avail for the bank 2. Create a check payment for the bank that is completed or released and not printed3. Print checkDECLARE @bank asvarchar (10)='BUSD'SELECT TOP(1) ''[APT_CHECK_FORM],cf.CHECK_NUM, cf.FORM_STATUS,cf.FORM_USE,cf.STATUS_SOURCE,CHECK_TRAN_UNO,LAST_MODIFIED--,cf.* FROM APT_CHECK_FORM cfWHERE cf.FORM_STATUS NOT IN ('A','V') AND CHECK_NUM > (SELECTTOP(1) CHECK_NUM FROM APT_CHECK_FORM WHERE FORM_STATUS IN ('A','V')AND BANK_CODE = @bank ORDERBY CHECK_NUM DESC)AND cf.BANK_CODE = @bankORDERBY cf.CHECK_NUM ASC | Expected: GetNextAvailableCheckNumberButNoAvailableNumber()Error: No checks available || Step 2: Next avail check number when no registered check numbers for that bank have been used1. Checks numbers are avail for the bank and none have been used 2. Create a check payment for the bank that is completed or released and not printed3. Print check | Expected: Check printedUse first check numberCheck print option formDisplayed the correct and start and end check numbersCheck form table updatedAPT_CHECK_FORM.FORM_STATUS ='A'APT_CHECK_FORM.FORM_USE ='C'APT_CHECK_FORM.STATUS_SOURCE 'P' APT_CHECK_FORM.CHECK_TRAN_UNO = APT_CHECK.TRAN_UNO APT_CHECK_FORM.LAST_MODIFIED = updated || Step 3: Next avail check number when previous check numbers have been used in order1. Check numbers are avail for the bank and have been used in order2. Create a check payment for the bank that is completed or released and not printed3. Print check | Expected: Check printedUse next avail check numberCheck print option formDisplayed the correct and start and end check numbersCheck form table updatedAPT_CHECK_FORM.FORM_STATUS ='A'APT_CHECK_FORM.FORM_USE ='C'APT_CHECK_FORM.STATUS_SOURCE 'P' APT_CHECK_FORM.CHECK_TRAN_UNO = APT_CHECK.TRAN_UNO APT_CHECK_FORM.LAST_MODIFIED = updated || Step 4: Print multiple when previous check numbers have been used in order1. Check numbers are avail for the bank and have been used in order2. Check Payments are completed or released and not printed3. Print checks | Expected: Checks printedUse next avail check numbersCheck print option formDisplayed the correct and start and end check numbersCheck form table updatedAPT_CHECK_FORM.FORM_STATUS ='A'APT_CHECK_FORM.FORM_USE ='C'APT_CHECK_FORM.STATUS_SOURCE 'P' APT_CHECK_FORM.CHECK_TRAN_UNO = APT_CHECK.TRAN_UNO APT_CHECK_FORM.LAST_MODIFIED = updated || Step 5: Next Avail when there is a gap1. Check numbers are avail for the bank and have been used in order2. Use a newer check number by doing a manual payment firste.g. 5 was last used then select 7 for the manual payment3. Create a check payment for the bank that is completed or released and not printed4. Print check | Expected: GetNextAvailableCheckNumberWithLargeGapsBetweenCheckNumbers()Check printedUse next avail check number > than the one last usedCheck print option formDisplayed the correct and start and end check numbersCheck form table updatedAPT_CHECK_FORM.FORM_STATUS ='A'APT_CHECK_FORM.FORM_USE ='C'APT_CHECK_FORM.STATUS_SOURCE 'P' APT_CHECK_FORM.CHECK_TRAN_UNO = APT_CHECK.TRAN_UNO APT_CHECK_FORM.LAST_MODIFIED = updated || Step 6: Print multiple when not enough check numbers to process all of them1. Checks numbers are avail for the bank 2. Check Payments are completed or released and not printed3. Print check more payments than there are avail check numbers | Expected: Error: Not enough checks || Step 7: Next unused check number has been voided1. Checks numbers are avail for the bank 2. Void the check number after last used check number 3. Create a check payment for the bank that is completed or released and not printed4. Print check | Expected: GetNextAvailableCheckNumberWithLargeGapsBetweenCheckNumbers()Check printedUse next avail check number after the voided check numberCheck print option formDisplayed the correct start and end check numbersCheck form table updatedAPT_CHECK_FORM.FORM_STATUS ='A'APT_CHECK_FORM.FORM_USE ='C'APT_CHECK_FORM.STATUS_SOURCE 'P' APT_CHECK_FORM.CHECK_TRAN_UNO = APT_CHECK.TRAN_UNO APT_CHECK_FORM.LAST_MODIFIED = updated

Steps: Step 1: Data Providers should be in the following order || Step 2: AccountOffice DepartmentProfit CenterSource Office | Expected: Disable, default from Vendor, APA_VENDOR_BOOK.select ven.VENDOR_NAME,ven.VENDOR_ID,gl.ACCT_CODE as [Account],vb.OFFC as [Office],vb.DEPT as [Department],vb.PROF as [Profit Center]from APA_VENDOR_BOOK vb inner join apm_vendor ven on ven.VENDOR_UNO = vb.VENDOR_UNO inner join GLM_CHART gl on gl.ACCT_UNO = vb.ACCT_UNOwhere ven.VENDOR_ID = '1112'Source Office default from Bank of APtype used in this invoice. || Step 3: Employee | Expected: Search list. Return Employee data. Required field regardless of the account require an employee or not. || Step 4: Amount | Expected: Currency field. Required field.Limit up to 14 digits and 2 decimals || Step 5: Narrative | Expected: Text box. || Step 6: Jurisdiction | Expected: list control. TBL_JURISDICTION. No restriction. || Step 9: Merchant | Expected: Generic text box.  Limit up to 250 words. || Step 10: Expense Currency | Expected: List control. Title: Payment Items - Employee Advance: Create/Post/Cancel and reconcile non system currency and different bank
Steps: Step 1: System pre reqs* Expenses is deployed* Expense licence imported* Expense workflows imported* Workflow approvals are turned off - Admin | Expenses | Employee Advance Workflow Options - Admin | Expenses | Expense Workflow Options || Step 2: Data pre reqsCAD RatesRate: 1.092007784100000Reciprocal: 0.915744388053213Employee Advance- CAD cur- Approved- Amount = $100 | Expected: APT_ADVANCEAMOUNT= 100.00 (transaction currency)ADV_BALANCE= NULLTC_AMOUNT= 100.00 (transaction currency)CURRENCY_CODE = CADADV_STATUS = ASCHEDULE_NUM = 0Note: Unlike other credit items, an advance is not converted to system currency when it's approved(posted)Note: Unlike other credit items, creating an advance does not create a credit row in APT_ADVANCE_AMT. This is not created until the advance has been applied to payment, the payment posted then the advance applied to an expense.DECLARE @advance asvarchar (100)='7'DECLARE @emplcode asvarchar (50)='NZ29'DECLARE @employee asint= (SELECT EMPL_UNO FROM HBM_PERSNL WHERE EMPLOYEE_CODE = @emplcode)----------------------------------------------------------------------------------- Advance ---------------------------------------------------------------------------------SELECT''[APT_ADVANCE],adv.ADV_UNO,adv.SCHEDULE_NUM,adv.ADV_STATUS,adv.AMOUNT,adv.ADV_BALANCE,TC_AMOUNT,DRUNO,PERIOD,adv.CURRENCY_CODE,* FROM APT_ADVANCE advWHERE ADV_UNO = @advance----------------------------------------------------------------------------------- Advance Amount ---------------------------------------------------------------------------------SELECT''[APT_ADVANCE_AMT],ROW_UNO,ADV_UNO,SOURCE_TRAN_UNO,SIGN,AMOUNT,TC_AMT,TC_CODE,DRUNO,PERIOD,LAST_MODIFIED,* FROM APT_ADVANCE_AMT advaWHERE ADV_UNO = @advanceORDER BY adva.ROW_UNO ----------------------------------------------------------------------------------- Summary tables---------------------------------------------------------------------------------SELECT''[APH_PERSNL_SUMM],*FROM APH_PERSNL_SUMM WHERE EMPL_UNO = @employeeSELECT''[APH_PERSNL_YEAR],*FROM APH_PERSNL_YEAR WHERE EMPL_UNO = @employee || Step 3: Create a payment - Employee payment- Bank is different to employee's bank but has same company- CAD Cur- C$100SELECT''[Unpaid Employee Advances],adv.ADV_UNO,e.EMPLOYEE_CODE,adv.AMOUNT,adv.ADV_BALANCE,TC_AMOUNT,adv.CURRENCY_CODE,o.COMPANY_CODE,adv.DRUNO,e.EMPLOYEE_NAME,adv.DESCRIPTION,adv.APPROVED_DATE,adv.*FROM APT_Advance adv LEFTOUTERJOIN HBM_PERSNL e ON adv.EMPL_UNO = e.EMPL_UNOLEFTJOIN HBL_OFFICE o ON e.OFFC = o.OFFC_CODEWHERE  adv.ADV_STATUS = 'A'AND ISNULL(adv.SCHEDULE_NUM,0) = 0 SELECT''[Payment Bank],BANK_CODE,b.CURRENCY_CODE,b.OFFC,o.COMPANY_CODEFROM TBM_BANK bJOIN HBL_OFFICE o on b.OFFC = o.OFFC_CODEWHERE b.CURRENCY_CODE = 'CAD'--WHERE BANK_CODE ='' | Expected: Payment saved || Step 4: Select to add employee advance- Select the advance | Expected: Details populated- Employee defaulted from the payment- Payment Amount displays in payment bank currency C$100 - Approved date from the advance- Advance amount displays in payment bank currency C$100 - Balance displays in payment bank currency C$100 - Description from the invoice- Advance grid amounts display in payment bank currency C$100 || Step 5: Save & Close | Expected: Advance detail record savedAPT_ADVANCE (updated)ADV_BALANCE= NULL SCHEDULE_NUM = -1APT_ADVANCE_AMT (record created)AMOUNT = 100.00 (transaction currency)SIGN = -1TC_AMT = 100.00 (transaction currency)TC_CODE = CADSCHEDULE_NUM = 0TRAN_TYPE = CH || Step 6: Note: this is new functionality so this step will only be able to be performed in release after 8.2.2Create another payment - Use latest released version- Enter the same details as the first payment | Expected: Payment 2 created || Step 7: Reconcile the two advancesNote: this is new functionality so will only be able to reconcile in release after 8.2.2. For 8.2.2. release, there is no spec so need to look at what expense report is doing instead. Difference seems to be balance field. | Expected: Tables and fields matchAPT_ADVANCE- All fields that should match, do- All fields that won't match e.g. unos, are populated with the appropriate valuesNote: SCHEDULE_NUM is set to -1 so it doesn't get picked up by the schedulerAPT_ADVANCE_AMT - All fields that should match, do- All fields that won't match e.g. unos, are populated with the appropriate valuesNote: SCHEDULE_NUM is set to 0 as its not used here || Step 8: Post both payments and reconcile the two advancesNote: this is new functionality so will only be able to reconcile in release after 8.2.2. | Expected: Tables and fields matchAPT_ADVANCE (updated)AMOUNT= 91.5744388053 (system currency)ADV_BALANCE= 91.5744388053 TC_AMOUNT= 100.00 (transaction currency)CURRENCY_CODE = CADADV_STATUS = P SCHEDULE_NUM = 0- All fields that should match, do- All fields that won't match e.g. unos, are populated with the appropriate valuesNote: SCHEDULE_NUM is set back to 0APT_ADVANCE_AMTAMOUNT = 91.5744388053 (system currency)SIGN = -1TC_AMT = 100.00 (transaction currency)TC_CODE = CADTRAN_TYPE = CH- All fields that should match, do- All fields that won't match e.g. unos, are populated with the appropriate valuesNote: SCHEDULE_NUM remains as 0 || Step 9: Cancel both payments and reconcile the two advancesNote: this is new functionality so will only be able to reconcile in release after 8.2.2. For 8.2.2. release, there is no spec so need to look at what expense report is doing instead. Difference seems to be balance field. | Expected: Payments canceledAPT_ADVANCE (updated)AMOUNT= 100.00 (transaction currency)ADV_BALANCE= NULLTC_AMOUNT= 100.00 (transaction currency)CURRENCY_CODE = CADADV_STATUS = AAPT_ADVANCE_AMT (record unchanged)AMOUNT = 91.5744388053 (system currency)SIGN = -1TC_AMT = 100.00 (transaction currency)TC_CODE = CADTRAN_TYPE = CHAPT_ADVANCE_AMT (record 2 created)AMOUNT = 91.5744388053 (system currency)SIGN = 1 TC_AMT = 100.00 (transaction currency)TC_CODE = CADTRAN_TYPE = CHX
