Title: Upgrade - Payment: Status conversion script
Steps: Step 1: Create data pre upgradeFollow shared step below to create checks in appshell, one for each statuses. Note that the shared step is only up til posting stage (Outstanding). Use Check Cancellation and Reconcillation in appshell to achieve Reconciled and Cancelled status.Note: If unabled to reconcile then just edit the status e.g.UPDATE APT_CHECK SET CHECK_STATUS ='R'WHERE REQUEST_NUM = 101 - Check with no details line or with unallocated balance- Check with details line and ready to post- Released check- Posted check- Reconciled check- Cancelled check | Expected: Checks (payments) created SELECT chq.REVERSAL,chq.CHECK_STATUS,chq.ENTRY_STATUS,--chq.EXPERT_PAYMENT_STATUS,*FROM APT_CHECK chqWHERE REQUEST_NUM in (96,97,98,99,100,101) || Step 2: Upgrade Deploy the new version | Expected: Conversion script is run e.g.C:\TFS\ExpertSuite\Dev\vnext\Modules\Database\Src\Database\Scripts\Post-Deployment\APT_CHECK_expert_payment_status || Step 3: Check the status of the checks has been updatedAPT_CHECK.EXPERT_PAYMENT_STATUS - Should update all rows correctly | Expected: Statuses updated  APT_CHECK.EXPERT_PAYMENT_STATUS  Check with no details line or with unallocated balance> Complete, C ( will be changed to Incomplete when validated in app)Check with details line and ready to post > Complete, CRelease Check > Released, RPosted Check > Outstanding, OReconciled Check > Matched, MCancelled Check > Cancelled, X SELECT chq.REVERSAL,chq.CHECK_STATUS,chq.ENTRY_STATUS,chq.EXPERT_PAYMENT_STATUS,*FROM APT_CHECK chqWHERE REQUEST_NUM in (96,97,98,99,100,101)

Title: Payments - grid: Data
Steps: Step 1: Data Pre reqs:- Need to be able to see some data returned for every column so make sure there is data to support this- Payments exist where mandatory only data exists- Payments for non system currency- Vendor payments exist- Client Payments exists- Employee Payments exist- Misc (name records) payments exist- Payments for checks with check number- Payments for wire transfer with wire number- Narrative is max length- 1099 amount is turned on for VendorUPDATE CMS_OPTION SET FLAG_VALUE ='Y'WHERE OPTION_CODE ='1099_IN_USE'- Use Sales Tax is turned onUPDATE CMS_OPTION SET FLAG_VALUE ='Y'WHERE OPTION_CODE ='SALES_USE_TX'Note: Data to add- Spot Rates- Image ref when this is developed || Step 2: General Checks | Expected: Use PAY - Grid.sql* Dates don't display time* Lookup type fields display appropriate text and code* Address displays address type on line 1 then address with commas || Step 3: Search all and check results | Expected: * Data returned to all columns is correct for various situations as set up in the pre reqs* There is no Payee Code for misc payments* Amount values display with their correct currency symbol, the correct number of decimals for that currency, and the correct values* Display blank instead of 0 for payment number, payment schedule, image ref, period * Narrative for max characters displays correctly in the hover pop up || Step 4: Bank Account | Expected: Display only segment that are flagged as account numberDisplay concatinated in sort number order with '-' between each segment

Title: Payments - grid: Save searches
Steps: Step 1: Note: The generic granula tests to save search are in FrameworkArea: PaymentsData stored: in configurationEXEC SECURITY.SetContextByName ''SELECT n.Path,n.Name,v.Content FROM Configuration.ConfigName n INNER JOIN Configuration.ConfigValue v ON n.Id = v.NameIdWHERE Path LIKE 'Preference.SavedSearches.PaymentsGridInstances.ExpertAccountsPayable%' || Step 2: Create checks | Expected: * Creates can be saved per user* Creates can be saved per firm (if the user has permissions)* Can create a new saved search including any of the items in the data provider section || Step 3: Load checks | Expected: * Can see and load your owned saved searches* Can see and load firm searches

Title: Schedule - Vendor: Add a Single Invoice
Steps: Step 1: Pre reqsWithholding tax UPDATE CMS_OPTION SET FLAG_VALUE ='Y'WHERE OPTION_CODE ='WHTAX_IN_USE'UPDATE APM_PARMS SET WHOLD_PCNT = 10Schedule- Type = Invoice- Status = Edit- Required header fields have been enteredVendor 1- Has same remit vendorVendor 2Has different remit vendorInvoice 1- posted- not locked- vendor 1- APType has a same bank as the schedule - has discount amount- has withheld amount- has 1099 amount- seperate check is onInvoice 2- posted- not locked- APType has a same bank as the schedule - vendor 2- has discount amount- has withheld amount- has 1099 amount- seperate check is onInvoice 3- posted- not locked- APType has a different bank and bank office to the schedule but the company is the same- vendor 1- seperate check is offInvoice 4- created in classic- posted- not locked- APType has a same bank as the schedule - vendor 1 | Expected: --------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- AP Type's bank, office and company-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------SELECT typ.APTYPE_CODE,typ.APTYPE_DESC,typ.BANK_CODE,b.CURRENCY_CODE,o.OFFC_CODE,o.COMPANY_CODEFROM APL_APTYPE typJOIN TBM_BANK b ON Typ.BANK_CODE = b.BANK_CODEJOIN HBL_OFFICE o ON b.OFFC = o.OFFC_CODE--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- Bank's office and company-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------SELECT b.BANK_CODE, b.CURRENCY_CODE,o.OFFC_CODE,o.COMPANY_CODEFROM TBM_BANK bJOIN HBL_OFFICE o ON b.OFFC = o.OFFC_CODE || Step 2: Add invoice with edited values1. Select to add single invoice- Invoice 12. Edit all the fields in the bottom section3. Add & Close | Expected: Record added to scheduleSchedule Items grid updated- Row displays in gridInvoice updated- schedule number updated to match the scheduleInvoice amount row created- Fields saved as per the form values- Other fields saves as per the invoice- Schedule number set to match the schedule----------------------------------------------------------------------------------- Declarations -- SELECT * FROM APS_SCHEDULE_Z ORDER BY SCHEDULE_NUM desc-- SELECT * FROM APT_INVOICE_AMT ORDER BY ROW_UNO desc -- UPDATE APS_SCHEDULE_Z SET CHECK_DATE = '3000-09-07 00:00:00.000' WHERE SCHEDULE_NUM = 14---------------------------------------------------------------------------------DECLARE @schedulenum asint= 14DECLARE @schbank asvarchar(50)= (SELECT BANK_CODE FROM APS_SCHEDULE_Z WHERE SCHEDULE_NUM = @schedulenum)DECLARE @company asvarchar(20)= (SELECT COMPANY_CODE FROM TBM_BANK b JOIN HBL_OFFICE o ON b.OFFC = o.OFFC_CODE WHERE b.BANK_CODE = @schbank)----------------------------------------------------------------------------------- Header---------------------------------------------------------------------------------SELECT ''[APS_SCHEDULE_Z],SCHEDULE_NUM, z.STATUS,CASE WHEN z.SCHEDULE_TYPE = 'V' THEN 'Vendor' WHEN z.SCHEDULE_TYPE = 'E' THEN 'Employee' ELSE''END[Schedule Type],z.BANK_CODE,z.CHECK_DATE[Payment Date],z.DATE_TO_PRINT,cl.DISPLAY_TEXT [Language],----------------------------------------------------------------------------------- Other fields---------------------------------------------------------------------------------z.CREATE_DATE,p.EMPLOYEE_NAME +' ('+ p.EMPLOYEE_CODE +')'[Created By],TAKE_DISCOUNT,z.EAP_INITIATED, z.CHECK_LANGUAGE,z.STATUS_DATE,p2.EMPLOYEE_NAME +' ('+ p2.EMPLOYEE_CODE +')'[Status Employee],z.STATUS_EMPL_UNO,z.CREATE_EMPL_UNO,z.CUTOFF_DATE,z.INACTIVE,z.PRIMARY_REGION,z.LAST_MODIFIED----------------------------------------------------------------------------------- From---------------------------------------------------------------------------------FROM APS_SCHEDULE_Z zLEFTJOIN HBM_PERSNL p ON z.CREATE_EMPL_UNO = p.EMPL_UNO -- created employee LEFTJOIN HBM_PERSNL p2 ON z.STATUS_EMPL_UNO = p2.EMPL_UNO -- status employee LEFTJOIN CXL_CODE_LOOKUP look1 ON z.STATUS= look1.DB_VALUE and look1.LOOKUP_GROUP ='PaymentScheduleStatus'JOIN CXL_CODE_LOOKUP cl on cl.DB_VALUE = z.CHECK_LANGUAGE and cl.LOOKUP_GROUP ='CheckLanguage'WHERE SCHEDULE_NUM = @schedulenum----------------------------------------------------------------------------------- Schedule items---------------------------------------------------------------------------------SELECT ''[APT_INVOICE_AMT],ia.ROW_UNO,ia.INV_TRAN_UNO,SOURCE_REF,ia.TRAN_TYPE,v.VENDOR_NAME +' ('+ v.VENDOR_ID +')'[Vendor],v2.VENDOR_NAME +' ('+ v2.VENDOR_ID +')'[Remit Vendor],inv.INVOICE_NUM,inv.SEPARATE_CHECK,CASE WHEN inv.BANK_ACCOUNT_UNO = 0 THEN'Check'WHEN inv.BANK_ACCOUNT_UNO <> 0 THEN'Electronic Banking'END [Payment Method],inv.BANK_ACCOUNT_UNO,chq.WIRE_NUM,chq.CHECK_NUM,inv.INVOICE_DATE,inv.CURRENCY_CODE[Inv Cur],inv.TC_INV_AMT,inv.INV_AMT,ia.SIGN,ia.TC_CODE,ia.TC_PAID_AMT,ia.PAID_AMT,ia.AP_AMT,inv.REF_NUM,DISC_DATE, DISC_AMT, HOLD_DATE, ST_WHELD,inv.APTYPE_CODE,typ.BANK_CODE,inv.VENDOR_UNO,inv.REMIT_VENDOR_UNO,inv.EXPERT_INVOICE_STATUS, INVOICE_STATUS,inv.TRAN_UNO[TRAN_UNO Invoice],ia.LAST_MODIFIEDFROM APT_INVOICE_AMT iaJOIN APT_INVOICE inv on ia.INV_TRAN_UNO = inv.TRAN_UNOJOIN APL_APTYPE typ ON inv.APTYPE_CODE = typ.APTYPE_CODE LEFT JOIN APT_CHECK chq ON ia.SOURCE_TRAN_UNO = chq.TRAN_UNO LEFTJOIN APM_VENDOR v ON inv.VENDOR_UNO = v.VENDOR_UNO -- vendor LEFTJOIN APM_VENDOR v2 ON inv.REMIT_VENDOR_UNO = v2.VENDOR_UNO -- remit vendor WHERE ia.SCHEDULE_NUM = @schedulenumAND TRAN_TYPE <>'CHX'----------------------------------------------------------------------------------- Avail Vendor items---------------------------------------------------------------------------------SELECT''[Avail Vendor Items],inv.INVOICE_NUM,v.VENDOR_ID,inv.DUE_DATE,inv.HOLD_DATE,typ.BANK_CODE,inv.CURRENCY_CODE,ba.PAYMENT_TYPE_CODE,inv.APTYPE_CODE,o.COMPANY_CODE,inv.DISCTERM_CODE,inv.DISC_DATE,inv.SEPARATE_CHECK,inv.JURISDIC_CODE,inv.BILL_PMT_REQD,v.VENDOR_ID,rv.VENDOR_ID[Rem Ven Id],v.VENDTYP_CODE,v.OWNING_OFFC,inv.DRUNO,INV_AMT,inv.DISC_AMT,inv.BALANCE,inv.HOLD_DATE,inv.TEN99_AMT,inv.HOLD_TAX,inv.ST_WHELD, inv.SCHEDULE_NUM,inv.INVOICE_STATUS,inv.EAP_INITIATED,inv.VENDOR_UNO,v.REMIT_VEND_UNO,inv.TRAN_UNOFROM APT_INVOICE inv INNER JOIN TBL_CURRENCY cur ON inv.CURRENCY_CODE = cur.CURRENCY_CODE INNER JOIN Title: Schedule - Vendor: Adding Multiple Invoices
Steps: Step 1: Pre-req- three posted invoice, using shared step below || Step 2: In Moscow, go to Payment schedule tab. Create new schedule by click the New Schedule ribbon.Choose Vendor Payment Schedule. || Step 3: Fill in required fields. || Step 4: Assume that you created the invoice using shared step above.Bank: BOTPayment Date: Current DateDate To Print: Current DateClick Save. | Expected: After clicking save, Add invoices ribbon will show as enabled. || Step 5: Click Add Invoices > Add Multiple Invoices. | Expected: Add Multiple Invoices dropdown form has a few default field: Due Date To, Bank Code, Currency and Separate Check. || Step 6: Fill or search for the invoices you created in Step 2. Hit Done. | Expected: The invoices you created in step 2 should be ALL added in this shcedule. || Step 7: Run the attached sql in this step to check if invoices has been attached successfully to the schedule. | Expected: The result return by running sql should be the same as the details grid. || Step 8: Go to Invoices tab, locate the same invoice in the grid. || Step 9: Hover to the 'i' icon beside the invoice status. | Expected: A small window appear when you hover over the info icon. It should show this invoice has Outstanding status and the hover over also shows the payment schedule Number the invoice attached to. || Step 10: Check the Payment Schedule column in the Invoices grid. | Expected: Should display the payment schedule number which the invoice attached to.  *If this column is not available, right click and add from context menu.

To access this form,
Open Moscow, Go to Payment Schedule section Tab. 
Click New Schedule on the ribbon.
Choose VENDOR payment schedule. 
Fill in the schedule headers and hit Save. Add Invoices ribbon should be now enabled. 
Click Add Invoices > Add Multiple Invoices.

available outstanding and part paid invoices where:    EAP_INITATED = 'Y' AND 'N' (why just Y and N? it could be NULL)   List is filtered by vendor if entered (is it filtered by remit vendor?)   Does not return an invoice that has a part payment on an unposted paymentSelected Invoice- Company of the invoice must match company of the schedule otherwise display error   (Company is linked to office of the bank. On the Invoice the bank is linked to the APType) || Step 4: Remit Vendor IDAdded in 821SP1 | Expected: Data Provider- Lookup- Mandatory- Populated from selection of vendor or invoice - Does not return record with UNO 0- Searches on name,id- Active and Inactive items - Has MRUs- Lookup Displays the code and descriptionSELECT VENDOR_NAME, VENDOR_ID,OWNING_OFFC,CURRENCY_CODE,*FROM APM_VENDORData Returned- Multi Select returns invoices for each filter item || Step 5: Middle SectionInvoice Amount, Invoice DateDiscount Amount, Discount DateInv 1099 Amount, Due DateBalance, Hold DateNarrative | Expected: Display- Read only- Populated from selected invoice----------------------------------------------------------------------------------- Declarations ---------------------------------------------------------------------------------DECLARE @vendorid asVARCHAR (50)=''DECLARE @invoice asVARCHAR (50)=''DECLARE @vendoruno asint= (SELECT VENDOR_UNO FROM APM_VENDOR WHERE VENDOR_ID = @vendorid)DECLARE @tran AS INT = (SELECT TRAN_UNO FROM APT_INVOICE WHERE VENDOR_UNO = @vendoruno AND INVOICE_NUM =  @invoice)DECLARE @remitvendoruno asint= (SELECT REMIT_VENDOR_UNO from APT_INVOICE WHERE TRAN_UNO = @tran)DECLARE @remitvendor asvarchar(50)= (SELECT VENDOR_NAME FROM APM_VENDOR WHERE VENDOR_UNO = @remitvendoruno)----------------------------------------------------------------------------------- Invoice ---------------------------------------------------------------------------------SELECT @vendorid[Vendor],@invoice[Invoice],--@remitvendor [Remit Vendor],TC_CODE,TC_INV_AMT,CURRENCY_CODE,INV_AMT,INVOICE_DATE,DISC_AMT,i.DISC_DATE,TEN99_AMT,DUE_DATE,BALANCE,i.HOLD_DATE,CASEWHEN i.TEXT_ID <> 0 THEN'('+CAST(i.TEXT_ID ASVARCHAR)+') '+ chqm.textELSE''END[Narrative],SOURCE_REF,EAP_INITIATED,i.TRAN_UNOFROM APT_INVOICE iLEFTJOIN APV_AccountsPayableText chqm on i.TEXT_ID = chqm.TEXT_ID --Table is APT_TEXTWHERE i.TRAN_UNO = @tran || Step 6: Discount Amount | Expected: - Editable- must be >= 0 - Can't be greater than invoice balance || Step 7: 1099 Amount | Expected: - Editable- cannot be < 0 (can get into this state when the discount amount on the invoice > the invoice amount)- Must be  <= (payment amount + withheld amount) || Step 8: Withheld Amount | Expected: - Editable- Hidden when CMS_OPTION.OPTION_CODE = 'WHTAX_IN_USE' is N. From 82sp2 check this cos copied from another test case- must be >= 0 - Can't be greater than invoice balance || Step 9: Payment Amount | Expected: - Editable- payment amount + discount + withheld must be <= balance remaining as per the balance displayed- cannot be < 0 (can get into this state when the discount amount on the invoice > the invoice amount) || Step 10: State Withhold Taxfrom 82SP2 | Expected: - Only visible when CMS_OPTION code: "ST_WHTAX" is on - Only enabled when selected invoice has state withhold tax setup || Step 11: Separate Check (checkbox) | Expected: - Check box- Editable check box is not visable until invoice selected - why? || Step 12: Cancel button | Expected: - Enabled- Closes form || Step 13: Add button | Expected: - Adds invoice amount item to schedule- Resets form || Step 14: Add & Close button | Expected: - Adds invoice amount item to schedule- Closes form

Title: Payment Schedule Entry - Modify and Remove invoices attached to payment schedule
Steps: Step 1: Pre-reqMake sure you have a few posted invoices to work with.Use this attached sql to check if invoices has been removed on UI and data level. || Step 2: Create a new payment schedule and fill in the require fields. | Expected: After filling in the header fields and save, header will be disabled. || Step 3: Add invoices to payment schedule through the Add Invoices ribbon. | Expected: Invoices added || Step 4: When no invoices being selected in the details line. | Expected: Only Remove by Criteria and Remove All is working as expected. Edit and Remove are disabled and not clickable. || Step 5: Select on of the invoices | Expected: Selected invoice is highlighted. || Step 6: Double click on one of the invoices | Expected: Opens up the invoice payment form. Can edit the amount values (Discount Amount, 1099 Amount, Payment Amount, Withheld Amount and Separate Check) || Step 7: Select two or more invoices in the grid. | Expected: Edit button is disabled and not clickable. The other three are working as expected. || Step 8: Select the first invoice. Click REMOVE.Check with the sql attached to step 1. | Expected: First invoice is removed. || Step 9: Select two of the invoices and click REMOVE. check with sql | Expected: Selected invoices are removed. || Step 10: (If you run out of invoices to work with now, add them back, be sure to run sql to make sure they have been added successfully) || Step 11: Remove by Criteria- Remove all payments below a specified value, enter the payment amount.- Remove all payments for the specified vendor. check with sql | Expected: - Invoices amount below the value you entered are removed. (Note: The Invoice Amount is total amount of invoices from the same vendor when not in separate check. For eg, If you have two invoices $200 and $300 from same vendor and not paying with separate check, entering $300 to remove will not remove any invoice from grid. Enter $600 will remove both of the invoices. 600 > 500 = 200+300)- Invoices for the vendor selected is removed. || Step 12: Remove All. | Expected: All invoices removed. Header is available to edit again.

Title: Smoke Test AP: Payment List screen ribbon
Steps: Step 1: Most of this should be covered by the other smoke tests - make sure of that before removing this test || Step 2: https://aderant.sharepoint.com/RD/AP/Moscow%20Design%20Wiki/Payments%20List%20Screen.aspx || Step 3: Refer to design wiki. || Step 4: New Payment | Expected: List these optionsVendor Payment,Client Payment,Employee Payment,Miscellaneous Payment || Step 5: Open | Expected: Open the Payment Entry screen for the selected payment || Step 6: Release/Unrelease | Expected: To release or unreleased either a single payment, or multiple payments || Step 7: Post | Expected: To post a payment || Step 8: Cancel | Expected: To Cancel a payment || Step 9: Print Payments | Expected: List these optionsPrint ChecksPrint Remittance Advices || Step 10: Create Bank File | Expected: Creates a bank file if Payment method is Electronic and payment is released || Step 11: Reprint checks | Expected: Reprint checks for check payments that are already printed || Step 12: Recreate Bank files | Expected: Recreate bank file for electronic bank payments where file is already created || Step 13: View Image | Expected: This will display an image of the payment in the Quick View pane on the right had sideNote: This option is in Payment entry screen. || Step 14: Export | Expected: Exports selected rows as an excel file || Step 15: Evaluate Rules | Expected: To test that payments pass all business rules. Enabled when status is incomplete or ready for posting || Step 16: Advanced search has moved to the white arrow next to the Payments header at the top of the grid

Title: Schedule - Employee: Checking the New Employee Payment Schedule Header
Area: ExpertSuite\Financials\Accounts Payable\Payment Schedule\Add to Schedule\Employee Invoices
Steps: Step 1: The design for new Employee payment header is outlined on https://aderant.sharepoint.com/RD/AP/Moscow%20Design%20Wiki/Payment%20Schedule%20Entry%20Screen.aspx || Step 2: The header fields appear in the following order: || Step 3: Schedule Number | Expected: Read only field. Display as 'New' for a new schedule. Display APS_SCHEDULE_Z.SCHEDULE_NUM when it is an existing schedule entry. || Step 4: Schedule Type | Expected: Display right next to schedule number. Display either Vendor or Employee Payment depend on which has been selected. || Step 5: Bank | Expected: List control. Only show active and not trust bank Acct_Type <> 'T. All invoices has to be from this same bank. || Step 6: Payment Date | Expected: Date provider, also date to be printed on check. Must be in parms dates || Step 7: Date To Print | Expected: Date provider, only select date >= today's date. do not have to be in posting range || Step 8: Language | Expected: list control, showing available language. Spanish, English, French for our case || Step 9: Details total and currency | Expected: Read only. Update when invoices are added or removed from schedule. Currency is obtained from bank select above. || Step 10: Payment Status - Upper right flag | Expected: Should display as orange flag with 'E' for Edit. || Step 11: Take overdue Discount.Not available in Employee Payment. Only appear on Vendor payment.

Title: Payment - Client Manual: Create/Post/Cancel
Steps: Step 1: Pre reqs Set tax fields on: UPDATE CMS_OPTION SET FLAG_VALUE ='Y' WHERE OPTION_CODE ='SALES_USE_TX'UPDATE CMS_OPTION SET FLAG_VALUE ='Y'WHERE OPTION_CODE ='TAXES_IN_USE'UPDATE APM_PARMS SET DEFAULT_TAX_IN ='X'--Q,X,Y,N || Step 2: Create payment with detail itemType = ClientBank = BUSDPayment date = todayMethod = ManualCheck Number = next availAmount = 100Sales / Use Tax = 100 Enter any other mandatory fieldsDetails Item amount = $100NOTE: I have contact Jan Lawson to review this test case. - Sam P | Expected: Payment created APT_CHECK ENTRY_STATUS = NEXPERT_PAYMENT_STATUS = CSOURCE = MREVERSAL = NPAYEE_TYPE = CDOCUMENT_TYPE = MCHECK_NUM = as enteredPERIOD = 0DRUNO = 0TC_CODE = CADTC_CHK_AMT = 100CURRENCY_CODE = USDORIGINAL_AMT = NULLCHK_AMT = 100.00 (payment currency)TEN99_AMT = 100.00 (payment currency)SALES_USE_TAX = 100.00 (payment currency)TAX_AMT =  Note: TEXT_ID is NULL in expert and 0 in classic - not an issue as can't process the expert payment in classic || Step 3: Post the payment | Expected: Payment posted APT_CHECK (updated) ENTRY_STATUS = REXPERT_PAYMENT_STATUS = OSOURCE = MREVERSAL = NPAYEE_TYPE = CDOCUMENT_TYPE = MCHECK_NUM = as enteredPERIOD = latest periodDRUNO = current drunoTC_CODE = USDTC_CHK_AMT = 100CURRENCY_CODE = USDORIGINAL_AMT = 0CHK_AMT = 100.00 (system currency)TEN99_AMT = 100.00 (system currency)SALES_USE_TAX = 100.00 (system currency)TAX_AMT = 0 || Step 4: Cancel the payment- today as transaction date- comments | Expected: Payment canceled  APT_CHECK (updated)  ENTRY_STATUS = REXPERT_PAYMENT_STATUS = XSOURCE = MREVERSAL = NPAYEE_TYPE = CDOCUMENT_TYPE = MCHECK_NUM = as enteredPERIOD = latest periodDRUNO = current drunoTC_CODE = USDTC_CHK_AMT = 100CURRENCY_CODE = USDORIGINAL_AMT = 0CHK_AMT = 100.00 (system currency)TEN99_AMT = 100.00 (system currency)SALES_USE_TAX = 100.00 (system currency)TAX_AMT = 0 APT_CHECK  for contra entry created with same REQUEST_NUM ENTRY_STATUS = REXPERT_PAYMENT_STATUS = MSOURCE = MREVERSAL = YPAYEE_TYPE = CDOCUMENT_TYPE = MCHECK_NUM = copied from originalPERIOD = latest periodDRUNO = current drunoTC_CODE = USDTC_CHK_AMT = -100CURRENCY_CODE = USDORIGINAL_AMT = 0CHK_AMT = -100.00 (system currency)TEN99_AMT = -100.00 (system currency)SALES_USE_TAX = -100.00 (system currency)TAX_AMT = 0 || Step 5: Reconcile the payments | Expected: APT_CHECK- All fields that should match, do- All fields that won't match e.g. unos, are populated with the appropriate values CHECK_LANGUAGE is set to NULL in classic on contra entry

Title: Payment - EB: Wire Number Auto assign
Area: ExpertSuite\Financials\Accounts Payable\Payments\Payment Create Electronic Bank File
Steps: Step 1: Data Pre reqs Banks - set to auto assign wire numbersUPDATE TBM_BANK SET ASSIGN_WIRE_NUMBER ='Y',AUTO_WIRE_NUM ='Y'WHERE BANK_CODE ='' Vendor - Has bank accounts on multiple banks- No payment exists for the banks with auto generated wire numbers Note: Need to either have no electronic payments or payments set so that the next number will be the same for 2 of the banks so we can see a duplicate wire number can be created where it is unique to the bank | Expected: No records returned from this query:SELECT * FROM CMS_UNIQUE_KEYS WHERE TBNAME LIKE ('_TBM_BANK_WIRE_BUSD') || Step 2: Create a payment for vendor for bank 11. Select to create payment2. Select Vendor3. Select bank 14. Enter the amount5. Save | Expected: Payment saved - wire number = 1 (latest wire number + 1 for that bank)- unique keys record createdSELECT * FROM CMS_UNIQUE_KEYS WHERE TBNAME LIKE ('_TBM_BANK_WIRE_BUSD') || Step 3: Create a payment for vendor for bank 21. Select to create payment2. Select Vendor3. Select bank 24. Enter the amount5. Save | Expected: Payment saved - wire number = 1 (latest wire number + 1 for that bank)- wire number is the same as for bank 1- unique keys record created || Step 4: Create another payment for vendor for bank 11. Select to create payment2. Select Vendor3. Select bank 14. Enter the amount5. Save | Expected: Payment saved - wire number = 2- unique keys record updated || Step 5: Create payment for vendor for bank 1 setting the wire number manuallyNote: you can either set the bank to manual wire assign or create the payment via classic1. Select to create payment2. Select Vendor3. Select bank 14. Enter the amount5. Enter the next wire number being 36. Save | Expected: Payment saved - wire number = 3 - unique keys record NOT updated || Step 6: Create another payment for vendor for bank 1 1. If you have set the bank to manual in the previous step, then set it back to auto2. Select to create payment3. Select Vendor4. Select bank5. Enter the amount6. Save | Expected: Payment saved - wire number = 4 (next number > lastkey that has not already been used)Note: at some point it was changed from this: (next number > than either the lastkey or the greatest numeric wire number on a payment, whichever is greater )- unique keys record updated || Step 7: Support for Classic setting1. Set a Bank to assign = no and auto = yesNote: if doing this via the UI you will need to use classicUPDATE TBM_BANK SET ASSIGN_WIRE_NUMBER ='N',AUTO_WIRE_NUM ='Y'WHERE BANK_CODE =''1. Select to create payment2. Select Vendor3. Select the bank4. Enter the amount5. Save | Expected: Payment saved - wire number = (latest wire number + 1 for that bank)- unique keys record updated

Title: Payment Items - Trust: Look and Feel
Steps: Step 1: General | Expected: https://aderant.sharepoint.com/RD/AP/Moscow%20Design%20Wiki/Trust%20Payment%20Detail%20Form.aspx* Save & Close and Save & Add are only enabled when mandatory fields are completed* Cancel is enabled* Date is defaulted to today* On Save & Add the form is reset* Once payment is released, the trust items are non editable || Step 2: Trust Matter | Expected: Is selected from active matter* On edit, the other values on the form are cleared || Step 3: Trust number | Expected: Is filtered on the client Matter for the trust item, bank of the payment and is active* On edit, the other values on the form are cleared except for client/matter* Error If there are unposted items for this trust on another payment - This restriction is being removed as classic allows itDECLARE @clientmatters as VARCHAR (2000)='' DECLARE @payment as int= SELECT ''[TRM_TRUST],TRUST_UNO,chq.BANK_CODE[Payment bank],tr.BANK_CODE[Trust bank],BALANCE,AVAILABLE_AMT,* FROM TRM_TRUST tr JOIN HBM_MATTER m ON tr.MATTER_UNO = m.MATTER_UNOJOIN APT_CHECK chq ON chq.REQUEST_NUM = @paymentINNER JOIN SplitByDelimiter (@clientmatters,',') s ON s.items = m.CLNT_MATT_CODEWHERE tr.BANK_CODE = chq.BANK_CODEORDER BY tr.TRUST_UNO || Step 4: Balance | Expected: Is populated on selection of trust- Disabled (formatted as per enabled amount fields)- Calculation of amount to display is a seperate test case || Step 5: Available Amount | Expected: Is populated on selection of trust- Disabled (formatted as per enabled amount fields)- The available balance is calculated as per the script below. Looks at the items in ACT_TRAN_TRUST where the item is not held SELECT''[Available ACT_TRAN_TRUST],tr.TRUST_UNO,@DisplayCurrency[Display Currency],CONVERT(decimal(25,10),SUM(ROUND(a.AMOUNT * a.SIGN* b.RATE, c.DECIMAL_PLACES)*POWER(SIGN(tr.AVAILABLE_AMT), 2)))[Display Amount],CONVERT(decimal(25,10),SUM(a.AMOUNT * a.SIGN* b.RATE *POWER(SIGN(tr.AVAILABLE_AMT), 2)))[Amount]FROM ACT_TRAN_TRUST a, TBL_CURR_RATE b, TBL_CURRENCY c, TRM_TRUST trJOIN HBM_MATTER m ON tr.MATTER_UNO = m.MATTER_UNOINNERJOIN SplitByDelimiter (@clientmatters,',') s ON s.items = m.CLNT_MATT_CODEWHERE  a.TRUST_UNO = tr.TRUST_UNOAND a.TRUST_UNO = tr.TRUST_UNO--AND AMOUNT_TYPE = 'P'Blended only use P amount typeAND (a.PERIOD <> 0 OR (a.PERIOD = 0 AND a.SIGN=-1))AND a.HELD <>'Y'AND b.DRUNO = a.DRUNOAND b.CURRENCY_CODE = @DisplayCurrencyAND c.CURRENCY_CODE = b.CURRENCY_CODEGROUPBY tr.TRUST_UNO || Step 6: Minimum Balance | Expected: Is populated on selection of trust- Disabled (formatted as per enabled amount fields)- Calculation of amount to display is a seperate test case || Step 7: Amount | Expected: Amount is validated* Can't be > available balance* Can't be negative* Can't go below the min balance (min balance may be negative so its valid to be able to overdraw the trust)DECLARE @clientmatters asVARCHAR (2000)='tst72.1'SELECT''[TRM_TRUST],tr.TRUST_TYPE,m.CLNT_MATT_CODE,tr.TRUST_UNO,tr.BANK_CODE,tr.BALANCE,tr.AVAILABLE_AMT,tr.MIN_BALANCE,tr.HOLD_AMT,tr.ACCT_TYPE,tr.TRUST_NAME,m.MATTER_UNO--,* FROM TRM_TRUST tr JOIN HBM_MATTER m ON tr.MATTER_UNO = m.MATTER_UNOINNERJOIN SplitByDelimiter (@clientmatters,',') s ON s.items = m.CLNT_MATT_CODEORDERBY m.CLNT_MATT_CODE,tr.TRUST_UNO || Step 8: Amount when there is a held amount1. Set a receipt type to have clearance daysAccounts Receivable | A/R Setup | Receipt Types | Clearance days2. Add a trust receipt using the receipt type with clearance days - will have a hold3. Add a trust receipt using the receipt type with no clearance days - won't have a hold4. Attempt to add a trust item to a payment that is > the non held receipt but < the total | Expected: Amount is validated* Can't be > available balance || Step 9: Amount Type | Expected: This is a hard coded list* For blended trust- Principal* For all other trusts- Principal- Interest- Bank ChargeSELECT tr.TRUST_UNO,tr.TRUST_NUM,tr.TRUST_NAME,m.CLNT_MATT_CODE,tr.TRUST_TYPE,tr.BANK_CODE,tr.ACCT_TYPE,tr.INACTIVE,tb.BOOK,gd.DATASET_NUM,gd.SECURITY_ID--,tr.*FROM TRM_TRUST trJOIN HBM_MATTER m ON tr.MATTER_UNO = m.MATTER_UNOINNERJOIN TBM_BANK tb ON tr.BANK_CODE = tb.BANK_CODELEFTOUTERJOIN GLL_DATASET gd ON tb.BOOK = gd.DATASET_NUMWHERE tr.TRUST_TYPE <>'NOM'--AND ACCT_TYPE = 'G' -- G General, B Blended, A avail for transfer, I investedORDERBY m.CLNT_MATT_CODE || Step 10: Trust Tran Type | Expected: Is filtered on APP_CODE is C or GSELECT TTT1.TRX_TYPE_CODE ,TTT1.APP_CODE,TTT1.TRX_DESC,TTT1.INACTIVEFROM TRL_TRX_TYPE TTT1 WHERE TTT1.INACTIVE!='Y' AND TTT1.APP_CODE in ('C','G') ORDER BY TTT1.TRX_TYPE_CODE* Mandatory when TRUST_TRAN_TYPE is on otherwise not availSELECT 'TRM_PARMS',* FROM TRM_PARMS || Step 11: Narrative | Expected: * Supports spell checking only* Max characters = 200

Title: Payment Items - Trust: Save Validation
Steps: Step 1: Note: The UI has all these validations now so It's not possible to replicate most of these even when tweeking the values in SQL. So these validations all need to be turned into integration tests || Step 2: Note: Where appropriate, Test both for add and edit as we've found the validations on new item may work but the're not always working on edit || Step 3: Trust Account is inactive1. Create a client payment- trust bank2. Select to add a trust item- enter the mandatory fields but don't save3. Inactive the trust accountUPDATE TRM_TRUST SET INACTIVE = 'Y' WHERE TRUST_UNO = 4. Save the trust item | Expected: Error: Trust number x for matter x is inactiveObservation in 8250: Didn't see an error message, but when after selecting Trust client, Inactive Trust account does not show up in drop down list. || Step 4: Trust bank code <> payment bank code1. Create a client payment2. Add a trust where the trust bank code <> the payment bank codeNote: The UI prevents the select of trusts that are incorrect but you can change payment's bank code in sql just prior to saving the trust itemselect * from APT_CHECK where REQUEST_NUM = update APT_CHECK set BANK_CODE = 'TBUSD' where REQUEST_NUM = | Expected: Error: Trust's bank transaction type IdTRST_BANK_CODE_NOT_MATCH_HRD || Step 5: Amount < 0 1. Create a client payment2. Add a trust where the amount < 0Note: Can only test the UI for this so will need to be created as an integration test | Expected: Error: Amount can't be less than zero AMT_CANT BE LESS THAN ZERO || Step 6: Amount = 0 1. Create a client payment2. Add a trust where the amount = 0 | Expected: Zero is allowed || Step 7: This restriction is being removed as classic allows itPayment with unposted trust exists1. Create a client payment2. Add a trust where the amount > 03. Create a second client payment4. Add a trust where the amount > 0 | Expected: No error Note: old error was:Error: TRUST_UNPOSTED_ROWS_EXIST || Step 8: This restriction is being removed Posted Payment where unposted trust exists on a payment1. Create a client payment2. Add a trust where the amount > 03. Post the payment4. Create a second client payment5. Add a trust from the same matter for the same credit  type where the amount > 06. Open the client credit on the first payment | Expected: No alerts on the posted paymentThe payment details are not revalidated so no alerts are displayed || Step 9: Amount is more than avail balance, payment unposted1. Create a client payment that is not system currency2. Add a trust where the amount > avail balance Note: The UI prevents this but you can change trust's min balance in sql just prior to saving the trust item SELECT BALANCE,MIN_BALANCE,HOLD_AMT,* FROM TRM_TRUST WHERE TRUST_UNO = UPDATE TRM_TRUST SET MIN_BALANCE =  WHERE TRUST_UNO = | Expected: Error: Cannot go below minimum trust account balanceTRST_VIOLATE_MIN_BALANCE || Step 10: Amount is more than avail balance - held amount 1. Set a receipt type to have clearance daysAccounts Receivable | A/R Setup | Receipt Types | Clearance days2. Add a trust receipt using the receipt type with clearance days - will have a hold3. Add a trust receipt using the receipt type with no clearance days - won't have a hold4. Attempt to add a trust item to a payment that is > the non held receipt but < the total  Note: The UI prevents this so in order to test the service, you will need to have no hold, get as far as adding the data for the trust item without saving it, add the hold, then attempt to save.  SELECT BALANCE,MIN_BALANCE,HOLD_AMT,* FROM TRM_TRUST WHERE TRUST_UNO = UPDATE ACT_TRAN_TRUST SET held = 'Y' WHERE ROW_UNO = | Expected: Error: Insufficent fundsTRST_VIOLATE_MIN_BALANCENote: This validation does not exist anymore, checked with Jacky while testing PR45757 || Step 11: Missing BalancesBalance = NULL OR Available = NULL OR Min Balance = NULL e.g.UPDATE TRM_TRUST SET BALANCE =NULL, AVAILABLE_AMT = 457.8721940266, MIN_BALANCE = 0 WHERE TRUST_UNO = 47 | Expected: Error: Missing Required FieldsTRST_MISSING_REQD_FIELDS Bug 234218 - Trust: Validation for missing mandatory fields seems to have been lost || Step 12: Trust amount exceeds trust min- Trust min = 200.01- Trust balance = C$500- Trust Avail balance = C$500- Client payment with same bank as trust- Trust item for C$300 | Expected: Error: Insufficent funds (Added back in 822)TRST_VIOLATE_MIN_BALANCE || Step 13: Trust amount does not exceed trust min when min is neg- Trust min = -100- Trust balance = C$500- Trust Avail balance = C$500- Client payment with same bank as trust- Trust item for C$600 | Expected: No error (fixed in 822) || Step 14: Trust amount exceeds bank minFuture - is currently dealt with in Release validation | Expected: Error:

Title: Payment - EB: Process electronic banking using docudraft
Area: ExpertSuite\Financials\Accounts Payable\Payments\Payment Create Electronic Bank File
Steps: Step 1: Pre req dataReleased electronic Payments- Different vendors and Same vendors- Same bank- Different payment types || Step 2: Process all the payments1. Select the payments2. Select Create Bank fileCreate bank File list of payments3. Select Create File | Expected: Files created- 1 file per bank/payment type- files created from templates as set in TBM_FMT_EBF- saved to the path as set in HBA_BANK_PAYTYP - file names created based on the values set in HBA_BANK_PAYTYP - file number generated from unique keys TBNAME = _TBM_BANK_<payment type code>.<bank code>Bug 206560 - EB: Last_Modified is not updated for bank file last key in CMS_UNIQUE_KEYSSELECT*FROM CMS_UNIQUE_KEYS WHERE TBNAME like'_TBM_BANK_%SELECT bs.BANKING_SYSTEM_CODE,pt.PAYTYP_CODE,ptlink.BANK_CODE,ptlink.CH_FMT,f.FILENAME,ptlink.FILE_PREFIX,ptlink.FILE_SUFFIX,ptlink.FILE_PATHFROM HBL_BANK_PAYTYP ptJOIN HBL_BANKING_SYSTEM bs ON pt.BANKING_SYSTEM_UNO = bs.BANKING_SYSTEM_UNOLEFT JOIN HBA_BANK_PAYTYP ptlink ON pt.PAYTYP_CODE = ptlink.PAYTYP_CODE LEFT JOIN TBM_FMT_EBF f ON ptlink.CH_FMT = f.FORMAT_CODEORDER BY BANKING_SYSTEM_CODEAudit records created- audit record created in APT_CHECK_EBTRAN for each payment processedSELECT * FROM APT_CHECK_EBTRANPayment record updated- fields updated in APT_CHECKSELECT EB_LAST_DATE,EB_SENT,LAST_EB_FILE,*FROM APT_CHECK WHERE REQUEST_NUM IN ()Transaction key record updated- field updated in ACT_TRANACT_TRAN.TRANS_NUMBERSELECT act.TRANS_NUMBER,chq.REQUEST_NUM,chq.WIRE_NUM, chq.CHECK_NUMFROM ACT_TRAN act JOIN APT_CHECK chq ON act.TRAN_UNO = chq.TRAN_UNOorder by act.TRAN_UNO desc

Title: Payment Items - Grid: Look and Feel
Steps: Step 1: General Checks | Expected: * Scroll bars* Column sorting* Row selection* Grouping* Numbers, amounts and dates right aligned* Text left aligned* Money displays currency symbol || Step 2: Select | Expected: * select all * reverse * select * select none * Shift + click - selects all between the two selected * Ctrl + A - selects all || Step 3: Customising the columnsNote: Check grid for all Payment Item types as columns differ- Advance - Client Credit - Disbursement- Expense Report- GL- Invoice - Matter Credit- Tax- Trust | Expected: * Available columns (settings maintained)* Column order (settings maintained)* Column width (settings maintained)* Default columns * Hover pop up where required || Step 4: Buttons | Expected: No Items selectedEach enabled button performs the correct functionAdd New = enabledEdit = disabledRemove = disabledRemove All = enabledOne Item selectedEach enabled button performs the correct functionAdd New = enabledEdit = enabledRemove = enabledRemove All = enabledMultiple Items selectedEach enabled button performs the correct functionAdd New = enabledEdit = disabledRemove = enabledRemove All = enabled || Step 5: Performance | Expected: * 1000 Invoices loads in * Spinner displays in grid untill all grid items loaded

Title: Payment - Look and Feel
Steps: Step 1: Buttons | Expected: All buttons work as expected * Save- Save the Payment* Save & Close- Save the payment- Close the payment if the save is sucsessful- Return to the payment if the save is not sucessful* Close & Add- Close payment if form is not dirty- Prompt user to save is for is dirty- Open a new payment for the same type as the one being closed* Close- Close payment if form is not dirty- Prompt user to save is for is dirty* Release - Set the payment to released- Set the appropriate fields to disabled* Unrelease - Set the payment to unreleased- Set the appropriate fields to enabledd* Print * Post - Post the payment* Delete- Delete the payment and all child links* Evaluate rules- enabled when payment enabled and status not posted * Calculate Tax - Tax button disabled when the only items on  the payment are invoice.(test when tax treatment is Y or N)- There must be a GL or disb items for the tax button to be enabled Bug 162891 - Hover items do not display on the correct position on some environments || Step 2: Amount | Expected: * Must be  > 0 for Electronic* Must be >= 0 for Check, Wire or Manual || Step 3: Spot rate | Expected: * Not enabled if payment in system currency || Step 4: Check numberCreate a manual payment | Expected: - validate next check number for the bank || Step 5: Status Indicator | Expected: * All fields display the correct data* Status indicator displays the correct status from APT_CHECK.EXPERT_PAYMENT_STATUS || Step 6: Editability | Expected: * Fields display editable/non editable when expected || Step 7: JurisdictionSELECT FLAG_VALUE FROM CMS_OPTION WHERE OPTION_CODE = 'TAXES_IN_USE' | Expected: * Mandatory if taxes in use = Y otherwise not visible* Defaults from Vendor for a Vendor payment || Step 8: Tax IncludedSELECT FLAG_VALUE FROM CMS_OPTION WHERE OPTION_CODE = 'TAXES_IN_USE'SELECT DEFAULT_TAX_IN FROM APM_PARMS | Expected: * Mandatory if taxes in use = Y otherwise not visible- Defaults to value set in parmsN = 'No'Y = 'Yes'X = 'Not Applicable'Q = no default || Step 9: Recoverable TaxNote: For the validation on this to work correctly, taxes in use must also be onSELECT RECOV_CONT_REQD FROM APM_PARMSSELECT FLAG_VALUE FROM CMS_OPTION WHERE OPTION_CODE ='TAXES_IN_USE' | Expected: * If recoverable tax is Y then enabled and mandatory * If recoverable tax is N then hidden* Max length 15 || Step 10: Sales / Use TaxUPDATE CMS_OPTION SET FLAG_VALUE ='Y'WHERE OPTION_CODE ='SALES_USE_TX' | Expected: * Mandatory if Sales Use Tax = Y otherwise not visible* Defaults to 0* max length 15 || Step 11: Remaining balance when currency set to use a comma1. Change Regional settingsRegion | Advanced SettingsDecimal symbol = ,2. Create Payment amount > 1000 | Expected: Displays with correct formating Remaining balance displays with decimal as comma instead of full stop

Title: Schedule - Employee: Checking the Add Multiple Invoices form, Expense and Advance
Area: ExpertSuite\Financials\Accounts Payable\Payment Schedule\Add to Schedule\Employee Invoices
Description:
https://aderant.sharepoint.com/RD/AP/Moscow%20Design%20Wiki/Payment%20Schedule%20Entry%20Screen.aspx
 
To access this form,
Open Moscow, Go to Payment Schedule section Tab. 
Click New Schedule on the ribbon.
Choose VENDOR payment schedule. 
Fill in the schedule headers and hit Save. Add Invoices ribbon should be now enabled. 
Click Add Invoices > Add Multiple Invoices.
Steps: Step 1: https://aderant.sharepoint.com/RD/AP/Moscow%20Design%20Wiki/Payment%20Schedule%20Entry%20Screen.aspxRefer to summary on how access this form. | Expected: Unlike Add Single invoice form for EMPLOYEE payment schedule, Add Multi return both Expense and Advance using the same form, unlike Add Single which you need to toggle depends on which invoice type you wish to look for. || Step 2: Approved Date To | Expected: Date Picker. Should default to today's date. Return invoice/advance with Approved Date<= Selected Date. || Step 3: Submit Date To | Expected: Date Picker. Not default to any date. Filter invoice/advance with APV_EMPLOYEE_INVOICE.submitted_Date column || Step 4: Payment Type | Expected: Return active payment type attached to the bank on schedule header.Optional || Step 5: Employee ID | Expected: QBE search field. HBM_PERSNL || Step 6: Office | Expected: QBE list field. HBM_OFFICE || Step 7: Bank Account | Expected: This field has been removed as per US 164050. || Step 8: From 821.EX0010AP Type | Expected: Additional filter that only applies to Expense Report, - NOT Advances. Bug 229930

Title: Schedule - Employee: Adding a single ADVANCE to a payment schedule using the Add Single Invoice form
Area: ExpertSuite\Financials\Accounts Payable\Payment Schedule\Add to Schedule\Employee Invoices
Steps: Step 1: Create a new advance in Expenses for yourself. Take note of the Bank which you are using. Bank are associated to your user's AP Type. || Step 2: Go through the workflow until the advance get approved. | Expected: Advance will have Approved status in APT_ADVANCE || Step 3: Open up AP Moscow, navigate to Payment Schedule > New Schedule ribbon > Employee Payment Schedule | Expected: This opens up a new payment schedule form. With Bank, Payment Date and Date To Print shown as required fields. || Step 4: Fill in the required fields as follows:Bank: your bank from step 3.Payment Date: Current DateDate To Print: Current DateClick Save | Expected: A Schedule Number will be assigned to you. Add Invoices ribbon is also enabled. || Step 5: Click Add Invices ribbon > Add Single Invoice. || Step 6: On The Add Single Invoice form, make sure that you have selected Invoice Type = Advance. || Step 7: Locate your advance.Do it by either selecting them in Advance Number data provider. Advance Description is in the brackets. || Step 8: After an advance has been selected, click Add & Close. | Expected: Advance is added to the payment schedule and showing in the details grid. || Step 9: Run attached SQL to check if

Title: Payment - Post: Spot rates
Steps: Step 1: Create a vendor payment- Payment date old enough to pick up a DRUNO that is not the lateste.g. 22/7/2012 will pick up DRUNO 100018- Currrency = CAD- has gl item- has disb item- has tax item- has invoice item || Step 2: Enter a spot rate and saveRate = 0.679071030829825 (the reciprocal will be: 1 / 0.679071030829825 = 1.47260000000000) | Expected: Spot rate saved on the paymentSPOT_RATE = 0.679071030829825 || Step 3: Post | Expected: A new set of currency rates is created with a new DRUNO- The new spot rate set will be a copy of the set that would have been used if that the payment had not been using spot rates e.g. 22/7/2012 uses DRUNO 100018- The CAD currency will be populated as per the spot rate enteredTBL_CURR_RATE.SPOT_RATE = YTBL_CURR_RATE.RATE = 0.679071030829825 (as entered)TBL_CURR_RATE.RECIPROCAL= 1.47260000000000 (1 / TBL_CURR_RATE.RECIPROCAL)TBL_CURR_DATE.FROM DATE = Payment dateTBL_CURR_DATE.TODATE = Payment date - 1Note: The dates seems odd but this is so the rate is never valid and therefore the rate will never be picked up by other than this payment we have just used it forThe Payment and all payment items have the new DRUNOAPT_CHECK.DRUNOACT_TRAN_JE.DRUNO WHERE TAX_CODE =''CDT_DISB.DRUNOACT_TRAN_JE.DRUNO WHERE TAX_CODE = the tax codeAPT_INVOICE_AMT.DRUNO------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------ Latest spot rates set----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------SELECT DRUNO,CURRENCY_CODE,RATE,RECIPROCAL,SPOT_RATE,LAST_MODIFIEDFROM TBL_CURR_RATEWHERE DRUNO = (SELECT TOP(1) DRUNO FROM TBL_CURR_RATE WHERE SPOT_RATE ='Y' ORDER BY DRUNO DESC)ORDER BY CURRENCY_CODE------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------ Latest spot rates differences compared to specific DRUNO ----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------DECLARE @druno as int= (SELECT TOP(1) DRUNO FROM TBL_CURR_RATE WHERE SPOT_RATE <>'Y'ORDER BY DRUNO desc)--DECLARE @druno as int = 100018 --10SELECT cr1.DRUNO[Non spot DRUNO], cr2.DRUNO [Spot DRUNO],cr1.CURRENCY_CODE[Non Spot Cur], cr2.CURRENCY_CODE[Spot Cur], cr1.RATE[Non Spot rate], cr2.RATE[Spot Rate],cr1.RECIPROCAL[Non Spot Reciprocal], cr2.RECIPROCAL[Spot Reciprocal]FROM TBL_CURR_RATE cr1JOIN TBL_CURR_RATE cr2 ON cr1.CURRENCY_CODE = cr2.CURRENCY_CODEWHERE cr1.DRUNO = @drunoAND cr2.DRUNO = (SELECT TOP(1) DRUNO FROM TBL_CURR_RATE ORDER BY DRUNO DESC)AND cr1.CURRENCY_CODE IN(SELECT CURRENCY_CODE FROM(--Non spot rate setSELECT CURRENCY_CODE,RATE,RECIPROCALFROM TBL_CURR_RATEWHERE DRUNO = @druno--ORDER BY CURRENCY_CODEEXCEPT--Latest spot rate setSELECT CURRENCY_CODE,RATE,RECIPROCALFROM TBL_CURR_RATEWHERE DRUNO = (SELECT TOP(1) DRUNO FROM TBL_CURR_RATE WHERE SPOT_RATE ='Y'ORDER BY DRUNO DESC)--ORDER BY CURRENCY_CODE)as A)ORDER BY cr1.CURRENCY_CODE || Step 4: Create a client payment- has client credit item- has matter credit item- currency = CAD || Step 5: Enter a spot rate and saveRate = 0.150000000000000(the reciprocal will be: 1 / 0.150000000000000= 6.66666666666667) | Expected: Spot rate saved on the paymentSPOT_RATE = 0.150000000000000 Bug 251676 - Spot rate reciprocal amount is incorrectly truncating the display to 14 decimals when it should be 15 || Step 6: Post | Expected: A new set of currency rates is created with a new DRUNO- The new spot rate set will be a copy of the set that would have been used if that the payment had not been using spot rates - The CAD currency will be populated as per the spot rate enteredTBL_CURR_RATE.SPOT_RATE = YTBL_CURR_RATE.RATE = 0.150000000000000(as entered)TBL_CURR_RATE.RECIPROCAL= 6.666666666666667(1 / TBL_CURR_RATE.RECIPROCAL)The Payment Title: Payment Schedule List- Delete a payment schedule
Steps: Step 1: Vendor Schedule || Step 2: Check APS_SCHEDULE_Z if a new row has been added. | Expected: a new record added to the table. || Step 3: Add invoices to payment schedule. | Expected: Invoices added. || Step 4: Delete Payment Schedule from the ribbon | Expected: Impossible to do so because Delete is disabled. || Step 5: Remove invoices from the details. | Expected: Delete ribbon is now enabled again. || Step 6: Delete payment schedule. | Expected: Payment schedule deleted. Check APS_SCHEDULE_Z if that row still in the table. || Step 7: Create another vendor schedule and attach invoice to it. Try to delete it from PaySch List screen. | Expected: Delete ribbon disabled. || Step 8: Check securityOpen Security Manager || Step 9: Untick all of the security under payment shcedules and leave one of them ticked.Try to delete a payment schedule || Step 10: Repeat with the rest of the security under payment schedules. | Expected: As long as user have a permission to CreatePaymentSchedule, they can perform delete. || Step 11: Untick all of the security under payment schedules. | Expected: You will not be able to access Payment Schedule in Moscow nor will you be able to deleted any of them || Step 12: Repeat with Employee Schedule with at least an expense report and an advance attached.

Title: Vendor Payment Schedule - Paying Invoices using different bank for the same company
Steps: Step 1: pre req- to have AP types from different bank but for same company

Title: Invoice List - Ribbons
Steps: Step 1: From Design wikihttps://aderant.sharepoint.com/RD/AP/Moscow%20Design%20Wiki/Invoice%20List%20Screen.aspx || Step 2: Ribbons should be in the following order. (Left to Right on the screen) || Step 3: Actions || Step 4: New Invoice | Expected: Open a new Invoice Entry screen. || Step 5: Open | Expected: Open Invoice Entry Screen for selected invoice. Editablity of invoice entry screen is on TC 162841Also enabled on invoice from Classic. || Step 6: Release/Unrelease | Expected: If selected invoice is Ready for Posting, 'Release' is enabled. If selected invoice is Released, 'Unreleased' is enabled. || Step 7: Post | Expected: Enabled when Invoice is Outstanding || Step 8: Cancel | Expected: Available when invoice is posted. Will pop up a cancel dialog for cancellation details.Also enabled on invoice from Classic. || Step 9: Delete | Expected: Delete not released invoice. || Step 10: PaymentsQuick PayCreate Payment Schedule | Expected: Jump to Payment section with quick payment form pre-populated with details from the selected invoice(s). Enabled when selected invoice status is OutstandingJump to Payment schedule section with selected invoice(s) attached. Enabled if status is Outstanding || Step 11: ImportInvoice Import | Expected: Brings out Import Invoice Wizard || Step 12: PrintEdit List | Expected: Print an edit list in invoice. If firm required to print edit list, then invoice is only available to post after printed edit list. || Step 13: ToolsExport | Expected: Exports selected rows or all rows as an Excel file || Step 14: RulesEvaluate Rules | Expected: To validate business rules. Enabled when invoice selected is Incomplete or Ready for Posting || Step 15: WorkflowInitate Workflow | Expected: Bring down dropdown for either initiate New Invoice WF or Approval WF

Title: Schedule - Employee: Adding multiple EXPENSE REPORT to payment schedule using the Add Multiple Invoice form
Area: ExpertSuite\Financials\Accounts Payable\Payment Schedule\Add to Schedule\Employee Invoices
Steps: Step 1: Create a few expense reports in Expenses for yourself. Take note of the Bank which you are using. || Step 2: Go through the workflow until the reports get approved. | Expected: The expense reports should have Outstanding status in APT_INVOICE || Step 3: Now, open up AP Moscow and navigate to Payment Schedule > New Schedule ribbon > Employee Payment Schedule | Expected: This opens up a new payment schedule form. With Bank, Payment Date and Date To Print shown as required fields. || Step 4: Fill in the required fields as follow:Bank : your bank from Step 2Payment Date : Current dateDate To Print : Current dateClick Save | Expected: A schedule number will be assigned to you. Add Invoices ribbon is also enabled. || Step 5: Click Add Invoices ribbon > Add Multiple Invoices.On the Add Multiple Invoice form, put in your employee ID.Locate your expense report.You can narrow it down by selecting your Employee ID | Expected: Note that if you do not put in your Employee ID, you might pull back other user's expense report. || Step 6: Click Done | Expected: Invoice is added that satisfy the search criteria, including those ones you created in Expense wll be added into the details grid. || Step 7: Run the attached SQL to check if the invoice has been attached in DB level.

Title: Schedule - Employee: Adding multiple ADVANCE to payment schedule using the Add Multiple Invoice form
Area: ExpertSuite\Financials\Accounts Payable\Payment Schedule\Add to Schedule\Employee Invoices
Steps: Step 1: Request more than one advance in Expenses and then got them approved. Take note of your user's bank (which associated with user AP type). | Expected: Approved advances will have Approved status in APT_ADVANCE || Step 2: Open up AP Moscow and navigate to Payment Schedule > New Schedule ribbon > Employee Payment schedule | Expected: This opens up a new payment schedule form. With Bank, Payment Date and Date to print shown as required fields. || Step 3: Fill in the required fields as follow:Bank : your bank from Step 2Payment Date : Current dateDate To Print : Current dateClick Save | Expected: A schedule number will be assigned to you. Add Invoices ribbon is also enabled. || Step 4: Click Add Invoices ribbon > Add multiple invoices. || Step 5: On the Add Multiple Invoice form, you can narrow down the search to your user only using the Employee ID field. Click Done. | Expected: all of your approved advances will be return and added in the details grid. If you do not narrow down the search to your user, you might return and add other users' advance. || Step 6: Run the attached SQL to check if the invoice has been attached in DB level.

Title: Payment Schedule Entry - User preference
Steps: Step 1: Make sure Moscow is closed. Clear your user configuration using Configuration Manager > All Settings > Preference > AvailableProperties > EmployeePaymentScheduleDetailsGridInstances and VendorPaymentScheduleDetailsGridInstances || Step 2: Open Moscow > Payment Schedule section > New VENDOR payment schedule. | Expected: A blank vendor payment schedule form created. || Step 3: Fill in the headers and save. Details grid is now enabled. Move the details column around (eg, move Payment Amount to the left most column). || Step 4: Close and reopen Moscow. | Expected: The column you moved is being retain as the same way when you last close them. (Payment Amount remain at left most column) || Step 5: Now, redo Step 2 - 4 on EMPLOYEE payment schedule. | Expected: Column moved is retain the same way when you lst close them. || Step 6: While on a payment schedule, change the column order. Open another payment schedule. | Expected: Without having to close the application , the just opened payment schedule should show the same column as previous payment schedule.

Title: Schedule - Employee: Expert vs Classic entry
Area: ExpertSuite\Financials\Accounts Payable\Payment Schedule\Add to Schedule\Employee Invoices
Steps: Step 1: In this test case, we compare the payment shcedule created in Moscow and Appshell in APS_SCHEDULE_Z. We should use the same values in these two payment schedule wherever possible. || Step 2: Create a new payment schedule in Appshell. || Step 3: Locate the two entries you created in Moscow and Appshell. Compare them. | Expected: The data stored in every column should be consistent in both of these record even though they are created in different application. || Step 4: Now attach an employee invoice into these payment schedules using the application they are created. || Step 5: Compare the two entries again. | Expected: Each column should also be consistent in both record.

Title: X
